name: Natria 706250A Neem Oil Spray for Plants Pest Organic Disease Control, 24-Ounce, Ready-to-Use
description:
Product Description

Help control pests and diseases with the Natria Neem Oil! This neem oil spray for plants is ready-to-use, with a convenient spray bottle for easy application at the first sign of infestation and disease. These multi-purpose plant sprays for bugs, fungicide and miticide to help you care for indoor and outdoor plants. As a preventative, apply this spray completely on all plant tissue on a 7 to 14-day cycle until the potential for infestation is no longer present. This neem tree oil for plants can be applied in spring, early summer and fall at the first sign of insects or disease to kill bugs quickly and control disease. It can be used as a fungicide for flowering plants, fruits, vegetables and houseplants, and a rose spray for bugs. Our spray for outdoor plants helps control aphids, spider mites, whiteflies, leafhoppers, leafminers, bagworms and other listed species. This rose disease spray can be used up to the day of harvest and can control diseases such as blackspot, mildew, twig blight, needle rust and more. SBM Company is a family-owned industrial group created in 1994 that operates in over 20 countries. We take pride in creating, registering, manufacturing and marketing products that are designed to deliver quality home and plant care. We stand behind our neem oil spray for outdoor plants and houseplants. Our neem oil for plants spray is organic and effective. This plant spray for bugs has been carefully designed to deliver results done right to help take care of plants both inside and outside your home. Product Details: (1) Neem Oil Spray - Size: 24 oz - Active Ingredient: Clarified Hydrophobic Extract of Neem Oil - 0.9% - Also Available in 1 Gallon. EPA Registration Number: 70051-13-92564.

I purchased a huge Fiddle Leaf Fig and the leaves needed some help. Some were damaged and some just dirty from transporting it. I love that this product is ready to use, so I just sprayed it on a clean cloth and wiped each leaf. A little goes a long way, so this bottle will last me a while even though after seeing how my FLF turned out, I used it on all of the plants in my home. My FLF looks amazing now and the leaves are so shiny that they almost look fake:) I love it!

Dear G-d the smell on this thing! It evaporates fast, so spray and run!

I used this on many plants in my house. One of them that I had recently purchased had baby centipedes racing out of the ground after I sprayed it. That plant lived the remainder of it's days outside afterwards.
Use every week or so during aphid season on my crepe myrtle to prevent the black soot from insect droppings. Also good for hydrangeas. Cheaper on Amazon then in store.

Get it- it works well. Got rid of my plants pest problem after 3-4 rounds of spraying. And the pest never came back!

Spraying on a plant with Japanese Beetles would cause the majority to fly off immediately. Not all, and we were reapplying every morning before they got active. I don‚Äôt know if it got rid of the Beetles, but it did greatly reduce the number for a day or two. Spraying other plants a few times before bringing in for the winter also. name: Red Heart Super Saver Yarn, 3 Pack, Black 3 Count
description:
Product Description

Super Saver yarn has been a favorite among knitters and crocheters for over 30 years. This 100% acrylic worsted weight, size 4 yarn comes in over 120 beautiful colors, so you will always find the perfect color to complete your project. No-dye-lot solids mean all skeins of a solid color match, so it‚Äôs easy to buy another skein and continue the project. Plus after you make your project it will be made to last, as Red Heart Super Saver yarn is durable and will stand the test of time, wash after wash. This product holds the OEKO-TEX Standard 100 certification.

reviews.content:
This is good quality yarn and I enjoy working with it.

Fair warning, though - don't mix with other brands of yarn in the same project - this yarn is more of a creamy white, so they may not color match, and the diameter of the yarn is not as thick as some other yarns that have the same gauge listed - it's slightly thinner, so your projects with this yarn will turn out smaller. How much smaller depends on what you're making with it - all of the blanket strips I made with this yarn were over 2" shorter than the ones I made with my other white yarn of the same listed gauge.

Do not use any acrylic/synthetic yarns to make pot-holders and the like - being a plastic-based yarn, they WILL melt when exposed to heat.

Still a great product! Just know what you're doing, is all.

This color is always sold out on other websites. Amazon carries it, and the price is decent, arrives quickly with prime. Who has time to run to every store to check for the colors you need when Amazon can bring it to you?

This is the Red Heart Super Saver quality that I‚Äôm used to. No knots or fraying, solid, sturdy, matched between balls, just what I needed. I made a large amigurumi piece and realized 2/3 of the way through that I needed more. New ball matched the old because there‚Äôs no dye lot discrepancy. Super Saver will never be the softest or the most stunning, but it has its place and it does what it does well. I wanted bright color, nice (not rough) texture, visible stitches, workability, and sturdiness for stuffing and stitching. Would buy again and I recommend it to everyone as their first practice yarn. Can‚Äôt beat it for that.

Color is very true to picture and the size of this yarn is great. Shipped to me quick and easy! I used this for my daughters box braids (long length) and it covered more than half her head with extra! ( she likes half and half style) 2 thumbs upüëçüèæüëçüèæ

The three pack is wrapped in plastic keeping it safe from stains. I have 48 years of crochet experience. Red Heart Super Saver is a good all purpose newbie friendly yarn. It is worster weight (4). I have used this yarn for afghans, ponchos, cloaks, placemats Christmas Stockings and shawls. This is economy acrylic yarn. It does feel rough when new but after a few washes it gets softer and softer with use. I have a floor length hooded cloak I made 30 years ago. This yarn is very durable. It is also easy care for anyone who doesn't want to fuss with hand washing and blocking. This yarn is no dye lot. Sometimes no dye lot yarn can change shades but not Red Heart Super Saver. It is rare if it does. I usually use a F or G hook with this weight. If you are new, making something that needs to withstand wear and tear or not sure how much you need, this is a great choice. If you are just learning get a light solid color to practice. If you are worried about how much yarn you need, you can buy more of this later and it should match the shade of your project. Normally 6 to 8 skeins will make a decent sized afghan. At the price listed for the 3 pack it is like a buy 2 get 1 free! This is not a good choice for baby items or warmer climates. It is awesome for New England winters. My only concern ordering online is I am a pull from the middle of the skein person. In a store I usually check for the yarn end pulling from the middle. I am happy to write that all three skeins I received have the end in the middle available which will help reduce yarn barf! Will purchase more of this yarn as needed.
I checked several retail and craft stores. Obviously this color is made of gold there. Found it here for the best price and home delivery.
This was the exact color and texture that I needed to match yarn I already had. I'm making an afghan for my neighbor's new baby, and this is just perfect for it!
The color is awesome!
I made granny squares trimmed in white with this and it is lovely
I needed more Spring Green Red Heart Super Saver for this work in progress, found it only on Amazon! Thank you!!! Dye Lot doesn‚Äôt matter for this afghan.

name: Broan-NuTone 403023 B000UW02A6 30-inch Under-Cabinet Convertible Range Hood with 2-Speed Exhaust Fan and Light, Black
description:
Product Description
Product Description

Upgrade your kitchen with the Broan-NuTone 30-inch Under-Cabinet Convertible Range Hood! This versatile range hood insert offers a complete solution to your ventilation needs by providing both an exhaust fan and overhead light for your stove. This range hood provides a MAX 210 CFM and 6.5 Sones blower performance to quickly remove smoke and cooking odors from the air, and the 2-speed rocker switch allows for quick fan adjustments and provides the ideal level of ventilation every time you cook. The built-in light with protective lamp lens accepts up to a 75-watt incandescent bulb (not included) to evenly illuminate your cooking area, and it is also controlled by a rocker switch for ease of use. This sleek black-colored steel range hood fits neatly underneath cabinets, and it features mitered sides and a hemmed bottom with no sharp edges to help ensure safety and provide a more decorative look. The one-piece dishwasher-safe aluminum grease filter offers easy cleaning so you can maintain optimum grease capture and keep your kitchen ventilated. This convertible range hood unit measures 17.5" x 30" x 6" and is designed with a 3.25" x 10" ducted opening that can be connected vertically or horizontally to provide versatile installation options at least 18" above the cooktop. It can work in an ADA-compliant application as well. It is both UL-Listed and HVI-2100 Certified for safety and protection, and it includes a 1 year limited warranty. Enhance your kitchen with the Broan-NuTone 403023 Range Hood!

From the Manufacturer

The Broan 403004 30 In. Black Ducted Range Hood is constructed with quality and good looks and outperforms the competition whether ducted vertically or horizontally. The sides are mitered and the bottom edge hemmed, with no sharp edges for safety and good looks. The unit has a two-speed fan switch with separate light switch and the motor is permanently lubricated.

During my search for a replacement hood (turns out there aren't that many 30" available these days) I found the Broan-NuTone 403004. The external measurements were identical to the Kenmore, so I purchased it in the hope that the electrical wiring and fan duct would match as well. Miracle-Gro makes growing beautiful, vibrant houseplants easy with their Indoor Plant Food Spikes. The product is reasonably priced and well worth it. My plants are already doing better in just a few days that I started using this product. Buy them if you want to make your plants thrive.

reviews.content:
Works for internet but setup can be a little troublesome. So I had trouble following along in the app. You need internet access to set up. I had to reconnect my old modem to get registered. After that I connected this refurbished modem. I got as far as a reset signal was sent, waited 10 minutes. I then believed it was not working. Had 2 blue lights and 2 lights that seemed to be off or at least not green. The app will guide you along and get you connected to your internet provider via phone, that at least was a help. I got through to Spectrum and had a 2 minute wait. Be nice and explain simply, I said I bought a new modem to replace old modem. She verified my address, asked for the old mac id, then the new mac id. Next she said modem would reset which it did. At first I get one at a time up to 4 green lights, then the transmit and receive turned bright blue which makes it appear that the power and network light are off. This is what confused me. Over the next couple of hours I waited, unplugged and replugged modem a couple times, still same thing. After a search on the internet, yes i'm now connected. I found on several forums, or faq on manufacturer site that some units the lights will appear to be off. If you look through the open grill case, i can see inside that they appear green, blue, blue and green, yet on the outside I only see 2 bright blue. The lights are like flood light when they need to be accent lights. I also had trouble loging into the webpage for admin access to modem, gotta use your browser for this. I ended up doing a factory reset with paperclip into the hole on the back, after that I could get in. use admin and the last 8 digits of the serial number on bottom of modem to access. Nothing much in there I need to change, but i alays like to look around. I finished the setup in the app, which now is mostly useless. It only tells me the serial number and mac id and has a copy of spec sheet and manual. Nothing else. It would be nice if the app showed you the status (and allowed turn off of lights) and allowed you to login to the admin settings within the app instead of having to use a web browser. app is kinda lame and the setup procedure although was partially helpful not the best experience. I was excited to get a new modem with an app, but i doubt if I ever use the app again.

This still is a good choice. My old modem was bought 11 years go when speed was like 20Mbps. It had room to grow up to 150MBps. Spectrum increased to 200Mbps but that old modem was only giving me 125Mbps. Only ended up costing me like 7.67 a year to own vs renting which i'm sure is more than that. I decided it was time to upgrade even though it was still working.

This modem has room to allow for growth over the coming years. I'm now getting 233Mbps which is far below it's max rating of 1000Mbps. This is fine for video streaming movies and I have lots of smart lights and home control devices along with alexa for voice control. The new speed while not necessary does help. I notice some apps load data faster.

üü¢ Refurb ARRIS SURFboard SB8200-RB Modem works and mine looks new for a lot less money.
üü° 2 Ethernet Ports are useless for most buyers. You need a Router with 2 WAN ports and support Link Aggregation.
üü° When connected to DOCSIS 3.1, The White and Blue LED can be Very Bright. Do Not Block Air when blocking the light or the modem can overheat and cause disconnection and other problems.
üî¥ Ignore Quick Start Card! It has Errors and Arris app does Nothing.
üî¥ Arris SURFboard Central App is just a "scam" to get E-mail and other data. Manual is online without this.
üü° This App then point to download other apps. For 1 time use, Don't download Xfinity and other apps to activate the modem. Just plug it in and call the ISP with the MAC address printed on it. Note that any Modem can't be activated by Xfinity Web site in the past. They killed this method.
üî¥ Many Browsers will "Freak out" connecting to the Modem @ 192.168.100.1 because does not have a valid https key. You have to ignore this warning. *Connecting to the Modem at this address has Nothing to do with Modem Activation!*
üî¥ Default login when connected to the web interface is often admin and Password is last 8 digit of the serial number *NOT* password as stated on the Quick Start Card. You will then have to set a new password. There is Nothing to change for most users but can show signal levels to tell when there are cable problems for people that can work with coaxial cable and DOCSIS 3 3.1 systems properly. Junk Cable and other problems in a building will cause slow internet and disconnections.

I have Optimum Online (a.k.a. Altice, a.k.a. Cablevision) 500mbps broadband Internet to my home. I keep wanting to switch to Verizon FiOS, but every time I call Optimum to cancel they lower the price of my service. I figure in about 4 more years they'll be paying me to stay. Lol. Which is okay with me, because as bad as Optimum's tech support is, Verizon's billing department is worse. But I digress.

The product I received is virtually indistinguishable from new. The modem, the power supply (a 12V/1A wall wart), the box, even the documentation looks factory fresh, without a scratch, smudge or hint of dust. The only giveaway is a small "REFURBISHED" sticker on the back of the modem, and a lithographed "Refurbished Unit" sub-header under the Arris logo on the top of the box. I removed the Optimum-supplied Ubee WiFi gateway, plugged-in the Arris SB8200 and, from my phone, initiated a chat session with Optimum's tech support to provision the new modem. It took a total of around 30 minutes for the tech to finish provisioning the modem, but then I was up and running with speeds equal or even better than I had before.

Two things to note with the SB8200: 1.) it will only communicate with the device plugged-in to the LAN jack when it was rebooted; if you swap devices you need to reboot the modem to get back on the Internet, and 2.) Optimum provides only "best effort" technical support, and no warranty/repair services, for modems purchased from a third party. This applies whether the modem was bought new or refurbished.

I wanted to replace the Optimum-supplied Ubee WiFi gateway with simple modem because I run my own firewall (pfSense), switches (TP-Link Omada) and WiFi AP's (also TP-Link Omada). The Ubee was fine when set in bridge mode (disabling its router/firewall functions) but the Ubee's (extremely strong!) WiFi radios could not be turned-off, and that was interfering with my own AP's signals. Plus, by returning Optimum's gateway and using my own modem I'll save $10 a month, so this refurbished SB8200 will pay for itself in less than a year.

I got a refurbished SBG8300-RB DOCIS 3.1 WiFiunit and it was about $120. It was impossible to change the network name or password until I found the number for support in a PDF manual online. . There is a hole at the top in the back you must press and hold for 15 seconds until it resets. Otherwise, it will ask you for the email of the previous owner when trying to log in. This should have been done while refurbishing the unit.

There is also no WLAN button, which you can click on some models which makes it search and pair with devices easier. Without it, connecting things like a printer is a tedious process.

Otherwise it works well.

The refurbished unit is working great and saved $60. Used the Xfinity app on my phone to commission the new cable modem by entering the MAC address and was up and running in minutes. I like the minimal refurb packaging as well. The only downside is a shorter warranty from Arris, 1 year versus 2 for a new unit. That being said there is a longer return window than usual (i.e. 90 days).

I upgraded from an old modem and did not want to pay full price. Connection wise all you do is unplug your old modem from the wall outlet, disconnect the ethernet cable that runs to the router, and disconnect the coaxial cable that runs from the wall. Now all I had to do was shut off the power to my router before connecting the coaxial cable, ethernet, and power to the new modem. Next I had to call my ISP to have them provision the new modem (you give them the MAC address from the sticker on the modem). There's no need to follow the instructions that come with the modem and definitely no need to download the Arris App. Anyways, after a couple of minutes I was up and running with no problems. All in all, happy with a refurbished Arris modem. I upgraded from an Arris Modem that I have been using for the last five years with no problems. Additionally, the unit I received looks brand new and the only way to tell that it is refurbished is because there's a tiny sticker on the back that says refurbished. Lastly, the modem works fine with my slightly random internet service provider known as Vyve, so this modem should work with anyone.

This was one of the easiest devices to install. It is exactly as described and works phenomenally. The WiFi strength seems stronger than what it replaced. Right out of the box and onto the desk with no worries at all. The signal lamps show the connection is working and is reliable. Overall and outstanding product.

I have 500Mbps service with Xfinity. Old modem died so I rented their modem till I could get a new one. This modem looked new. Plugged it in and waited till it synced. Used the Xfinity app on phone to activate the modem (5 minutes). Total time to be up and running was 10 minutes. My download speeds are much faster (590 Mbps) than with the Xfinity modem and this one is smaller and runs cooler. I hope it lasts.

Bought for xfinity install at my parents house. My parents had cable years ago and switched to DSL because it was cheaper at the time. However cables bandwidth increase with price staying flat so my parents wanted to switch back. Order this modem because it is compatible with xfinity and is good for downloading speeds faster than the plan my parents got 600mbps and they wouldn't be spending money every month renting a cable modem. Xfinity sent a technician to reconnect the house cable and set up the cable modem. The technician informed my parents the cable modem I bought couldn't be recognized by Xfinity and wouldn't work. Luckily I had another arris cable modem a bit slower than this one but I knew it worked since it was the one I just replaced at my house with a faster one. Later that week I went over to my parents house and using the Xfinity app was able to get the Arris SB8200 rb working with the cable and the connection is pulling about 850mbps. I believe the technician was messing up the Mac address when calling in the cable modem. The address had Bs that looked like 8s. After getting modem running I couldn't be happier.
Wasn't aware I purchased a ReFurb until I began to provision the device. My eyes deceived me. Oversight committee need on self (lol). Product is functioning performing admirably.

name: Rain-X 5079281-2 Latitude 2-In-1 Water Repellent Wiper Blades, 26 Inch Windshield Wipers (Pack Of 1), Automotive Replacement Windshield Wiper Blades With Patented Rain-X Water Repellency Formula
description:
Product Description

Outsmart the Elements with Rain-X! No other wipers deliver the innovation and technology that is offered by Rain-X Latitude Water Repellency Wiper Blades. These unique blades apply a patented Rain-X water repellent directly onto your windshield for you. The repellent is transferred from the squeegee to the glass ‚Äì and the magic of Rain-X is activated! Rain-X Latitude Water Repellency Wiper Blades feature advanced beam technology designed to hug your windshield for maximum contact and superior wipe quality. These 2-in-1 wiper blades both clear and repel the elements to provide superior driving visibility. Compared to traditional wiper blades, the difference is amazing! For optimal water repellency activation, run your wiper blades on a clean, dry windshield for 2 minutes. Once activated, the water repelling action will last for months! If you need additional help with determining the right wiper blade size for your car, reference our Blade Finder or Amazon's Confirmed Fit program. If you need help with installing your new wiper blades, installation videos can be found by scanning the QR code on the back of your wiper blade‚Äôs packaging.

reviews.content: There were easy to install and worked great with one MAJOR problem. They put a film of Rain-X (which they are supposed to do) on the windshield which interfered with the Eyesite camera (used for adaptive cruise control) on the Subaru Forester. It was not bad during the daytime, however at night the Eyesite world stop working for awhile then start working and then stop working. Cleaning my windshield with rubbing alcohol solved the problem, but they are not good for my Forester. I game them four stars since I am sure that they would be fine on other cars.

I always choose Rain-X. These mold to your windshield. Super smooth. Has water beading tech in the wiper so when it is raining you have better visibility. Works even better if you prep your windshield with something like rain-x or spray-on wax coat.

First time installing a new windshield wiper for me.
It was very easy and quiet as soon as the set up was done.
Very happy with the purchase so far, longevity is going to be determined.

I got the windshield wipers yesterday, installed on my 2020 Cadillac XT4 and they work great! Easy to install, especially when you watch the video and it‚Äôs your first time installing your own windshield wipers.

These were incredibly easy to put onto my Mazda 6. It took probably 8 minutes, and most of that was getting it out of the package. They make no noise and don't leave streaks. Definitely worth the money. Life is too short to drive with bad wipers.

Works pretty well on my 2018 Nissan Rogue SV and it was easy to install. It leaves a small rain drop line at the very end of the viper in heavy rain but it's nothing that'd distract clear view. Been using it for almost 2 months now with quite a few rains in my area, no issues so far.

I have these wipers on two different cars. They only last ~1.5 years, but they work great when they do!
My old wipers were starting to chatter and it was driving me insane. I needed something that was quiet and worked well.

When they're new, they've worked very well. I personally can't see the difference with my treated vs untreated windshield, but honestly that's not a huge deal to me. The installation took literally 30 seconds per blade... The hardest part was getting the old one off! When it rains, these are silent, and have good visibility. The only ones I'd recommend over these that are on my girlfriends car are the rainx high end sillicone ones. Those are just next level.

Love that it came with the QR code to show me how to install this. The code has all the different types of hooks for you to be able to find your car. I was glad I didn't have to ask a man to do this for me. I will say removing one plastic piece in the beginning made me thing I broke it for a minute so that is the only thing I would change but I replaced all my wipers and the back one with this brand.

I have always hated my wiper blades, they're noisy and don't work very well. But these things are amazing! They are almost silent and are the best working blades I have tried, especially for the price.

I didn't realize that the wipers for my car needed two different sizes so I accidentally bought two of the same side!

I swapped these out on my car when my old wipers started to fall apart (original dealer issue). These hook on and click in pretty easy once you remove the old wiper. The clarity is very good and I don't hear rubbing/squeaking noises (even during a light, misty rain). I'll see how long these hold up, but so far they are very good! Note: my car required two different sizes (driver side was longer), so be sure to check them against your vehicle model (don't assume you need 2 of the same size).

reviews.content: These are my absolute favorite markers for writing on the weekly dry erase calendar I have on my fridge. reviews.content: These are holding up extremely well for me. My car is outside 24/7 in Texas. I only use Bosch wiper blades on my car. They wipe the best and last the longest. You pay a little more but when you compare the wipe and durability you probably spend the same or more for the other brands.

I am quite pleased with their performance. They were very easy to install and fit perfectly on my car. The blades are very durable and made of high-quality materials. They are also very quiet, which is a huge plus in my book.

However, the one downside to these wiper blades is that they started streaking less than 3 months after I installed them. While they still clean my windshield relatively well, the streaking is definitely noticeable and somewhat frustrating

My 2019 f150 lives outside in Louisiana sun. The wipers are about 18 months old and are still going strong. No streaking and no brittle rubber. I take no care of them and never wash my vehicle, so all dust and bugs on the windscreen is removed by these blades

These are the longest lasting wiper blades I have had since moving here. Most barely make a year. You do pay for them, but they are a pleasure to own.

My previous pair of these blades lasted me around 3 years and I could have gone longer with them. They are super easy to install, quiet, and efficiently remove the rain from my windshield. Spend a few extra bucks on these. They'll last longer and outperform cheaper blades.
This is my second set for my 2019 F150. The first set lasted 2 years, and still had life left. Hands down, the best wiper blades I've used.

I have tried just about every brand of wipers on my cars, but once I found Icons I have never strayed. I've used them on many different models and they perform much better than other brands. name: Vortex Optics Diamondback HD Binoculars 10x42
description:
Product Description

The Diamondback HD delivers a rock-solid optic that optically punches high above its class.

reviews.content:
These are my first real pair of binos. I got these as a surprise gift for my wife for our trip to the Everglades. Apparently there are lots of birds there lol. She like birds. Me, eh‚Ä¶not my bag so much. Compared to the gift shop binos at the national park, these are amazing.

The optics are razor sharp. They are as sharp as the pictures taken from my mirrorless camera lenses costing 8x as much. I was surprised at the clarity and sharpness. The first thought that ran through my head was I need to get a longer range pair but I snapped back to reality. The 8x28 is perfect. I think the next size up would have too much ‚Äúshake‚Äù making it harder to zero in on the object. She would complain and I‚Äôd never hear the end of it. Ugh. These can ‚Äúshake‚Äù a little but it‚Äôs not that noticeable, as others have mentioned. The distance is nice.

The controls and adjustability are top notch. It stays where you left it.

The size and weight is very manageable. It‚Äôs not too heavy so you can carry this around all day and it won‚Äôt hurt your neck.

It comes with a nice case that includes a shoulder strap for the case and a neck strap for the binos. Incidentally, the rubber eye cover loop is not broken, it is split by design. That is so you can remove the rubber cover and still have it attached to the neck strap on one side. Otherwise, it would be hard to use with the rubber cap attached to both sides of the neck strap.

What I didn‚Äôt like about it‚Ä¶
The rubber eye covers, the eye side, comes off rather easily when you put it in the case. The large side rubber cover also comes off too easily. I wish these snapped on or took a little more force to pull off.

The metal strap loops are too small. You can only slide a single flat strap through it. So any strap thicker than that won‚Äôt fit. I had purchased a OP/TECH strap thinking I could install it but I can‚Äôt. It‚Äôs wider so it‚Äôs more comfortable and usually the included straps are junk-but the included neck strap is okay.

All in all my experience with the first real pair of binos has been stellar. I‚Äôve purchased a red dot sight from vortex previously and it has been great. Vortex as a company continues to impress me with these binos.

First; delivery was the worst! Out for delivery while I was on vacation and excited to receive them for sightseeing. Come to find out, they weren‚Äôt out for delivery as stated on the app. I cancelled the order and lost out on the sightseeing event.
The binoculars, after reordering, we‚Äôre awesome! High quality and smooth operation. Eye cups, center focus and size were perfect for me. I got the 10X32. Bright and clear, but it was the quality of the product that impressed me. They‚Äôre not something you might want for backpacking but they‚Äôre small enough to notice the difference from a large pair. They‚Äôre the perfect midsized binocular at a very reasonable price. Happy customer for the Vortex binocular but very displeased with the Amazon promise to deliver on time!

Now I know that $200 might not seem ‚Äúmodest‚Äù to most folks but price a par of Trinovids for some idea of just how crazy expensive binoculars can get. Are Trinovids ten times better than these? Probably not but they are damn sure ten times better than the cheapies I have been using up to now. If you have the money, buy a pair. You won‚Äôt regret it.

The Vortex HD Diamondback 10x42 are a solid pair of binoculars. For a inexpensive ($195) binocular they are well worth the price, the glass is very clear and bright. The build quality is is on par with more expensive brands. And it comes with a a very nice case and straps. I bought the binocular as a ‚Äúused but like new ‚Äú idem from Defender Outdoors LLC and they were definitely new; with all the proper packaging, accessories and instructions. Very happy with the purchase.
Needed a set to give more zoom than 10 x 42. And these 12 x 50 did the job plus price was right.
Clear and ergonomic, therefore a great buy for the money, as good or better than products for twice the money.

I had 8X good quality binoculars and they were lacking zoom and clarity at targets out past 100 yards. Needed to upgrade and didn‚Äôt know if I should go to 10X, 12X or 15X‚Ä¶quickly realized 10X wasn‚Äôt enough. 15X is too much for hand held sighting, need a tripod to focus at that zoom and didn‚Äôt want to be stuck having to use a tripod. These 12X are great at zooming out to easily see targets and shots at 100-125 yards with great clarity‚Ä¶exactly what I needed.

My old pair of binocs just weren't cutting it anymore. Awhile back, a friend of mine let me look through his Vortex binoculars and I was very impressed with the clarity of them. I was needing a new pair for hunting, so I bought these, and it was a very good choice. The price can't be beat for the exceptional quality you get with them.
Best binoculars under 250 bucks hands down no questions asked. The chest pouch is awesome. Lense covers work good. They give you everything you need.
Good quality feel to these. Lenses are bright and clear. Very happy

reviews.content: I use it to complement my stand up freezer, so I don't need to overload it, given that I open and close it so often. The chest freezer stays shut until I need to add something to the stand up. A chest freezer wouldn't do it by itself. I have a thermometer and I check all my refrigeration regularly. It is right-on. Maximum electricity is about 150 watts or 1.5 amps, what an incandescent light bulb would draw. I got it when I realized that my stand-up was running 24 hours during the summer. The chest freezer will add years to the life of my main freezer, which I bought used.
The perfect fit
Great small freezer. Very quiet running

This 5.0 cubic foot chest freezer arrived very well packaged and with no dents anywhere. After plugging it in, within an hour it was down to 8 degrees, and soon further down to -2, its stable temp. Set-up was simple, except for extracting the retractable power cord from its storage pocket. The edge of the pocket cover happens to align with the edge of a vent cover, so it is not at all obvious and you end up wondering whether the vent cover needs to be removed. I had to search through YouTube videos to find the answer to that problem. Live and learn.
Works good

Arrived in good shape no scratches or dents and looks very nice.

It was light enough for my husband to move around the house on his own when it arrived.

It‚Äôs just my husband and I and even tho I buy meats and such in bulk (lasts forever that way) there is still a LOT of space left over.

I just wish there was a way to organize the contents.
I am happy with the product
My unit is very efficient and very fast cooling. When my unit arrived the only blemish was that the upper right front corner had been dented but it doesn't affect the overall condition.
Came with a big dent! Works okay but lids not all that tight so have to put weight on it!

Two of us are living in a condo and I knew I wanted a chest freezer for the garage. I was debating between the 5 and 7 cu.ft. models and I made the right choice. The smaller of the two holds a LOT of food. I ran out and bought a small turkey and all kinds of sale items that included meats and veggies and 2 pies and ice cream...and there is room for SO MUCH MORE!
I really wish this Midea 5 cu. ft freezer came with two baskets instead of one, but other than that, I am very pleased with my choice thus far.
It arrived two days after I ordered it, in perfect condition, and I was able to "walk" it into my garage by myself. I am a 5'2", 75 year-old woman. Living in NE Ohio with winter approaching, I can now hibernate if necessary. It should only increase my monthly electric bill by $2 to $2.50 per month. I set it to High initially, but after reading other comments, I feel comfortable turning it down to the Medium setting.
I am well pleased with this purchase.

name: SYLVANIA ECO LED Light Bulb, A19 60W Equivalent, Efficient 9W, 7 Year, 750 Lumens, 2700K, Non-Dimmable, Frosted, Soft White - 8 Pack (40821)
description:
Product Description

Bring modern and best-in-class lighting into your home with the energy-saving SYLVANIA 9W ECO LED A19 soft white bulbs! This 9 watt LED lamp is specifically designed to replace 60-watt incandescent bulbs. At only 9 watts, this SYLVANIA LED lamp can emit a bright 750 lumens, saving you money on your electricity bill. In fact, this bulb‚Äôs estimated annual energy cost is just $1.08! With a lifespan of 7 years, this LED lamp emits 750 lumens. What‚Äôs more, SYLVANIA LED lights don‚Äôt need a warm up, don‚Äôt overheat, and don‚Äôt emit harmful UV-, IR-, radiation and are mercury-free. You can also safely install them in ceiling light fixtures (not for use with fully enclosed fixtures) or accent lights. If you like modern lighting in your living room or workspace, then this product‚Äôs 2700 soft white color is just right for you! See the clear difference SYLVANIA makes; better lighting for better living.

reviews.content:
I am very glad I took a chance on these. I have a rare eye disease and my vision is going dimmer by the day.
I have bought a lot of different bulbs but they all did very little to help me see indoors. When I put these in I was surprised at the difference . My rooms are bright as sunshine and it is saving me a lot of headaches from squinting and straining to see clearly. Glad to have them and I am definitely ordering more. My only concern was they needed to be padded better I am surprised they made it through shipping.

Using a KILL-A-WATT meter to compare the coast between this LED and its incandescent equivalent, the savings become evident. The meter measures based on 24 hours or use, but dividing the number by .25 gives you a 6 hr/day cost. When you multiply by the number of bulbs, you truly see the cost/savings. I only have 8 bulbs, but the incandescent cost me $79.05 x .25 = $19.76 per bulb/yr. x 8 bulbs = $158.08/yr. The LED costs $8.64 x .25 = $2.16 per bulb/yr x 8 =$17.28 . A savings of $140.80 over a years time. This is based off my cost of $0.141 per Kilowatt.
This is only my savings for my ceiling lighting fixtures which is less than 1/2 of my total fixtures, so changing everything to LED is going to be awesome, assuming these things last as long as they claim.

Greetings again fellow Amazon Dwellers.
Now, these bulbs are different than I'm used too. Super bright but with a nice soft glow. Plus their LED so they are gonna last longer. They better. So far they outshine ( see what 2ed did there? ) the crappy cheap competition bulbs that burn out after a month. That's what 2ed likes: if I'm gonna buy them they better
last till the Apocalypse .
2ed recommends them. That's all you need to know.
' Nuff said.
2ed

These bulbs are the bomb, and I do save money on my electricity bill. They also are very crisp. My daughter parked in the driveway, and wondered why it was so bright outside, at night lol. Smart investment.

Placed them all around the house with hopes to see help with the electrical cost because it's just ridiculous right now. I purchased because of the reviews and don't like strong lighting. Arrived fine all worked. Recommend

These light bulbs have a crisp white light. It helps with reading especially when compared to regular light bulbs. I‚Äôve had less strain and less headaches since using these bulbs. I would recommend.

They are plastic.
They work fine in my application.
Will buy more as needed.

I bought 2 more boxes!

One of the bulbs in the pack did not work. I can visibly see the electrical contact on the back/bottom of the light isn't formed correctly and I think it's not making contact inside the socket. The other 5 bulbs worked and they are very, very bright and WHITE. Much, much brighter than the 60W incandescent bulbs I replaced.

I just hope they last a good while. I hate replacing bulbs.
These work great and at a substantial discount than our local box stores
I had 9 bulbs dead in my house. I got these and replaced more than I should have my house looks so different!!

name: Flexzilla Garden Hose 5/8 in. x 50 ft, Heavy Duty, Lightweight, Drinking Water Safe, ZillaGreen - HFZG550YW-E
description:
Product Description
Product Description

Flexzilla Garden Hose is engineered with a Flexible Hybrid Polymer that is both lightweight and durable. This premium hose redefines flexibility and is easy to maneuver around your yard. Flexzilla Garden Hose has zero memory which allows the hose to lay flat and ensures that sprinklers stay put without twisting. Its durable outer cover is abrasion-resistant, and the reinforced mid-layering provides extra strength. Plus, with our superior O-ring, you get a long-term, leak-free connection at the spigot. The Flexible Hybrid Polymer inner tube material is drinking water safe.

From the Manufacturer

Flexzilla 5/8" x 50' garden hose. Flexzilla is a revolutionary hose featuring a Premium Hybrid Polymer material that redefines flexibility. Flexzilla hose characteristics offer zero memory allowing it to lay-flat exactly where you drop it and won‚Äôt work against you during operation or coiling after use. Flexzilla offers extreme all-weather flexibility, even in sub-zero conditions. Flexzilla is currently in use by oil companies located in Alaska!

reviews.content:
Nothing negative to say. Came package nicely in a simple box. Also came with a printed instruction showing how its made and info. Obviously loosen the hose, completely straighten it, and then run the water.

I would definitely recommend it, I had straighten it out by walking towards the watering area but the hose itself was not completely straighten it out by the faucet section. When I ran the water it started to twist in sections. Easy fix, I flipped the hose but it's not really needed. I shut off the water to fully straighten it out, than ran the water. The water pressure was good and I really like the color of lime green nice contrast to the turf grass and most lawn colors. I was impressed with the company and how the hose felt sturdy and well-built that I'm buying a water gun from the same company, sometime later next week.

I had damaged my previous metal hose, one of the bolts came undone so I needed a new garden hose. I didn't want any more gimmicks like expanding hoses or metal hoses with seems to get damage easily at the link, not allowing the water to pass. Choose to get a well built hose and found this. Its flexible, works well and good pressure.

UPDATE : 2/14/2023

After using it multiple times a week. (new Asiatic Jasmine minima driveway spot) and yard watering weekends. Its sturdy, feels good in the hand and overall I like it and seems so far durable. Its stiff but still more flexible than basic hoses. Makes it easy to pack in a hose holder box I have.

I needed a short hose to extend my sump pump in my crawl space to the outside wall to join to a 50 foot hose.

I'm in New England and the last 3 winters have been challenging. Below freezing to above freezing causing major water issues in my crawlspace. I needed a heavy duty very pliable hose that could handle cold weather. Thus far this hose has been exceptional. I needed a 5 foot hose that attaches to my sump pump and runs to the outside wall of my crawlspace to attach to my 50 foot hose. This allows me to just attach my long hose without having to keep gong into my crawlspace. With the extreme temperature swings I have to take my longer hose into the house when the temps drop to avoid freezing. Now that I have this hose it's so much easier to just do that from the outside where I have this hose attached with several pipe clamps.

Impressions: Very sturdy. Well made. Stays very pliable. I have had no leaks on both connections. The price is very good as compared to other hoses.

I just bought a second as a backup. I don't think I will need it but I want to be on the safe side. If I flood I can lose my well pump. No regrets thus far. Durability: Time will tell. Regards.

I purchased 2 of these on July 12th, 2021. I have a farm and garden, so I use hoses religiously, even during winter (for livestock troughs). I swear by these. Every day use for 18 months without a single break, no leaking from either connecting end, no kinks, no bubbling or bulging... I've even accidentally ran over them a couple times with my lawnmower and pickup truck!! (My grass gets stupid long lol) The flexibility even helps when they freeze during the winter, they're durable enough that you can really wrench them to break up the ice. Usually I bring them inside before a freeze but the weatherman likes to lie every now and then and I don't catch it in time. But even having been frozen several times for the last winter and a half, they're still working perfectly. Every other hose on the market is subpar to this brand!!

Side note, I noticed some folks having mold issues with their hoses... I haven't had any mold growing on mine, and one of them permanently stays inside my 12'x16' greenhouse...

Tubing seems thin (notice the grey sleeves to stop it folding/kinking), hardware is nicely styled. Makes a change from brass. The green is very vivid. You wont trip over it.

The stickers had me laughing though. Save some plastic and dont bother including those. I cant see anyone proudly advertising their (garden) hosepipe. The kids wont be all "please please dad can i have the hosepipe sticker" üòÇ leave the red bull stylings at the hardware.

This is our third hose like this. They are all still in use. We abuse them because we leave them laying in the sun. Some people complain about kinking, but the hose comes with instructions on how to roll it out the first time without having that problem. If you follow the instructions, they do not kink. If you just try to roll it out like any other hose, you'll likely be cursing a blue streak.

We are in the process of switching out all of the plastic in our house and came across WeeSprout products for our toddler's dinnerware. We started with the bowls and cups and loved them so much we decided to get the plates too. Unfortunately two of our bowls developed minor cracks, but once we reached out to WeeSprout, they very quickly apologized and sent us replacements! We are very impressed with their team and their products.

I use it with a water transfer pump and needed hoses that don't kink, coil, or bunch up, easy to maneuver and just lay flat wherever I put it. Flexzilla does the job. Love the high visibility color too!

I‚Äòve been them using them for several months for an on demand hot water heater for my barn. They handle the heat well and they‚Äôre super flexible and good quality. The short length is perfect for my needs and they‚Äôre easy to drain. I use quick connects to attach them and they‚Äôre super easy to remove and drain the system.
This hose is great quality. However it's a pain to wind up it kinks back on itself terribly.
At 100 feet long, it's just right for those of us with a larger yard. Would buy again if I needed another.

description:
Product Description

Designed with American innovation for beginner stargazers, the Celestron Travel Scope 70DX is a professionally engineered refractor telescope that is perfect for celestial or terrestrial viewing on the go. It‚Äôs the perfect telescope for adults and kids to use together with its fully-coated, high-quality glass optics, including a refractor-style 70mm objective lens. The aperture allows higher-resolution viewing, without adding a lot of extra weight. Added coating on the large 70mm lens allows more light to enter, providing sharper, crisper viewing of celestial and terrestrial objects during the day or at night.

The Celestron telescope for beginners is designed with several operating features that make it exceptionally user-friendly. Our precision manufacturing standards and high-quality materials are unmatched in the industry. We‚Äôve included two quality eyepieces (20mm and 10mm), 2x Barlow lens, and a star diagonal for crisp low- and high-power viewing during the day or at night, allowing you to enjoy close-ups of wildlife in nature or stargaze with family and friends.

This telescope also comes with a smartphone adapter that allows you to connect any smartphone to any telescope eyepiece with an outside diameter of 45 mm or smaller for digiscoping opportunities. The additional magnification provided by the eyepiece allows your phone to capture great images of the Moon and planets. To capture the best image, Celestron has also provided a Bluetooth shutter release that allows you to trigger the camera‚Äôs shutter on any Android or iOS smartphone remotely, without disturbing the placement of your phone and telescope.

The Celestron Travel Scope 80 weighs just 3.3 pounds and assembles in seconds with no tools required. It‚Äôs easy to use to navigate the sky. When your observing session is over, everything packs up into the handy included traveling backpack.

Your purchase also entitles you to a FREE download of Celestron‚Äôs BONUS Starry Night Astronomy Software with information on thousands of celestial objects, printable sky maps, and more. It‚Äôs the best way to learn about the night sky and plan your next observing session.

Celestron is the world‚Äôs #1 telescope brand, with telescopes in world-class research observatories and even aboard the International Space Station. Now your family can enjoy a quality Celestron telescope in a portable package and at a price to fit your budget.

reviews.content:
I've had a 8" diameter dobsonian telescope for about 25 years but wanted a smaller scope I could take camping when I didn't feel like dragging the heavy, 4 foot long one with me. I also wanted one I could use as a spotting scope for birding.

There are only two things I don't like about this scope. 1) tripod is way to wimpy. Even on a name brand heavier-duty tripod, it's less stable than a dobsonian. The tripod it comes with is barely adequate. It works best if placed on a sturdy table with the legs extended just far enough to make it less tippy. 2) There is some lense flare when looking at Mars, but this is to be expected for this price of scope. There is also some minor purple fringing around the edge of the moon, but the moon looks so gorgeous thru it that you forget to notice.

Now for what I like:
1) Portability - doesn't kill my back to haul it outside. Sets up in minutes. So easy to take outside, I use it all the time. I'd only haul my big scope out a couple times a year because it was too heavy.
2) The moon looks so AWESOME thru this scope!!!
3) Jupiter: you can see several of the moons. I haven't been able to make out any of the color bands as I kinda can with my bigger scope, but that's to be expected due to the size/cost of this one.
3) Saturn: It's my favorite planet. Even though it looks tiny in this scope, you can see the rings and it's beautiful.

I was able to see the nebula in Orion's sword from the city (I live on the outskirts of Salt Lake City) It was really beautiful on one especially dark night, but most nights it's not dark enough to see it well. I haven't been able to see other nebulas I've looked for. I expect that when I'm able to get away from the city lights I'll be able to see more nebulas and galaxies. (Nebulas and planets thru backyard telescopes don't look like most photos. You don't see the colors. Nebulas look like gray clouds. They can still be beautiful tho).

The eyepieces feel cheap, very light weight, but are surprisingly good. Better than I expected for the price. They have enough eye relief that They work ok with my eyeglasses, but I prefer to take my glasses off when looking thru the scope.

I haven't tried the digiscoping adapter yet, but I've experimented with a similar one on my other scope. Digiscoping is tricky and often not all you hope it'd be, but you might get some good photos of the moon.

I haven't really tried it as a spotting scope yet, other than to look at some leaves at the top of a tree, and expect it'll be good for that. I'm considering buying a zoom eyepiece for that.

All in all, I think this is an amazing scope for the price. Too bad the tripod isn't as good as the scope. If you can get a heavier tripod, you'll love this scope, especially if you can find some dark skies. But even from the city, the Moon, Saturn & Jupiter are so amazing thru this scope.

This telescope has been so much fun! Easy to use and set up. The tripod is a little light so having a camera or phone on the tail end makes everything a little shaky and hard to guide by hand. Very durable but easy to pack to events or on trips.

After several decades, I wanted to return to observing the night sky through telescopes. I didn't want to begin with an expensive telescope, so I went with a entry level item. Celestron is one of the most popular telescope makers in the world, so I thought I couldn't go wrong with a telescope from them, which is why I went with the Celestron 70mm Travel Scope DX.
I was a bit disappointed with the quality of the diagonal, spotting scope, and tripod. After reading some of the reviews though, I was prepared for that. I ordered a replacement diagonal and tripod along with the telescope. I was more concerned with the quality of the scope. I was pleased with the scope itself.
The best way to get started is by observing the easier objects. It allows a person to get used to searching the sky, finding the object you're looking for, and enjoying the view. What better subject to begin with than the moon.
The above pictures are of the telescope where I was taking terrestrial photos using a SVBONY SV105 camera. The next was the first picture of the moon with the telescope with my Google Pixel and the smart phone adapter that came with the telescope. As you can see, it needs a lunar filter. Thankfully the telescope came with one. The third image is one taken of the moon with the same Google Pixel phone. This one I still didn't use the filter for, because the Google Pixel has the ability to adjust for the brightness of the moon. I just used my phone's photo ability. The final photo is of trees in the distance taken using the 70mm Travel Scope and the SVBONY SV105 camera.

Initially, I bought a cheaper plastic knock off which barely worked, overly complicated to set up because of its cheap production. Cut to an episode of Big bang theory where one of the characters was using a Celestron telescope for an experiment. I saw the brand before but know nothing about quality telescopes; I returned the cheap telescope and paid a $40 difference for this telescope. Just taking it out of the box, I could feel the quality is much higher than the original one I bought. The body is heavy high quality materials, the eyepieces are actually metal as opposed to plastic coated in chrome. As soon as I set it up, I was able to get a clear view, even the cellphone adapter is made of metal. I am looking forward to using this at night seeing what I can see and capture. My only complaints are the quality of the tripod and travel bag are not great but the tripod is slightly better than the one that came with the knockoff. Recommended for beginners to learn on.

Overall this is a great beginner telescope. The fact that it comes with it's own backpack is a plus. It was super easy to assemble and I was able to view the full moon beautifully. The software is terrific and easy to use.

My complaints are:

The tripod is NOT stable and far too short to be useful (I'm 5' 7"). I nearly turned myself into a pretzel trying to use the scope and then look into the eyepiece. I wound up grabbing a camp chair and sitting so that I didn't throw my back out We're looking in to getting another one.

The camera attachment is not very easy to use. You have to take your phone out of its case, but no matter how light, it pulls the telescope out of angle and you have to start over again from scratch. I actually held my camera to the eyepiece to get a picture

Because of this, I gave this 4 stars

The telescope is great. Super light and easy to use.
I upgraded the spotting scope to one with the laser. The tripod is lightweight but not very sturdy. When I try to lock position in place it always moves because the telescope is a bit too heavy for it. So I‚Äôm likely going to upgrade to a better tripod.
The iPhone mount attachement is also useless because it‚Äôs heavier than the scope. So again locking an image into place after finding it in the focusing scope is impossible.

So some updates are needed to use the telescope. But it‚Äôs a great one for beginnners. I tried another Celestron a bit more advanced. It made finding and focusing much much easier and smoother. But the item was bulky and heavy.

So I prefer this one just for its compactness and ease of use. Price evens out to the other more expensive one after the add ons.

¬†It's tiny. Smaller than what I was expecting. But worth it. I was shocked at how close I could get with this telescope. It's versital and can be used for wildlife watching as well. Some people would say its cheap made. But I was impressed with the tripod as well. So far I have no complaints. It's a great little travel telescope. Highly recommend.

I reviewed this product before I decided on which brand of telescope to purchase. The positive and 5 star reviews for Celestron 70mm Travel Scope DX did not let me down. Assembly is so simple. I first looked through during the day. I was amazed at the beautiful view of nature. Which one of my faves !!! At the first look at stars at night took my breathe away!! I didn't know that many stars were visible through this telescope. My kids ,that are young adults ,absolutely enjoyed seeing the moon for the first time .We were fascinated seeing the craters so detailed!!!! Now I wish I had gotten one of these when they were little. So if your kids are little. I would highly recommend getting a Celestron telescope for beginners.. I have only had it for a month so therefore I am learning as I go. So far so good :) I will take pics and add them to this review soon.

My son decided he was super into space last year so I wanted to get him a telescope for Christmas but had no idea where to begin. When asking for suggestions I kept hearing one brand- Celestron. And I am so happy with that suggestion.
The telescope was very easy for us to set up. My husband and I had never set up a telescope in our lives so we had no idea what to do but the instructions were easy to follow. My son is 8 and he enjoyed using it and caught on to the basics of it quickly.
The backpack makes it super easy to just pack in the car and take it with us to the park and even on vacation to the beach.
Great quality, easy to use, h highly recommend.
Grandson birthday present but due to weather and basketball games hard to find a good clear night to use it. But was immediately impressed. Said too cool.

It stunk up my whole room when i unpacked it. I washed it with hand soap and that helped quite a bit.
Just buy it if you in need of one. No logo. Just clean black mat and looks very stylish on your desk. Good quality as well.
Great and durable mouse pad! I shove this into my backpack almost everyday and it is holding up like a champ! It works very well with my mouse and the mouse glides very seamlessly.

Spraying Lysol on it helps and layout pads separately
After that no issue

name: Sharpie Permanent Markers, Fine Point, Black, 12 Count
description:
Product Description

Sharpie Fine Point Markers Permanent marker for use in industrial, retail and home applications. Long-lasting, fine point tip with quick-drying, alcohol-based ink. Use to mark on CDs and labels.

reviews.content:
I've always loved Sharpies, namely, the ultra-fine and fine point types. On some surfaces, the stuff you write/mark needs to be allowed to dry for a fairly short amount of time or else you can smear it and then not be able to undo the smeared/messed up part, but on some surfaces it's set right away. Either way, once it's set, it stays that way. I have stuff I wrote I've written on with a Sharpie many years, even decades ago, that's still good as new or maybe only with a little wear. Of course, I'm not talking about just writing on paper, in which case you'd obviously expect that. But I'm talking about surfaces such as rubber or certain types of plastic that you can't or can't easily or clearly write on with "normal" pens at all: those were easy to use a Sharpie on and what I wrote or drew on those surfaces stays there for as long as I'd ever need (probably until after I die, after decades of being very useful and reliable!).

I also haven't had any of these leak on me, as I've had many normal ink pens do over the years, sometimes ruining something like a shirt I liked a lot. No Sharpie has ever done that to me, though, I'm happy to say! I've also packed these in suitcases during not only more local, but also during long international flights, when the flying altitude is quite high and at least sometimes, I assume the baggage compartments were not pressurized. Yet, they've always survived well, never rupturing or even leaking. Maybe I've just been lucky, but if that's the case, then I've been lucky countless times and feel very safe with Sharpie products, as well as feeling like if any ink pen is going to write on a surface (without being a "paint" type pen that's much more expensive and usually unnecessary), then these will do the job, and last long enough to make me feel like I got my money's worth.

Lastly, it's worth noting that in this case, "name brand" status can really make a difference, and for very, very little money (spending a few more cents for Sharpies than a budget brand isn't like buying a Rolex!). It might be easy to forget about this if you're looking for a bargain on a minor item like markers, so I thought this worth mentioning here, even though I've never mentioned this factor in any previous review of anything else. Maybe it's partially because you can have the best name-brand item for such little investment when you're talking about markers. But mostly, it's because the Sharpie is so well-known, and for so many decades, in many professions as being THE "professional" marker (the only one, really), one that any/every TRUE pro in that given profession uses without exception. In fact, people in my past line of work never asked for a marker. No matter what company or client was involved, no matter where we were on a cross-country tour (at least in the USA, but maybe also elsewhere: I'm just not qualified to say for sure what the case is in other countries), everyone always just said, "Hey, do you have a Sharpie?" or "I need a Sharpie, please." Sharpie was equivalent to the word "marker," but was used instead as the most natural, normal thing to say instead of marker, which just goes to show how much it's the accepted standard that, when violated, stands out. That is, if someone asks for a Sharpie (meaning, marker), and you hand them something else, they WILL notice that it's not the normal, high-quality marker they expected.

Sharpies are the gold standard in multiple business worlds, I know, but the one I happened to work in had me doing production and/or tour management within various popular music genres (e.g., various types of "rock," pop, etc.). Working in various roles in the music business, many times I found myself playing roles in which I would need to be able to provide a marker to an artist (musician) so they could use it give their autograph to a fan on a very wide variety of potential surfaces that they wanted signed. I always had the production case well-stocked with Sharpies (and if I hadn't, anyone else stocking it would have inevitably and only used Sharpies), not only due to their ability to do the job and do so reliably no matter what odd things fans wanted signed, and no matter what varied surfaces the production crew might need to write upon, but also, to be honest even though it's unpopular to admit you do something due to wanting to present a certain "image," because it was the ONLY pen that a true "pro" would use.

Whether it was so that fans would know they were dealing with true pros ("fine point" are the standard for autographs, or marking on things like boxes, btw), or so that our business associates such as the local production companies (if I was touring) or the touring crew (if I was doing local production) would know they were dealing with the highest caliber on our end as well. Like anyone taking their career and careers of those they work with, as well as their organization's success seriously, I'm sure you want to be seen as a pro for various reasons, including letting those you do business with, your customers/clients, those who you buy from, etc. feel confident that in working with you, they're working with true pros at the top of their game, providing the best products or services available in your field. It instills confidence on others' part when they see you using the gold standard tools, and in the case of permanent markers, that happens to be Sharpies. Using any other brand just doesn't say "I'm a pro" like a Sharpie does. And worse, it can make it seem like you're a "wannabe," someone who's just very new in your field and unaware of how things work, or possibly even a failure, who cares more for saving just a piddly few bucks or cents than for providing the best quality available of whatever you provide. It's not even about the pens when it comes to this issue, of course. But the impression you give off about yourself can be affected by something that's seemingly (but not really) so insignificant as the brand of marker you use. That's not true about what paper brand of staples or paper you use, imo. I'm not saying every single thing matters like this. But for whatever reason, Sharpies have long been the default marker that pros use, possibly in your field as well. And your overall presentation of yourself and your business to any who see that pen, even if you're not actually using it, can translate into more than enough additional dollars you make as a result of being seen as a reliable pro as you could possibly save buying any other brand, as odd as that seems hearing myself write these words (normally, I don't think this way, and I wouldn't say this about most stuff I'd use in my business activities).

But it's also the case that, in my experience (and I have occasionally used other brands of markers that other people gave me to use), Sharpies are as good as or better than any other marker I've ever used. As should be the case, "image" doesn't have to matter here: if you just want the best, most reliable permanent marker out there, you'd get a Sharpie anyway.

And btw, no, I do not have ANY investments in the Sharpie company, if that's what they're called, or any other possible personal benefit in recommending these pens!

I thought I HAD written a disparaging review and want to apologize about it (but I can't find the review). I thought that other products much cheaper would do just as well. After all this time (close to 2 yrs) I have to admit that no, the cheaper stuff does not do as well. Most of my label written with cheaper stuff lost whatever was written on them a while ago. So, the ink is really more permanent.
Now, is it sharp enough. Not quite. The felt tip wears out too easily. Is it the worth the money? Not quite either. Once you know that it WILL last out in the sun and rain, you will have to decide according to your budget.
I am retired and live in the trpics, so... you get it.

I finally needed to replace my sharpie pens and I wanted the basic black sharpie marker that can be used to mark items. I am not using them to decorate in colors. For the value of the cost I got a 12 pack
Classic Sharpie, they work well, last and can never be found when you need them.
I use these when labeling food at work.
Very good
Sharpies are the best permanent markers for most things
Awesome product
Great Value. Lasts a long time if the cap is not lost!
I got them for my mom. They work fine. No issues with writing, delivery or anything.

name: Zebra Pen Z-Grip Retractable Ballpoint Pen, Medium Point, 1.0mm, Black Ink, - 18 Count (Pack of 1), Model Number: 22218
description:
Product Description

Looking for an everyday tool that doesn‚Äôt look or perform like one? ZEBRA's Z-Grip brand of pens is where simple, effective style meets high performance writing. The Z-Grip Ballpoint Retractable Pen delivers on all fronts: value, performance, comfort, and style. There's no need to compromise on any of the attributes you like in your pens as the Z-Grip Retractable Ballpoint Pen features easy-glide ink, a comfort ridged grip and a metal clip for durability. The silky smooth low viscosity ink provides quicker writing speeds and a smooth, skip-less writing experience, making the Z-Grip Retractable Ballpoint Pen ideal to use for note-taking, journaling and long meetings. A soft, latex-free rubberized grip provides increased comfort while the plastic barrel allows for ink supply visibility. The convenient metal pocket clip allows quick access and ensures you will never lose your favorite pen again. Now you can get the job done right every time with a reliable, smooth-flowing pen! You'll feel the difference when you write, but not at the cash register. Ballpoint pen is not refillable.

reviews.content:
If you‚Äôre looking for cheap pens these are good. They write smoothly and I like the feel. Two big problems I saw with them (but again, you kind of get what you pay for):

They run out of ink pretty fast. I‚Äôve been a little disappointed with how fast I run through the ink. I write a bit, but not an abnormal amount. Really just in my journal every day, and usually only a few pages at most (small 5x7-ish sized notebook). But luckily the package is large, so I‚Äôm not too worried about that. Just may.l not be the most cost-effective option if you‚Äôre buying for an office or other environment where you will be writing a lot.

The other thing I haven‚Äôt loved is the speed that the ink leaves the pen. If I‚Äôm just writing it seems to work fairly well, with only a few letters here and there coming out slightly faded. But if you try to draw a line (I usually put a line between journal entries so I can maximize page usage‚Ä¶ because I use my journals a lot), it fades halfway across my page (again, it‚Äôs only like 4-5‚Äù across‚Ä¶). So not super ideal for anything more than regular text writing or something along those lines. Any continuous lines tend to run out of ink and you have the lift the pen and start again. Maybe a weird complaint, but I know people who use these types of pens for art and other things like that - so I would not recommend these for that.

Overall, even with these complaints, I feel like for the price, these are pretty good pens. I‚Äôve liked them and it was nice to get so many in a package.

I like that they are retractable. These pens are a great value as compared to most retractable pens. Eventually some of them come apart, which is to be expected, but unlike other pens, they DO NOT leak when they come apart. I have bought several packs and will buy again when needed.

I can't believe I'm rating pens. I go thru a lot of pens. I'm always writing notes, taking notes, scribbling, etc. This is a great deal for amazing pens for what i need for. I didn't realize there were pens i didn't have to press down so hard to write with. Literally, i have arthritis in my hands, my hand and fingers cramp up, i would have to pull them apart. Very painful. I don't have to do this using these pens. It was a bit hard to get used to not having to press so hard. These are very comfortable for me to hold. I gave a couple away, when friends noticed i had so many. If anyone has arthritis in their hands i recommend these pens. They write clearly without pressing hard to write, don't skip and came in blue which i wanted and is sometimes hard to find.
Every day use , writes really smooth with very little effort .
Seems it gets harder and harder to find blue ink pens. .I love these.

These pens are the best pens I have ever bought. They write so smooth.

The only issue I have found if you don't use it for maybe 1 day it does not write real good the first 2 letters you write. Then its okay. The ink must dry out some after sitting a while. But I love these pens.

I would buy again.
I use these for work as a restaurant server and they never fail me. I love having the large pack of them as my pens seem to always be disappearing! Will be buying more in the future.
It takes a bit of effort to make it run and I hate it about any pen. My work involves require taking a lot hand notes. It works fine once it starts going. Below average product.

all fine tips - assortment of black which come wirh covered tips to scrape off when ready to use - blue tips are uncovered - comfortable to hold, no-bleed tips are great! - economy box is great as well!
Like bolder lines, must dry to avoid smears.

reviews.content:
My daughter is 1 year and 8 months. She absolutely loves it! I absolutely recommend it. She can climb all the way up the ladder and go down by herself which I was not expecting.

One thing to note: THIS DOES NOT FOLD UP. This isn't a problem for me, I don't regret buying the slide, but one of the photos posted makes it look like the slide folds in half for easy storage.

Unless I'm missing something, I do not believe you can store this flat like the picture without removing the slide from the ladder. I don't personally think I could take them apart now that they've been locked into place without risking hurting the plastic.

I definitely recommend this. It's lightweight enough to carry easily but feels very solid. It was wonderful to see my child having so much fun! But like I said, you cannot fold for storage! Not without taking it apart again. And if you've ever assembled something like this, you know they are not built for those plastic notches to come out of their holes easily.

I think how much fun it brings is worth giving up the floor space, especially if the weather outside isn't hospitable where you live right now. Whenever she outgrows this, I am going to hang onto it for someone else who has kids or my grandkids.

My son loved this slide! He was 18 months when he received it and learned how to climb up and go down the day of! It‚Äôs now a staple in his playroom. Took legit less than 2 minutes to put together and I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs dangerous at all. Perfect height and let‚Äôs them test themself in the beginning and learn coordinated climb in a safe way especially if you are there with them until they get the hang of it. If you are on the edge of buying it then get it! The other slides just cost more money for pretty much the same thing

it‚Äôs great for children who don‚Äôt have control of their motion weight going down bc the lip is close the floor. it‚Äôs great for teaching posture tho i do like how close the bottom is to the floor unlike other slides can make them jar themselves too hard. it‚Äôs a smooth landing. the little lip close to the ground will bump their back a little bit as their depending on it when they first experience a slide. it‚Äôs a great product. it definitely needs to sit on a children‚Äôs foam mat or play mat because it slides on the floor.

The slide üõù is super cute .. is not heavy is very light .. just perfect for babies start to discovery new things to do my baby start using when she is 1 year old and 3 months .. well my daughter is 9 years old and she using the slide too .. very strong

My 18 month old is slide obsessed. We‚Äôve been using a balance board and our nugget couches as a slide and she‚Äôs been consistently into it for months. This slide went on sale and we pulled the trigger. It doesn‚Äôt easily collapse for storage so be mindful of that! She‚Äôs very happy with it though. For an 18 month old it‚Äôs the perfect height/length that it‚Äôs safe for her to do alone but still be high enough to give her a thrill. It‚Äôs very light, easy to move, easy to wipe down, and easy to put together with a flat head screwdriver. Minus one star for it not being collapsible for easy storing.

I ordered this slide for my 1 year old based off of the many good reviews. The first time I purchased the slide, it came without handles. There are only 4 parts to the slide: slide, steps, 2 handles. Half of the slide didn‚Äôt arrive. So I sent it back and reordered it. The second time it came, it came without the manual/ instructions. It may seem like a simple thing but it‚Äôs frustrating and the bottom of the box was open. The slide itself is good for a 1 year old.

My toddler got this at 18 months and has been playing with it for 4 months non-stop. It‚Äôs the one toy she doesn‚Äôt get tired of. We even got her a $500 climbing set but she‚Äôs obsessed with her slide. üòÇüòÇ

Purchased this for a Christmas gift. Little girl was 14 months at time. She loves it. We purchased a pop up ball pit and she shoots down the slide into her ball pit. Great product! Light weight and easy to move.

I have a VERY physical toddler who is always on the go. I purchased this slide 8 years ago for his older sister and she loved it (until her older siblings inevitably broke it - it does have a weight limit, and while it's listed as indoor/outdoor, sunlight and heat will eventually degrade the plastic), so I knew it'd be a good choice for our active little boy. We set it up in the family room and he uses it all the time. He still gets into mischief all the time, but at least having the slide entertains him for part of the time!

Bought this slide for my 1 1/2 year old kids and they loved it, but the the top of the slide needs to be more wide. My kids struggled to get their legs in front of them because the slide was so narrow, and then they ended up just sliding head first.

It was delivered with care. We bought it as an extra to put in garage. It is very quiet. It has lots of room in it. Looks great. Very satisfied with this purchase.
