reviews.content: I wish I had bought this sooner. Our ice maker in our refrigerator broke, so we were had no ice. Our daughter found this one on Amazon and we thought it sounded like a good deal. I think it works great. just in a half hour or so you can empty the basket and start another batch. The noise does not really bother us. We keep it in our laundry room. It has a self-cleaning feature, which nice to have. We use the water out of our refrigerator which is filtered.

Ice machine made loud noise when making ice. Left alot of water in reservorir. Did a return and it was extremely easy and fast. Overall I am satisfied with the process and thats why i rated it 4 stars.

This ice maker is amazing. I'm just one person so it makes more ice then I could ever need. It's not too big. Nice size sits right on my kitchen table. The ice is made quickly and if you don't use it fast enough the ice melts back into the reservoir. Super easy to use and my favorite purchase in a long time

Our ice maker in our fridge stops working periodically and is a major inconvenience to try and fix it because you practically have to crawl inside of the freezer to put the lever back on. And even when it does work, it never keeps up when we have guests. So I bought this table top version‚Ä¶we always have enough ice now. It‚Äôs quick, easy to use, and cubes are decent sizes. The only complaint I have is that the cubes are wet and tend to clump together when I put them in the freezer tray.
fits great in our break room, which has limited space
This was a great purchase. When we are having a party we fill it up and the ice just keeps being produced. We are very happy with it.

Ok let me start off saying i really like this ice maker its fast and the catch basket is big compared to another ice maker i had before this one, not overly loud, and produces 2 sizes ice, large and small..it arrive on time, set up was a no brainer
Now id like to address some of the negative reviews about machines that stopped working after 4 or 5 months, well, mine did the same, and of course i thought it was going to have to go in the trash but after some experimenting this is what i came up with...
I ran the machine continually, i bagged up cubes and never shut the machine off, well when it stopped freezing and making cubes but the motor continued to run i gave some thought to it and decided i wasnt going to throw it out just yet so i left it unplugged on the counter for 2 days, and then i decided to try one more time, plugged it back in, filled it with water and turned it on and BOOM within 6 or 7 minutes cubes dropped into the catch basket! I was so happy because i love this machine, so my conclusion is you should not leave it running for long periods, store cubes in ziplock bags and give the machine a break by unplugging it for 24hrs or less, then fill the resevoir to max level and turn on. Also i might add my tap water causes lime easily so i do not use it in the machine, i buy bottled water for it....i hope this is helpful.
It makes great ice

I am very happy with this Ice Maker, It makes ice fairly quick. I turn it on when the ziplock bags in the freezer (previously filled with this ice) get low, making sure that the water area is full. Fill a gallon ziplock bag or three, then turn it off. It is great, if you get low on the water or the basket is full, the machine will turn itself off automatically. I use ice all year and so far this has saved me from having to fill trays that mysteriously end up empty when I want ice. If I somehow end up not having ice when I want it, it only takes a few minutes to have some. It has become my favorite appliance.

This ice maker works great makes ice fast just plug it in add water and turn it on that's it and the automatic shut off if it runs low on water it shuts down so no damage is done it also shuts down if the ice basket starts to over fill so no ice falls out and if you don't use all the ice as it melts the water goes back into the tank to reuse and keeps making ice no waste ice on demand it's also quiet and yes I recommend it the perfect gift you can also keep gathering up ice out of the basket and putting it in freezer bags and always have plenty of ice on hand great for tail gateing to take it with you gallon jugs of water a power inverter or generator you have ice for camping cold drinks or whatever you might need ice for

name: UNO Card Game, Gift for Kids and Adults, Family Game for Camping and Travel in Storage Tin Box [Amazon Exclusive]
description:
Product Description

UNO is the classic family card game that's easy to pick up and impossible to put down! Players take turns matching a card in their hand with the current card shown on top of the deck either by color or number. Special action cards, like Skips, Reverses, Draw Twos, color-changing Wild and Draw Four Wild cards, deliver game-changing moments as they each perform a function to help you defeat your opponents. If you can't make a match, you must draw from the center pile. And when you're down to one card, don't forget to shout "UNO!" The first player to get rid of all the cards in their hand wins. Now card game-lovers can get UNO in a sturdy tin that's great for travel and makes storage stress-free. Colors and decorations may vary.

reviews.content:
Remember when families and friends actually played board games, and card games? Instead of a living room with no conversation, just a bunch of people tapping and swiping their phones? Well getting this UNO set can help you relive some of the magic from the good old days. When everyone actually had fun and interacted with each other.

Believe it or not, I forgot how to play UNO. Which is weird, considering how much I played it when I was younger. Even as a young adult. But just like riding a bike, you never really lose it. Open the tin, break out the cards and the rule sheet. And in a minute, it all came back. So easy to play, that even toddlers can participate.

BONUS TIP: HOW TO GET EVEN THE SMALLEST KIDS INVOLVED

So Mattel recommends that kids ages 7 and up can play. But any kid 4-6 can most likely grasp the basic rules, as long as they can recognize numbers. The catch is that it may not hold the attention of a five year old all that great. But there's a way that you can still put the UNO cards to good use, while enjoying some bonding time with your little ones. Here's what I figured out, after a couple of games of UNO with our Little Girl....

Make it a memory game. What I did was go through the cards, and picked out two identical ones for different numbers/colors. So two green 5 cards. Two red 4 cards. Two blue 2 cards. Two yellow 7 cards. I tried to avoid sixes and nines. Basically take eight to twelve cards in total. Then place them in two to three rows, face down (UNO side up). I'd ask our Daughter to flip a card over. Yellow 7. Okay, now try to find the other Yellow 7. And she gets to flip over another card. If it's not the right one, I let her know that was a really good try. Now let's flip the cards over, and try it again. If she gets it right, I congratulate her, and she gets so excited. This way, she can play a simple game that also helps her work on her memory skills. So she can remember where certain cards were, and match them up. When she does well with six cards, I bump it up to eight cards. Then ten cards. It's simple, but fun for the smaller kids that may lose interest in actually playing UNO. And she still gets to have fun with the rest of us.

There are no negatives about this set. The only thing that could have possibly been improved, is to have made the tin a tiny bit more travel-friendly. The two stacks of cards are held in plastic, inside of the tin. But it seems like they could have simply made the tin much smaller, and still fit the cards in. Making it a bit easier to just stick in your pocket. That's not a dealbreaker, just thinking out loud. Otherwise, the quality of the cards and tin are both great.

Look. It's ten bucks. That's it. People spend more than that on two iced coffees, or a drive-through at a fast food place. But those are things you only get to enjoy once. Whereas you could use these cards in this tin for well over a decade. Plus you can make it a family tradition, or have fun when friends come over. It's advertised as a kid's game. But truth be told, we played it more in our dorm's game room than I ever did as a child. UNO never gets old. Why put it off? Add it to your shopping cart. You've got the ten bucks to spare, right now. Check out. It will show up at your home in as soon as a day, if you have Prime free shipping. And you can take that ten dollars, and turn it into million dollar memories with your family. But you can't do that, if you don't order it. So buy a set today, you'll be thankful you did.
As a collector I enjoy Amazon's collector tin option for Uno. They always arrive in great condition and look great on the shelf.

We play a ridiculous amount of Uno in the house and needed to replace our worn out deck. Since we play a lot, I figured it was worth it to upgrade from our zip top bag to the nice tin.

The tin seems sturdy and looks nice, easily stacking on the shelf of games.

BUT the tin has a flimsy cardboard insert that will surely not last long. The cardboard takes up space, making the tin bigger and bulkier than it needs to be. And when the cardboard falls apart, the cards will sit sloppily in the box instead of neatly stacked. Disappointing.

The game itself is classic UNO and has the newer wild cards with the blank area for house rules.

For whole family or big company who never met before!
I‚Äôm glad to find this in America
The case keeps the cards from bending

All of our grand-kids love this game. I realized that I needed my own copy so that when they come to visit, we can play it with them. They never seem to tire of it. I liked this version b/cit comes in a decorative tin that is sturdy to keep the cards safe from damage, also it's small so if we wanted to take it on vacation, we could. This is a game that has certainly stood the test of time. I remember playing it with my kids, and now they have their own. Great game.

I‚Äôm so glad I bought these uno cards for my students. They absolutely love the game, and the tin is an added bonus. We know where the cards are at all times, and I have a couple students who love to play uno, and they like the fact that it comes with its own case, instead of a box.
While a bit bulky for traveling, the cards are sturdy and the tin storage is good for storage.
Bought it for the grandkids. They love it!
GREAT GAME, GREAT PRICE, FAST SHIPPING!!!!

In a race to deplete your hand, match one of your cards with the current card shown on top of the deck by either color or number.
Strategize to defeat your competition with special action cards like Skips, Reverses, Draw Twos and color-changing Wild cards.
When you're down to one card, don't forget to shout "UNO!"
This fun family card game is perfect for adults, teens and kids 7 years old and up.

name: Pokemon TCG: Random Cards from Every Series, 50 Cards in Each Lot
description:
Product Description

YOUR BEST VALUE ON POKEMON CARDS: Look no further for the best deals on assorted Pokemon cards. LOTS OF RANDOM CARDS FROM ALL SERIES: You will receive a variety of regular and energy cards. Duplicates may occur. BOOST YOUR COLLECTION: With random cards from every series, each lot is a surprise.

reviews.content:
Purchased these because the littles have been brainwashed into believing they need to "collect the all". Luckily, they have cynical parents who know better, so when this pack popped up, at a fraction of the cost, we decided they were worth the gamble, if only to give the kiddos a small treat during the holidays.

Two kiddos, to bundles purchased. One bundle had zero repeats, while the other pretty much had nothing but repeats. I was tempted to return them, but figure they could each get on of the doubles, and the others can be traded away. Or as these cynical parents guessed, cards ended up being tossed into the bin a couple day's later.

Overall, price per card wasn't bad. We may or may not purchase more bundles. But like every other fad, wait long enough, and they will stop caring about them. We'll see how long this fad lasts.

Okay, so I‚Äôve seen a lot of mixed reviews here so I thought I‚Äôd leave my own experience to the mix. I ordered these for my 7-year-old to give out on Valentine‚Äôs Day. I bought a little zip lock pocket for the cards to go in and created a foldable bag tag/header.

My plan is to include two cards per bag for his class of 19 with a few cards left over. I was skeptical about these since a few people said they got like two different cards (40 of one and like 10 of the other). I was fully prepared to get like 25 and 25 and that would have been fine honestly since I only needed two diff cards for each kid. I was a bit worried about getting all energy cards, but that can happen with a regular booster pack too.

My pack came in pretty quickly and I had very few duplicates. If this was for a child just starting their collection, I think this would be a good set. My son already has most, perhaps all, of the Pok√©cards we got in this pack, so I can‚Äôt recommend it for deck building.

I received 51 cards total. 4 energy cards (all different), 8 trainer cards (all different), 2 Treecko, 3 Voltorb, 2 Gulpin, and one of each of the following:
Sneasel
Seedot
Minior
Volbeat
Rattata
Teddiursa
Whismur
Phanpy
Wingull
Tropius
Larvitar
Marshtomp
Surskit
Zorua
Mareep
Eevee
Cutiefly
Beaviary
Tentacool
Tentacruel
Cacturne
Lombre
Nuzleaf
Shelgon
Boldore
Woobat
Turtonator
Pignite
Bouffalant
Herdier
Pyroar
Slakoth

All in all this works well for what I purchased them for. I ordered a second pack before these arrived in the off chance I received 50 of the same card, so I‚Äôll update this when I receive my next pack.

Bought 3 of these packs for gifts from this seller. Cards were in excellent condition, and a good selection- barely any doubles. This is opposed to a pack of 50 I bought from a different seller on same ad and there were tons of doubles in that one- sometimes triples! There may have been a fake or 2 in there I check against websites and couldn‚Äôt match up a couple, but for the price this can‚Äôt be beat!

Bought two packs for the fun of it and was pleasantly surprised. I knew there would not be any rare cards going in, but wanted to get something for me and the kids to enjoy with each other. Very few duplicates - 4 cards we got two of.

Only negative was out of the two packs - 50 cards each - one pack was missing 1 card. For the price though, not a big deal for me.

Will buy again!

I give this 4 stars because it does say there are duplicates, so I can‚Äôt even be mad at that. I giggled the whole time I went through the cards to see just *how many* duplicates. The pro- we got 54 cards, the con- 27 out of the 54 were all duplicates haha. This is just for my 6 year old son who is just getting into all things Pok√©mon, so it‚Äôs not really a loss. He‚Äôs about to have a birthday party, and we will just add those duplicates as party favors in the bags. No loss there!

I ordered 5 packs from Innova Games and the cards were all in great shape and had limited duplicates. I saw a lot of ads suggesting that people were getting a ton of dupes but buy them from Innova and if you‚Äôre like me you won‚Äôt get any. The part that I found rather depressing was that out of the 250 cards I purchased not a single card was a foil. I‚Äôll likely buy more to see if I get any foils, but will for sure buy from Innova if I do.

Out of the 7 packs I bought over the previous 3 months, I only received one pack that had multiple duplicates. This specific pack came with 50 cards but of only 3 different Pok√©mon. The other 6 decks were very good and had a lot of varied Pok√©mon. Minimal duplicates even among the the 6 different packs. Great for my 8 and 6 year old boys who are just getting into Pok√©mon.

I got this for my kids who are just getting into pok√©mon and I was tired of spending $7 for eight cards at the store to find them all over the house. Just like previous reviews stated there are no holograms or rares in here but I didn't get but maybe two duplicates so all in all it's an amazing purchase for kids getting started

Perfect for my 5 year old who just likes looking at them and having a collection. Dont expect anything rare. I'm pretty sure they are just leftovers from someone opening packs where they kept the valuable ones and bundle the rest.

Great card variety from the seller I purchased from (Ponder Quest)! 51 (whoops!) cards included and there was only one card duplicate. Now I am no expert on Pokemon cards, but this seemed to have a good mix of basic cards, trainers and energy. Just what I was looking for for my 7 year old novice!

Only drawback was lack of tracking for the shipment and it came 1 day late, but for the price I paid this was 100% worthwhile!

name: PILOT G2 Premium Refillable & Retractable Rolling Ball Gel Pens, Fine Point, Black Ink, 12 Count (Pack of 1) (31020)
description:
Product Description

G2 is the longest writing gel ink pen (independent ISO testing. Data on file with PILOT corporation of America). provides smooth, skip-free writing. Contoured rubber grip offers writing comfort and control. Great for everyone, especially people who write for a living. Retractable and refillable.

reviews.content:
1. The ink is bold so you can read your writing with ease. It doesn't seem to disappear into the page after soaking in like other pens; this is very bright and visible.

2. Lots of ink comes out at once so quick writers won't struggle with a dry pen. When you want to write, there is ink available!

3. That said, so much ink comes out at once that your words will smear if you run your hand over it before it dries for 30 sec. For right-handed people this is typically not a problem, but left-handed people may struggle to keep their writing neat because the ink doesn't dry quickly.
I use these pens every day at work. I haven't found one person that doesn't like them...a lot!

One of the things I appreciate about these pens is their versatility. They are retractable, so I can easily protect the tip when I'm not using them, and they are refillable, so I can continue to use them for a long time. They are also very convenient to use ‚Äì I just click the top to extend the pen and start writing.

However, I did experience some issues with the PILOT G2 Premium Refillable & Retractable Rolling Ball Gel Pens. The ink can sometimes skip or smudge when I write, which can be frustrating. The pens also seem to run out of ink more quickly than I would like.
great pen great saturation sometimes it gets on hands when writing though
G2 pilot is the pen for me. I love the grip, gel writing and fine point. The transaction was smooth and arrived on time. Amazon prime is awesome as always.

I love these pens. My only caution is that I buy the "fine" point variety, and the line is really more like "medium." That's fine with me. I was concerned that the "fine" point might be too light/narrow, but it's exactly what I wanted.
I'm a server and these are the only pens I can use
I love these pens. They write so smoothly. Holding them steady while writing is great.
Ink flows nicely; retractable; right fine Point for my use.
Great pen

name: TERRO T300B Liquid Ant Killer, 12 Bait Stations
description:
Product Description

To kill common household ants, simply place TERRO Liquid Ant Baits stations near indoor areas where ants are spotted. Ants enter the trap, consume the liquid ant bait and return to the nest where they pass on the bait to the rest of the colony. TERRO Liquid Ant Baits are specifically formulated to allow worker ants to consume the product and survive long enough to carry the liquid back to the nest and deliver a dose to the rest of the colony . The liquid ant bait stations prevent the bait from drying out and provide the ants with a continuous supply of liquid, day and night. Monitor the baits regularly for activity, but do not interfere with the ants or baits. Replace with additional baits when the first set is depleted. Depending on the size of the ant infestation, complete control may take up to two weeks.

Recommended Placement : Along baseboards In corners of rooms and cabinets On countertops Under and behind appliances Under sinks or around pipes and water sources On windowsills and around doorways Near garbage cans Along ant trails.

reviews.content:
I very rarely write reviews which is kind of stupid because I usually read reviews prior to getting certain products. Therefore I guess I will start now, hoping I can help someone decide wether or not this product is for them. Before you read this long review I want to let you know this is the BEST product I have ever used.

Before I tell you about how AMAZING this product was I will tell you what kind of Ant üêú problem I had. Maybe someone can relate.
I have a parrot and he is in a room that is near a window. With all the different types of food he eats and with the warmer weather that we started having in my area (NJ) I started seeing ants outside. That‚Äôs when I started seeing some ants coming in from the bottom left corner of the frame of our window. I have never had an ant issue with the 17 years I live hear. Even having my parrot and all the amounts of food he eats. For some reason last year during the spring time is when I saw these crazy little annoying bugs come in my house.
These ants seemed to be a different type of ant. One I have never seen before. They were small but the minute you go near them they would run away or scatter away super fast. I have an exterminator on my block and he told us they were sugar ants. What the hell is a sugar ant? Lol. Well I was told that these ants hide out in your shower and in the kitchen because of the sugary foods around. Why are they found in a bathroom is beyond me. But I looked it up after what he said and everything he told us was what I read on line about ‚Äúsugar ants‚Äù. I mentioned that last year I had this problem and they were found behind the faucet in our shower. That‚Äôs another story. Anyway, before having an exterminator come into my house, I figured I would try to resolve the problem myself. So before buying this ‚ÄúAMAZING PRODUCT‚Äù, I purchased all the ‚ÄúRaid‚Äù products that come in the square plastic containers. The ones that come in white or grey containers. I put the Raid traps by the window and where else I thought they might come in. I actually tried the mixture of vinegar, sugar and water concoction that was told on line to use for these ants. But nothing worked. I doubt an ant even went to these traps because near my window they would go around those traps. I was getting frustrated because I skeeve bugs. And I was afraid of an exterminator coming in with my parrot living here. I wasn‚Äôt taken that chance of him dying with the chemicals. Anyway after coming to a dead end with the Raid traps I began reading and reading on so many products just to find a worthy product. That‚Äôs when I came across this product. It was very different than the normal products that are used to kill ants. So I figured why not, let me give it a try. I received my order really fast and was anxious to use them. After reading all the directions these baits were very easy to use. It comes in a thick clear rectangular container. To open it, it Reccomended to hold it up right and twist off the plastic top until it snaps off. It was a little tough for me to snap off the top like it says on the package. Therefore I used a pair of scissors to open the trap. Word of advise, if you need a pair of scissors to open your product, just make sure to keep the trap upright so the liquid doesn‚Äôt pour out. After opening the trap, I then placed this trap about 3-4 inches away from the bottom corner of the window. Right where I saw the ants coming in. They scurried away from me at first, but the minute I put this trap down it was shocking!! No joke. I was shocked to see all these ants go running toward the opening of this trap. The trap actually attracted more ants to come out of hiding to eat this food (crazy). I actually spilt a little bit on my windowsill and some ran to that and got stuck. But what was amazing to me was after I put the trap down and watching these ants go to it, it was shocking to see them run right back out of the corner of the windowsill. It was crazy. I just watched for a few minutes and to see them either get trapped inside the trap or grab some of the food in the trap and run back outside or wherever they came from. And by the end of the day they were gone. It‚Äôs about 2 weeks now since I only used one trap and I have yet to see another NASTY ANT!! Wahooo!!!! They are gone.

This product is BY FAR THE BEST ANT PRODUCT I HAVE EVER USED IN MY LIFE!! This is noooo joke. Therefore you can count on me to continue to purchase and use this product for any ant problem that might arise again. I will never buy a different type of ant trap again. No matter how popular people feel the ‚ÄúRaid‚Äù products might be. The sprays are only wonderful for the outdoors but for the inside the ‚ÄúRaid‚Äù products are definitely not as effective as this product is. I actually gave my neighbor 2 traps and after a day or two they were gone by him as well. These traps are crazy how wonderful they work. I swear by this product and I know if you purchase these traps you will too. I will never buy another kind of ant traps again. These are the BEST kind of ant traps on the market by far!!! And mind you, I AM NOT making any kind of commission from this company for this product review. I am just sooo happy my ant issue is gone for now. Sooo, if you want to get rid of these annoying, nasty bugs ‚ÄúFAST,‚Äù then purchase these traps. And I promise you, you will be so happy you did.

We had a horrible ant problem in our kitchen, even though we kept the kitchen clean and free from food scraps or dirty dishes. We have indoor dogs, plus, we prepare food in this area and we did NOT want to use chemical pesticides.

First I tried diatomaceous earth and it did not work. We tried spraying the ant trail with household spray cleaners, cleaned them up, then followed up a 2nd time to try to clean up any scent trail. The ants simply changed course and found different ways in. There must have been hundreds or thousands of ants that were coming from a huge colony in the backyard.

After doing some research, I found these traps are pretty safe. The low dosage of borax in the traps really won't really harm dogs or humans. Borax is non-toxic to humans to begin with, unless consumed in large quantity.

I placed just a couple of these bait traps on the kitchen counter, out of reach of the dogs. I also placed just one outside where the trail was, and made sure the dogs could not get to it. The ants quickly made their way into the bait traps. Within just 24 hours, there were hardly any ants seen at all. Within 48 hours, not a single ant was seen in the kitchen. The ant trail outside was also gone.

This product worked amazingly well. Just BE CAREFUL not to tip the trap forward after cutting off the tab or the liquid will start spilling out. The slightest tip forward will make this leak.

These work well. Through some Google-research (I call it gee-search) I discovered that ants can't really be avoided through spraying (like what professional service companies advertise), so these perform the function of creating a "bait-trap" that the ants consume and either die or carry back to their colony (I know, it sounds a little brutal, I don't disagree, but I also don't love having ants crawling on me 24/7, so it's a tradeoff).
The way it works is, you EXPECT to see a literal sea of ants (it was TERRIFYING because I just kept thinking of that scene from Honey I Shrunk the Kids) congregating around these bait-traps like it's the last drink at the ole' saloon before Bad Bart comes to town. You can smash them if you want, but you're just working against the system at that point; recommendation to just let the weird, clear liquid do its job. After a day or two, when you no longer see the sea of ants, you can remove the used traps (there will be A LOT of ants in there) and set down a few fresh ones to temper any future interlopers.
Here's a helpful anecdotal tip that literally everyone gave me: if you have ants, you will ALWAYS have ants. I don't know if this is true yet, but I feel like I have killed about 10 million of them so far using the above described methodology (they do come back, not sure that there's anything that can avoid that), but we'll see if in 20 years I'm still laying waste to the local ant population through my pools of murder liquid (handily stored in little plastic containers).
One detraction: it hurts like the dickens to tear these stupid little things open. Maybe I'm doing it wrong, but twisting the tops off always hurts my fingers a little. But the effectiveness of it makes the struggle worth it.

Unfortunately for the ants this is a fantastic product. Every spring they come in my apartment. As soon as I put these out within 48 hours I have no more ants. It may freak you out at first because it seems like you are getting more ants. It's only because once one ant finds the trap they spread the word to all their ant friends and they all come to eat. That's a good thing. The product is designed to kill them slowly. They have enough time to tell there friends about the food and bring some back to the queen. My ants are usually dead within 48 hours. It could be 4-5 days. Some will die in the liquid. Most back in there underground home. I learned not to waste these. One per room or rooms they are in. Anymore then that and mine ignore the extras lol

Like the box says they last about 90 days. Now I set them out around the end Feb before it gets warm. I rotate new ones in every 11 weeks until bug season is over .

If your goal is to remove the ants from your home, this product is definitely what you are searching for. Many times throughout the year I've used these. Within a day or 2 of placing this, the ants have stopped coming in.
The package says you can twist off the top, but that has never worked for me, due to my puny arms, we will never know. Scissors takes care of opening it, no problem. Be careful when you go to throw it away, you do NOT want this stuff spilling. It is not fun trying to scrub sticky dead ants and liquid ant poison off of a living room floor, let me tell you. As many times I have knocked these over, you'd think I'd learn to be more careful. So recap, ants die fast, cut open if you're weak, and don't spill or you may cry.

I had a few ants in my office and saw them coming from a vent. Decided to lay two of these down, next thing I know, over 1000 ants all over the poison hanging out all night (I think a lot were dead within a few hours or intoxicated). By early morning most of them returned to the colony and the few that died were actually carried back so the ants cleaned up all of the mess. No more sightings of any ants. They brought the poison back to the colony and it killed them all. This stuff is amazing. Just be sure to let them do their thing over night and do not correct your enemy in the middle of a mistake. It will shock you and gross you out when they all come out, but they need to take it back to the colony to kill the queen and the rest of them. Do that, and this stuff works amazingly.

I've purchased a few boxes over the years, and when I lived in an apartment with a sugar ant problem this stuff was a life saver. My kitchen and bedroom were infested with sugar ants. I'd see them crawling in little lines through the carpet, across the countertops, the nightstand, everywhere.

Just two of these traps were enough to completely get rid of the issue for months. Following the directions is critical. You need to place them near an area the ants commonly walk to have to most effect. I placed one on my windowsill by the nightstand, and two nights later there was a huge pile of dead ants all around the trap.

It seems that some species of ants don't care for this stuff, as I had some red ants in my home that never touched the bait, so I had to use some barrier spray to solve that issue, but for common house ants, it wipes out the whole colony within a week.

The only thing I wasn't a fan of is the form factor, it's fairly easy to accidentally cut too much off of the packaging, and end up with a giant, sticky mess all over your surfaces. I had to take extra care to place the traps in an area where I wasn't worried about knocking it over, or where it was at an angle for the liquid to seep out.

All in all, I will continue to buy these as long as I have ant issues in my home.

We have an ant problem every summer in our apartment and use these to keep them at bay. We can‚Äôt ever seem to completely eradicate the nest, but these seem to help. I really hate looking at swarms of bugs of any kind so these are not for the faint of heart. The baits attract the ants by the THOUSANDS which is the point, but you have to allow the bugs to devour and feed this stuff to the nest. It‚Äôs super gross to allow bugs in the house to feed and I have a hard time watching. Other than that nasty little detail, they seem to mostly die off after a few days but never completely. We must have a super nest. So‚Ä¶helpful but not a 100% solution to a large ant problem.

I've had a pest control coming to the house for years due to a contract we have. Most times when the weather gets better, ants are sure to come in regardless how many times the pest company comes and regardless of what we have used to get rid of them. I hate the ants in the kitchen but I understand they will always be an issue...it's nature. My sister uses this product and I figured I'd give it a go. I tried it and the ants at first did NOT go in the trap. Once they did, they did NOT stop going there. Took only a few days and the ants stopped coming out from where ever they were coming from. They have not returned....yet (they always do). When they do, I will be ready. I have better results from this product than the pest control....saves $ too!

We had an unusually bad ant problem this summer. Normally, they would go away after a week or so and not come back until the next summer, so killing them really was not necessary and my preferred approach. However, this year they were on a different type of mission and would not leave.

We had very small ants, but probably thousands of them walking an ant trail along a path in our kitchen. I originally wanted to buy these baits because of the reviews and the idea of the sugary liquid bait made sense to me (put a couple drops of a sugary pop drink on the floor and the ants would likely swarm it). However, we have a cat and I was concerned for her safety.

Ultimately, we bought a different brand that did absolutely nothing. Along the ant trails, the ants would go through these baits giving a little hope at first, but the numbers did not decrease. After a week and a half of no results, I bought these baits and put a few where we can see them come into the kitchen. I covered the baits with a box and put almost 60 pounds of weights on the flaps to prevent our little one from getting to them. Fortunately, she was interested for a minute in the box on the floor (typical cat :-) ), but otherwise left it alone.

First, the results were quick in one way. The baits immediately attracted the ants and there was a massive decrease in the ants along the previous ant trail. After an hour, I actually took the weights off and looked and they were absolutely going nuts over them. I replaced the box and left the baits alone for about 4 more days.

Now, the ant problem seems to be finished. I have subsequently checked the baits and I have seen only a few still walking around them. I am leaving them for a little longer to hopefully complete the job.

Two notable observations. First, opening the baits is tricky. The instructions make it look like they tear right open, but that really was not the case. I had to work pretty hard to open them and then the entrance was all jagged etc. Next time, I will see how they open with scissors. Second, from my previous inspection, the ants have tracked a lot of the liquid solution out of the trap. Nothing can really be done about this from the manufacturer, but just a warning to those who use these. Maybe consider putting the traps on something if you are worried about your floors or other surfaces these might go one.

All in all, I think they give you a decent number of traps for the money. We have leftovers for possibly another 'invasion'. I also am very pleased on how fast the results were. Almost immediate change in the numbers due to the attraction of them to the bait and abandoning the ant trail (minus a few headstrong soldiers) and pretty much clearing up the issue in about 4 days. In my opinion, the manufacturer claims are legit.

name: THERMOS FUNTAINER 12 Ounce Stainless Steel Vacuum Insulated Kids Straw Bottle, Frozen 2
description:
Product Description

The FUNtainer 12oz Vacuum Insulated Stainless Steel Water Bottle with Straw keeps drinks cold for up to 12 hours. Our kids water bottles are built so their drinks are as cool on the inside as they look on the outside. Kids stay hydrated and parents stay happy. The double wall stainless steel construction is built to handle drops, dings and assorted roughhousing. Includes an integrated carry handle with soft-touch grip, making it easy for kids to carry with them throughout the day. Help keep germs away with the hygienically covered silicone straw which is removable for easy cleaning. To clean, you can pop your FUNtainer water bottle in the dishwasher; however hand washing is recommended. Not for use with hot liquids.

reviews.content: This is my favorite water bottle for the kids. It has a handle, leak proof if you make sure the straw is pulled all the way, great designs, straw is covered so not always exposed when it gets thrown on the floor, even the one year old can open it. The only con I would say is it‚Äôs difficult to fully clean the straw but it‚Äôs great that you can replace it. Also, my kids have chewed through a lot of straw bottles, but these have held up quite well. Would like it in a larger size with a straw like this (I think the larger size is only a spout). My kids inhale water so I often have to fill it up. Keeps the cold with ice in it. The value is the best. I would even prefer this over more expensive brands.

My kids have used these cups for many years. My daughter who started middle school finally decided she couldn‚Äôt be seen with Barbie or My little pony anymore so I had to replace it with a plain one. They‚Äôve made some improvements including ribs on the bottom of the mouth spout so you can actually grip it and pull it out to clean it. It used to be smooth and with soapy fingers that was literally impossible. They‚Äôve changed the handle a little so it doesn‚Äôt lay flat. I‚Äôm not sure how I feel about that yet because I feel like it has more potential to be broken off because it doesn‚Äôt nestle properly but so far we haven‚Äôt had that issue. We‚Äôve been using these in bags and the car for as long as I can remember and we have never had a leak. The only issue is - if you have something in there that gets warm it will sometimes explode out when you pop it open. We‚Äôve only ever used it for water so that‚Äôs not a big deal but something to keep in mind if you were doing sticky beverages. One last thought is they do get holes in the mouth pieces easily if your kids are prone to chewing on the straws. I still have trouble with my son doing that however there are replacement straws on Amazon which are much cheaper than the ones that come with it. They will fit this version but they are not as easy to get out as the one that comes with it. Also, they do keep beverages cold a very long time especially if it starts out with ice. My daughter reported that she still has cold water even in the last period of her school day. On a negative note, they are not dishwasher safe. We have always hand washed ours. So if you‚Äôre somebody that doesn‚Äôt want to do that, I would not recommend these.

It is marketed for KIDS so pay attention to the size. It's quite small compared to a "normal" adult-sized water bottle. But it was purchased for overnight access to water at bedside for an adult. It holds enough water to do the job -- and is better than the risk of knocking a glass over in the dark. It also gets used around the house as it has a nice straw feature and lid. WAY cheaper than an adult-sized bottle -- and it does what is needed -- carries enough water for around the house and shopping trips.

Somehow it has become my personal mission to find a truly leak proof water bottle for my children. And, while I do like this water bottle for several reasons, this one is not *exactly* leak proof.
First, the pros: stainless steel insulation helps keep water cold (which would be nice if we had an ice machine..), easy to remove/clean/replace straw, the fact that the straw is protected by a lid, the handle on the lid, fun/colorful/neutral option designs, it is easy to drink water from (ie you don't have to suck hard to drink).
Cons: THIS CUP IS ONLY LEAK PROOF IF THE LID IS CLOSED. For my 3 year old, this is no problem - she is capable of opening and closing the lid unassisted. However, my 1 year old is not physically able to open/close nor intellectually capable of understanding the importance of closing the lid to prevent leakage. I will add too -- while I do like the handle, it is a bit cumbersome/my fingers get stuck when I grab the handle when the lid is open. Not a deal breaker at all, just a feature to consider.
Overall, I do like this water bottle and will likely buy more, especially when my 1 year old is older.
Recommend for 3+

I purchased this as a replacement for one of my students, water bottle. I accidentally dropped the previous water bottle and it shattered. It was not this type of water bottle, which I feel is safer, easy-to-use and spill proof. The student loves it.

The flip top, carrying handle and silicone straw are all great sizes for kids and easy for their little fingers to open and close and use. The straw components come apart easily for easy cleaning. We have been putting all components on the top rack of the dishwasher to deep clean once a week and everything is holding up really well. Really durable. It‚Äôs been dropped a thousand times already and no broken parts! We pack it for school, stick it in cup holders in the car and use it during bedtime. My child sleeps with her water bottle and no leaks!

I only wish the larger version was leak proof and had a silicone tip or straw mouthpiece for safety. The first time my 6 year old used it, she knocked it over when she set it down on the table (lid was flipped open because it was still in use) and it resulted in a huge spill because of the large mouthpiece.

I‚Äôve been buying these water bottles for my twins since they were 2 (they‚Äôre now 5). They are the kids‚Äô and my favorite water bottles. The cover comes down and snaps shut to keep the straw clean. The lid is easy enough for toddlers to open and close themselves. The water stays cool in the bottle. Ours have been dropped hundreds of times and have not broken. The kids carry it by the handle. At the end of the day I take it all apart (bottle/straw/lid/spout) and put it in the dishwasher. A downside could be if you have a toddler that chews a lot they can chew a hole in the straw. They‚Äôre a soft flexible plastic.

These are the only water bottles my nieces and nephews use and they are super durable. With a new niece, a new water bottle was needed! The designs do eventually wear off with a lot of wear and tear (like 1+ years of daily usage) but the different colored lids help them differentiate whose bottle is whose even when the designs wear off.

This is our third Funtainer. We love them. If you have a kid who is picky about having to bite the straw or suck really hard, etc, this is the cup for you. Zero effort, easy close, handle for clipping on backpack, stays cold. Perfection.

This Thor themed thermos is the perfect addition for any young superhero fan! The stainless steel construction not only looks sleek and cool, but it's also durable and easy to clean. The vacuum insulation keeps drinks hot or cold for hours. I think it is important to note that there are some leak issues with this thermos - if left on its side our turned upside down, the beverage just flows out of it. Would be nicer if it was more leak proof. Requires monitoring so you don't have a mess to deal with. This is definitely a thermos that we keep at home.

description:
Product Description

Wevac Vacuum Sealer bags and rolls





Waste less, enjoy more!




LOWER PRICES with GREATER VALUE

Commercial Grade Rolls and Pre-cut Bags with inexpensive pricing.

Bags and Rolls are EASY & CONVENIENT to use!

Save more food so that you can enjoy life more.




EASY to VACUUM and SEAL, HEAVY DUTY

Embossed Micro Channel design make it efficient for vacuuming and sealing

Air and water proof material prevents leaking and freezer burn

The included Bone Guard can be used to prevent food from puncturing the vacuum bag. It is ideal for storing or sous vide cooking T-bone calves, denim bones, ribs, seafood with fishbone or shells, and more.




SAFE and GREEN

Prevent FREEZER BURN and DEHYDRATION.

Perfect for Storage, Meal Prep and Sous Vide.
Keep Freshness and Flavor in your food
Extend shelf-time 3-6 times longer




Wevac has 10 years experience of making professional vacuum sealer bags!




Wevac bags are made in China to US quality standards.

reviews.content:
I have the larger food vacuum machine I had for years. We all know the brand. The bags are really expensive and I needed more so decided to give these a try. First I will say you get a lot for the money. I do have two "Cons" about the item. My machine will allow you to store the roll inside. I like that feature as it also has a built-in cutter. The rolls I just bought are so big there is no way to fit them inside the machine.

So I decided instead of struggling to cut each bag I needed, I would just roll up from the other end till it was large enough but not too large to fit inside my machine. Now for the other "Con" of the product. I needed to seal up a few pounds of fish. The bag did not suck out all the air as my original bags. it was not a very tight seal around the food. When it starts to seal, you can see some air enter the bag and the suction around the food gives a bit.

I think for the money it's a great value, maybe to seal cheese and other items you will be eating sooner. As for placing it in a freezer, I think the food will still get freezer burn. I would not trust it to freeze steaks or seafood or other meats long term. If you only need this short term it's a good choice over the more expensive. I tend to get meats and seafood on sale and sometimes it's in the freezer for 6 months. I also had corn on the cob a year later from the freezer. If sealed and vacuumed well it can last up to a year. Although better than a zip lock bag, I would not freeze items longer than a month.

I sealed up some one pound bags of hamburger meat using these bags with my brand name sealer. The suction on the bag was great and at the end of the vacuum process they sealed completely. I saw no need to add a second seal.

I immediately froze the meat for a week. Not a long time but if it is going to fail it will do so as the product in the bag freezes and the internal water causes it to expand and stress the bag.

No issues. Will rebuy these when I run out.

Bought these to so I could dust off our Freska food sealer our son gave us for Christmas 3 years ago to start using it again. When he gave it to us, we thought "cool...quite a little novelty item that we probably won't use." HE went through the included bags pretty quickly with his fish filets and deer sausage at which point we knew to whom the gift was REALLY intended. But, with the recent ridiculous rise in meat costs, we've decided to resurrect it and start buying meat in bulk from the various grocery stores "loss leader" ads and socking it away in our 'extra' freezer.

These bags worked perfectly in our Freska sealer, and when purchasing them in rolls like this, they are actually cheaper than ziplock freezer bags and of course there is the added benefit of sucking out all of the air that might otherwise freezer burn meat stored for long periods of time. While I can't compare to other brands, these seem plenty thick and I have had no problems with them tearing while sealing. Plus, if you have sharp edges (as another review mentioned as a potential negative, noting they were thinner than some other brands), this package came with half a dozen "bone guards" that could be placed inside over any rough edges to prevent this problem.

I will likely run out of freezer space before using both of these rolls, but when the time comes I will order these again. Great value, and our newfound hobby will save us hundreds on various meats over the course of the coming years.

I looked at dozens of vacuum seal bags and rolls. Every one of them had a group of 1-3 star negative reviews about thickness, tearing, freezer issues, and other comments. At some point, I had to just ignore the negatives and settled on Wevac. (NOTE: this is being posted on all three products I purchased)

I'm going to save you hours of time. No negatives. Just as good as the name brands at a much lower cost. Thickness matches (at least feels like it), seals properly, and freezes just fine. I have vacuum sealed items with sharp bones and zero tears. Sauces sealed fine.

I also got the 8" x 12" 200 count bags and the 6" x 12" 200 count bags. Get these at the same time! So convenient and a big time saver when packing bulk meats and chicken.

I liked the fact I can customize these to whatever I need. Be it small sizes to store spices I buy in bulk to full ears of corn!

I LOVE the fact they are reusable! I have learned to cut them longer than what I need at the time so when they are washed they can be resized and reused for different than what I originally used it for. They are really thick, I was surprised!

Amazing value! I have ordered twice and I will again and again!

They come packaged well with no damage, and I get them super fast.

Highly recommend these!

I bought a vacuum sealer and needed extra bags to seal my food with right and ran across these babies Wevac Vacuum Sealer Bags and let me tell you they work great just cut them the size you need and seal them on one end and wham your ready to do some food vacuuming very great quality bags very easy to use.
I buy these and use them in my food saver and they work just great. They‚Äôre cheaper than buying the food saver brand and they were just as good. I will continue to buy them as needed.

The bags that were included with our vacuum sealer were horrible! Lots of wrinkles meant machine wouldn't seal. However, purchased the Wevac bags and these work wonderful, just what we needed. Thank you WeVac for a terrific product!

Thinner then the OEM bags that came with my machine but seem to vacuum and seal just fine.
Wish these had a label area for writing like other bags do. Price is good.

I ordered in the 11in and 8in roll. Theae are fone except for the fact that the roll will not fit in the food saver sealer. Probably wont fit in alot of home use vacuum seal machines but i knew that when i ordered them. Youll have to get creative figuring out how to cut the bags but they are definitely good bags. I packaged about 25lbs of meat yesterday with them and had zero problems

name: Walker's Razor Slim Ultra Low Profile Compact Design Adjustable Range Shooting Hunting Hearing Protection Electronic Earmuffs
description:
Product Description

WALKER'S RAZOR SLIM ELECTRONIC MUFF With its ultra-compact design, the Razor Slim electronic muffs offer superior hearing protection in a low-profile design. Two hi-gain omnidirectional microphones pick up outside noise and broadcast it through full dynamic range HD speakers for an ultra-clear, balanced sound. Sound activated compression has a blazing fast 0.002 second reaction time to ensure your hearing is always protected. Available in a variety of color options, the Razor Slim electronic ear muffs are priced right and packed full of innovation. Patriot Series Razor ear muffs feature a nylon attachment on the headband that is compatible with your favorite patch. USA flag patch included with purchase. Slim Folding Design - Walker's Razor muff delivers the slimmest profile available in an electronic shooting muff and a compact folding design. SPECS: - 2 hi-gain omnidirectional microphones; - Full dynamic range hd speakers for clear & balanced sound; - Low noise / frequency tuned for natural sound clarity; - Independent volume controls; - Sound dampening composite housing; - Sound activated compression - 0.02 second reaction time; - Nrr - 23 db; - Audio input jack; - Recessed volume control knobs; - Comfortable headband w/a metal wire frame; - External battery door; - Operates on 2 'AAA' batteries - included

reviews.content:
To start I would like to say that I have paid full price for every piece of digital hearing protection that I possess, and am not receiving anything for this/any review! I have been rather obsessed with finding the best protection over the years because I care about my hearing, will never stop shooting guns, and want to be comfortable while enjoying guns :) . I own every single one of the hearing pro sets that I discuss. If you don't want to/have time to read the whole review, I'm putting my conclusion at the top. Feel free to read the rest to figure out why I answered this way.

But here is the quick bottom line:

Do not buy a knock off brand. I do not own any of them, but have tried them. Not worth saving a few dollars. Of the more affordable name brands: Walker, 3M, or Howard Leight... The Walkers are by far the best and most comfortable. But if you have a tiny bit more $ to spend, search for the "AKT1 Sport". Are they worth the extra money? Yes, absolutely - buy the AKT1's if you can afford them. If you already own some 3M's, Howard Leight's or Walker's and are looking for a major upgrade without breaking the bank, go for the AKT1's. I have not noticed a difference in sound or comfort (just design) between different Walker models, but I did notice the difference in sound and comfort when I got the AKT1's! Should you just save your money and buy the "Gucci" of ear pro, ComTacs or MSA Sordins? Probably not, but maybe depending on need.

The details:

In the $50 - $100ish range I own 5 models: Walker's Razor Slim & XCell, Howard Leight's Impact Sport, 3M's Peltor Sport Tacs, and the AKT1 Sport's.

The best hearing protection does two things. 1 - it protects your hearing, 2 - it should not be a burden or painful to wear. Walker's, Howard Leight's, and 3M's are not very comfortable for shooting after about an hour, and on my wife (smaller head) they are actually painful to wear for more than about 10 minutes. Each of them also make you sweat because of the material of the cup pads.

Howard Leight - I put HL in 5th place because the sound quality is quite "electronic-y", and they are just downright uncomfortable for any period of time. The sound amplification of quiet sounds is quite substantial and impressive at times, however the quality of the sound itself is lacking. I don't need to hear a whisper from across the room if I can't determine whether the whisper came from a robot or a human. (Robots, although friendly looking, are usually evil, so it's important to know the difference)

3M's Peltor Sport Tacs - are in 4th place because their price point was a little higher, they are still uncomfortable for long periods of time, and they are also a bit bulky for shooting rifles. The cheek plate on a rifle is almost guaranteed to nudge these muffs and cause your shooting ear to have decreased protection. They still have a bit of an artificial electronic sound, but seem to have the best overall hearing protection in this price range when shooting larger calibers or indoors (as long as you can avoid the cheek plate nudge).

Walker's - The XCEL and Razor models are tied with each-other for 3rd and 2nd place. They beat out HL's & 3M's just because they are a bit more comfortable. But they are tied with each-other because they don't really have a noticeable difference in sound quality or protection. I think they are both the same Walker tech, just different designs and price points. They are both a little more comfortable, and noticeably less "electronic-y" sounding than the Howard's or 3M's. The sound amplification of quiet sounds is pretty impressive. But in order to make them comfortable for extended shooting times you'll have to spend $ on upgraded gel pads.

The AKT1's - take first place. I found these on Amazon and never heard of them prior to that. But I am very happy to have found them! There are only 2 little negatives: 1- they are still a bit bulky (although light weight) so the cheek plate of a rifle does nudge them, and 2 - the amplification of quiet sounds is not quite as dramatic as the other brands. However they take first place because the fit is incredibly better on the AKT1 than any of the models mentioned previously. This is true for both large and small heads actually. I think this simply because the band seems to have had a lot of thought/development put into it, and the pads on the ear cups are either real leather or really nice fake leather. Unlike the other models listed above, these are comfortable out of the box. You don't have to upgrade the pads because they are super soft and that alone is quite impressive. The sound quality is also remarkable. They may lack in magnitude of amplification, but the microphone & speakers work together to provide the least artificial sounds of any other headset I have worn (including ComTacs and Sordins). It is sometimes hard to tell if they are even turned on when someone is talking to you, because the sound quality is so good it sounds like their real life voice.

Lastly the $200-$400 range:

Peltor ComTac's and MSA Sordin Supreme Pro-X's are pretty equivalent to eachother - I cannot decide which of these are actually better. I can say that I like the sound quality of the the speakers in the AKT1's better than both of these high dollar headsets. However they both feel more durable than the AKT1's, and the sound dampening tech in the ComTacs and Sordins are noticeably more advanced than any of the lower priced sets. If you can afford the $200-400 price, then go for them. If you need to use coms while wearing ear protection, buy them. They are the only brands that have a substantial amount of radio/mic/helmet mounting accessories readily available - and the only two that I would trust for coms reliability. The major benefit is the platform they provide. Most (if not all) come with the gel padded cups and I would buy a set with the genuine leather band cover if you use the top headband style. I prefer the Sordins, as they just seem to fit my head better than any other brand, and I am a fan of the brand name. I have not tried the newest Sordin model yet though... so I may have to update this. Are they that much better than the cheaper models? For very specific reasons yes... but if you are not actually needing the coms platform, then buy the AKT1's. Yeah, I think the AKT1's are that good!

I'm X Army so I'm probably not the one to ask to rate these. My ears are bad anyway from big crap back in the day. But I needed some help and I found it in these. I have hearing aids and I can wear these over the hearing aids. Last Saturday I went to the Range. I was sitting right next to a guy shooting a AR15 with 5.56 rounds. Basically loud. I had no problem blocking him out almost totally. Other side was a pistol and it sounded like snapping of fingers. I'm very happy with them. If I needed another pair I'd order the same thing again. Very pleased.

Have yet to use these at a range but instead while using heaving equipment and it was great. The automatic adjustment was incredible. Could have a normal conversation while the equipment was not running and didn't have to take the protections off to hear anyone. Then as soon as the equipment turned back on, went into noise-canceling mode. Can't wait to see how these do at the range. Have not tested the headphone jack yet. Also these are really low profile compared to other noise canceling protection I have used in the past. As well as being really comfortable to wear. Work them for quite a few hours at a time and did not feel uncomfortable once. Definitely recommend, or even finding some that have Bluetooth capabilities as well.

So I wear a size 7 1/2 fitted cap so I have a pretty large noggin. My other shooting earmuffs were okay but didn't quite get a good seal since the earpads got stretched out whenever I put them on. I decided to upgrade and seeing that this set was pretty popular, I went for these.
Fitment wise, much better than my other ones. Took a little bit to get the earpads softened up so they could expand a bit but, well worth the effort. With a my cap and glasses, these fit my head perfectly. I did find these are a bit difficult to put your eye protection on after you put the earmuffs on so just a heads up.
This is my first electronic hearing protection so I wasn't really sure what to expect here. I was assuming you'd be able to pick up conversations but may get the occasional blast whenever a gun is fired. This was almost completely true. Even without the power on, you still get decent noise reduction so you can use them as-is. There is no worry about what happens with the batteries die so that's a nice relief. I shoot primarily at an indoor range and I've seen numerous complaints about these types of hearing protection working great at outdoor ranges but not so good at indoor ranges. I didn't find this to be an issue at all.
Shooting my 9mm/45 ACP indoors, these earmuffs worked well at blocking out the noise to a comfortable level. When I turned the volume on the headsets, I could hear the people in the booth next to me really clearly. The gunshots had sort of a booming/echo sound to them but it wasn't loud at all. I felt it to be really comfortable shooting my handguns. One thing I did notice is that the sound seemed to be a bit stronger in one ear than the other. My left ear sounded pretty clear while the right ear was kind of, meh. Not sure if this is expected or not but we'll see.

I have 2 pairs of these, 1 for shooting and 1 for work. I am a diesel mechanic and these headphones are fantastic when using loud air tools. I can hear a bolt drop and hit the ground then get back to impacting with my 3/4in air gun. If someone needs me I don't have to take them off to hear them, they can talk like normal and I can understand them without issue. Same goes for shooting purposes, my loudest gun is the .338 Lapua and these handled it just fine.

Specifically for males with large heads. To start I am 6ft 3 inches tall about 280lbs and wear a size 7 7/8 (one size below an 8). So I can say I have a pretty large head and proportionately large ears. As far as which I recommend over the other my answer is get both and see which fits you best.

Fitment on head I‚Äôd say they‚Äôre about the same, the Howard Leight (HL) has slightly more head space if you‚Äôre wearing a hat, which can be due to it have less padding on the band compared to the Walker Razor (WR). The HL does not squeeze my head as much so it can be more comfortable over longer periods of time. But the HL ear pads are smaller than the WR the hole size is not substantially different but it‚Äôs enough to notice. I measured the HL and it was only about 1 cm smaller across each way than the WR BUT the depth of it was 1/2 inch deep while the WR was 3/4 inch so the HL is about 1/4 not as deep which for me made the difference. The HL although comfortable, due to the depth being smaller it did not completely seal around my ears I noticed on my left ear there was some space between my neck and ear wear it was not sealing, and without a proper seal I would not feel comfortable using it. Again this is why I say try both if you have a large head, because I feel depending on head shape, ear size and where your ears sit on your head the HL may fit and since it doesn‚Äôt squeeze your head as much it would be the better option.

The WR are better looking in my opinion, the band has more padding and the ear muffs are deeper and bigger, but the band does feel tighter on your head and will not be able to be used as long as the HL.

As far as the sound goes the HL has better sound I believe, it is slightly better and since they have a fabric like cover and not a metal cover like the WR they do not pick up much wind noise.

I personally stuck with the WR but I do not consider the HL to be lesser than the WR. Each has its pros and cons and I‚Äôd have to say ultimately try both. HL may fit better for wider heads. But for my WR I added gel ear pads and it has greatly improved the wearability. If you get either of these I really recommend getting the gel ear pads for added comfort.

I saw a friend using these and it caught my eye right away. Ironically right after saw the instructor at the facility also using the exact same ear protection.

After using them for a little i can say they provide just as good noise isolation as your regular low tech bubble shaped large ear protection head gear but with a fraction of the side making it easy to move around and much more comfortable to wear.
They also fold down to a very small footprint in size when not used and pack away with very little space needed.

The added benefit of the dual side microphones to digitally include outside noise when needed is a huge game changer allowing you to hear what people are saying easily and also comfortably talk without yelling since you can hear yourself much better as well to gauge your own volume of speech in loud environments.

10/10 would recommend.

I like the looks and light weight and easy to store away folds up to pretty much as a pair of wool socks in a suit case and easy to use and won't have to be yelling or yelled at with these love them so far just can't wait to get to the range I know they will be so nice to wear

I live the ease of use with these as well as the audio when turned on let‚Äôs me hear people talking clearly as well as my own footsteps while outside or in the house wearing these. I also like the aux port so I can listen to music while using these

I bought this for my backup set. They work pretty good but not quite as good as my other earmuffs. Cancels out loud noises just fine and I can hear others speak clearly. Why i did not give this set 5 stars is, it has a constant background static sound that is a bit annoying. The more i turn up the volume the louder the static sound gets. It doesn't, however, interfere with my ability to hear a conversation. Other than that, they work well.

name: Carson MicroBrite Plus 60x-120x LED Lighted Pocket Microscope (MM-300)
description:
Product Description

Carson MicroBrite Plus LED Lighted Pocket Microscope The MicroBrite Plus is a portable microscope with an impressive 60x - 120x magnification range. It is simple and easy for young students to use, making it an ideal introductory microscope, yet its compact design and optical clarity make it a great field microscope for professionals and hobbyists as well. Check up on your plants, look at microscopic wildlife from a nearby pond or take a peek at each individual pixel on your smartphone screen; everyday objects become amazing discoveries with the MicroBrite Plus. Its lightweight build and pocket-sized design make it easy to take with you anywhere you go. Crystal Clear Viewing The LED illumination and high-quality optics ensure a clear, bright and crisp image. By utilizing an aspheric internal lens system, distortion is eliminated due to the unique shape of the lens. The MicroBrite Plus is powered by 1 AA battery (not included). Carson. Carson will repair or replace your pocket microscope if it is found to have manufacturing defects in the materials or workmanship. Please note that due to the extremely powerful magnification of this pocket microscope that the focal distance is very short. Therefore, you must hold the microscope directly over your subject for optimal viewing clarity. Begin at the lowest magnification (60x) and adjust the focus until you have a clear view, then increase your magnification to your desired level.

reviews.content: I was skeptical about the quality I would receive for the price paid for these, but was pleasantly surprised. Not only does this unit easily fit in a pocket in some baggy pants, but also in a hoody pocket, or on a desk in your office. It‚Äôs conveniently held in your hand and focuses at the end of the unit with a light to illuminate the subject. Just place this down on a desktop, turn on the light (if needed) and see what you can see. My grandkids live to look at their fingertips, pocket lint, leaves or just about anything their little exploring minds can think of. I use it for looking at circuits and wiring connections. It really is a useful and fun set to have with you anywhere you go. Curiosity is a wonderful thing. This can help you see sn otherwise unknown world. I recommend them heartily.

There are a lot of 1-2 star reviews complaining that this product doesn‚Äôt work. I have no idea what they‚Äôre taking about. When sharpening knives and straight razors I use this microscope to view the condition of the edge and observe the scratch pattern and I‚Äôve never had an issue getting it to work. It is a common suggestion in the knife sharpening / razor honing world because it works well. The description says it works better when viewing an object that‚Äôs laying flat but you can definitely still make it work just fine holding it in the air, that‚Äôs the only way I use it. The magnification is great and the light helps a ton. Maybe some people got a defective product but I‚Äôm willing to bet a good portion of those reviews are user error which seems to be fairly common when it comes to negative reviews on this website. For less than $20 this product is a steal and I will happily buy it again if something happens to the one I have currently.

I bought this as a stocking stuffer for my grandkids, son, and daughter-in-law. I told them to divide out the items to put in the stockings, and my son saw it and said, "I'll take this!". Keep in mind they have a full size microscope for the family and teens to use, but it's always nice to have something small and handy which doesn't require set up. On Christmas afternoon this little microscope was a popular item, because you can just pick it up and use it---there's nothing to put together or study, to be able to use. It's a handy little item.

El Microscopio es un excelente instrumento para aquellos que buscan una herramienta compacta y f√°cil de usar para ver objetos peque√±os con detalle. El aumento de 60x y 120x es perfecto para ver detalles en monedas, sellos, insectos o plantas. la imagen es clara pero no es excelente debido a su tama√±o, pero para mi prop√≥sito fue mas que suficiente. (revisar los tricomas)

I bought this for my little sister, but honestly I had a lot of fun myself, I may buy one for me haha. The pictures correspond to 1. salt grains, it was the object that made my sister get super excited about trying it on everything and anything, she was so happy her eyes shinned :), 2. One of my hairs and one of my gray hairs, which made me feel old, but like a kid inside discovering that they're actually transparent *I'm so poetic* haha. The image quality is great for the price, in my opinion. As I said, I may get one for myself, it's nice and fun, 5/5 recommend.

Wonderful except that the light is so very bright that all surfaces appear to be washed out white. I found a easy solution that solves this. Just find a white stick (I used the border around postage stamps) and place it over the light bulb. This allows enough light through to see textures perfectly without losing the color.
Great for beginners, kids. Very compact, easy to handle. A little more light and thin than I expected.
I did not know there were to levels of adjustment finally 3 months later i figured it out ..Works well did not find any mites though guess that is good news

Gifted to my 6yo for Christmas. He thinks it‚Äôs cool, but other stuff is more exciting from all the presents he got tbh; I checked out the picture quality on this little microscope and there‚Äôs a tiny learning curve for how to best use it but I can tell it‚Äôs well made and he will grow into using this especially come spring & summertime. Just hope the battery doesn‚Äôt give out before then!ü§ûüèº

This turned out to be more entertaining than I had hoped. Kids examined everything and were ‚Äúwowed‚Äù at the detail visible with this little thing. And because it‚Äôs small enough to fit in a child‚Äôs pocket they take it everywhere.

name: Simple Modern Water Bottle with Straw and Chug Lid Vacuum Insulated Stainless Steel Metal Thermos Bottles | Reusable Leak Proof BPA-Free Flask for Sports | Summit Collection | 32oz, Almond Birch
description:
Product Description

The Simple Modern Summit Water Bottle with Straw Lid and Chug lid comes with two different lid options to best fit your daily needs. The Straw Lid and Chug lids are both leak-proof and have a transport handle to keep you hydrated on the go. The bottle is made from double walled, vacuum insulated 18/10 stainless steel.

reviews.content:
I originally ordered the almond birch color w/ the 3 lids. The color of the lids weren‚Äôt exactly the same as the bottle and appeared to have a slight slight greenish tint to it compared to the almond base. Wasn‚Äôt too crazy about that so I exchanged it for the lavender color. The lids are slightly off color as well, but I like the lavender more. The lavender lid will look more like a true lavender and and the bottle color pulls more pink. Overall I‚Äôm happier with this over the almond color but both are pretty!

To solve this, I wish you wish you had the option to pick black lids or same color lids ‚Äî just as you have the option to select size & lid amount.

So far the bottle doesn‚Äôt leak and keeps my water nice and cold! :)

I‚Äôm a flight attendant and this is my second one of these (the first one was stolen by a passenger) I love this bottle. The only note is if you plan to fly with this bottle the air valve is one-way, in. So after takeoff if you flip the straw up it will shoot water out because of the pressure change. I bought a pack of straw lids that has a 2-way air valve and don‚Äôt have that issue anymore. Definitely recommend this bottle. Ice lasts in my bottle over 24 hours.

I seriously love this water bottle! I‚Äôve purchased 3 in total already. One for my friend, my boyfriend and one for myself, we all love it. Kept my ice water cold for 2 days when I forgot my water in the car! I have the 64 oz so I only have to refill once to get my full gallon in! The only thing that I hate it how heavy it can get when it‚Äôs filled but I‚Äôm also carrying half a gallon so can‚Äôt complain there. I‚Äôve had mine for about a year now and the color has not chipped or scratched! It does come with 3 lids I prefer to use the straw option but it‚Äôs nice to have the option of switching it up. All in all I love it

My order came in all dinged up. Unfortunately, i did not open/notice in time that the package was damaged, and could not send the damaged product back anymore. This was mistake, but i figured I'd all if they would replace it. I included pictures and they got back to me super quickly happy to send me a new one so i could be fully happy with their product! Which is awesome!
The straw is at sn angle instesd of straight up, which is super convenient.

Anyway, my issue was resolved so quickly and pleasantly trust i just had to praise them here! A+

I waited for over a month to write a review about the Leopard Print Water Bottle 32oz. For starters, I love the print. It‚Äôs beautiful! Pros: it‚Äôs easy to clean, it comes with two styles to drink from (a cap to open or the lid itself), & two straws. Cons: for me, it can leak a little sometimes. And the ice does not last 24 hours but I think it‚Äôs because I keep my house on 75 (I get cold easily) even though it‚Äôs insulated. Another con is it does not fit in my cup holders so it can be a hassle when finding a place for it in my car. But other than that, I love it. I use it every day and it works.
I do recommend it though! And it‚Äôs at a great price point. You can order it for different sizes too (look at photos in the description!)

Tip: if you have a cup that you like, you‚Äôll be more encouraged to drink out of it and that‚Äôs how I am getting enough water. Hope that helps!

I love this brand. My kids and I each have several of these in different sizes. This is the first time I bought the 64oz. I got it because I always end up being the only one to bring their bottle with them when we go anywhere and everyone drinks mine dry. (I‚Äôve got 3 kids). I thought this would be perfect to hold more water and it wouldn‚Äôt disappear has quick and leave some for me üòâ. Well it ended up being very very heavy since it‚Äôs metal and full of water. A lot heavier than I imagined. That‚Äôs my only bad thing to say about it. Otherwise it‚Äôs durable, easy to wash, love that they come with an extra straw and pretty colors. Easy to open and close the spout for the kids. Paint stays on through many many many dish washing cycles.

When I say, BIFL material, I'm not joking. I did my research and actually bought the tumbler first and had that for about 1.5 years before buying this bottle. I love the quality and the lid loop design. Some companies make them really big or flimsy or sharp and awk but this is just perfect. I love the ease of cleaning and also, the fact that you get three different kids so you can pick whichever fits you best. I'm not a paid reviewer and I'm not joking when I say Simple Modern is a good quality and economical brand. The bottle (and the tumbler) keep ice cold enough that it doesn't melt quickly--which is super important where I live because it gets VERY hot in Arizona. In the summer, I have left the bottle empty with just ice cubes in my car and can come out the next morning to cool/room temp water without it being warm or hot. I hope that you can see how much I love this brand by the fact that I have bought both the tumbler and bottle.

Hands down my favorite brand of water bottles. I own two of this style and a 40oz with handle and straw. These cups are amazing. Keeps ice for HOURS, leakproof and easy to clean,. WIll never buy another stanley now that I‚Äôve found this brand

I love this bottle ‚Äî this is the second one I‚Äôve purchased. The color is so pretty and it keeps my drinks nice and cold all day. My only complaints are that it‚Äôs a bit heavy and that it doesn‚Äôt fit in my car cup holder.

It's an awesome water bottle use it daily and lemme tell you this thing can keep ice as ice for like 2 days it's great for hot and cold was very happy with the purchase and it didn't break the bank like a yeti
