name: Filtrete 20x25x1, AC Furnace Air Filter, MPR 1000, Micro Allergen Defense, 2-Pack (exact dimensions 19.688 x 24.688 x 0.84)
description:
Product Description

Opt for a Filtrete Allergen Defense¬†Air Filter to transform your central heating and cooling system into a whole-home air filtration operation. This no-nonsense filter helps capture varying sizes of particles, from the large (lint, pollen, dust and pet dander) to the microscopic (smoke and smog).

reviews.content: Yeah, I bought the wrong ones because I've got bad mold sensitivities. However, I was just a little lazy about changing filters and my motor burned out. I'm one of those that take a good 20x20 Lasko fan and put one of these behind it. I filled the corners to make it a ducted fan and the sound level drops WAY down. But having the 1000 Merv 11, I've got loads of airflow, just crazy amounts. The fan itself wasn't made to be ducted so the reduction in fine filtration made the airflow difference and will actually prevent this burnout from happening again, though I've only had it once. I think that was one of the water resistant motors which are closed. The open case motor is much cooler since air flows around the rotor and now it's getting more air in general. So I'm not getting as good filtration, in mold and tiny stuff, but since these fans aren't really made for pulling hard, even with my difficult to make duct, the 1000 is probably better in the long run. It blows really well on 1, so I will save some electricity and make my fans last a lot longer. These good Lasko fans aren't cheap. I had one last 25 years but it didn't have a filter behind it. I used it for a couple years with a filter and it seized an old dried up bearing. So I should have known that pulling air through filters with these heats things up and that will shorten the life, but it all connected when I got out my new filters and "Hey, It's sure blowing like crazy. No wonder. I got the 1000s." Now I remember making this decision on purpose for these very reasons, but before the motor burned out. So if there are others like me out there, I'd recommend the Merv 11, or 1000 because our fans will last longer. Maybe I just waited too long to change it. Well, that's possible. Maybe if you're better at changing filters, there's no problem with the 1550, but another plus with the 1000s is that they're cooler in the summer, blowing clean air at you from across the isle and on #1 setting. #2 is great and if I were to put the new motor into the ducted frame, the sound would pipe down. I guess it's like everything. How much time and how good is your back to make or reuse a ducted fan? I'll say this, If you want to make a ducted fan, get the pink or blue foam boards at Home depot. I found a purple piece of packaging foam and that cuts like butter. It's great to work with and sound absorbing. Don't use styrene foam, (brittle, crusty stuff). It's hard to deal with in every way. I wish there's someplace to buy these online. That makes it so much easier that it's not such a dreaded task at all. Anyway, Merv 11 will allow better air flow and that might help make up somewhat for the difference in filtration but I know the 1000s are not going to ruin a Lasko in 7 years. They'll last forever (essentially) on these Merv 11s. In this hot weather, I'm enjoying that better airflow. I also recommend the Lasko fan combo. Esp on these 1000s. They really keep the air in the house clean. I had my carpets cleaned and he said, "you're gonna have a lot of dust here on the AC inlet louvres. Well? (he tries again.) Huh. These are completely clean. Not a speck." He walks off mumbling "I don't know why it's so clean...". It's the Lasko/3m combination. It cleans SO MUCH air. I can go 2 years on a house filter and even then I don't see dust, I just assume it's there. It has to be. My inlet grates are spotless. Anyway, it really works and for so little money. I don't even bother to tape it up. The vacuum of the fan pulls it into the fan. That's the first thing I noticed. It barely pulled. That's the difference between the Merv 13 and Merv 11. It is a matter of preference ultimately, so try one of each. Keep the one you don't like because it's a lot better than nothing. (Unless you've got loads of money, I guess. I'm more of a waste not want not. It's not exactly true, but the saying has a point.) Anyway, I almost forgot. I prefer these filtretes over Filterbuy and others. They're sturdier and I believe they filter better, the MERV ratings being equal, the 3M is better made and it filters better, though I'll use a Filterbuy on the house system, for some reason. There's a frame around the house filter. So sturdiness isn't as important. These 20x20s for the Lasko fan are moved around, bumped into. They take the punishment and never get damaged. 3M really knows how to box these up, by the way. They're glued everywhere and it's very hard to open. Be careful.

We have had a Honeywell F50F Electronic furnace filter with its two high voltage collection modules for over 25 years and it just does not seem to be collecting the dust like it used to. That lack of apparent dust collection, combined with a lot of sneezing in the morning when the furnace turns on, prompted us to look at replacing the Honeywell electronic filter. After some research and careful measurements we discovered we could replace the original electronic metal modules with passive media filters and determined that the Filtrete 20x25x4, AC Furnace Air Filter MPR 1000 should fit....AND IT DOES! A perfect fit in all dimensions. The only thing is one needs to remove a guide in the bottom center of the Honeywell housing which is easily done with a screw driver (see the attached picture). Once that is removed the filter slides in with enough friction that we know it provides good air seal on all edges. The length was also perfect and the housing door closes securely. See the attached picture when installed in the Honeywell housing.
This MERV 11 filter has only been installed for a few days but during the morning furnace house warm up, there was no sneezing so I have high hopes this filter or even the more effective MERV 13 version will be our ultimate solution to the F50F electronic modules replacement.
The paper pleats would not be cleanable with compresses air without destroying the small particle filtering and as its paper it cannot be washed and must be replaced.
The packaging for the filter states it is good for 1 year and at $60 for 2 filters, that's a very reasonable annual maintenance cost for the filter replacement and our health.
This filter will fit into either the F50F or the F300 Electronic Filter housing. Just be sure to turn off or remove the power to the F50F module.
The package comes with 2 filters so we are good for 2 years of sneezeless mornings!

This is a replacement filter for the 20x24x1 filter installed with our new heat pump. I decided to try these 3M filters because many of the reviews mentioned filter effectiveness at reducing allergies and the like. I have not had my filter installed long enough to comment on that. But the striking thing is how much less work the air handler had to do. I don't hear that big sucking noise from the air return any more. 3M seems to have really reduced the air resistance in these filters as their product description says. I went with MERV11 filters (a better filtration level than the base MERV8). But the quietness shows that even with a MERV11 filter, there seems to be minimal air resistance.

The quality of these filters is great! The vendor was fantastic! Unfortunately, they were the wrong size for my furnace, and I could not find one the size I needed. I went to Home Depot and paid the same amount for a greatly inferior product. I wish these had been the size I could use. My refund was processed very quickly as I returned the product fast. Thank you Amazon and vendor!!

This filter is a perfect fit for my mobile home furnace. It is durable, and very effective in a home with two cats. The 2-pack is convenient, especially using Amazon's subscribe and save feature, so you need never run out.

Pulmonologist recommended high filtration for a family member with a respiratory condition. It was also recommended to replace
the filter 2-4x a year vs the annual replacement.
We went with this filter as it's high merv filtration level met our needs, but not so high as to cause excessive wear on the brand new furnace- as recommended by our HVAC installer our unit shouldn't go over Merv 12, so this fits well.
I just popped in a new filter after having one in for 6 months. It's definitely been doing its job, the air in our house has been cleaner and the filter was a bit dirty, but nothing that couldn't have waited in a non-compromised household for several months.
Will be putting this item on auto delivery.

These Filtrete filters seem to be a little better than standard quality. I don't usually open windows during the summer but use a/c. The cold air intake for the heater and a/c draw through a Filtrete cleaning dust and many particles from the air.

I decided to try a MERV 11, to see if it would make a difference for allergies, it sure does help. No more sneezing, coughing and blowing my nose in the morning when I wake up. I didn't realize that dust mites and possibly mold spores could be the problem. I always changed the filters frequently, I was using MERV 8, but using MERV 11 made al the difference. It's well worth the extra money. Shipping was very fast, next day delivery.

Filtrete packaging, description, and rating are spot on. With those other brands who fudge the size descriptions a wee bit, it makes me wonder about the validity of their claims on MERV rating / Filtration. I know I am getting what I ordered with these filters.
I have been using these filters for years. The 18x20‚Äù are not easy to find so I appreciate that 3M sells through Amazon. Change your filter every 3 months if you have allergies.

DESIGNED WITH EXCLUSIVE Filtrete Brand 3-in-1 technology from 3M to trap unwanted air particles while letting cleaner air flow through

The higher the MPR, the more microparticles--such as pollen, pet dander, smoke, bacteria and viruses--your filter will capture from the air passing through it

name: Celestron ‚Äì SkyMaster 25X70 Binocular ‚Äì Outdoor and Astronomy Binoculars ‚Äì Powerful 25x Magnification ‚Äì Large Aperture for Long Distance Viewing ‚Äì Multi-coated Optics ‚Äì Carrying Case Included
description:
Product Description

Celestron‚Äôs Sky Master series of large aperture binoculars are a phenomenal value for high performance binoculars ideal for astronomical viewing or for terrestrial (land) use - especially over long distances. Each Sky Master model features high quality BaK-4 prisms and multi-coated optics for enhanced contrast. Celestron has designed and engineered the larger Sky Master models to meet the special demands of extended astronomical or terrestrial viewing sessions.

reviews.content:
I originally gave these four stars because the focus has play in it. I bumped them up to 5 stars because of the low price and the fantastic astronomical views. They stay in the focus you put them in, but the play occurs only during adjustment. My 16x50 is much better for daytime sight seeing.

1. The eyepiece lens is 23mm, vs 18mm for my Nikon Aculon 16x50, 16mm for my Celestron 10x50, and 13mm for my Tasco 7x35. Despite this, they have the same eye relief as the smaller binoculars, and also a moderately smaller apparent field of view.
2. I followed the exit pupil, drew a triangle, and quickly and accurately measured the apparent field of view of the Celestron 25x70 to be only 57.5 degrees, and that is the maximum no matter where your eye is. My Nikon's are 61 degrees, my Celestron 10x50 is 60 degrees, and my Tascos are 58 degrees. Visual observation confirms these math measurements.
3. They are noticeably heavier than my other binos, but not a lot.
4. They are easy to hand hold very steady in the day time, without resting my elbows on anything. At night it is much better to have something to brace my elbows on.
5. They look like they are good quality, other than the thin strap.
6. They are 10.4 inches long, and 8 inches wide.
7. There depth of focus is less than that of lower powered binoculars, so I really have to adjust them as I aim around at stuff terrestrially at different distances. These are better for astronomy than for birding. My 10x and lower did not need to be adjusted much unless I looked at something really close. My 16x is in between, but still pretty forgiving.
8. The focus is smooth but has a short lag, and requires diopter adjustment of the right eye to compensate for the lag. In cold weather, the focus wheel is tighter than any of my other binos, but still reasonable enough to turn.
9. I am a bit near sighted, so I get a closer near focus at around 50 or 60 feet instead of the advertised 75 ft. My nikons near focus at 18 ft, not their advertised 28 ft.

As many other reviewers already said, the eyepiece barrels seem too big around, and pinch my nose if I try to get closer to the eyepiece. However, if I carefully measure the interpupilary distance, I can place them so I see the full field of view without the pinch. It just does not come as naturally as with my 10x50. I separated them to see if getting one eye closer would give a bigger field of view, but it did not. I guess how close I get is close enough. It just feels weird them being that far out on my nose and making that third point of contact like that. Edit: next day: I'm getting used to the new feeling.

The correct place to hold these binoculars is by the barrels in front of the prisms. That is how to get steadier views. Better yet, slouch down in a chair and put your elbows on the arm rests. Then all you'll see is your heart beat.

I looked at a distant light, and compared its size to the Nikon's 16x. I find it very believable the Celestrons are 25x.

The field of view is not as wide as advertised. The apparent field of view is 57.4 degrees, not 61. The belt of Orion just barely fits in the view. The moon is 30% of the view. The true field of view is 2.4 degrees, not the advertised 2.7 degrees.

The arms of the eyepiece adjuster also have some wiggle in them causing a 1/4 inch delay when turning the adjuster wheel. I have had to re-adjust the right diopter even when I did not touch the center wheel, indicating it might be moving a bit. But it does not take long to get back into focus. There is also a flare visible off to the side of the exit pupil, though I don't see it during astronomy.

Despite these flaws, I can't subtract a star at only $70 shipped. These binoculars are a league above my 10x50 for astronomical viewing, at least in terms of looking at individual targets. A telescope has many advantages, but these are grab and go. However, to see the phase of Venus, you need to stop down the aperture and sit down to brace your view.
-------------------------

I easily saw the correct shape of the Orion nebula on a half moon when my 10x50 could see nothing.
I could see the dark side of the half moon, whereas my 10x50 could only see the bright side. My 16x50 also saw the dark side.
Jupiter looks much bigger in the 25x70, but I may need to reduce the aperture to see the stripes. I can see bands on Jupiter 114mm f8 Newtonian telescope at 28x, but I can't see bands at 25x in the binoculars.
The Pleiades look much better in the 25x70 than in the telescope or my other binoculars.
The double cluster in Perseus is clearly visible in the 25x70, and looks tiny with an almost stellar core in my 10x50.
Andromeda, M31, looks better, with M32 and M110 noticeable by it, and very hard to see in my 10x50.
I can see a tiny ring around Saturn at 28x in my telescope, but at 25x, I sometimes see a ring around Saturn and sometimes I don't. On the day that I could see a ring, my 16x50 detected ears.
I can see M13 and other globular clusters as small fuzzy balls. I could find them in my 16x, but smaller. In my 10x, I can locate most of them, but they look like stars. Maybe I can detect a little fuzz on M13. In my 7x, I can't locate most of them, but I can see M13 and maybe a few others, though I don't remember.
All of my observing was hand held, unbraced.
I could point them at whatever I wanted and hit my targets just fine. I had trouble hitting Andromeda right away because I could not see it naked eye.
M82 and M81 are easy to identify in my 25x70 as I sweep over them. I can see the cigar shape of M82 in my 16x50 too, though I can't find either one in my 10x50.
I can see a mountain range on the moon in the 25x70 when my elbows are braced. I've not yet found it in my 16x50.
Airplanes look bigger but take longer to find in my 25x70.
At 25x, you can't tell where you are in the sky from the star orientations. You just have to point and look, and you know where you are when you see the object you are looking for. At 16x, I can pan around from bright star to bright star and figure out where I am by memory. At 10x, I can see some bright stars in the same field of view, but have to pan for others. And at 7x, you can easily see where you are.
I actually think my view of M31 was more enjoyable in a 15x70 than in these 25x70, though I know the Orion nebula is better at 25x. It keeps getter better even at 60x.
M33 can be located at lower power, but the 25x70 gave the best view, giving maybe a hint of spiral structure.

These are really nice and of good quality from what I see so far. I wish the eyepiece cover (there's only one to cover both eyepieces) would fit better. If you turn the binoculars upside down, the cover falls off. It'd be nice if they put some pop up covers on them or at least make them fit better, so they wouldn't fall off. The lens covers fit nicely and work just fine. The strap that comes with them is almost worthless. It's so thin and there's no padding for your neck, so they immediately dig into your neck when you put it over your head.

I got these today and it is amazing for the price. It is very cold here but there was no fogging going in and out. It took some time to get the distance between my eyes set. They are stiff and hard to move at first. I finally got them adjusted right. No double vision issues. Images were very clear. The phone adapter was too small so I am returning it. I found one that will fit my phone. The tripod connection is under a little cap right above the focus adjuster. Some reviewers said it didn‚Äôt have one. It does. I do plan to use it with a tripod for longer viewing sessions. It is a tad heavy after a while.

These are tremendous for times when you just want to check out what is happening above you but don‚Äôt want the hassle of setting up a telescope. You can do just casual scanning but highly recommend a tripod for night sky viewing.
Used for looking at planets and stars. Really need a tripod to help steady and get good focus. Works as well as a telescope.
Liked the power and ease of use. They‚Äôre heavy tho and won‚Äôt be used in the field too often
great quality and size for watching the moon and other sights of nature at a distance.
Extremely clear. Great binoculars but you really need a tripod to get the best out of them.
Todo fue perfecto , producto ,precio , tiempo, calidad
These binoculars are lightweight enough to transport easily in and out of the house and small enough to leave on a tripod.

name: Etekcity Food Kitchen Scale, Digital Grams and Ounces for Weight Loss, Baking, Cooking, Keto and Meal Prep, LCD Display, Medium, 304 Stainless Steel
description:
Product Description

This Etekcity digital scale has endless uses for personal or commercial environments - great for homes, kitchens, offices, and more. The scale has an easy-to-read LCD display with beautiful clear backlit. With a capacity of 11lb (5kg), you can weigh a variety of items with ease. You will be surprised at all the uses you will have for this product.

¬†

Weighing Functions

You can easily choose among measurement in oz, lb:oz, g, ml (Milk & Water), fl'oz (Milk/Water). This digital scale measures in precise increments of 0.05oz (1 g) to accurately weigh your items. Power is provided by 2 AAA batteries (included), making the scale portable and ensuring that you can easily acquire replacement batteries.

¬†

Tare Function

The tare function allows the user to deduct the weight of a container from the total weight in order to determine the net weight of the contents excluding the weight of the container which holds them.

¬†

Clear Display and Auto-off

The scale has an easy-to-read backlit display, staying 30 seconds for easily reading. To save energy, the scale also features an auto-off function, allowing the scale to turn off after 2 minutes inactivity. Do not mix new and used batteries to power the device

¬†

Specifications

Weight Capacity: 176oz / 5000g / 11 lbs

Units: g / oz / lb:oz /ml (Milk & Water) /fl'oz (Milk/Water).

Measurement Increments: 1 g

Minimum Measurement: 2 g

Auto-Off: 2 Minutes

Power: 2 x AAA 1.5V DC

Dimensions: 7.3 x 5.7 x 0.6 inches

¬†

Package Contents

1 x Digital Kitchen Scale

1 x Quick Start Guide

2 x AAA 1.5V DC batteries

Do not mix new and used batteries to power the device.

reviews.content:
I love that my Etekcity Digital Kitchen Scale is a great tool in my kitchen to help me measure food to ensure that I track what I‚Äôm putting into my body, my husband's and my children‚Äôs bodies each and every day, all day! It helps me measure food and ensure the quality control on everything. This food scale is my constant companion. I don‚Äôt eat without it. Now, don‚Äôt get me wrong. I didn't always use a food scale to measure my food intake. In fact, for years when I heard people talk about using a food scale, and measuring their food intake it was always dieters, and one thing I never went on was a diet. At least not in the sense I understood they meant to use the word, "diet"! The thought of depriving my body from food was foreign to me. In fact, growing up with a limited food supply meant that once I was old enough to get a job, I exiled food shortage from my life. However, overeating because food became plentiful in adulthood with a job eventually became a problem. Especially after pregnancy and becoming a mother. An experience worth losing a few vanity points over for sure! However, with weight gain vanity concerns pale in comparison to health concerns. You see, I needed to know for sure that I was eating what my body needed, and that I was feeding my husband and children what their bodies needed. And, if I began to tip over to overeating, I wanted it to be a conscious choice! And for my husband and children, I wanted to help them learn when to recognize that they were tipping over the point of eating the recommended daily calories from each food group so that I and so that they had awareness of when they had enough to do the job of sustaining a thriving body so we could experience the whole life change we were after as a family. This Etekcity Digital Kitchen Scale plays a big part of helping us do that. All day, every day. It makes it easy. It takes just a second to put the food on it and measure the serving size. And I get to choose the units (ounces, grams, etc.).

Now, I don't know about you, but I LOVE observing how people who work for companies in a support capacity do their jobs. And when I come across a person or staff that wows me, I stop and take notice! I also stop and take notice when I come across staff that has the opposite effect on me. And my follow through is just as thorough then as this review is now. The Etekcity Digital Kitchen Scale support team wowed me! Immediately they responded to my inquiry when my scale, which I had for a long time, stopped working one day. Like I told you, this thing works hard all day every day measuring food for a family of four. Well, their support team instructed me on how to troubleshoot what was the cause of the problem, offered to send me a new scale, which arrived quickly, AND the piece de resistance. Several weeks later, they reached out to me to ask me how the new scale was working. Talk about a customer support team! Now that's the kind of service I want all day every day!

So, if you're considering buying a food scale for yourself and/or your family, I highly recommend the Etekcity Digital Kitchen Scale. Not just because it's an amazing digital piece of machinery, but because the company has people, actual human beings who work there that care about the service they provide customers and it shows in the CRM (customer relationship management) system they very likely automated utilizing the beauty of digital technology to do it, but they also kept the human element present with their service, which gives them an extra edge.

This is my third Etekcity Digital Kitchen Scale! It's a machine. It isn't meant to last forever. All machines eventually stop working. There's an expected life for every machine. And when this machine serves me till it can't anymore, like the last 2 did, I'll gratefully whisper a thank you for your service to the people who made it and gladly buy another one. Year after year. Etekcity and their customer team now have a "raving fan", as one of my favorite teachers and mentors calls it! When you get yours, let me know if you become a raving fan of the Etekcity Digital Kitchen Scale too.

This scale works great. It‚Äôs been 100% accurate every time, I LOVE the tare feature, and being able to change from ounces to gram is clutch. It‚Äôs slim so I can easily slide it behind my utensils jar on my counter top so it takes up nearly zero space in my tiny kitchen. Great buy. Zero regrets.

I watch quite a few baking shows and most focus on scales and recommend you have them. I use mine specifically for baking. You can‚Äôt go wrong with this scale. It is compact and fits into tiny spaces. It‚Äôs as flat as the tiniest tablet. I like mine very much.

It is just so handy. And so thin it‚Äôs easy to store. I did get it wet. And they kind of freaked out for a day. Then I used it the next day and it‚Äôs perfectly fine. I would recommend this. I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to buy it again.

I tested it for few days and figured out it‚Äôs a great kitchen scales , sometimes the weight is a bit different but otherwise works great
It comes with batteries which is great
It has many different units like grams lbs milk etc
It looks great and very durable

I have used old school scales for years baking. For commercial use, this scale wouldn't cut it. Around my personal kitchen, it is spot on, and It is small and doesn't hog my counter space up like my big, big $$$ analog scale(s). Very accurate. Batteries (I was scared about this) seem to hold up well. I have turned out about 20 loaves of Sour dough, made starters, Soda Breads, and still on the same batteries. Very nice, feels like I'm more in the lab, than the kitchen:). I like the accuracy particularly for very small gram measurements. You can't weigh small amounts of, say, dried mushrooms on the big scales.

I‚Äôve had this scale for I think >6 months. It is very easy to use. I like how I can switch between measurement s like grams or fl oz. I especially love the zero out option and the ability to turn the scale off when not in use. This was a great buy!
This was so simple to use. It took no figuring out. I can put any container on it and set it to zero so only the contents are weighed.
this handy little tool kept me in the sourdough game. my family can rejoice in fresh sourdough stuff because without this scale I was throwing in the towel.

This little scale works just fine if you are measuring directly on the metal, or using a *small* clear dish. I wish that the weight screen was not on the same plane as the scale area - or that the scale area was raised because unless your dish is tiny it will cover the result.

name: KitchenAid All Purpose Shears with Protective Sheath, One Size, Black
description:
Product Description

These all-purpose shears from KitchenAid are a valuable addition to your kitchen utensils set and ideal for a variety of tasks throughout the home, from slicing poultry and pizza to clipping coupons. The blade edges feature micro-serrations to provide a superior cutting experience. Durable and strong, these kitchen scissors are made from heavy-duty stainless steel that withstands daily use, with soft-grip handles that provide comfort and control while using. The shears come with a blade guard to protect blades when stored. Dishwasher safe; hand washing is recommended.

reviews.content:
I have never owned a NICE pair of kitchen sheers before. I have always just gone and bought a cheap pair at the dollar store.

Let me tell you... I will never go back to a cheap pair of shears again. These are SO nice! They cut really well. They are comfortable to hold. I love them!

My husband actually used them to cut some Flex Tape and ruined them. I was SO pissed and told him he was using his spending money to replace my damn scissors cause he was never going to get them cleaned. He tried but... it's flex tape... the glue on that stuff is supposed to be practically permanent.

When he couldn't get them clean he had to concede and get me a new pair. Like I said... never going back to cheap shears again.

I purchased these shares as part of a wedding gift. I gifted them because I use my kitchen chairs every day. I love these shears Because they are easy to use and easy to clean. I have severe arthritis in my hands so cutting food with a knife is painful. My kitchen aid shears make cutting food so much easier. And when I am done I just put them in the dishwasher and they look as good as new.

I love the color (I purchased the turquoise) very heavy duty. We use utility shears in the kitchen a lot plus it matches my color theme. Anything kitchen aid is a win win in my eyes. You won‚Äôt be disappointed in this purchase. Also love the texture of the handles- very comfortable.

This is a very nice pair of kitchen shears. I ordered them for our camper and had the opportunity to use them on a recent camping trip. They are very sturdy and easy to hold, even with arthritis in both of my hands. They are sharp and cut well, and I like the cover for the blades. I especially love the Aqua Sky color, as it matches our Vintage Cruiser camper. I've had several pairs of kitchen shears in the past that have fallen apart after just a few months, but I have a feeling these shears will be around much longer. I will probably end up buying a pair to use in my house as well.
These are a cooks delight. Sharp and easy to handle. I use them to cut up vegetables, and walnuts. Works like a charm.

Both loops are large enough for arthritic hands and designed to be grabbed from either side. Sharp as a razor and solid build. I do not know how they resharpen yet, but I'm guessing that they are going to be top-notch and in favorite my cutlery block for a long time.
We use these so much that we have three pair. That way, even if one is in the dishwasher we can still chop up chicken or other kitchen tasks.

The shears that came with my knife set/block broke, and these are a great/high quality replacement and fit in my knife block perfectly. And . . . I thought they were very reasonably priced! You won‚Äôt be disappointed!
Great scissors for all kitchen duties! Like the weight and durability!

Shears are so underrated in the kitchen. I use shears often when preparing food for cooking. I also frequently use shears for preparing cooked food for plates for my wife and kids. I actually prefer shears over a knife for cutting chops or steaks before plating the meat for my wife and kids. Shears are precise and so easy to use.

These are excellent kitchen shears from KitchenAid. Great quality and comfort. No pinching at the finger loops. These are super affordable. As a bonus, the shears break apart for easy cleanup.

reviews.content: The first thing I noticed is that the color was wrong. But the box said it was the right color so it must have been boxed wrong at the factory. Second thing is that it came with windows mode s. Which means I couldn‚Äôt download apps that they didn‚Äôt approve. Like YouTube. But they highly suggested ticktock which we are hearing is insecure. So, I had to get it out of s mode before I could get the apps I bought it for. Worked out in the end. I‚Äôll keep it.

Great speed. Quick start and fast loading. Easy to use out of the box. Unfortunately the touch screen required a lot of tweaking to get a decent picture quality. My device clearly showed signs of heavy use of the touch screen out of the box and it was not advertised as "refurbished". My last laptop was in use for five years and showed little sign of use even after five years of use so something is not right.

So far I like everything concerning the computer. Easy set up ,.touch screen, not to big not to small. Not as fast but what I use it for it is just fine. Great Price! and arrived earlier than expected. What more could I ask for.

Bought pretty much on impulse. Needed a basic laptop as the Acer Spin5 I use has a power connection glitch. This machine did come with Windows 11 installed, but I just finished going through all the updates (about 6 or so) to get to the latest version of Windows 11, and it runs ok. Also went through a dozen driver updates and everything works ok. I was concerned about 8 megs of RAM being enough for the software I use, and it's not, apparently, as that software runs but crashes after a while. Also, 256 GB of ssd storage is not enough. However, both those things are pretty easy to upgrade. Screen optical quality is very lackluster & I have been trying to tweak that in Windows with not much luck. I like the touch screen, track pad, keyboard feel. I like the power connector, seems sturdy and that's important to me, as I have regularly killed laptop power connections. All in all, a pretty good deal for $385 + tax.

I love my new laptop and the touch screen is perfect. Only thing that I dont really like is the battery life.
But other than that I love my touch screen laptop.

My laptop from 2014 was on its last leg, so it was definitely time for this new one. I'm very pleased with this straightforward, classy laptop and would recommend it (but not for gaming, etc.) The battery life is decent.

I got this when they were having a sale. Paid less than $400. Perfect for everything I need to do. Screen is very responsive to touch. Keys are soft and don‚Äôt feel cheap. The laptop itself doesn‚Äôt feel cheap. Battery life is fine. I can sit and do what I need to do for a few hours and still have almost 80% battery life even while using multiple tabs and watching YouTube videos. Screen quality is not like a high end laptop but it‚Äôs decent for what you pay.
Like the touch screen and does my personal business
Llego en muy buenas condiciones, es un buen equipo justo para lo que necesito
This is the single best purchase that I have ever found. Works flawlessly and is built solid for years of service.

name: Broan-NuTone 423004 30-inch Under-Cabinet Range Hood with 2-Speed Exhaust Fan and Light, Stainless Steel
description:
Product Description
Product Description

Upgrade your kitchen with the Broan-NuTone 30-inch Under-Cabinet Range Hood! This versatile range hood insert offers a complete solution to your ventilation needs by providing both an exhaust fan and overhead light for your stove. This range hood provides a MAX 230 CFM and 6.0 Sones blower performance to quickly remove smoke and cooking odors from the air, and the 2-speed rocker switch allows for quick fan adjustments and provides the ideal level of ventilation every time you cook. The built-in light with protective lamp lens accepts up to a 75-watt incandescent bulb (not included) to evenly illuminate your cooking area, and it is also controlled by a rocker switch for ease of use. This sleek stainless steel range hood fits neatly underneath cabinets, and it features mitered sides and a hemmed bottom with no sharp edges to help ensure safety and provide a more decorative look. The one-piece dishwasher-safe aluminum grease filter offers easy cleaning so you can maintain optimum grease capture and keep your kitchen ventilated (damper sold separately). This range hood unit measures 17.5" x 30" x 6" and is designed to fit 7" round vertical ductwork for simple installation at least 18" above the cooktop. It can work in an ADA-compliant application as well. It is both UL-Listed and HVI-2100 Certified for safety and protection, and it includes a 1 year limited warranty. Enhance your kitchen with the Broan-NuTone 423004 Range Hood!

From the Manufacturer

The 42000 series offers an effective and durable under-the-cabinet hood solution for vertical discharge installations. The range hood is designed for 7-Inch round vertical duct attachment. The hood comes in a variety of appliance matching colors and widths, and features a fan designed for years of trouble free service, an easy to clean grease filter, an easy to clean grease filter, a protective lamp lens that distributes light evenly over the cook-top and control switches for fan speed and light activation. Includes built-in 7-Inch duct adapter. Installs as 7-Inch round ducted only. 190 CFM, 6.0 Sone (vertical discharge) performance. HVI 2100 Certified. Dishwasher-safe aluminum grease filter. Accepts up to 75-Watt light (bulb not included). Built-in 7-Inch adapter. BP87 dampers sold separately. This range hood can work in an ADA-compliant application.

reviews.content: Was a direct replacement for the Broan that I had. Wanted one with MORE suction CFM's but did not want to rework the entire exhaust duct system at this time. Looks nice, works well. Only complaint is where the sheet metal is formed and shaped at the front corners could/ should have been fitted better or spot welded as the seams are kind of open and allows cleaning cloth to get caught up on the metal corners. Otherwise, happy since it was a direct replacement which took me like 10 minutes to install :)) Longest part was swapping over the electrical plug. Plan to upgrade to a more powerful Broan or equivalent in the later part of the year. NOTE: Although identical, seems to be just a little quieter than the old one, just a bit low (200 CFM max) on the exhaust rating. Happy with the look and price till a higher CFM unit can be installed and, in our budget, :))

Update: It's been two years and the hood has worked flawlessly. I've had to buy a new range hood though because of a grease fire. This one is surprisingly still under $40 and I was so satisfied with the last one that I bought it again. Another reason for repurchasing this one is that I've already done all the preliminary work and it will slip right in. No figuring, cutting or buying additional parts. I'm sure I'll get more than two years out of this one as long as I don't burn my house down.

Original review: The hood in the mobile home I purchased worked, but was beyond cleaning. I purchased this one as it fit perfectly in the space and it was very inexpensive. My mistake was not realizing that this unit has a seven inch exhaust when my old duct work was only five inches. I had to purchase a reducer and some metallic tape which solved the problem. I also purchased a seven inch damper as one does not come with this range hood and didn‚Äôt want to reuse the nasty one I pulled out of the five inch duct.

The metal on this hood is pretty thin, but for the price you can‚Äôt expect heavy duty. I recommend a two person install. The unit is not heavy, but is a little awkward to hold up and try to screw it in under your cabinets. If you drop it or bump it too hard you will damage it. The mounting points can be easily damaged if the hood is not held steady while installing. Once installed the odds of damaging it are slim.

I made a template out of cardboard so I could cut a larger hole in the bottom of my cabinet with a jigsaw to accommodate the seven inch exhaust. I marked holes, drilled them and put screws in leaving the screws protruding so I could lift the hood up. I slid the keyholes onto the screws then tightened the screws. I had trouble holding the hood steady while tightening the screws and bent a couple of the screw keyholes in the top of the hood. After bending the keyholes back into reasonable shape, I took styrofoam from a different purchase and used it to hold the hood up. I added washers to the screws (after painting them gloss white) to give more strength to each of the four stress points were the screws go. My old hood was hard wired so I knocked out the plug in the back of the hood and ran the wire from the wall into the hood. (Prior to screwing the hood to the cabinets.) You have to remove one screw that holds the cover for the electrical components. Remove that cover, make your connections and put the cover back on. If you have an electrical outlet your need to plug into then you can just wire in a power cord rather than hard wiring the unit.

The hood came with four short screws to screw it to your cabinets. I had to come up with longer screws because these would be much too short. Mobile home remember? My cabinets are particle board including the bottom. Under the bottom there is a half inch of open space and then a layer of sheet rock. My screws needed to go through the sheet rock, through the open space and into the particle board. If you have nice cabinets made out of actual wood then the short screws should work for you just fine, but if you have nice cabinets you probably won‚Äôt be choosing this budget range hood.

I‚Äôve got the hood up and running. Some say it is loud when the fan is on high, but it‚Äôs a fact that my old fan was louder. (Mobil home. Built on the cheap.) I put a nice bright LED bulb in rather than that old incandescent bulb. My installation is low enough that you do not see underneath the hood at all. If I do look under there it looks much like the nasty old hood it replaced ‚Äì just clean.

My hood arrived in pristine condition, but I can understand why so many people end up with dinged or damaged hoods. This is very light thin metal that will take damage easily. The install can be done alone, but would be easier with two people. A couple of the front seams on either end do shed a little light when I turn it on, but I wouldn‚Äôt have noticed it if I hadn‚Äôt read about it in another review and it‚Äôs only noticeable if I have the hood light on with the kitchen lights off. A dab or two of caulk or a piece of tape will fix that. It‚Äôs in a spot underneath where you‚Äôll never see the tape anyway.

The front face of my cabinets hang down almost an eighth of an inch lower than the rest of the bottom of the cabinets so even though the front of the hood fits tight and flush to the cabinets, I do have this minor crack of a space between the hood and the cabinet bottom on the sides. Caulk it. I am happy with the hood. It looks much nicer than the ancient one it replaced and works great.

I got this bad boy for only $40 although the price does fluctuate.

We replaced an identical one we had because our daughter used oven cleaner on the top and made the biggest mess you ever saw. The paint came up only partly leaving a sticky gooey mess that never went away. Worse than this, every dirty piece of lint, dust, bugs -- everything stuck to it. The nightmare from there is that all the aforementioned debris stuck so good, you could no way wash it off! All of this is not the to the detriment of this great item, of course.

I love this hood's simple and functional design. It worked perfectly right up to the day we finally replaced it because of the above. It is not overly loud, no more than any other fan over the stove.

What you need to know is this -- it does not come with the butterfly -- Broan BP87 Vertical Discharge Damper, 7-Inch. Be sure to get this item or you'll wait to get it before getting the install job finished. We just cleaned up the old one and reused it.

Also, the older version had a painted (black) electrical cover. I don't know if it matters, but save the old one (if this pertains) if you want the painted electrical cover. I opted to keep the new one which is lighter in weight and just the plain galvanized steel which is better looks-wise with the aluminum-colored vent screen. Not that it matters much as hopefully one doesn't spend much of their time looking up into their hood.

It's a thumbs up for function and long-lasting performance.
Our old one with the ruined top was 28 years old -- still working perfectly.

Update after installation. It is even more quiet than ever. Also, the new hood's front edge now has a lovely curve to it rather than the sharper angle on the older one. Very Nice!

Considering the price, this is a pretty good deal. I replaced my old GE 7" round ducted hood with the Broan stainless steel hood also with the round duct. The dimensions were pretty much the same as the old one. Install wasn't too tough, helps to have an extra set of hands to hold the hood while mounting. All in all you can't beat it for the price. Looks good too, no issues with mine.
Easy install works great, requires some electrical skill to wire though the wal or ceiling.

Overall a very nice product. It works as intended. The shipping was free and the item arrived quickly. The seller was nice. I would definitely recommend this product. I might purchase an additional one soon.
Llego r√°pido buen producto
Great Piece

Easy to use arrived without any damage looks super nice installed just wish they used a fan motor with a higher cfm needs better suction i just wanted a black overhead ill get i better fan very easy to replace it and its very easy to install this appliance remove and replace 4 screws and a 3 wires a kindergartener could do it

name: Roku Streaming Stick 4K | Streaming Device 4K/HDR/Dolby Vision with Roku Voice Remote and TV Controls
description:
Product Description

Roku¬Æ Streaming Stick¬Æ 4K is faster and more powerful than ever. The redesigned long-range Wi-Fi¬Æ receiver is super-charged with up to 2x the speed‚Äîexactly what you need for smooth streaming in spectacular 4K, Dolby Vision¬Æ, and HDR10+ picture. The all-new design plugs right into your TV with a simple setup. It‚Äôs perfect for wall-mounted TVs and keeping wires out of sight. Stunningly sharp 4K picture brings out the rich detail in your entertainment with 4x the resolution of HD. Watch in awe as colors come to life with spectacular Dolby Vision¬Æ picture. Start streaming channels including Disney+, Prime Video, HBO Max, Apple TV+, Netflix, Sling, Freevee and Hulu in a snap with a super-fast startup, and enjoy smooth TV streaming in rooms further from your router with the long-range Wi-Fi¬Æ receiver, now up to 2x faster. Power up your TV, adjust the volume, and control your Roku device with one remote. Easily search across thousands of channels with your voice and control your TV, streaming, and sound‚Äîall with the included Roku voice remote. Upgrade your streaming with a massive selection of free, live, and premium TV, including Roku¬Æ Originals only on The Roku Channel. The customizable home screen puts your favorites front and center, so you can spend your time streaming‚Äînot scrolling. Setup is simple with everything you need in the box. This Roku¬Æ Streaming Stick¬Æ 4K also works with popular voice assistants. Ask your Alexa or Google Assistant-enabled device to launch channels, search for entertainment, control your streaming, and more. You can also control your TV using the Apple Home app or Siri on your Apple devices plus share videos, photos, and music from your Apple device using AirPlay.

reviews.content:
I've had experience with a number of devices, and this one is my favorite.

My priorities:
Fast streaming/minimal lag
Easy to navigate
Access to shows of interest
Ability to preview as i fast forward or rewind

Apple TV:
Expensive
Can't preview or issues with some of the apps that was frustrating. it wanted to rewind or fast foward instead of clicking to the screen section you wanted with a preview. This really killed the device for me.
Easy to overshoot if you used the finger swipe option to quickly move fast-forward or rewind.
User interface, for the most part is decent and fast except for how navigates while playing.

Fire TV
Built to sell products instead of show shows, laggy, and for whatever reason I hated interacting with this device. Not being able to easily access the content I wanted due to poor organization really rubbed me the wrong way.
Pro - ability to bootleg shows, but not something I'm into and I only checked this out during the first weeks of covid.
I want to emphasize the lag issues. This is built as cheap as possible to minimally meet requirements to function and it shows.

Roku
So, now that I have the other devices out of the way, and ignore my LG streaming which is my favorite, I'll speak to this device and why it has my vote.

This device is surprisingly fast. I didn't expect a device that was almost as responsive as my apple TV and LG TV. This is slightly slower but barely and no lag which is the most critical thing for me.
We got this for the British Bake-off access which led to an unexpected cool thing. The discovery of the free shows, if you don't absolutely hate commercials. For the complete British Bake-off experience, we mute the commercials. So, the additional channels that Roku provides has made it continue to be useful.
Roku allows a preview of channels as I fast forward through it.
Roku does have an issues with some apps where I need to log out and go back in so the remote works correctly. I'm not sure if that's a bad app issue or the device but a quick back and in fixes. The apple device has never crashed or become buggy on me. The Firestick has, but it's cheap.
The price is significantly cheaper than apple making the Roku a no brainer.
Unlike the apple TV, which requires counter space, this plugs into the back of the TV and is hidden away.

Now, an issue I had when I first turned on is that my remote was not communicating with the device. I was extremely annoyed as this was an early Christmas present for my wife, and I wanted it to function within a certain time window so a return and replace would have ruined it. The device showed the remotes power but didn't communicate. After resetting the device, the remote works fine now. If you run into an issue, try resetting the device.

4k streaming? It's okay. I didn't do a side by side. It has 4k.

Navigation? It's simple enough but could be made better. I thought the last version of the Fire TV was worse. The apple TV does shine in this area on most apps I played with. My biggest gripe with navigation in Roku is that marking something as favorite and then LOCATING the favorites from Roku's channels and free shows, was not intuitive. I did eventually find my favorites, but that was frustrating. Additionally, the channel/app/inventory searching involves clicking to the right instead of down.

So, speed is slightly less than Apple, but barely. Navigation is slightly less easy based on the layout vs apple, and i think it's better than the Fire the last time I used that thing. The Roku has a nice access to misc. free channels. Its price is a quarter of Apple. The fire TV? I don't consider these two in the same league.

So, if you're picking up a streaming device, I'd recommend the Roku over the other devices (except the LG TV native streaming app which is the best I've used). Performance and price are good. The only reason to avoid is if it doesn't have access to what you want to watch. For me, it filled in the gaps and provided baking shows that we otherwise didn't have access to.

I am only rating this 5 stars because the customer service rep was extremely helpful and fulfilled my request with ease. Not to mention He was extremely patient with me and very kind. I was able to receive confirmation for a full refund, granted I had purchased the Asurion 2 year coverage plan. I haven't had to return any items before and didnt know how it actually worked not to mention the shipping is longer, to and from hawaii. He was able to help me find the best and easiest option for return very quickly.
Unfortunately, the remote that I received is defective. I connected and set it up according to the instructions. My wifi connection was excellent. The only problem was the apps weren't opening and kept ready "authentication error". I could not for the life of myself, find a probable cause or solution. I tried clearing cache/cookie by pressing a few buttons on the remote (home button 5x, up arrow x1, rewind x2, forward x3) and even did a system restart. I tried signing out and logging back in but the problem was still there.
I am going through some dark times in my life at the moment and purchased to pair with a projector for my children so we could enjoy some family time with their father who's health is preventing him from leaving the house. As lame as I sound...i was just so grateful to have been treated with kindness as people, and life have not been so very kind to us lately

I‚Äôve been using Roku boxes and sticks for years. They are consistently excellent at every function they perform. Their ability to stream without buffering, lost connection, or interruption beats all my ‚ÄúSmart‚Äù TV‚Äôs hands down. I have a number of Samsung TV‚Äôs that I buy for picture quality, and while most have built-in streaming function I have a Roku on each box. The reason is not just the better performance, but also to have a consistent user interface across multiple TV‚Äôs in my house. I have three Samsung smart TV‚Äôs of various ages, and all three have different user interfaces. Combine in a Vizio smart TV, with its own unique interface, and the learning curve is too much for many of the people in my house. I have 5 Roku units of varying ages, and they all have the same user interface. The new Roku sticks add TV power and volume control so you only need one remote. The Roku user interface is easy to learn, and organizes its presentation around the various streaming services (Netflix, Hulu, Prime Video, Paramount+, etc.). Wirecutter tells me that the Google Chromecast might be the better adapter, because it organizes the interface around the shows you like to watch so you don‚Äôt need to remember which show is on which streaming service. I think the Roku is easy to use, and given that all our household TV consumers know the interface, I‚Äôm not anxious to change. Yet I agree that Google‚Äôs UI approach is interesting. But competition being what it is, I suspect Roku will release a similar function on their product at some point in the future.

Roku Streaming Stick 4K | Streaming Device 4K/HDR/Dolby Vision with Roku Voice Remote and TV Controls

First the pros: Steaming quality seems to be better than the fire stick. I'm using the Roku on an older Sony and I believe the max resolution 1080p. Doesn't need to be plugged into power adaptor, but when only plugged into a TV USB port the Roku may pause until the mini battery (probably a capacitor) in the charging USB cable charges up (a few seconds). The contents of the box include the adaptor, so I decided to use the adaptor. You can download the SPECTRUM app on this Roku, but I tried to load the Spectrum app on the Fire Stick and it wouldn't work no matter what I tried, although I did not try a pirated app, just legitimate downloads, and Apps2fire.

Cons: I tried setting up a new account, but when I logged out and tried to log back in my password wasn't recognized (or account), so I had to reset my password to log in, but it wouldn't recognize the new password. Next for a new account credit card info must be entered to progress (grrrr). Since I couldn't log in without resetting my password each time, I tried an old Roku account I had, and that worked fine (didn't even have to set up a credit card... Interface is not that intuitive in my opinion, I give the Fire Stick a nod to setup and interface.

I bought this product and recommend it.

I like Roku products. I have 2 or 3 each of the TVs, Sticks, Ultras, speaker sets. This newer stick (model 3820) has one change in particular that made it almost unusable in my setup. I have a media hub that provides a stand alone wifi connection and an SD card slot. The media hub can provide a pass-thru internet connection (normally a hotspot from my phone) as well but most of the time does not have a network to connect to. Previous models of the Stick can read MP4 video files off the media hub card with the Roku Media Player regardless of pass-thru internet connection. This new model Stick WILL NOT READ THE SD CARD unless the media hub is connected to a network and provides it pass-thru to the Stick. Why? I don't know. I hope they fix it. I had to swap it with one of my previous gen sticks (model 3810 which was on my home wifi) to keep the functionality I needed.

Also, they made the power cord with built-in wifi longer (a few feet at least, and micro-usb). I see that as a plus for most people, but in my case, a shorter cable was preferred. The 3810 has a 1 foot cable with a mini-usb connection. They are not swappable between models because of the usb type. They should have kept the same connection so people could choose even if it meant a bit slower connection on the older shorter cable.

This has been a game changer for us! We have two older LG televisions in our home that do not have all of the latest streaming apps. We have a new TV that we primarily use with an Apple TV but I did not want to spend that kind of money on two tv's we don't use as much. This was the perfect solution! Now we can stream Spectrum cable through the Roku as well as all of our other channels such as HBO, Hulu, Peacock, Paramount, etc. I'm so happy with this that I'm going to buy another one so I don't have to keep moving it from one old TV to the other! Set up was a breeze and I love the remote. My husband even figured it out quickly and didn't have to ask me over and over how to navigate it! He now watches Roku TV in the basement and I got my Apple remote back! Haha!

I bought one of the first smart TVs, but now find that some of the content on the many streaming services I pay for can no longer be ‚Äúviewed on this device‚Äù. Since our electronic devices have become ‚Äòuse and toss‚Äô thanks to the constant upgrades, I figured I‚Äôd have to invest in a new smart TV. Luckily I saw an article about Roku and Firestick. I never understood what they were before. I decided to try the Firestick as it was $10 cheaper and if it didn‚Äôt work I wasn‚Äôt out that much. To my amazement it made my old TV new again. Now I can watch everything on all my streaming services, and much easier than before. Since that worked so great, I decided to get a Roku for the other television to see how it performed and it works great too. Roku has an easy to follow interface and it seems to work a little better than the Firestick interface, which doesn‚Äôt always show what was last watched for some reason. I like the remote better on the Firestick, because it is small and thinner, but this remote is good too, and if you have bigger hands you might prefer this one. One point is that the Firestick was not only $10 cheaper, it came with an HDMI extender, which you may need if your HDMI port is in a tight spot. Highly recommend either!

With prices rising everywhere, my parents decided it was time to cut the cable to minimize unnecessary expenses. they didn't think it was worth continuing to pay so much every month for only a handful of channels they watched. They quickly started to get bored of not having anything to watch and asked me for help to try and find them a more cost-effective solution. I looked around and found this as an alternative to high monthly cable bills and decided to give it a go. The device itself has an easy setup and there aren't any visible cables sticking out from the back, making the room and TV mount area look less cluttered and easier to dust and clean. They like the fact that they can subscribe to only what they want to watch without having extra channels that they don't need, it makes finding content easier for them, and even get recommendations for other content that they might enjoy. They also really like that the TV goes into a "screen saver" mode when they step away for a bit but are able to pick right back up where they left off without interruptions. Their favorite feature is the remote and how easy navigating the content is with it. It's very user intuitive and can even control the volume on multiple devices with one remote automatically. The reason why the device is a bit finicky though is that it will suddenly freeze during an episode and the workaround can be a bit frustrating. Turning it off and on seemed to work at first, but then we found ourselves having to unplug the device itself from the TV and then plug it back in which becomes tedious when watching something suspenseful or scary and having to repeat the process over time. Overall, it's an okay device if you're looking to cut costs and get the job done.

I bought the Roku streaming stick because my Samsung TVs WiFi system needed to be reset each time the TV was turn. Installation and set up, including loading all my streaming services, was straightforward and took about 15 minutes. The stick is installed as an HDMI device and comes up running as soon as the TV is turned on. Also, there is no lag time whether it is changing the streaming service or changing the channel within the streaming service. The Roku stick communicates with my TV through the HDMI and therefore the remote controls the volume and power of the TV and the receiver that's hooked up to it (if the HDMI CEC protocol is turned on).

I bought this because I have an old sharp TV that's HD but it's not smart. I have tried in it my parents simple Roku and it worked great but I noticed that my USB port doesn't give enough power to the Roku, and it started to shut down from time to time, the same was to this 4K roku. And I don't mind having to plug in the wifi cord into the ac power. BUT the wire is super short so I have to plug the USB with the wifi in the very corner, this way the USB and all the wires are visible, like, I should have saved $20 and bought the simple version. Also sometimes I turn the TV on and it doesn't recognize the Roku I have to unplug the wifi cable and then plug it again so the Roku SW starts, and tbh it's really annoying. After a 12 hrs shift sometimes all I want is get home, turn the TV on while I rest my body but now I have to move things around before so. Not to mention that I thought since it was more expensive the platform would be better but not. Roku needs to update their user experience, the apps have stars but I can't read the reviews on them. Also if the platform was customizable that would be awesome. At this point Roku you should hire me as a project engineer bcs you have lots of areas of opportunity.

Pros:
Anyways, it gets the job done and that's why I'm not returning it. It does look very hd in my 53" tv, it is faster than the simple Roku and once pluged into the ac it gets better and even faster. And later I'm gonna buy and extension so I can hide the wires. Would recommend? Maybe. If you have an ac power near your tv, and if you don't mind moving and etc. Also keep in mind that if your tv is old or even remotely old (mine is 7 y/o my parents TV is 4 y/o) and live in a hot environment with no Air conditioner it might get hot and shut down.

name: Silonn Ice Makers Countertop, 9 Cubes Ready in 6 Mins, 26lbs in 24Hrs, Self-Cleaning Ice Machine with Ice Scoop and Basket, 2 Sizes of Bullet Ice for Home Kitchen Office Bar Party
description:
Product Description

Ice in 6 mins - Self Cleaning - Portable - 2 Types Of Ice - 26LBS Ice Per Day - Cooler Drinks Faster - Ice Scoop & Basket Included - Transparent Lid - US Based Phone Service.

reviews.content: We had an ice maker in our previous 5th wheel so I was a bit perplexed why our new 2022 5th wheel fridge came with a built in wine fridge instead of an ice maker. I knew as fast as we go thru ice that ice trays weren‚Äôt going to cut it and always buying bags of ice gets old. I purchased this ice maker for $89 and all I can say is that this is one of the best purchases I‚Äôve ever made! I filled it with water, plugged it in and it started making ice within about 15 minutes. You have a size choice for the ice cubes however even the large size isn‚Äôt huge but they don‚Äôt melt quick either. We used the ice as we normally would and what we didn‚Äôt use would eventually melt into the water reservoir to be frozen and reused again. I do have to add that the only noise the machine made was when it dropped ice into the basket and it wasn‚Äôt bothersome at all. It‚Äôs not a large machine so it doesn‚Äôt take up a lot of counter space which is always at a premium in a 5th wheel. Overall I‚Äôm very happy with this machine and highly recommend it, so much so that I‚Äôm buying the same machine for our home.

Pros: This little ice maker has been working nonstop for about 2.5 months and we're very pleased. It consistently produces ice every several minutes and recycles the water so it's very easy to use. We clean the interior with vinegar water and nothing else. It does not keep the ice cold like a freezer; however, just by leaving the lid closed and keeping the unit on there is always ice waiting on us. I generally put a little over 4 cups of water in twice or three times times a day if we're all using it (5 people) because we use a lot per person.
As far as noise, it is noticeable but not intrusive. We can talk at normal volume nearby without any issues. It was pretty easy to get used to the noise. I'd buy this again because it has easily paid for itself and is lots more convenient than driving to the store constantly for more ice.

Cons: the ice get soft quickly and even when it is freshly made it isn't a hard freeze. That's OK with us because it's so quick to produce another set of cubes but might pose a problem for others. You do also need to plan ahead when cleaning it because the drain plug is a touch awkward to reach if you're also trying to hold a bowl to catch the leftover water. I find it easier to carefully move it to a sink for draining.

Even though some reviews were bad, I decided to purchase the ice maker. It's easy to use, quick to produce ice, and doesn't take up too much counter space. I simply fill with filtered water to the max waterline, plug the machine in, and select small or large ice size, and let it work. By the time I finish cooking lunch/dinner there is plenty of ice available. I do save any extra ice to put in the freezer in a separate ice bucket, but make sure to shake the ice bucket several times in a 10 minute period to break-up any clumps of ice that have frozen together. I do recommend this ice machine, and I would purchase this machine again. I love the aqua color also.

This ice maker works really well. I have read in some reviews about it being loud. I don't believe it's unreasonably loud at all. When Ice lands in the tray after being made, it's going to make a noise. Most of all the refrigerators that has a built in ice maker that I've seen seems to be louder than this machine.
I run the machine in the kitchen while I am in living room watching TV. Every once in a while I notice the sound of the ice being made falling into the ice tray. I catch my self wondering who's in the kitchen for a second before I realize it's the ice maker. The ice maker makes ice in two sizes. Bullet shaped with hole in one end. I like that. I usually make the small ice bullets. I ONLY USE SPRING WATER in this machine. No taste, other than clean tasting ice. I will not use tap water. I also make sure that the machine is completely dry when not being used. The one thing I do not like about the ice maker is the location of the drain plug. It's a plastic stopper under neath the front of the unit and you have to pull the ice maker over the edge of counter to open it to drain. The plug isn't easy to pull out and It feels awkward pulling it to the edge of counter so I can drain it. After I do drain it, when I am done making ice, I wipe it out with paper towel to ensure that it completely drys. Fresh tasting ice every time that way.

It's so interesting, growing up in the frigid north, that I never really viewed an ice maker as being an essential tool. Living in Phoenix where the tap water is sometimes 100 degrees, I've come to learn how important an ice maker can be.

I go through a lot of ice.

There is a bit of a learning curve with this device. I've learned, for instance, that I need to fill it every morning. If I do that, I can have a steady stream of ice all the time.

I've learned that the machine works better if you get a piece of Styrofoam and cut it so it fits in the lid. I realize that this isn't a freezer, and it's not designed to keep ice frozen. I have found that the extra insulation causes it to run less often.

I do wish that the bin was larger. I go through about a tan of water on this thing a day, and I'm the only one using it. If you have more than one person using the ice from this, it's probably not going to be very well suited for your purposes. But if you are using ice for a specific purpose or if you are the only one using it, I think it's a great little device.

Of course, the primary issue is that taking a single step up on a more powerful machine will triple the price, so this is about as good as it's going to get.

This ice maker is amazing! It makes ice quickly and it's not very noisy at all. But the thing I like best is that the ice is very oxygenated so it's soft and chewable. I crave ice all the time and this ice is better than I could ever get in a store or at Sonic's. Honestly, it's the best ice I've ever had. If you're looking for ice that's perfect for your drink or even to snack on, I can't recommend this icemaker more. 10/10! Wish I could give it more stars.

I love this ice maker! It is a great price for a solid icemaker that produces ice quickly. It's a bit loud, but it blends into the background after a bit. I don't really think there's much of a difference in the two sizes, but I didn't really need two sizes anyway. It melts a little bit quickly, but not enough to be a problem. Hoping that it will hold up long-term.

Does exactly what it's supposed to do.

Love some of the engineering behind it.

The ice sits in a tray and if it melts while it waits to be used it drips back into the water reservoir to be made back into ice.

Once full, if ice is removed or melts, it will automatically start making ice again.

Great for personal use. The only one in my family that really uses ice is my wife. Makes plenty for her. If you want something for more than 2 people I'd recommend getting a larger one, or storing the ice it makes in the freezer.

All-in-all it works perfect for what I needed it for.

I set this up down by my office so that I could have some nice ice for my ice tea and soda. This was easy to set up and it makes great ice. I was surprised how quick it makes ice. I am very happy with my purchase. Thanks AA

Thought I‚Äôd have more ice but this works in a pinch or for outings where ice is necessary. All day at about 6 hours will make a 10 lb bag of ice. But drips due to the interior not remaining cool while the ice is dropped and more is made. Overall it does work, and does assist in a pinch.

aboutProductTopics.name: Make sure this fits by entering your model number.
Note : Please check the dimension and item weight of the product and confirm it fits your space
FAST ICE MAKER: The Silonn ice maker only takes 6 minutes to make 9 bullet-shaped ice cubes. Fill 2L of water into the water tank, maximum ice capacity can reach 26 pounds in 24 hours.

TWO SIZES OF ICE CUBES: You can make two different sizes of ice cubes. Small ice cubes can chill seafood and beer keeping it fresh and cold. Large ice cubes are more suitable for beverages to achieve a rapid cooling effect.

QUIET AND USER FRIENDLY: When making ice cubes, the noise is lower than 35dB, similar to a working refrigerator. The transparent lid allows you to monitor the ice capacity. The sensor automatically detects when ice is full and stops producing to prevent overflowing.

EASY TO CONTROL: The control panel is very easy to operate. Fill the ice maker with water, press the ON button, select the size of the ice cubes and that‚Äôs it. When the water is insufficient or the ice basket is full, the indicator light will turn on.
SELF-CLEANING & PORTABLE: Silonn ice Maker machine is portable and efficient with size of 12.3 x 8.7 x 12.5 inches. Press the ON/OFF button for 5 seconds to start the self-cleaning process.

name: SHARPIE S-Gel, Gel Pens, Medium Point (0.7mm), Black Ink Gel Pen, 12 Count
description:
Product Description

The power of Sharpie is now in a gel pen with the Sharpie S-Gel. With no smear, no bleed technology and bold, best-in-class ink, this Sharpie pen delivers always-vivid writing. It‚Äôs a high-performance gel pen with a sleek, professional look that makes it a writing instrument you won't want to loan out. And the contoured rubber grip makes for comfortable writing during any task. Available in multiple point sizes, barrel finishes and gel ink colors, Sharpie S-Gel offers a smooth writing experience perfect for homes, schools, or offices.

reviews.content: I got these as start-of-semester gifts for myself and my partner-- both teachers. These pens have a grip section that feels nice. It's not slick or plush and the ribbing is not deep. It's nice to hold when writing for a long span. The ink is dark and dries quickly. It does not feather on most paper (though that really depends on your paper). There's no scent to the ink either. I prefer the .7 line over the .5, as the .5 is a "true" fine point which people looking for that may appreciate. I was a die-hard InkJoy gel user, but these are better.

I recently purchased a pack of Sharpie S-Gel Pens, and they exceeded my expectations in every way. The fine point tip allows me to easily draw precise lines and write small details with ease. The ink is smooth and the colors are vivid. I especially love the fact that the ink is gel-based, so it doesn‚Äôt bleed through the paper. It‚Äôs also smudge-resistant and dries quickly. I highly recommend these pens to anyone looking for a quality writing instrument.

These are very smooth writing pens. The ink is more of the wet variety (differing from ballpoint pens). The ink is very dark and rich, for lack of a better term (looks much better than ballpoint pen inks). I bought them on sale when they are a little over $9 (for 12). I would not hesitate to buy it again. Another thing I like is that you hardly have to press for the pen to write. The only drawback (if there is one) is that you might have to wait for the ink to dry as it is more of a wet variety (as mentioned).

One last thing. Since the ink is of a wet variety, it can "bleed" through paper, so keep that in mind.

The SHARPIE S-Gel Gel Pens generate clean, consistent lines with a smooth ink flow. But, the 0.7mm point size was too large for my purposes. It gave my writing a chunkier and less accurate appearance than I desire. Furthermore, the bigger lines made it difficult to cram as much information as I would have liked into a page. If you prefer a finer point size for your writing, I would suggest shopping for a different pen. But, if you don't mind a thicker line and like smooth ink flow, the SHARPIE S-Gel Gel Pens could be a suitable choice.

This is my favorite pen. I have been looking for a pen that writes smoothly and doesn't cost a fortune. Well, i have found it. This pen writes smooth and is weighted great for me. My only complaint with it is that the cartridges do no seem to last long enough. I have gone through twenty of them over the last year and a half! But I love them!
These are the best pens! These pens write nicely, don't smudge or leak, don't break easily and just plain look good on paper.
I Have Used a lot of Pens For Work and must say nothing can compete with these!

I was stoaked to hear the Sharpie putting out pens so I bought them as soon as they were released. Since then, I have regularly used them, and none of the 12 pens have died yet. They are so smooth to use and I suggest them to anyone who likes writing with gel pens that don't smudge.
I love these pens and don‚Äôt use anything else!

I love these pens. I‚Äôve bought them about 3 times from different location. They are long lasting and the black color I got is perfect. The only reason that I‚Äôm not give 5 out 5 is because I ordered the 0.5 and received the 0.7( i didn‚Äôt return them as I still like them but I just have a preference for the other size) and the protector cap on the end of the pen ( the one you take off before first use ) was hard to remove and came off in parts , which makes me think the product has been on the shelf for long . Other then that the pens are great and I will definitely be repurchasing .
