name: Broan-NuTone F403623 36-inch Under-Cabinet 4-Way Convertible Range Hood with 2-Speed Exhaust Fan and Light, Black
description:
Product Description
Product Description

Upgrade your kitchen with the Broan-NuTone 36-inch Under-Cabinet Convertible Range Hood! This versatile range hood insert offers a complete solution to your ventilation needs by providing both an exhaust fan and overhead light for your stove. This range hood provides a MAX 230 CFM and 6.5 Sones blower performance to quickly remove smoke and cooking odors from the air, and the 2-speed rocker switch allows for quick fan adjustments and provides the ideal level of ventilation every time you cook. The built-in light with protective lamp lens accepts up to a 75-watt incandescent bulb (not included) to evenly illuminate your cooking area, and it is also controlled by a rocker switch for ease of use. This sleek black-colored steel range hood fits neatly underneath cabinets, and it features mitered sides and a hemmed bottom with no sharp edges to help ensure safety and provide a more decorative look. The one-piece dishwasher-safe aluminum grease filter offers easy cleaning so you can maintain optimum grease capture and keep your kitchen ventilated. This 4-way convertible range hood unit measures 17.5" x 36" x 6" and installs as 3.25" x 10" ducted opening connected vertically or horizontally with damper, 7" round vertical ducting (damper sold separately), or as non-ducted with air recirculation (filter sold separately) to provide versatile installation options at least 18" above the cooktop. It can work in an ADA-compliant application as well. It is both UL-Listed and HVI-2100 Certified for safety and protection, and it includes a 1 year limited warranty. Enhance your kitchen with the Broan-NuTone F403623 Range Hood!

From the Manufacturer

Broan economy 40000 series 36-inch under cabinet mount range hoods feature a two-speed fan, a rocker-type fan and light control, and a polymeric blade and light lens. These range hoods are 160 cfm and have a 6.5 sone rating, for quiet operation. With this kitchen range hood, you have the option of ducting vertically or horizontally. The mitered sides and hemmed bottom ensure safety and clearance of the cabinet door. Keyhole mounting slots make the range hood easier to install. Four-way convertible; installs ducted 3-1/4-inch-by-10-inch (vertical and horizontal), 7-inch round (vertical) and non-ducted.

reviews.content: We love this as an over-range, under cabinet fan. We had an exhaust tube & power outlet in the cabinet above the stove, so the fan needed a power cord which isn't included in the package. My partner picked one up from Home Depot & cut it down to the necessary length, then attached it to the wires. Given his experience with electrical devices the installation was quick & easy. The fan works great, but the light didn't work at the same time with a 75 watt bulb. When we replaced the bulb with a 40 watt bulb both the fan & light worked just fine. This looks so much cleaner than the ugly white microwave that was too large for that space anyway. We're happier with our counter-top combo microwave/airfryer which we also purchased from Amazon.
Exceeded our expectations. Great quality, easy to install, very modern sleek look, matches the web description.
Good product!
Easy installation. Pull the smoke and heqt away from the range.
Extremely satisfied. Very competitive pricing with other listed pr
It is really like the one that I replaced. Except this one has high and low exhaust my last one had all speeds.
Fit right in to place of old hood and looks more modern than the old one that was in our 30 year old manufactured home
On a quaility scale of 1-10, I gave it a 6.
Worked for what I needed

Mine is stainless steel so it goes with any decor. I had my handyman install it and he didn't have any problems. The only gripe I have is the fan switch: it works well on high speed but doesn't work at all on low speed. I never use low speed so it's not an issue for me.

name: THERMOS FUNTAINER 10 Ounce Stainless Steel Vacuum Insulated Kids Food Jar with Folding Spoon, Navy
description:
Product Description

The 10oz FUNtainer Food Jar from Thermos brand is vacuum insulated to keep hot foods hot and cold foods cold-and since it's designed for kids it's also colorful and fun. Send them to school with their favorite soup so they can enjoy it fresh and hot at lunch time. If they're in the mood for a cold snack, pack it up with yogurt and berries, or apples and peanut butter. The FUNtainer food jar is light weight and compact with a push button lid so it‚Äôs easy to carry and open. To clean, you can pop your FUNtainer food jar in the dishwasher; however washing by hand is recommended. Spoon included.

reviews.content: I ordered this for my 10 year olds school lunch. He‚Äôs tired of cold sandwiches so this is perfect for hot pasta, nuggets, or whatever you want. It comes with a cute little spoon as well. My son said his food is still hot after 5 hours. It‚Äôs on the small size but I didn‚Äôt need anything bigger it fits enough food for what he needs.

I use this thermos several times a week in my daughters lunch. I have a 2 year old who does not like cold lunches so this product comes in handy. I love that it comes in a variety of colors and designs. This is the fourth one I‚Äôve added to the collection. It‚Äôs easy to clean and holds up well after many uses. Keeps food warm for several hours, dishwasher safe, and very affordable compared to similar products by other brands. 100% recommend.

There really isn't much to say about this Thermos. It's your basic Thermos, with the usual Thermos ability to keep cold food cold and hot food hot. This particular model has a neat spoon compartment (with folded-up spoon included in the compartment clip) as well. While we don't use the spoon very much, it's neat and seems decently durable. (I'm not sure how one would go about replacing a lost or damaged one, though that may be a consideration at some point...) Clean-up is easy, and if you've had a Thermos before you know the key (for best results) is to clean your Thermos as soon as possible after you get home. There aren't a lot of moving parts besides the inner ring you can pop out and wash. I use a small cleaning brush to get into the top efficiently and have no issues. The spoon compartment is part of the top of the Thermos, and has a pop hinge. Water definitely can get in during cleaning, so you do have to make sure that you rinse that section and dry it thoroughly -- and the spoon, if you keep it in there -- whenever you clean the Thermos.

That all said, I'm really happy with the purchase. It's perfect for a decent-sized lunch entree or soup, and my favorite part is the striking metallic blue color of it, which just makes me feel good to look at. You really can't go wrong with a Thermos-brand insulated food container, and not only did I have no issues purchasing this one, I'm thoroughly pleased with my purchase and will no doubt be buying more in the future.

I was alittle taken back how small it was , I originally got it for my boyfriend for his lunches but it was too small , you can probably fit a cup of something inside the thermos . Keeps your food hot though so defiantly gets the job done . I eat lunch at 3 pm and pack my lunch at 9am and it‚Äôs still warm :)
My kindergartner has been asking me awhile to get him a thermos. So he could take hot lunch when he packs. Great product and he's happy with it.
Perfect for my daughter, it stays hot and cold all day while she goes to school.
I use this for my daughter's lunch box. It keeps things warm for her until lunchtime. I would definitely recommend.

I got this for a couple of uses. One, keeping cheese sauce hot. It's next to impossible to reheat some cheesy sauces, so when I finish cooking them, I pour them into this little thermos. It will keep it at the perfect temperature for several hours. If you want to make hollandaise sauce at lunch time, it will still be hot for serving at dinner! Highly recommend.
Happy with purchase. Recommended.
Keep my grandson food warm for daycare

name: Amazon Basics 1/2-Inch Extra Thick Exercise Yoga Mat
description:
Product Description
Product Description

Amazon Basics 1/2-Inch Extra Thick Exercise Yoga Mat

From the Manufacturer

Amazon Basics

reviews.content:
I love this yoga mat!!

The Amazon Basics 1/2-Inch Extra Thick Exercise Yoga Mat is a high-quality mat that is designed to provide a comfortable and supportive surface for exercise and yoga practice. The mat measures 74 x 24 inches and is made from high-density foam, which provides extra cushioning and support for joints.

One of the things I really like about this mat is its thickness. The 1/2-inch foam provides excellent cushioning and support for the joints, making it a great option for those who have sensitive knees, wrists, or ankles.(My cat loves it LOL) The surface of the mat is also slip-resistant, which helps to prevent injuries and provides a stable foundation for yoga and other exercises.

Another great feature of this product is its durability. The mat is made from high-quality materials that are built to last. The surface is easy to clean and maintain, and the mat does not show signs of wear and tear even after extended use.

The mat is also lightweight(about 2Ibs) and easy to transport. It comes with a carrying strap that makes it easy to take to and from the gym or yoga studio.

Overall, I would definitely recommend the Amazon Basics 1/2-Inch Extra Thick Exercise Yoga Mat to anyone looking for a high-quality, comfortable, and supportive mat for exercise or yoga practice. It's thick, slip-resistant, durable, and easy to transport, making it a great option for those who want to work out or practice yoga at home or on the go.

I have more hits than I do misses with Amazon Basics products. These mats, for the money, far exceeded my expectations. I purchased two of them as inexpensive options for my kids to do yoga with me. Product quality was consistent on both. When I wear my mat out I will gladly look to purchase one of these as a replacement. They roll and unroll nicely. Stay where you put them, and are comfortable to be on. If you're on the fence about quality, don't be. They are great!

Very comfortable mat. Doesn‚Äôt slip and is ready to wipe down. Is long enough for me (5‚Äô 6‚Äù) to lie down flat with space remaining on both ends.

However, I have two dogs that like to get on the ground with me. The instant they stepped on the mat there were puncture marks everywhere they walked. Their nails aren‚Äôt exceptionally long and they weren‚Äôt being rough or jumping, the foam just doesn‚Äôt hold up against pets with nails.

I‚Äôve only had it a couple days, and do I think I‚Äôll keep it because it is very comfortable and I quite like the color. I‚Äôm just sad my pups can‚Äôt yoga with me anymore.

If you have pets who join in your yoga sessions maybe consider getting something a little more rugged. Otherwise it‚Äôs great mat!

This works really well for my outdoor yoga classes that are just on pavement, I used to have a regular yoga mat and had bruises all on my spine and lower back and knees because I don't have much fat or skin there, and this is the perfect solution for me.

I was looking for a yoga mat that doesn't hurt my back when laying down. It was pretty straightforward. It's thick and cheap and did what it is supposed to do. The only knock on this is if it will be durable later on. It seems like it won't hold up for years but short term wise it seems great.

The extra thick padding makes it great to use on any surface, it‚Äôs non slip and extra long! Honestly great purchase, you get exactly what you‚Äôre paying for. And it‚Äôs easy to roll up and stay rolled up.

It's a different material than the yoga mats I've had in the past. More like foam than rubber. I was using two mats and a kneeling pad for my knees.

Pros
It's nice & long.
It's light weight
It's well padded, so I don't need an extra mat or kneeling pad

Cons
It's not as "sticky" as my other mats
It squeaks and stretches a bit during poses
It's a little awkward to fold & roll. Needs to be put in a "confined space" so it doesn't come undone.

I'm new to the yoga game, and I really like this mat because of its thickness and easiness to clean and transport. It has some flexion in it when you use it, because of the things that they have you do on the mat it's very useful. Definitely recommend
Since I'm tall, the mats in the gym are too short (and too thin to be comfortable). This mat is long enough and quite comfortable. So far, it's held up well.
Doing ab workout or weight training on a standard yoga mat wasn't cutting it. This was great for my lower back felt very cushioned and stable. It does speak when I do planks but love this item 10/10

name: TP-Link Deco AX3000 WiFi 6 Mesh System(Deco X55) - Covers up to 6500 Sq.Ft. , Replaces Wireless Router and Extender, 3 Gigabit ports per unit, supports Ethernet Backhaul (3-pack)
description:
Product Description

TP-Link Deco WiFi 6 Mesh System(Deco X55) - AX3000, Covers up to 6500 Sq.Ft., Replaces Wireless Router and Extender, 3 Gigabit ports per unit, supports Ethernet Backhaul (3-pack)


Deco X55 is an upgrade of Deco X20 which has faster WiFi Speeds and more Gigabit Ethernet ports. It is ideal for the users who subscribed up to 1G Internet service.

Industry-Leading Support

TP-Link offers 24/7 technical support and 2-year warranty for most home products,1 more year than most networking brands.


Buy with Confidence

Founded in 1996, TP-Link is a global provider of reliable networking devices and accessories, involved in all aspects of everyday life. With a proven heritage of stability, performance and value, TP-Link has curated a portfolio of products that meet the networking needs of all individuals. Now, as the connected lifestyle continues to evolve,the company is expanding today to exceed the demands of tomorrow.

reviews.content:
I read some slightly negative reviews on here about this product, and it not having some features in the app. Some people were miffed that the advanced security/parental features were a subscription, but that didn't apply to me. Until the time of purchase, I had been using a $60 mesh system from TCL, but the main problem was that the TCL only had 10/100 ports, and we normally have 20-ish devices connected at any given time. Needless to say, the network was very slow.

Once I pulled the trigger on this system (after extensive research to make sure it had GbE ports) I had high hopes for our network. This system was around $185 as opposed to the eero 3pk that ran closer to$250 - $300. I was excited for the Wi-Fi 6 as well.

After unboxing, the instructions were clear on exactly how to set it up, and the Deco app made it very streamlined. Once the first node was configured, all I had to do was plug in and name the other two in the app, and they grabbed their configs automatically from the first node. Wi-Fi, I immediately noticed, was much more snappy, and I don't have a Wi-Fi 6 antenna in my phone. Each node has three total GbE ports on it, and they are self determining, so it doesn't matter which one you plug your internet service into. I was very happy about this, as it gave me the ability to have a dedicated port for each of my two 8-port GbE switches in my network cabinet.

NOTE:
Deco devices do NOT integrate with OneMesh devices, so don't get those two features mixed up. If you have OneMesh-compatible extenders already, then you can get the same mesh-like unified network feeling with a OneMesh-compatible router.

The system supports Ethernet Backhaul, so if your house is already wired up with Cat5e or better, you can plug these directly into your wired network to free up the Wi-Fi signal a bit. I don't have the luxury of a wired-networked house, so the Wi-Fi mesh works just fine for me.

One thing the eero system has that this one doesn't is a dedicated wireless band for the nodes to communicate with each other, so if that is a major deal breaker for you, then this is not the system you're looking for.

Overall, I am very happy with this system so far, and I haven't had problems with TP-Link products, so I hope to use it for years to come!

These can be really quick and easy to configure, but have a decent level of settings which can be adjusted. It has parental controls, simple QoS, ability to block and allow access from certain devices, able to see reports on usage, etc., all in the easy to use app.

There is also a web page you can use to do a lot of the configuration if you prefer that, but the app is super easy to use. It is also pretty cool that the app will let you manage your network remotely if it is connected to the internet, as well as if you are on the wifi directly, you can manage it, even if the network is not on the internet.

Being able to spread these things out and either connect them to each other via wifi or a wired connection, and having a few wired ports on each of them really gives a lot of flexibility to your network.

Want to add some wired connections to a desk, but not run an ethernet cable there? No problem, as long as the wifi signal can reach, just set one of these on that desk and you have three wired connections right there.

Need to extend wifi coverage beyond where it would normally be able to reach? Again, no problem, plug these in to ethernet ports in various places on the network and you have a wireless mesh network that lets you automatically switch between them as you are walking around, all without ever dropping signal.

So I previously had a TP-Link Router and an Extender that supported Mesh. But unfortunately it only supported mesh when the Router was acting in Router mode, I needed just the Access Point functionality. So I had these two pieces of hardware that didn't provide the features I needed, I see that enabling the AP mode for Mesh is a feature requested by users on the TP-Link forum, but who knows if they will ever enable it.
So back to this product. The install couldn't have been easier, not a big fan of having to create an account to use the IOS app, but it is what it is. I am using the wired backhaul feature on one of the units and just regular wifi on the other. I no longer have drops when walking through my house while streaming an app. I am happy with the speeds which vary between 200-300. The app is decent, I can see all the devices and even control my Kasa smarthome switched ect. I was able to set this device up as AP mode with a couple taps on the IOS app and a reboot of the mesh devices.
I now only have one wifi network name, devices that can use 5ghz connect to it as do the 2.4ghz. I have not have any issues as of yet.

25+ years ago, I bought my first home wireless system‚Ä¶it used a dial up modem in the hub and broadcast a few hundred square feet. Setting that up was a memorable process. I have lost count how many routers and wi-fi systems I have used, some easy some hard, so in our lake house I tried out the Deco-Mesh system. It was so easy to set up, so quick was the install that I almost felt cheated. If my grandmother were she still living, she could hook this up‚Ä¶instead of plug and play, it‚Äôs plug in and go to work.
The lake house is built like a bunker into the side of a hill complete with 8‚Äù thick concrete walls and slab. Our old wi-fi worked through the strategic placement of POE range extenders. The overall speed was not great but the service consistent. After installing the deco at the modem, I really didn‚Äôt know if I would need both additional mesh points or more, I really wasn‚Äôt sure if I would need all the POE range extenders. Wow, one unit covered 80% of the house‚Ä¶coverage degraded as you passed into the addition (through the 8‚Äù concrete wall). So I placed a mesh unit near the addition and that was is it. I am putting the last mesh point at the dock and I have coverage everywhere- no hocus pocus, no tech knowledge required.

I liked the system so much that I am getting the XE75 model for our house ditching the much more expensive and much more problematic AmplifiHD mesh system.
the app for the deco products is also easy and informative. Long have I worried about people joining the network without my knowledge - deco provides an alert to my iPhone anytime a ‚Äúnew‚Äù device joins. It is those kinds of features that make the Deco system valuable.
Wi-fi 6 is worth the upgrade, too many people are paying for expensive GB internet when the max throughput of their network hardware is less than a GB. Wi-fi 6 is also smart recognizing the different demands of each attached device. After all, a roku and a light bulb have very different needs. With GB internet, and a network with more 100 devices, my speed tests are consistently above 800 mbs/800 mbs over a wi-fi connection- that is just amazing to me.
So if you are looking to upgrade and not break the bank or throw a ton of money into a system that will be outdated in a few years, I encourage you to give this deck unit a try.

My home is approximately 3000 sq ft with structured wiring for a gigabit ethernet switches and a gigabit connection to the ISP. Prior to buying the Deco I had a nighthawk router. I could get wifi signal to all of the house, but with some difficulty and wifi connection and speed was spotty in some parts of the house. I could've covered the entire house with just two Deco x55 units, but went with three and set them in different corners to make sure I had good wifi in the garage and around the outside of the house as well.

The Deco units are very easy to setup. The app for connecting to them is well designed, easy to use and I can monitor and administer my home network when I'm out of the house. The app has some advanced features that are hidden behind paywalls. All of the features you would commonly need are free and the advanced features are add-ons that you wouldn't normally expect from a wifi router. The wifi coverage is excellent and supports seamless roaming. No more lost connection of slow speed due to weak signals!

For my home I'm using ethernet connections for the wifi backhaul. However, when I tested the units I wasn't able to stress the system enough to tell the difference between using ethernet or wifi bandwidth for the backhaul.

The only negative so far is that I tried to use the main deco unit as traditional router with one port for the WLAN and the other two ports for LAN connections with this deco unit as the root of my network topology. Unfortunately, this set the LAN connection to 100Mb. The app doesn't show the LAN port settings and there aren't any lights, I just noticed that the speed test for all of the hardwired devices were being limited to 100Mb. Changing the network to use a switch as the root of the topology and having a single LAN connection from the deco to the switch fixed the issue.

This product has exceed my expectations. I replaced an existing TP Link router with this product. Install was super easy, with one minor hiccup. When I first set it up, the wireless was working, but wired connections were not. I rebooted the router and my wired devices, and that fixed the issue right away. The phone app is great for keeping track of all connected devices. I like that it lets you rename your device to something that makes sense to you, rather than just whatever the device defaults to.

I've got the router connected to my modem in the northeast corner of the basement. I added a unit to the 2nd floor southwest corner. I am not using the 3rd unit. My connection speeds have improved dramatically over the house. One tip which helped was to set the main wi-fi settings to 5G only. The only issue with that was one device was only 2.4 capable, but I hardwired that, so problem solved.

I am very happy with this purchase and would definitely recommend.

This is an awesome product it connects to the network fast, great range, devices stay connected, I have thirty-seven devices that work all the time, the app is super easy to setup and view the devices that are connected, and the speed is not super but not bad. The bad thing is when you are used to setting up a router by logging into the router it lacks the options of some other routers that I have used before, and the IP address and subnet mask are different from most other brands of routers. I only had one slight hiccup when I setup my wireless printer it took a little while to connect with the static address that I gave it but after setting it up it connected and is rock solid better than when I had a router and Wi-Fi extender. One of my satellites is in my shop about sixty feet from my main house but the master is in the middle of the house, and I can watch streaming video, listen to music on a dot, control my thermostat, lights and a fan and I can do it consistently without any problems.
One other thing that I do not like about it is that it only has three ports which when you connect the modem to one that only leaves two ports for ethernet connections. So, if you are looking for an inexpensive mesh router, I do not think you will go wrong with this TP-Link router.
I have not contacted Tech Support so I cannot say if they are any good.

I bought the Deco X55 3 node mesh system to replace an aged TP Link 1900AC because I felt the signal was weak in areas of my 1200sq ft home. After an easy set-up of Deco X55 and some time for them to find & talk to each other I was already getting good signal but it wasn't the full bandwidth that my carrier was supplying. TP Link says it takes awhile for the system to really mesh & adjust to your usage. By the next day I was getting full band width on downloads & the upload was a little higher than Max according to an internet speed test. i was able to get great reception throughout the house & even got signal across the street. I put 1 in the front of my house & 1 in back linked together with a CAT 6 cable then I have 1 in my bedroom using over the air linkup, basically forming a triangle. I haven't tweaked any settings on the system because it is working for what I need it to do.
I run a PS4, 2 TVs with Roku, 2 tablets, 2 phones, and an Amazon Echo Show with no problems.

Super easy to setup. My home is one level and long, up till now I never have been able to get wifi from my router which is on one end of the house to the other even with wifi extenders and have a good stable connection and enough speed. I also just upgraded my internet with spectrums wifi 6 modem and router, which the router is a dumpster üî• always dropping out. I swapped out spectrums piece of junk with these Deco jobs and put one with the modem, one in my kitchen, and the other in the master bedroom and what a night and day difference it has made. I'm getting almost the same speeds in my bedroom Deco, which is on the opposite end of the house as the one at the modem. Also as you move through the house your device switches from one Deco to the other seamlessly so you always have the best connection possible. I love it, what a great product that does what it says it does!!!

So far this has been a great system. I have about 80 clients on my network in a 2,100 square foot house and then a wired backhaul out to my garage which is about 80@ square foot. Installation with the wires backhauls was a little confusing and unusual (you need to set it all up with no wires all in the same room first before you try to do wired backhauls which is weird to me). The app isn‚Äôt as pretty or intuitive as other offerings but it works and has been reliable which is the most important factor to me. I‚Äôm sure there are many tech people out there to give detailed nerd reviews but as a person that only cares about it working trouble free, it‚Äôs fitting this bill just perfectly

Protip: They make you create an account (which requires internet) before you even set up your internet. So make sure you download the app, and make an account before you take your internet down to install. I have zero cellphone service so I had to drive down the road just to set up my account before it would let me setup my device. This is silly design in installation by Deco but probably doesn‚Äôt impact many people

name: Amazon Basics Narrow Ruled 5 x 8-Inch Lined Writing Note Pads - 6-Pack (50-sheet Pads), Pink, Orchid & Blue Assorted Colors
description:
Product Description
Product Description

Basics Writing Pads, 5" x 8", Narrow Ruled, Pink, Orchid & Blue Paper, 6-Pack

From the Manufacturer

Amazon Basics

reviews.content:
These are what they are an assortment of lined pages perforated at the top. I like them.

THE JUGGLING HAMSTER

I will now tell you how you can save your life if a grizzly bear is chasing you.

SUPPLIES: Several pads of this paper, Amazon brand peanut butter (the others will not work), and you need a quality large chef's piping bag. While running from the bear you need to quickly apply some peanut butter to a piece of paper and throw it to the side. You must keep running no matter how much you are compelled to write on the paper. As everyone already knows grizzly bears can't resist Amazon branded peanut butter (they are smart like you and enjoy reading my reviews too) and if you are fast enough and don't run out of peanut butter or paper your chance of survival increases.

If you are able to get far enough away attempt a quick glance over your shoulder. If you notice the bear sitting down and doing origami you are probably in the clear. Yell, "Thank you for not killing me you magnificent grizzly bear you may have the rest of my cool paper and Amazon peanut butter!" I know it will be hard to part with either of them but drop them, wave happily and RUN. Congratulations on not becoming drizzly bear food. There will be more cool paper in your future just click BUY NOW.

I like that this paper is a tree based product that works well for both writing and drawing and probably doodling as well (I‚Äôm personally not a doodler). It easily accepts multiple writing utensils including both pen and pencil. I‚Äôve also witnessed it handling crayons with no issues when my granddaughters were over. This paper could be used in a variety of settings including home and office and being 50 sheets per pad I‚Äôm confident that you could use a different sheet of paper each day and one pad would last up to 50 days.

I go through a lot of letter pads even though I feel like I'm always on the computer.

I love these pads for "creating" and everyday paper needs. Generally, I recycle these "draft" pages within a week since the info is data entered. I write notes and minutes from meetings on my favorite higher weight paper pads, but they are pricey.

If you are writing on both sides of the page, make sure you have a pen that doesn't bleed through.

I always have one of the pads in reach. They are perfect for so many things.

Nice color, great for tossing into every table stand around our house. I couldn't ever find a pen or paper before now I have paper in every drawer in the house. Now if I could just remember where I put that pen!? LoL I love these super helpful just the right size and the colors help me keep track of what is what.
The multi colored (blue, purple, blue) pads of paper are perfect for notes. The price is right. They are nice because they add a little variety to the ‚Äúdrab‚Äù yellow ones.
I love using these colored notepads. They help me organize the difference between personal, business, and school notes for easy identification, no more mixed notes in one notebook.

I get these on repeat. You get a whole stack of them. So handy to have on my desk (and elsewhere, as they tend to follow me around) to quickly jot down thoughts. (Very often is easier than using my phone for such things).
I like to tear off the used pieces or leave them attached if I need more than one page for a project. The paper is sturdy.

I like the paper. The colors are a little more muted but very nice. I have 3 classes in a row and it‚Äôs great to organize the paper color with the classes. I also really enjoy that they are lined on both sides, a good addition. The cons..... the paper is quite lightweight. As these are used primarily for my own class notes I think they are fine. I always use a pieces of plastic that I have had for years, that I put between the sheet I‚Äôm writing on and the rest of the notepad because otherwise the paper underneath will have impressions on it, which drives me crazy.
Pros- colors keep my classes organized, and lines printed on both sides and cons very very lightweight.
Smooches- caitie xoxo

We got a ton of games this Christmas and I was surprised at how many require scoring but don‚Äôt come with any way to score. I got the half paper size, and they are absolutely perfect. Let the games begin!

name: Amazon Basics 3-Shelf Adjustable, Heavy Duty Storage Shelving Unit (250 lbs loading capacity per shelf), Steel Organizer Wire Rack, Black (23.2L x 13.4W x 30H)
description:
Product Description
Product Description

An Amazon Brand.

From the Manufacturer

Amazon Basics

reviews.content:
I was looking for storage units to create a pantry but everything I found was not the right size or if it was, the shelves were not adjustable. I found this unit and I loved the amount of weight each shelf held but I wanted the shelves to be closer together and I needed 8-10 shelves total. I searched all over the web to see if I can get extra shelves for this unit but didn't find any, so I decided to get 2 units and use whatever shelves I needed for one unit. I figured that most likely I would've paid more than $50 for 3-5 extra shelves, so for $100 I ended up making one awesome pantry. I used just 8 shelves and stored away 2 shelves and remaining poles. (NOTE: each leg is made out of 2 poles that gets screwed on top of each other so you can actually create 2 shorter units out of one unit)
The unit is pretty sturdy but it's a pain in the but to put together by one person. The shelves are held up in place by some plastic pieces that you have to connect and snap together in each corner and then lower the shelf from above on these pieces. The plastic pieces are marked with an arrow and the word TOP. Each pole has markings/indentations 1 inch apart all the way down. You hold 2 plastic piece together and place them around a pole, arrows pointing up, holding them together ABOVE the line on the pole where you want the shelf to end up. Holding the 2 pieces together and by sliding them down they end up in the indention on the pole at the level you want them to be. When they end up on the indention you'll hear a click and that's how you'll know they are locked together in the right place. Count to see on which indention you are on that pole and place the other pieces at the same level on the other 3 poles. Now, 2 things you have to know about these plastic pieces:
1. They would not close together fully, meaning you might see a bit of a space between them.
2. They stay put but when you lower the shelf you will have to hold each one in place and guide each corner of shelf's hole over them because if you don't do that and you hit one of pieces with the shelf they would snap open and you'll have to remove the shelf and connect the piece that disconnected from the pole. It would've been better if the plastic pieces were open only in one side and closing fully when snapped together. What I ended up doing was placing a piece of tape on one side of the plastic pieces (making one side like a door hinge) which made it easier for me to put the shelves over them. If I was hitting one corner by mistake the pieces would not snap off and fall down completely but stay on the pole giving me a chance to close them pretty quickly without having to remove the shelf anymore. At first I put tape all the way around the pieces but the tape was adding thickness to the pieces and they wouldn't fit in the shelves' holes. So, I tried tape only on one side and that worked. After all shelf's corners are places over the pieces, you will have to push down on the shelf, at the same time on all 4 corners to lock the shelf in place evenly.
So, with all that said, the units are pretty nice. The plastic pieces need some design improvement. If they were designed better this unit would've been a breeze to put together.
One thing I have to mention. I had room for a 46" or 48" W unit but that size unit was too deep for my space (I needed 12"-14"D unit and the 48"W they sell on Amazon is 18"-20"D). So I ended up buy this 36" W unit even though I was not using 10-12 inches of my space where I was planning to place the pantry. I made plans how to arrange baskets on each shelf based on the listed measurements. A lot of planning went into this since I had to consider how many baskets I needed and how much that would cost, finding the right size baskets etc, etc. Only after I ensemble the entire unit I found out that the 3 baskets I initially wanted to place side by side on each shelf would not fit and I was baffled not knowing why that would be.... Well, the unit is 36" W, meaning the shelves are 36" W but because the ploles are designed to be part of the shelves they take up about 3" of the shelf. From one pole to the other you have 33" width and because of that I couldn't use the baskets I needed to use and had to rethink the entire pantry, cost, sizes of items etc. Because of this unforeseen issue I lost a bit of space in the spot where I placed the unit (keep in mind that I could've used a much wider shelving unit to begin with) and I'm bumped about not using the space to the max as initially intended. I wish I knew about these details about the measurements before I made my decision to purchase this unit. The measurements were a very important part of my decision to purchase these units and they were not an easy item to ensemble and dissemble to send back to Amazon. Although my pantry turn up nice, I had a lot of headaches rearrange everything just because of the unknown measurements.
After founding out that the shelves were not as wide as I expected them to be, I couldn't find baskets to fit so I ended up using Flat Rate shipping boxes from USPS (which are free, you can order them online or pick them up at a local USPS location) that I had to cut to size and covered in shelf/drawer lining. Not fun at all :(
I would recommend this unit for it's sturdiness and price but buyer beware: you will have to spend some time putting it together if you don't have a 2nd person to help you. And, I hope you read my review if you're planning to use the the unit in a specific way where the exact measurements are a must to know before hand.
I finished my pantry by covering the back and sides with a stiff plastic shower curtain, and with a fabric shower curtain for the front part.
Another thing I need to mention is that if you need to slide something on the shelf back and forth (like I wanted, a box to be pulled out and put back) the shelf's front is a bit higher and the item on the shelf will sit a bit lower and the edge will have a bit of a "lip" so you'll have to lift the item up a little at the edge to get the item over the "lip". I didn't like that, so in order to make the shelf smooth front to back, I came up with the idea to put cardboard on the shelf but a bit smaller than the shelf so the thickness of the cardboard when sitting on the shelf away from "lip" will come up at the same height with the lip, thus making the shelf same level from front to back. I needed 8 cardboard pieces long enough and very inexpensive. I bought 2 moving boxes 18"x18"x16" from Menards ( about $5 with tax for both) and cut them lengthwise in 8 pieces. They were the perfect fit. To make sure the cardboard didn't move when pulling my boxes out, I taped the cardboard in each corner from underneath. Problem solved and it came out nice. I hope all this info might help someone who wants to use this unit for a pantry.
Pictures:
1. How the unit looks with the cardboard on each shelf
2. Work in progress, how the flat rate boxes look after I cut them to the size I needed to be
3. How the unit looks from the back with the plastic shower curtain covering the back and sides
4. How everything looks and how the unit looks like with 8 shelves on it
5. I ended up finding some baskets that were perfect fit and blended well with the flat rate boxes. I didn't like the baskets' colors much but I had no choice, I made them work :)
6. How the flat rate boxes looked like after covering them in shelf/drawer lining I got at Dollar Tree store and label them too :) Also, on the shelf with the 2 green baskets, in the back of the shelf I used a lazy susan I had before to be able to easily access my tomato paste cans.
7. Final product. Front covered with fabric shower curtain that's easy to pull up to one side (see picture #4 to see how it seats on left upper corner). On top of the unit I places 3 foldable rectangular boxes (from Menards $6 ea) that I'll use for very light items (toilet paper, paper towels, napkins etc). To make sure all weight is distributed ok and unit stays in place first I made sure feet were leveled properly (the unit had screws at the bottom of each foot so you screw and unscrew each feet to level it properly to an uneven floor). Second, I secured the unit with velcro and plastic cable ties to the railing thats on the back of the unit (the unit comes with ties to secure it to walls but I used my own ties)
Third, I placed my heavy items on the lower shelves (cans, sugar, flour, oil etc). And lastly, I placed my light items (mixed in with some light weight ones) on the upper shelves and the top one.
8. I needed more light so I found this light that has a magnet on the bottom and a hook to hang anywhere. I can move it on any shelf, (standing up, sideways, etc) and have my hands free when I pull out a box/basket etc. It's awesome. I know, too much info, sorry :)

I bought this shelf to fit inside the cabinet opening left by the demise of our short-lived dishwasher so I could store cleaning supplies in the space (rather than just have them on the floor in baskets).

It was very easy to assemble. You need to make sure the tiny ridge inside each black support piece lines up with the appropriate groove in the leg you are clipping it to, but once you do that you're good.

It was advertised as "heavy duty". I would not personally call it that, based on the gauge of the wire used for the shelving. I'd say more medium-to-heavy duty, as you cannot load these shelves very heavily or they WILL bend and sag.

This makes storing some of the jumbo bottles of Pine-Sol and Murphy's Oil Soap awkward, but I placed them at the outer edges where part of the weight is supported by the rim around the shelf. I think the weigh per shelf is about 35 lbs. max, if I remember correctly, so most of the big bottles ended up sitting on the floor in front of this unit--but that's fine.

This unit fit the opening very well (I went by the given measurements compared to dimensions of my cabinet opening) and really did what I wanted it to do. If it had been slightly sturdier, even better--but I am not unhappy with what I got.

This review is for the Amazon Basics 4-shelf adjustable, heavy-duty storage shelving. After the usual scan of different shelving units, I purchased this one to organize the garage. The weight capacity per shelf suits my needs and the buyer comments were above average. There is an excellent video to show how easy it is to assemble. I highly recommend watching the video. I was able to assemble by myself in no time. The two most important tips were to unpack and sort the parts. The second tip is to make sure you understand that there is a top and bottom on the clips. Count the grooves on each pole so your shelf is level, the clips will "click" into the groove you choose. If the clip doesn't slide you are good. The shelf will slip over the clip and it will hold in place. It arrived with minor dings in the cardboard packaging but no damage to the contents and all parts received. After being satisfied with everything, I purchased another 4-shelf unit (no casters) and two 4-shelf units with casters.

I'm very pleased with this rack and was able to put it together by myself, although a helping hand in the beginning would have been helpful. There are 8 poles, 2 of which screw into each other to make one, tall pole (therefore a total of 4 poles.) When the poles are initially placed in the holes of the shelf placed on the bottom, it's awkward to stand up the entire rack without a pole falling out. But on my second attempt I did it!
As others have advised, watch how you place each shelf on the poles as there is a correct way...with the lip around the sides facing down. This way the rack slides down over the slightly tapered clips (which clip onto the poles wherever you decide you want the height to be) and this gives each shelf stability. Just don't place clip near where the 2 poles are joined together (as advised). I also cut up part of the cardboard box to match the shape of the shelf to use as a "liner" so that small items don't fall through the slats.
It's a very nice shelving unit.

This fits perfectly in my laundry room. I bought two to go on both sides of machine. I needed it for laundry detergents and such. I do have top shelves for that, but I am short and instead of always using a foot stool or reaching for my products they would sit on machines. I hated that because I like order and neatness and I did not with time have machines get rusty.

Anyway, the assembly it took a good 10 to 15 minutes because the directions are not made simple enough to understand. So, I had to try to figure it out as I went along. It is quite easy once you get it together, but those directions threw my mind for a loop.

Now as I write this, I noticed the photo and see that the shelves are supposed to fit over the black clips. lol So, for those who are thinking of purchasing this. If you should, make sure not to let the black clips confuse you if they don't click together all the way. Also, make sure the shelves are pushed down on the clips and make sure the shelves are flat at the top of shelving as shown in photo because if not it will be unstable. I found that out when I wondered why I put together one and the last one was wobbly. The shelving was upside down. lol
Other than that, I now have an organized laundry room. It's like breathing fresh air. :-)

I like the shelves, only 14x36" (I prefer 18x36") but as it happens they fit my space a little better. I'd have preferred 18x36" for the same price (paid $40@ for 18x36" back in 2018 but those days are gone). I considered these mid-strength as the shelf wires run side-to-side. High-strength the wires run front-back, weigh more, and cost more (you can compare on Amazon or elsewhere).

I'm planning to replace the adjustable feet with casters, which I've done with the 18x36" shelves. Went to HD with one foot and used their nut-and-bolt gauges. In this case, the support is 3/8"-16 (coarse thread) x 1" long (see photos). No guarantee every one is the same, so worth checking. Threaded-stem casters should cost about $15-$20 for a set of 4 on Amazon.

I may have an addiction to these 'Amazon Basics' shelving units, I just bought my 6th one! I started with the butcher's block/microwave cart unit and was thrilled with it. Then I discovered the tall 5-shelf unit and bought one. I liked that so much I bought 2 more of the tall ones. Then I bought this short 3-shelf unit on Prime Day and got so excited about it that I went back and ordered a second before the sale was over.

So let's get the assembly "controversy" out of the way. I won't attempt detailed directions here, but I hope you'll trust me when I say these really are incredibly easy to assemble. And they're perfectly stable and sturdy once assembled. Any review that says these are crazy difficult, or "won't stay together" or that they "wobble" etc have all assembled them incorrectly. Please consider that I have bought SIX of these now, I'm a pro. I can assemble these small ones in about 8-10 minutes leisurely, and the tall 5-shelf ones in about 15 minutes each - and that includes time for me to ponder ideal shelf placement! That's at a relaxed pace and there is zero frustration. Now, I will admit that I was initially perplexed on my very first unit for a few minutes as I fumbled around with the black connectors trying to make sense of them. I too thought "this thing is junk" until I realized I was not realizing how they work. Once I understood the simplicity of it, the rest all flew together with ease and are actually fun to assemble. I could quite literally assemble these with my eyes closed at this point.

Watch the videos which should help. But generally: the connectors come in 2 halves that fit together around the pole. Be sure to look for the arrow pointing up so you have them upright. Also look INSIDE for the little ridge lines, this is super helpful. Those lines line up with the single lines on the chrome pole. I actually place them just above the chrome pole line and slide them down until I hear/feel them click into place. The two halves fit together but with a slight GAP. Meaning that they do not close together entirely. They stay in place but will look slightly separated - this is normal! Do not try to force them to fit together tightly, they aren't intended to. When you push the shelf (lightly, there's no need to force it) down over the black connectors, it wedges them closed a bit more. This is by design so that the shelves aren't loose and popping up; they stay in place nicely.

Also keep in mind that the black coin-like caps in the box are packing scrap and can be tossed out or repurposed but are not parts for the unit. Lastly, the edging on the shelf goes DOWN. They are NOT lips to hold things on the shelf. You might be able to make it work that way, but it's not meant to be that way. Just know that if you're having a hard time with any part of putting these together, you're doing it wrong. I can assure you, I live alone and have no one around to give me a hand, so I would never buy SIX of these units unless they were super easy to assemble, because I am not a very patient person.

These are stable, strong, hold a ton of weight and are extremely versatile, which is why I love them so much. They go with just about any decor style. I have two of the tall units as pantry shelving and a third tall unit in my art studio. I came up with a creative way to use these small 3-shelf ones by putting a 6 foot x 18" piece of plywood over two of them (one at each end with a space in the center) which serves as a sideboard/counter and/or deskpace area in my rustic kitchen where I can roll out bread dough or sit down to pull up recipes on my laptop, etc with baking supplies on the shelves underneath. The leveling feet are handy too. My ONLY complaint is that the prices on these fluctuates dramatically, so I tend to wait and snag one when I see them on sale. I'm considering getting one for the bathroom (towels etc) and maybe even one for off-season clothes storage. They look so classy and nice and the storage and organization they offer is fantastic. These units are some of the best things I've ever purchased on Amazon actually.

This is probably the best shelving unit I've ever purchased. It was packaged very well. Everything was protected so that no damage could occur. It came with not only the 4 inch wheels but also adjustable feet if you didn't want to use wheels. The steal was very strong. The posts screw into one another instead of just pushing them in like most units. The finish was excellent. The design and engineering is outstanding. Assembly was a breeze. Took about 20 minutes with no tools. I would recommend buying the gorilla grip shelf liners which fit this perfectly. All in all I would highly recommend this product. It's a bargain at this price. I plan to buy more units.

Purchased one of these originally and found it to be very sturdy and that was what I had hoped for. I bought a so called plastic 5 tier TOUGH shelf from Walmart and it was rated for 50 lbs per shelf. After a few months, with only about 20 lbs on the shelf, there was severe sag and I was really disappointed with that product. i wanted to replace it with a heavy wire metal unit so I came across this one at only about 10 dollars more. It took about 30 minutes to assemble it the first time and I had to learn that the plastic clips that positioned each shelf had a special 'click" to it be be sure it was secure. I mismatched the position of the clips a couple times and had to redo that corner but one I got the hand of it, it went smoothly. I really like how sturdy it is and it can hold at least the weight that it lists. Looks good too in chrome. It also was large enough since I wanted shelves that were closer to 30 inches wide. So this unit fit the criteria as I had hoped and am very pleased with it. I searched again for something like it a month later to fill another area with shelving in the garage. There was nothing else wide enough in the same design, sturdiness, and width in comparison to this one. SO, I bought another one and I am very happy with these units. If I were to buy another, the only change would be if they had a lower price but this was the only option worth considering for me.

These are very easy to set up Ive set up and taken them down a few times for my dad who uses them to hold some really heavy stuff and looking at some of the other reviews Id like to say a few things in hopes this will help someone

They can hold a lot of weight I got it on Sept 27th 2022 and have had fish tanks set up and running on it since the day I got it... I will edit this review in the event that this ever does break but I highly doubt that will happen so if youre seeing this review its good and has been set up with no problems to this day since the date listed above

I saw some about how the things you put together are plastic and they should be some different material but my dad has other shelf racks that also have the plastic peices and thats because the "thin plastic" goes sideways so its the thickness of the side vertically holding the shelves not the thin part the way they designed it can actually hold a lot of weight and the shelves that go on top lock on airtight in a way that the plastic parts wont be moving anyway so its pretty secure Im pretty sure almost all if not all of these shelf racks have plastic bands Ive not seen one with a differnt material for them and my dad is perfectly fine putting loads of weight on these

You can use the indented rings around the legs to count how high youre putting each plastic bit up and make sure youre getting them all at the same height and around every 8th dent is a second indented ring to help you count without losing track I havent seen any complaints about not knowing how to do this but if you didnt know now you know

Theres a lot of people saying the design "has no way of holding that much weight" I have a 20 long paladarium on the top of mine and have had it set up for a few months now and it has a 10 and a 6 gallon on one row then a 10 on the lowest row so yes it can hold lots of weight fishtanks are heavy cuz of all the substrate and paladariums are heavier it has loads of substrate and water and I had to use lots of petrified rock for it too so I can confidently tell you itll hold whatever you wanted to put on it too

name: Brita Standard Water Filter Replacements for Pitchers and Dispensers, Lasts 2 Months, Reduces Chlorine Taste and Odor, 3 Count
description:
Product Description
Product Description

Keep tap water healthier and tasting better when you regularly change your Brita replacement filter. Made to fit all Brita pitchers and dispensers, this replacement filter reduces copper, mercury and cadmium impurities that can adversely affect your health over time, while cutting chlorine taste and odor to deliver great tasting water. Designed to leave no black flecks in your water and with no pre-soak required, the Brita filters are quick and easy to use. Change your Brita filters every 40 gallons or approximately 2 months for best performance. Start drinking healthier, great tasting water with Brita today.

Amazon.com

Brita Pitcher Replacement Filters are universally compatible with all Brita pitchers, including the compact Brita Slim Pitcher. Featuring a unique design that reduces the potentially harmful impurities and unpleasant flavors found in tap water, these filters offer you the nourishment of healthy, great tasting water with every glass. By using Brita Filters, which are now recyclable, you support the environment by cutting down on bottled water waste.

are also available in:

Brita filters optimize your drinking water to be healthy and great tasting every time.

Each Brita filter helps reduce waste by substituting for an estimated 300 water bottles. Enhance the Quality of Your Drinking Water
Brita Filters provide you the natural benefits of water by cutting down on unwanted substances. Specially engineered with an Ion Exchange Resin, these filters grab hold of impurities found in tap water like lead, copper, mercury, cadmium, and zinc to reduce their presence in your drinking water. The taste and odor of chlorine is decreased with a sponge-like filtration system, giving your water a clean, fresh taste every time.

Refresh Your Body and Mind
The health benefits of water are wide-ranging. Water helps keep your skin glowing, your mind working, and your body moving by aiding in metabolism, detoxification, and the transport of nutrients to all organs. Brita appreciates the importance of water to human wellbeing and has created products that enhance the quality of your drinking water so you get the nourishment you need in a fresh, healthful way.

Brita Filters should be changed every 40 gallons or two months and are not intended for use with microbiologically unsafe water.

Reduce Waste and Help the Environment
Using Brita filters is an effective way to reduce waste. Each filter equals about 300 water bottles, many of which end up in landfills. Even better, Brita filters can now be recycled thanks to Preserve's Gimme 5 Program.

Brita Pitcher Replacement Filters are universally compatible with all Brita Pitchers, including the Aqualux, Atlantis, Classic, Chrome, Deluxe, Grand, Riviera, Slim, and Space Saver pitcher models.

About The Brita Products Company
The Brita Products Company is a leader in the production of freestanding water-filtration systems designed to improve the quality of drinking water by reducing its impurities. Heinz Hankammer, the company's creator, realized the need for enhancing the healthfulness and taste of potable water in 1966. He and his family first accomplished this goal under a pear tree in the family garden and have been working to carry out their mission ever since. The company is named after Heinz Hankhammer's daughter, Brita. As a corporation, Brita is committed to community and environmental outreach through projects like FilterForGood.com, a campaign dedicated to the reduction of bottled water waste.

What's in the Box
3-pack Brita Replacement Filters


See more

reviews.content: I bought these replacement filters for our Brita pitcher. I normally purchase the long last filters. With the recent price increase for just one long last filter, I thought we could try the standard this time. I received 4 standard filters for less than the price of one long last. At first the filter had the the water tasting like it had a little chlorine but that soon resolved after a couple more refills. We are at week 4 after about 2 gallons a day (we go through alot of water) the filter is still properly working, draining and the water still tastes great. If the other 3 filters work out like the first, we will probably switch to standard filters!

I wish that there was a way to make these filters last longer because it‚Äôs one of those things that can be easily forgotten about.

The 4 pack is the way to go especially if you use your Brita‚Äôs a lot. I drink practically a whole Brita a day, so these filter‚Äôs definitely get their wear. Don‚Äôt know how i‚Äôve managed to do this twice now but once the filter goes bad I seemingly never had replacements directly on hand.

If you‚Äôre like me, just buy the 4 pack lol.
I use the water pitcher for my coffee maker & dog water. The Britta cartridges drain quickly so that I'm able to fill the pitcher. Generic ones like Great Value drain way too üêå slowly.

There was an after taste from my old filter from the original unit. I replaced it with the new filter and that taste was gone.

I live in an area where water is sourced from underground ground aquifer and there is an oder and taste that makes me buy the expensive spring water for drinking and cooking. With the Britta filter I need to buy less spring water because the smell and after taste is gone.
I only use the real Brita filters. I've tried others and none even came close to the quality of Brita. I definitely would recommend.

The old filter was very old and not filtering very good. It would take a long time to get water through it. Now with the new filter the water comes through nice and clear and no after taste. Just what the pitcher needed!
Always a good product for my Brita pitcher; it filters the chlorine taste out of my water perfectly.
I've been using Brita filters for years. It's convenient to order online for delivery!

I love these but definitely make sure you are consistent with changing them out. I waited a few months too long by accident and my water got super moldy after a day! looked inside the filter and it was covered in so much mold so definitely be careful!

I started to compare water pitcher filters by trying several different brands. Brita was the 2nd brand I tried and I no longer desire to try another. I am not able to filter the maximum limit of 40 gallons. That is not a statement against Brita - it's a comment on our local water supply üòí.

reviews.content:
I was using "Who gives a Crap" toilet paper but when they jacked the price even higher it just didn't make sense for my family. We have two people who work from home all 100% of the time now so we are providing all our daily TP. I still wanted something that wasn't wrapped in plastic to reduce waste. Luckily I found this and it has been such a great switch. While it is not Charmin or anything super plushy (which I found seems to leave tp particles behind) it is decent tp (2ply still kinda thin though but so many sheets on a roll) if you want an example think of the kind of toilet paper you have to use at a normal business or the doctors office.

Great price, low waste, and gets shipped to your door. I will be buying this again.

Unfortunately my first order never arrived because the shipping label was not properly put on the box. It came loose and stuck to another large box (probably happened in delivery truck) I received a large box instead with a suitcase in it.
Amazon refunded my first order and sent me another box. The second box also did not have the label properly applied. Someone is not peeling the entire back off the label sticker so only the edges of the label are sticking and it‚Äôs not enough to hold it to the box. Be aware your toilet paper may not arrive because of that. Someone who ships the box has not been told to peel off the entire back of the sticker.
Other than that I‚Äôm pleased with the product. The toilet paper is great.

The quality of this toilet paper was exactly what I expected. It is fine for my wife and I. The price is great for 80 rolls. Some other companies toilet paper may be softer, thicker, however, I have found that one tends to use too much because of this. The Scott paper is safer for septic systems and easier to store in our bathroom cabinet. I figured out that this box should last us approximately 4-5 months. We will probably buy again.

It is a huge supply. The quality of absorption due to the quilting allows to absorb more area of the surface than thicker types. I believe it is the perfect recycled toilet paper product. Use with a spray bottle of filtered water and a little peroxide for a cheaper wipe.

I have been looking for everyday items we use to buy in bulk that is cheaper and reduces wastes coming out of our house. I'm glad I bought this product. We use scott's anyways and now we're stocked for months.

Received my last order on july 30th, 2022. Today is February 2nd, 2023 and my family of 4 and plenty of visitors only have used less than a half of the quantity of rolls that we received almost 7months ago. The quality is good and rolls are about average size. Will 100% recommend to anyone trying to save and stock up.
I love ordering this amount of tp! It last me about 5 months! It‚Äôs perfect. Way cheaper than buy it by the roll here in stores. Saves me so much money and trouble.
I use this product for hard to get to areas
The price was phenomenal for such a huge amount of product. However, it doesn't absorbs as much. Like thinner kind of tissue? It still have a ton of value for your money though.

I bought an inexpensive TP at grocery store. It ended up only being 'Single' ply = terrible. This purchase is 'Double' ply. It may not have lotions and scents but is just fine for daily use. It will be my go-to product.

reviews.content: I got this as a mini gift for my niece and it was a great gift as she loved it!! I love the fact the my daughter's were able to put do it themselves. They designed the garden and decorated it. I didn't like that if you don't let it get air it will start to form mole. But overall I loved this product.

Got these to add to Christmas gifts and they were such a hit! The chia seeds grow so quickly, littles will get a kick out of their handiwork! The set is so easy to set up. Comes with a small water nozzle that‚Äôs easy for the kids to squirt water into the terrarium. We live in a rather humid area, so you can see the condensation build up quickly. It‚Äôs a great, fun gift, but also a great science experiment and it‚Äôs self contained, so you don‚Äôt have to worry about knocking it over and spilling or bugs. Great value for less than $10!
My great granddaughter loves it.

This was a Christmas gift for my daughter. She‚Äôs almost 4 and loves growing plants/flowers. She had so much fun putting this together and watching it grow so far. It only took 2 days for them to sprout and this is what they look like after only about 4-5 days. Only complaint is that the sticks on the shell and tail are a little long and don‚Äôt stay in place very well as you can see. They shift a lot.

My 6 year old absolutely loved this. He was so excited to create it and the chia seeds grew so fast! Within 2 days they sprouted and he loved seeing that progress. Had to throw it out because the chia seeds got so massive and became moldy but we didn‚Äôt maintain them ethier. Will buy agian in the future!

I got this for my niece for Christmas. The plants grew quickly, but died just as quick, even following all the instructions. The lid came cracked, so I was disappointed with that too. However, she still loved it and is planting more seeds, since it came with a lot!

description:
Product Description

Resistance Bands - 5 Loop Fitness Bands Set - Loop Exercise Resistance Bands - Exercise Bands For Legs And Arms - Carry Bag


Are you ready for the most versatile, results producing workout bands on the market?

These bands are ideal for
- Sports
- Fitness
- Injury rehabilitation
- body shaping
- weight loss
- physical therapy


How do our bands differ?

First, our bands are made of high quality latex (not rubber bands which are much cheaper and tend to break easily). They are stronger and able to stretch further. You will feel the same resistance after a dozen reps.

These bands are made of latex, not materials such as Thermoplastic Elastomer (TPE) - TPE materials cost 40% less, are not gentle to skin and much less durable.

Second, our bands are comfortable, soft and easy on the skin. The only way to achieve that is to let the latex rest for a long time in tightly controlled circumstances such as temperature and humidity before making the bands.

Both of these involve a higher investment for us but we think it's worth it to create a better product.


What makes our resistance bands special?

These bands are rigorously tested to be snap, stretch and sweat resistant.

You get 5 resistance bands set and you can combine multiple bands to find your ideal resistance.

These bands are so lightweight that they make a great travel fitness kit!

This is also a great Christmas, Mother's and Father's day gift idea for men, women, dad or mom.

reviews.content: The bands are exactly what they say they are, easy to use, different tensions, easy to carry with you on the go. The colors and wording make it easy to use and the black one, the strongest tension, is just that! I just got them so I'm not sure how long they'll last as I put them through the ringer, so to speak, but hopefully they'll be well worth their money.

I bought these to continue with some exercises that I had been doing in physical therapy. They won't take the place of heavy gym equipment or free weights for doing exercises like squats or bench presses, but they are very helpful for targeting smaller but very important muscles like the shoulder and hip internal and external rotators.

I need these bands to use on my legs, just above the knee for glut exercises. Self-tie bands wear and start to roll over and cut into my legs which is why I tried these bands. They're working great so far -- no rolling over. My only concern is that because they aren't wider, I think they might too also start to roll up after they've been used awhile, but so far, so good. Not complaining yet!

I was very pleased when I saw that each band was color coded according to strength as well as marked, extra light, light, medium, etc. making them easy to use. There are also references to Youtube Simply Fit videos to help you learn the various exercises as well as a card included with many exercises shown.

I ordered this item at about midnight and it arrived about dinner time the same day. It is exactly as advertised. I was hoping it would include a miniature trainer who would remind me each day to use the bands and who would oversee my training, infusing me with positivity at every turn. I looked everywhere in the box for one, and even turned the cute little carrying bag inside out - but no personal trainer. In defense of the manufacturer and Amazon, the product description did not include a personal trainer. Other than that, I love these bands.

These bands are exactly what I was looking for. I was dealing with IT band problems and looked up exercise# that required these bands. The light band took care of my issue. I‚Äôm glad to have the various band for future use.

EXCELLENT! I am instructing a chair aerobics class and these bands were an awesome teaching tool for everyone in the class. They could pick their level of stretch band strength. I have been using them for a month and working very well. Thanks You!

It's more a problem of the Item Description, but unless you are going to use it exactly as shown in the photos, be aware that it may not work for you. Also be aware of the fact that there are two sizes mentioned 9n the description, and get the size you need.

I looked at many bands before deciding to buy this one. I have been using these bands for a month now to do my physical therapy at home and I love it. It has good quality, the packaging is good, and they are exactly like what I use in my physical therapy sessions. The product is affordable and a good one-time investment.
Nice compact set, I really like them for a floor, wall, and chair workout, but standing works too. I like that there is 5 different tensions.

Not only does the Proctor Silex Single Burner Cooktop heat up quickly with 1200 watts it provides a range of heating options from high to warm for maximum cooking and serving versatility It's perfect for quickly boiling water for tea or pour-over coffee and it's ideal anywhere you need extra cooking space or a place to keep food warm until serving time Since it's portable and compact it's easy to move from place to place and even easier to store Whether you need an extra burner for holiday cooking are doing home renovations or plan to go camping the Proctor Silex Single Burner Cooktop gives you all the cooking convenience you need It works with all types of cookware and since the coil is hinged you can lift it up to quickly wipe spills from the plate underneath Convenient nonslip rubber feet grip surfaces and your kitchen countertop to help prevent sliding and the power indicator light lets you know when the cooktop is plugged in and ready to use.

reviews.content: I was so disappointed when I took this out of the box. I needed it to boil water for a science project in my classroom and I was sure it wouldn‚Äôt get hot enough. Well, it definitely got hot enough. I was able to boil water quickly.

I got this to help me cook while my kitchen was being remodeled. It can't replace a stove top but it has been a great help to me. If I need to boil water, I typically start it in an electric kettle and then add it to a pot on this burner. I have able to use large skillets on it (8 and 10") successfully. I don't understand the temperature controls very well - I just use it at full strength nearly always. But I think it's a great device if you don't have access to a full kitchen.
It heat up a pot real quick cook my food on time fry my chicken crispy

Did what it needed to - plugged in and heated quickly. At the highest dial setting ( settings are not marked it's a dial that turns from off to high) but at high setting it quickly boiled water. The burner size seems sufficient and it seems level. I plan to use it only when traveling to hotels without full kitchens so it won't get regular use. The materials feel cheap and lightweight (light weight is a plus for travel) but I fear it might be a reflection of quality and longevity so time will tell.
This hot plate works very well and heats up quickly. I use it to warm up my lunch at work in a cast iron skillet. I can fry a sandwich in under 5 minutes.

This was awesome for the past holidays when I needed to be out of the way but cooking. Also my new house has had and it's hard for to Guage cooking time for some things on it. This has been perfect for me. I felt like my old self again. It cooked just like a stove top. Great product!!
Es practica, liviana y super efectiva para viajar y estadias cortas

Love the convenience to move the product where
there is an outlet.

The only minor downsides are that the burning elements were a little smaller in overall diameter than i was expecting, which is not a deal breaker since I purchased it for the higher number if spirals in the coil, and that the element itself was not completely flat so that a small portion of the element was not touching the bottom of the pan. The element itself appears to be of a thicker build though so I expect excellent longevity out of these burners. I purchased them as back-ups in case of emergency and for portable use. I noticed they boiled a pan of water very quickly. Good, solid product.

I use this thing when I'm at work sometimes so can make my food fresh instead of it sitting in the fridge already cooked for several hours. I've cooked steak with this thing and can get it to a perfect medium rare with a good sear on the outside with very little smoking. I rather use this thing than the stove at my apartment.
