name: TERRO T2502 Ready-to-Use Indoor Fruit Fly Trap with Built in Window - 2 Traps + 90 day Lure Supply
description:
Product Description

90 day lure supply : each trap lasts for up to 45 days.

reviews.content:
I have intermittent issues with fruit flies, though never what I would call a huge amount at one time. Finding the right spot to place the traps involves some trial and error, but once I've got it, the fruit flies dive right in. So, for my specific needs, this works well. Also, when I bought this, it was part of deal with some other items that I needed, so that made this already cheap item even cheaper.

That said, know that what you're really buying here are the plastic containers. There's nothing magical about the liquid; it's just water with some vinegar and a touch of sodium laurel sulfate. A web search will likely return hits for mixtures you can make with stuff you probably already have at home.

I'm glad to have the little plastic containers because I don't have anything else in my small apartment that would work as well for the spaces where I want to use them, and I don't mind mixing up my own liquid for the bait. If you're not sure if this will work for you, you might try experimenting with some of the bait recipes you find online before ordering these traps.

These are convenient, and the plastic portions can be reused by filling it with more liquid bait. Apple cider vinegar with a drop of Dawn dish soap works perfectly. The included bait smells like ACV, so it may be similar to the homemade version.
The only thing I didn‚Äôt, like was the liquid that goes into the traps. It was a very small amount about the size of the eyedrop bottle, but it still works very well with the fruit flies

As someone who has constant fruit fly issues this thing actually works! Can‚Äôt say it gets rid of 100% of fruit flies (because what does) but it catches soo many. If you run out of the liquid it comes with just will it with apple cider vinegar and it‚Äôs the same thing. Wish it was a little more aesthetically pleasing but I‚Äôll take it.

The liquid that goes inside of the trap is putrid! As long as you don‚Äôt do what I did and spill it all over, you should be fine. You don‚Äôt really smell it once you have filled it and set the trap in its designated location (unless your holding it to your face huffing it, I don‚Äôt know why anyone would do that but - think of the world we live in today. Someone out there would definitely do that) we had all these fruit flies show up at once and these traps took care of almost all of them within a week. There were a few lone rangers that managed to resist the stench, but we have refilled and they should be gone soon also. You just fill the trap, sit it aside and that‚Äôs it. Easy peasy. I would use these again if those pesky fruit flies come back. I don‚Äôt know why this review asked me to star rate the adhesion‚Ä¶ there is no adhesion on the product. Just ignore that part if you see it in my star ratings.

There are a number of different varieties of tiny flies & gnats that infest kitchens & are attracted to fruit. Some are attracted to these traps. Others will flock to the scent but get caught on sticky pads better. This is why some reviews say they work & others don't. For best results get both traps & sticky pads, whether you buy separately or in a set. That will give you success with all "fruit flies".

I had large number of tiny but very intrusive fruit flies before I finally ordered these traps plus a set of sticky pads. I used both together. For my situation, these traps only got a few flies each but they were instrumental in drawing the flies to the area to get stuck on the sticky pads (bought separately). It just depends on which variety of flies you have, but using both traps & pads will work for all types. My infestation was gone in about a week.
This product worked so I am pleased.

Bought this item for my son's home because they could not get rid of these little insects in the summer. We tried all of the YouTube recommendations and still could not get rid of those pesky bugs. This item was a game changer and eliminated them almost immediately. I would highly recommend this item.
They work but doesn‚Äôt attract them well enough to get them all

These fruit fly traps work decently for what it's worth, I usually bait them with a bit of red wine or apple juice and change it out every few days to prevent molding.

Catch rate will vary depending on whatever liquid you've got in there and how many fruit flies there are, but all in all these really help in clearing out swarm especially if you've cleared up any other sources of food that they might have been nesting on such as bits of food remaining within the garbage disposal unit.

To clean the unit just add a splash of water and then dump out the flies that were in the trap into the toilet, afterwards run it underneath some hot water with maybe a drop of dish soap and rinse it out for a few seconds, afterwards it should be right as rain to be baited again with some more wine or juice.

aboutProductTopics.name: Make sure this fits by entering your model number.
Works Fast ‚Äì This fast-acting traps eliminate fruit fly infestations. You should notice a dramatic decrease in fruit fly populations within a few days
Long-Lasting Lure ‚Äì The ready-to-use, non-staining lure attracts adult fruit flies. Each trap lasts up to 45 days, giving you up to 90 days of protection!
Discreet Design ‚Äì The attractive, apple-shaped trap design will look at home in any kitchen. It also blends in with the fruit these pests love

reviews.content: I bought this for my daughter who loves to paint. It is an excellent quality paint and an amazing price too. I started out painting Christmas ornaments and gifts for family when I was strapped, and found I loved it. Eventually I began traveling, and one day came across a rock that reminded me of a toad, so I painted it that way using craft paints. I decided I wanted to paint scenes and portraits and miniature portraits, but at first I was terrible so I kept at it.
I was fascinated by all the different kinds of rocks we came across in different countries, and by how the sky looked different all the time. I started watching tv shows like Bob Ross and other painters to learn about perspective. Then I created my own scenes and portraits, often painting from my own photos, all using craft paint. I sprayed the completed, dried painting with sealant, some glossy, some flat. If you are interested in painting, just do it! You dont need a studio, just a table or desk. You dont need the right outside light, just buy a lamp that imitates sun
light. You may discover a wondrous deep well of creativity and freedom.
Tip: The 8 ounce bottle is often the better value over 2 ounce. You dont need a special pallet‚Ä¶u can use a paper plate to get started. If you take to it, as with most things in life, good tools are essential, and by that I mean good brushes.
Enjoy!

I needed some green paint so I could paint a holiday sign for my office. This was perfect! One coat did the job, and that‚Äôs saying something because I‚Äôm terrible at painting. I‚Äôve purchased many other colors, and will continue to purchase this brand
I needed some white acrylic paint in my dorm, and this was here the next day! Just what I needed! Comes with a good amount, a great price, and great white color!!!!

It‚Äôs paint, worked great

name: Lodge SCRAPERPK Durable Pan Scrapers, Red and Black, 2-Pack
description:
Product Description

Lodge Pan Scrapers. Handheld Polycarbonate Cast Iron Pan Cleaners. (2-Pack. Red/Black)

reviews.content: Got greasy buildup, stuck on food, crusties? This will get it off easily and keep your cast iron looking and working perfectly. Get a little too aggressive? Just touch up your seasoning after and it‚Äôs good as new. Don‚Äôt believer old hearsay and wife‚Äôs tales, cast iron can and should be cleaned with soapy water. Just dry completely and reseason lightly when needed. If soap and water or a little elbow grease takes your seasoning off, you didn‚Äôt season it properly. This tool works as intended. It is a little stiff and awkward to handle when new, but still does it‚Äôs job.

So glad I got this! I first bought a cheaper one (which looks just like this one) and returned it for the Lodge brand scrubber, which is much better quality and totally worth a few extra dollars. The inside rubber pad is nice and stiff and the chain metal stays in place which makes it fast and easy to scrape burnt bits off my cast iron skillet. So far, 2 months of almost daily use and its just like new.

This is my second set of these Lodge Scrapers. We lost the first set. Gremlins, I guess. Anyway, I love these scrapers. They are really about the best I've found for scraping away that buildup you get when you fry food in a cast iron skillet. I did break the edge of the black one, but I believe that was maybe from getting caught in the hinge side of the cabinet door. The reason I only gave them 4 stars is because they should be about an inch larger. I would like to have one about 4 inches square, or at least a rectangle of 4 x 3 inches... they would be easier to hold onto.

When food doesn't stick to the pan, the brush is pretty nice, but so is any other cleaning tool. When food DOES stick to the pan, the brush doesn't always manage to get it. A lot of times the food stays on, what I end up doing is take a kitchen paper towel/napkin and scrap the food up with my thumb under running warm water. But if that can get the toughest job done, why wouldn't I just use a paper towel or dedicated cloth the whole time? If the food isn't coming out, just apply more force on the fingers. Either the brush hairs are too soft or too long, since in my experience they don't scrub hard enough.

These work for much more than just cast iron. They are perfect for cleaning the painted top on my stove, too. Any surface where cooked-on food or grease accumulates is easier to clean initially with plastic scrapers. My electric grill gets a plastic scraper with grooves (also sold by Lodge) for the channels and one of these to get the crust of the tops of the ridges. They don't harm non-stick coatings and are heat resistant enough to use once the grill has been turned off for a few minutes.
Product gave a great caressing rub to my cast iron. A great cast iron massage product.
I use the dish washer less, with this brush. It is really great.

This 2-pack of Lodge Durable Pan Scrapers has gotten lots of use in my house. I bought them for use on my cast iron which they are perfect for. They can scrape anything off without scratching anything. I have also used them for scraping gunk off my electric stovetop, other pans, my pizza stone, and even scraping labels off glass jars. Anytime we encounter an issue that requires scraping with no scratching, these scrapers are the first thing to enter my mind. They truly get the job done and I highly recommend them.
This is a very versatile scraper. I like the curve to the one edge to get into corners of pots and pans. It works very well even on baked-on food.
Just abrasive enough bristles to clean moderately heavy gunk. Does not pull off seasoning

Features 4 different shaped corners for cleaning any shaped pan

name: JBL VIBE 100 TWS - True Wireless In-Ear Headphones - Black
description:
Product Description

Great sound, no-frills and no-wires? Simple: JBL Vibe 100TWS. Powered by JBL Deep Bass Sound, these true wireless headphones color your day with up to 20 hours of playback. Total freedom from wires means hands-free calls and full comfort. Immediately paired and independent thanks to dual connect, music, calls and voice assistant can be controlled from the earbud, so you can keep the flow going. Enjoy daily!

reviews.content:
i got these for about $15 and they are the best ones we own! ive been back for more a few times (kids lose them) and this last time, they were on a black friday deal and i scored a few back up pair too!

the sound is good, the noise cancelation is enough that Id be able to get hit by the car behind me before I heard it but cant quite block out my kids screaming enough for me to ignore them fighting.. ya know, not $1000 buds but def $100 quality without that price on my walllet. ive had to take them out a few times to acknowledge things going on around me.
best part is, Im not even mad when the kids lose these.

here's some points we have noted:
I use them at the gym every single day for any where from 1-2 hours, listen to music at work some days for an hour or so, talk on a few calls, my battery life works like this: I usually drop them in the case between uses and charge the case every 2-3 days. the case has not been out of power yet and the buds only ever got as low as the first warning beep one time when i used them almost the entire evening and into the night (think 5pm-11pm). tested them recently, they lasted over 4 days listening to them a lot. they charge up very quick. the call quality is great. never had anyone complain. im using them with an older dinosaur and a brand new galaxy s21, both run perfectly smooth and connect flawlessly. i love the announcements when i first pull them out and put them in my ears. also, my "must have feature" when i bought these was the individual capabilities and they are perfect on that point, better than others. i can control them seperately with no problem. i typically used just one all the time with my old pair to extened battery life but i have mostly used both with these.

Side Note:
I am just a normal, non tech person who loves listening to music for everything i do, hates listening to gym conversations and people who want to interupt my purpose, hates holding the phone to talk, and thinks people talking to themselves are hilarious. I cannot tell you the exact sound output and i did not time the usage or measure the battery output. i just know they work great for normal everyday usage and im not a brand "wh**e" so these are perfection to me and my wallet for a family of 5!

probably important to note the following:
- they instantly paired to both of my devices when i opened them and took them out. my device only requires a quick search, click the product you want to pair, and approve the pairing on the phone. simple
- i bought several pairs for members of my family who needed replacements and all of our pairs (except the pair witht he bad battery) work well, are the same quality, and seem to be the same battery quality
- everyone from 10 years to 23 years, and the adults, are all happy with them
- we are all droid users and some phones have no jack, while other can use wired buds also
- we have tried expensive ones, wired ones, wireless in other brands, and other cheap sets and all of us have liked these as our #1 or #2 choice (one daughter liked the sound of a more expensive pair but that pair didnt have great battery either)

These are a typically great JBL product at their price point; the sound quality is very good for a value earbud. I find there to be an appropriate balance of treble/mids/bass out of the box, and I think that the highs are super crisp and bass can really boom. I find that they fit and seal well to stay snug in place and provide great passive noise-cancellation to block ambient sound. They're a little large, but I don't wear them for fashion, and I'm guessing the size helps with sound quality and power, as well as battery capacity. The battery life is very good, and it recharges quickly. I also personally prefer the hard button on the buds rather than a touch button. Overall, I really like these, especially having gotten them on a half off sale.

However, I have 3 surprising issues with them I wish I'd known before buying... Lack of volume control, no incompatibility with the JBL app, and the case size/lack of lid.

First, the buttons on the earbuds can't control volume, which makes absolutely no sense. Other JBL and earbud products allow volume control on one earbud and playback control on the other. These have the exact same functions on both left and right, which seems like a wasted opportunity. Also, that means the volume is entirely dependent on the source/playback device, and if the output from there is too loud/quiet for your preference, well.... you're stuck. With my phone, these earbuds were VERY loud even on the lowest volume setting possible. NOTE: I have a Samsung Galaxy (Gen 8), so I was able to go in and mess with the stock Samsung equalizer (Sound Settings > Advanced Sound Settings > Sound Quality and Effects) to turn the decibel levels way down and make them usable in all ambient settings. I was unsurprisingly unable to do this on my iPhone 11, though, as its Music EQ is very basic.... Android wins again! Regardless, I've read other customers have the same but opposite issue, where the earbuds are too quiet on the highest volume setting. Avoidable and frustrating, but potentially a work around for some.... The second problem is that there's no compatibility with the JBL app, which means you can't customize the EQ sound profile on less funtional playing devices (ahem, iPhone...) like you can with most newer JBL headphones, nor adjust the volume further, which is a feature I'd really appreciated with other JBL products. Lastly, a small thing: I find the charging case to be unnecessarily large and its lack of a lid a little unsettling. If the size means the charging capacity is greater, then that's fine, and the magnet is very strong and seems to hold them in well enough upside down and even when shaken violently, but the case is bigger than I want for pants pockets and I can see the earbuds being knocked loose and falling out in a bag/purse with other items.

In all, a solid buy, but there may be a newer version or another JBL product with similar sound/quality that have earbud volume control, app compatibility, and a better/smaller case that'd be preferable.

2 WEEKS AFTER DELIVERY:
I wasn‚Äôt expecting much when I ordered these. They‚Äôre only $25 bucks‚ÄîI thought they might make a decent Xmas gift for my nephew. He was so pleased with them, I tried them and immediately ordered a 2nd pair for myself.

LIKES:
Obviously the price. Can‚Äôt beat $25

Sound: VERY impressed with the sound quality. I‚Äôm a huge hip hop/classic rock/audiobook fan. Great bass/CLEAR and CRISP. NO STATIC

Calls: simple/intuitive. One touch answer/end call. Can hear perfectly well and no complaints on other end. SIRI/Alexa works no problem.

Fit: they fit very well and have S/M/L tips to ensure a snug fit.

Battery: battery life is excellent. I get btw 4-5 hours music on full charge.
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
DISLIKES: Not much to be honest. My list here is nit-picky considering the price but in the interest of keeping it real‚Ä¶

ANC: Don‚Äôt know why ppl are even mentioning Active Noise Cancellation. Not advertised. BUT: when you‚Äôre buds are in, it‚Äôs simply difficult to hear anything else. That being said, be careful while driving. You don‚Äôt need to have both in.

NO TOUCH: This is the ONLY thing that is even moderately annoying about these. You have to physically press the button on the bud. When you do this you‚Äôre gently pushing the bud deeper in your ear. Not at all painful or anything but def would be nicer to have touch assist.

Volume control: Have to alter on your phone/device. Again, not a deal-breaker by any means. No EQ but sound is great so I don‚Äôt care.

Case‚Äôs cord: it‚Äôs about the length of my hand from wrist to tip of middle finger. Maybe 6 inches. Could def be longer. That being said, I keep the charging case in my center console so i don‚Äôt need the length. Some might find this frustrating though I‚Äôm sure.
The case itself is great, the magnets hood buds well, no issue.
‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî-

OVERALL: best wireless pod value on Amazon. USE EVERYDAY SINCE PURCHASED WITH NO ISSUES.

PS. nice range too. Can leave phone in bedroom‚Äî walk the house/front and backyard without losing signal. When you do lose it, the buds will make a chime sound to let you know that you‚Äôre back in range.

NO BRAINER FOR UNDER $30. If they were Touch assist with volume control i wouldn‚Äôt really have a thing to complain about at all.

HIGHLY RECOMMEND.
4/5 stars

I really like these headphones. I bought a cheap pair before these and every time I used headphones during a call I was told I sounded like I was underwater. So I gave these a try instead! The purple pair is such a nice color, the headphones fit my ears well and the buttons are very receptive (so I don't have to shove the whole thing into my ear to press it). The sound and mic quality are great, no complaints! The only complaint I do have about these headphones is the stupid case! What a bad design idea. Dropping the case (which leaves the earbuds completely uncovered to collect dust and crumbs from my purse) means that your earbuds just FLY in opposite directions. This particular feature is a gem when it's under 30¬∞F and you drop the case, so your earbuds fly under 2 different cars in a parking lot. I will have to look into buying a case for my earbuds case which is just ridiculous -_-

TL,DR: Great headphones, crappy open-top case design. If you're clumsy like me and drop headphones frequently, either avoid these or be prepared to chase your earbuds every time.

I only needed one for listing to music while working in the office and these work perfect. It does start to hurt my ear after a while but I've never had anything not hurt when it is sitting in your ear for hours. It is very comfy for short term use (1-2 hours). I didn't realize they were noise canceling when I bought them so I have to take it out when talking to someone as it really does make a difference. I wish it had options to tap to pause the music so I wasn't having to take it out of my ear or scramble for my phone when I need to pause. Battery life is good, haven't had any complaints. I've been using them almost daily for about a month with no issues.

When I first got these I was in LOVE. They worked great and I was impressed with the sound quality for the price of them. It‚Äôs also been hard to find ear buds that fit my ears. I‚Äôve been a JBL fan for a while and have many of their products. We‚Äôre a few months in now since this purchase and I‚Äôm now regretting it. For some reason the left headphone dies while the right is fine. I‚Äôve had to unpair and repair the headphones multiple times during a workout. If they‚Äôre not fully charged, the sound goes in and out. It also goes in and out if i don‚Äôt have my phone RIGHT next to me, even if it‚Äôs on the floor right in front of me. I wish I could return these, but unfortunately the time frame has passed. I also feel frustrated as I RAVED about these headphones for the first few months and many of my friends have purchased them because of that.

I got these at a discount so I assume they are being discontinued. For the price I paid they are very good. They easily connected to my iPhone and I use them at the gym with no problem (running, weights). This is my first Bluetooth earbud set so I don't know if they are unusually big but it would be nice if they were a little smaller. Only 3 sets of tips were included, 5 would be better because I think I would like larger ones. I was able to get a good ear seal but occasionally I get a snick sound as the rubber loses seal.

Sound-wise these are very smooth sounding with good balance from bass to high treble. The low bass is lacking however (I'm confident larger tips would not make a difference). If you are used to the ultra bass boost a lot of earbuds produce these will seem weak.

My first experience with decent wireless buds, wanted them for pairing with my music while working out. Was SO surprised the first time I took them out and put them in, they paired effortlessly and INSTANTLY with the music app I had running on my phone. I keep them in through vigorous workouts (weights plus rowing) and have never had to even re-position one.

The one feature these buds are missing that would elevate them several stars is volume control on the buds themselves. It's totally dependent upon the device volume setting, so for instance if you're working out and want to turn the volume down for some reason, you are out of luck unless the device you're paired to happens to be at hand (in which case, why are you bothering with buds?) These NEED independent volume control. Otherwise, a great deal, good sound quality, I charged the device once so far, keep picking 'em up and using 'em without having yet had to recharge them.

I bought an off brand set of Bluetooth Earbuds for approximately $10 more than what I got this set for, and although my first set was nothing to complain about. This JBL set has a longer battery life per earbud, and long battery life over when you have the charging case. I would definitely recommend this product, and I‚Äôm curious how much the quality changes from this product when comparing to ‚Äúhigher end‚Äù brands/models.

I‚Äôd say just go with this one or something similar in the same price range.

I was going to title this great earbuds for the price - but truly, these are just great earbuds. I bought them at 50% off however I would‚Äôve been more than willing to pay full price if I knew the quality I was getting. The connection process is quick and easy, just follow the included set-up guide. Besides that, I haven‚Äôt had any issues and have really enjoyed the earbuds. The noise cancellation, while not an included feature, is a feature. I barely turn the volume up one notch and every other noise disappears. It is worthwhile to try different earpieces to best fit your ears. Additionally, the sound quality is second to none for the average user and the different levels can be distinctly heard no matter at what volume. No notes on longevity since I haven‚Äôt had these for long but so far, 5/5.

name: Rit All-Purpose Liquid Dye, Dark Brown
description:
Product Description

This¬†versatile, easy-to-use and non-toxic liquid dye is¬†ready to deliver vibrant¬†color to almost any type of¬†fabric or fabric blend, including cotton, linen,¬†silk, wool,¬†rayon, ramie or nylon. Perfect for rejuvenating faded¬†clothing,¬†changing the color of apparel, shoes or¬†accessories, coordinating home d√©cor,¬†hiding laundry¬†accidents and so much more. Looking to create¬†something¬†unique? Rit has been tie-dyeing clothing¬†and d√©cor for decades. It‚Äôs also the¬†perfect tool to¬†create an ombr√©, dip dyed, marbled or shibori pattern.¬†It can¬†even dye wood, wicker, paper and cork.¬†Plus, because it is a pre-mixed concentrated¬†liquid, you can¬†use a little or a¬†lot depending on your project and have the flexibility to save it for another time. Whether you are rescuing faded jeans,¬†creating a costume or decorating for a party, all you need is a washing¬†machine, plastic container or stainless steel sink to get started. With 500+¬†color recipes available on the Rit's website, it is almost certain you‚Äôll find the¬†right color for your needs.

reviews.content: I use this for my shibori dye resist craft . I am not a person to have a dye bath sit around like the pros. I have used this about 4 times and it works well. For a very deep indigo colour I do leave my t shirts in for about 1 to 2 hours and I get the colour I like. Do forget to use the dye set so the colour doesnt bleed. The smell is not bad at all and I am sensitive. Wear a mask if u need to

Make sure when using it in a bucket to stir the entire time or it gets spotty. I also tried to dip another shirt after using the dye in the bucket once before. It came out lighter than the first one with the same time. Next time I will add a little more dye before dyeing another shirt.
Is this product on my jacket and it worked fine.

I use Rit dye all the time, here are some helpful tips!

Step by Step
CHOOSING FABRICS. Rit works best on many natural, washable fabrics and materials, such as: a. 100% cotton, linen, silk, wool, ramie
b. Synthetics such as rayon and nylon
c. Fiber blends with at least 60% cotton or other dyeable fiber (blends will tint evenly but will not achieve full color)
d. Nylon-based plastic such as those found in buttons, fasteners and lacrosse sticks
e. Natural materials such as wood, wicker, paper, feathers and cork But there are fabrics and materials that will not accept dye, such as: a. 100% polyester, acrylic, acetate, fiberglass, spandex and metallic fibers
b. Fabrics with rubber backing (bath mats or throw rugs)
c. Fabrics with special finishes such as water repellents
d. Fabrics with bleach damage or extensive staining
e. Fabrics washable only in cold water or labeled ‚Äúdry clean only‚Äù
f. Polyethylene plastics such as golf discs
g. Polycarbonate plastics such as eyeglass frames
Fiber content and weight also effect how color appears making fabrics like cotton, wool and silk absorb dye differently, slightly changing the hue and brightness of the chosen color. If you are in doubt as to whether your fabric will accept dye or achieve the color you want, we recommend testing a swatch.
DYE PREP. Cover work area with a plastic table cover or newspaper and have paper towels or sponges handy to protect against any possible spills.
Wear rubber gloves to protect hands from getting stained and to insulate them when working with hot water.
Use plastic buckets or stainless steel pots for the dye bath. You can also dye in a stainless steel sink. Don‚Äôt dye or rinse items in a porcelain or fiberglass sink or tub as they are likely to get stained./p>
ACHIEVING TRUE COLOR. Always follow manufacturer‚Äôs care instructions for your fabric as well as Rit Dye package or bottle instructions.
Remove stains on fabric or use Rit Color Remover before dyeing to get fabric to an off-white or cream color. This will help achieve uniform color results when dyeing.
Dissolve powder dye thoroughly in 2 cups of very hot water first to avoid dye spotting. Stir dissolved powder dye or well-shaken liquid dye into dye bath until evenly dispersed. Never pour liquid or powder dye directly on fabric unless looking to achieve a specific creative effect.
Be sure to use enough dye for the weight or size of the project. For example, for a pound of dry fabric (about 3 yards), use one package of Rit powder or 1/2 bottle of Rit liquid in 3 gallons of water. You want enough water for the fabric to move freely in the dye bath so that it can absorb the dye evenly across the garment.
When dyeing 1 pound of dry fabric in dark or bright colors such as Black, Dark Brown, Cocoa Brown, Navy, Purple, Wine, and Dark Green, use double the amount of dye (2 packages of Rit powder or 1 bottle of Rit liquid) in 3 gallons of water.
For the deepest color, use a water temperature of 140¬∫F/60¬∫C and keep heat constant while dyeing (the stove top method or a washing machine work best). Note: If tap water is not hot enough, heat water on the stove, in a teakettle or in the microwave.
If dyeing a garment more than one color, it‚Äôs usually best to start with the lightest color and move to the darkest.
For more intense color when dyeing fabrics containing cotton, rayon, ramie, or linen, add 1 cup salt to the dye bath. When dyeing nylon, silk and wool, add 1 cup white vinegar to the dye bath. If possible delay adding the salt or vinegar until 5 minutes after the fabric has been in the dye bath. The delay will help to promote level dyeing.
Add 1 tablespoon laundry detergent to all dye baths to help promote level dyeing.
The longer the garment is immersed in the dye bath, the deeper the resulting color. Items can remain in the dye bath up to 1 hour as long as the water remains hot. You‚Äôll also have to make sure the item receives constant agitation or stirring.
Garments will also look darker when wet and prior to washing.
When you remove clothes from dye bath, rinse in warm, then cool water until water runs clear. (Warm water helps to rinse off surface dye more effectively.)
Wash your fabric/clothes in warm water with mild detergent and then rinse thoroughly in cool water. Machine dry or hang dry.
CARING FOR DYED ITEMS. For the first two or three times, wash your dyed item by itself in cool water with a small amount of non-bleaching detergent. Always wash your dyed clothing with similar colors in cool water with mild detergent. Dry cleaning silks and special fabrics is recommended.
CLEANUP. Clean containers and sinks immediately after dyeing by scrubbing with hot water and powdered cleanser or bleach.
Clean washing machine using highest water level with hot water, detergent and 1 cup chlorine bleach using complete wash cycle. Clean lint traps. Plastic or rubber machine parts may be tinted but will not stain laundry.

I use Rit dye all the time, here are some helpful tips!
Step by Step
CHOOSING FABRICS. Rit works best on many natural, washable fabrics and materials, such as:
a. 100% cotton, linen, silk, wool, ramie
b. Synthetics such as rayon and nylon
c. Fiber blends with at least 60% cotton or other dyeable fiber (blends will tint evenly but will not achieve full color)
d. Nylon-based plastic such as those found in buttons, fasteners and lacrosse sticks
e. Natural materials such as wood, wicker, paper, feathers and cork
But there are fabrics and materials that will not accept dye, such as:
a. 100% polyester, acrylic, acetate, fiberglass, spandex and metallic fibers
b. Fabrics with rubber backing (bath mats or throw rugs)
c. Fabrics with special finishes such as water repellents
d. Fabrics with bleach damage or extensive staining
e. Fabrics washable only in cold water or labeled ‚Äúdry clean only‚Äù
f. Polyethylene plastics such as golf discs
g. Polycarbonate plastics such as eyeglass frames

name: Frigidaire Compact Countertop Ice Maker, Makes 26 Lbs. Of Bullet Shaped Ice Cubes Per Day, Silver Stainless
description:
Product Description

This Compact Ice Cube Maker will be your kitchen‚Äôs biggest asset. Make bullet shaped ice cubes in less than 9 minutes and store up to 1. 7 lbs. at a time. Not only will it keep your sodas, lemonades, cocktails, smoothies and other beverages nice and chilled, but it will produce day after day up to 26 lbs. of ice cubes. The Large see-through window will let you watch your ice being made. Ideal for kitchens, offices, home bars and parties.

reviews.content: I love this. Keeps us from going out and spending on ice.

This ice maker is amazing. It make ice really fast .
I can't keep up emptying it . I would recommend it to anyone .
It‚Äôs great but be aware that when you empty the ice into freezer to store, it freezes into a block. I use an ice pick. Also if you have a big freezer get a bigger ice container.
Great countertop accessory

Makes ice. Good deal for the price. Kinda slow but it beats ice cube trays! I use it probably 2 times a week and fill up 2 medium size plastic bins for daily ice water. Drain plug on the bottom is handy for draining right into the sink when you‚Äôre finished making ice. If you leave the water sit in it, it gets a smell.. if you‚Äôre looking for an ice maker for big events or like to entertain, get a bigger, better, more expensive type as you won‚Äôt get the ice production out of this one quickly.

I had purchased this item back in January for my 1BR apartment. Aside from the color, it was perfect (I ordered black but it arrived in aquamarine, oh well). By August, I noticed it started to rust, but it still worked. And finally, at the end of November, it stopped working. It would still turn on, still lit up green but that's about it. It was perpetually stuck on the "it's full" when it was most certainly not even making ice. I unplugged it. Drained it. Dried it out. And whatever free time I had to spare I spent trying to locate customer service. Alas, 7 working useful months was all I got. I think what makes it worst is the lack of customer service. Under amazon, my product support ended in June (or July).

Edit:
I'm changing my rating since they did issue me a refund and were very nice.
This is the email to contact them support@curtiscs.com
I emailed them my order number, date of purchase, amount and indicated it was from Amazon. They will then email you back with instructions. Instructions include what pics they need of the unit in question such as angles and the unit number. They will also instruct you whether or not to ship the unit back to them. In full transparency, I DID ship it back to them on my expense (I think I paid $50+ for shipping). Process takes a while. They will then decide whether to give you a refund or send you a new unit. I got my refund (price of the unit NOT shipping). I didn't mind paying for shipping so this was a non-issue to me. Overall, I'm just glad it's now resolved.

We have a water filtration system in our sink so I was super excited to be able to filter our water and poured into it. One thing I wasn‚Äôt expecting is that it does not refrigerate so it is not to be considered a freezer. You must pour the ice cubes into your freezer to keep them. But it is worth it in the end. We love it
Compact and very nice ! Puts out plenty of ice

This ice maker is a nice size to keep on the counter and use as your ice bin needs to be refilled. Does not stay cold to use to store ice storage. I run 2-3 baskets to keep in our freezer. 4 star because the large size cube is still pretty small.

The product is easy to use, looks nice and doesn‚Äôt take up too much space. The ice is great if you take it out and use it immediately after it is made. If you wait, it starts to melt and recycle quickly. I wish that the cubes stayed frozen a little longer in the basket.

I missed the return window or I probably would have done so and tried a different one just for the simple fact that the cubes don‚Äôt stay regular cubes long enough.

reviews.content:
IF I'd realized the size of the original MEMORY CARD that came with my Amazon FIRE TABLET 8 when I bought it, I *WISH* that I'd purchased this extra larger, 512gb, Memory Card at that same time with my new FIRE TABLET 8!! Because I honestly use my FIRE TABLET 8 for SO MANY different reasons & ways I'm able to use it!!
I use it for ALL of my MANY, MANY, different AUDIBLE version, KINDLE version books, PLUS the MANY Amazon PRIME VIDEOS I've gotten for use with my own personal Amazon FIRE TABLET 8!!
This could/will make such a WONDERFUL GIFT for any special occasion for the several different types of different electronic devices this can be used with/for, as well!!
And I found that it's *VERY EASY* to INSTALL IT by myself being a severely, physically, disabled, senior citizen, because I was able to install this 512gb (largest one available at this time) MEMORY CARD with the Amazon FIRE TABLET's Representative talking about it by just a quick phone call!! VERY EASY for me to successfully install it by myself!! And I was in DESPERATE NEED of it when I ordered it!!
GOOD LUCK!!

I bought this memory card to increase the storage on my Lavender Kindle Fire 10 64 gig. Installation was a breeze and I just followed the on screen instructions. I think it moved 16 items to the card because it said on the screen it was doing so. And my internal storage increased a bit. However, I have added a few pics via screenshots and a couple of apps and both the internal and memory card storage gig numbers are still in the same place. Since neither is increasing/decreasing I can't say for certain that it's really working.

*Update Ok SD memory card is working. The numbers of gigs is changing. Definitely a great buy. Just installed one in my mom‚Äôs Kindle Fire 8.

Only two weeks in, but the memory card seems to working great.

I got this card for my kindle as it was specifically recommended by Amazon, and my kindle came with only 8 gigabytes of storage, which is ridiculously insufficient for any modern complex operating system expected to accumulate data. Even worse, it's not really 8 full gigabytes. (Also, I got tired of being nagged about running out of space after taking only a few dozen photos.)

Computers like numbers that are in powers of 2, and work best with processors and RAM that are built on powers of 2, which is why you usually see numbers like 8, 16, 32, etc. and not "strange" numbers like 10, 21, 43, etc. For this reason computer systems have *traditionally* used 1024 (2^10) as a base when reporting storage usage in kilobytes, megabytes, gigabytes, etc.

When it comes to a physical storage medium, however, capacity does not have to be a power of 2; it can be whatever number of storage positions will *physically fit*, the only real requirement being that the computer processor can count that high.

Manufacturers are notorious for cutting corners in manufacturing wherever possible then hyping up their products. In the case of the kindle, Amazon used 1000 (10^3) as the base of its "8 gigabyte" claim and aimed for a physical arrangement that would guarantee *at least* 8,000,000,000 bytes of storage (1000*1000*1000*8), over half a billion bytes short of 8,589,934,592 (1024*1024*1024*8). Not surprisingly, SanDisk did the same thing with this less-than-32-gigabyte memory card, as this deceptive practice has become an industry standard. But I digress a bit, my point being that an 8-gigabyte kindle affords you with MUCH less storage space than you would expect, necessitating a memory card for expanded storage, especially since the kindle's operating system uses a LOT of overhead, and every application you install also wants to use a lot of storage.

When inserting your new memory card (or removing it) it is best to do so while the device is turned off. Mobile devices are finicky when it comes to "hot swapping" memory cards, often refusing to read the card, or even worse, damaging the card and corrupting data.

After you've inserted the card and turned the kindle back on, go to Settings -> Storage, and move all the option sliders to the right to tell your kindle to utilize the memory card as much as it is willing to. Unfortunately, some features will still waste space on the internal storage, e.g. screen captures and blue tooth file transfers will NOT be saved to the memory card.

To "move" my kindle books to the memory card, the easiest way was to delete them then re-download them. To move other personal files to the memory card, I connected my kindle to my PC and used Windows Explorer.

From the previously mentioned settings menu, you can also move *some* applications to the memory card. Before and after the move, the amount of storage used on each disk is displayed. Moved applications will still use *some* space on the internal storage, and funnily enough, moved applications use more TOTAL storage than when they resided solely on the internal storage.

One application I did NOT move was ES File Explorer, as this is a system-critical application (due to the kindle's shortcomings).

It should also be noted that the kindle's crappy built-in file browser CANNOT locate the memory card. The files *are* there, but you will NOT find them without a proper file browser like ES File Explorer. Also, some programs (such as the red Notepad) will not be allowed write permissions to the memory card!

A few days ago my wife turned on my kindle and it updated itself which took over half an hour, which seemed unusual because when I observe updates they tend to run much faster. Afterward, my kindle stopped recognizing the presence of the memory card. The solution was to turn off the kindle, remove the card, turn the kindle on, then back off, then reinsert the memory card, then turn the kindle back on.

The card is working great, and is less than 3% full while my kindle has less than 1.5 gigabytes free.

Update 2018-04-23

Last night just before I went to bed, my kindle battery was running low. I was too lazy to go find a charging cable, so I just turned the kindle off.

This morning I turned it back on, with only 12% battery power remaining, and found that several program icons were dark. When I tried to launch one of them, I was told that the program couldn't run because the memory card could not be found! I tried removing the memory card and restarted the kindle like I described in my original review, but the memory card could STILL not be found.

I took the memory card out and connected it to my desktop computer and confirmed that it was in perfect working order. I then put it back in the kindle and connected the kindle to my computer, letting the charge process turn the kindle on. The darkened icons were still dark, and I saw a flash of the memory card icon at the top-left of the screen. I opened ES File Explorer which located the memory card and showed me its files. I went back to the home screen and none of the icons are dark any more.

I guess my piece-of-crap kindle doesn't want to exert any effort accessing the memory card if the battery power is red-lining when the device boots up.

The card being said from Amazon: was created for the Kindle Fire, but after you buy one, the proof is in the pudding!!!. There is so many options you find for this card after you install your: SanDisk 128 SD Memory Card to your KINDLE Fire. I ordered this amazon-recomended 128 GB card for my new Fire HD 8 PLUS tablet. When i installed it, the card properly "clicked" in as it should have but when I powered the tablet back up, the new card did not pop up as sucessfully installed as other users had mentioned. I tried physically removing it and reinstalling several times but each time it still showed as "corrupted" in the settings/storage.

I contacted the seller who immediately sent a replacement card. I carefully installed it but it still showed as corrupted. Frustrated, I clicked on where it said "corrupted" in the settings/storage folder to see if maybe it would give me some more information, though I wasn'e expecting anything because it didn't look like a link and was suprised when this action caused a message to pop up that said that the new card would need to be formatted to work and did I want to format it now? Well of course I did. I formatted it as internal storage and transfered the recommended apps there and it was installed. It would have been tremendously helpful if the formatting option appeared under or near the "corrupted" message.

I feel bad that I had to return the first one to the seller but wanted to share this in case anyone else is receiving the "corrupted" message.

name: PopSockets: Phone Grip for MagSafe, Phone Holder, Wireless Charging Compatible - Clear
description:
Product Description

Our PopGrip for MagSafe is a wireless charging compatible phone grip. PopSockets PopGrip for MagSafe lets you kickstand your phone up anywhere you go, use your phone one-handed, and prevents drops. When you‚Äôre done, it collapses flat. You must have a MagSafe compatible case to securely attach our PopGrip for Magsafe to your phone. It is compatible with Pop Socket cases and mounts for MagSafe, wireless charging adapters, and non-Popsocket MagSafe cases.

reviews.content:
I have been looking for a new MagSafe pop socket that is honestly cute. I came across the PopSockets MagSafe Phone Grip in Neon Pink, a fun and stylish addition to my phone. It's a nice pop of color that adds personality and makes it easier to find my phone in my purse or bag, and the phone grip has made it easy to hold my phone with one hand comfortably.

The MagSafe technology is fantastic, and the grip attaches easily and securely to my phone. It's great that it's wireless charging compatible, so I don't have to take it off when charging my phone.

The grip on my new pop socket has made taking selfies, or video calls easier, providing added stability and reducing the risk of dropping my phone.

Overall, I'm very impressed with the PopSockets MagSafe Phone Grip and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a convenient and stylish way to hold their phone.

I really like this. I bought it to work with a Spigen Tough Armor MagSafe case for my new iPhone 14 Pro. (My last phone was a Samsung S8 Active, also in a Spigen Tough Armor case, but with no PopSocket or MagSafe features).

I like the feel/added sense of a better grip on my phone. The PopSocket PopGrip is just enough to add a more secure grip, particularly in cold weather or when wearing gloves.

One feature in particular that I find convenient is the ability to rather easily remove the MagSafe PopSocket PopGrip. It MUST be removed if a wireless charger is used for the phone, but it is easy to remove from the phone, and even easier to replace it.

Both the Spigen Tough Armor MagSafe case and the PopSocket MagSafe PopGrip include features that serve as a "kickstand" for the phone. However, if the PopSocket PopGrip is attached to the phone, it prevents the use of the Spigen kickstand. While the PopSocket MagSafe PopGrip is easy to remove, some folks might consider 2 kickstand features as redundant/unnecessary. If so, they should consider a different case. Personally, I have no problem with the "redundancy". However, be aware that the kickstand in the Spigen case only allows for it to be used in landscape mode, and only when the PopSocket PopGrip is not attached. The PopSocket PopGrip works best with the phone in landscape mode, but can be reversed if the charging port needs to be oriented in a particular direction.

With both the Spigen Tough Armor MagSafe case and the PopSocket MagSafe PopGrip, I feel my new iPhone 14 Pro is pretty well protected. If you're looking to protect an investment in an expensive smart phone, I would recommend both.

I upgraded to a new iPhone 14 pro with the mag safe technology and I liked the pop socket I had on my old iPhone 11 Pro but was a little bummed I had to remove my case to do wireless charging. With this new set up, I can easily take off this MagSafe pop socket and attach a battery or put it on a wireless charger.

I also use the pop socket car mount and this works perfect like my old one did. So happy I can keep using my older items.

After I got a new iPhone 14 Pro Max and a MagSafe case I looked for holder. Tried a ring type first, but it wasn‚Äôt the most comfortable to hold. Got this and I am happy. Strong magnets to hold it on. I carry my phone in a pants leg pocket and this does not interfere with sliding the phone in or out of the pocket. Highly recommend.

Never knew how convenient it was to have a pop socket. I was always afraid of ‚Äúcommitment‚Äù and regretting later of sticking a pop socket on my phone and eventually tossing it when I get a new phone or case. With this one, I can remove the whole thing when I want and use it on a new phone or case whenever that will be. So convenient.

I love this , I already had a MagSafe metal part on my case and then I bought this and it fit perfect cause I needed both parts for this to work. It‚Äôs super strong and I love that I don‚Äôt have to use my fingers to hold on the bottom of my phone. Having the I phone 12 pro max it‚Äôs a strain in my fingers to hold so this helps soo much. And this attachment is super sleek. Pictures attached

I was hesitant based on reviews but I‚Äôm glad I gave this grip a try. I‚Äôm using a OtterBox magsafe case with a 14 pro max and the magnet attachment is strong! It‚Äôs almost hard to remove it for charging but that‚Äôs a good thing. My only concern is the actual pop socket if it‚Äôs going to be as durable. It does seem a bit looser but time will tell. It would be a great idea if they made that part replaceable as it seems to be the only thing that in time would break. On the mention about the sticker issue. Mine did not come with one. Perhaps they changed how it is packaged so don‚Äôt worry about that anymore.

In the past I had snickered a bit under my breath whenever I saw someone with a popsocket; but, I've been having a hard time holding onto my new phone and decided to give it a chance. Wow! What a difference! The magnets are very strong when connected to my MagSafe compatible case. I can shake it around and it never comes loose. I hold the popsocket between my index and middle finger; I feel much more comfortable holding my phone one handed now.

Exactly as it‚Äôs shown and described. My biggest concern was how strong the magnet was and if it would get knocked off my phone. It‚Äôs surprisingly strong even through a case, it takes a good amount of force to slide it off but not so much that it‚Äôs struggle to switch designs. The only downside is you can only put it in one spot due to where apples magnet is. I‚Äôm never going back to stick on pop sockets, this magnet design is a total game changer!

This magsage popsocket is Great ! The magnets are really strong and there is no risk of it falling off accidentally And i got the clear one that matches perfectly with my Clear Apple Case ‚Ä¶. As for the clear sticker that comes on the magsafe popsocket, it is Not as bad as people have said in their Reviews, you simply peel it up and then use scissors to cut a small part and it will come off completely

I definitely recommend this to anyone who wants a strong magsafe popsocket

aboutProductTopics.name: Our phone grip for MagSafe we call a "PopGrip" securely attaches to your MagSafe-compatible case for maximum grip and kickstand capabilities
Wirelessly charge your iPhone by simply sliding off the magnetic PopSocket and setting on a wireless charging pad
Offers a secure grip so you can text with one hand, avoid phone drops, and use as a phone stand on-the-go
Pop Grip for MagSafe is compatible with PopSocket cases and mounts for MagSafe and non-PopSocket cases for MagSafe
Strong built-in magnets securely attach the cell phone holder grip to MagSafe-compatible cases
