name: Vortex Optics Crossfire HD Binoculars
description:
From the manufacturer
Crossfire HD Roof Prism Binoculars

You know what they say about people who assume you can't get HD optics, rugged performance and high end form-factor in a value-price binocular? They clearly haven't checked out the Crossfire HD. Add in the included GlassPak binocular harness for quick optic deployment in the field and superior protection and comfort - The Crossfire HD truly is a rare find.

Adjust Eyecups & IPD

The eyecups on the Crossfire HD binocular twist up and down so any viewer can see the full field and enjoy comfortable viewing‚Äîwith or without eyeglasses. When not using eyeglasses or sunglasses, keep the eyecups fully extended. For the best viewing when wearing glasses, twist eyecups down.

The interpupillary distance (IPD) is the distance between the center of your left and right pupils. Match the IPD of your eyes and your binocular by rotating the barrels in or out until you see a single image free of shading

Eyecups & IPD

 

Focus Binoculars

 

Neck Strap

 

Lens Care

GlassPak Binocular Harness

The GlassPak Binocular Harness stores and protects your binoculars while keeping them close at hand for quick deployment. Tethers attach to your binocular for added security against accidental drops while the fully adjustable straps create a comfortable fit. Follow these steps to attach the binocular tether straps.

Thread the wide end of the binocular tether straps through the harness strap buckles.
Size to fit by adjusting the one-size-fits-all harness strap.
Thread the binocular tether straps through the strap attachments on binocular.
Thread the binocular tether straps back through the tether strap buckles to secure.

reviews.content: I have 6 pairs of binoculars including 10x42 and 12x42. The vortex set I got was the 8x42. I‚Äôm a bow hunter so I‚Äôm always looking for that great set of binoculars. This vortex set is a little heavier than my others. And by the way the other sets I have are off brand and range in prices from 30 bucks up to 130 bucks. The first thing I noticed was the quality of the build and they way they fit my hands. They are just more comfortable compared to my other sets. What I did like about these was the bino harness that is included. I‚Äôve already got a vortex bino harness and they usually cost right around 25-30 bucks. There was a neck strap that is really nice along with a lens cloth and lens caps. There is a cover that can be taken off on the back side of the focus wheel so that you can use these with a tripod. Now this is the part most won‚Äôt like. The quality of the optics and magnification. When I look through these binoculars and then my others I really don‚Äôt see much of a difference. The image is clear. When I go back and forth between this pair and my other binos I honestly can‚Äôt really tell a difference besides the feel in my hands. Now I‚Äôve been told this by a lot of people but me being me I had to know first hand. They was right. One bonus with these vs other brands though is the warranty. There‚Äôs a lifetime warranty on vortex. So in all your pretty much paying for the name and warranty. Like I said I‚Äôve always been told there‚Äôs not much of a difference up until you start paying those high prices but right now I‚Äôm just hunting whitetail and turkey so I don‚Äôt need something extravagant. Although maybe one day I can. Until then I‚Äôm completely happy with my vortex optics.

First impressions:
Purchased the Vortex Optics Crossfire HD Binoculars, 10x42 version.

I bought these binoculars for bird watching, which has specific requirements as opposed to sports events and nature hikes. I wanted a large enough magnification that I could easily see the birds, but also with a wide enough field of view so that when a bird hops from one branch to another ‚Äì something they are prone to do ‚Äì that they wouldn‚Äôt be lost out of frame. I also wanted a fairly light weight and sturdy construction, all of which I found in my choice.

These binoculars provide a crisp, clear image with no refraction. That is no colored fringes near the outer edges. The aperture is large enough that there is plenty of light gathering ability. Focusing is easy and natural, with the dial centrally located.

This line is advertised as light weight, and it is, compared to other brands, but still it‚Äôs noticeable when hanging around your neck. This is not a complaint.

CHOOSING MAGNIFICATION:
For my whole life I‚Äôve chosen and used bargain basement binoculars, usually 8X magnification. I thought 10X would be marginally better, but experts claim that when you use anything over 8 times, then the image can bounce around from your hand movements and shaking. I didn‚Äôt choose the 12X for that reason. The 10X that I purchased has noticeable jitters if held with one hand, but not so much that you lose track of the image. I‚Äôm glad I didn‚Äôt get the 12X. I‚Äôm quite pleased with the 10X, but I think I‚Äôd be just as happy with the 8X.

CHOOSING FIELD OF VIEW:
As mentioned above, I want the objective lens diameter to be large enough so that if a bird is on the move it would be easy to track and not fly out of range. The 42mm turns out to be perfectly suited to my needs. The next step up, 50mm may have made the binoculars bulkier and heavier, so I‚Äôm happy with this choice.

ADJUSTMENTS:
The inter-pupil distance adjustment was easy and intuitive. If the left and right sides are not adjusted to your eyes, you will see dark edges on the sides of the image. Once adjusted you don‚Äôt have to worry about this, unless you accidentally jar the adjustment.
The diopter adjustment, likewise, was simple and intuitive. Once set up (if one of your eyes is weaker than the other) you can set once and forget about it.

The neck strap was easy to install and adjust. No problems there.
As mentioned in other reviews, the body strap for the carry bag it just too complicated. It reminds me of a medieval torture device. I discarded it and purchased a simple shoulder strap.

MINOR COMPLAINT:
I found that to see clearly through the binoculars and get a full field of view, your eye must be positioned exactly in the center of the eyepiece and at a specific distance from your eyeball. For me, this required me to hold the eyepiece about 3/8 inches from my eye. I found that resting my forefinger on my forehead, and the binocular eyepiece on the edge of my finger accomplished this nicely. The problem, however requires a more comfortable and reliable solution.

I purchased a pair of 42mm rubber eye cushions that did the trick. That size rubber buffer is standard for microscopes, and are available for about $10 on the internet. See photos.

CONCLUSION:
All-in-all, I quite satisfied with this excellent product. It has made my bird-watching experience much more productive and enjoyable.

I got these as a gift for my husband. I would say these are midsize--bigger than the pocket version and smaller than the full size we used to own. For amateur birders, these are really nice. The sharpness of the viewing is pretty amazing and they are much stronger than any pocket-size binoculars. The price was also $100 less than we saw elsewhere. Overall we are very happy with them. Slight larger that we would like for hiking but the trade-off for a better image and longer viewing distance is worth it.

I the Vortex Crossfite HD 12x50 back in November of 2020. I‚Äôve been using them almost daily for over two years. They are incredible for the price. In my opinion, binos in the $1000-$1500 price range are not much better than these. These are high quality and come with a quality soft case and lense cloth. I would buy these again. If you‚Äôre on the fence, buy them. I don‚Äôt think you‚Äôll be disappointed. Especially for under $200.

These binoculars were bought as an upgrade to a pair of Bushnells that just weren't cutting it. I'm a birder and needed something better. These Vortex really went well beyond my expectations and the chest sling was the icing on the cake. Highly recommend for birders looking for a budget optic that doesn't perform "cheap".

Awesome set of Binos! Field of view was my main emphasis, but this is one of the few sets of binos that I have ever used that actually closes down to my pupillary distance. This allows me to get the most out of the binos. 8 x 42 HD is amazing and may be too much for what I need. I use them for birding in my backyard .

Bought these for birding. They are slightly "heavy" when you compare other models. Vortex is a great band and the diamondback are lighter then these. But with the specs on these I'm very pleased. They come with a carrying pouch, lifetime guarantee. I think I'm a new fan of vortex gear now!

I bought these to replace some old, low-end binocs at a mountain home for views and wildlife, and I couldn‚Äôt be happier. Yes, if you are a Zeiss etc fan then you‚Äôll be disappointed but these don‚Äôt cost $1K either! Binocs have come a long way from only 20 years ago and unless you have money to burn or use them in some professional capacity, these should do a wonderful job in this magnification and size range.

El equipo me llego 5 dias antes de la fecha de entrega, caja sin embalar supongo que por procedimiento de aduanas se abrio la caja. lo revise y todo ok. el crossfire HD 12x50 Vortex un equipazo ya me meti a vistear a 7 km y puedo observar a una vaca, estoy muy satisfecho de invertir por este binocular, su peso se nota pero pues por la calidad de material entiendo y en su funda no se nota al momento de caminar. DHL entrega rapida. y amazon entrega informacion completa.

Purchased first pair for Alaskan cruise in 2022 and they were perfect in image and compact for packing and carrying. Wanting use for both work and home bought second pair so I would always have them near.

name: XLUX Soil Moisture Meter, Plant Water Monitor, Soil Hygrometer Sensor for Gardening, Farming, Indoor and Outdoor Plants, No Batteries Required
description:
Product Description

The XLUX T10 Moisture Meter tells you, instantly, whether your plants need water. With this meter, you will know that sometimes though the top of the soil looks dry, just beneath the surface it's very wet--no wonder the plants are struggling.

It's very easy to use, just stick it in the dirt and the dial instantly tells you whether the soil is dry, moist or wet

Easy To Use

Inset the probe of the meter to the plants' root level
Note moisture level in the dial which has ten scales
Remove probe from soil and wipe clean after each use

Tips

Avoid hard stones when inserting probe as they may damage the probe
Never put this meter into water. For some very loose soil, the reading may be inaccurate
Don't leave it in the soil for more than an hour for use

Features

1. Easy to read levels

2. No batteries needed

3. Indoor/outdoor use

4. Color coded reading system

5. For most plants

Package Includes

reviews.content: So far I'm very pleased with this product. I think that the few negative comments have been made by people who don't understand the science of sampling and data collection. They don't realize that with any device used for measurements, there will always be a sampling error. They think if the device doesn't record the same result every time then there's a problem with the machine. Yes, you can place the probe into soil at different locations in the same pot or garden area and it may record slightly different readings, say maybe 6 at one spot and 6.5 at another. But for the price of this device, it is very accurate. Also, many comments were made that they inserted the probe into a glass of water and it didn't read "wet", when the instructions clearly say not to do this. There were comments made about the probe being a weak spot in the device, and would break off. Yeah.... If you try to use this as a pick axe or a fence post. You're not supposed to beat it into the ground with a sledge hammer. It is a delicate instrument and should be treated as such. Some people, in their reviews, imply that they stick the probe into the soil and leave it there as a permanent fixture, which you can't do. If you treat this instrument with respect, gently insert it into the soil (without a hammer please) and then wipe off the steel probe with a cloth or even your hand, it seems to work perfectly. And, as the directions state, don't insert it into a cup of water to test it. If you want to test it for accuracy, insert the probe into a bundle of dry peat moss or potting soil, take the recording, and then add various amounts of water to the soil and retest. Record the results you get and then you will have a guide as to what it means when the probe registers say, "5 - moderate moisture", or "9 - very wet", or "2 - very dry". I think this is a great little instrument and an excellent value, and comes with a warranty. I just received an email from the company reminding me that it has an 18 month warranty and to contact them if I have any issues. I am a professional Mechanical Engineer as well as a practicing physician, with a hobby growing some exotic plants. I think this is a great little instrument, with good accuracy, and not any more delicate than I would expect. The price is great on Amazon, with free delivery, good communication from the seller and with a good warranty. Definitely would recommend to my friends and buy again.

I purchased this moisture meter in the latter half of last year to use for my Calathea, Alocasia, and Variegated Aroids that require more diligent watering routines. In my experience, it works great for soil mixtures that are made up of smaller particles (sand, peat moss, store-bought potting mix) BUT it does not give an accurate reading for mixes that are more chunky or loose (I use a homemade aroid mixture with pine bark, perlite, coco coir, charcoal, and worm castings). Overall it is a good product that I‚Äôve found good use with for my ficus, peperomia, pothos, etc. even though it does not work for the specific plants I purchased it for. I‚Äôd recommend this product for the more casual plant parent that uses denser substrate, but I would not recommend for someone that uses looser/customized potting mixes with more aeration.

Attached photos are of the meter in my custom mix vs store bought mix of two plants watered at the same time about 2 days ago! :)

I'm glad I got this moisture meter! I can't tell exactly just how accurate it is (as I have nothing else to compare it to) but because I'm notoriously an 'over-waterer' - just the fact that I'm thinking about watering...enough to take the time to use the meter...it makes me think twice about giving my plants another drink. I've done a bit of online research to find out about each of my plants' watering needs, so I've got a good idea now about who-needs-what, and when. So far so good - and right now, I'm going to give the water/moisture meter most all the credit. I really believe my plants will continue to be healthy, and my thumb will get greener every step of the way. It's a good product in my book! -jjk

When I had originally bought this product, the one that was sent to me did not work. I reached out and emailed info@xluxtek.com and they sent me a new one free of charge. My new one works! You do get what you pay so it‚Äôs not an extraordinary piece of equipment. The picture featured is freshly watered avocado plant. The meter does not seem to go into ‚Äúwet‚Äù but stays in between ‚Äúmoist‚Äù and ‚Äúwet‚Äù (7/8 mark). Obviously there will be a flux in meter as there are some drier parts in a plant. Other than that is seems like it works.

I have a brown thumb when it comes to houseplants, either overwatering or underwatering, so I went without for several years in our new home. Then I got the itch again and purchased some. This meter makes it easy for me to check the soil for moisture levels. I had to lay rocks on top of the soil to keep my dog out of the plant so I couldn‚Äôt just shove my finger in to test. The meter slides in easily to give me a reading making my life easier and greener.

Very easy to use and read. I was over watering my plants when I moved from a house to a small apartment. Maybe it was warmer, less windows? Not sure, but I had to water much less, and this helps to monitor, especially on the bigger pots.
Got this and it never really changes. Kinda stays stuck on one reading so not as helpful as I‚Äôd like.

There‚Äôs nothing to dislike about this product, it legitimately tells you the moisture content of your soil. I was blown away by how dry my plants were. I had thought I was overwatering but come to find out I was extremely underwatering. Plants are doing much better.
This moisture gauge works well and helps me to determine the moisture level in my large plant containers. Easy to use and to read.
Does exactly what it claims to do. Poke it into the ground, see if the ground is dry, moist or wet. Make a decision whether the plant needs watering or not. Simple.

reviews.content:
Both strings works straight out of the box. I decided to apply them underneath my furniture and around the bottom edges of my wall - and they were super easy to apply!

I do wish they could be a bit brighter but they are perfect for our room because we use a projector on the wall for our entertainment system.

The remote that comes with it is near useless. I downloaded the app and it works MUCH better and gives more color gradient options. English is not the app's first language so its not the most user friendly when you get down into the finer customizable options.

I've ordered these lights twice for my daughter'sroom. The first set we left at our old house and each time I've ordered them they've always been been on point! All of the lights work and none defective. I'd advise when you run them to unroll them and start from the cord close to the outlet you'll be using. My daughter runs them all day and night and they have not increased my energy bill. It's like a party every night in her room.

I purchased these lights for my son‚Äôs room about 8 months ago. They were fairly easy to set up and surprisingly bright. He loves being able to change the colors with the remote control. After about 6 months of use (several hours a day), the lights stopped working. We ordered a replacement remote control and that solved the problem. Now 2 months later the lights stopped working again. We checked all connections, replaced the battery in the remote, ordered yet another new remote, and still the lights don‚Äôt work. I reached out to the company and am waiting to see if they have any suggestions. In the meantime I have ordered the newer version of the lights. Hoping they will work better and it seems there is an app you can use with the newer ones. I like the idea of being able to set a timer for the lights to turn off.

I‚Äôm always skeptical about buying electronics that seem like the price is ‚Äútoo good to be true‚Äù lol. But I did and I‚Äôm glad I did. These babies got put on a bed that sits on a white/cream run and OMG, it‚Äôs just made the room look brighter. One strip fit the perimeter of a king bed plus the headboard. I LOVE that you can control from phone. You can make it dim or brighter. It has different settings for flashing and timers. You are supposed set to sync with music but I could never get that part to work but it‚Äôs no biggy, I‚Äôm not throwing parties so whatever. I really love these lights. Cool for the price welllll actually a lot better than I thought they‚Äôd be for the price.

These lights were so easy to install. The lights are very bright, and I only used 1 50" inch and it wrapped around my entire room. I did not have to use the other half. If you have a large room, GET THESE. You will not regret it. Some colors do not work on the remote though such as pink and purple.
Box comes with two packages of lights with adhesive attached to stick to wall. Only downfall is that they have to be connected to same adapter so cannot use in separate rooms

These lights were really easy to install. The adhesive for the lights seem to very sticky and strong. When I was putting the lights on and readjusting them on to my wall it did take off some paint. I don't mind to much since its going over that parts of my wall that use to have lights and the paint is already taken off there and usually that means adhesive is good but I know that may bother some people and could be a factor. The remote control for the lights work awesome and the Bluetooth feature where you can use your phone as the remote works good too and it was really easy to sync up. All in all I was very happy with these lights and my overall purchase. The only reason I didn't give them a 5 star rating is your unable to attach the lights one after the other to best use all of your lights you have to start all the way at the beginning where your converter box is and meet up in the middle where last left off if you are trying to cover your whole room if that makes any sense and also could be factor for some people. This ended up being very wasteful. But other than that I am very happy with these lights.

I use my LED lights in my room ALL THE TIME! Been about a year now and they still work perfectly. Some of them are glitched and have a different color light on but it isn‚Äôt enough to bother me or even notice much. The app is awesome and gives u a lot of options and the remote is very handy and useful too. Really satisfied with my purchase!

Overall we love these lights. They are very bright but dimmable and there are so many custom settings. The app is great for controlling and getting them just right. They stick very well and there is a lot of lights to go around. We used only 50ft so far and it made it almost all the way around the ceiling. I took away 1 star for a couple of reasons. The first being that the remote is very finicky. If you are not pointing it right at the sensor it doesn't work. Also the instructions for how to set up are pretty poor. It took a lot of trial and error on our part initially to get them set up. Overall I would recommend and I would buy again.

Update: The seller saw my review and offer a full refund or replacement of the lights, so I updated my rating due to the great customer service.

I bought these 6 months ago for my daughter's room. She turns them on at night for 1-2 hours before bed, so definitely not used 24/7, and they quit working a few days ago. Definitely aggravating when I have to buy a new set, climb on a chair to take the old ones down, then put a new set of lights up.

reviews.content:

Amazon, please note this is not a camera. You ask me to give a star rating as a camera. Thats not what this is. It is also not a charger. This is a hub that splits a usb connection with buttons on it to turn each connection off or on individually. Handy gadget if you ask me.

This the second one I bought because it‚Äôs a good quality for the price. And I travel with my laptop that has one USB port so I can add devices easily and & I like that I can turn them off/on when needed. And I like that the cord is shorter so it can sit directly next to my laptop.

reviews.content: The Nosefrida is a great aspirator to be used for both newborns and children alike. The ease of convenience without the need for power helps ensure your newborn or child has a clear nasal passage and prevents buildup and drainage into the throat. It would be nice if this came with a pedal or a compression tool but honestly you only have to suck the moisture and drainage out of the nasal passageway. You are protected by the filter so you don't get any throwback into your mouth or throat. Just wash the tubing with hot water and gentle soap (a little goes a long way) and you are good to go for another cleaning. Works well and doesn't need to go a great distance. I recommend purchasing additional filters with it.

I caught a very bad cold where both nostrils are clogged up and swollen. That means I‚Äôve been unable to blow my nose. I‚Äôve had to wipe continuously to get the muscles out. I remember my uncle using this contraption on my baby cousin and I thought to myself ‚Äúcan I do it on myself?!‚Äù

I am 26 years old. I used this physically on myself and it‚Äôs been the BEST THING EVER. My nose can breath since I‚Äôm not constantly wiping it with a tissue or napkin.

I‚Äôm so disgusted what is physically coming out of me as well impressed that although my nose may be clogged up that It‚Äôs still able to get all the snot out.

This is my second purchase. I love it. The delivery nurse recommended it and it has not disappointed. Truly amazing and actually works. It's incredible how much mucus it removes to help my 17 month old sleep. Literally provides INSTANT RELIEF

So I love this snot sucky thing‚Ä¶I really do. The only thing that is aggravating is the face that the end that you put into the baby‚Äôs nostril is so big. I wish that it was a little smaller or maybe had a soft little tip to add that would make it easier to clear baby‚Äôs airway. Other than that, it‚Äôs easy to clean and easy to use

Get one for home and one for the diaper bag..

Not as gross as it looks and more effective than the little bulb squeeze thing or the electric version.
This product gets all the snot!!!
This has been a life saver for us when my LO gets sick! It gets the mucus out of her nose every time and allows for a lot of suction unlike similar products
If you have a baby you need one of these. Clears them out better than any bulb syringe or electric suction.
This is exactly what I needed my baby has some really bad boogers running and this is just perfect to suck everything away I am so happy I'm able to help my little one breather again with no boogers
This is the 2nd time buying a nose Frida and I absolutely love it! Definitely a baby must have

description:

WE ROAST THE COMPETITION

	

	



COMPLEX THERMOMETERS ARE DEAD MEAT

Most thermometers are too complicated; packed with features you'll never use. Our thermometer is straightforward and reliable, so you can focus on the grill.

	
HOLD THAT READING WHERE I CAN SEE IT

The Alpha Grillers thermometer has a hold button that allows you to lock the screen, so you can remove the thermometer and read the temperature with ease.

A PRECISION TOOL FOR ULTIMATE CONTROL

FOR COMPACT STORAGE AND TOUGH REACHES

Features	Easy to read, multi-use digital food thermometer for meats, liquids, deep fying & candy making.	Includes serrated spatula, scalloped tongs, basting brush & fork with hanging hoops.	Triple-head stainless steel wire bristles with built in scraper & ergonomic handle.	Multi-clove chamber, easy to squeeze handle with ergonomic design. Includes silicone peeler and cleaning brush. reviews.content:
Play Video
¬†This review covers the original Alpha Grillers Instant Read Meat Thermometer I purchased in February of 2017--and the new upgraded model you see here (June 2020 anyway). The original thermometer was purchased for $15 based on users reviews on Amazon. You can't find images of it here anymore (although you can see it in my picture comparing the 2017 model to the 2020 model), but it worked well enough and I've been mostly happy with it for the last three years. Recently it went from unreliably turning on, to not turning without removing the AAA battery and futzing with it (no corrosion) for 10 minutes. I was disappointed but $15 for three years of service and left out in the elements, I can't complain too much. I started to browse for a replacement and see that Alpha Grillers' has a "lifetime warranty" so I email them pictures of the unit, invoice info, etc. I kid you not: two days later, a replacement arrives from Amazon, and it's the latest version. So none of that "pay for shipping" the
dead unit back to them, and we'll see what we can do run around. This alone, should convince you that it's worth buying this thermometer since we all know most of the hardware on Amazon is sourced from a giant factory making and selling units to other resellers. It's probably not a question of the difference in the label--it's a difference in the customer support and there, Alpha Grillers gets 5-stars.

Accuracy and response
Since I have the new unit, I wanted to see how accurate it was so I compared it to my Fluke 52 thermocouple thermometer with a Fluke 80PK-2A immersion probe that I had calibrated with a GE Druck DPI-822. I then filled a narrow mouth Pyrex 1,000ml flask with water from our hot water pot that had been set to 208 F and tried to hold both probe tips near each other in the hot water while trying to take a picture with the hand on a phone. The Fluke 52 and 80PK-2A read out at 184.4 while the Alpha Grillers displayed 184.1. As you know, water cools off fast and it's you don't uniform temperature in the container so the 0.3 degree difference could be the actual temperature difference from the probe positions in the hot water or even the probe shaft differences. Basically, the accuracy is excellent for a $20 meat thermometer.

I also wanted to see how fast the Alpha Grillers unit responds so I filled a second small glass container with ice and water and recorded the display as it was dunked from the ice water back into the hot water (which had now cooled off further). You can watch the video above (it goes from removal from ice bath to hot water, and then back to ice bath and again back to the hot water) but it does respond extremely fast but not necessarily "instant." To be fair, "instant" is more of a marketing term and open to interpretation anyway. "Instant" coffee still takes time to add to water and stir for example.

I'd say it takes about 3.5 seconds to respond to the ice bath to hot water--which is "instant" for most of us. For example, the Fluke 80PK-2A is far slower by design because it's a non-tapered, thicker, stainless immersion probe that absorbs a lot of the heat and can take a lot more abuse. The more slender tapered Alpha Grillers tapered tip is designed to pierce meat and also responds far quicker since you don't have to heat up a lot of metal.

As far as the design of the unit, like the previous model, it features a hidden magnet to let you stick it to side of your grill which is a great feature, and the hole lets you hang it from a hook as well if your grill's hooks are large enough. The package also comes with four small hook and loop (Velcro) with adhesive on the back if you want to Velcro it to something.

The new model's rubber buttons are also far easier to press than the previous design's plastic bubble-type. New to this model is very even white LED backlighting. Yes, it looks blue in the official marketing pictures but that's the digital camera color temperature at work--it's actually white.

Hold function
Also new is a hold, and min max function. The function is unlike most typical thermometers which typically cycle from room temperature to max temp and min temp. It's pretty thought out here for a meat thermometer. On the older model which doesn't have the old function, I would stick the thermometer in to the meat on the grill and twist my head over to see the current temp. On meat on the rear of the grill this means getting your head into odd angles and also pretty close to the grill.

With the new model, you insert the probe, press the Hold button to activate the hold (it will display HOLD) and read the temp without all the head craning and heat on your face. Press Hold to release the hold function.

One thing I want to point out: the UI for the hold function might be a little confusing because the hold function first requires that you turn on the hold function before you can use it. This occurs from off state to on. So like most, if you have it folded shut, and open to use, you will have to press the Hold button to turn on the mode. That means the first time you want to use it, you'll have to press it twice: Once to activate the hold mode, and once again to do the first hold. After its in its hold mode, it operates the way you expect it to: Into meat, Hold button to read, and Hold button to release. It doesn't turn off until the thermometer is switched off.

Max Min Function
The same Hold button also activates a max and min temp. This again is unlike the typical user interface of a temperature gauge with room temp / max / min cycle with a single click. To read the maximum temperature, you press and hold the Hold button for 3 seconds and it will display the maximum temperature with MAX in the display. Press again and will see the minimum recorded temperature since the unit was on and MIN in the display. One more press and you exit back into the standard mode. Note: you CANNOT the Max/Min function if it is currently in HOLD. You have to do this from the normal operations. Undocumented feature: Alpha Grillers' documentation say to clear the recorded max/min by turning the unit off (folding the thermometer shut) but if you are in the MAX or MIN mode, you can simply press and hold the Hold button for three seconds and it will reset both recorded max and min memories.

Calibration Mode
Unlike the 2017 mode, the 2020 version features a calibrate feature. On the button that lets you switch from Fahrenheit to Celsius, pressing the button for 5 seconds will let you calibrate the unit. The instructions say to put the probe into a container of ice and water by using the Cal (f/c) button or the Hold button to set the calibration point to 32 degrees F or 0 degrees C. Obviously out of the box accuracy is excellent and for meat grilling do you really need this kind of accuracy or to even calibrate? I dunno. I was more afraid of accidentally pressing the calibrate button and throwing it out of whack so I went ahead and pressed the Cal button for 5 seconds which causes the display to show "CALL" (yes there's only one L in calibrate) but rather then letting me accidentally mess up the calibration, the thermometer displayed "ERR" and then went back into normal operation. My guess is the unit won't even let you calibrate it unless it's in an ice bath first so my worries about screwing up the calibration are pretty unlikely since you'd have to accidentally dunk it into an ice bath first.

Build quality and battery
Unlike the original Alpha Grillers I had which runs off of AAA, the new unit uses (which comes pre-installed) a CR2032 coin cell. I think this is an improvement as AAA kinda stink. They seem to be the most prone to leaking of all the cylinder cells I use (looking at you Kirkland). Lithium coin-cells, though more expsnsive, are more reliable, far less likely to leak (and ruin your unit) and operate at lower temperatures. The higher voltage also means more power for the the advanced functions in the unit too. I can't say anything about battery life as I haven't had the unit long enough, but I'm sure the LED backlight is the largest consumer of power so if you use it sparingly, it'll probably last quite a while.

Water resistance
Alpha Grillers calls it "water proof" and in the documentation, it's stated that you can "fully submerge" it in water for a short-time so long as the battery compartment is screwed on tightly. I didn't dunk my unit but I have no reason to doubt the water resistance of it. There are no visible screws anywhere on the unit and there is a gasket in the battery compartment (the gasket could be a little larger though to increase the seal as there are no ridges to mate with the gasket on the actual battery cover, just a flat surface). The only ingress of water would likely come through the gasket flattening over time or through the pivot point of the probe.

The previous 2017 model used a small nub switch that the temperature probe boom depresses to switch off or on. This switch has moved to the inside of the unit which also adds to its water resistance. The probe boom itself is very stiff to open and close which also adds to water resistance. I have no idea how the probe is connected to actual controller board inside or how water resistant that is. The 2020 unit actually switches off at about a 45 degrees angle too which is an improvement over the 2017 model which required closing it firmly to switch off. I would often not switch off if you didn't close it correctly.

I think this is plenty of water and dirt resistance for a meat thermometer unless you're a Navy Seal Griller who needs to scuba up from a sub before grilling on the beach. The main take away is you can probably leave this on your grill during inclement weather without worrying about it being killed. The previous model I had did not have any weather resistance claims and also no gasket in the battery compartment which might be how I killed it.

Improvements
Coming from the previous model, it's a big improvement but it's not without complaints. I think the Hold feature is great, but the button is too close to the temperature scale and backlight button. This means you have to angle your thumb to hit it straight on. You're also going to almost always hit that button from an angle which will put more stress on it over time. The other complaint is the hold button should be activated from power on without having to press it once. I suppose this is done to prevent someone from reading the wrong temperature but I'd rather have it on.

Overall the 2020 model is a big improvement over the 2017 model. Currently it's quite a bit more expensive ($15 for 2017 model vs $20 for 2020 model) but I think the improvements are worth it. And let me again point out the customer service Alpha Grillers provides. My old one let go three and half years later and they stood behind it. For a $15 thermometer. Even if they didn't and they said, "it's been three years bud," I'd buy another one with the improvements, accuracy and speed the new model has over the old one.

And yes, I received this unit free, because my old unit died. Alpha Grillers sent it to me as a warranty replacement not to have it reviewed. It did not ask me to write my review, I did it because a company that stands behind its products deserves recognition and is worthy of my time spent.

Update: Company reached out and wanted to refund me my money. Asked just for a replacement and they shipped it right out. I really appreciated that type of customer service. Thank you so much.

Mine wasn‚Äôt waterproof. I have been very careful not to get wet at all. Dropped it in the sink and once it hit water the screen hasn‚Äôt been right since. Even put it in rice to try and salvage it. Can‚Äôt believe water did this. I was happy with this product up to this point. Didn‚Äôt even have it 4 months.

I actually love this thing. I have had it for over a year now and I use it frequently because I‚Äôm always cooking. It‚Äôs accurate, and the LED is bright enough to see it against the light in your oven. Also, it has a magnet on the back so you can stick it right on the fridge for easy access! I might buy another one soon.

My old digital thermometer finally gave out. This was one that looked similar to my old one, but also had more features, including a backlight and a magnet to attach to places. I might have only had this a few weeks, but I‚Äôm convinced this will work for years to come. I‚Äôve been using it twice daily to start a sourdough starter, so it has been used frequently over two weeks. It is accurate when I pull out the probe. The temperature it reads is the same as in my house.

I'm a sous chef, so a thermometer is crucial to my daily work. Ive gone through a few, and this one is by far the best! Its "fold/extend" probe is quite long and allows for temping food still in the oven. Its movable shape and length allow me to probe food without having to remove a sheet tray from the oven, and without having to insert my hand into the oven, possibly burning myself on a rack. Its got a very quick read (within 3 to 5 seconds), and has yet to fail me in any professional kitchen setting. This is honestly a must have for anyone in a kitchen!

I bought this as a Christmas stocking stuffer for my husband. He's always wanted a digital meat thermometer, so he was excited to use it. He's grilled a few times since then and he's used the thermometer. His first time using them with steaks wasn't perfect; the steaks were still a bit more red than we'd prefer. But he admitted that he may not have inserted the needle far enough. It worked perfectly with chicken.

I have been very happy with this thermometer, and WAY down the line I started having some problems and contacted their customer support. Their team is GREAT and I got support that was way above expectations. So I wanted to let fellow amazon shoppers know you can buy this item with confidence.

I prepare food for a women's and children's homeless shelter. I transport the food, stage, and serve it. I generally keep it hot with containers, etc., but using the cooking thermometer was easy and accurate. It removed the uncertainty of knowing the right temperature.

I've had two of these Alpha Grillers Instant Read Meat Thermometers for a while now and thought I'd take a moment to submit a review. I don't like putting up reviews on products I've purchased but haven't put them to use. I've definitely got my monies worth from these products. I really like them, easy to use, accurate and a part of making my barbequeing or cooking even better.

Works well, good holding/staying power of probe (doesn't move around). Reads accurately enough for food, easy to clean and couldn't be happier with the product. Have not needed to replace battery (can't see needing to for years) but access to the cover is easy. Would recommend to those looking to buy one.

reviews.content: Very easy to use. Quality of tape is great. I used it on some heavy moving boxes. None of the boxes broke open. I used extra tape on the bottom of the boxes. Also bought some boxes through Amazon. It worked out well. New boxes and tape. Much cheaper than the brick/mortar stores and they were delivered to my front door.

Have used this tape for moving, gifting, and labeling galore,
The applications are endless and can list a few more,
reinforcing papers such as lamination on a budget,
tape is clear so it is easy to fudge it.
This tape is sticky and strong and a truly solid buy,
with this tape your limit is the sky!

I was expecting brown packing tape which generally gets used to tape around boxes. Instead this is just a bunch of transparent tape, a bit thinner and not nearly as long as the rolls of transparent tape sold by the Post Office. I guess it is strong enough to encircle a box to close it. You get a whole bunch of them so I guess it's a good deal, but wastes plastic with the multiple dispensers . As usual with transparent packing tape, you have to be real careful not to let it snap back onto the reel, it is hard as sin to get it started again with your finger nails.
I can‚Äôt buy enough of this shipping tape. I am packing up a spare room to giveaway articles, perfect tape. And for everyday mailing. Scotch works best. And yes each roll has its own dispenser!

Do yourself a favor and buy this tape. Don't try to save money and buy a cheaper, inferior tape, as it won't be worth your time or effort or cash. This tape is thick, strong, reliable, and you'll use less. The best!

I have used Scotch shipping tape before.
I was very disappointed in this. And it is suppose to be Heavy Duty.
It doesn‚Äôt seal ~ like a regular box.
It says ‚Äú GUARANTEED‚Äù.
Wish I would have returned it.
I was expecting bigger rolls, but it turned out to be very good as well. My fault for not reading the description I guess.

We recently moved and used these to tape up all of our boxes. They hold well onto the cardboard and didn't open under temperature changes (moved from a cool place to a coastal warmer place). And for the price, you really can't beat it. If you need to pack up a bunch of boxes for moving or shipping goods, this is a great addition to your packaging supplies. Or you could support your local post office and buy clear tape there that is comparable quality as well.

I am an online seller who packages and ships almost daily. This is the third order of this tape that I have purchased. Steller deal compared to buying by the roll at the local hardware store. Have purchased from other companies and the tape was old and was almost impossible to get it back if you lost the end. Never had that issue here. Will continue to purchase.

The convenience of having a box of this tape on hand was more than I realized! I keep one in the kitchen drawer, one in the present-wrapping supplies, one for my daughter, one for the other daughter...you get the point. I just emptied the box, eight months later & still currently have a roll in each of my stashed places. I will definitely order again!

reviews.content: My dog shreds, the fitted sheet on my bed when he is ‚Äúnesting‚Äù. Instead of replacing the whole set of sheets, I decided to give these sheets to try just to replace the bottom sheet after he shredded them. It‚Äôs a great work around and I can‚Äôt tell the difference between the sheet and $80 sheet set fitted sheet. For $11 you just can‚Äôt beat it! Also, these sheets are surprisingly durable.

Amazon knows I NEVER comment on any review but these sheets were made for my bed!!-I have a California Queen (extra long and extra thick) with 2 mattress pads and have never before found any fitted sheets anywhere that fit. I did wash them before putting on so don't know anything about the shrinkage (if there was any). Am very happy with my purchase. TJ in Arizona

These sheets for the low price is very good & the deep pockets are everything
I have 2 mattress cover a bed foam & now I got a pillow top mattress cover & still those deep pocket fitted perfect
I purchased the spa blue & it's teal not light blue so if your like me who dislikes teal get another color
I won't return it cause I hate returning, just becareful with the colors
I‚Äôm a sheep snob and my bottom sheet on an expensive set tore. Ordered this bottom fitted sheet and was worried because the price was so cheap. EXCELLENT! Very happy!

Bought this to use as a couch cover as our dog(mutt) sheds so much. Have 2 other queen bottom sheets I use for the same purpose and rotate their use between washing. They're starting to look worn and I need to replace them with the same size but with all-around elastic to keep the edges from popping off after many seatings. This bottom sheet is PERFECT as the extra elastic keeps it in place and corners stay put and the fabric is soft for our 2 legged family members. Also, I remove it once or twice a day to shake the dog hair off outside and the hairs just float away and don't stick. I use the quick wash setting on warm in my washer and dry on low and it comes out like new. The deep pocket allowance probably helps too at keeping the sheet on the couch. Will be buying more. Very happy with my purchase.

I like this sheets because they wrap around a pillow top mattress well. mine is 9 inches deep and this fits great. the material is normal. Of course not 1000 treat count egyptian cotton but it doesnt cost a fortune either. i've had it for a little over a months and my big dog climbs on it all the time and it holds up great so not issues with the sturdiness of it.
Gets rid of the annoyance of having to tuck your sheet back under your bed every morning, not insanely soft but still very comfortable. Would recommend!

I get tired of spending a lot of money on new sets of sheets each year, when only the fitted sheet needs replaced.

No company has ever created a sheet that I‚Äôve found, that isn‚Äôt thin and that doesn‚Äôt tear quickly.

I saw this sheet, it got decent reviews so I ordered it and one other from a different seller.

Pros: Less than $12.00 , so even if this tears within six months, it was so cheap. It matches my existing top sheet and pillow case from a name brand that were $80.00 for the full set. It also fits my mattress perfectly.

Cons: it didn‚Äôt have the little tags that say top/bottom and side.

The other sheet I ordered at the same time was $19.99 and the deepest sheet I‚Äôve ever purchased, it had the tags and is the one I kept on the bed for now.

I‚Äôd purchase both again. Photo taken after being washed and dried.

I‚Äôve always been too lazy to fiddle with a top sheet, so this was a good find. My mattress is 8‚Äù thick and the sheet has enough fabric to make my bed look pretty wrinkled unless I smooth it out intentionally. My only issue is that it‚Äôs pretty irritating to orient the sheet when you‚Äôre putting it on, but otherwise I have no issues.

Accidentally posted a review on this earlier. I confused it w/ another item - sorry.

The bedding works well and feels comfortable.

reviews.content: These dish cloths are great. I bought them because my old dish cloths are‚Ä¶ well‚Ä¶ old looking. I‚Äôve only had them for about 4 years but they have holes in them and they‚Äôre not doing the job anymore. So I bought these new dark gray dish cloths to replace them. They are soft but sturdy. I currently live in PA and I‚Äôve never experienced the kind of hard water they have up here. The water is so hard, my wash cloths can stand on their own when they air dry. But these dish cloths remain soft and they are easy to use. They are not overly large but they are definitely larger than my hand. When I reach for them I hesitate because the quality is so good I feel like I shouldn‚Äôt be using them to wash dishes. They are very absorbent and the waffle design makes cleaning a breeze. They are great as a gift also. I‚Äôll be getting a set for my sister‚Äôs house warming and I‚Äôll be getting more in different colors for myself to replace all my others.

Wow! These are beautiful, thick, absorbent, and perfect in size. The quality of fabric is outstanding, too. That's great, but what sent me over the moon is these are COLORFAST, too.

I always use bleach in my dishwater because I'm one of the few who handwashes my dishes. After accidentally putting a brand new one into the sink, I later found it just as nice as it was when it went in, so I kept on using it. Nice! These hold their color. (FYI: I bought the dark grey)

These cloths are exactly what I need, durable absorbent to get the job done. It's always a gamble when ordering these types of things online because you can't feel what you order until it arrives. However, I tend to scour the interwebs for reviews on all products I order before hand. It turns out that this purchase hit the nail on the head. Therefore I totally recommend them to anyone looking for a dishcloth they can use to absorb a mess and or scrub out with an ample amount of elbow grease!

There‚Äôs nothing i do not like about these dishcloths. I‚Äôm very fussy about dishcloths being I‚Äôve bought so many and they end up in trash. They are the perfect size and they wash up nicely. My old ones are now rags! Highly recommend üëçüòÄ
Good size. Love the material. Not too plush. Easy to wring out & rinse dish soap from rag. Very happy with these for use in kitchen to wash dishes and wipe off surfaces.
These are nice towels. They are a bit thin but still nice. They will be used as a kind of mat to put clean dishes on to dry. These towels were packaged nicely as they were shrink wrapped.
I got these for the kitchen, they are truly absorbent and non-streaking on the counters. I can really wring them out easily and they dry quickly. I will buy again when needed.
Changed colors in my kitchen, looking for my grey and found these to match my glass tile backsplash. They are soft, sturdy, and a good size for washing dishes, or cleaning counters, etc.
These washcloths are well made and just what I was looking for. They are bigger than most dishcloths and made of cotton. They are thick and soft.
I wanted some good quality dish rags and these cotton waffle weave cloths are great! I bought the grey ones. The color fades as you wash them, so be aware. They are great quality other than that.

reviews.content:
I've been looking for a fun new game to play with my 7 year old. I saw this had great reviews and wanted to give it a try! He had the game down after one round and loved it. We have played multiple times now and it's been a hit every time! The 3 specialty cards are the best, they had us cracking up! You have to make a specific movement depending one which one is laid down, before slapping the deck (the specialty cards are the groundhog, gorilla, and narwal in the picture)

I highly recommend if your looking for a fun game for your kids to play, or a game to play with your kids!

Kids find this game fun and interesting, and it's not super tedious for adults either. There's a bit of a learning curve for some kids, because it's a lot to remember at first. But you can teach the game in layers: first the primary rule set (taco, cat, goat, etc. spoken in rhythm as cards are placed), keeping the specialty cards (gorilla, narwhal, etc.) out of the deck at first. Then when they grasp the basic rules, you can start adding in the other cards to keep it fresh.
For parents that have been forced to play CandyLand or Yahtzee Jr. a thousand times, this will be a refreshing change of pace. And it's small enough to keep in a purse or backpack, so it travels much better than your average board game. Unfortunately this packaging doesn't travel very well. It's a slip box instead of having a lid, so it's more likely to tear. The cards require a little bit of jimmying to fit in all the way, which is bad for the longevity of the cards and the box. You CAN purchase this game with a proper lidded box or tin...I recommend that one, if you're able to get your hands on it.

This game is hilariously awesome! It combines slapjack, charades, and verbal dexterity. It‚Äôs a quick, fun, energetic game perfect for all ages as long as everyone is roughly the same age.

The first time I played this was with a group of former football players and wrestlers and we broke the little card table we were playing on.

Our kids take this to every sleep over and birthday party and we‚Äôve gifted it several times.

You can‚Äôt go wrong purchasing this game as a gift for yourself or your family and friends.

This game is so fun! My kids, 8 and 6, love to play and they caught on quickly. It always makes us laugh and we also get competitive. Its a great game to teach kids to be gracious winners and losers because its so fun and silly. Quickly become the one they ask to play the most often (and one I don't hate saying yes to).

I bought this for my nephew who is 9 and he loves this game! I also bought it for my friend who is 30 and we played with a group of 8 and everyone had an very fun time as well. You can play this game with basically any age group, it's easy to learn, and you can play this sober... or not. Highly recommend

We played this recently when friends came over with their kids, and we all had such a blast! It IS quite fast-paced, and the slapping of cards can get a little rambunctious, but all the laughing makes it worth it. :) Just like all the other reviews say, just get it‚Äî-it‚Äôs really fun! Perfect family game, great for adults (for added bonus, while enjoying adult beverages), too. :)
We have a 4, 7, and 9-year-old and we all love this game. The kids are genuinely better at this game than adults! Used at a company retreat and everyone loved it (ages 20-60+).

A game for whole family. We have such fun, play with our adult children and grandchildren. Give out as gifts. Have had four generations playing game, and all of us in tears with laughter, great memories!
The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because I think they cheaped out a bit on the packaging. I would have liked the packaging to be more sturdy than it is. Easy to rip.

It's super easy to learn, and it's fun for all ages from kids to even my friends in their 20s and 30s. The illustrations are cute, and I think it's cleverly designed with multiple color backgrounds and similar animal and food shapes to trip up people, especially when it gets fast and competitive.

I first played this game at a house party with 7 people, and I don't know how we managed to play it because playing it between 3 cousins, we were going through the cards easily. I recommend getting more than one deck to play with more people.

After enjoying it so much, I gave my brand new deck to my cousin who was visiting from abroad, so I'll be buying more for me and to gift to others.

name: Mac Book Pro Charger - 118W USB C Fast Charger Power Adapter for USB C Port MacBook pro & MacBook Air 16 15 14 13 inch, Ipad Pro and All USB C Device, Include Charge CableÔºà7.2ft/2.2mÔºâ
description:
Product Description
Perfect Replacement Charger for New USB C Port Macbook

Included a specialized 5A USB C to C cord to charge USB C MacBook at full speed 118W. Revive your MacBook Pro 15 inch to 100% in only 1h 35mins. Works with USB C 96W, 87W, 67W, 61W, 30W, 29W PD Charger Adapter.

Implements high speed charging while maintaining normal operating temperature by sophisticated electronic innards.

Foldable plug for easy storage.

Built-in smart chip safeguards to protect your laptop or cellphone from over-load voltage / current, short current and high-temperature.

Equipped with "Power Delivery (USB PD) Protocol" intelligently output a suitable power automatically for fast charging your laptop, tablet, smartphone and more USB type C & Type C port devices.

7.2ft/2.2m USB C to C charging cable let you can work and charge your laptop anywhere.

One for All USB C Charger

Wide Compatibility:

Compatible with PD 20W 25W 29W 30W 61W 67W 87W 96W 100W model

Compatible with MacBook Pro 13-inch 2021, 2019, 2018, 2017, 2016 (A1706/ A1707/ A1708/ A1718)

Compatible with MacBook Pro 14-inch 2021(A2442)

Compatible with MacBook Pro 15-inch 2021, 2020, 2018, 2017, 2016 (A1706/ A1707/ A1708/ A1719)

Compatible with MacBook Pro 16-inch 2021, 2019(A2166)

Compatible with MacBook Air 13.3/13.6 Inch M2 2022, MacBook Air M1 2020 (A2337, A2179, A1932)

Compatible with MacBook Retina 12-inch Early 2017, 2016, 2015 (A1534/ A1540/ A1646)

Compatible with MacBook Air Retina 13-inch 2020, 2019, 2018

Compatible with iPad Pro 2022/ 2021/ 2020/ 2018 12.9 inch Gen6/5/4/3, iPad Pro 11 inch Gen 4/3/2/1

Compatible with androidphone: Samsung Galaxy, Google Pixel, LG, Moto, One plus, Xiaomi, OPPO, Huawei, Kindle etc

Compatible with Nintendo Switch/ Steam Deck/ Switch Controller/ JBL/ Beats/ Sonos

Compatible with Google Pixelbook/ Chromebook Pixel; Dell XPS13; Lenovo Yoga; HP Spectre; Samsung Notebook; Acer; Asus

Compatible with iPhone 14/ 14Pro/ 14 Plus/ 14 Pro Max/ 13 Mini/ 13/ 13 Pro/ 13 Pro Max/ 12 Series/ 11 Series/ XS/ XS Max/ XR/ 8/ 8 Plus(Not include USB-C to Lightning Cable charging cable)

And for all usb c port smartphone, laptop, tablet and devices

	

	



Ultra Fast Charging

Our 118W usb c charger offer fast safe charging Charger your MacBook Pro 15 inch to 100% in only 1h 35mins.

	
Support Data Syncing

In addition to fast charging, it is also suitable for charging, synchronization and data transmission between different USB C devices. High-speed Data Ttansfer Up to 5Gbps.

	
Safe and Reliable Fast Charger

Safely charge, refuse to explode when hot. Built-in safety protection system, intelligent identification chip, effectively avoid short circuit, over-voltage, over-current, and other safety hazards, charging faster and safer.

	

	



Foldable Design

With the foldable design, it will take less space of your bag and keep this adapter more durable.

	
Portable and Compact Size

Small, lightweight,compact but durable.You can simply put it in your pocket or handbag and so on, so easy to carry. Perfect for home, office , business and traveling.

	
Enough Length

Total cables length is 7.2ft/2.2m is enough for easy use in any place.

With such a long charging cable, no longer have to worry about the charging cable being too short.

reviews.content:
I was very surprised when I found this product, which includes the cable for only $30. Originally, I was just looking to replace my factory Apple charging block for my MacBook Pro, and was fully prepared to spend $70 on the block, and up to another $20-30 on the cable. In fact, I went to Best Buy, looking to do just that - but they no longer sold the original Apple product. So, instead, I spent $70 on some off-brand which I didn‚Äôt like, for multiple reasons..

First of all, if I‚Äôm going to spend that much money, I‚Äôm buying the original Apple product; it‚Äôs as simple as that. So, I bought the damn thing temporarily, just to have something to use until I could order the Apple one; which, in fact, I was searching for here on Amazon, and surprisingly did not find. That‚Äôs how I found this product, instead.

Now, I‚Äôm a bit of a review snob. If a product isn‚Äôt 4.5+ stars, with a credible amount of reviews, I‚Äôm probably not buying it. But, even at this price point, this product was holding a full five stars - so I settled on trying it, instead of going directly to Apple. I love it, honestly. I don‚Äôt have any REAL complaints. Just one tiny little thing, that doesn‚Äôt really matter. Especially at the end of the day, for this price.

The one that I returned to Best Buy drove me INSANE, because the damn thing was so heavy that it sagged from every outlet you plugged it into. It didn‚Äôt feel ANYTHING like the original Apple charger, and it CONSTANTLY fell out of the socket and interrupted my usage experience. Oh, man I cannot tell you how annoying that was.. and I forget why, now but there was something else about the cable, too that just felt nothing like the one I had been using for the last five years. I just, hated it. All around.

This bundle, though is almost exactly the same size as the Apple one, and even a smidge smaller, I think, which is nice. It‚Äôs light, as it should be and it actually stays plugged in. That was a pleasant surprise, because at this point I wasn‚Äôt sure what to expect. I have no complaints whatsoever about the charging block (which is the expensive part, obviously). I have no use for about half of the power of this thing, since my device only uses a maximum of just over 60 watts, so I can‚Äôt attest to an increase in charging speed, or anything like that. But, as a replacement for the factory original device, for even less than half the price, I can say that I am surprisingly pleased.

One of the great things about USB-C and Power Delivery, is that overkill is no problem. It‚Äôs not like there‚Äôs any worry of pulling too much power, and damaging your device. So, for the fact that this product successfully works as a replacement for my Apple charger, AND includes a free upgrade to upgrade-proof, especially at this price point, is just a really nice added bonus.

The only complaint that I have, is with the cable. It is decently annoying, but it doesn‚Äôt bother me because the product overall is such a great value. When plugged in to my MacBook Pro, it will (pretty often, actually) slip out of the USB-C port, justtt enough to disconnect from the device and stop charging. I have to gently snug it back in there, and it only moves this tiny little indeterminate amount. You would never be able to tell, by just looking at it that the connector isn‚Äôt fully seated in place, but when you slide it back in, you can feel it move a teeny bit, and you can feel it kind of snap back into place. Again, moderately annoying, but I don‚Äôt particularly find this to be a bother, considering I was perfectly willing and prepared to spend 2-3 times the amount of this product on the genuine Apple version. For the value? I really can‚Äôt complain.

Plus, if I ever decide that it indeed IS a bother, I could always buy another cable for $20 or less. Hell, I could even buy one straight from Apple, and I‚Äôm STILL saving money. So, again, I really can‚Äôt complain. For the manufacturer, though: I would definitely recommend replacing the cable that you offer, with this bundle to eliminate this issue. Cables are cheap, and even if you have to raise the price on this bundle accordingly (what, $1.00? $1.50?), it‚Äôs worth it to do so. I mean, come on; the charging block itself is a great value, at this price. The cable is just a bonus, anyway.
I needed a charger & fast as my brother took mine on accident. This charger is fast and is exactly what i was looking for at an affordable price.

I was looking for a good macbook charger and came across this really affordable one. It's been almost 2 months and it's still quick at charging and very sturdy too. The cord also comes with a good piece of velcro that keeps things organized. I like to use the cardboard box it came with to carry it around in my bag.
This is a great charger, great value.
Glad to find a replacement for a 5 year old computer.

Gets a little warm but so did the original one not an issue for me but only thing I didn't like it does not have the removable prongs to install a cord like an original apple chargers

Also for some reason it did give the not the correct charger message saying it wasn't getting enough power but it did charge while I was lightly gaming without it losing charge so beware if you might to heavy gaming or have a more powerful graphics card.

I bought this because I was looking for a spare charger for my 16‚Äù MacBook Pro M1 Max. You can‚Äôt really beat this thing for the price. Yes, it looks like a knockoff Apple charger because it basically is. But it works great (I tested it on 3 different laptops and an iPad Pro) and it‚Äôs a fraction of the price of buying an OEM Apple charger.

Observations:

1. It feels lighter than a typical OEM Apple charger, but I‚Äôm assuming that‚Äôs because this one is using GaN technology instead of silicon. I don‚Äôt think this is specified one way or the other on the product page though.

2. The included USB-C PD cable is a very nice touch. Usually, you have to buy the cable separately. I was also pleasantly surprised by the included cable‚Äôs overall quality. It‚Äôs not a braided cable, but it feels well made.

3. The charger is detected by macOS properly as a 118W PD charger.

This charger is a little more expensive than others on here but it's worth the extra cost. I've purchased a few of the cheaper ones and either had to return them or suck it up and buy a new one after the return time expired. This one hasn't failed me yet. It doesn't overheat like the cheaper ones and charges pretty fast. I would tell my friends to buy this one over the others.
This product provides good power to any laptop. Cord is simple and minimalist white.

I haven't had any issues so far, but it's just a touch bigger than the official Apple product. I wanted to use this to keep in my bag for when I'm out and about, but now I'm using it at my desk, and taking the official Apple charger with me.

name: ChomChom Pet Hair Remover - Reusable Cat and Dog Hair Remover for Furniture, Couch, Carpet, Car Seats or Bedding - Portable, Multi-Surface Lint Roller and Fur Removal Tool
description:
From the manufacturer
Benefits at a Glance
Remove dog hair & cat hair easily
Reusable, sturdy pet hair remover tool
No batteries required

The ChomChom Roller is one of the World‚Äôs Best Pet Hair Remover. By simply moving the pet hair roller back and forth, you immediately track and pick up cat hairs and dog hairs embedded deeply in sofas, couches, beds, carpets, blankets, comforters and more.

You have probably tried all types of pet hair and lint removal products‚Ä¶ from sticky roller tapes, to products that cannot be used over and over again.

With the World‚Äôs Best Pet Hair Remover, you'll never need another gadget! No adhesive or sticky tape, no power source required, clean and convenient pet hair remover. They make great gifts.

No Adhesives or Sticky Tape Required

Premium quality brush that traps pet hair. You can use it over and over again.

How to use

	

	

	



Step 1

Roll it back and forth in short strokes to trap the pet hair into the chamber.

	
Step 2

Press the handle catch to open the chamber.

	
Step 3

Remove all pet hair from the catchment chamber.

	
Step 4

Pet hair gone.

reviews.content:
The Chom Chom was love at first try. I have 4 cats and cat hair is a huge problem. Even though I vacuum regularly, it's the bedding, blankets, throw pillows, and furniture that I have a hard time with and that is where it gets all over my clothes. I hoist the vacuum up to do the upholstery but a vacuum doesn't work on throw pillows and blankets/bedding. And hoisting the vacuum up is laborious and difficult and I'm not going to get the vacuum out to do just that. I have a hand-held cordless vacuum but that doesn't do any good on the furniture etc. Even when I vacuum the furniture it still leaves finite hairs.

So the Chom Chom was the missing piece to my fur containment puzzle, and now I have the secret weapon needed to finally battle the fur and win! Plus, the Chom Chom is just fun to use. I do agree with one reviewer that the release button is easily accidentally triggered but I just have to be mindful to not press that spot and it's fine. It's easy to use, doesn't snag fibers (there's nothing on it that would snag), it's so easy to remove the fur from the chamber!

The first time I used it I was literally gasping in amazement at how easy and effective it is. And I bought this, I wasn't gifted it for a review. I did a bunch of research out of desperation, bought 4 different tools (one of them was a scraper kind of tool which totally snags fibers and ruins fabric, the Chom Chom is not like that).

I saw cheaper versions of the Chom Chom with very few reviews, but I chose the Chom Chom and I'm glad I did.

Also, it's great on clothing so this may replace my sticky tape rollers (which are effective, but I go through the papers quickly and it's hard to peel sometimes).

Give the Chom Chom a try, you won't regret it.

I had high hopes for this after reading reviews - and it did not disappoint!!
After trying it to get a little dog hair off the couch (our dogs aren't allowed on it, but with a Belgian Malinois that sheds a lot and a Pittie that sheds a little) and seeing what it picked up...I decided to try it on the carpet in front of our sink (why a builder would put carpet in front of a bathroom sink I have NO idea!).

Needless to say, this is where the disgusting part comes in...

Even after vacuuming well, I was disgusted at what this got up! Between the dog hair and MY long hair - CRAZY how much it got!

I can't wait to try this is the car/truck!!

Long story, but we have five cats. I recently bought gel rollers to replace the tear away, throw away rollers. Those are great for humans and their clothes. But but the cats sleep on my sofas at night. (We use Jersey slip covers on the sofas). And using the gel rollers was time consuming. I only have two and if I wanted to do a good job I‚Äôd have to rinse and dry them three times each.
I stumbled upon this product. I was skeptical. Looks like an as seen on tv product. I‚Äôve given in before to these types and have always been unsatisfied.
I gave in anyway.
Wow! I ran it over both sofas, even with having to hold the slip covers taught in a few places and within minutes I was done. The trap held more then I could see. I was also able to three beds quickly with ease.
I‚Äôm very happy and this product was worth every penny. Thank you.

Terrier mix and Sharpei owner here. Both dogs shed and there‚Äôs the eternal struggle of how to moderate the hair shedding. The stairs were in need of a deep clean and I used both this product and a Furminator broom on every step. Between the Chom and the broom, Pic 1 is what had been living in the stair carpet for who knows how long!

Pic 2 is the stairs after the final step, the vacuum. Pic 3 shows a full vacuum container, a good 1/3 of that being from the Chom and broom. I had to really put my arm into it but so worth it. My only complaint about the Chom Chom is the placement of the button to open it. Maybe it‚Äôs just my grip but I hit the button a lot and it pops open while I‚Äôm cleaning. Still worth the purchase.

I don't usually review products, but when I do it's because they're either amazing or their garbage. This product is amazing! Honestly, I didn't expect it to work, but wanted to try it anyways as it had such awesome reviews and am glad I did. It grabbed all of the cat cat hair in one swipe, on a chair that did not even look like it had that much cat hair. It swept it into the little bin and deposited it without creating a mess. It's incredible! I will save a ton of money. No more of those sticky lint rollers. Whoever invented this is a genius!

My daughter in law purchased one of these for her 3 dogs. She raved about it. I was skeptical, and the high price kept me at bay. I finally pulled the trigger and bought one... OMG... I have never seen anything like this. I have a long haired GSD (4-5 inch) and I vacuum daily. Of course, he sleeps on my bed and my couch on top of sheets I place to keep hair off of ME. One swipe of this thing and the hair was GONE!! He loves to rub against my bed skirt which is WHITE he's black and well... you know what happens. I fight this daily and almost removed it. This tool is a breeze on my skirt as well, I would have never guessed it! Well worth the investment - LOVE this remover.

I bought this and told myself I was crazy for spending this amount of cash on a pet hair remover. I thought, ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no way this thing is worth that. I‚Äôll return it as soon as it gets here‚Äù‚Ä¶ but I WAS WRONG! It shipped quickly, and I opened that sucker up and used it all over the place the day I got it. It pulled up every single hair out of the back of my couches where the cat sits. I couldn‚Äôt believe it did such an amazing job. I‚Äôve tried vacuum attachments and tape rollers specifically made for pet hair that didn‚Äôt do as great a job as this thing. The key to it is the 2 rubber arms that extend the length of it. They pull the hair up so the bar can grab it and push it into the reservoir. Bottom line- I am not returning it. It‚Äôs fantastic! It even worked on my throw pillows, which have little tassels at the end. It can pull the hair out of the tassels too! I love it!!!

I do not leave many reviews, because honestly who has time for that lol. That being said, this is the best dog hair removal product that I have ever tried and I have tried SO many. Other rollers, scrapers, vacuums and vacuum attachments... They've worked to a point but either not worked super well or been frustrating and time consuming to use. I was pretty skeptical of this but decided to try it anyway and it works like a dream. I have a shepherd mix and another short haired dog and the amount of hair that gets on our furniture shortly after cleaning it has always been so frustrating. I got this in the mail today and tried it out and I only had to roll over the sofa cushions a couple of times before this thing picked up all of the hair. I am so excited to have this as it's going to make cleaning super fast and easy. I would definitely recommend for probably any kind of pet hair.

This pet hair roller is the best I‚Äôve used, seems well made too. My cat has really fine short hair, and this picks the hair up off the chair cushions, pet bed and bed comforter really well. If you have a goofy cat like mine, you can use it directly on your cat if you want, mine actually likes it lol. The only thing I don‚Äôt like it the lint chamber door release button is right where I like to place my thumb, and it pops open, but it‚Äôs definitely not a big deal, just have to remember to adjust my grip.

¬†Honestly, every pet owner should purchase this. I was nervous to purchase this at first, because to be honest, it looks like a tacky cheap item and it's actually not!
The amount of lint rollers I go through is unreal, and this thing really does get the job done. Now I don't typically use this for clothing that I'm wearing, but I have before it worked very well!

I typically use this for my couches & blankets and bed sheets, and I'm always amazed at how well it works. You use this in quick back and forth motions and it does pick up so much pet hair in seconds! I love to do this in my guest bedrooms as the last thing before my guests arrive.

Pros: Super easy to use. Works great on blankets or bedding, couches, car seats, even my sweaters! The overall quality of the Chom Chom seems great and not cheap. I sometimes use a bit of force when moving the chom chom in the back and forth motion, and I'm not worried I'm going to break or snap the thing. It is something that I would keep in my home and not in my work purse like a typical lint roller. It's super easy to empty and clean out.
I think this works best on flat surfaces.
It does pick up link, tissue remnants and anything trapped that the dryer didn't get very well.
I haven't had to clean the brush surface much; it stays pretty clean from simply emptying the compartment. It can easily be cleaned with a soft towel soaked with water. Chom chom recommends replacing the gadget over time, I'm not sure when that would be, but I've had mine for over a year, and I don't feel the need to replace it anytime soon - and that's after daily use.
Doesn't damage my furniture or blankets. Neve snags on anything as well.
Comes ready to use, and no assembly needed.
So easy to use, it's handy to have on every floor!

Cons: It does tend to work best on tight areas. For example, if my blanket was on my bed, I would tend to pull the blanket tightly before using. I found it easier to pick up the dog hair this way.
If your duvet or blanket has texture to it, I found it somewhat difficult to use on.
I sometimes hit the button that opens the compartment where the fur is collected, but it's so easy to re-shut, this didn't bother me too much.
I would recommend not using this on curved or lose fabric, as this seems to work better on flat, tight furniture.
It's not quiet when using, so I wouldn't recommend using if you're trying to stay quiet while cleaning!

Con & Pro: you do need to empty the compartment every time (or at least I do with two dogs) but that isn't such a bad thing, because it shows the chom chom is doing its job well!

Overall, great purchase and don't regret at all. I never realized how much fur was on my carpet or blankets after the dryer.
