reviews.content:
I got this particular scale for two reasons. One is that is has a high capacity of 22 lbs. My current scale does not go that high, and I‚Äôve run into the limit once or twice. The second reason is that unlike other models, this scale has an elevated surface above the LCD, so it won‚Äôt be covered when weighing something that‚Äôs larger than the surface. It‚Äôs a problem that I‚Äôve encountered with my current flat scale.

My first reaction was that it was small‚Ä¶ Well, smaller than my current scale. My second reaction was that, while I wasn‚Äôt sure about this when ordering because I thought it might be bulky, it is not, and would be easy to find a place to keep it.

The scale is packed very well, with foam strips between the weighing surface and the scale to prevent it from movement and being damaged in transit. There is very little non-recyclable material in the packaging.

The LCD is nice and bright. The instruction card is pretty small, though it does explain usage, which is pretty obvious. One thing that is not mentioned in the instructions is that to turn off the scale, you have hold the power button for a few seconds. If you don‚Äôt use the scale it will turn off automatically after 2 minutes. There is a hold button, shared with the units button. The instructions don‚Äôt describe this button, but in the reviews I read that it will keep the scale on for 5 minutes of non-use instead of 2 minutes. This is helpful if you‚Äôre retrieving or cutting ingredients, or want the tare value to remain for a longer period of time.

I happened to have a 50g weight for calibration on another scale I have. I checked the scale and in fact it read 50 grams in most locations on the surface. If I moved the weight to a corner or edge, if it did vary, it never went below 49g or above 51g, within the tolerance of the unit. I‚Äôm confident the weight will be accurate.

So far I am very pleased with this scale, and plan to stop using the larger Polder scale I‚Äôve been using until now.

So I purchased this about a year and half ago and have used it almost every day since and it has held up perfectly and is one of my go to kitchen tools for my weight loss journey. When counting calories it is best to weigh foods for most accurate calorie count and I do this day in and day out multiple times a day and I still haven‚Äôt had to change the first battery I put in this scale. I have a spare battery tucked away that came with it but have yet to use to. I love the color and I love the size. Easy to store and travel with if needed - I‚Äôve taken this on multiple vacations and weekend trips. The buttons are more touch style than a press style so it did take me a couple uses to get the hang of that but now I can quickly switch between measurement units and zero out the scale. It wipes clean easily too which is nice. It has little rubberized feet to keep it from sliding on your counter which is also a nice well thought out feature. When I purchased this scale I figured for the price it would be a great starter scale and that I would just upgrade once I got the hang of weighing foods and by then it would have stopped working‚Ä¶. Nope! Still going and still awesome! If you‚Äôre trying to lose weight and are considering weighing your food this is a great scale to get you started. You can‚Äôt beat the price and the multiple color options are nice! It‚Äôs very basic but it‚Äôs absolutely fabulous anyways. I highly highly recommend this scale.

If you're in the market for a food scale, I would highly recommend this one. I recently purchased it and have been thoroughly impressed with its performance. In fact, I would give it a solid five stars.

One of the things that I appreciate about this food scale is its long-lasting battery life. I have had issues in the past with food scales constantly draining their batteries, which can be frustrating and inconvenient. However, this scale has held up really well and I have not had to replace the battery nearly as often as I did with my previous scale.

Additionally, I love the sleek design of this scale. It is modern and stylish, and looks great in my kitchen. It is also very easy to use, with a simple interface that allows me to quickly and accurately measure my ingredients.

We took chance on this and couldn't be more pleased. This scale is a fraction of the cost of some more expensive and more functional scales. While we appreciate the easier to view, pull away, and backlit display of a more expensive scale for cooking we love the lightweight, accurate, and simple operation of this affordable, slim, accurate, and elegant scale. It's very satisfying to find something affordable that does not look or feel cheap. The packaging was a fine example of elegant, simple, and recyclable packing and the extra button cell was a generous and thoughtful touch. This brand is now on my radar screen and I wouldn't hesitate to try their other products too.

Despite the specs given in the product description, I was very surprised with how thin and light this scale was. This isn‚Äôt a problem but I‚Äôm almost afraid to put this thing on the counter for fear of breaking it. Another review I read mentions how the buttons are smooth to the surface and have to tactile feel and this is precisely the case. I don‚Äôt find this to be an issue but understand how others could. The description also suggest a glass top to the scale but I don‚Äôt believe there is glass anywhere on this thing, just highly polished plastic. Lastly, there were not instructions included with the scale.
Despite these things I am satisfied with the unit. It stores away most anywhere in the kitchen and does everything I need or expected it to.

I wanted a scale that would be a compliment to my weight loss and healthy eating journey. I looked at several of them, and most could measure weight, but not much else. I chose this Greater Goods scale because the scale makes it easy to get several nutrition facts all at once, such as various measures of fat and sugar content. I like that it can measure food items up to 11 lbs. The scale also lets you switch between ounces and grams (up to hundredths accuracy) for lighter foods. It's easy to clean, and looks nice too. I'm happy with my purchase.

This is almost a daily use item. We keep it in our top drawer in the kitchen.

We use this on lots of items. Our most frequent use is weighing meat portions. That's huge for us as the meat portions are were we over eat in our calories.
The scale is simple and easy to use. It is easy to zero-out and weight. I included the instructions via the web.

Good quality product. Great service. Fast response for any questions. We are using this one in our camper for staying on track.

I use the scales for other items in my day to day like weighing coffee beans and roasting chips for brewing.

I have a scale that I brought back with me to the US from England. It lasted a good 15 years, so when it was time to buy a new one, I wanted to make sure I chose well. After reading the reviews, I went with this scale and I am glad I did. It is lightweight and not bulky, and it works like a charm. Controls are simple and the digital read-out is bright and easy to read. The overall look is elegant, too, which I appreciate.

Small kitchen scale with various weight settings like grams, ounces and pounds. It has a tare setting so you can set a bowl or whatever you choose on the scale. Hit tare and it 0's out for accurate measuring of what you are needing weighed up. To reset it, simply remove your bowl or whatever you used for storing and hit tare again and you are back to 0. I love this! It even came with 2 batteries!

Like the fact that they included an extra battery for future use. I have a postage scale that we use occasionally in the kitchen and thought this scale would be a better option. Having just received it I am pleased with the packaging and performance. I compared it against my postage scale and it was right on. Like the fact that it has a much higher capacity than my postage scale and it's easier to read. I recently purchased one of the Greater Goods blood pressure monitors and interacted via email with their customer service on a question with the phone app and they responded quickly, had me up and running the app in no time.

aboutProductTopics.name: Make sure this fits by entering your model number.

A Smart Choice: Greater Goods classic kitchen scale is the perfect introduction to measuring your food for better cooking and portioning at home. A scale that does everything you need, does it well, with a little extra, looks great while it‚Äôs doing, and is priced right.
Fresh Features: All of the qualities you need and expect in a kitchen scale: readings down to the gram, an eleven pound capacity, four units of measurement, and an easy-to-clean, smooth surface.

Simple and Stylish: Never let a kitchen accessory cramp your style again. The simplistic, modern design of this scale fits right in with the decor of even the trendiest space. Looks good, and if you need to, it‚Äôs compact and easy to store.

True Support: Our friendly team in St. Louis are industry experts at-the-ready to assist you with any questions that might arise about your kitchen scale. We take pride in our work and want you to have a great experience from beginning to end.

Beyond A Purchase: Yes, we design and produce high functioning, slick looking kitchen scales, but we value the positive impact of a purchase, on a global level, as much as anything. That‚Äôs why we only partner with ethical factories and ensure a portion of every sale is given back to a charity that aligns with the nature of what you‚Äôll be using. Learn more about how we give back in the short videos on the side tab!

name: Utopia Bedding Zippered Mattress Encasement Queen - 100% Waterproof and Bed Bug Proof Mattress Protector - Absorbent, Six-Sided Mattress Cover
description: Product Description

reviews.content:
Yeah? Rather sleep in your car? Yeah? Buy a tent and sleep outside? I did! Like most of the stories on here this will be long. If you just wanna know if it‚Äôs a good product then stop here, yes it is. If you wanna hear my story with the spawns of Satan then read on ..
I caught my case pretty early because I am terrified of bugs. That‚Äôs not to say I only had one or two. When I started waking up with bites, and literally feeling them crawl on me I finally did a thorough inspection. BOOM! Right near my feet was a nest. I‚Äôve never been more scared in my life! Grabbed a credit card and tupperware and scraped the whole end into it, then hurried and sealed it shut. Called my landlord the next morning and someone came and confirmed what I already knew. To say I freaked out was an understatement. When he told me he was behind and could take weeks to come do I‚Äôm pretty sure I had a mini heart attack. Now you should know I live in low income housing and they have to treat it (thank God) but weeks?!? I have 2 kids and my youngest carries his blanket around like the Charlie Brown boy. Let me also add that before I knew I had them I would bring my bed blanket out to the living room in the morning. UGH!! The first thing I did after my panic attack was buy some DE. Literally dusted all sides of my bed and box spring in it. I then dusted heavily around all four sides of my bed. After that I laid down three strips of double sided tape at the entrance of my bedroom, added more DE, and closed the door. Once on the other side I completely sealed off my bedroom with those plastic tarps and heavy duty tape. I then once again laid down a thick layer of DE and 2 more strips of double sided tape. If one of them could have made it through my wall of China I would have shook his hand and gave him a pat on the back! I also opened up the bedroom window so they wouldn‚Äôt smell my CO2 and try to come to me. Figured if the window was open that maybe it would throw them off. I have no idea if it worked or not. But they never showed up in my sons room. They say not to sleep in another room cause they‚Äôll just follow but I‚Äôd rather eat a roach then spend a minute in that room. Luckily my 14 year old has severe OCD and absolutely nothing in his room except 2 dressers, his tv and chair and his bed. Let me add here that I immediately bought the climb ups, sent my oldest to his fathers for a few weeks and slept in his bed. All outlets that weren‚Äôt in use were taped up, layered! The ones I had already caught I decided to have them be my test subjects. I put some DE in there then taped it back up and waited. It‚Äôs true that DE doesn‚Äôt work immediately but I notice it def stuck to them and even made it hard for them to stay on their feet. They kept flipping upside down. In another container I just had them in there and taped the lid. My landlord said they can suffocate after awhile. WRONG! For four weeks I watched them walk around like it was their home. They don‚Äôt suffocate, even vacuum sealed they still have enough oxygen to live awhile!! But by day 2 the DE did its job, they were def dead! But unfortunately I still had to go into the room of death to clean it out for the pest guys. I put trash bags over my shoes, taped it real good, and used doctor gloves for my hands which also was taped around my wrists. How did I get in and out of that bedroom you might ask. Well luckily I live on the first floor and went in and out thru the window. Basically anything I haven‚Äôt used in a year went straight to the trash. The things I did need and wanted to keep were doubled bagged, sealed tight and brought outside. Things I couldn‚Äôt wash or get wet went into a storage container with DE. Oh and to the person who showed video that they can‚Äôt climb scotch tape you deserve an award my friend! Anyway I put those certain things into the container with the DE and put scotch tape along the entire top of the bin inside, so if they were in any of those things and tried to climb out by the time the reached the scotch tape they fell right back down into the DE. Like one person said, make friends with garbage bags cause you will be living outta them. I bagged things that needed washed, threw the tightly sealed bags out the window and then double bagged them again before getting put in my car to be dried. They say 30 mins high heat kills them, but like I said these things paralyzed me so i did 40-50 most times, especially with clothes close to the bed. Everything on the bed went right into the trash, I was too scared to even touch them, except for my pillow, no literally, I have one of those My Pillows and it‚Äôs amazing. I washed that then fried it. Bought a couple cheap pillows, put the freshly washed pillow covers on and used double sided tape to seal off the ends. BTW, double sided tape works perfectly to seal shut ur pillows instead of also buying pillow cases! Before this my bed was on the floor, I didn‚Äôt have a bed frame, so I bought a metal one from Walmart for 32$! Not bad to get ur bed off the floor right! After the treatment I put both the mattress and box spring protectors on, set up the metal bed frame, used scotch tape on each leg maybe an inch down from the frame, and put climb ups on the feet of them. I also dusted DE in each one just to be safe. And if one did happen to get on my bed and go down to it‚Äôs hiding spot or whatever they weren‚Äôt able to climb back up with the scotch tape there! Luckily 4 weeks later the pest guys came and did their thing, I reduced a lot of clothes and whatnot that has been sitting in my room for years and finally after weeks of sleeping in a tent then my teenagers room I was finally able to break down the Great Wall and open my bedroom for business again! Trust me, if ur reading this whole thing you‚Äôre prob like I am and becoming a bedbug expert. I highly suggest buying both protectors and even a new metal bed frame and climb ups if you can. If not then at least invest in some DE and scotch tape to dust everything you can and tape the legs of your bed so that they never get a chance to get to you again from the floor! Good luck my fellow insomniacs, you will win this battle!

Love this encasement! The price is great for the quality, and it has held up very well so far. We have had a Big Barker Dog bed (size giant) since 2015-ish. These beds are $400-$500. We have a 206lb Mastiff. Our dog bed has been used and abused, and Big Barker also didn‚Äôt make the waterproof covers when we purchased our bed. Plus, their covers are expensive! We needed an encasement to go over the bed but also to fit under the top cover, so I opted for this one. This encasement is a bit larger than our bed, but we just folded it over and put on the top cover. This product has really served its purpose- helped with the bed‚Äôs smell, protected the bed from wet dog and drool, and overall helped to extend the life of our dog bed. Would recommend to anyone!

Our apartment building has a problem with bed bugs and we wound up getting them in the living room, now doing our best to keep them out of our bedroom, so far no sign in there. Got this cover to prevent them from taking hold in the mattress just in case. This is nice and soft for the mattress, while the box spring below is now taped inside a giant plastic bag meant for use while moving. I like that it has strong velcro right over where the zipper stops and it is very bright white, which will make it easy to see anything in case they get up on the bed. It doesn't feel or sound so plasticy as other covers, however it does have a thin lining of plastic like stuff on the inside, but you can't tell from the outside; it's nice and soft!

Anyone who's interested, here's some other stuff we've been doing, hope it works:
We already had a metal bed frame, and I think it might be what saved us so far. I invested in a steamer that goes for 40 minutes and used it all over the furniture, carpet, and in cracks and baseboards.
I got some carpet sliding things for each foot of all furniture. These I chose instead of interceptors because we also put a smooth piece of packers tape on each leg, which hopefully will do that job of keeping them from crawling up, while the carpet sliders make it easy to move the furniture to steam and vacuum the carpet each week (and to re-treat every month or so).
Pesticides we are using: a light dusting of food grade DE, barely perceptible is what I heard is best, so they will crawl right over and through, rather than around it. We used this in cracks and crevices and in the groove of each carpet slider. We got the one here on amazon that comes with a duster. I have used DE in the past without the aid of a duster and it is much harder to apply properly and DE can really easily get everywhere and make a big mess. Also Crossfire, really nice stuff, with clear easy to follow instructions.
Unfortunately, like most apartment renters, we are subject to use a laundromat instead of a washer dryer in the unit. We bring our clothes there in pillowcases and toss the pillowcase in with the clothes. No need to use plastic bags IMO. We then us a hard plastic, smooth laundry basket, no grooves: make sure it's deep enough on the bottom so your clothes don't have a chance to touch the floor. We use this to pick up the laundry, it is cleaned off before and after. No clothing allowed on the floor, and for now we aren't using our dresser, just hanging everything up, socks and things like that inside a bag, hanging with everything else. And that's about it, so far so good. Good luck to all of you out there dealing with these mini vampires!! Breath, take care of yourself and do what you can to keep peace with your family too..it can be a stressful, exasperating thing :(

I've tried several different brands of King size mattress encasements over the years. This one rates:

* Standard for ease of installation. They're all a pain in the butt when you've got to wrestle a mattress larger than you are.

* Excellent for waterproofing. I have 4 cats and 3 kids who play on my bed and my spouse and I will occasionally eat and drink on it. There have been pet and child potty accidents and several spills and none made it through to the mattress.

* Great for the flap over the zipper pull. Other brands I've tried have much more difficult and less effective ways to hide the zipper and protect the opening there.

* Excellent for low noise and little bulk under the sheets. This was on an 11 inch king size memory foam mattress, so if yours is thinner you'll have more wrinkles than I did.

* Poor for washability. Even though I followef the instructions carefully the layer inside wrinkled up badly, so I think it's delaminated and that makes it trash as it's no longer waterproof or bug proof. It's also nearly impossible to dry. Put it on and forget it. I wouldn't have removed mine at all if I hadn't gotten a new mattress and decided to try to wash it before installing it on the new one.

I take care of a family member. Who no matter how many times I try. I have had to change linens everyday. I have bought and tried numerous mattress protectors. This one is fantastic. I protect my new mattress and I live in an apartment complex so you never know who has bed bugs. This covers entire mattress, waterproof and easy to put on. I have told family and friends about this one. Also it doesn't break the bank but gives a peace of mind.

I bought this for my new mattress because I currently have 2 pups that have accidents occasionally. Today this mattress protector was put to the test and passed with flying colors. Found a puddle on my bed and feared the worst, but took this cover off and my new mattress was totally dry!! Definitely recommend!

I co-sleep and am working to transition my daughter into her own room. I have a quilted waterproof piece that I put down, but I wanted something that would also protect the sides of the mattress. This thing was not easy for my 5‚Äô2 self to put on alone, but I did it. I had the mattress propped way up in the air and pulled it down over the top like a pillowcase. It withstood me shoving it onto the bed and pulling it the rest of the way down with no wear or tearing, so that was impressive. My daughter leaked through last night, and although I did have the quilted piece on top of this and under the sheet, I definitely feel safer having it on the bed. We have one for her bed as well, and that was easier to install because smaller bed size.

I foster dogs and I used this to cover an old futon so I could reuse it as a dog bed. I used it for a mom and 8 pups who pooped peed, and got mud all over, but it washed out easy and I can re-use it for the next time I foster.

I purchased 7 of these mattress encasement's and 1 box spring encasement's . They are such a BLESSING . Whatever these tiny black specs are they are not able to get thru these wonderful encasements ..I would give these a 200% satisfaction. Amazon doesn't have enough star ratings for this product or company..My review is a little long for some maybe, but maybe very helpful for others, who can't figure out what they are dealing with. Wasn't sure what we had, Thought it was bad thinking we were fighting fleas from animals...until I found a bug around my bed (which turned out to be a tick which can be mistaken as bedbug) then pulled mattress covers off and seen a creepy translucent thing looking at me.(turned out to be baby silver fish.) I live in a very wooded area with ponds and natural springs every where.. I freaked out... Then little black specks everywhere and small like white soft cocoons every where..And when I tried to vacuum the black specs seemed to dig into fabrics...was sure it was BEDBUGS until I started looking every where and found in kitchen, in staples , on furniture ( just laying there on top not moving) , drawers , inside fridg. ,dressers,laminate floors...you name it...in our new RV (Used 2016). Thinking Camping World didn't sanitize the mattresses .. Found them laying on top of leather seat counters , floors ect...
....Leaned against mattress in RV to grab something in cupboard started feeling bites on knees..cleaned off with white paper towel sure enough.. black specs that don't move.Bombed whole house and RV with the hotshot bedbug which has the insect growth regulator {NYLAR} ...Finally last week was directed to a an employee at Ace Hardware that has an RV and camps A LOT...KNEW exactly what it was...some call them( noisome ) or something like that because can't really see them unless you wipe area feeling bites with something white..can't believe it was so easy called {POLLEN MITES } that fall from trees with flowers or anything that hangs from trees and they love oak trees..he said his wife thinks he's nuts but he said you find them in other places you go in buildings ,stores ,garages ,( I said yes I was looking in the stairwell of my moms apt. building and even seen them there .)their every where and they get picked up on your clothes, shoes, dogs, cats, bird feeders on you porch, Ferraro cats(I was even blaming the used RV hadn't had but few months.).I was happy to hear from the start, that I would have bites from bedbugs, that you could see and I didn't even find bites when I was bit by the black specs . But could even feel biting on my head if I shook my head over sink area I would see black spec or specs that had fallen from head...Then I wouldn't feel biting anymore, and if I did I would rub head area harder with tips of fingers and sure enough would find more, then wouldn't feel bites anymore..So now I am seeing the light at the end of the tunnel . But still using hot water in washer and dry for over 30 min. Run already cleaned Blankets pillows ect. through hot dryer for 35 min. every 3 to 4 days and will continue until absolutely feel they are gone.. Am still keeping all clothes in totes or bags and towels sheets ect. My husband is no longer coming in and sitting on our furniture after working outside and hes not leaving clothes lay with other laundry, he bags it until I wash...Hardly seeing any but will bomb every few months as directed on the can. .. and make sure we treat outside to help keep from picking up so many...I hope this review helps a lot to someone.. .And you are not crazy. Exterminators will not find anything when you call and say you still have something..Don't waste your money . Just make sure to spray with something that will kill mites ect...and if it does not say it has a I.G regulator in it you can buy one and add to it..I used MARTINS I.G REGULATOR {the 4 oz bottle $19 HALLS can treat up to 5000 sq ft,or 1 oz bottle $9 Walmart online] and bug blaster indoor/outdoor which I got from Halls nursery think its an 8oz bottle $17,...can also order online on amazon. Others will pop up from other co. also like doyourownpest.com or something like that, if you prefer to order and save the running around trying to find .Don't bother with products from home depot, Lowe , or Walmart , unless the ones I listed.. and buy yourself a $10 insecticide pump sprayer..make sure to spray base boards . Can get different products to spay furniture ... I sprayed my underneath coach fabric with the bug blaster with I.G regulator mixture ,not the cushions... I did not really care to spend this much time on this review but really feel if it just helps one person it was worth every minute I spent explaining everything I dealt with..I have read alot of people frustrated trying to figure these noisome things out and people think your nuts. I feel so blessed that a real outdoors man encountered these things and knew that people call them noisome, but are really pollen mites. I had never heard of pollen mites either...

Only slept on it for a night so far. Seems pretty good. It was a lot easier to put on than I thought. I did it by myself and didn't prop it against a wall. I put it kind of diagonal on my platform bed. I carefully maneuvered by going from side to side. Barely took any time , kind of like the way I'd put on a duvet. Material seem thin and fragile to me but I'll update later on how that is at the time. I recommend so far. Good price, especially since I was having a really hard time finding an encased zipper protector in a queen size

reviews.content:
I‚Äôm obsessed with this thing. I hate dicing vegetables - especially onions. This thing is an absolutely breeze. I‚Äôm super busy and anything to save time without sacrificing quality, I‚Äôm game. I was worried this would be one of the many things I buy and use once before it gets buried in my cabinet. I‚Äôm happy to say I use this at least once a week when I‚Äôm doing my meal prep. It‚Äôs great with onions, peppers, celery, carrots, you name it! I like the size because it is compact but I sometimes have to quarter my veggies rather than halve then to fit over the slicer. Depends on if it‚Äôs a monster onion or the baby ones.

This thing is dishwasher safe which was a huge plus for me. Just beware that the blade plates are sharp! I accidentally cut my finger just grabbing the blade off the counter. Totally my bad, but just a heads up! This thing is amazing and I would buy it ten times over if something happened to mine!

Let me start out by saying, I hate cooking. I know hate is a strong word, but I hate cooking. And chopping veggies by hand? Hard pass. You can imagine my delight when I stumbled upon this gadget one day while perusing the app and thought to myself, now there‚Äôs a smart invention. I purchased it for fun to try it out given I‚Äôve been ordering meal subscriptions lately, and meal subscriptions are obsessed with having you chop stuff.

This thing really works! And the best part is, it almost makes cooking tolerable. Almost.

Pros:
‚Ä¢This thing really works. (Notice the earlier foreshadowing.)
‚Ä¢Easy to assemble.
‚Ä¢Easy to disassemble and clean. I just put it in the dishwasher.
‚Ä¢SHARP blades - ask me and my thumb how I know.
‚Ä¢Easy to store. Decent size.
‚Ä¢Takes mere minutes to chop veggies as opposed to hand chopping.
‚Ä¢Multiple blades/attachments.
‚Ä¢Great price.

Cons:
‚Ä¢I can‚Äôt think of any. Will report back if something comes up.

Tip of the day:
‚Ä¢You do have to slice smaller pieces for this to work. You can‚Äôt put half an onion on this thing and expect it to chop it, not unless you plan on standing on it. Smaller pieces = the way to be.

All this time in my life I‚Äôve chopped stuff (badly) the mess, the clean up, the band-aids needed when I could have been using this?
Machine washable people!!!!
Easy to use, stores neatly, has a large chopper and a dicer screen, and also some fancy vegetable swirly thingamabob that will never get used. You just slam that lid down and everything falls neatly into the container and it all over the floor.
Comes with handy brushes that we never use to clean it with because DISHWASHER SAFE!
Takes some force to chop raw potatoes, but even a weakling like me can do it, and I just imagine I‚Äôm at work thinking ‚Äúso, Bob, tell me again why you prefer your documents in Comic Sans font!‚Äù
I actually giggle with glee now whenever my recipe calls for diced something.

I like the vegetable chopper. Started off chopping various vegetables, but it really works best with onions. Though with onions, it takes a lot of effort to force the oinion through the machine. The spiral blade was completely useless. I don't plan to use it again.
In the end, the amount of effort needed to chop veggies was a turn-off. The way to fix it is to use 25% of the capacity. Takes 4 times the repetitions, but the amount of time is probably the same because you're not using your entire body weight to chop veggies! Also reduces likelihood of tripping, accidents and injury.

First off, I gave it a 3 for ease of cleaning because the top part (the blunt block that pushes the veggie through) has like 100 small crevices, and if you've used this to dice anything that's a little soft (tomato, mushroom, etc) you're gonna get pieces stuck in there. And the crevices are so thin you can't just pick them out. You gotta blast them or actually dig with a be spatula. Pretty annoying but, they can't really design that part in a different way so doesn't really feel right to dock them for it. Would be like saying a burger is bad because beef gives you gas. Not the burger's fault, not yours, you get it.

Now, to address many of the reviews talking about how you need a big man or you need to step on it. What? No no. Here's how you use the thing: lay the veggie on the blades, making sure none of it is touching the sides, but as far from the back (the side opposite the opening end) as possible, as the farther toward the back it is, the less it can close down before touching the veggie. Then push *with your normal strength*, until it's not going anymore. At this point, the cuts have started. If you just push, push, force slowly with umph, it can smush the softer veggies. No - what you do at this point is literally smack the thing down, (guys: like it just checked out your wife - ladies: like it just told you to smile more). Think of it like the difference between pushing a sword through something more slowly, vs just jabbing that som' b. with pinache. The cut will be more clean, and you will have momentum adding to it. You don't need to be strong to do this. I'm short enough that women don't swipe right on me in dating apps. I am smol man. But that thing, it checked out my imaginary girlfriend. I can't just let that slide. *WHOMP*, boom, cleanly diced tomato, only a little marinara snot.

If you're calling on a guy to do it, or you're stepping on it (can't believe that one, wow dude) you're definitely not getting the full appreciation. It's nice to just hit something now and then. And how often do you get to hit something and then cook it. This is called opportunity, my friends. This thing is amazing.

Now onions don't make me cry. I make them cry.

I liked that it came with cleaning tools to make sure that you can get all the little pieces out after using. I will say that tomato skins got stuck pretty easily and we‚Äôre more difficult to clean. That said, definitely will make food prep a lot easier and happy to have it in my kitchen!

I would avoid putting the plastic bin in the dishwasher. I‚Äôve had similar products and it will warp with the extreme heat, so definitely hand wash and let it dry! That‚Äôs probably the only downside.

This is the best purchase i have EVER made. This thing is SHARP and so easy to use. I can chop all kinds of veggies in seconds. The longest part is prepping the veggies and even that doesn't take a long time. This thing is so easy to clean as well. I just use the sprayer on my faucet to get out any little pieces of veggies if any.

I asked my husband to get me an onion chopper for Christmas because I was so damn tired of CRYING until I was blinded. And even when I would somehow manage to get through half the onion I would give up and haphazardly chop the rest, hoping to avoid any fingers. It‚Äôd be unevenly cut and I would just tell my family ‚Äúchew and swallow.‚Äù So my husband was tired of me whining about a first-world problem and got me this chopper to ease my sorrows. And it‚Äôs been awesome! The blades are super sharp (my index finger can attest to that) and it cleans up pretty well in the dishwasher. Sometimes there are small pieces of onion left behind but the provided bristle brush helps remove them. I also really love using it when I‚Äôm cooking with colorful vegetables because having all the pieces the same size is very aesthetically pleasing. So five stars!

I'd have to say this is one of the BEST kitchen purchases I've ever made. It makes prep work so simple and fast. Instead of chopping veggies for my husband's omelet each day, I just chop for the whole week on Sundays. This has certainly been a game changer in my kitchen. I highly recommend this product for meal prep.

I only use this to cut up onions for my food cart, but its 3 lbs a day and has cut them flawlessly. I'm not gentle with tools, and if the onion fits in the blade area, I jam that top down and cut it. Half an onion at a time, like it or not. ZERO ISSUES. I bought several from wally and broke them. So if you need a complaint, the durability is due in part to the plastic supports under the cutting body (smooth on top, compartment walls under) and it is fiddly to clean there. But food doesn't go there, kinda like a pan - always clean where its needed (inside), maybe imperfect where its not. Also, the little tool (that cleans the grid that presses the onions through) is ornery to pick up 50% of the time. You'll see... Anyway, the chopper, for my purposes is that close to perfect. OH! I almost forgot...if you touch the sharp side of the cutter, you're cut. I sharpen tools a lot in my wood shop, but this thing is scary sharp!

reviews.content: I wish I had bought these years sooner, they work great and it's a big help having a pair in a drawer of every room. Makes getting to them quick when I need to use scissors a big help.

For whatever reason I don't know,but scissors have disappeared at our house. So, these 3 in different colors should last longer because I took 3rd choice and am keeping mine safely stored in my workshop drawer away from the ghosts that take them without our knowledge. And yes , they are sharp and sturdy as would be expected.
Scissors have a way of disappearing in my house. These are great quality. You can‚Äôt beat the price.

I'm always hunting for a pair of scissors and wanted multiple pairs in case one was misplaced. This was the perfect solution. They are great quality, the colors are nice, and I am able to put my hands on a pair of scissors when I need them. I keep a pair in the garage, a pair in the kitchen drawer, and a pair in the office. Perfect.
These scissors are very sharp and sturdy for a great price and speedy delivery.
Not going to say the best scissors ever - but they work pretty well and for the cost of 3 it's a great bargain. Even if I lose a pair every few years, this set will last me almost a decade lol
feel nice, work fine
Very sharp, I use them in the office and they have never let me down.
I‚Äôve used them to cut clothes and they‚Äôve dulled fairly quickly but that might be my daughter since they weren‚Äôt made specifically for cutting clothing.
I think I will enjoy using these very much. They are clean and sharp with precise cutting. Nice.

name: SUPER DEAL Compact Mini Twin Tub Washing Machine, Portable Laundry Washer w/Wash and Spin Cycle Combo, Built-in Gravity Drain, 13lbs Capacity for Camping, Apartments, Dorms, College Rooms, RV‚Äôs and more
description:
Product Description



Superior 1300RPM Motor

Upgraded 1300RPM motor + max frequency of 60Hz.
Large wave pulsates + New water flow
Less twisting of the clothing + better cleaning & washing effect

Overall Dimensions: 23‚Äù(L) x 13.5‚Äù(W) x 26‚Äù(H)
Washer:12‚Äù(L) x 13‚Äù(W) x 14‚Äù(H)
Spinner: 7‚Äù(Dia) x 9‚Äù(Dep)
Waterproof Rating: IPX4
No assembly required
Portable Washing Machine with Spin Dryer
Ideal For Limited Spaces: If your room is not so spacious and you would like to have a washing machine, there is no problem on that

This compact twin tub washing machine is perfect for those with a need to multi-task, save space and may want to save themselves a trip to the expensive laundromat.

Manufactured from a durable ABS body, it is ideal for camping trip, dorm, RV, apartment or anywhere with limited space.

Please Acknowledge Before Purchasing:

To ensure the quality, product will do water intake and drainage tests by manufacturer.It will be re-cleaned&dried, but may have some water left inside to cause wet/water stain.

Design with washer tub and spinner tub; Wash tub capacity: 8 lbs + Spin tub capacity: 5 lbs
Spin and Wash at the same time, 15 minutes washing cycle & 5 minutes spin cycle
No more costly trips to the laundromat
Separate timer control settings for wash & spin cycle operations
Built-in Gravity Drain & Water Inlet Hose
Heavy bottom, lightweight top weight distribution for stability

	

	



TWIN TUB DESIGN

Designed with separate timer control settings for washer and spinner operations.

Washer Timer: 5 kinds of washing time for you to choose (0/3/6/9/12/15 mins)
Washing modes: Standard/Drain/Soft.
Spinner Timer: 5 kinds of spining time (0/1/2/3/4/5 mins)

Put the clothes in - fill with water - set time - hit start button - Go and sip your coffee - Take it out. Simply enjoy clean laundry and fragrance of laundry detergent! .

	
WE PAY ATTENTION TO EVERY DETAIL

Comes with a cover plate, when you use the spin tube, put it above the clothes to protect them from being thrown away at high speed.
Upgraded design ensures it runs quietly without any annoying noise.
High-strength plastic material ensures this machine will never be rust eaten.
A drainage tube allows you to easily drain out dirty water.
Equipped with water inlets on both sides of the washing machine. Comes with inlet hose.

	
VERSATILE USE

Great for doing small loads of delicate clothing like under garments and more.

You can also wash sheets, towels, jeans, T-shirts and numerous smaller articles.

Easy to move and transport to anywhere, lightweight and space-saving design allows it easily fit in a bathroom or closet, ideal for dorms, apartments, condos, motor homes, RV‚Äôs, camping trips or anywhere with limited space.

FAQ:

Question: How noisy/rattly is it compared to a standard washer?
Answer: NOT LOUD AT ALL. Just do not put too much in the spinner to make it off balance.
Question: Can I wash jeans in the machine? How many pounds can it handle?
Answer: Absolutely! It can handle 8-9 lbs. You can wash 4 to 6 shirts or pants. Or numerous smaller articles. 3-5 pairs of jeans would be no problem.
Question: Do I need to purchase any additional items for it to function properly?
Answer: It comes with everything you need. Some customers may need to buy additional adaptor for faucet to better fit the inlet hose.
Question: Does the dryer really dry the clothes?
Answer: Actually it will basically dry the water. You may still need to air-dry the clothes. You can wash and spin dry at the same time. It is such a lifesaver!
