name: COSORI Air Fryer, 5 QT, 9-in-1 Airfryer Compact Oilless Small Oven, Dishwasher-Safe, 450‚Ñâ freidora de aire, 30 Exclusive Recipes, Tempered Glass Display, Nonstick Basket, Quiet, Fit for 1-4 People
description:
From the manufacturer
COSORI Pro LE Air Fryer
Your Efficient Kitchen Helper

The Cosori 5.0-Quart Air Fryer looks beautiful in the kitchen while creating perfectly crispy meals in minutes with rapid air circulation, high temperatures, quiet operation, and easy cleanup

 
 
 
7 Presets Preheat Shake Reminder Up to 450¬∞F
5-Qt Capacity

The nonstick square fry basket can cook 2 lbs of frozen fries and 2 whole chicken breasts at a time.

Small Footprint

Modern and minimalist design, match your countertop without taking up too much space.

reviews.content:
This was an excellent purchase. Very user friendly, easy to maintain and clean. The overall size of the COSORI Air Fryer 5 QT is perfect for small to large size cooking. I am not a fan of too many kitchen appliances but I will say that this is well worth the investment for what it does and the rewards that it yields to your time management, nutrition and economic needs. Overall design and color is sleek, and simple, a little more boxy for my taste and space availability but I am able to live with it for the benefits that it yields.

Food experimentation was successful each time. The lamb chops came out excellent although I would try a lower temperature to begin the cooking process and finish it with the preset temperature at a shorter interval. The steak fries was also an excellent tester that passed the experimentation. The giant prawns cooked to the exact specification of tenderness on the preset temperature for seafood. This appliance is powerful from the standpoint of its cooking ability. I can put the ingredients in an 20-30 minutes later its done to the perfection that I require without having to spare a moment to keep an eye on it while I am busy with another task.

I especially enjoy the fact that it is an easy to clean and maintain kitchen appliance. The basket is easy to clean even after it cools down and the crustiness from the food hardens. A quick soak in warm soapy water after the basket cools down and soft sponge does the trick. No residue of smell left in the pan at all. The inner housing can be easily wiped down with a damp cloth when the entire appliance cools down makes for easy maintenance - no more than 1 minute.

It does make a huge difference in the prep and cooking when you need a quick and healthy meal after a long day of work. The COSORI 5 quart was the best after looking at a plethora of other air fryers and also having tested with my sister's (not COSORI brand). The cooking basket height and width is excellent - spacious cooking, especially if you like pans that give you room to maneuver the ingredients. The overall size of the appliance for the countertop would be slightly larger for a small kitchen with less countertop space but if you have room to spare you would hardly notice it taking up room; but for what this appliance does, I would say that the space issue becomes a non-issue.

The initial and subsequent cooking in the air fryer did not yield an odd smell that you would normally get from non-stick surfaces. I did follow the suggestion to preheat and I did it with a bowl of water-vinegar solution in the air fryer for about 20 min cycle two times. The price point for this appliance was reasonable especially for what you are getting. HIGHLY recommend this particular model of COSORI.

I've owned a number of different brands of Air Fryers over the past 10 years and it has been very hit or miss. I moved into a smaller place recently and wanted a new Air Fryer that was better suited for smaller spaces and not take up too much counterspace. I searched long and hard and decided on this one. There is another version of this one that is slightly smaller and is WiFi enabled. I elected to go with this one since I could not think of a situation that I would want to control this unit remotely (although you can see the WiFi indicator on the touch screen, it doesn't light up and there is no WiFi functionality in this unit. I assume the control panel on the WiFi version is exactly the same or they plan to make this one WiFi enable in the future as the reason for it being there.

I've used it several times already to cook wings, fish, shrimp, and I even cooked a NY Strip in it (yep! I Air-Fried a steak... I know, I know... I said the same thing to myself that you are thinking while it was cooking), but to my surprise, using the preset worked like a charm. The steak was evenly cooked to a perfect medium well temp, just the way I like it. It was juicy, had a little char on the edges, tender and delicious (I cook a mean steak regardless). When I cooked the wings using the Chicken preset, I ended up adding additional time and increasing the temp since my previous experience with other Air Fryers indicated that the presets always undercook chicken, besides the fact that I like to flip them towards the end to ensure they are crispy all the around. The unit indicated 20 minutes @ 360 degrees. I changed it to 25 mins @390. At the end I flipped and added an additional 5 minutes for 10 wings and then after a total of 30 minutes Bam!!! Perfectly cooked chicken wings. I reduced the time by 5 minutes if I'm only cooking 5 wings or so. Pause at the 5 min remaining mark and flip. They come out just as crispy as if they were deep fried (non-battered wings) Now, 30 minutes is in no way faster than pan frying but waiting a little longer for healthier food is not a deal breaker in my book, especially if the food turns out good.

The unit has a number of presets including one for Fries that alerts you when it's time to flip. I have not used that preset yet but found the presets on every Air Fryer I have owned, to be hit or miss.

Cleaning is a breeze. No, seriously, you cannot get any better than this. Simply let the unit cool. (DO NOT run it under water while it is hot, as it will warp the aluminum pan due to the rapidly changing temps which will also cause the Teflon coating to start to separate prematurely from the pan).

Remove the crisper tray and run it under water or use the sprayer and then gently wipe it with a wet sponge or dish cloth using just warm/hot water or a mild soap. The rubber ends are removable, but I just leave them on and clean around them. Rinse the pan and wipe the same way. This is the easiest Air Fryer to clean. The non-stick surface, like all other Teflon based coating will deteriorate over time or improper care, therefore, use silicone, Teflon based or wooded utensils in it to avoid scratching the surfaces.

It comes with no cookbook or any other accessories. There is an App that you can download that controls the Wifi version, but the App has dozens of recipes specific for use with both this model and the Wifi version.

It has an actual on/off button where most units need to be unplugged (I unplug it anyway since I don't trust touchscreen automated electronic panels which when defective can cut the unit on by itself). It has a timer and a preheat option. You can pause the unit, so you don't have to reset the temp/time if you open it to check on your food allowing you to continue once you close it (major plus). The outside of the unit does "not" get hot. The fan ports the hot air out of the rear and has a built-in guard to ensure you have space behind it so that it is not flush up against the wall. There is a startup process when you first get the unit. Following the instructions, you basically run through each setting and a few presets to familiarize yourself with it. You'll run preheat which will burn off and residual oils left from production. Unlike MANY of the others I have own or tried, there is no burning plastic odor when this thing is running. I had a different brand with an oven door and trays instead of a pan, that smelled like burning plastic that didn't go away until I THREW it away.

I chose this brand over so many others since I bought my daughter a previous model of the same brand. Since I have not heard a single complaint about it in 3 years' time, I conclude that it is still running fine because she would not hesitate to call me and let me know how much she hates the piece of junk I bought for her for Christmas that one year.

Overall, I am happy with this unit, although it did cut off prematurely once during cooking, but has since operated fine. I've had it less than 30 days but so far so good. It seems well thought out in the engineering department. While I should probably return for the one glitch, it has likely been resolved once the unit was unplugged and plugged back in.

I highly recommend this unit if you are only cooking for 1-2 people. YMMV

Overall I‚Äôm pleased with my Cosori 6.8 Qt dual blaze. There a few things I think you guys could innovate to make slightly better, but they wouldn‚Äôt stop me from buying the product.

The first Cosori we got was the 5.8 quart. The basket fell apart after a year though - the part where the plastic front was attached to the metal basket sort of disintegrated where the screws attach. Also, it was frustrating that the drawer was on a slight tilt forward, meaning if you pulled it out even a little it continued to slide forward and down on its own, which could lead to falling if you don‚Äôt have a massive amount of counter space in front of it. I loved how versatile it was for cooking though. This definitely got me hooked on air fryers. If I had done more research I might have realized that Cosori have a 2 year guarantee, so I should have contacted the company to see if they could give me a new basket. We just went ahead and bought a new one though because I wanted it to be slightly bigger.

The new one we got is the 6.8 quart dual blaze. This one has some improvements. I don‚Äôt know if the inside coating is actually different, or if it‚Äôs just been a while since I had the old one and I‚Äùm misremembering, but this one seems easier to clean. Everything wipes out really easily. It has a removable shelf inside instead of an entire basket you lift out. The shelf is easier to clean as well. The old basket had all the holes and slats that could be difficult to get grease/debris out of.

The only issue with the shelf is taking it out. It has two holes in the center that you're supposed to put your fingers through to lift it out. However, when your food is ready and it's hot, you obviously can't do that! So you have to get the food out itself with a spatula or tongs. If you do try to tilt the entire drawer over, the shelf falls out with the food. I think it would be good to have a handle that sticks straight up in the center, with a threaded screw hole in the center of the basket. That way you could grasp it to lift it out if you were making something like fries, etc, but if you wanted to cook an entire chicken you just unscrew the handle, and voila, the shelf is flat again.
I also think they should make four divets horizontally in the corners of the drawer, so that the shelf stays put if you do want to tilt the entire drawer over to dump something out. These divets should be strong enough to hold the shelf in place for an easy tilt, but with the screw-in handle it would still be easy to exert enough force on the shelf to remove it if you wanted.

I would also recommend putting little foldable ‚Äúfeet‚Äù on the sides of the shelf, so that you could raise it if you wanted, and cook something both in the bottom of the drawer itself and on the shelf. Again voila - instant accessory. That to me is a major selling point, and I doubt I'm the only one that would love a built in accessory like that.

One more thing - the dual blaze has the settings of reheat, broil, bake, air fry, and roast, but it does not explain in the instruction manual how the dual burners function accordingly. Example, air fry is both burners on high, broil is top burner high, bottom burner low, etc. I had to scroll through a dozen FB posts to try to find out if somebody knew, and I still only found 4 of the six settings. These should be clearly in the instruction manual.

Both products are still great and I would still recommend them, as evidenced by the fact that I bought another Cosori :) Just tweaks that would make them even better and might get some people more sold on them.

Ps- one more pro. The new dual blaze is much quieter than the old one.

Update 2/23/23: Check RECALLS on Cosori website (see photo). This CP358-AF 5.8 QT Pro not affected by this recall as of today.

First, and most importantly, NEVER use a NON-STICK COOKING SPRAY on any air fryer. It will ruin it and make food stick more. If you feel a compulsion to spray, spray the food ... not the basket. Also, don't scrub or use harsh abrasives when cleaning. Let it soak with the dawn dishwashing spray, or even water. (I've never placed it in the dishwasher, so I can't comment on how it stands up to that.) Most of the time, I've found that after it cools off I can just wipe it with a few paper towels.

Second, I love this air fryer. I personally prefer the air fryers with a detachable basket, which this one has. It's basically a basket within a basket. They are easier to use (from putting the food in to dumping it out) and even cleaning (by hand, at that). AND, this particular model has a replacement basket available for sale here on Amazon.

This air fryer is very easy to use. You press the power on button, then the preheat button, select the temperature using the +/- button and press the play/pause button. It tells you how much time it will take to pre-heat. Once it's preheated, added your food, press the temp/time button to toggle to the time, then press the +/- buttons to adjust the time. If you need to change the temperature or time at any point, you press the +/- buttons. (Many air fryers will not allow you to change the time or temperature midstream. You basically have to turn it off and start over. Not this one.)

The basket itself is a decent size. In fact, I think the only difference between this one and the higher capacity air fryers is the depth of the basket. This basket is more of a square shape with rounded corners, and it's not very deep. I like mine to have more surface area and not be as deep. I've found the food cooks faster and crisper.

I haven't used any of the pre-programmed buttons because I'm either following a recipe, or the instructions on the food bag/box/carton. I've found that this air fryer cooks pretty darn close to the instructions provided on the bag, as far as time and temp. I do always preheat the air fryer, regardless of what the instructions say.

My only gripe, if I had to find one, is that I wish the cord were maybe 3-6" longer since I sit my air fryer back on a center island (and the plug is down on the cabinet). Other than that, I really like this air fryer, which I got on sale for $89.

This is the perfect size for 1 or 2 people. Love that the touch buttons are easy to use. You can easily bypass the preset temp and time for things like veggies and fries. The interior surface is well coated and very easy to keep clean. The grate inside the interior is kind of a force fit so it doesn't fall out with the food. But very easy to pull out to clean. Love the audible alert at the half-way point to let you know the food is ready to shake before it finishes frying (that's automatic when you choose one of the preset times). It's a small footprint on the counter. Cleanup is so minimal. It's really changed my life. Before I heated a whole oven to roast vegetables and it took about 40 minutes, and would heat up the whole kitchen. Using the air fryer it only takes about 18 mounts to roast vegetables and they come out perfectly. I've used it to reheat chicken tenders and pizza, baked frozen toasted ravioli, baked potato skins. It's fantastic.

I haven't had one of these air fryers before so I can't compare it to others, however, I have found this cooker to be very handy, easy to use and clean, and exceptional at some things.
Steak would be my #1 favorite to cook on this, this is kind of sacrilegious for me to say that being a maker and avid user of BBQ grills and smokers, but it is true. After bringing a 1-inch steak to room temperature with seasoning on it for an hour or so, I cook it at 450 degrees for about 10 minutes (5 on one side and 5 or 6 on the other) to get to medium rare (134 degrees before resting). The char I get on the steak is comparable to what I get on a grill but with much less time and hassle.
#2 favorite would be the potato wedges, cut a potato into 1/8 wedges, soak in olive oil and seasoning, place them on their back in the fryer (no need to shake them at halfway point) and after 10 to 12 minutes you have perfect wedges. Now the steak has rested long enough and you are ready to eat a great meal ready in less than 1/2 hour!
#3 An honorable mention has to be made for the small pizzas you can make in these!

Take-away~ buy one that heats up to 450 degrees, when I first followed the directions that said 400 degrees the steak didn't have the nice crust without being overcooked - get one of those silicone baskets for easy cleanup - get one of those elevated grates, this puts the steak or other food up off the bottom closer to the heat source and for better circulation of heat under the food.

Approximately one month ago my wife and I bought a Cosori Air Fryer. We thought that the fryer would help this retired couple cook quick and easy meals with a minimum mess in the kitchen. For that month the Cosori met and even exceeded all of our expectations. Then things went wrong! In my first attempt to cook ground meat in the machine I thoughtlessly attempted to break up the meat with a kitchen tool. This action deformed the crisper plate. I attempted to remove the plate, scratching the basket non-stick coating rendering the basket a potential health concern. We reached out to Cosori Support in hope of purchasing a new crisper plate and basket. They responded almost immediately and advised that they did not sell the plates and baskets separately but would try to resolve our issue. After verifying our machine purchase they advised that a new basket and crisper plate would be shipped to us free of charge! In this day and age, it is refreshing to find a company who makes a quality product and will go the extra mile with it's customer service. I highly recommend this company and products.

*2nd Update* - I'm changing my rating to 4 stars because of the exceptional customer service from Cosori. They reached out and I explained the issues I was having with the first two air fryers. They graciously sent me a third air fryer, directly from Cosori, and this one works as perfectly as most of the reviews here state. I did not have any issues with a horrible lingering plastic smell and this one doesn't rattle at all. The basket even operates more smoothly, so third time was a charm. Still, one star off for the issues I had with the first two air fryers. Cosori takes good care of their customers, so don't hesitate to contact them if you have any issues!

*Update* - I'm lowering my rating to one star. The 2nd air fryer has also developed a loud rattle when the basket is opened and closed and intermittently during cooking. The rattle on the replacement is worse than the first one. May end up returning this one as well.

There are some features about this Cosori air fryer that I love, so I'll start with those first. Food turns out perfectly every time and it's much faster and economical than using the oven, plus the convenience of this appliance can't be beat. The large 5 quart capacity, for the low Black Friday price I paid, was an added bonus. I also like that the maximum temperature goes up to 450 degrees for searing, compared to most other air fryer's 400 degrees.

Now for what I didn't like. I'd read reviews about the strong and persistent odor but since my other air fryer, an Instant Vortex, didn't have an issue, I didn't expect this brand would be a problem. I ran the air fryer through the initial start-up according to the instructions. The burning plastic odor was significantly worse than my other air fryer to the point that it set off my smoke alarm for the first time ever, which really surprised me. The unit wasn't smoking but apparently the vapors released by the unit were triggering the alarm. This was very concerning. I unplugged it, let it cool, and tried it again. The alarm went off again. I finally finished the break-in process outside (although, the odor was still very strong outdoors) and eventually the burning plastic smell subsided, but I soon encountered another problem. The air fryer's heating element started rattling and vibrating badly whenever the basket was opened and closed. It also sometimes rattled while cooking. I decided the unit I received must be defective so I sent it back. I took a gamble and ordered a replacement. I did a few break-in cycles outdoors this time, which shouldn't be necessary, but I didn't want to take any chances. This unit seemed to be slightly less smelly. There are also no rattling sounds with the new one.

I've head such great things about the Cosori brand but when I compare it to my Instant Vortex air fryer that I've never had any issues with, this Cosori model isn't nearly as solid feeling and the quality just isn't the same. Since the price of this model was so good, I was considering buying others as Christmas gifts but changed my mind after my experiences with it.

My wife and I are so pleased with the COSORI 5 Qt Air Fryer. It put the fun back into cooking! It's the ideal size for a couple. Besides looking great - it can cook at 450 degrees - more than most air fryers. It also came with a 2 year warranty. It has 7 presets, ability to preheat, and a shake option. It doesn't consume much countertop space - its only 10 inches wide. It sits next to our stove. Additionally, we have a 12 inch wide butcher block cutting board that sits on our electric glass top stove. When we use the air fryer we place it on the butcher block cutting board under the exhaust hood to eliminate smelling up the entire house. And if we are also using our oven - the hot stove top does not affect the rubber feet on the air fryer. It did require researching recipe cooking times & temperatures along with a few trial and errors - then recording what really works on note files on our iphones for future reference. Research showed that some additional accessories also need to be purchased to get the most out of the air fryer. The basket dimensions of the 5 qt air fryer are 8.6 in x 8.6 in. We opted not to purchase their accessory pack - but instead purchased what we thought were better choices. Here is a list of the accessories we purchased: Soleader Plate Gripper (set of 2), Casaware 7 inch Ceramic Nonstick Pan, Dowan Ramekins 8 oz (set of 6), The Sweet Baker Professional Silicon Baking Cups (set of 12), and P & P Chef 7.5 in round racks (set of 2). Things we have done thus far with great success: chicken wings, drumsticks, thighs, steak, toast, fried pickles, eggs, pizza, tater tots, french fries, french toast, and baked potatoes. My favorite breakfast, poached egg on toast: crack 1 egg into a silicon muffin form (with a hint of avacado oil wiped around), cook for 6 min at 380 (no preheat) - and add toast after 3 min - just too easy. Cleanup after air fryer use has been very easy, a hot water spray and sometimes a bit of dishwasher soap.

I saw a recommendation for this air fryer and decided to check it out. Amazon had a sweet deal on it, so I couldn't pass it up. This unit replaces a Ninja model I bought just over a year ago. The Ninja worked well, but I couldn't pass up a new shiny!

Upon arrival I saw it arrived in a Cosori-labeled outer box, so shipping was not anonymous and porch pirates could steal it pretty easily. The unit was double-boxed but they went overboard with the packing tape on the inner box! All they needed was ONE piece as a security feature to show it had not been tampered with, but the entire top was sealed tight.

After liberating the fryer from its box, I removed all of the packing material inside it and washed it as prescribed. I followed their two-step bakeout procedure and for the first time was very surprised to smell ZERO outgassing products! The first air fryer I tried was so obnoxious with plastic outgassing I had to throw it away. The Ninja wasn't bad, but it still needed a couple initial bakeouts. The Cosori was completely unobjectionable.

So far, I've run a batch of Ore-Ida french fries through it and a bag of Ore-Ida Potatoes O'Brien. They both came out great. I like the touchscreen on it and the keep warm feature is real nice. They advertise a shake reminder which is good, but it only works at the midpoint of whatever time you set. Not the absolute most convenient. There's a bacon setting. I'm curious how that one will work.

This brings up a good design feature - the basket is a two part assembly. The inner part which is perforated to allow drippings to fall through is the part attached to the handle. The outer part is comprised of an inner solid aluminum shell and an outer plastic shell for insulation. Both the inner half and the inner shell are aluminum with a nonstick coating. So far, they're very slippery.

The fryer also incorporates an automatic shutoff circuit when the basket is removed. So, when you want to shake your food, you can just pull out the basket without fiddling with the controls (although, there is a pause button). The fan and heater will shut down and then restart when the basket is reinserted. The fryer settings remain unchanged so it just picks up where it left off.

I don't recall seeing anything about the basket being dishwasher safe. Handwashing isn't that big of a deal, but the parts are bulky and fill up a normal-sized sink pretty quick.

I'm going to play around with it more over Christmastime and see how the bacon and steak features work. So far, I'm happy with it and I see it featured in several online recipe websites. If Amazon has it for sale for under $100, I would recommend getting one.

reviews.content: I bought two of these hygrometer/thermometer two-packs. They are small, so make sure to look at the dimensions (sometimes pictures can be deceiving). I think the size is great for placing where they are needed, and they are easy to read. When I first received them, I placed all four of them next to an old old analog hygrometer I had, and all four displayed about the same reading as the old hygrometer. Quite close enough for my needs. I like placing them in different parts of the house and basement so I can keep track of temperature and humidity. In the summer, I especially will find these useful in the basement so I know if I'm succeeding in removing excess moisture with dehumidifiers. In the winter, I have already found them very useful in making sure humidity is in the correct range. It's also handy to see the temperature displayed. I have not owned them long enough to rate battery life. So far I'm very pleased with this purchase.

I live in Missouri and found out not two or more rooms are creative in temp room. So with reviewing different indoor room thermometer with humidity, needed one to see like this digital then the other types. I took a chance and bought 1 at first to see this was back in May 11, 2022 and I liked it. So then on May 27 I bought 4 more. For the size it was just right and for giving me the temp. plus the humidity and the tiny face icon, added to it. Battery is still running. 1st one went in the kitchen. The others went to rooms. Then I order more several went to my cheese venture, inside cupboards, testing to see the temp. as I was preserving food items and needed to check the temp. and the humidity. I'm satisfy with it. Will be ordering more.

I've bought three of these now. I have one in my old ass car that does not have its own internal temp. reader, so this helps me know when I'm freezing my butt off or FREEZING MY BUTT OFF.

I have two of these monitoring a valuable collection of mine as well that I'd prefer be kept at proper humidity. I did some primitive 'testing' on these - putting them together and in different spots to see if they'd line up & they almost exactly did - maximum off by a 1-2 degrees/humidity percent in either direction, often quite similar.

Will continue to buy & as of writing this, still haven't had to replace any batteries (first one purchased well over a year ago.

Our RV has two zones for cooling and heating. The thermostats do not show what the current temp is, just what you have it set at. I first bought just one of these and placed it in the living area of our RV to have a more accurate reading of what the temp is. Love it so much, got another to put in the bedroom. So easy to read and its small enough it doesn't get in the way. Also has a magnet on the back if you want to hang it on a fridge or door handle.

I live in a relatively dry area. So, in an effort to provide the best care for my plants, I needed a way to measure the humidity level.

The "ThermoPro" arrived in an Amazon padded envelope. The item packaging was good. It even came with battery (1 AAA - included). Upon taking the item from the packaging and installing the battery, it took about 5 minutes to stabilize the reading of temperature and humidity %. So, now I know that humidity level is around 35%.

I did a test. I placed it in my shower a few minutes after taking a regular shower and it took about 8 minutes for the humidity to climb from 32% to stabilize at 87%! I find it very useful!

Pros:
1- Large clear display and easy to read.
2-Has a magnet on the back to stick to a fridge or ant metal surface.
3-It takes 1 AAA battery that is easy to find compared to others that utilizes special thin coin style cell.
4-Battery was included :)
5-Inexpensive.
6-It displays a smiley face when the humidity is within comfortable level.

Cons:
None at the moment. I will update if anything comes up.
Conclusion: Recommended ! 5 Stars.

Prior to purchasing this product, I had no idea about the humidity level in my house. The picture with 34% is in my kitchen on my fridge. The other one was taken after taking a shower (87% humidity).

I bought this 2 pack of thermometer and humidity meters as I need a constant reading in two rooms.

This is a well thought out meter with friendliness in mind. It runs on one AAA battery (yes!). The meter is about 2 x 2 inches, has an easy to read display, a fold out stand and a hang by magnet or by screw hole option. I ended up using the magnet option in one room and the screw hole option in another.

The top numbers of the display shows the temperature. The bottom number shows the percentage humidity level. There's also a face icon that shows a smile face if good humidity, middle no smile for okay, and a frown for not good humidity level.

I compared the meter to another one I already have that I know is accurate and this meter compares well.

Here is what I like and dislike of this meter:

Likes
-----
- runs on AAA battery
- simple to use
- accurate
- different ways to display (magnet, screw hole or stand)

Dislikes
--------
- magnet adequate but could be stronger
- screw hole adequate but cold be bigger an deeper for a better fit

Overall, I give the ThermoPro TP49 2 Pieces Digital Hygrometer Indoor Thermometer Humidity Meter 4 stars.

they are magnetic. Seem to work well. Display time & humidity in large font. Are they accurate? I have no way of knowing. But, I will say, when I wake up in the AM, my humidity is around 34% (low). After running the tea kettle and a vaporizer a few hours, the humidity measures between 45-55%. I am pleased to report they are registering the change.

This is the second one I've purchased. The first one is still working flawlessly in a humid, cold place going on three years now - on the original battery no less. I don't write many reviews anymore but this product I can highly recommend. Note - while the instructions are tiny, they are also unnecessary. One button changes it from F to C, that's it. It has a magnetic backing and can stand up if desired.

this thermometer is better than i expected. very well made, there is a magnet on the back so you can attach it to the metal surfaces, like fridge.
small in size, but reads very well from afar.

I need something small and cheap to go in the container with my 3D printer stuff, it came with a battery and worked great. Its really easy to read and there is a small button on the back to switch between C and F.

reviews.content:
This litte device is useful and has multiple functions. It is sturdy and can handle many chopping, dicing and slicing tasks encountered in cooking. Please familiarize yourself with all the parts and functions. The cutting edges are extremely sharp and must be always be used following the precise instructions, especially when using the slicing blades. NEVER, I repeat NEVER slice anything without using the cover attachment.
It is a small device, so if you are using it for a big job, you will need to empty the receptacle often because it fills quickly. I have used all the different blades and attachments and I am quite pleased with the results. Some of the attachments do not clean up easily because small pieces of whatever you are slicing or dicing get caught up in/along the VERY SHARP surfaces.
I would say, this is more than just a functional gizmo; but use with caution ‚ö†Ô∏è

Amazing. I took years trying to find the perfect chopper. Although I originally wanted one that was simple with only 4 blade sizes, I couldn't resist the price on this one and the reviews seemed to point out it was best regarding durability. It's so good even my mother in law loved it and so I ordered a second one just for her. Really saves time. The trick is to make sure you precut slices that fit within the frame and make sure you put the handle down fast enough, the slower the less effective it is. Blades are sharp. Finished boiled vegetable salad in less than 15 minutes vs a half hour or more with regular knife chopping. And I chop fast but when it comes to vegetables boiled they tend to stick to the knife. Buy it its worth it. Also comes with free frother you just scan a code and it's free shipping too.

This product works great. It is what it is advertised as. I love it. I wish the chopper area was a bit larger; but slicing veggies and other items to fit is quick and easy. I do not understand a lot of the negative comments; but I wasn't there when they had their problem. I experienced some of the cleaning problems, but quickly understood how to correct them. The multi-tined fork supplied with the product works wonders with a touch of patience. It can be a bit loud, but most of us play the TV and radio louder most of the time. My grates and chopping attachments are plenty sharp. No problem cutting anything yet for salads, salsa, veg medleys. Pare this with a good mandolin and you have an unbeatable combo - unless you are a professional chef with lots of time. It is sturdy and simple to use.

I suffer from arthritis in my lower back from having 3 back surgeries. Standing, bending, lifting ect, cause a lot of pain in my back. I love cooking but it keeps me on my feet for longer than I can handle. This product is going to save me soooo much time from hand cutting/chopping. I just got this chopper this week and used it few times. I love it already!

Everything that is included with the chopper and storage for blades feel very heavy duty, not cheap. The blades are extremely sharp making cutting into tomatoes smooth and avoiding making salsa instead of pico. (yes it‚Äôs happened to me) i do recommend if ur not a strong knife user, want to save time, want everything cut the same size, ect.

The one thing I believe will make using this a bit challenging is the inserts are very tough to remove. I could be missing something to make it easier to remove the inserts, will check booklet again.

you don't mind spending half an hour cleaning the top part of the chopper. Onions become impacted in the grid, and the grid is very time-consuming to clean. I found a wooden skewer easier to use than the included cleaning fork. I think I will buy a mini-processor with hand pull and dedicate that to onion grating, as it will be easier to clean. I did try to follow the directions of one reviewer who did many pounds of homegrown onions with the machine and the machine worked very well creating dice. It was the lengthy cleanup that took all the joy out of the process.

I still like this unit very much and will keep it for bell peppers. It took me 30 minutes to wash 6 bell peppers, clean out the insides, dice them, and clean the machine. The washing up was so fast, it would work just fine for 1 bell pepper. Just be aware it makes enough sound to wake up a baby. I haven't tried the machine on anything else yet, but I expect it will be useful for dicing potatoes and grating carrots.

I got the 10-in-1 version because it has plastic containers for storing the very sharp dicing and grating blades. The containers keep everything safe and compact during storage.

I recently purchased a vegetable chopper and I am thoroughly impressed with its performance. The chopper is compact, easy to use and clean, and made of high-quality materials. I love the various attachments that allow me to chop, dice, and mince a variety of vegetables with ease. The blade is sharp and cuts through even the toughest vegetables with ease.

One of my favorite features is the container that collects the chopped vegetables. It's a great size and prevents any mess or spills on the counter. The lid also snaps on securely, which makes it convenient to store leftovers in the refrigerator.

I would definitely recommend this chopper to anyone looking for a kitchen gadget that simplifies the process of chopping vegetables. It's a great investment for anyone who loves to cook and wants to save time in the kitchen. Overall, I am extremely satisfied with my purchase and would definitely buy this chopper again.

Bought as a gift for my wife after hearing how nice on of these would be. While I do find it a little challenging to clean , the praise that my wife gives this thing every time she uses it makes it worth is. Meanwhile I continue to use a knife. Probably cause I am too lazy to get this out of the drawer, and tearing up while cutting onions is normal to me. But hands down would buy another one and will likely due so as a gift for someone else in the future.

I got this primarily to help my youngest to make cubed potatoes as he is not yet able to work well with the high quality knives we have. In the past, I had a KitchenAid product similar to this but much more expensive, which I had to move on from when the slicing blade bent since the blades are not purchasable separately. This product has a very high quality feel to it with the build and feel of the plastic, the quality English in the instruction manual and the packing it came in. Some things that I would have liked to see in this: slightly larger in size so that the leverage would make it easier to process potatoes, a second thinner slicing blade as the included one is 2mm thick, a design that would allow all the parts to be stored/attached to each other when putting away (I may have missed something, but the small size of the storage container part means I can't lock the top down in place with the blades inside I probably should have gone for a product that is specifically designed for dicing potatoes as that is the main thing I want, but I don't like single or very few purpose devices in general if a multi purpose device is available. Again, build quality is very good, especially for the price.

There isn't anything about this product that I don't like! I had an event coming up and made a dish that required a lot of chopping. This thing cut my time in half! It was easy to clean and the little fork that comes with it makes getting the leftover veggies out of crevices'. This kitchen gadget will get tons of use and not stuck in a cabinet never to use again. Great purchase!!

I‚Äôve used this to cube, slice and dice several different things and it does the job well. I find it easy enough to clean, but I haven‚Äôt had to prepare large amounts of anything yet. The blades are definitely sharp - I was trying to remove the cubing cartridge and accidentally touched the blade and cut my finger pretty good. Of course I realized the blades are very sharp, but obviously I wasn‚Äôt paying close enough attention. Won‚Äôt make that mistake again!

description:
From the manufacturer

Set the bait and insert it back

	

Press the rear of the trapper until it clip with the ground

	

Place it in the area where rats frequently appear

Why Choose Us?

Upgraded mouse trap, no poison, no glue, no touch disposal.
Sensitive pedal parallel to bait, 0.03 lbs of weight is only needed to trigger the trap.

Warnings

Be careful your fingers when you set the traps.
Please place the mouse traps where kids and pets can't touch.
After setting the mouse trap, never touch it with your hand.
If you want to release the trap, please use a stick or other tools.
Anyway, be careful, please don't hurt yourself.

reviews.content: I set six of these last night in the garage and all baits were licked off overnight without tripping one trap. I think they‚Äôre too big for small light mice who don‚Äôt trip the platform. So I‚Äôll need to get the smaller traps. I suppose the good news is that I probably don‚Äôt have rats! (Something ate a wire in my garage parked VW last week - a $500 fix!). I did catch one small mouse in a different disposable trap I bought elsewhere. So the campaign continues.

These mouse traps are absolutely amazing.

We live on a ranch and have been fighting mice since we moved here.

I've used rolling traps, and the old-fashioned wood snap traps.

I thought we had gotten most of the mice, then I noticed there was one really obnoxious little mouse who would run across the counter stop and look at one of the mousetraps sniff it and turn and run away.

One day he ran across the top of the TV screen stopped and stared at me, the war was on.

Seriously this felt like an old episode of Tom and Jerry with the mouse always getting the better of us.

Out of desperation I ordered these traps. Baited them with a little peanut butter and a little sliver of dog biscuit which they for some reason love. I know they love them because they chew holes in every bag we get.

So I set out two mouse traps with baited with peanut butter and dog jerky treats, I placed one on the counter and one one behind my recliner where I sit.

It could have been much more than about 5 minutes when I heard this weird noise, I didn't recognize it cuz I'm so used to the other snap traps. When my wife said you know I think that might have been one of the new mouse traps.

Sure enough I look behind the chair, and there he is Jerry all bloody and dying. Yep none of those humane traps around here.

The one thing I will say is these aren't nearly as powerful as the old wood snap traps, the old wood snap traps would break their necks and kill them almost instantaneously.

These aren't quite as powerful, don't get me wrong they snap down on them and kill them but sometimes it doesn't kill them right away. They sit there and twitch for a while, a few times we've had to search for the trap as they've drug it off. They don't drag it far.

But seriously these things are super easy to bait, super easy to clean, they don't hurt nearly as bad if you get snapped in the finger with one.

And they're reusable.

But the most important part is they work and they work much better than the old wood traps. Within the first day of using them we caught eight mice.

It's like my whole day was spent doing nothing but baiting these mouse traps.

We have literally eradicated every mouse in every living space on our property. It's been probably two weeks since we've caught a mouse, I see no traces of them, no mouse droppings, no two holes in potato chip bags and flower bags or sugar bags.

We do have traps out continuously, we have to rebate them once a week because of peanut butter and dog jerky treats tend to dry out.

So like I said if you're on the fence about these, just buy them they're worth every penny. With that said you might have to experiment with what your mice like to eat. Not hard to figure it out just go through your pantry and find out what they've been getting into and bait it with that. Around here it was the dog jerky treats that they liked.

Another tip is come springtime the mice are less interested in eating and more interested in mating so baiting traps with food isn't quite as effective as it is the rest of the year. During the springtime I recommend getting some pheromone bait and putting a couple drops in the bait holder. Along with a couple bits of string, they like string and yarn for their nests.

The traps work well, I had a couple of times when I checked the traps and the peanut butter was eaten off by a mouse and the trap didn't engage. Most of the time I'm snapping the fur off them MFs. I like em better than the sticky traps because they're reusable and they kill the mice.

Mice like to sneak into our basement every fall and winter. I never want to touch a dead mouse, so for years we used poison baits. However, while they worked, finding the dead mice was an awful experience. The smell was wretched and it took way to long to figure out where their little corpses were.

I finally decided to try these traps and I'm glad I did. The mice appear to be killed instantly. I keep disposable plastic gloves and grocery sacks right there so I can quickly glove, squeeze the other end of the trap so the jaws open and drop the mouse right in the grocery sack to be taken outside. I then drop the traps in a bucket of hot soapy water to clean them before reusing. I never have to touch the mouse, and I'm only close to it for a brief bit of time to drop it in the bag.

I'm very happy with this product.

I was weary at first. I attempted to set up 2 and instantly broke the plastic that holds them open. I was instantly frustrated but figured it out. I did use peanut butter and put a gold fish on top. We had only seen 1 mouse so I set up 3 traps total. I‚Äôll admit, seeing other reviews of catching one in 30 minutes gave me high expectations. I sadly did not catch our friend in that time but I woke up this morning, less than a day after setting them up, and we got it! I feel a lot better knowing we should be pest free üôåüèª
Like the wooden mousetraps and just as likely to prove fatal, but less likely to biodegrade.

I was a little skeptical at first, being used to the old school wood-base mouse traps. Unpackaging them and pushing open the clamp made me more worried - it felt light to me. I even made the weakness comment to my wife and immediately put my foot in my mouth because I accidently tripped it while fuddling around and caught my finger in the trap. "*Expletive*!!!... Nevermind... they'll work" was my reaction.

After setting up some traps with some peanut butter in the removable dish (nice design, btw), I was a little worried after day 1 and the clever fella managed to reach past the trip platform and lick up the treat. I saw someone made the comment that they stuck a cracker in the peanut butter, and perhaps this made the mouse have to work at it more, and get closer footing? Idk, I'm not a mouse - maybe I just happened to have a cleaver customer. Anyways, I just put some Cheez-Its further back in the clamp and viola! Next morning I had a dead mouse. Cleanup was way easier than the old school traps, because you don't have to put your hand anywhere near the mouse to finagle it open - just pinch open the plastic clip over the garbage can and you're done!

These are a win in my book!

Amazon is the best way to search for item you need around the house.having problem with mouse inside my garage and bought several wood trap at Home Depot none work the mouse is still around . So I search in Amazon and found this mouse trap and order a set
I was weary at first. I attempted to set up all of it in my garage and waited for several week I was instantly frustrated that no mouse in the trap I did use peanut butter and put a cracker on top.I had only seen 1 mouse so I set up all traps total. I‚Äôll admit, seeing other reviews of catching one in 30 minutes gave me high expectations. I sadly did not catch our friend in that time but I woke up one cold morning, and found my fried mouse trap, and i got it! I feel a lot better knowing we should be pest free . I will buy another set and use it out side my backyard just in case they searching food in my area.
It did catch a baby mouse, but I was left with that uncomfortable sound of the mouse dragging the trap trying to get lose. These are definitely for very small mice.

I caught several mice that were in my garage. One of the mouse traps would not stay open and did not work. Amazon offered a refund if I returned the package, but the others were already used. They are easier to use than the conventional wooden ones.

From the manufacturer
Restore fabric, upholstery, and carpet like-new
RESTORE CARPET TO LIKE NEW CONDITION

Fabric Clean restores a new look to carpets by removing stubborn stains and reconditioning the fabric fibers to how they once were.

 
REMOVE: DIRT, BODY OILS, STAINS, SPILLED LIQUIDS

Clean set-in stains, dirt, and filth from any color floor mat, carpet, or upholstery in any car, truck, SUV, RV, and even around the home or office with Chemical Guys Foaming Carpet Cleaner.

Insane Water Beading

BREAKS DOWN AND REMOVES STUBBORN STAINS

Fabric Clean is the easiest way to remove stubborn stains from carpet and upholstery, its oxygen-infused formula penetrates deep into the fibers and helps remove stubborn stains.

 
EASILY REMOVES DIRT, ODORS, AND STAINS

reviews.content: I completely forgot to take before and after pictures but as a mom with kids I can tell you that I had spilt coffee on the front seats and god knows what all over the back seats. I‚Äôve had my car ‚Äúdetailed‚Äù and was told that they couldn‚Äôt get the stains out anymore than what they were able to do. There were still stains like it was barely cleaned, so I took matters into my own hands and found this stain remover. As SOON as I sprayed the cleaner it was like a magnet pulling out the stains. Once I started scrubbing though is when the magic happened. I saw all the dirt, spilt drinks, etc just come right out and my car seats literally look like new. This will forever be my go to stain remover. Also I want to mention the citrus scent and how natural smelling and amazing it is. I was scared it would smell like a fake overpowering citrus but it didn‚Äôt at all. I will say that I wish that citrus scent lasted longer than it did but I didn‚Äôt buy it as an air freshener. It did it‚Äôs job cleaning my seats.

This stuff looks like snot, sorry but it does. It's not pretty but man does it WORK! You can dilute it with a bit of water for lighter stains or go full concentrate on thoes stains that have been there for decades. Finally a cleaning product that has a decent scent. Does it smell like roses, no, but if you are familiar with heavy duty cleaners then you know EXACTLY what smells I'm referring to. This doesn't have a chemical smell whatsoever. Tip- if you choose not to dilute it, make sure you scrub it off WELL or it will leave a thin crust of product where applied. Other than that....this is a wonder product! HIGHLY recommend.

This product works wonders! My 1 yr old got into my makeup & as you can see left my couch a mess. I called a cleaning company & they quoted me over $200 to clean the couch. I didn't want to spend that & thank God I didn't have to waste my money. The process was super easy. I applied a small amount of the product on the couch & used the brush by hand (didn't feel like using a drill) & instantly the stain came out. The smell is fresh. I am super impressed & 100% satisfied with this product.

Anything that is set in or very dark, you‚Äôll need to use another cleaner for. I was able to get rid of the water stains on my passenger seat, but some of the deeper stains on the carpet and seatbelt remained. I used a drill attachment to agitate it and a wet vac to suck up the rest. It smells pleasant, but I need something that is a bit strong. Still fairly happy with it for general cleaning though, especially if you clean often enough. Would still recommend it. Make sure you have spray bottles for a lot of their products, they need to be diluted.

I don't usually leave reviews, but THIS product is really something! I'm 62 and have fibromyalgia and arthritis, so I don't do a lot of deep cleaning anymore but the car interior needed it badly after two long distance trips.
I followed the instructions which were easy and mixed my solution 8:1. It states you can use it stronger if needed but this stuff worked like a dream. It removed stains that we thought were permanent on the floors and doors. Spritz it on, brush it in and use a clean rag or towel to lift it off.
Next on the project list are more Chemical Guys products!

I bought this to clean the upholstery on an accent chair, but had the opportunity to use it on my light grey, almost white rug instead. My large puppy stole a chili dog and had to eat it on my rug. I used 2 tablespoons in 20 ounces of water, with their brush, and less than 30 minutes later no sign of the crime! Unfortunately, now I can see the entire rug needs cleaned, lol!

I wish I had before and after pictures of this stain I got out! I spilled food in My husbands brand new explorer and it left a grease stain. With three rounds of cleaning with this stuff it got it out. I was scared after the first try but gradually it came out. Keep trying even if it doesn‚Äôt help at first. It will. And give it time to dry.

I wish I took a before/after photo for this, because I was skeptical. But holy crap does this stuff work. Took horrible, impossible to remove stains out of my car seats. Def do the 8:1 ratio though for tough stains, and do a few passes. But once you do, your seats will look new.

I never leave a review before for something as simple as fabric cleaner. but this product is worthy of the review. Its great at cleaning and restoring the carpet mats. And refreshes it with lemon scent. I bought the kit with spray bottle, cleaner, and drill brush. Awesome kit to buy. I wouldn't use the yellow (medium) brush for seats though. Its too stiff. Buy their grey (soft) brush instead.

I have very happy with this purchase. As in the photo below I have a lot of cleaning and detailing products. This solution I have found to work really well on those small seat stains in cloth material. The bottle I wish came in a spray bottle though for an easier distribution of the material. Instead I dab a little bit on a rag and scrub it into the fabric and let it break up the stains. I wait a little bit and then wipe the soap back off with a clean microfiber with a little pressure and it usually gets the stain out. There have been times where I had to go over the stain twice to fully remove it. In my opinion this isn‚Äôt a bad solution to have in your arsenal of cleaning supplies.

name: MOTOPOWER MP69033 Car OBD2 Scanner Code Reader Engine Fault Code Reader Scanner CAN Diagnostic Scan Tool for All OBD II Protocol Cars Since 1996, Yellow
description:
Product Description
Scan, Fix & Erase
MOTOPOWER MP69033 OBD2 Scanner
Professional OBD2 Car Diagnostic Tool Engine Fault Code Reader
Product Features:

Multi-Functions - Practical Multi-Functions OBD2 code reader features built-in OBD2 DTC lookup library, which help you to determine the cause of the engine light, read code, erase code, view freeze frame, I/M ready, vehicle information, data flow, real-time curve, get vehicle speed information, calculate load value, engine coolant temperature, get engine speed.
Wide Capability - Supports 9 protocols compatible with most 1996 US-Based, 2000 EU-Based and Asian cars, and newer OBD II & CAN domestic or import vehicles. Supports 6 languages - English,German, Dutch, Spanish, French, Italian.
LCD Display - Designed with a clear display LCD screen (128 x 64 pixels) - white backlight and contrast adjustment.
No need any battery or charger - The code reader gets the power directly from your vehicle through the OBDII Data Link Connector.
Compact Design - Car diagnostic scanner is equipped with a 2.5 feet long cable and made of a very thick flexible insulator. There are 6 buttons on OBD2 Scanner: scroll up/down, enter/exit and buttons that quick query VIN vehicle number& the DTC fault code.
ABS / Airbag codes NOT Supported - It is able to read and clear check engine information which is part of OBDII system, but it cannot work with non-OBDII systems, including ABS / Airbag / Oil Service Light, etc.
What's in the box - OBD2 Scanner Code Reader x 1, Instruction Manual x 1

How to connect the scanner with the vehicle?

a) Turn the ignition off.

b) Connect the code reader‚Äôs plug to the vehicle‚Äôs OBDII port

c) Turn the ignition on. DO NOT start the engine.

d) The code reader will then automatically link to the vehicle‚Äôs computer.

e) Refer to the manual for details.

Why does the scanner‚Äôs screen not turn on?

Check the fuse for the OBD port in the vehicle‚Äôs fuse box. Usually, it‚Äôs the same fuse as the cigarette socket. If the fuse is blown, there will be no power for the OBD port, so the scanner cannot be power on.

Does the scanner support Air Bag, ABS, Brake, Suspension, Oil Service, Maintenance Reset or Battery Registration?

No. It can only scan the vehicle‚Äôs engine system and emission system, detecting the engine fault by displaying the fault code and erasing the fault code after the engine problem is fixed.

Why does the scanner not read the VIN (Vehicle Identification Number)?

a)- Due to the different vehicle makers and models, some vehicles‚Äô VIN may not be able to read by the scanner. A professional vehicle maker‚Äôs scanner is needed.

b)- The vehicle‚Äôs computer may be blocked or revised before in purpose.

What are the vehicle brands that the scanner supports? (Search Question / Ask others)

Theoretically, it works with most 1996 US-Based, 2000 EU-Based and Asian cars, and newer OBD II & CAN domestic or import vehicles.

But due to the datalink problem with the ports, it may fail to connect with some vehicles in some circumstances.

reviews.content:
It seems easy to use. I plugged it in and it turned on right away. The hardest part was finding the OBD2 port in my 2008 Mazda Miata. Now that I know where it is, it will be easy to find next time.

I used it in my 2001 Jeep Grand Cherokee and in my 2008 Mazda Miata but it did not find any error codes. I bought it because my Check Engine light went on in my Miata, but I discovered it was because my wife did not put the gas cap on tight after filling up the gas. Before I received this device, I put the gas cap on right and cleared out the error light by disconnecting the car battery, so by the time I got the device, the warning light was already off. The Jeep had no warning lights on and the device did not report any error codes

So as of now, I'm assuming my cars are OK since the device did not report any error codes and there are no warning lights on either of my cars.

Simple to use! Depending on your car there might be a book of alternate codes!
My check Engel light came on 2 weeks ago with it being a 2014 I figured I‚Äôd have to take it to the Shop or a local shop! I also have many re calls on this car I figured that it might be one of them! Witch could put me without a car!
So I did some research came up with OBD searched on AZ came up with this one!
I mostly check the comments on devices before buying! This was mostly good an cheap! After I got it I read an researched for my possible code list for my car an saved for present an future!
So used the device an ended up being a simple issue that is not a Cattasterfy! LOL emissions issue so I‚Äôm working on the suggested fixes from the internet when I typed in my car make model an year an issue code that brought up many finds they all said the same thing giving me a list of my own fixes I can try but that last one might end up costing me!
But I now know it‚Äôs not a car crippling issue!

PS only took me about 4 times to get it to work right! Witch was my own fault I did not have the ignition on far enough to get the readings an it will tell you things to check an redo!

Love this thing so far!!!!!

I was a little skeptical on how cheap this was compared to a lot of other readers out there but for the price it was worth a shot. Couldn't have been easier to use, diagnosed my check engine issue immediately and was able to clear the error as well. (Although I'm not 100% sure this device cleared it, or it went away on it's own, because these older cars are finicky). This will be a great inexpensive investment for my older 911.

Been going back and forth for a while on an ODB reader for my various personal vehicles so I can possibly avoid a visit to the mechanic, this unit had me worried due to only being $25, like theres no way is gonna work right, first off it doesn't look or feel like its cheap, it worked immediately out of the box and even though I didnt need them the instructions included are clear and precise and make sense. With this little gadget Ive added a great tool to my toolbox

This reader allowed me to easily diagnose an issue on a 2007 Ford and a 2016 Subaru Crosstrek. When clearing codes the reader gave me an error, but it appeared to correctly clear codes. The reader also provides simple real-time informatics such as throttle load, temperature, etc.. I would recommend this scanner code reader to those who occasionally need such a tool and don't require graphing functionality or the ability to clear higher level codes such as airbags.

I got one for work just for quick code checks and clearing check engine lights, I've been pretty satisfied. The live datat display is really neat and I've used it a few times just to see and it is a usefull feature in my opinion, it gives you access to stuff that I didn't think you could on a little code reader. I ended up buying another to keep in my car.
I only have one 'issue' ,sometimes it gives a message saying it cannot clear the light please make sure the engine is off, or something like that. However i think maybe a couple times it wouldn't clear the light on some vehicles. Other than that it really hasn't let me down. I also use it to check which computer modules have passed/cleared. Very useful and good price.

I've been wanting to get one of these for a long time. I just wanted to know the code(s) so I can google it and plan ahead for repairs. I used this on 2 different cars so far and both times the codes came back the same from what the auto shop scanned. It doesn't have a lot of features as the more expensive ones, but it does it's job well enough.

I used this on my 2006Ford Ranger, and it works, perfectly. It ran a test on the truck and gave a engine light code, that there was a leak, I changed the gas cap, cleared the problem code, took the truck for a ride to Madison Wisconsin and back, poof emissions cleared. So if you have a problem or you want to see if you might be getting to that point before you get one, this is definitely a product to have.

I bought one of these because my wifes car always throws codes and then they just go away for no reason. Someone ended up stealing it off my porch after delivery, but luckily the seller sent me another one. Thank you for that. Functionally its very simple. Plug in and start reading codes. It picked up the code my wifes dodge dart was throwing immediately. I dont have any codes being thrown in my car (subaru wrx) but i tried anyway, and it seems to be able to communicate with it as well. must work for most car make and models. for the price its really your best bet. pretty solid, good price, good customer service. 5/5

This hand-held OBD2 scanner has already saved me hundreds of dollars. I use it to identify issues to determine whether I can fix it or go to the shop. If a shop plugs in their OBD2 scanner one time it will cost you many times what this one costs and you own it. I use it on both of my vehicles and have also used it to assist neighbors in troubleshooting theirs. Everyone who owns a car should have one.

reviews.content: I am a first time birdwatcher, so I am new to all that is involved. I find these to do a really decent job. I just have some difficulty with adjusting quick enough to see the birds before they fly off sometimes. I do wear glasses, so that is part of the problem. I am pleased with the product.

I am VERY pleased with these binoculars. Good quality at this price point.

Pros:
1) Clear (Bak-4 Prism and Multi-coated lenses)
2) Sharp image focus
3) Realistic colors. Even the edges don't appear to have a significant amount of chromatic aberration
4) Great for the price. (These aren't $1,000 binoculars... but they don't cost $1,000 either).

Cons:
1) Although these focus well, you may find you need to make some small adjustment when viewing objects at different distances to get both eyes focused. Note: This is an issue with binoculars at any price point, but I find these might need to be adjusted more often. To do this you will need to cover the right objective lens (without touching the lens) and use the focus wheel to focus on an object. Then, cover the left objective lens and rotate the diopter ring (which is on the right eyepiece) until the the object is in sharp focus with the right eye. Now both lenses should be in focus. Not hard to do.
2) Hardly worth mentioning, and I'm not sure I am explaining it well, but, for those who care, there is a slight bit of field curvature which means straight lines may appear slightly curved at the edges of the image. This isn't really noticeable if you are looking at stationary objects. The only reason I mention it is because if you are looking through the binoculars and sweep them from side to side, it makes the image appear to waiver a bit.

Again, I almost hesitate to deduct one star because the pros far outweigh the cons.
Get a pair of these and have fun!

No longer able to dig big holes or pitch 300 lbs of soil into a new bed, or crawl around an uneven one, I propagate roses from cuttings on my deck. I‚Äôve started planting the little guys but unable to see how they‚Äôre doing. I decided I needed binoculars. This product is amazing! It‚Äôs under a pound, compact and sturdy, provides excellent clarity, and at considerable distance, I can see my small young transplants leafing out. Each morning I ditch my usually very necessary glasses, hang the binoculars around my neck and am likely something of an oddity, standing on my front porch surveying.

I know this will sound crazy but I purchased them for Christmas present for my husband. We can‚Äôt see the channel selected on tv screen
And one of always had to get up and look. No more. They are small and compact and they have made our life so much easier. We are in our mid 60s and even
With our glasses still can‚Äôt see that well at a distance. Problem solved

I wanted a decent pair of binos to look at stars, birds and scope out wildlife. This is the perfect pair. Clear viewing, easy to adjust and small. I can throw them in the car or a big pocket and have easy viewing without the bulky, swinging, cumbersome experience of a large pair. Very pleased!
I bought these to view birds and other wild life that visit my yard. They are going to work well for that purpose.
Easy to hold standing up without feeling heavy which is what happens with the older model I had. Nice long range clear viewing. Easy to slide top wheel to adjust quickly. I love it. Great price.

These are by far the best pair I‚Äôve bought for this price. These are compact and fit in the palm of your hand for when you‚Äôre on the go. I use these while on duty and have to look far away they are very clear and easy to adjust.

These were purchased as a gift. An avid hiker who is slight of build and needs light weight items to go into her backpack. Now a year after she received them, they are always with her in the backpack and used regularly. A durable and great product!

I'm an astrophographer and have a lot of optical gear, these are very nice. I wasn't expecting them to be such good quality at this price. Bought them as a gift for someone, they won't be disappointed at all.

name: Utopia Bedding Throw Pillows Insert (Pack of 2, White) - 18 x 18 Inches Bed and Couch Pillows - Indoor Decorative Pillows
description:
Product Description
Elegant, Exclusive & Colorful Pillows!



Our throw pillows are available in multi colors that are designed for universal use, making them ideal for a car, office, sofa, bed, outdoors etc. Whether you are resting on a couch for a movie or taking a nap, our pillows will add flair and unbeatable comfort to your home.

	
 
 
 
1 POLYESTER FILLING 2 BOUNCE BACK 3 SOFT FABRIC 4 EXPERTLY CRAFTED

reviews.content:
We purchased multiple sets of throw pillow inserts to find the best one for our new couch from RH. We wanted throw inserts to match the quality and comfort of the sofa. Utopia Bedding's option won hands down. It has the same density and plush feel you get with down - but it's actually more supportive, bounces back into shape better, and doesn't go flat (read: pressure points) when the down did.

That being said, if you must have a down option....we recommend Comfort Down over other brands. They were the most dense, luxurious option we tested with the down pillows.

I ordered two of the 26" x 26" pillows. As previously stated by other reviewers, pillows arrive VERY compressed from being shrink wrapped. I put mine individually in the dryer on Air Fluff for 15 minutes and was amazed at how large and fluffy they were at the end of the set time. They were a perfect fit for the Euro Sham covers I purchased. I would highly recommend these pillows. Great quality at a VERY fair price.

I have purchased a bunch of these in different sizes from this same company, and they are always nice. Highly recommend! They are vacuum sealed and will fluff up a lot overnight, but probably take about a week to get to their full poof. I have been buying inserts 2 inches larger than the case, and that seems to work very well. I didn‚Äôt notice any odors at all and I am usually sensitive to that.

These pillows are amazing. They‚Äôre the perfect blend of firm and soft. I got these for my couch just over 2 years ago. In that time, i spent at least a year consistently sleeping or napping on the couch using this. They are incredibly comfortable, and have not changed in the slightest after 2 years. HIGHLY RECOMMEND

I bought these pillow inserts to replace the ones I had in my couch pillows which had become very flat. My covers measured 18‚Äù so I ordered the 20‚Äù ones. They came vacuum packed, but puffed up immediately upon opening, and even more so after I placed them in my dryer on a low setting with Tennis balls for 5 mins. My pillows look new again, very full and very soft. I would definitely buy again.

They come compressed and vacuum sealed. As soon as I opened the package, they began to expand. I did run on air fluff in the dryer with wool balls for 15 minutes to remove the crease line where they were folded. Came out fluffy soft and full and fit the 12 X 20 faux leather covers perfectly. https://smile.amazon.com/dp/B0BMXHPDCL?psc=1&ref=ppx_yo2ov_dt_b_product_details
They have a very supportive but soft feel. Highly recommend.

These are amazingly soft,a mini version of "your pillow". I had some smaller cases and hoped they'd fit.they were mint green and I use them on a recliner that I really love.They aren't a regular size,if you order, please keep it in mind.For comfort or a nap, they're perfect.

I originally purchased these in August of last year after I bought new pillow covers for my couch. These arrived packaged very well and they fit perfectly inside of my pillow covers. I lay a lot on my couch and I use these pillows for support, and I find that they are provide comfort and are soft.

I needed two 16"x16" fill pillows for decorative cases. These arrived today, and already they are fluffed up and inside the covers. I took them out of the vacuum seal and put them both in the dryer together with 4 tennis balls. I probably put the dryer on the "no heat" setting and fluffed the pillow for about 15-20 min (stopping every 5 or so min to check). They fluffed right up. I didn't feel I needed to even wait the 24-48 hours that the packaging suggests. I'll update this if the pillows deflate or otherwise aren't satisfactory. For now, I'd recommend these!

Ordered to replace the stuffing in the pillows that came with my couch. When I received them I thought this won't work because they were vacuum packed and looked impossibly flat but if you follow the directions they fluff right up. Very happy with the results, so I ordered another size and again love it. Next time I need pillow inserts I will order again
