name: havit HV-F2056 15.6"-17" Laptop Cooler Cooling Pad - Slim Portable USB Powered (3 Fans), Black/Blue
description:
Product Description
Ergonomic Comfort that You Can Feel



Havit laptop cooler fan gives your laptop and yourself a better gaming or typing environment and get your work done faster.

	
 
Fairly Quiet Laptop Cooling Fan



Havit laptop cooler is quiet enough to ignore its existence while working.

	
 
Ultra Portable



Slim, portable, and light weight allowing you to protect your investment wherever you go.

	
 
Compatible with Your Different Devices



Suitable for using with different devices from router, laptop, PS4/ PS5, tablet and more.

	
 
Visible Working Status



The LED indicator light locating near the on/off switch and those coming with three fans allows you to easily know the working status of the laptop cooling pad, especially at night.

	
 
Two USB Ports & One Power Switch



Provides extra USB ports to allow you plug extend devices like mouse, keyboard, headset stand. Simply turn the laptop cooler pad on/ off by the power switch.

	
     

Where can I use this laptop cooling pad?

We suggest you use this laptop cooling fan on a table/ desk, the bottom of the laptop cooler should be lifted off the surface. If you block the bottom of it, it will not blow upward

What type of USB cable can this laptop cooler use?

It uses a USB-A to USB-A cable. All commercially available USB-A to USB-A cables are compatible with this laptop cooling pad.

Do the fans blow air up into the base of the laptop?

Yes, the air from this cooling pad blow upwards. But please be noted that: To actively cool your laptop, you must have its bottom partially or fully unrestricted.

Can I turn the lights off?

No, unless you turn off the whole laptop cooling pad. There is only one power switch to control the laptop cooler but no separate power switch to control the lights and fans.

Can the speed of cooling fans be adjustable?

No, there is only a power switch to turn on/ off the cooling pad, the speed of fans is default setting.

Havit 15.6"-17" Laptop Cooler Cooling Pad
Number of Fans	3
LED Light Color	Blue
Rotations Per Minute	1400+/-10% RPM
Adjustable Height Levels	2 Levels
Compatibility	15.6"-17" Laptop/ Router/ PS3/ PS4/ Tablet
Cooling Pad Size	14.9" x 11" x 1.2"
Weight	1.5 lbs
Cable Length & Type	23.63", USB-A to USB-A
Fold Arms	‚úì

reviews.content: I wanted a fan to use on my lap when I use my laptop. My laptop is brand new and whether its my personal laptop or a work laptop (few years old) I noticed they always get uncomfortably warm on the lap. This allows air to not just keep the bottom of my laptop cool, but to circulate between my lap and my laptop. My lap gets a good little bit of cooling breeze too. Works great! I love the additional USB ports on it since the fan takes up one on my laptop so I can keep my phone charged or whatever else I need charged.

I like this product, and it does cool my Legion Pro 5 laptop. But like almost all gaming laptops, the exhaust vents are close to the top of the keyboard and on either side. This product has one fan in the center in that area, and two fans down below, underneath the touchpad area of the keyboard. There aren't exhaust vents on the laptop down there. I would like the configuration to be two fans up on the top, pulling air out of the exhaust vents on the computer, and one down below.

The slim design makes it very portable and easy to carry around, while the three fans provide excellent cooling performance for my laptop. The USB powered design is very convenient and I can use it with any laptop as long as I have a USB port available. The fans are very quiet and do not generate a lot of noise, which is great for when I am using my laptop in a quiet environment. The adjustable height feature is also a great feature that allows me to find the perfect angle for my laptop. The price is very reasonable for the performance and quality of the product.

I would have given it more stars, but when something completely dies after about 4 months of actual use, I have to give it a zero because that's what it is right now. When it was working, it seemed to do it's job and was quiet and now it's silent.
Update - 2/21/2023
Seller Refunded purchase price so I gave them 5 stars. After 4 months of use, they made things right. I would buy again, but no longer need one.

Really love this fan. Easy to slip into your bag next to your laptop without too much extra space needed.

The only thing I'll complain about is you'll want to put this on a desk and not your lap, because you'll chill your legs out otherwise.

It was a pretty good cooling pad and was able to use it for a couple of months. Over time though it started to slow down a little and so eventually I had to get a new one but very good and very well worth the money.

Works right out of the box. Won‚Äôt know how cooler my Mackbook Pro M2 max gets until I do a test later on. One thing I had to do, was purchase an adapter and a longer USB cable. Can‚Äôt use the short cable that came with the cooler because my computer doesn‚Äôt have a USB A connector, only USB-C and did not want to connect the cable to a computer anyway, to save a little power use. I have the cable insrted to an Apple 5 V power brick, one that comes with the older iPhones. Works perfectly.

My husband has a gaming laptop that I often use when he's not home for photo editing or playing Sims, and that thing would get HOT to the touch. I ordered this, and it arrived in the mail today thankfully. Turned it on, and the sound was so quiet I had to question if it was even on or not. I LOVED this because I usually am watching Netflix while editing my clients photos. Not once has his laptop got hot since putting this fan under it. I am so impressed! Will be buying another eventually when I get a laptop of my own üòÇ WORTH IT!!!!

I was expecting a lot more noise when I turned it on for the first time. It has 3 fans and is more quiet than my laptop fans. I have a Dell XPS 13 and I play some light PC games on it. Usually the laptop fans are at max capacity and the laptop still gets really warm. But the fans were only running at like half power when gaming with this cooling pad on. The blue LED that turns on with it is kind of a gimmick. But I am not too annoyed with it. Pretty good deal for $30 I'd say.
The USB in the front on the cooling pad bugs me I'd rather it be on the side. But it keeps my laptop nice and cool my games perform much better so I do like that :)

reviews.content:
First off, I did not end up using the clips. I mainly have the trunk down because I am a fur-mom x2 (no 2 legged children); except for the neighborhood kids I take to church on Wednesday and Sunday, then the seats are back up in the sitting position.

Back to the clips! Seeing as I have the seats down and pups in the back (American Staffordshire Terrier and Blue nose pit) I didn't want them walking on them, so they don't hurt the paws or snag on the felt interior. Also, the last picture I put a trunk cover down and didn't want that torn.

For the non-dog car rider people these clips go at the end of the elastic and it was tough for me to pull the elastic under the crevice of the seat and trunk then stretch and clip. One end is the loop the other is like a tighter L-shape and I would use pliers and close them into each other to fasten more securely. The clips work but not sure how long it will stay and not pup moving the seat from up to down position. Therefore, I secured mine with zip ties! They seem to fix it all just like electrical tape! j/k. The zip ties wont hurt the pups paws; I could give it more slack in the stretch attachments that come on the seat covers and it doesn't feel so tight that it is gonna rip them.

To be honest; that was my hardest part. Getting the backseat part on and then making sure they were nice and snug around the back part. Oh, and the front seats have a velcro snap to secure under the seat. Have to go under both sides of seats and feed them through the seat adjuster then velcro it.

The part about removing the headrest and cutting small holes to fit the headrest back over and also cut holes for the seatbelt snaps was easy. For the head rest cut a small pinch out about the size of a dime and that is perfect to fit it nicely. The seat belts about the size of a quarter and you can wiggle them through and if it gets too tough just cut a tad bit more and they fit nice.

My front seats look a little baggy in the picture because I have arm rest on my seats. I am going to got back and do the same like the headrest. I will remove the arm rest; pull the car seat cover into place taunt and then cut a small hole and put the arm rest back on. I was just getting tired and the rain was coming. Otherwise you could just cut a vertical line long enough to slip around the arm rest bar and down to the bottom of seat but that could be a lot of material cut versus a small size dime hole like the headrest.

I also purchased the product for less than the NEW price. I picked the like new for about $13 dollars and they look brand new? I don't know if it was because the box appeared opened then taped back but mine look brand new and had no cuts or tears in them. What a deal!

Item arrived quickly packaged nicely with no damage. Again, budget friendly for my fixed income disability budget. Seats are protected from dog hair and a quick spill of a drink if it happens. Got them in my favorite color too! Very pleased; would order again.

First of all, I want to say that now that they are installed, they look very nice. I have a 2013 Kia Sorento. My biggest complaint is that there were no proper instructions, just one sheet of paper with some confusing pictures that didn't help much. I had to come back to the video here on Amazon to see how to install them and even then, we were just winging it, hooking things here and there, wherever we could. Oh, and when I opened the box, the knife cut the top cover of the back seat cover as there was nothing between the box and the fabric of the seat cover, so buyer beware! I can't attest to the durability or the value for my money because, honestly, I just installed them yesterday, and no one has been in my back seat to test them. (I'll come back in a few months and let you know.) Installing the front bucket seats were easy enough, however, the seat covers do hide the mesh pockets that are behind my front bucket seats. But, other than that, they fit very well in the front. I kept trying to take off my headrests, and in my Kia, they do not come out. I realized later that they don't need to, as there is a hole that opens large enough to get over the headrests for the front bucket seat covers. Only the back middle headrest was removable, so we had to just fit the cover around the other backseat headrest poles. Also, it was very difficult to hook the straps under and around the back seats. A small person with very small arms may have less of a struggle than we did, but we did manage to get it done. Overall, (THUS FAR) we are satisfied with the seat covers. Honestly, I don't know how our back seats got so filthy, so anything is an improvement! I'm not looking forward to the day whenever I'm going to need to put one section of my backseat down for a load of something, but there are zippers that I can undo to be able to accomplish that. I just know it's going to be a little bit of a hassle, but it'll be worth it if they are durable and a good value for the money. We'll see. I'll let you know.

Great seat covers! Only reason for the 4 stars is because the back seat was a tough to instal. I assume other cars back seat can be better access especially on suv or cross overs but for mine, it was difficult and the straps were not long enough to clip. So I‚Äôm making it work. The two front seats were easy peasy! I would buy again because they are somewhat cushiony and reliable.

My wife ordered this for her explorer what she failed to see is that it was ment for a four door car with a front and a back not for an suv with a third row seating lol other then her mistake it wasn‚Äôt a bad product I gave four stars cause it said it would fit her car when clearly it doesn‚Äôt

I would recommend buying car seats for your car specifically. It's worth the additional money. They're placed on my 2016 Dodge Charger Hemi RT. I forget I don't have actual head seats so the back looks weird. Still appeasing to the eye though .
They look alright just wish it would of fit my nissan kicks a little better and the back seat covers was extremely difficult to install so just did front two seats.
Pretty easy to install! Pulling the cover on the back of the front seats so it covers everything was hard in my car but overall happy with my purchase!!

Estan lindos..solo que para los asientos delanteros no son separados el espaldar del asiento..lo que forma una peque√±a burbuja en el medio!! Los de atras si calzan perfectos porque traen ligas para halarlos y ponerlos a la medida!!

These seat covers work well and are easy to install. My only 'complaint' was that the material didn't feel to great on my legs when I wore shorts in the summer. Other than that, they're great seat covers!

I bought these for my son but I was a little nervous about it because I didn't know if they were made of cheap material, because the price was so low. I've always believed in you get what you pay for. But I was so pleasantly surprised when I got them. I gave them to my son & he was just as happy about them as I was. He put them in his car & they were extremely easy to put in. He says he'll never have another car without seat covers again because they make it look like new seats & they protect his seats. I'd recommend these to anyone.

reviews.content:
I purchased this throw blanket for myself. I have large windows in my home and the temperature has been brutally cold in the Winter. This is just perfect for me when I settle in for a movie in the evenings, or when it's a bit cold in the morning. This is my go to when I have coffee in the mornings, and when I'm done with the day and snuggled in the evenings. It's one of my favorite things in my home.

10/10 Very highly recommended.

We purchased 3 of these blankets in different colors for our older 3 kids and they love them! The material holds up very well, zero shrinkage from experience and still.super soft even after washing. Our younger girls are jealous of the bigger kids blankets cause they are so big and their blankets (from a different seller) shrunk a lot. Looking forward to purchasing one for our bed once abled. I personally like that though it is light weight material it's heavy in a sense. Not quite like a weighted blanket but heavy enough for comfort and warmth.
Definitely recommend!

First off the reason I ordered this blanket was hopefully it would wash well and not throw my washer off balance like my cotton blanket always does. I love cotton and was skeptical about sleeping under fleece but this is amazingly light weight and just enough warmth. Truly is cozy. It also produces no lint in my dryer. Very pleased!

I received a Bedsure Sherpa blanket as a gift a couple of years ago, after a couple of years of heavy use and multiple washes, it is still in good shape. This has been a cold winter, and I needed a new blanket for my bed, so I went with Bedsure again. I love how soft the blanket is, it‚Äôs not too heavy (since I use it under a down comforter) and very warm. The blanket is the perfect size for my bed (I got the queen size), the dark grey color looks very nice, and it folds easily. I recommend this blanket!

I pretty much replaced all of my blankets with these! Super soft, the 60 X 80 is perfect for laying on the couch. I love that it‚Äôs not bulky and easy to travel with because it doesn‚Äôt take up a lot of room when I carry it with me on the plane or car.

This blanket feels amazing. It is super soft and washes up looking brand new again. I bought it as a Christmas gift for my pet pig and she hasn't been able to tear this one up, like she has done to her other blankies. I recommend highly. It is a pretty decent size, not too big, not to small. It is perfect for throwing on the couch or inside the car for road trips, but mainly it is used for snuggling, this one is her favorite. I wish there were some girly colors available for my little princess.

My dog loves "cuddlies" - anything soft and fluffy, and she adores these. I've bought three for things she jumps up on, and they're perfect, because they're easy to wash and dry, very plush and come in pretty colors that match what I'm covering pretty closely. Definitely a "go to" product for me now.
The blanket is incredibly soft. I ordered a king sized one for my bed and my wife and I love it. I am 6‚Äô4 and it fits perfectly over my head and feet. Great value for this blanket

I‚Äôm always skeptical when buying fleece blankets because I hate the feeling of matted, peeling fleece. I‚Äôve washed these blankets three times and they are still SO. SOFT. I ordered two more after the first. The only note is that navy blue and dark blue are the same colors. They look like it in the photo, but I can confirm they‚Äôre also the same in real life. Obsessed with these blankets!!!
I bought this blanket for my husband because he wanted a longer one than what he had before and he loves it. It‚Äôs super soft and lightweight, our puppy even fights to have her turn with it!

reviews.content:
I purchased a set of (5) 30 Gallon pots. I actually found these by accident when I was searching Amazon for a regular black plastic pots. As always the local box store sold them way too expensive. It was the picture of other VERIFIED PURCHASERS on Amazon that convinced me to give them a try.

Have only had them for about three weeks and no negative comments. The picture is of a Pineapple plant being grown in the Fabric pot. Pineapple plants do not require much water and air temperature should be around 72 degrees. I like the fact that the roots will grow to the outer edges as well and will have air circulating to them through the fabric pot. Maybe no much but more-so if it were a plastic pot.

It has been three weeks since I transferred my plant to the new pot as it was suffering from over watering in the plastic pot it was in. Since I moved it to the Fabric Pot, the yellow on the leaves (an indicator of too much water or root rot) has gone away. No over watering on Fabric pots. So far very happy! I will purchase more fabric pots and will be looking at the 15 gallon ones.

Update 5/17/20

So this week I attempted to move one of my 30 gallon pots with full soil and a fully grown Pineapple plant in it onto a 5" Plastic pallet so that the fabric pot gets air circulation not only on the sides but from underneath as well and keep the pot from sitting on the hot concrete. I grabbed the pot from one handle and I tried to JERK Lift it onto the pallet and created a 9 in tear on the the handle I grabbed it from.

Let me be clear, this is not in anyway a knock on the fabric pot and it was my fault. I was merely being a "Guy" about the whole thing and not looking for any help to lift it from both sides. The pineapple plant is prickly so I was just trying to get underneath it and get it on the pallet.

So here is the "GOOD NEWS". I had a spare same size fabric pot laying around, so what did I do. I carefully Double-Bagged the existing ripped pot into a newer fabric pot and I WAS BACK IN BUSINESS. E.g. one fabric pot into another. Try doing that with a cracked plastic pot. Lesson learned, call my wife next time to come help me :)

I love this stuff and can't wait to get my hands on the 15 gallon ones. Last time I checked they were out of stock. Stay tuned for more lovely pineapple fabric grown pics.

Update 6/22/20

Finally have some good pics using the Fabric Pot Bags with full grown Pineapple plants in them. The bags must be a plus, as my wife and I are not experienced growers. Plastic pallets below Fabric Grow pots help keep them off the hot concrete and avoid having the bag rot due the weather elements.

Pic 1 - A harvested Pineapple from a Fabric Grow Bag Pot, YUM !
Pic 2 - Original Pineapple that has been in fabric pot since we purchased the grow pot bags
Pic 3 - Update from 9/22
Pic 4 - Update from 9/22
Pic 5 - Pineapple in blossom, YUM
Pic 6 - Fully grown pineapple plants in 30 gallon grow bags
Pic 7 - Side pic of pallet with another 30 gallon grow bag

All in all we have three active 30 gallon bags and looking forward to more. These bags are great.
Recommend them highly!

Update - 9/22/20

- Cannot get enough of these pots. Take a look at the 9/22 pics. I cannot control the order of them when Amazon posts them but I wrote 9/22 on the image. One pineapple from these pots at about 14 inches tall. HUGEEEE. This was the double bagged pot that broke on me (my fault) months ago but going strong.

Thanks again

I received them quickly and the feel very sturdy, of course it's February and I haven't used them yet but I can tell they'll do the job I want since I'm a renter and have no place for a garden. I'll try to update later in the year.

I thought a 3-gallon would be the size of a 3-gallon bucket that you get nursery plants in. These look a lot smaller than that. They look to be 1/2 the height. I would use these to transplant a 2 qt nursery plant, but def nothing larger if I wanted it to be able to stay in the pot for some time. They look really durable and I look forward to using them, but don't even think about transferring a 3 gal plant into these.

Awesome, sturdy, durable grow bags. This design helps the roots breath easier and allows the dirt to dry properly.

Package arrived quickly and just as described. I've already purchased another set since they were exactly what I was looking for.
I really like using this product for my garden plants. I've used them for starter beds with flowers, herbs, and many veggies.
These are great for space saving growing. Great water & ventilation control. Not big enough for my big bushy plants

They are just what I‚Äôve been looking for. Being a cloth bag with two heavy duty handles, they are easier to move with a full load of dirt than the plastic tubs that I have used in the past. They also should hold up better than the plastic ones over time.
wasnt sure how i felt about these but my plants thrived in this planter.
I like using soft side containers, and these proved to be the best so far. While I expect they will watermark, that's not a problem, as the ease with which they can be moved is a plus.
Great bags I used over and over again Durable bags great value.. highly recommend

name: HotHands Hand Warmers - Long Lasting Safe Natural Odorless Air Activated Warmers - Up to 10 Hours of Heat - 40 Pair
description:
From the manufacturer
HotHands Hand Warmers

HotHands warmers are single-use air-activated heat packs that provide everyday warmth and are ideal for keeping your body warm when temperatures drop. They‚Äôre available in several styles designed for your hands, feet, and body. Have you tried them all?

	

	

	



Double the Warmth

Each individually sealed warmer package contains 2 single-use warmers.

	
Heat that Lasts

Warmers use air-activated heat designed to for easy on-the-go warmth when you need it.

	
Cleared for Takeoff

Warmers have an estimated shelf life of 3-4 years, ready to be opened whenever needed.

	
Ready to Use

Air-Activated Warmer Technology -- simply open the package and they heat up quickly!

reviews.content: You know that feeling where you know your fingers are there, but that's only because you can see them? Yes, it's an emotional feeling because your hands aren't doing anything for you. Pop these open, and you can feel like a human again pretty quickly. You know that feeling where you know your toes are still there only because you haven't seen them fall out of your shoes? These work for cold toes, too! Feel like a human again in cold weather yay!

These hand warmers work exactly how you‚Äôd think they would. I do a lot of winter sports and these are a must have in the region that I‚Äôm in. They get quite hot and last for a while. Definitely would recommend them to anyone who doesn‚Äôt like cold hands!

These hot pads work well to keep your hands warm. Last a few hours and make amazing gifts. I give away to random people standing in the cold and when they try them their face shows how well these warmers work. Recommend only if you work outside when it is cold. Pretty useless during the summer.

These worked very well for a super cold trip to Colorado. Opened the package in the morning, put them in my pockets, and by dinnertime they were still HOT! Not lukewarm, but HOT! They definitely last and are super convenient to carry around, open & shake for instant warmth while out in the cold weather!

I've been ordering these by the case from Amazon for many years. I think they work really well. My fingers get painfully cold when the temps go below 30 degrees F which is frequently during South Dakota winters. I put the packets into lightweight mittens and wear glove liners underneath. They last several hours. This year I received the packets in a wrapper instead of a box. That is fine with me. I counted to make sure there were still 40 double packets and there were. I know other reviewers have complained about these but I have not had any problems with them.
These warmers work great. Pop them in my gloves and off to detect I go as a happy camper. Can't recommend any higher. Would buy again.
Great product. Easy to use. All day warmth. A family member has Raynaud‚Äôs syndrome and stashes the packets in the house, car and at work to grab as needed.

These hand warmers are so convenient and come individually sealed (2 in each pack). On days below 35 degrees outside I open and shake them to activate. It takes a good 20:min for them to heat up and then they are ready to go. I stick them into my jacket pockets or my gloves and they keep my hands warm for a few hours. Great for working outside in cold climates , walking the dog, riding a bike or Skiing. Well worth the price for a little comfort ‚Ä¶
I always have a box of these hand warmers, as well as the foot warmers, on hand at all times. They are consistently quick warming and last a long time. Also make a great donation to homeless shelters
Power out , Too cold at work , Car broke down in winter .these always save my bottom .I pull out a few and I'm toasty

reviews.content:
This is the second one I purchased, and I don't actually use these for what they're intended for. I have a couple of different laptops that have styluses. The expandable base is perfect fit for me to put the charger in. Of course I put the stylus in the pin slot, with other writing utensils if I need them. The zip part in the top I put my drawing glove in (So that way my hand doesn't touch the screen directly when drawing).

I would 100% recommend these for a school case, an art case, or whatever else you feel you could use it for.

This pencil case is a game-changer for students and professionals alike! The spacious design allows for easy storage of not only pens and pencils, but also larger items like calculators. The case is well-made with a durable exterior that can withstand daily wear and tear, and the zippered closure ensures that all items stay securely in place. The compact size makes it easy to carry, making it a great choice for on-the-go use. Overall, this pencil case is a fantastic investment for anyone looking for a versatile and practical storage solution for their stationery and small tools.
This pencil case is so good! It holds so much stuff all at once and you can even expand it! A lottt of people at my school use this specific pencil case so that says a lot. I recommend buying this!
Awesome product. I‚Äôm a pen person and I would totally buy again. Great size, adjustable and easy access pen pocket. It‚Äôs a definite win.
I love this pencil pouch! It works great. It is so durable and I can fit so much in it.

I needed a new pencil pouch for school because my other one was busting at the seams. This fits a ton of pens and pencils, I would say around 40-50 easily. I love that it has a divider so that you can organize your most used pens and pencils. It also has a separate area for random things you need to organize. Easy to wipe clean and even pushed to the max it still zips easily and holds well. Definitely will buy this again when it‚Äôs time for a new one.
When I got it, I was worried my pens wouldn't fit, but they all fit perfectly! It looks small, but fits a lot!!
pencil case is very good ,would buy it again

Work in a school and needed to replace my old one. This one is perfect for me; I can fit everything I
wanted to carry, the size is perfect, nice strong material, and it‚Äôs cute :)

This is great and does exactly what I wanted to do, which is carry my Nintendo Switch Accessories for travel. (Note: many of the accessories I am talking about are third party accessories.

This case has enough for the pictured joycon grip, a portable stand, and the joycon wrist attachments. On top of that I will be able to fit a charger, cable, and more. Of course there are many Switch cases that can hold everything you need. But I prefer having two relativly small cases for my bag rather than one big case that takes up too much space in my bag.

The best part is the design and color. This is a Great organizational piece to have, definitely recommend.

reviews.content: This bundle was worth the price and it came quickly which was what I needed at the time. It was my first time using this vinyl for shirts I was making in a crunch. The black vinyl was stiff weeding compared to the white and takes more time to adhere to fabric than the white one. Overall it was worth the value and I would repurchase now that I got through the learning curve of pressing it.

This was the bright gold that I was looking for to use with a project. I was placing it on heavy canvas so it took a bit more hit and pressure to adhere. Otherwise, it was a good product for the money and the color of gold that I was wanting.

I love this vinyl, easy to weed them other brands. I bought this gold and a black, I made shirts for my Great Grandson‚Äôs 1st Birthday Party. Shirts are for his 2 Aunties, his Pops, his Nana, his Great Auntie and his P Pa and GG.

This was my 3rd time ordering this item. It weeds very well and it's affordable. Only problem I had with one of them was. A piece at the end of the roll had bubbles in it and was wrinkle so I couldn't use that piece

It was good but I feel it was a little thin when i ironed it on the pattern below came through so u can see it well. I have a gold one from this line that didn‚Äôt do this. Other than that it weeded great

I made 11 Valentines T Shirts today. Used most of the red roll and about half of the black. Online ordering more red now. Great Value. A bit thinner than glitter HTV but that is to be expected. As I was cleaning up, I found the seller had included a weeding tool with me order. Thank you.

It had soo many air pockets, never experienced that before, esp with this brand. I had to get my mini out and do letter by letter to try to save 2 shirts, then after washing and drying looked like crap again
This vinyl was easy to weed. Took me a few trys to figure the heat and peel time, but after that it was smooth sailing. Made sweatshirts for the moms of the dance team! They were a huge hit!

I was hoping that the gold was a shiny polished chrome gold but it was not. It is more of a burnished/brushed finish. The product works great. It‚Äôs still pretty and my project turned out nice but I was hoping for a different finish.
Was hoping to use it to cover and darken an odd color on the back of my vinyl. Worked splendidly and looks great! üëç

reviews.content:
* Real ez, quick set up. SIMPLE
* You get 4 round STICKY PADS and I had lot of fruit flies and so don't think my first pad will last long.
* So getting REPLACEMENT PADS (if you have a lot of critters to kill) is a POTENTIAL ISSUE.
* I plan to cut the pads out of the rectangular sticky pads I already have, so not concerned about buying their pre-cut, round, small, sticky pads (Some reviews say that are not always readily available???)
* I would pay more to get this same on with a STRONG FAN (i.e. to create more downward suction)
* This has 2 settings of fan speed and the higher speed is NOT as powerful as I would have liked.
* On high fan setting, it does get MOST of the tiny flies that get over the top. HOWEVER, I saw numerous of them land on the top and "hang out" or crawl around on the top lid and NOT get sucked in. MOST get sucked in; I don't know why some seemed immune to the suction as they sat on top of the grate type of opening; more suction power would have pulled them down.
* The other potential issue is: NOT all that get sucked in land and stick on the sticky pad; you can see them crawling around inside the container but NOT stuck on the pad. Only had it for 2 days and not sure yet if those end up on the stick pad, eventually? Will have to observe longer on this.
* Finally, mine started working almost immediately in DARK KITCHEN where I have more than a few, much more, of the little bas-tids flying near the trap. Seller says allow 3 days; mine was almost immediately sucking them in.
*.CONCLUSION: If I learn more or different I may update this. But it is working well for me; just not 100% on every fruit fly that gets near it (for some unknown reason) and a stronger fan would have made it work better.

I repotted a plant a while ago and promptly got an infestation of those little gnats that sometimes live in potting soil. I tried the vinegar/dish soap method for getting rid of them, some fly strips, and mouthwash, but I just couldn't get on top of them. They were multiplying faster than I could kill them. It was starting to gross me out, so I looked for another solution and found this thing. Within two days there was a noticeable and significant decrease in the number of gnats pestering me, and by the end of the week, they were gone entirely. (It also caught a rather large moth that had gotten into the house. I had been trying to shoo that one out, but it must have found the black light while I was sleeping and met its demise.) I kept it running (at night) for a while longer, just to be safe, but it did what it needed to do. A few weeks later, I had some fruit flies, and a couple of nights with this running took care of them, too. I've put it away for now, but it's nice to have for those infestations that come along from time to time. Hopefully I won't need it again for a while, but I like knowing it's there.

It's very quiet--I never heard it running at all. The black light isn't terribly bright--bright enough to attract the bugs, but not enough to be distracting while watching TV or anything. Changing the sticky pads is very easy. The auto timer works well. All in all, no complaints. (I should note: I have a fairly small, open-plan home, so putting it in the kitchen worked well, since the dining room and living room are all part of the same open space. I never had to move it to a bedroom or bathroom, though--it seemed to attract the gnats on its own, which was nice.)

This product has seemed to help get rid of my gnat problem for now. If I was to purchase another one I think I‚Äôd probably buy the newer version now that I know it actually works.
The only thing I dislike about it is that you have to have the sticky pads to go with it so that means you have to continue purchasing those. This is the only reason I didn‚Äôt give it 5 stars.
All in all it‚Äôs a great concept. Before purchasing this I tried all of the hacks to try and get rid of the gnat problem I was having and nothing seemed to really work to get rid of them till this.

My home was infested with sewer flies for many months not knowing where they were coming from, I used this gadget with great success while we were investigating the source. It works fabulously for small flying insects like sewer flies, mosquitos and fruit flies. Note that this unit works only in darkness, indoors and not meant to be left on endlessly. Though I did leave it on for many days straight with no issues. After 24 hrs the paper traps were entirely coated with flies. We quickly ran out of the sticky paper traps so I ordered more (not cheap considering its just sticky paper). My fault I did not measure the diameter and just ordered Amazon's recommendations for refill and they were a size too small. Other than that, a good product. Quiet and compact and did what it was supposed to do. But the motor/fan could be stronger. Whenever replacing the paper traps I had to do it outside as many of the flies were still alive trapped inside the unit. Also had to use an old toothbrush to clean the insides. My flies are gone now THANK GOD! Will I use it again? Maybe if I had an indoor area infested with small, flying insects.

It seems to work, has some bugs stuck to the sticky pad but, it's not nearly as effective as the simple sticky spike things you stick directly in the plant soil. And, it's 10x more expensive than the sticky things but, the peace of mind is definitely worth something. I run it at night near my bed lest any of the little critters decide to visit my face... nothing more annoying! It's very quiet and the light isn't intrusive. It's not designed (so the instructions say) to be run 24/7. I move it around, placing it near plants and again, put it in my room at night. I'm sleeping better if that counts.

I really like this fly catcher but it doesn‚Äôt catch the main flies that I normally get maybe one or two of them like fruit flies this product mostly catches, small gnats and other small flying insects. Use a little treat on the inside of the product to catch more of the insects regardless of the size in addition to only use us at night because kids under the age of three like to play with it and this is not a toy. Instead of buying a bunch of the sticky plates on the inside just get regular tape put it on the top pull it off and you‚Äôll get the flies off. This will help you save a few dollars.

I purchased a scratchNdent and found my item had been used and slightly damaged, the top swirl grill was missing a small piece, and one of the sticky disks had been put into the unit already with a gnat stuck to it. Okay. I plugged it in, pushed one of the setting buttons (standard) and the light came on and the little fan makes a little bit of breeze, but wet a finger and hold it at the bottom and it is breezing out.

It is also bigger than I expected, but I have such a tiny bug issue in this place, I don't care as long as it works. Something was mentioned about it works better in lower light levels. So. I plugged it in and set it up in a place I have been having issues. Four hours later, I pick it up to look down in. There's a lot more than one gnat on the mat already. It's doing the job. Great.

The local little winged wildlife has resisted: letting the pots dry out good between waterings, watering with a mix of hydrogen peroxide and water, top mulching the pots, and the yellow sticky trap things. This seems to be vacuuming them up. YAY! If this works out I will get a couple more as I have plants in a few areas in my house.

Trust me, I have at least six different microbugs including fruit flies, fungus gnats (arrgh!), a different gnat, and not sure exactly but a few are like tiny tiny various sorts of beetles... keeping the swarms down would be wonderful, without killing my plants. I will update this as it goes..

The picture isn't quite truelight because it is fairly dark in there, but. That's what it sorta looks like ON in the dark. To the right that is a matte BLACK surface that it's reflecting off of.

Edit: my house is large, my buggie collection is way down on one end of the house where I have my first one, but. I just got a second one, also scratchNdent, to deal with the other end.

I seen where someone complained that it is a fly-spa. This will NOT work on houseflies. They are too big and strong to be whooshed down onto the sticky pad. There are other ones built ($60-80) as wall sconces that WILL do the houseflies. This isn't built for that.

However all the assorted little gnats and such are collecting at alarming rates on my sticky pads. It is nice to sit at my computer in the evening and not kill at least a dozen tiny assorted buggies. And my fungus gnat problem that came in with some potting soil mix, is pretty much gone.

I can't say enough, if you have a grow booth and issues with little critters, that putting one of these in the booth at about two weeks for a night will not affect your grow and if there is anything in there it will clear out most of the problems. I have one room where the booth and most of my houseplants live (plus my spring starts as I go into that season as I update this) and the first one is outside the grow booth on the floor where it clears
that room pretty well.

Second one installed near the kitchen sink and other bathroom on other end of house, as there is a persistent problem there. I don't think it will catch sewer flies but those tend to respond to hot vinegar flushed through a running disposal with hot sink water, then follow with a cut up lemon and some icecubes run through the disposer. I will let you know if I get those little buggers back and if it can catch one or not.

On both I am turning them off during the day and on after dark, as that is when the UV light seems to be the most visible to the little winged pests. I also want to see if the kitchen one will draw spiders. There are a few kinds that are drawn to dead prey, and though I have sticky traps for them, if this will be able to stick one down or not if it comes to check it out. Another thing I will update.

Edit update. Plant area one is catching mostly gnats, vatloads of them. Kitchen has only a few, but is getting the fruit flies from the bananas. I put spider traps near both and the kitchen catch is up. Could not be happier with both Katchys. Have spring bedding and flower starts going and a new grow in the tent. I‚Äôve put one in the tent a few times and no gnattie problem (last time will be day/ night 18 so as not to mess up auto blooming). No chemicals. Still worth the price. Replacing the sticky pads is super easy too.

Edit: very late fall. We are the house servants of two mixed breed part Persian purries. The grey and white one in particular has very fine hair and a very full coat despite daily brushing/grooming. So we have slightly pre-used fur all over. Plus lots of house dust-joys of where we live. I have to take a q-tip to the top of both my Katchy‚Äôs weekly to keep the house glorp from obstructing airflow (also have to do it to our tower fans). Still catching the tiniest no-see-ums, fungus gnats and fruit flies. With fall garden harvest, the fruit flies moved in. I added a capful of apple cider taped off with a few holes next to the kitchen one, and it was literally carpeted with fruit flies in the bottom. The plants that came in brought micro buggies, and those numbers are quickly dropping as well.

A Katchy doesn‚Äôt instantly get your population but in days you should have a disgusting collection on the bottom pad‚Ä¶ I purchased a no- zap UV/sticky pad catcher meant for houseflies and installed over the toilet at the ceiling. It also does the job with a little time. So. Katchy do their job well, are easy to use and maintain, and paired with a true flycatcher, really helps keep you unbothered. $40 well spent.

Does what it‚Äôs supposed to do. I recommend running this at night, excess ambient light will cause the gnats to scatter to that source. I have ran this for 2 nights at 9 hours run time so far I‚Äôve caught 22 of them.

The item arrived broken :(
¬†
I am SUPREMELY disappointed because I was so excited at the thought of having an effective method to combat my nemesis that is the mischievously thriving fruit fly colony which plagues me, and this item arrived this morning broken. :( The blades of the fan internally are not connected and are banging about inside. Though I don't normally pay full price for things unless necessary (I either wait for a good sale or use applicable coupons/promo codes), I took the plunge on this purchase due to my need for a competent and efficient resolve combined with it's GLOWING reviews! First, I had to wait 9 days to receive the item, which I wasn't happy about, but not upset either. I have literally been checking tracking daily and looking forward to it's arrival. Then it arrives *HAPPY DAY*. I opened the package, removed the unit (felt/heard something odd but didn't think too much of it at that moment), reviewed the directions, plugged it in and although the light came on, the fan did not. I thought maybe I need to press a particular button or what-have-you, so I re-read the directions. Nope, it should be automatic. So I then began inspecting the unit and realized the fan blades were not connected. I then even looked for a way to open the unit without busting it so that I can fix it myself (I'm incredibly handy and that's how much I wanted this to work!). No go. I could probably open it up, but then it wouldn't be returnable. Ok, so THEN I go to the item link on Amazon and as of earlier today, it said "This item is currently unavailable" followed by something to the effect of 'and we don't know if or when it will become available'. I attempted to contact the seller to no avail. My only viable option was and is to return it. I don't want to return it for a refund or leave a bad review. Rather, I want the working unit I paid and patiently waited for. Errrrr. I decided to go about my day knowing I'd come back to this later and here I am. ... I pull the item up this evening, it is in fact available again, but instead of the $39.79 price I paid 9 days ago, it is right now (6/15/2018) listed at $54.49. Whaaaa?? So I am leaving this review in hopes that the seller will contact me and make good on my purchase, at which point I would update my review to reflect the working conditions of this seemingly enigmatic device.

In summary, this 1 star review encompasses only that the item arrived broken and therefore did not operate as intended. A working unit may very well be worthy of all it's positive reviews. And maaaaybe even the new $54.49 price.

I hope I am a unique case. I also hope this review was of help to you.

Update 6/17/18:
The seller contacted me today apologizing for my inconvenience and explaining that Amazon is responsible for the damage done during the shipping of this product. I responded immediately that I appreciate the response and although I completely understand that Amazon assumes the shipping responsibility, I am also concerned that I cannot repurchase a working unit at the price I paid 2 weeks ago. I inquired how this can be rectified, stating that I fully intend to update my review according to their level of service and the actual benefits of a working unit.¬† And now I await their response.

Honestly, if I have to repurchase at the higher price, I won't and I'll leave my review star at 1. It's not the price as much as the principle. Products can be damaged in shipping, that's understandable. But the seller is also responsible for commitment. So I'm really hoping they come through with a reasonable resolve that honors the price I paid for a working unit. I'll keep you posted.

Update 7/1/18:
The seller not only replaced my originally bought unit, but included extras as well. They have been extremely diligent in correspondence and I can honestly say that I am not only satisfied, but impressed.

With that said, I would not have altered my review to 5 stars for customer service alone. ...these units works amazingly! The home I live in was built in 1924 and does not sport insulation the way a new home would. So pests are/can be/were a problem. The units do in fact attract flying things very well! The sticky pad of results had 2 bugs I didn't know I had and don't recognize. I am extremely happy with my purchase! And may very well buy more.

The unit itself is aesthetically pleasing and is relatively quiet. Night is the best time for results since that's when it's darkest and the bugs can 'see' the light. The blue light transitions in brightness, which is even more effective in attracting it's prey.

I'm changing my review from a 1 star to a 5 star. I saw other reviews stating it was a flimsy design. I do get what they're saying, but how thick must this unit be to rectify that?? It works as intended and looks good doing it. The bottom is easy to open to check and/or replace the sticky pad. There are only 2 buttons so it's super easy to operate. And it doesn't look like a bug catcher at all. No one would know. So I feel it's 'flimsiness' (is that a word?) is of no concern. As long as it performs, who cares how heavy or thick it is?

This is 5 stars from someone who had to work for it. I hope this review helped you! Happy bug hunting :)

I over the last few month I had seen an increase in the number of gnats, fruit flies and mosquitos invading my apt so I searched for an indoor bug catcher to help control the problem and found this item. It‚Äôs a small quiet machine with two speeds and has a UV light at the top. When you turn it on the light comes on and a quiet vacuum comes on which pulls the bugs to the bottom of the trap where a glue board is located. At first it seemed a bit sketchy but after 3-4 days I noticed a decrease in the amount of flying insects in my apt. It‚Äôs best to turn it on at night so the light attracts the bugs and it works it‚Äôs magic. There is different version that is automatic which comes on when it gets dark or you can buy the manual one. It comes with 4 glue boards but you can buy replacement boards on Amazon. I had this now for a few weeks and have yet to have to change the glue board. Pretty good product!

reviews.content: I love this little compressor ! I've already had to use it 3 times since getting it with these temperature fluctuations that seem to affect my tire pressure. It's easy to use. You just plug it into your lighter outlet, then set it to the correct measurement, in my case I used PSI. You then set it to the PSI you want, in my case 36 and then screw the hose end onto the tire valve. It will digtally display the current tire pressure. You may hear a bit of air hiss until its fully connected. You don't need to overscrew it. You will know by the hims stopping and it will feel right. Simply turn the machine on and it will fill the tire surprisingly pretty quickly. Quicker than at the pay pumps! The display will reflect the filling progress and stops automatically when set PSI is reached. You shut the machine off and disconnect the hose. Voila! Your tire is good to go! This will pay for itself in time and money driving around trying to find a working air pump when your tires are low. I am super happy I got it.

I did not know before this that you don't HAVE to drag out at least a pancake air compressor, plug it in to charge, have a long ass hose and drag it to your car to air your tires. That is how I had always seen it done. Funny, right?

This product seems well made, it's cute for an air compressor and EASY to use. It gives me peace of mind knowing I can keep my tires maintained easily. I LOVE this product! So easy for a person to keep their tires on point. I also got the carrying case; worth it.

A must have for a vehicle owner.

Pumps well. Haven't had any issues. Have been pumping a tire from 10psi to 33psi every morning for a month because I have a slow leak I'm too lazy to get fixed.

Socket plug is sturdy -- I got this to replace a lesser pump whose electrical plug melted.

Pressure shut off works as expected. Remembers pressure setting in between uses. If you forget to turn off the pump, that's ok. Even if the pump is "on" when you first plug it in, it won't turn on until you turn it off and back on again. Really important in conjunction with auto shut off -- I often forget to turn the switch to off when I'm done.

Light seems good.

Red LED on the plug socket to let you know when it is powered -- a nice touch as my former pump didn't have this and it was a hassle to get it inserted properly. No such issue here.

It's loud but not moreso than any other pump I've used.

I had a Black and Decker jump starter combo unit on which the pump died and could not be replaced; it had digital pressure gauge and auto stop. Got another combo unit but it has analog gauge in a hard place to see and must be monitored to avoid over inflation. Which meant squatting beside the loud thing. This new pump is quieter and faster, and can be set to run automatically. The gauge seems to show the same values as my others, so it is accurate enough. Of course, being corded is less convenient than the others, and it just barely reaches the back tires on my Honda Odyssey, and has to be passed through the vehicle when switching from passenger to driver side. It is not a very heavy cord so you will need to run the engine to get more voltage for the unit to do its best. But it inflates faster than the other units I have owned, is not as loud.

Power Cord length is good for a sedan. Might be a little short for a pick up truck. I wish the air hose could be just a little longer.
The air pump is sufficient enough to handle all 4 tires. Pumping from 29psi to 40psi is no sweat and only takes a couple mins if most. Its very quick. It makes some noise but what do you expect? It needs to pump air.
I keep it inside the house during winter because of freezing temps.
I bought 3 of these total because I've been very impressed with it. 1 for myself. 2 as a white elephant gift.
UPDATE REVIEW 1/29/23 I've used this several times now. Wisconsin weather can get cold... I found the air attachment lever that folds over can be prone for failure to being weak and can eventually stop clamping down and will leak air during pumping air. Make sure told hold down tight before clamping it closed. And when you go store it; leave it open position. This needs to be upgraded by the manufacturer. At least mine doesn't want to clamp down anymore after a few uses. I have to push down hard and then clamp.
In conclusion, for the price... it does what it's suppose to do. After all, it's better than waiting in line at the pump on a freezing winter day.

Since many of the reviews mentioned needing to turn the car on, I was worried this was not going to work because I own an electric car that doesn‚Äôt have an on button (you just sit down with the keys in the car to turn it on‚Äîit doesn‚Äôt stay on continually if you aren‚Äôt sitting). Not a worry though, this worked no problem similar to other cars (no babysitting the car to keep it on). It worked quickly, is easy to work, and adorably smaller than I thought it looked in the pictures which helps for garage organizing! Definitely worth it.

Worked exactly how it was supposed to right out of the box. Easy to use and inflated my completely flat tire to 32 lbs of pressure in less than five minutes (I wasn't counting, it was probably closer to three minutes but it was definitely under five). Gave me enough time to drive down the street to the tire place.

My car's tire pressure monitoring goes off all the time as the temperatures shift and this has already saved money by not having to go to the gas station multiple times every winter to pay for air.

After spending several hours lately trying to find a functioning air machine at any local gas stations I finally broke down and ordered the AstroAl inflator and I am really, really glad I did. I used it to check and pump up the tires in both our vehicles; it is easy to use and absolutely does what it says it does. I am only sorry I waited as long as I did and can now just skip the hassle of broken or cut hoses or air machines that take your money and don‚Äôt work, and now just have an inflator that I can carry around and does just what I need.

Updated Review:
I bought this AstroIA Air Compressor and started using it in November 2021. I used it once a month and sometimes twice a month to pump up one of my car's tires for about 6-8 minutes each time to 32 pci. By October 2022, the pump part stopped working suddenly during use even though the flashlight and display were still working. I could read the gauge, but it just won't add air. I was so disappointed because I love how well this compressor worked when it was working. Then I remembered that Amazon's page said this item includes one year warranty, and in the question and answer section the seller had said it includes a three year warranty as they are confident about this product. I decided to take the chance to contact the company via Amazon's page that lead me to their email address at support@astroai.com.

I informed the seller of my issue with the product and they replied within a day asking questions and for more details. After several emails back and forth, the seller honored their warranty and sent me a replacement within a week. I was so happy that they followed up with me professionally and came through on their warranty. I have to say that even though AstroAI cost a bit more than other compressors, it is well worth it as this is a real company that backs their products. It is nice to know that you expect a good product and if anything is imperfect, the company will make it right. This company has the same quality service just like Amazon's customer service. So be confident in your purchase of this product. Go ahead and buy it with confidence.

Original Review:
The AstroIA Air Compressor is the best corded compressor I have used so far as this is my third corded compressor ever used. My only complaint is that the power cord could be much longer as it is not long enough to reach all tires if you have a longer or larger car. It uses a 12v power cord that connects to your cigarette lighter in the car. However, you can separately purchase an extension cord with a transformer that connects to 12v, which is what I did that can connect to a wall outlet.

Things I like are that it comes with several air pump attachments so that you can pump other items besides tires; a fuse in case you need to replace the fuse (instruction says not to use pump for more than fifteen minutes at a time, so don‚Äôt do more than one to two tires at a time); it takes around 6-8 minutes to pump up the tire; automatically shuts off if you set tire to psi you want (there are other forms of measurements in the digital display, so be sure you select ‚Äúpsi‚Äù for Americans); light weight; and easy to repack and put back into the box.

Compared to rechargeable battery powered pumps, this is not as fast, but definitely faster than other corded pumps I have used. Other corded pumps can take 10-20 minutes per tire. Rechargeable battery pumps can do a tire in about 3-4 minutes. This pump is not as loud as other pumps, but it does make noise.

The great thing that this pump has that I did not see in older pumps is the automatic shut off upon reaching the desired psi. I do not have to stay with the pump while it is pumping. I let it pump in the driveway while I go into house away from the cold. When I hear the pump stops, I come back out to unleash the pump and turn the switch back to off before unplugging it and put it away. Even when the pump stops, the power remains on as the digital display needs power, so be sure you switch the power off.

This pump is light weight and nice looking, and easy to use. It comes with an instructional booklet that has multiple languages. They should update the compressor with a longer cord though, and it would be perfect.

Have used several times to top off truck tire pressure after cold weather temperature changes. The digital pressure gauge is consistently within 0.5 lbs of truck sensor gauge and a hand gauge.

The only improvement I can offer, to make this compressor even better, is to include a cloth or PVC type "ditty" storage bag, to keep the 12v power cord, hose, and accessories all together when storing in my truck. Storing with the packaging box takes up too much space.

aboutProductTopics.name: Make sure this fits by entering your model number.

FAST INFLATION & ADVANCED ACCURACY: High-quality materials were sourced for this tire inflator as it can pump up your car's tires with 35 L/Min, it can inflate the 195/55/R15 car tire from 0 to 35psi under 5 minutes. Professionally calibrated to always return a reading within 1.5% of the pressure of your tire. Please NOTE that after 10-15 minutes of continuous use, let the air compressor rest and cool for an equal amount of time at a minimum before continuing use.

PROGRAMMABLE INFLATION: Use the "M" button to set your desired pressure unit, and then press the "+" and "-" buttons to set the desired pressure. The air compressor will automatically shut off when it reaches the pre-set pressure (Please make sure the pressure you set is higher than the current pressure of your tire).

PRODUCT HIGHLIGHTS: One-click to change pressure units among PSI, kPa, BAR and KG/CM; Large white backlight LCD screen makes it easy to read even in the dark; Equipped with integrated LED flashlight with independent switch control for emergency use; 12V 120W 10ft (3.05 meters) long heavy-duty car cigarette lighter cord makes it convenient to use;NOT 110V AC plug. It needs a 10A or 15A converter to use in a wall plug.

WIDE RANGE OF APPLICATIONS: 3 Nozzles and Extra Fuse Included. Inflates any Schrader valve on cars, SUVs, motorcycles, and bicycles; the included accessories quickly inflate balls, air pillows, cushions, balloons and mattresses. NOTE: This pump is NOT intended for use with high pressure or large volume applications like pools and Inflatable canoe

BUY WITH CONFIDENCE: Christmas decorations and gifts for men women. Easily stow the compressor away in your car or garage and it will be ready to use at a moment‚Äôs notice. Package includes 1* digital air compressor, 1* Replacement Fuse, 2x Air Nozzle Cones, 1* Needle Valve Adapter 1* Presta to Schrader Adapter, 1* Extension Hose Coupling, 1* User Manual; If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to contact us.

reviews.content:
Don't get me wrong, these are probably worth it for the $35 I paid, but its a large gap in quality between these and "name brand" binoculars.

First off, they are nearly identical in size to Vortex Viper 10x42s. Build quality is definitely lacking on these, even when comparing to low end name brand binos. The pivot between eye pieces doesn't have enough resistance and if you hold them one handed the other side will droop after a minute or two, the focus wheel is also too easy to move and worst of all it has backlash. This makes dialing in focus is a bit of a nightmare, especially when looking over hilly terrain where you are constantly adjusting it in and out. The diopter adjustment moves every time you rotate the eye cups to close them in, and the over molded TPU is not affixed to the inner metal frame so you can feel it sliding around.

As for actual glass quality.... I was not able to get proper eye relief while wearing glasses as my eyes were too far away, an issue I've never had with any other binocular. If you look dead center they are fairly clear, but there is a definite vignette filter thing going on, no matter how perfectly I try to dial the diopter in. In fairness this is really only noticeable if look to the edge of the eye box which I'm guessing most people don't do through binoculars, but I like to set mine on a tripod to scan a whole treeline without moving the binos and look through a spotting scope for details, so this is a downside for me. Brightness is my biggest issue, they are realllllly bad at dusk, basically don't even bother 10 minutes after sunset. I can clearly see details for another 10 minutes through Diamondbacks/Intensitys, and then another few minutes after that when looking through my Vipers.

The case really isn't bad, its made of a rigid cloth, that actually works better than most of my other bino cases as it doesn't collapse when you put the binos in, so that is kind of nice. The neck strap would preferably be about twice as wide, but functions just fine.

All in all, exactly what I expected for the price, but nothing like what the reviews make it out to be, and perfect for what I need them for... a pair I can leave in the hunting vehicle and not be very worried about them being stolen and punishment for my son when he forgets to pack his binos on a hunting trip.

If this is going to be your only pair of binos, I would look elsewhere. Keep in mind you can pickup Vortex Diamondbacks for $100 on sale, and you get one of the best warranties out there. I ran a pair of Vortex's over with a truck, and when buying a new pair at the store I told the clerk about it and he said Vortex would probably replace them for me... sure enough three days later I had a replacement pair from Vortex and if I remember correctly I didn't even have to pay shipping.

I dont know a great deal about binoculars, but decided to buy my mother a ‚Äúgood‚Äù set since she moved to Florida and started to casually take up bird watching. Wanting to go with a reputable brand and after a few hours of research and reading, i went with Vortex Diamondbacks and had them delivered to her home. Since i was taking a trip to visit, i found these for $25 and figured I‚Äôd buy them just to see what the extra money actually got her since the style, size, and descriptions are almost identical. There is a clear difference when you compare the imagines switching back and forth. THAT SAID - the difference the extra $225 made is not nearly as large as you‚Äôd expect. Its the Ultra fine details, the edges, and sharpness/clarity of the objects at distance that are noticeable. I honestly expected to be blown away how much better the Vortex was - but i wasnt. You‚Äôd really have to be an optics guy to appreciate the small difference in image quality. I mean the difference is there, but its a very small difference. I‚Äôm CERTAIN the Vortex is a ‚Äúbetter‚Äù binocular, not to mention the support you get from a good brand that will stand behind a product they warranty without question. They simply feel better too as soon as you pick them up - but these two brands are extremely similar in feel, style and features. Meaning, for 90% - 95% of people these would be just as good as the Vortex unless you‚Äôre REALLY willing to spend a lot more money for not much difference. So if you are an average person thats looking to buy a set ‚Äújust to have them‚Äù, to bring to a football game, to enjoy yourself outdoors, try your hand at birdwatching, ect - I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate buying these. If there is any chance of them getting lost, stolen, broken, or generally beat up - dont spend the extra money. If you decide later that you wanna buy something better, than consider these as your insurance in a backup pair, or a second set to lend to a friend. You really, really cant complain about what you get for the money. The case is garbage compared to a vortex, its just a basic pouch - but it serves its purpose. These even come with lens covers - just like the Vortex - (they dont fit as well) but buying those alone separately would probably cost $10. As far as bang for your buck - from an average guys opinion, i cant see a better option than this. If i were to try to set a scale comparing them against the Vortex Diamondbacks, if the Diamondbacks were a 10 - these would be a 8.5 in an overall comparison (not just clarity). I can only imagine the difference between these and say the Vortex Crossfire‚Äôs (one step below the Diamondbacks) would be even smaller. When it comes to things like this, just like rifle scopes, small differences come at a big expense, and I imagine a large chuck of the cost for a pair of binoculars from a place like Vortex is to cover the costs of a large company and their marketing - which these dont have to pay for. At the price, (esp at the $25 i paid) you have absolutely nothing to lose. If you already have a good set, and just want a second pair - buy these. You‚Äôll be amazed at how good these are for the money.

Lastly - for those who dont know what the number mean - (10x40) (12x50) - the first number is the power of the magnification (10 times closer, 12 times closer) and the second is the size larger lens (how big of an area it will allow you to see when you look through). For bird watching, experts claim the ideal sizes are either 10x42 or 12x42.. you dont want something extremely powerful, but you want something with a larger lens so its easier to find what your looking for, and keep looking at it while it‚Äôs moving (like a bird, obviously, or even a football game, Anything that can be moving at speed). A size 50 lens is physically a bigger (And would give you a larger picture) but are a larger heavier set of binoculars - so the 42 lens is a great compromise. For a easy way to think of it - to give people a rough idea, say a 12x20 you would be able to see a large bird at distance, but he may take up the entire ‚Äúscreen‚Äù (for lack of a better word) as you looked through those binoculars - where with a 12x45 set you would see the same bird just as large - but you‚Äôd also be able to see a large area around him. So Its easier to find him, and if he moves you can easily follow him and also see whats around him. There is not a huge difference between a 10x or 12x set of binoculars, so dont go crazy like i did. (I ordered and canceled 3 times before i finally picked what size on the Vortex). But if you were on the fence trying to decide if these were worth your money - Yes, they are. You‚Äôll be surprised and impressed what the money got you.
This product works really good for a daily trail venture. It is light, has a good length carrying strap and also a nice case to preserve it

I bought these binoculars as a gift for a friend.. I was a little worried because of what they cost.. They far exceeded my expectations for what I paid for them.. I couldn't believe how well made. They were an easy to use.. The images were absolutely amazing and well lit.. Great paraphinoculars for the money..ü•∞üòé

The Binoculars are very clear and light weight. I have not yet tried the phone/photo attachment but appears to be easy to assemble. I definitely feel they are worth the price.
I'm so glad I purchased them I have an old pair but looking through these it's like day and night and plus the little stand for my cell phone, give me the opportunity to get some really good pictures

I'll be taking these hiking and I'm really excited to use them. I've used them around my house to see birds from a distance and these are really good for the money you pay. The binoculars themselves are looking very promising. The glass is clear and you get a lot of good details and overall easy to use. I'm impressed. Now the camera adapter, complete crap. I tried to used it and it broke as soon as I applied some pressure.
I'll be updating my review after my trip...

name: Flexi Hose with 8 Function Nozzle Expandable Garden Hose 50 ft, Lightweight & No-Kink Flexible Extendable Garden Flex Hose, 3/4 inch Solid Brass Fittings and Double Latex Core, 50ft Black
description: Product Description

reviews.content:
I bought two of these in September of 2018. One for the deck and one for the front porch. I found them to be very handy and the one on the deck is still working fine. It coils up, stretches out, is hardly more than the weight of the water! Easy to maneuver because it's flexibile and light weight.

I flipped the one on the front porch over a bush this summer and it came apart. The fittings are high quality brass, but the hose came apart about a foot from the spigot. I was very surprised! It is unrepairable so I had to throw it away.

The only other thing is that the hose on the deck is behind the porch swing. There is about 2 feet of space between the railing and the swing. When I turn the hose on back there, it fills up quickly, expanding in every direction and there is no place for me to step without stepping on the hose. I usually step on it about 5-6 times before I can get out from behind it all. It is not damaged yet, which is a little surprising! It seems to be very sturdy and I hope it lasts a long time yet.

The hose in the front popping open was a pretty big surprise. It is not under my feet to turn it on so I have rarely stepped on it. It has had pretty gentle care. Overall, they are pretty convenient, but I am not quite ready to spend that much again for something that lasts 4 seasons. I am trying a local hose from a reputable nursery now in the front. I can't manipulate heavy hoses anymore, so if this doesn't last, I may be back because they are very easy to use and very convenient. :-)

I was in the market for a new hose for cleaning off my condo balcony. I had used expandable hoses before and liked them. But, due to a bonehead move by me, I had to resort to on line videos to remove an old hose. You see, I we had purchased an expandable hose with an aluminum female connector. Aluminum and copper don't mix nicely. I should know that, we have a boat and know about galvanic reaction. Anyway, I left the hose connected for a couple of weeks and had to hacksaw it off. I did this when my husband was not around so he wouldn't know. BAHAHAHA! He ended up knowing and was impressed that I didn't ruin the copper threads on the hose. Anyway, we had a good laugh and this time I am not making the same mistake. Should I leave the hose attached, it will not matter as the new one has copper fittings. The hose seems sturdy and does not leak. I cannot comment on it's durability as I need to use it for awhile.
So far so good, only had for about 2 weeks. Does the job too early for durability.
So far so good.

This hose is awesome! It is light and small. It expands to it‚Äôs 100ft when used and shrinks again when empty. It is easy to move around with no kinks or tangles. The design of the hose pretty much maintains the water pressure until the hose is impressively empty, which is neat. Also because it is soft and light it is so much gentler on the plants and pots it accidentally bumps into/brushes over. Besides that it isn‚Äôt really bumping things as the soft flexibility of the hose makes it easier to control the length of it behind you. Overall this hose is just so easy to water my whole yard with, with none of the hassles of traditional hoses. Excellent gift for yourself or others!
Revived promptly product as described at a fair price

Absolutely love this hose. We live in a condo with our plants on a patio which does not have a water outlet. We added a double outlet to the washing machine water source so that we could use the normal hose attachment. It easily reaches out from our kitchen to our two patios, yet springs back to a small hose when empty so that it stores easily in the tiny storage spot beside our washing machine. Doesn't tangle, and the material it's made from doesn't harm or dirty the wood and carpeted floors it has to traverse from faucet to patio. Any other normal hose would take too much space and probably ruin our floors. Sure beats hauling countless watering cans. Actually does make having plants on our patio much more enjoyable. We've had it nearly a year, and it is still like new. We do store in inside out of the sun. We just love it and so grateful for this option.

I have two of these hoses that I purchased almost four years ago. They have not performed very well until one of them sprung a leak spontaneously. I contacted customer service and they immediately responded and are sending a replacement hose, after I provided them the order details. Apparently they really do have a lifetime warranty!

We love these hoses. We have several that we use in different colors for different purposes. They shrink down and fit in a nice small pouch that takes up little room. They're very light. They extend to the full length advertised. Our only complaint is the material. The material is similar to shoe laces and takes a while to dry when it gets wet, so something to consider if you store it in the bags like we do (we use them in our RV for fresh and black rinse water). The material type also lets things like sticker burrs latch on and stab you when you're not paying attention. For this reason we stopped using them in our yard. If you have nice green grass or you have it hooked up to a faucet to water flowers this thing is perfect. It works wonderfully for our RV since we're always refreshing the tanks over concrete. But if your yard is like our wilderness and has things like stickers, go with a more traditional hose.
I already have a 100 ft one I use for my front yard flowers and rose bushes and it has been completely reliable. That‚Äôs why I bought the 50 ft one for a smaller area.

Placement Tips

	

	



Multiple Placements

Damp & Moist Locations

Switch it Up
