reviews.content:
It was horrible - because it Works Perfectly !
Little smart critters don‚Äôt like metallic crinkle of aluminum foil, so you can lay strips/tracks of foil to direct the critters path into these glue traps, (my recommendation, since they‚Äôre smart enough to avoid). A peppermint spray helped banish them from hiding spots, so they had nowhere to go but into the trap paths I‚Äôd set up. My hyperactive startle response caused heart palpitations whenever I heard the dreaded noises. I‚Äôm overly empathetic about the cruelty of this method. Luckily my neighbor has volunteered to take care of discarding (while I burry my face and sing La La La La La making him laugh). Ideally a quick, more humane death could be made available via some mini gas chamber, instead of the awful option here alone. I hate that I have to do this, but my nerves are frayed, food larder ruined, and the barnyard smell & disease vector simply isn‚Äôt healthy.
Water leak allowed them entry. Now it‚Äôs fixed & I have walls again. Hopefully the nightmare will be over. I‚Äôm Piling metal shavings & then spray foam into any cracks in walls at floor.

Not easy to remove the capture doesn‚Äôt mean this product is not good and actually it‚Äôs super effective!! if it‚Äôs easy to remove it won‚Äôt work so we‚Äôll. This little guy has been living somewhere in the porch for a while and left many droppings every 2 days. I‚Äôm really tired cleaning up after him and bought him Tomcat bait. He took that for snacks and still very healthy. He tampered the snap trap and got away with the apple on it. I was humiliated and that hurt my feelings. Then this magic board arrived. I put 4 along the wall, checked an hour or 2 later and got him. It‚Äôs not easy to set him free though. Olive oil worked slowly and that might give the rat a good PTSD. I strongly recommend this product.

These work better than anything I‚Äôve tried: traps, other brands of adhesive traps, wildlife safe poison like Rat and MouseX (you have to have patience with the latter and I was not feeling it this week) . I was pretty sure that I‚Äôd spotted a runway for what appeared to be a juvenile rat/very large field mouse. Caught him on the second day plus three other house mice who came to see what was going on. It‚Äôs not an instant kill of course and you do have to drown them if you want to quickly put them out of their misery. But I figure that misery pales next to the extreme and eventual fatal pain experienced by owls and other raptors who grab a rodent slowed by conventional poisoning.
The problem I have with the product is the manufacturer‚Äôs instructions on this page do not match the product as delivered. ‚ÄúFor best use, leave trap with paper on so pests can acclimate to the trap, then place glue boards along known or suspected rodent pathways.‚Äù
Made sense to me. Only there were no papers on these traps. Instead they were inverted so sets of two were stuck together face to face. Pull them apart and the glue was already exposed. Rats especially can be suspicious, but there was no putting down these traps covered so a rat could safely investigate and grow comfortable with them before the fatal glue was exposed.
If the manufacturer thinks this approach is enhances the likelihood of a clean catch then the product should be delivered in a way that makes it possible.

There is a reason why professional exterminators use this and don't bother with "snap traps" - they flat out work. But there are a few things to keep in mind to make sure you get maximum effectiveness:

1. You must know the path that the critters are taking. Just spend some time getting inside the head of your vermin - they have a nest somewhere and they travel back and forth to food and water sources. They will usually travel against walls and along the tops of roof joists. If you find holes in walls, you will often see a dirty smudge where their filthy little tails drag along behind them. You will also see droppings (they seem to poop constantly). Place these traps in the high traffic areas, arranging them so that they are butted against walls, and along the trails they follow (think of the way ants travel in a line - rats and mice kind of do the same thing).

2. Don't bother with bait - if you follow the instructions in #1 above you don't need bait. I have never baited these things and I have caught a LOT of rats (my wife feeds birds in our yard and the seed attracts rats).

3. Do NOT use these outside or anywhere your pets or children can come in contact with them. If you put them outside, you will inevitably end up with a bird stuck to it, and unless you are a cold-hearted killer, you will feel awful. When I have to use them outside (like along the pathways the rats use to visit the bird feeders) I cover them with a long pice of plywood propped against the wall to create a "tunnel" and try to make it much more difficult for anything other than a rat or mouse to get stuck. Also, curious house cats will OFTEN get stuck in these, especially if there is a mouse or rat thrashing around on it and squeaking. Let me tell you that it is NO fun trying to pull one of these off your cat's face while there is a live rat stuck to it (or a toddler's shoe!). Also not covering them, you'll end up with a lot of leaf litter on them, which hinders their effectiveness.

4. Don't use these if you can't handle the sight of a dead (or dying) rat or mouse. Be prepared to "dispatch" the animal humanely once they are trapped. These traps do not cause instant death (the way snap traps do). The animal will eventually die (often from suffocation or shock) but the most humane thing to do is to kill them once you hear the squeaking and thrashing around. Speaking of which, it is fairly common (especially for a larger rat) to become partially stuck on one of these traps. I had a big wood rat get his back end stuck on one in my attic one night, and he flipped out, thrashing around and dragging it all over the place until I was able to crawl up there and "take him out". Outside, I usually use a shovel to decapitate them quickly when they get stuck. In the attic, I will usually use a very sharp hunting knife or a pair of lopping shears to decapitate them. (Did I mention this is not for squeamish people?). On a side note, don't leave these in the attic too long without checking them. Trust me, if you wait until you smell something funny, you are going to have a very unpleasant situation to deal with.

5. Make sure you wear rubber/latex/nitrile gloves while disposing of these once you have a dead mouse/rat. The reason is twofold: first, they are filthy disease-ridden creatures and they tend to poop and pee all over when they die, and you don't want contact with that. Secondly, if you accidentally get stuck to the trap while retrieving it, you can slip off a glove easily. If you're bare skin gets stuck (and these things are STICKY!) you will have a real mess do deal with.

These are great, super-sticky traps. I don‚Äôt know if it was even two hours after setting a trap out with a dab of peanut butter in the center that I got my first mouse that snuck its way into the garage. I have more traps set now just to make sure there are no more critters in there. I think I‚Äôll keep a stash of these at all times and periodically hide them and make sure my living spaces are critter-free. Very worth the money!

I bought a handful of these glue traps and set them up in areas where I have seen mice running around. After a few weeks, I had not trapped one. I decided to throw a few peanuts onto the traps and within three days, three mice are caught and gone. So, yes, they do work BUT I think that the scent that is added does not attract the mice...but with a few peanuts or a tiny dollop of peanut butter, they definitely do their job!

Caught three mice within 10 minutes of putting them down. By the morning there were 14. The cherry/almost scent works like a charm and I didn‚Äôt add other bait. Will definitely buy again if I need them.

I put out one of these in an area where we knew we had had rats before and where we currently had traditional spring traps with peanut butter, but the rat ignored the other traps and went straight for the glue trap. It is stuck on its side and can‚Äôt get off.

This mouse has been taking a crap on my work desk for months. I finally got sick of it and decided to invest in a trap. Literally the day after putting some bait down i come in the office to see this little bastard.
I have mice in a rural cabin. They eat poison for snacks, steal bait out of traps - nothing has worked. These traps caught 6 mice in 5 days; they really work. Highly recommended.

reviews.content:
I bought these cubes for my grandson who is 7 but is very advanced for his age. He had one cube before but there is not much you can do with just one cube. Now he loves playing with the bunch because it allows for many more possibilities.
Before giving this gift, I wanted to test how difficult they are for a person over 60. At first it was quite challenging to create anything interesting. Then I realized that the more I try to control the process, the less successful the result. The more playful and curious I became, the more magic had happened on its own. It is a very peculiar and wonderful toy. I like the total sense of it: beautiful design; perfect size with smooth texture for easy grip; not too tight and not too loose in the joints; also they create a nice clicking sound when the cube's magnetic sides connect. So, overall it is pleasing to all our senses and helps to evolve our creative mind.
Brilliant invention! Highly recommend.

I bought this for a grandchild for Christmas. She loves this kind of thing and I thought she would enjoy it. They are a little steep in price and I must say, I was a bit surprised when it arrived in a tiny little 2.5 x 2.5 inch box, (From the pics, I was expecting something about double that size). I wanted to be certain I was getting a decent quality item, so I removed it from the box and started messing around with it to check quality and entertainment value. Well, we are now 3 days closer to Christmas since it arrived and I am no closer to getting back into that 2.5 x 2.5 box it came in. It is ridiculous how many times I have tried to fold it back into a tiny little square! To be honest, I simply feel frustrated with the whole damn thing. I even had ideations of tearing it apart and gluing it back together. (Then I remembered what I paid and I thought better of it.) The quality certainly seems decent. I am basing that on the fact that it didn't come apart yet and I think I have folded it every which way to Sunday. On the upside, my granddaughter is probably going to love it! She is just 9 yrs old, but will probably get it back in the box in 5 minutes!! So, I guess what I am reluctantly saying, is that I think the entertainment value is there. I still have 20 days to get some help (probably from a kid!) with getting this back in the box it came in. Otherwise, I will find a new box to wrap it in and keep the old box - so I can show the granddaughter how it looked when I got it. It is a little embarrassing that I have found this to be so difficult. But, I am trying to be transparent here and forewarn you that UNLESS you have some help from a genius (ok maybe exaggerating there), DO NOT take it out of the box to try it out if it is a gift for someone else! If they weren't so darn expensive, I would have simply just ordered another one and kept this one for my dumb self. üòú

EDIT: 01/24/23 - I did order a second one for myself (and company) Mind you, I did not even get it out until several days after Christmas. Today is the 24th of January and so we maybe had it opened 3 weeks. It has been played with quite a bit by kids and adults alike, however it is tearing apart at one of the seams. So, frankly we are a bit disappointed for spending $20 on something we thought we would enjoy a bit longer. After only 3 weeks, it is clear this one is not going to last much longer. I guess on the upside, $20 is really pretty cheap entertainment these days, when you consider the cost of going to a movie or bowling, eating out or any other activity. We probably did get at least $20 worth of entertainment, but still. üò¢

Sitting on the crossroads of order and chaos, art and geometry, sculpture and puzzle‚Äîthese cubes are my new obsession. I‚Äôm 31 and although playing with blocks makes me feel like I‚Äôm 3 again, their complexity is such that I have sunk hours into manipulating and admiring all the different shapes these can make. I inevitably had to get 2, and then 4 and finally 8 so I had a MEGACUBE. I plan on gifting these some day and already bought some for my friend who got me my first cube.

I bought this as a Christmas gift for a six year old and it was a definite hit. There are so many different shapes to make out of it and the magnetic connections are fun as well. The only thing I worry about is long-term durability as it appears everything is just stuck together with heavy duty stickers. We shall see, but for now, it is a blast to play with.

This was received very well by my nephews son, in fact everyone had a go at fidgeting with it during the evening.

It‚Äôs pretty neat, easy enough to manipulate, and between us all messing with it we discovered 2 or 3 designs that one night. Smaller than I expected, but that also makes it easily portable I suppose.

It‚Äôs comfortable in the hand, no sharp edges. Can‚Äôt speak to how it‚Äôs holding up as it was a gift.

My 7 year old son has significant ADHD but is also very intelligent. I bought this for him as a quiet fidget toy and it works wonderfully except that he keeps interrupting me to show me all the cool shapes he can make with it. We enjoy playing with it a little in the evening too :D

Got these for grandson and granddaughter at Christmas. They loved them and my grown daughters and sons-in-law had so much fun I had to buy more for them! They are very well assembled and durable since they get used quite often. Great gift for various ages!

Bought this for my 10 year old daughter and she loves it. She plays with it for a good amount of time and loves trying to make all kinds of different shapes with it. The whole family started playing with it too so it‚Äôs good kids and adults. Definitely recommend.

This is great for kids for all ages. If you have a child with ADHD or need to just keep them entertained for sometime, this is the best and the more you buy the better. It is my son ask for them all of the time and just adds onto them $25 a pop is pretty pricey but worth it in the long run. Plan to buy the whole collection.

I have purchased several of these shashibo cubes as gifts for both adults and kids. I even recently purchased one for myself to use in my office. It is great to mindlessly transform in your hands during conference calls and as a way to occupy yourself while actively pondering something. Its also great as a fidget for anxiety.

name: 12x42 HD Binoculars for Adults with Universal Phone Adapter - High Power Binoculars with Super Bright and Large View- Lightweight Waterproof Binoculars for Bird Watching Hunting Outdoor Sports Travel
description: Product Description

reviews.content:
The birds, fish, frogs, and turtles in my neighborhood have become my new friends since social distancing began, and these binoculars have been spectacl-ar in helping me identify them. I‚Äôd never used binoculars before this new hobby, so here are some things I‚Äôve learned that might be helpful to first-time users:

Binoculars always have two numbers in the spec, AxB. A represents the magnification ‚Äì the bigger the number, the more zoomed-in the image looks. B represents the size of the objective lens, which is the piece of glass at the far end of the binoculars. The bigger the number, the brighter and clearer the image looks.

They also have a focus wheel that sits between the two halves, which you‚Äôll have to rotate depending on whether you want to focus on something close or super far away. There‚Äôs also usually an additional fine tuner on the right eyepiece that will allow you to adjust for differences between your two eyes. So when using a pair of binoculars for the first time, you should close your right eye and use the focus wheel for just your left eye, and then close your left eye and use the fine tuner for your right eye. After that you can just directly use the focus wheel.

I had an old pair of Bushnell 12x25 binoculars at home before I got this Adasion 12x42 set. Here‚Äôs a comparison, with things I learned from experience:

1/ Size: The Adasion is bigger because of the larger objective lens. You can see the size difference in my first picture.

2/ Eyepiece: The Adasion has eye cups that rotate in and out, which give your eyes some breathing distance from the eyepiece lenses. You can see in the second picture the right eye cup has been extended while the left one has not. The Bushnell didn‚Äôt have this feature, so my eyelashes were always brushing against the glass, and the glass itself would frequently fog up.

3/ Straps: This seems like a trivial one, but it bothered me more than I expected. Bushnell‚Äôs straps attach at the center, while Adasion‚Äôs straps attach on each side. This results in the Bushnell hanging somewhat perpendicular to my torso, which makes it really annoying as it bounces along while I walk. The Adasion just lies comfortably flush against my torso.

4/ Protective covers: You can see these in the first picture. Each objective lens has an individual rubber cover that hangs off the end. If you don‚Äôt like them, you can remove them ‚Äì they‚Äôre attached by a rubber ring that slides off easily. But I think they‚Äôre great and protect the glass from smudges. The eyepiece lenses have a joint cover that you take off completely; I only put it back on when I‚Äôm done for the day.

5/ Picture quality: The most important difference. You can see four pictures I took through both binoculars. Interestingly, I found that the Bushnell binoculars were very slightly more magnified than the Adasion. I actually prefer the wider field of view of the Adasion, which is more forgiving of unsteady hands. The Bushnell also starts to get blurry on the edges (see the fence and bench or the floating grass in the fish photo), while the Adasion is much clearer throughout. In addition, colors are a lot brighter through the Adasion, while the Bushnell is a bit faded.

This brings me to my last piece of advice: the smartphone adapter is pretty cool. I had no idea what a phone adapter was in the beginning ‚Äì I assumed it was some kind of USB cable that digitally connected the binoculars to your phone, and you‚Äôd have to download an app or something to take pictures. Nope. So apparently, you can just hold up your phone camera to the eyepiece of any binoculars, have your phone ‚Äúlook‚Äù through the binoculars (monocular?), and you simply use the camera app to snap whatever your phone sees. It works surprisingly well as an amateur telephoto lens. That‚Äôs all I did to take the pictures from the Bushnell.

Turns out though, it‚Äôs kind of hard to hold the binoculars in one hand, your phone in the other, and both steady enough while maneuvering your thumb to snap the photo. It‚Äôs flat out impossible to take video. So the purpose of this phone adapter is to make it easier by holding your phone in place. It‚Äôs a very simple piece of hardware with a spring-loaded clamp around your phone (both an iPhone 6s and iPhone 11 fit just fine) and a round cap that attaches to either of the binoculars‚Äô eye cups. For best results, attach your phone without the eye cups extended. Righty tighty all the way. I find that provides the optimal phone-to-eyepiece distance for the best view from the camera.

I also did some extra research on phone adapters and tried to buy one for my Bushnell. The universal circular ones have a screw cap where the attachment can be expanded or contracted in order to fit any eye cup. But I actually found that the screw mechanism made the attachment so thick that my phone camera was too far away from the eyepiece to see much through it ‚Äì all I got was a small hole. In contrast, the adapter that comes with the Adasion was built to fit the Adasion eye cups perfectly. It‚Äôs a nice snug fit so your phone (even a heavy iPhone 11) will stay in place at just the right distance from the lens and without needing any hand support.

The last thing I‚Äôll say about the phone adapter is not to be surprised that your picture is a circle in a black vignette. That makes sense, since that‚Äôs what you see when your eyes look through the binoculars too. The rectangular photos from other reviews can be produced by either zooming using the camera‚Äôs zoom function or just cropping after the fact.

Okay that‚Äôs as much as I‚Äôve learned so far through my amateur explorations, hope you‚Äôve found it helpful. :)

I love these binoculars! I love to watch the wildlife and these are perfect for that. I can see far and it's clear and they aren't too heavy. They have phone features i haven't tried yet, but so far I'm very satisfied!

I wanted a set of Binoculars but didn't want to spend too much. I didn't plan to use them that much but there have been times I wanted to have them.
I ran across these an put them on my list. I didn't really care about the phone adaptor part but figured I might at some point.
After getting them I was surprised. They work well. Tried the phone thing and it's ok but really about the same as any other adaptor. It IS a bit flimsy and wobbly. Just because the attachment to binoculars is plastic. Once steady it does ok.
The binoculars DO have some pretty upscale things usually only found on High dollar binoculars. Like coatings, lens, etc. So that was cool.
I wear glasses and it was really a nice surprise to see adjustable eyepieces for with or without glasses.
I would have to say I'm pretty pleased and it looks like the warranty iron clad if I understand it.

Got these during Black Friday sale for a good price, but even at the current price they're a great value for the money. They're well-built, feel very solid and adjust well. I use them primarily for night skywatching, but also for looking at wildlife and landscapes. The images I see are quite bright and have great color. I looked at a half moon and Jupiter last night. Was able to see the Galilean moons around Jupiter (you need to be in a nice dark place and have a good way to steady them for that), saw really cool details of mountains and craters on the moon. I even saw some moons where the foot of the mountain was still in the dark but the peak was already in the sun, very interesting view that looked like the peaks were floating.

I used to have a 12" Dobsonian telescope, but for being able to get a quick view without hauling out a lot of gear, I like these even better. Highly recommend them for casual use.
This kit comes with almost everything that you need to go birdwatching. The included tripod and phone mount are rather useless paired with the binocs, but can be repurposed for other tasks.

4 stars until I use in the field. Out of the box, they felt overly heavy. The storage bag looks cheap with white stitching. The tripod is very flimsy but I don't expect to use that as much as I will the actual binoculars while on the go. The color and light retention is superb. I can read the back company name of a van that is parked one block away - not the license plate, but the words that are appx. 10 inches high. I feel for this price range - currently under Sixty dollars, that these are an amazing deal. If they become too heavy, that's when I know I need to go up in price tier to over 100. Will update once used in the field. Phone adapter is not why I purchased these.

Good viewing frame and a cool feature where you can hook it up to your smartphone and take a photo of what you see in the binoculars. I thought the price would be more expensive, but I was pleasantly surprised. It's much better to spend a little bit more and get all these features then buy a cheap pair with a small viewing frame!
Great for viewing objects, wildlife that is very far away; can identify wildlife from great distances. Photos taken with iphone without binoculars and then taken through lens of binocular.

This is great entertainment on a long hike or short stroll. The bag however isn‚Äôt quite big enough to fit the phone stand and other accessories in it. The phone stand is also a bit gimmicky and doesn‚Äôt work too well (not balanced very well). Bought it for the binoculars not the stand.

This is done exactly right. Have barely gotten up and running, but can see great advantage and opportunity for some pretty nifty shots to come. If you're a pro, it's a great scouting tool. And it's light weight enough to save your back AND help you get the shot or plan it right. As anyone who has ever dragged big glass to a remote location will tell you, knowing where to stand is everything. Great binoculars with a clever feature and excellent value. (Like these better than the Bushnell's - but don't tell them!)

I'll submit photos after more thorough testing.

reviews.content: I got these a week ago, easy to install on the headrest rail. I got them for when my husband rides with me, I can't put my purse in the passenger seat - don't like it kicking on the floor, so now I just hang it behind him! Works great. and I hang my bags of groceries etc behind me, don't tumble over and spill on the floor. I don't think they will be intrusive on "back seat sitters" - we'll see, they are easy enough to remove. Price was right! I'm happy!

I really like these hooks. I use them to hang so many different things on them. Right now we are hiking a lot so I hang our water bottle belts on them. I have a bag with a shirt that I want to return on one of them. There is no end to what you can do with them. I am glad I bought 2 sets so I can put one in my truck.

Makes it so easy to store my bag when I have passengers in my car! I usually keep my bag on the passenger seat; but when I have someone in my car (i have a 2 door coupe) it was always annoying to reach back and put it in the back seat & hope it didn't fall over or slide across the seat. Having this to hang it on has been great! I have one on each front seat in both vehicles now!

I love these hooks for so many reasons! I use them to hang my purse or bag, while driving so it doesn‚Äôt fly into the floorboard. I also use it when I pickup fast food so I don‚Äôt have to worry about it moving about when driving. The only downside to the hooks (according to my husband üôÑ), is that unless you turn them around, they poke your passenger in the neck. Easy fix. Would recommend this product!

I wish I had bought these earlier. I bought them anticipating I would only truly use one although I was going to put them all in the car. I wanted to hang my diaper bag on so it wasn't always getting in the way or rolling around the van.
Ended up using the whole 4 pack when I discovered that thw headphones for the DVD player fit perfectly! Love not having those thrown all over!!
I will definitely be buying more to hang more stuff on.

These hooks are well made and sturdy. They are perfect for holding my purse and my car coats! So much better than my coats being tossed on the floor and being walked on. They also hold my purse out of the way but still within reach and a trash bag! Best investment I‚Äôve made. I purchased two more sets, one for my husband‚Äôs car and one for my son‚Äôs car.

They do exactly what they state they do. When I have a passenger in the car I now have a place to hang my purse instead of throwing it in the backseat or keeping it on my lap. I utilize them every day and they blend in nicely with my black interior.

I have a steel water bottle that I love that holds 32 oz, but it won't fit in my car's cup holders, so I use the the purse holder to hold my bottle by its loop. I didn't know the hooks were plastic because they're really tough.

Excellent product. Best bang for the buck. Buy this without reservation.

This is the second set of these I have purchased. My friend saw them in my car and liked them, so I got a set for her.

reviews.content: I was not sure about this product because I had something similar before and it was very poor quality but got surprised by how sturdy this is and very useful in the kitchen.i use it even as a colander to rinse fruits and veggies.it is collapsing and easy to store

This is definitely a must-have for anyone who uses a microwave! It is well made, the height is adjustable, the diameter meets my requirements, and it is a heck of a lot better that using a napkin or paper towel to put over the dish you're heating. I'm sorry I didn't get one sooner.

This is a perfect size. Better handle than smaller sizes also.

I'd gotten the medium first, but it wouldn't cover a plate!

As one other customer stated, it is a little hard to pop up at first, but I have found that after popping it up and down a few times gets it easier. It is nice and tall, so if I have a small bowl, the food does not touch the top of the cover. Also, I can keep it in the microwave in the flat position and heat my morning cup of coffee on it without removing it. I would not advise actually cooking something on it for a longer length of time.

So far, so good. But popping the tops up and down is a pain. Popped up food easily caught in crevices if you don't open them all the way. I suspect they will die early due to all the manipulation required to move the tops up and down.
The product seems sturdy, well-made, and is of very high-quality. And, oh yes, it has kept my microwave clean. This is a great purchase.
It does save room, but not sure if that makes it worth it as it's a bit difficult to 'unfold' it for use. All in all it's a good product that works.

name: Gskyer Telescope, 70mm Aperture 400mm AZ Mount Astronomical Refracting Telescope for Kids Beginners - Travel Telescope with Carry Bag, Phone Adapter and Wireless Remote
description:
From the manufacturer
Gskyer Telescope AZ70400

Stepping into the art of stargazing for the very first time can be an overwhelming experience. Overly complicated telescopes, hidden features, and confusing accessories only make the process of getting started more difficult. A balance between affordable and performance are two of the most important aspects to consider before purchasing any telescope. The Gskyer Instruments Infinity 70mm telescope manages to do exactly that ‚Äì An affordable affordable for a high quality telescope.

What makes this particular model ideal for any beginner astronomer? Here‚Äôs a brief overview:

The visual resolution and optical capabilities are top tier for the low-end affordable.
Assembly is not overly complicated and beginner friendly.
The aperture diameter divided by the focal length calculates the magnifying power of a telescope. The Gskyer possess a 70 mm aperture and 400 mm focal length, which results in precise and high-resolution images.
The telescope is compact and portable.




What's in the box?

1x Carry Bag
1x Aluminum Alloy Tripod
1x Telescope Tube
1x Finder Scope
1x Zenith Mirror
2x Eyepieces(10mm,25mm)
1x Barlow Lens(3X)
1x Phone Attachment And Blutooth Remote
1x Accessory Tray
1x User Manual

ABOUT MAGNIFICATION

Gskyer telescope is a cost-effective one with bright image quality and high magnification power. 25 mm, and 10 mm eyepiece all offer varying levels of magnification.

Which is very suitable for kids, beginners and amateur astronomer to explore the sky, the moon, the planet. Meanwhile, you can enjoy landscapes during the day.

3X Barlow lens increase the magnification three times,which can make the magnification up to 120X
Additional accessories are compatible with the Infinity 70 mm and can further enhance the telescopes optical ability
Fully coated optical all-glass lens create high transmission coatings for enhanced image brightness and clarity.
3X Barlow Lens

A 3x Barlow lens, 25 mm, 10 mm eyepiece and finderscope all offer varying levels of magnification. The magnification from 16x to 120x and provides clear, up-close images of birds, wildlife, distant treetops, as well as the moon, planets, and some star arrangements. It comes with everything you need to get started with astronomy.

 

 

 

Travel Scope AZ70400

Traveled - The body, accessories, and tripod are lightweight and fit conveniently in the provided travel bag for easy portability. for backyard exploring, outdoor adventures, camping trips, and vacations, both kids and adults will enjoy of discovery and observation fun.

Installation - Assembly typically takes anywhere from 15-30 minutes. Regardless of previous astronomical equipment experience, the step-by-step guide makes putting the telescope together quick and easy.

Simplicity and Convenience - Lenses are easily swapped, and the focused uses a standard rack-and-pinion system, allowing fine-tuning to produce a vibrant image. Wide angle and latest generation of HD Gskyer eyepiece are more comfortable to see objects without eye fatigue and dizziness.

Choosing - The affordability of the Gskyer AZ70400 telescope makes it an ideal choice for beginners seeking a telescope that meets a balance between quality and affordable.

reviews.content:
This is a review of the Gskyer 80 mm refractor telescope. I am not an employee of Gskyer, I am an astronomy hobbyist. I have 3
other telescopes and a spotting scope. My review is based on this background and is a fair and honest assessment of the package both for daytime use as a spotting scope and as a night time astronomical telescope.

This is an entry level 80 mm short focal length refractor telescope/spotting scope package. It includes the optical tube assembly (the telescope), a mount/tripod, three eyepieces and a 3X barlow. Based upon my tests, it works well during the day as a spotting scope and at night as an astronomical telescope. The simple operation and stable mount make it an good first scope. The included eyepieces and barlow give it a good range of magnifications. Its compact size would make it a good ‚Äúgrab and go‚Äù or travel scope for someone who has larger telescopes.

The Mount ‚Äì This is a shining feature of this package. The tripod/mount of the Gskyer 80 mm is solid, stable, easy to direct and does a good job. Many entry level telescopes have flimsy and wobbly mounts/tripods making the telescope difficult to aim and resulting in a shaky image that is difficult to focus. The mount of the Gskyer 80 is an outstanding feature of this package. Note that it uses a dovetail attachment for the optical tube which means that the mount could be used with other optical tubes or other dovetail mounted accessories in the future. It also includes a standard 1/4 20 stud on top of the mounting rings which can be used to mount a camera or other accessories. The finder scope uses a standard dovetail mount so other finder scopes could be used. This is a level of flexibility you don‚Äôt typically see in a package at this price.

The Optical Tube Assembly ‚Äì This is what you might normally think of as the telescope. The OTA works well and presents a good image. In side by side comparisons it compared well with my Meade 80 mm scope. The focuser is easy to use and includes a 45 degree correct image diagonal that presents the correct image that you would want when using this as a spotting scope during the day. This also works well at night when you are comparing the sky to a chart as things are in their correct positions in the eyepiece. The scope uses the 1.25‚Äù standard that is most commonly used for telescope eyepieces, diagonals and filters so you can easily add accessories in the future.

The included finder scope works well. The bracket is sturdy and provides ample adjustment so that you can align it with the optical tube assembly. Note that you will need to focus the finder when you first take it out of the package. This is done by turning the front black part. This is easy to do and will only need to be done once, but it is not mentioned on the assembly sheet.

You will have to align the finder with the optical tube. This is a normal procedure required on any telescope and is best done during the day. Find a target as far away as possible, but at least 500 feet away. I like to use the cross arm of a telephone or power pole. Using the 25 mm eyepiece, center the cross arm in the eyepiece of the telescope, not the finder. Now use the two black screws on the finder to move the cross hairs till the target is centered in the cross hairs. You are now aligned. This is very important for use during the day and at night. You may have to make a minor adjustment from time to time but that is normal.

Eyepieces ‚Äì The included eyepieces present good images and are well matched to the scope. A nice touch is that they are threaded to accept standard astronomy filters which will help improve your view of the Moon, planets, nebula and other targets. The eyepieces, when combined with the included 3X barlow, provide 16X, 40X, 48X, 80X, 120X and 240X. For daytime spotting scope purposes, the 16X and 40X are good choices. If the air is very quiet the 80X works well too, but it is the atmosphere that will limit the magnification, not the scope. For night time use, typically an 80 mm scope will max out around 140X to 160X, but don‚Äôt hesitate to give 240X a try on the moon. Just remember that atmospheric transparency and turbulence will be the limiting factor rather than the scope. And, because the Gskyer 80 mm uses the popular 1.25‚Äù eyepiece size, you can add single focal length or zoom eyepieces, diagonals or filters of any brand.

What can you see with this package?

During the day I tested the scope by focusing on the leaves of a maple tree at about 150 feet, about half a football field. I was able to see the veins in the leaves without difficulty. I have not taken it to a shooting range but I would expect it would do well for target practice. At 800 feet I was easily able to resolve leaves on the top of a tree as well as a bird perched on a branch. Many spotting scopes use zoom eyepieces so I tested it with the included eyepieces as well as my 8-24 mm zoom eyepiece with good results.

As an astronomy telescope it did well compared to my other 80 mm scope. The mount is easy to direct and the focuser made focusing easy. It worked well on Mars, Saturn and the rings,the Moon and star clusters. I expect it to work well on Mercury, Venus, Jupiter and its moons, stars, star clusters and double stars. I have enjoyed the Orion Nebula, the Pleiades and other deep sky objects with an 80mm telescope.

To a large extent what you can see with any telescope will depend on your ground and sky light pollution levels. I live in a very light polluted suburb of NYC. Even under these challenging conditions, in addition to the Moon and the bright planets, there are hundreds of star clusters, asterisms and double stars within the capability of this telescope. At a darker site, the range of what you can see greatly expands. That would include galaxies and nebula that would be challenging from a light polluted location for any telescope. Don‚Äôt expect things to look like the pictures in magazines. Those are produced with long exposure astrophotography, often have false color added, and do not represent what you will see through the eyepiece of a telescope many times larger than this one.

In summary, if you are looking for a compact, easy to carry, easy to use scope that can serve as a spotting scope during the day and an astronomical scope at night, the Gskyer 80 mm refractor should serve you well. And since it uses the standard 1.25‚Äù eyepiece and diagonal size it will let you add eyepieces, filters, diagonals and other accessories in the future. You can also take photos or videos through the eyepiece. You can hold the phone up to the eyepiece but there are attachments made for ‚Äúdigiscoping‚Äù with 1.25‚Äù eyepieces that make this a lot easier. Or add an eyepiece webcam to project the image on a screen or enter into the world of planetary imaging.

If you are looking for a scope for a tween or teen that they can use on their own, this would work. A smaller child would need help setting this up but a 10 year old can likely handle it on their own.

You should have a lot of fun with this scope.

I bought this knowing nothing about telescopes and not knowing what I could expect to see through this thing.

Now I know more, I think this is a decent value, but it comes with A LOT of cons.

In telescopes, the aperture size matters much more than magnification. The bigger the aperture, the better the image will be. This is a 70mm aperture (2.75 inches), which is about as small as you can get. It's typical for an "entry-level" telescope, and a decent value for the money if you want to get into stargazing without dropping 500 bucks or more on a bigger scope.

However, if I could do it over again, I would've spent more and gone with a better one.

First, as with all beginner telescopes, it is actually much harder to use than a more intermediate level one. This is something well-known in the amateur astronomy group I've joined, and they never, EVER recommend buying a beginner telescope, ESPECIALLY for kids.

Because most kids like looking AT stuff more than looking FOR it. And with this telescope, far more time is spent hunting for objects than actually looking at them.

My kid doesn't have the patience or attention span for that, but I rather enjoy the challenge, so I do it. Which brings me to the next problem.

This is made for kids. As such, the stand is very short. Which means that all the time you spend hunting for things, you'll having to be hunched over, crouched down, or kneeling on the ground.

And if you live in a place with a lot of light pollution, you won't be able to see much more than stars, the Moon, or the brightest planets. Even Mars is difficult to see through this telescope, and you can't make out any detail whatsoever on the surface.

You can make out SOME faint detail on Jupiter, especially if you go away from light pollution on a clear, moonless night. And you can just make out Saturn's rings.

Venus, on the other hand, is very easy to see. Especially now, near the end of April 2020, it is the brightest it'll be all year, so we've been looking at it every night. It's too bright, even at its dimmest, to make out any detail, but you can see what phase it's in.

Galaxies, most nebulas, and many star clusters are beyond the ability of this telescope, but that being said, I was able to see a planetary nebula called The Ghost of Jupiter last night.

For perspective, I've had a few weeks of use and practice, and feel comfortable with the telescope, and have a number of apps, charts, and star maps to help me find things, and it STILL took over an hour for me to finally find it, put it close enough to the center of my field of view to use with max magnification, and put it in focus.

And even then, it looked like a hazy, bluish star. We couldn't make out any detail or the distinctive eye-shape that can be seen with even slightly larger scopes.

Still, it was cool and the kid loved it. I consider it worth the effort, but my back is killing me today.

Don't get me wrong, for an entry-level telescope, this is good. It'll serve our needs while we save up for an upgrade. But, like all entry-level telescopes, this is harder to use and not powerful enough to see much.

All the time required to hunt for things, for what many may consider a disappointing result, could potentially end up killing a kid's enthusiasm.

If you absolutely MUST get an entry-level telescope, this is a good choice. But if at all possible, save up and get a larger aperture.

I bought this as a gift for my grandkids and the intent was to allow them to witness the "Christmas Star", the conjunction of Jupiter and Saturn on December 21. The plan was to capture the event nightly from December 19 through December 22.

Receiving and unboxing the telescope was pretty straightforward. The instructions were somewhat trying, but given that there were only a few "moving parts" it was easy enough to figure out. The only problem we encountered was that the adapter for allowing the telescope to connect to a smartphone was missing half of the adapter and we could not connect a phone to the telescope. No idea why the part was missing. We unboxed the telescope on our dining room table and when we discovered the part was missing we had no less than 5 adults searching for it, to no avail. We didn't lose the part, we just never had it. That was disappointing when you consider that being able to attach a phone was one of the primary reasons for selecting Gysker and we lost our opportunity for the grandkids to record their witness of the grand event.

Setting that bit aside, the telescope worked wonderfully. It was easy to set up, with all of the [available] parts fitting nicely into the supplied carrying case. We transported the telescope to our observation area and the telescope set up easily. The 'spotter' scope allowed us to get on target quickly and the aperture and zoom features allowed for a spectacular view, including many of the moons surrounding the planets. We even used the spotting scope and a smartphone app to align the telescope with other stars for equally breathtaking views and we spent about 2.5 hours searching out various objects in the night sky each time we went out. (From dark until bedtime).

The grandkids (10, 9 and 7) really took to the telescope, learning how to use the various parts and functions rather quickly, even to the point that they could select and observe a star on their own. The tripod was solid and held a stable image and everything, sans phone adapter, worked very well.

If I was rating just the telescope on cost to function-ability, I would rate the Gysker telescope 10 stars. It is a very good telescope for the money and since we wanted the kids to get excited about the night sky, this was a great purchase. The ONLY disappointment was because I specifically chose this telescope because we could attach a smartphone to record an event that only happens every 800 years and then was unable to do exactly that, well, it was a real letdown.

Even at that, I would tell anyone wanting to start amateur exploration of the sky that this is still a great telescope for the money.

My 19 year old daughter gets this out every night and points it out of the window, or takes it to the yard. Literally every night, and if it‚Äôs cloudy she is inside complaining about it. When we travel- this travels with us. This has sparked an interest in so much, from learning more about what she‚Äôs looking at, to photography. It gives a quality view and is sturdy and easy to use and SUPER portable. We LOVE it. Buy it.
Meant for kids, there is a guy on YouTube that had a very helpful video to assemble and use. My kids enjoyed it got them off their devices and outside so I‚Äôd say it was a win

It's super easy to assemble, but I can't for the life of my see anything at night. I can see trees and structures during the day, so the issues at night may be on my part. Maybe I am using it incorrectly? I'm not sure, but I should at least see a star or something...

The first order came late. The date changed three times, making my son's Christmas gift late. The initial order came with an air bubble in the outer lens and some hair-like thing on the inside of the telescope, making them visible on everything I looked at. The replacement came rather quickly without any obstructions to the view. I just wish I knew how to use the darn thing...üòÖ

Amazing product. Got it for my mom as a birthday gift. You can see the moon very well & if you live near a towns/city‚Äôs view it‚Äôs pretty cool at all the stuff you can see all around the town/city. Only problem I have is that it didn‚Äôt come with instructions on how to build it/put it all together. So my dad had to kind of wing it & I‚Äôm pretty sure some parts aren‚Äôt assembled correctly.

Easy to set up and works pretty well. We probably don't know what we're doing so hard to find what we're looking for. Also, doesn't lock in place so if we get set on something we have to be careful not to move or we lose it
Good and well made, high quality and fun

I love the easy setup and use of this telescope. I bought it for a friend for Christmas, they were ecstatic! It was nicely packaged and easy to set up. They have since been able to capture amazing views!!!

reviews.content: Over many, MANY, years this is my 3rd purchase, and I have gifted a couple too. I stand by this easy to use daily shake blender as less to deal with then the inverted styles! However on this one the lid is SO HARD to get on and off compared to older purchases, which also had an inset on the base for the cord to keep neat and not just lay on the counter between uses. Still my favorite model and brand though!

I purchased this little dandy to blend my morning nutrition shakes, and it performs very well. I even does a decent job with small ice cubes. However, the push-on lid is poorly-designed. It's a tight fit...Almost TOO tight! It presses on very tightly, but trying to remove it is a tricky process. I wanted to remove it once while there was still liquid in it, and after significant struggling, it suddenly popped off & I had shake all over the kitchen! A screw-on would be much better. Other than the lid, I'm very satisfied with it.

I purchased the blender a couple of years ago but have only recently used it on a regular basis. It‚Äôs used exclusively for smoothies that contain liquid, protein powder, and frozen fruit. As one might expect, I do cut larger pieces of frozen fruit up a bit.

So, in the capacity that I use it, I would say it is a good, simple personal blender with adequate power. I like that I‚Äôm able to drink the smoothie directly from the blender container.

I don‚Äôt know how long it will last now that I‚Äôm using it pretty much daily but at the price it is, I wouldn‚Äôt expect it to go on for years and years. If you do the math, if the blender lasted only one year, at the purchase price of approximately $20, and using it once a day, it‚Äôs pennies each day.

I‚Äôm fine with that‚Ä¶it‚Äôs worth it.

Had this for 3 months. Only dislike is the lid, it doesn't seat without a fight so I hold it on while in use. I use it almost daily. I bought a similar model, the only difference is this one I can wrap the cord. Would buy again, worth the bother with the lid issue considering the price point. Chops up and blends the food and ice well.

BUT I am pleasantly surprised! This little blender is great! I was unsure about now well it would blend. So far it has blended frozen fruits and made a great smoothie. Also it has blended carrots, celery and spinach. It's perfect for a small blender and easy to use, less mess and clean up. You cannot go wrong for the price. Only draw back is it is a little loud.

The one drawback I have is that the lid doesn't have a thumb tab to help leverage the lid off. If you have hand dexterity issues this may be difficult for you. We use this for our 8 yr old who has a nutrient deficit and we mix his shakes 2x a day. It works for that really well. As for chopping and blending food I don't have experience with that but don't expect it to work as good as our Vitamix will.

I love how compact it is and you're able to make a decent sized smoothie. Fits perfectly on any counter space and easy to store if need be. Best of all, it has no issues blending frozen things, like fruit and ice. Also very easy to clean!

I use this every morning for my breakfast smoothie üòã

I mix an Ensure 30 gr protein drink with 1/2 banana and 1/4 cup thawed blueberries or whatever fruit I have on hand and a scoop of Orgain supplement. Easy, fast‚Äîready to drink. Can add an ice cube st the end. But it will not crush ice cubes which is why 4 stars and not 5. Also would like USB rechargeable instead of electric. Cleans easily with water and a drop of dish soap‚Äî‚Äîgive it a whirl. Also top shelf dishwasher.

The initial product on Amazon in the white color has two blender bottles, whereas the other colors do not not come with two blender bottles. I ordered the black thinking I was getting two blender bottles and didn't. I thought the price I paid for the blender wasn't worth it. It blends ok, but not for the price I paid.
Love it but it does have a cord which I thought I didn't but I blend and take my cup fit in cup holder

name: Coquimbo Sewing Kit Gifts for Women, Mom, Traveler, Adults, Beginner, Emergency, Sewing Supplies Accessories with Scissors, Thimble, Thread, Sewing Needles, Tape Measure etc (Black, S)
description: Product Description

reviews.content:
Arrived today, so I cant yet say how strong the thread is (I will add to this review if any problems arise), but it is a decent little kit - for the price - for taking on vaca for small jobs. Referring to some points made by other reviewers:
yes, the thread coils are quite small. But they appear to have more than enough thread to do a few simple jobs each. And there are two each of black and white, and three of light beige, which somewhat compensates for the lack of length. You will eventually need to buy more thread. By small jobs I mean re-attaching buttons, hopefully sewing a hatband onto a felt fedora (why I got it), but I wouldn't expect it to sew up a large rip in pants. As to difficulty in opening the case with the needles, there is a tiny piece of hard-to-see transparent tape securing it in place. This must be removed. After that, the black back piece is pretty easy to remove from the transparent part that actually holds the needles. When you remove that back piece, make sure it is/was on the top side, and hold the case perfectly flat, so no needles will not fall out even if the "hole" happens to be aligned with a needle "slot". Assuming needles dont start falling out, look at the side edge of the transparent part (it is opaque in places, but not the black backing.) You will see a gap at one point. To remove needles you need to rotate the transparent piece until the gap is over the "exit" slot for the needles you want to use. It is fairly difficult to rotate, use two opposing thumbs to turn it. Keep the whole thing level horizontally while you are turning the plastic, because whenever the "gap" goes over an "exit slot", if it's not perfectly level a bunch of needles will fall out.
As a beginner, the hardest part is getting the thread into the needle. This kit comes with two threaders, which help a little but its still difficult for an old fogey like me with shaky hands and non perfect eyesight to do. The biggest help for me is this very useful device I got somewhere a long time ago, maybe at a surplus store, a jewelers loupe (?) which is a thing with a strap that goes around your head, a little light, and a strong magnifying glass that goes down over you eyes. That brings intense magnification to bear while leaving your hands free. But you probably wont take that on vacation, so, get a pair of strong reading/magnifying gasses (get them at a dollar store, they are way too expensive elsewhere). Also, the thimble is a ring with no top, which may actually be more useful than a regular one since I push the needles with my finger tip, not the top of my finger. We'll see.
Thats a pretty long review for a $7 item, and I will add to it after I actually try it.
OK,adding now after first use, sewing a hatband onto a felt hat. First, the thread is weak. It broke on me once when pulling through the felt. Thread is fuzzy, obviously not a strong polyester. Also, I was wrong about their 'ring' thimble being OK. A real thimble works much better. You get what you pay for.

Some of the pieces were damaged upon arrival. Most notable were the thread spools, half of them were crushed. They still hold the thread though so I can't complain. It came with a lot of needles and pins which is nice. For the price, it's a nice sewing kit to have around for minor repairs.
I love this sewing kit, that I am able to fit it in my purse to have with me for quick fixes on the go! It‚Äôs super cute & handy

Small and compact, yet quite a bit packed in there! I only use it for minor repairs and small crafts here and there so I didn't need anything fancy. This does what I need it to do and was much more cost effective than other options. I also love that it's small enough that I can keep it in the car without it taking up much space at all!

arrived quickly, nicely packaged, in a secure kit. Everything I need and inexpensive.
Very pleased
Nothing fancy or high quality, but offers everything you meed to patch a tear in your jeans. For the price point - 5 stars

My dog accidentally tugged a little too hard on his favorite moose toy and ripped its head off.

This sewing kit arrived just in time for me to sew it back together for them to be friends again.

Charlie boy couldn't be happier!

Sewing kit = dog mom approved!
Super cute and comes with everything you need. For the price it's worth it. I throw it in my purse and take it with me.
This isn‚Äôt a bad product, but it is cheaply made. The price does reflect that however, so it‚Äôs not much to complain about. It‚Äôs small and good for traveling. It will get the job done.
Quality is appropriate for cost

name: 5 STARS UNITED Ring Sizer Adjuster for Loose Rings - 12 Pack, 2 Sizes for Different Band Widths ‚Äì Silicone Ring Size Adjuster - Invisible Ring Guards for Women and Men
description: Product Description

reviews.content: My wedding ring kept slipping off due to weight lose and I almost lost it twice. This has worked to keep it tight enough not to slip off..

Bought this to size up my ring.
My ring has 3 bands. Had to wrap around all 3 bands together or the set wouldn't fit. The ends of the adjuster keep coming undone, but it does its job, my ring isn't falling off anymore.

I‚Äôve lost 140 pounds with a lot more to go and I have a diamond ring that has sentimental value that was so loose I was afraid I would lose it (in fact, I did lose it for a while!). I found these and thought I‚Äôd give them a try, They were fairly difficult to get started going on the ring, but once they got started, they went fine. I‚Äôve worn them for a few weeks now and they are comfortable and work well. The only caveat is that if they get too wet, they turn milky until they dry out. No big deal at all. At least that was my experience when I left my ring in jewelry cleaner over night.

I purchased these because I have several rings that are family heirlooms, that for one reason or another cannot be sized at the jeweler. This has worked wonderfully on several rings that are just a wee bit too large to feel secure on my finger. Since I only needed 2 turns of the smallest diameter coil, it was pretty fiddly and fussy to get it wrapped around the band, cut, and wiggled into place. However, once done the ring felt secure and I no longer felt I was in danger of losing it. A great value, since you get several coils of different sizes, and may only need a little bit to make a ring feel secure.

I bought these adjusters because we haven‚Äôt had my wedding band welded to my engagement ring yet. The larger size worked beautifully to keep both rings together (my rings were too large, too, so really the perfect product for my situation) but I ended up switching to the smaller size as my finger would swell at night under the heat of our blankets.

The smaller size was a a little bit trickier to get around both rings but I was able to get it around both of them within less than two minutes. Truly impressed by this product! Such a simple solution for rings that are too large and holding two rings together. The band no longer slides around and it really looks like the rings are welded together.
They should have came up with this idea 50 years ago!!! I will NEVER use another kind/ brand/ stlye of ring gard!!

I really like how these fit and you can literally fit soooooooooooo many rings from this set. Like seriously. So many. They're easy to put on and even work on sautered rings. Easy to adjust and remove too which will be nice because I fluctuate between almost two entire ring sizes throughout the year. I only gave it 4 stars because I have to remove my rings when I shower now because shampoo and conditioner get caught up in between the adjuster and my ring and it's a pain in the rear to clean out. I usually never remove my jewelry because it's real and clean them often anyways, and partially because if I never remove them, I'll never lose em. But cleaning out the shampoo once it gets in there seriously sucks but that is literally my ONLY complaint and it's so nitpicky. Even still, I would definitely recommend these

I loved these adjusters! I used them until I got my engagement ring resized, and the material was comfortable and easy to cut. I did not mind waiting to get my ring resized because the adjuster provided a protective barrier between my ring and hard surfaces. One complaint is that it got gross pretty quickly, so I did have to change it, but was easy to do so since so many sticks of the adjuster are provided. My second complaint is that stuff can get stuck in the adjuster, and depending on what was stuck, I think find materials were scratching my ring a bit (which is gold, so it easily scratches). My advice is to change the adjuster on a regular basis!

I bought this for my wife's ring. For years she has been putting thread on the ring to help it fit her finger. She doesn't trust someone to resize it and the price is crazy for that service. I brought packet with several different sizes. I put it on for here and there is a slight learning curve, but it turned out it wasn't hard. The biggest thing is my wife loves it. Her ring fits snug and doesn't spin and it is comfortable. She has been wearing the ring for a couple of weeks and it is holding up very well.

This is a cheap and easy way to help tighten up your ring! I bought it and use it on my engagement ring and it helps it from falling off. The only downside is that is seems to move a lot and whenever you put lotion on you have to make sure to take the ring off or the lotion gets stuck in the adjuster. Other than that it works!

description:
Product Description
IMPORTANT TROUBLE SHOOTING Ôºö

1. Please Note: it is not recommended to use it on unstable Paint WallsÔºårough walls, powdery walls, wet surfaces or uneven surfaces.our tape is very sticky,avoid causing the wall surfaces to fall off when removing tape.

2. Before use -- Ensure that the contact surface is kept clean and dry.

After use -- Press down hard and hold for 20 seconds after sticking, to make the adhesive tape fully contact with the surface,this will help maintain long-lasting stickiness .

3.How to remove -- Using hot air from a hair dryer will soften the tape and make it easier to remove.Then you can use a sharp tool to slowly lift the tape from one side and then slowly peel the tape off the surface of the object.

4. To avoid possible damage, do not use the tape to hold heavy objects or valuables.

5. Keep this product out of the reach of children.

6. Store in a normal cool environmentÔºåavoid direct sunlight. If the tape is directly exposed to sunlight for a prolonged period, the colour of the tape‚Äôs surface may turn yellow.

However, yellowing of the tape will not affect the normal use of the product,the adhesive properties of the tape will perform properly in use.

reviews.content: Whatever amount of this tape you're about to use, it's too much -- unless it's something you never want to come off for the rest of eternity. If you've got a mummy's tomb to seal, this is the tape you want for the job. If there's an earthquake and California is about to fall into the Pacific Ocean, the government had better use this stuff to keep it in place. Had Abraham Lincoln had this tape in 1860, the South would not have been able to secede. This stuff is so strong, it transcends the physical realm. It will keep your relationship together. If your boyfriend is about to leave you, just take this out of the drawer and show it to him. You don't even need to apply it. Its power is so strong he will be unable to leave you. This tape creates a bond that cannot be broken. Use with caution.

I often put up many decorations for the holidays on the walls. I purchased this super tape because duck tape doesn‚Äôt always keep the cardboard signs stuck up for a while. This stuff is super strong. I cut long straps to secure the article on the wall, but all I really needed was a tiny little tab For each corner, not the big long strips I used. It was super hard to remove my little items for Valentine‚Äôs Day that I put up every year. As gently as I tried, I wound up ripping big holes in my wall! I now will have to pay a handyman for repairs and to paint the living room. But a paint job was well overdue as I have lived here 10 years and never been repainted. Overall, it is a fantastic, durable, reusable product. Just remember, less is more!

So this tape is really strong and does remain sticky after washing it. HOWEVER finger prints is enough for it to loose its adhesive so try not to touch it all over.

Also yes this tape can damage your wall. What I learned from wall adhesive from Walmart. Leave a little of the plastic on the tape and pull it left or right so it stretches. DO NOT PULL IT TOWARDS YOU, you will pull up paint.
Last less is more if you can get the corners with smaller sizes for framing it'll work. No need for extremely long pieces.

I have about eight 0.5in by 1in of tape throughout my picture.. minus the middle because its a bit heavy and that size didn't work. I used 1inx4in

I used this stuff allllll around my old apartment for all the artwork we had. I used it because it claimed to be renter friendly and not tear paint. While it does hold up paintings, even bigger canvases, very well, it does pull off the paint when you remove it. There was a few spots where the paint survived, but majority of them did need paint patching. Thankfully patching the walls is not a huge/very difficult task, but I have switched to using sticky puddy for those paintings in our new apartment.

I had some folds in a carpet runner - a sharp kink from how it was shipped. I put 3 strips of tape under that area and pulled tight when laying the runner back down. The kink isn't completely gone, maybe sticks up about 1/16" but it no longer is a tripping hazard. The tape has great adhesion between the carpet and the floor, this is a runner that my dog uses constantly and it hasn't moved at all.

Es f√°cil de usar.
Fuerte adhesi√≥n.
Necesitaba pegar el conejito en mi balc√≥n porque debido al viento corr√≠a el riesgo de que se cayera y se rompiera. Y con este producto(double sided tape) pude resolver 100 porciento.
Ha habido lluvia, viento y calor pero el conejito sigue pegado a la columna de madera. Lo recomiendo.

I was trying this product out for a specific purpose and it didn‚Äôt work for that. I was trying to use it to close the gap between my blackout curtains and the wall and it lost its sticking power very quickly.

Really I need to get the curved curtain rods that are made to solve this issue.

Otherwise it seems like it‚Äôs pretty good and will be a welcome addition to my crafting stash.

This tape is super easy to use. Works better than other products on the market. There are so many different ways to use it. I up them on throw rugs, to hang pictures on the wall and one small decorations on my daughters dresser that the cat likes to knock off. Now they stay right were we want them.

If you need some strong double sided tape, get. This. It's literally perfect. I didn't have super high expectations (or needs) but it has excelled in its duties. Read on if you'd like my personal reason for liking this tape or stop here and just understand I think this tape is great.

I purchased this to fix a child lock on a lever style door. I have a 32 pound dog that likes to jump up and open the doors with his paws like a little human. Fun, right? Except when you're changing, going to the bathroom or just need some privacy. The adhesive on the lock itself eventually wore off, maybe with his weight constantly pulling the lock down for so long. I bought this tape, applied, didn't like where it was, peeled it off, reapplied the same piece (crossing fingers it would stay sticky) and it has held up for almost 3 months now with him tugging on the lever. It doesn't fall down, it didn't leave any marks or damage when I peeled it off the door. I've since used it on walls to hang small decor and a thin mirror. It's just a new staple for me and the cost in incredible for how much you get. Forget a command strip the rest of my life. I'm keeping this tape

I'm not even slightly exaggerating when I say blown away. From reading the reviews I expected a good product that is hard to handle and hard remove. Well, I personally think that it's easy to manage and easy enough to remove. It doesn't just peel off when you remove it, but it does so cleanly and gives the resistance you would want from something you expect to work correctly.
When I first touched the sticky part I didn't think it would handle the first task I bought it for. It just didn't feel very sticky and I had a difficult job for it. I have an HDMI switch I wanted to adhere to the back of my TV. 5 cables curve away from it right after their connection therefore putting a lot of strain on it not allowing it to lay flat. It held and held superbly! I ended up replacing the switch today and wow, it holds great! I plan on buying lots more of this in the future. Highly recommend.

The way I used it was to stick it to the back of what I was using it on as I unrolled it and then with a good pair of scissors cut it and pressed it in. Then just remove the strip and put it on the surfaces. I pressed and held the first time since I wasn't yet sold on it, but today I pressed it and walked away confident that it was there until I chose to remove it. Great stuff!

name: AGLUCKY Countertop Ice Maker Machine, Portable Ice Makers Countertop, Make 26 lbs ice in 24 hrs,Ice Cube Rready in 6-8 Mins with Ice Scoop and Basket (Black)
description:
Product Description

1„ÄÅAGLUCKY: Feel free to to let us know if you have any questions about the machine and we will reply within 24 hrs, we always stand behind our product.

2„ÄÅWhen you receive our ice maker, please keep the ice maker upright for 24 hrs before first using.

3„ÄÅPlease Note: The ice cubes will melt if they stay in the machine for a long time, it‚Äôs suggested to hold the ice in an ice bag when the machine is done making ice and store it in the refrigerator.

reviews.content:
I purchased this AGLUCKY countertop ice maker almost 4 months ago. I live in a small lakeside cottage and the kitchen doesn't allow for a refrigerator large enough to contain an ice maker. Keeping up with ice cube trays, especially when entertaining, was a challenge I was just done with. I also don't have a lot of counter space but since this unit has a fairly small footprint, I was willing to at least test sacrificing counter space in exchange for giving up ice cube trays.
When I bought this, it was on sale. Even so, I hesitated to purchase it because several 1-star reviews stated it stopped working after 30 days and customer service was non-existent. Seeing several of the same 1-star complaints is always a red flag to me. But - Because of the price and because of my total annoyance with ice cube trays I took the plunge. I am happy to say that almost 4 months in and we are still going strong. I use this regularly 1 -2 times a week. I fill it and make a full "batch" of ice cubes and when done, I leave the lid open to dry out and unplug the unit until I need it again.
The ice cubes are very wet so if used directly out of the machine they are not long-lasting cubes and if placed directly into an ice bin in the freezer they become a big clump. To avoid this, I keep a gallon zip lock bag in my freezer and each time the basket is full of ice, I empty it into the bag and lay it flat in the freezer. When the next batch is ready I shake the bag to break up the cubes, dump them into the ice bin and repeat the process. One complete fill of water in the ice maker makes enough ice to fill the ice bin in my freezer. When I have the amount of ice I need, I open the lid and unplug the unit until next time. While the whole zip lock bag process may sound involved to some, to me it still beats dealing with ice cube trays. I unplug the unit only because that is the manufacturer recommendation for my Vitamix and it just makes sense to me to not run electronics when not in use for long periods of time.
The "cubes" are only about 1/3 the size of a regular ice cube. The size is nice for filling water bottles and for cocktails. And yes, it really does make ice cubes within the promised 9 minutes. Of course, it isn't a great number of cubes but is ice in 9 minutes as advertised.
I am very very happy with my purchase and have recommended it to several of my friends. I would definitely buy again.

THis is the first counter top ice maker I've bought, so I'm not comparing it to anything else, but as far as I'm concerned this is a great little device. I've been without an ice maker since I moved into my current home where the new fridge is without an ice maker. Yes, I realize I could just use ice trays, but I have a teenage child and guess where the trays are every time I want ice??? Yes, you guessed right, the trays are empty, on the counter, or in the freezer with no ice in them. So after getting tired of that situation I got an ice maker.

This device makes ice in about 9 minutes. I fill the water reservoir every few days and it keeps us supplied with a nice flow of ice. I use filtered water. So far I've had no trouble with it. It's not very noisy, and you can turn it off when not using as long as you don't mind waiting 10 minutes when you want the ice.

Highly recommended.

I looked at many ice makers. Big, expensive, and some quite excessive.
I really don't need much when it comes to ice in drinks -as my drink of choice is
good coffee.
But once in a while, such as with pizza, a cold cola just can't be beat.
So far this little machine has made oodles of little thimble shaped "cubes."
And I think this is neat, '..it has a feature that if ya don't use them for some time they are recycled into more little cute cubes.
The machine is a little noisy but I got used to it easily.
Now I really don't know how the larger and more expensive ones work as I have never had one before this one. But this one makes ice, and the ice then cools my soft drink. I ask you, what more do I need?

I bought this because my ice maker went out in my freezer. It‚Äôs a nice ice maker. I am hard of hearing, so when I have my hearing aids in it is loud. But, when I take them out it‚Äôs not as loud. It vibrates, so be sure to put a grippy pad underneath. It‚Äôs fallen off the counter 3 times now without a grippy pad underneath. What a mess with all the water coming out. Luckily it did not break. It still works. But, I can not stress enough to put some kind of support that has a grippy. I read a lot of reviews and didn‚Äôt see anything about that. Overall, it is a nice ice maker. The cubes look like bullets. It takes from starting at 8 am till about 1 am to fill up my ice box. I hope this review helps.

I received this ice maker for Christmas and I absolutely love it! I use ice all through the day and my fridge ice maker broke and was far too expensive to repair so I used trays. No more. This little appliance has in action since I received it and it is so easy to place in a convenient location and ice is always ready. I haven't noticed a difference in taste but I also refill it daily with water because I use a lot of ice. I have been using it for over 2 months with no issues at all. The only sound is when the cubes drop into the basket but that also happened with the fridge ice maker. I am very pleased with this wonderful gift.

This is a great ice maker. We use a lot of ice so thought I would get one. It isn't very loud when running. Of course you can hear the ice drop into the dish so that's ok. I read a lot of reviews before buying. People saying ice is sorta wet when it comes out. The ice is a little wet. What I do is take basket out, shake over sink, then dump into ice container in freezer. After about 5 min I open freezer and break ice apart ( very simple) with some kind of sturdy plastic utensil. I do this till my ice container is full. Then you are good to go. The ice is very easy to break apart and stays apart. So for that tiny inconvenience I get fresh Ice whenever I want it. And I use bottled water because we our area has sulfur water so can't use it for ice.

I LOVE THIS THING!!!! My freezer doesn‚Äôt have an ice maker, and is too small to keep bags of ice with other food. So, I caved and purchased the tabletop ice maker. I LOVE it! It makes just the right amount of ice for me to fill my Stanley before work, and I have ice for when I get back. I like that even when the ice in the tray melts, the machine just recycles the water and makes more ice. It‚Äôs not super noisy either, I catch it every once in a while, but only if I really listen for it; otherwise it‚Äôs just typical background noise and not noticeable. Definitely recommend for people with limited freezer space who go through ice quickly like I do!

My husband hunts and killed so many deer this hunting season that we didn‚Äôt have room in our freezer for the ice maker anymore. So I had to buy the ice maker to have ice.

Pros
1. Easy set up
2. Makes ice cubes fast
3. 2 different sizes of ice cubes
4. Sound level isn‚Äôt that bad. Only when it‚Äôs putting the fresh ice into the basket do you hear anything.
5. Low energy. I make ice in the day and put the ice in an ice bucket in the fridge then I turn off the ice maker.

Cons
1. Ice cubes are small and hallow from inside which means they melt fast and will water down your drink
2. Have to keep an eye on the ice tray because it ‚Äúfills up‚Äù fast and you need to empty the ice cubes before the machine makes more ice.

Conclusion: great product. Easy to use. Does the job. Good price

This sweet little ice maker is marvelous. We have a small kitchen with limited counter space, but she fits right in and wow - does she make the ice. (We have an icemaker in our freezer, but she she frequently jams and is the source for much consternation when one NEEDS ice) So I thought I'd give this a try and I'm glad I did.
After reading directions and cleaning, I poured in the water and waited. Before long she was filling up her ice basket, which I then dumped into gallon size freezer bags. I've made so much ice now (I have 6 gallon bags in the freezer) I turned her off, wiped her dry, and unplugged her.

This product works nicely. I could hear it in the kitchen when it would fill the ice tray but other than that, this makes ice pretty quick. I‚Äôm not a fan because it just continues to melt, and it‚Äôs not frozen enough to put in the freezer without all the ice freezing into a big ball.

I got it because I didn‚Äôt have an ice maker in my freezer but I like the ice trays that make the balls instead.

Definitely great for parties, get togethers as it makes ice quickly.
