reviews.content: I like that I could get a longer shower curtain to fit a taller tub shower unit, a standard 72 inch curtain comes just shy of the top rim of the tub but the 75 inch length adds the 3 inches I need to stay inside the shower unit. It is weighted with magnets along the bottom. I choose the clear so it lets in extra light and doesn't interfere with the appearance of my patterned outer curtain. It has a reinforced top with metal grommets. It is a bit stiff, I would not want it any heavier or it would not hang well. It meets my needs perfectly

I‚Äôm happy with my clear shower curtain liner. It‚Äôs a good quality and the length was perfect. I use it behind my decorative shower curtain to keep the water from going all over the floor. The magnets help keep it in place. Arrived pretty quicklyüëçüèª
I didn't realize how much thinner it would be than our previous curtain. It works fine with a curved rod but might suck in with a straight rod. I am satisfied with the purchase.

I was tired of the shower curtain getting sucked into the shower with me. So I was looking for something with heavy duty magnets to adhere to my cast iron tub. This is definitely the best shower curtain I've ever had in respect to staying in place. I've been using it for about 5 months now and it still has the packaging creases and is very stiff. I was hoping it would relax a little.

You would think that with so many people having a clawfoot tub there'd be a variety of styles and colors of the correct size shower curtain to choose from, but it is so not so. Believe me when I say I have searched high and low and absolutely no other websites or stores have the 180" x 72" size except Amazon and this is the only one that is water proof and has 12 magnets. Do not make the same mistake I made and buy one with no magnets or only 6 magnets. You'll be so frustrated you will want to rip down the creeping curtain after 2 days. Also don't make the mistake of getting a curtain that is not 100% water proof unless you want to mop the floor daily. If you have a clawfoot tub, this is the only shower curtain that works.
I sent a review earlier about this product and I wanted to retract it. I was mixed up as to which product I was referring too. This product is well made and I highly recommend it!

I appreciate that the holes have grommets, this is usually where it tears. Magnets are sealed on both sides so hopefully no rust in the future. I have really hard water, so I am already seeing a little soap/water scum but hopefully it will clean well. Good product so far.
I was putting this up this morning and the metal around the hole just came off, thankfully it‚Äôs not too noticeable but it bugs me to see it.

This medium weight liner came in a length long enough for the magnets to cling to the tub sides. We replaced our old shower curtain rod with a curved one for more elbow room and placed it above the tile surround. That meant we needed a much longer shower curtain liner. Big box store liner wasn't long enough. And better yet, SIX magnets is better than a mere three. I hate brushing up against the shower curtain liner when I take a shower because they won't stay flat; THIS shower liner stays put because of the combination of its medium weight, it's extra length and width, and the six magnets. It clings to tub and tile instead of me!

The sizing is accurate- in my tub, the shower curtain is a bit long but so was my other ‚Äúnormal sized 72x72‚Äù shower curtain. The width is exactly what I wanted and keeps all the water in my clawfoot bathtub. I like the magnets at the bottom of the shower curtain, they work pretty well to stick against the tub.

This paper was perfect and just as good as any other cardstock I've bought, and you can't beat the price. I highly recommend!

description:
Product Description
Bring the world closer and enjoy a detailed view with the 10x50 binoculars from SkyGenius

The SkyGenius 10 x 50 Binocular has been created to provide wildlife enthusiasts or any binocular users with the highest performance and innovative technology. We combine quality, functionality, and reliability in every aspect of our binoculars to offer you the best experience in your observation of nature.

Our wish is that as you hold the SkyGenius 10 x 50 Binoculars in your hands, you will carry hope, live a life without fear, and never stop trying, explore new life

Focus on brilliant detail at 1000 yards with a range of 367 ft/1000 yards. Perfect for outdoor activities to observe wildlife and landscapes.

I haven‚Äôt purchased a pair of binoculars in a long time but these make that wait all the more enjoyable. Crystal clear views. Excellent texture and comfortable in hand. The 10x50 magnification is excellent. Love it.

Got these as a gift for my dad and he‚Äôs addicted. He‚Äôll use them for ANYTHING.
Neighbors having a fight? Let‚Äôs be nosey.
Birds being loud in the morning? Where are they at? Let‚Äôs see!
Horse racing but not getting the ideal view from the screen? Don‚Äôt worry, you can look yourself.

Love these and so does he!!! Highly recommend!!

I bought this product because I want an actual tangible lens product other than a digital camera. This product is a good way to look at objects up close through the lens of the binoculars. The lens in these binoculars are really professional because it handles the rack focusing quite excellent. This is a good product I would recommend to friends and family.

I ordered the 10 x 42 model. These are lightweight, which makes a big difference. The pair you have in your hand is infinitely superior to the pair you left in the car. Bright enough image. Little color aberration. Unless you are a hardcore birder, these are good enough; if you are a hardcore birder, this is a practical backup pair or to leave in the car/boat/camp.

Hesitant to purchase at first bec I dont know anything about binocs but after reading reviews of some binocs being sold here. I realized this one is the best and I really liked it a lot.

reviews.content: I ordered this filter after purching some, that were clearly fake, on another site. This one seems legit, has the serial number on it, security tag, and was in the right packaging. Also came with the microchip that is supposed to reset the fridge. I installed the filter started to purge the filter, the water came out black at first like it's supposed to and tastes like it should. The only problem is the microchip wouldn't reset the message on my fridge. Called GE, they told me to go to Home Depot or Lowes to buy a new one. Did that, the and the message is still up on my fridge to reset the water filter. I called GE and explained all of this to them, they are now sending me out a new water filter claiming that the batch of microchips is probably faulty. Beware before you buy a fridge that requires these water filters. I still don't know if these filters are legit or not for sure.

Purchased and received same day. Simple install following instructions, since I would have probably messed it up trying to figure it out on my own. Replace filter message went away and water tastes great after the rinse procedure was completed.

These water filters work out great for our GE Profile fridge. Saves on plastic bottles and water tastes great ! It‚Äôs less expensive than at Best Buy ( where we had purchased in the past)
They last for 6 months when we get a reminder on a our fridge to replace. Very happy with purchase. As usual, excellent delivery from Amazon!!!!

My GE fridge takes these filters, for some reason GE put in little RFID tags onto the filters and no other companies make cheaper replacement filters that i've been able to find. These filters work well and are easy to install, they make our awful city water so much better.
Got these for our fridge and they work as they should. Water tastes great out of it.
Somewhat easy to install; pricing is OK - great value for Amazon Subscription 6-month renewal (per GE Refrigerator recommendation)

The filter on the left is the filter I removed from my refrigerator and had been ordered off of the GE site. The filter on the right is the one I ordered off of Amazon after removing the old filter and replacing it with the new filter I bought on Amazon. I was still receiving a message saying to replace the filter. I called the number listed on the Amazon page and it was a direct connection to GE. They had me go into my refrigerator settings to reset the message I was being given to replace the filter. I have never had to do that before.
I was very pleased that I was able to purchase the exact water üíß filter that I needed for my Profile GE refrigerator.

Price is high. Did the mistake of not buying a fridge based on the price of the filter and availability. Lol. These things are hard to find and expensive. But, Amazon has it like everything else you don't find anywhere...
It's a water filter. Install is easy. After filling 4 32oz cups and dumping them out the water comes out clear.

name: ATERCEL Workout Gloves for Men and Women, Exercise Gloves for Weight Lifting, Cycling, Gym, Training, Breathable and Snug fit
description:
Product Description



About Atercel

We at ATERCEL are all real folks just as passionate about sports as you. We believe our mission to create potential-unlocking gear with bar-raising quality standards and our athlete-centric approach is revolutionizing the fitness market. As a startup, we see many legacy fitness brands lagging behind not only in next-level product innovation and quality, but also in the personalized customer care needed for accelerating your performance.

Why should you choose Atercel workout gloves?
Great choice for workout, cycling and more!

Get annoyed at your sweaty hands, calluses and blisters in the workout? Let Atercel workout / exercise gloves improve your grip on weights and protect your hands!

Ergonomic design
Anti-slip silicone gel pattern on the palm
Breathable mesh fabric inside
A towelling panel on the upper
Soft foam pads
Easy to put on and take off
Breathable and Lightweight
Great Design for Workouts

	

	



Maximizes Your Grip

We researched how hundreds of people use gloves to enhance our ergonomic design, leverage the muscle direction and placement and optimize grip functionality all to bring you a better glove. The result protects your hands from calluses, reduces friction discomfort all while still maintaining a strong grip on what you are holding onto.

	
Easy On and Off

The loops between the fingers make the gloves extremely easy to get off.

	
Cool and Try All Workout Long

Designed with a toweling panel on the back of the glove for wiping away sweat, and the soft mesh fabric inside fit the front of hand to keep your palm cool and dry all workout long.

Size Chart
XSmall: 6.3 to 6.9 inches
Small: 6.9 to 7.5 inches
Medium: 7.5 to 8.1 inches
Large: 8.1 to 8.9 inches
XLarge: 8.9 to 9.6 inches
Choose the Correct Size

This workout glove has a snug-fit design, relieves pressure placed on your hands and reduces the friction between the gloves and your hands when you exercise. Please choose the correct size according to the size chart.

HOW TO CHOOSE:

1. Measure the circumference of your palm (the widest part) just like the picture showed.

2. Check the size chart and choose the right size

Suitable for Indoor and Outdoor Use

	

	




Better grip. Protecting your hands efficiently. Ideal for general workout, cycling, gym training, powerlifting.

	

Atercel gloves is made of lightweight, breathable and stretchy material, to increases flexibility, comfort and fit.

	

We offer 5 different sizes for you. The Atercel workout gloves are perfect for both men and women.

reviews.content: Used this for the gym, lifting weights and on the machines. At first they were a little tight but over time they stretched a little and now fit perfectly. I've had them for about a year now and go to the gym twice a week and so far they've held up very well. I'd recommend them for anyone looking for workout gloves. Size runs a little small but just let them work in a little and it'll fit fine.

I have had my old Harbinger gloves for a long time now, they ripped and wasn't as supportive as they once were. I decided on these and WOW do they perform! I can't believe I waited so long to purchase new ones when these have been here for me all along. The price was great too, such a good value!

I ordered these work out gloves about 3months ago, and I wanted to wait until I made up my mind about them before posting a review.
These are fantastic gloves!! They have padding on the palms with rubber pattern that helps with gripping weights/handles. A good Velcro strip to keep them tightly closed, and they haven‚Äôt stretched or lost their shape at all.
I ordered the red ones in large, and it‚Äôs a nice deep red that I really like and they are a snug fit.
I‚Äôll definitely be reordering when the time comes and I‚Äôd recommend to anyone looking for a good quality workout glove

In and out of wheelchair due to spinal traumas and bad knees. Was tired of hands getting torn up and scraped regularly. This time around I decided to try a pair of gloves to help.
Although a combination of workout, cycling, motorcycle, and wheelchair gloves, came up, I settled on these for both price and description. When they arrived the other day, I would have bet money they were wrong size or would never fit.
I was wrong. Although a little snug, like they should be, they fit my beaten up hands better than my skin. I could not be happier with them so far. Will amend review if they don't last but doubt I'll need to.
Great value for any of the above stated uses. I would recommend to anyone looking.

I use these gloves for weight exercises and on cardio machines. I used to buy them a brand called Harbringer from a local sporting goods. I'd be lucky to get 2 or 3 months out of them before they fell apart. These gloves are great after 3 months they show no wear at all and they cost only about 2/3rds what the others cost. Definitely recommend

So I started my workout üí™ again and needed some gloves for the weights. I ordered theses gloves and they are comfortable, light, and easy to take off. I'm happy with my purchase. Money well spent... oh and I ordered the large but the way...

My old gloves had worn out on me, so after researching a few, I decided to purchase these. So far I am satisfied. I had to break them in some, because at first lifting a bar with weight off the ground, was interesting. But now things are better. Also, using the two round hook assists to remove the gloves was interesting at first, but now that I have used them more, it has been easier using them. The one thing I have not done yet is wash them. My old gloves I machine washed and allowed them to air dry. These it is suggested that you wash them by hand. So I will see soon enough. But for now satisfied with my purchase.

Easy to put on and the loops between the finger webbings help get the gloves off because they are snug. The extra cushion might be the reason but it helps your palms from getting blisters. The towel feature is nice because I forgot about it and when I wiped my forehead I didn‚Äôt scratch myself.

My skin use to get rough from my workouts but now they don't thanks to these gloves. they are so comfortable. Love the strings on it to help u remove them easily and the towel material to wipe your sweat is genius. Got my husband a pair

I have only used the gloves 5 times but they meet all my requirements. Can't comment on its longevity since I have only had them for a short time. Really like the little straps that help you remove the gloves. Very smart!

name: ThisWorx Car Vacuum Cleaner - Car Accessories - Small 12V High Power Handheld Portable Car Vacuum w/Attachments, 16 Ft Cord & Bag - Detailing Kit Essentials for Travel, RV Camper
description:
Product Description
Easy To Use For Quick Cleanups!

1. Turn on your car and plug into the 12V outlet.

2. Pick one of the 3 free attachments for those hard to reach areas.

3. Clean from front to back!

4. Use our included filter brush to brush out any excess debris and extend the lifespan of your filter.

		
	ThisWorx Model 1.0	ThisWorx Model 2.0
Type of Filter	Single Paper	Double Filter
Suction Power	106W & 8.8 amps	110W & 9.17 amps

reviews.content:
I was so skeptical at the time i opened it n saw such a small suction. But i used it in my car where my dog always rides shot gun. N the car is full of fur. I vacuumed the seat the floor the dash the console the door. HECK I VACUUMED THE DOG. i wanted to see how good it was. It vacuumed his loose hair right off. I had a cup full of his fur.
The reviews were right down side was the brush. Not that it didnt work but u want ant extra one or a bigger one. I didnt even use the exta accesseries. But i was just amazed on how much fur it picked up. N i keep it in my car still plugged in so when ever im driving n im at a red light i vacuum myself the fur thats on me. I look pretty silly at the red light. But its getting att the fur.

This is a cute and moderately effective vacuum with a lot of pluses for cleaning a car: the storage bag is great, the included accessories are ideal for reaching between seats, the suction is strong enough to get the one cashew your kid has somehow wedged into a cranny. It's easy enough to clean out after use, up to and including changing the filter. And it's small enough to travel in the car full time without sacrificing much cargo space.

The downside of a car specific vacuum is that it is specific to cars. This is designed to plug into a car outlet, so you can't easily clean a spill on the couch if all you can find is your car vacuum. This one is a bit small for cleaning the floor of the car, and the size somewhat limits the suction.

The vacuum worked great! Husband and I took a long road trip with a very messy toddler, the vacuum picked up all sorts of crumbs, hair and even road salt! The cord reaches all the way from the front to the back in my midsize SUV with extra length to spare. The only downside of this product is the vacuum needs to be plugged in the entire time in use in the car charging outlet, if I were to buy the product again I would spend the extra money to buy the rechargeable version or the one that has the normal outlet but that is only for the convenience and because I would love to be able to use it inside as well for hard to reach and small areas like the kitchen drawers and things. Overall recommend!

I rarely give out a 5 star to any product. This product perhaps deserves a one! Yet I feel every product has room for improvement! The suction power is excellent. Note this product is not for really deep cleaning, it‚Äôs simply to small for such work. It cleans very well for its size. The various attachments work wonderfully. The cord length could be slightly longer for use in SUV‚Äôs & large vehicles. The storage bag is a little small making it a bit difficult to pack everything in.
It is overall a great product. I recommend this product!!!

This thing sucks!

Seriously, though the suction is impressive for such a small, offbrand vacuum. I bought this to use around the house so I didn‚Äôt have to get out the big, heavy Shark every time there is a small cleanup somewhere. Just had to buy the AC to DC cigarette lighter Converter to charge it in the house and it holds a charge impressively long. Comes with all the tools to get in those hard to reach spaces like between the oven and the cupboards, underneath the oven and around the trashcan with the crevice tool extension. I haven‚Äôt really used the brush much, but it seems perfect for cleaning off baseboards. Filter is easy to clean out(even comes with a second filter) and handy carrying case for travel. Only thing that would sweeten this deal is a wall mount to charge it(and if it came with the AC to DC converter plug to charge it).

I wish I would've taken a before and after picture! You'll just have to take my word for it. So initially I was skeptical of this vacuum because of its small size. I noticed there were TONS of reviews though, mostly decent, so I decided to pull the trigger on it. I have a messy toddler and am about to have my second baby, so the idea of being able to plug it in right in my car and do some cleaning, was really appealing. I also really like the idea of having different attachments for cleaning nooks and crannies. I decided the other night to get it out and give it a shot and I'll say, initially I wasn't overly impressed. I plugged it in and turned it on (yes, with my vehicle running) and thought, "wow, that's it?" But when u started vacuuming with it I was actually pretty impressed. So NO, you're not going to get industrial vacuum-quality with this device. However, like I said, if you want to be able to take your time at your own house and so some car cleaning, this device is great. It actually did a pretty good job of cleaning my carpets and giving my car a refresh. I loved that the attachments helped me get into spaces I'd never have access to with the vacuum at the car wash. So between the counsel and the seats, etc. The hose in my opinion is shaped oddly and doesn't work too well, but I loved the brush and the straight attachments. The hose plugs in one way to the vacuum and then faces a different direction at the end, so it's pretty uncomfortable trying to straighten it out to fish it down into a nook. Not bad, though. Just personally won't be using that attachment as much. I like that it includes a brush for the filter and an extra filter. What I did find annoying was that the suction power was lacking if even the smallest amount of dirt and hair stuck to the filter. So I felt as though I was constantly emptying the dust cup even when I should've been able to fill it up more. Lot of dirt and particles like to stick right around the tip where it sucks, right in the crack between the opening and the outer plastic. So that was annoying, but holding it facing up and giving it a few good taps sent the dust down with the rest of it by the filter which was good. I did notice that when you open it and take the filter out to dump the dust, the rubber ring on the filter gets dusty and makes it difficult to seat it back into place within the plastic so you can click that back onto the actual vacuum. So tinkering with that was pretty annoying trying to get it to seat correctly so I could get back to vacuuming. It took me quite a while to complete but my car also hadn't been vacuumed in a while. All in all, I would say this is a really good but also flawed device that is nice to have if you don't like having to go to the car wash to clean out your car, or you have small and messy children like I do and want to be able to clean up after them in a pinch and at home. This device as I mentioned earlier is also quite good for the nooks and crannies the car wash vacuum heads simply cannot reach. However if you're expecting professional detailer-quality results, you'll likely be disappointed. This vacuum does have pretty good suction power but some stuff that is almost weaved into the carpet fibers still remains. It is not perfect, and i would say it's not quite as professional quality as the claims state on the box. It also claims you can clean wet messes with it, however I have not tried that as of yet and am not sure I'd be comfortable testing that. So, all in all, if you're looking for what i described, you should definitely get this product. However if you're looking for something more professional grade, you may want to look into something a lot more powerful. I am happy with the value of it, and hope to get a lot of use from it.

I appreciate the car plug option, when I‚Äôm down in my underground parking structure. As other reviewers mentioned, the suction is not that great. I bought the more expensive model with higher voltage and can‚Äôt imagine the lower volt one. Good for tidying up. Not a deep clean obviously.

Does the job but wish it had a little more suction. It sucked up the messes in my vehicle but my car wasn't the dirtiest it's been so with that said I wish there was more suction power. I really liked the different attachments and being able to get in tight spaces to vacuum was very nice.

This product works as the name says this worx. I am impressed with the suction for such a small cleaning vacuum, its worth the price.

Please note that for some cars with lower amp fuse for example (10 amps ) i would suggest installing a fuse 5 amp higher than the original. This is because the vacuum might draw more power and heat than the fuse can handle which will then pop the fuse. Though that is the main purpose of a fuse it can be annoying to be replacing fuse every now and then.
This was a great price, arrived quickly, and was nicely packaged. Before I opened the box I realized I didn't have the type of outlet it needed so I returned.

reviews.content:
I've never really had a problem cooking rice on the stove, so I never felt I needed a rice cooker. I was concerned about taking up extra space in my cabinet for a device I didn't need. I had heard so many good things about this particular rice cooker, and the price was so reasonable, I thought, why not give it a try?

Well, I have to say this is a handy little device. I like the peace of mind of setting and forgetting. I have made 3 batches of rice now, and each one came out perfectly. The first time I followed the instructions, I rinsed the rice, put in the water, stirred and turned it on. About 25 minutes later, perfect fluffy rice. The second time, the only change I made was using chicken stock instead of water. Again, perfect fluffy rice. The third time I was in a hurry, so I tried the rapid rice function. According to the booklet, I was supposed to have cooked rice in 9 minutes. I didn't have rice in 9 minutes, it still took 20 minutes. I had forgot to rinse the rice first, so it was a little sticker, but still perfectly cooked. I need to go back and make sure I didn't miss any steps in the rapid rice process.

The book comes with recipes, you can make complete meals in this cooker. I haven't tried the steaming options yet, but you can steam veggies and proteins as well, even while your rice is cooking. I will be experimenting with that function in the future. You also have the ability to cook other grains, which I also have yet to try.

I would like to mention, you can cook rice quicker on the stove than in this rice cooker. The real advantage here is the hands off set it and forget it peace of mind. Most meals that I would be making to go with rice take 20-30 minutes to prepare, so the fact the rice cooker takes longer isn't an issue for me.

I did purchase the smaller size cooker option because I don't make large batches of rice at one time, but there are larger size options available. And finally, yes you can cook rice in an Instant Pot, but if you have your meal cooking in there, you can't cook both at the same time in the same device.

We own a large 60 cup, party-sized Aroma Housewares rice cooker and love it, so we decided to give this small 8 cup a try.

Growing up in an area where white, sticky rice is served on the daily, you become a rice cooker connoisseur early on. Having owned pricey cookers and cheapy cookers of nearly all the popular sizes and makes, I've learned that the only things that matter are 1) is your rice cooked firm and chewy; 2) is it easy to clean; and 3) does it cook enough to feed your family. This pot met all these criteria for us as well as taking up very little counter space while looking good in steel & black. At 1st glance we thought, "this is the teeniest pot we've ever owned!" but it really does cook 8 full cups of perfectly done rice - translucent and slightly sticky. (We don't eat fluffy, softer rice like Uncle Bens).

We rinsed and drained completely 4 cups of raw rice (rice measured to the cup brim and used a colander to drain) then filled the pot with cool water to the 4 cup line in the pot. Doing so matched the Thumb Measuring rule (lightly touching the top of the raw rice, water should reach 1st digit). We were pleased that the lines are clearly marked in white. Using the "white rice" setting, the pot began its 10 minute count down after 25 minutes for a 35 total minute cook time. There was no wait time after cooking was complete. This review is based on the Sam's Club Members Mark Thai (Hom Mali) Jasmine Rice, a long grain. We have not tried our other favorite brand which is Hinode Calrose White Rice, a medium grain, but I suspect it will need a bit more water, probably filled to the 8 liter mark, and will need at least a 15 minute wait for the rice to set before serving.

We have not tried the "warm" setting for rice since we unplug the pot as soon as its done, serve it, then refrigerate whatever is left. I will use the warm setting occasionally for broths. I also plan to cook bulgar using more water than rice on the "brown rice" setting. The "delay" setting works well for jasmine rice presoaking, then cooking on flash rice. Probably won't use it for steaming, but you never know...

This cooker serves 3 persons well. Fast and easy to clean with no sticking. We also like the white speckled black pot - that's a first for us. We've had the pot for a day and already tried two recipes. Very useful thus far!

I've been making rice on stove for years and finally decided to get a rice cooker. Oh man this is a game changer! It makes the Peeerrrrrfffect rice! Best rice I've ever eaten, even better than the ones I got at some of my fav. restaurant! It's compact and doesn't take much counter space. It's extremely easy to use with preset settings for making steamed rice, steam veggies, or heat things up. It can make soup, porridge and many other things in minutes! Oh it also looks very cute with this compact size. I'm soooo happy with this purchase. Just to clarify that I'm one person, so I got this size which is perfect for 1-2 people for regular use. For a family with kids, this would be a tab small. But for single or a couple, this is perfect.

I love the size. It‚Äôs lightweight and easy to store and doesn‚Äôt take up a lot of real estate on the counter if you prefer. It‚Äôs not only great for cooking grains but the steamer basket has proven to be very convenient to steam vegetables and/or fish/meats while grain is cooking. It probably works best for up to 2 people as far as the steamer goes. The instruction manual has instructions, not only for your grains, but also for steaming and cooking meats and vegetables. It also has some recipes for oatmeal, frittata, jambalaya, french toast casserole, chili and pasta. It even has a delay start and flash cook for rice if you‚Äôre in a hurry and it keeps warm when cooking is done. The outside stays cool to the touch & the whole thing is very easy to clean. It was definitely worth the price.

I've had Aroma rice cookers for decades and, overall, they're reliable kitchen workhorses that produce good consistent results. This newest model, the small white one with limited functions, is no different. My issue is the blatantly erroneous claim that this model accommodates "4 cups raw" and "8 cups cooked" rice. That's a bold-faced fabrication. "Cups" refers to the puny plastic measuring cup that arrives as part of the kit and that provided cup is equivalent to approximately 1/2 a US measuring cup. The rice cooker pot looked precariously full with just 2 cups of uncooked white rice and the 4 cups of water required for cooking. Upon cooking, the rice was cooked perfectly but was overflowing the pot, requiring cleanup. In summary, Aroma rice cookers are sturdy efficient machines but beware the capacity touted online as it's only technically true because they've created their own measuring system. The unit preforms well but it's tiny and not suited to making quantities of rice for large families, parties, or extra rice for storage and use later. If making a little less than 2 standard US measuring cups of rice in one go, the product performs well. However, the be aware of the dinky size of the thing because, in this case, a cup is definitely not a cup.

I've use my Rice Cooker a lot to make about 1 to 2 cups of rice and have been very happy with the Aroma branded cooker because of its small size, ease of use and cooking speed. Using it is so simple; add rice, water and start the cooker.

A couple things disappoint me. The first, I seem to only get about two years (ARC-914D = 2 yrs, 1 week this time, previously I had the ARC-914SBD) out of them before I have to buy another. I know it's time to replace when I have to restart the cooking process because finding too much water and uncooked rice in it after the first attempt. Restarted the cooking process will make good rice, and that's' when I order a new one. The second issue; some times it will sort of burn and leave a clump of gelatinous rice at the bottom center of the cooker. I know too much starch can cause this, but pre-rinsing the rice couldn't prevent this from happening. I discovered if I coat the non-stick surface with an little extra olive oil spray corrected this issue 100% without altering the taste of the rice. I purchased another ARC-914SBD; and pick between models based only on which one is cheapest at the time.

I bought this AROMA brand rice cooker to replace a larger vegetable steamer (by a different manufacturer) that had an attachment for cooking rice. I wanted to have a cooker that was primarily for rice, with the option to steam vegetables and/or cook other foods, while being smaller when stored on the countertop, and easier to clean than my old one. Based on other Amazon reviews, I selected this one.

Before I forget to write it, I think it is important to point out that this cooker is rated for 8 cups of COOKED rice, NOT 8 cups of uncooked rice. The usual ratio for regular white rice is 1:2, meaning that if you put in 1 cup of uncooked rice, you will have 2 cups of cooked rice when done. So with this product you can put in a maximum of 4 cups of uncooked rice, and will end up with a maximum of 8 cups of cooked rice.

It is also important to note that if you choose to use the optional (included) vegetable steamer/food cooker tray, this fits inside the rice cooker pot and therefore takes up some of the space in that pot; you can cook rice AND steam vegetables/cook food simultaneously, but you cannot fit the full measure of rice when doing so. In my estimate, if you put in a cup or two of uncooked rice, the vegetable steamer/food cooker tray holds about enough to feed two people when combined with the rice. It is certainly not large enough to simultaneously cook rice and other food in quantities for a family; AROMA makes a similar product with a larger capacity if you need it.

I shopped in several stores (Sears, Bed Bath & Beyond, Target, Macy's) before buying this cooker. They all carried electric rice cookers, but none had this product. Sears has AROMA products, but only in a less expensive non-digital version, while BB&B had a similar cooker by West Bend that did not look as good in terms of quality. But the majority of places I looked carried only non-digital rice cookers. I mention this because I think the digital ones have a couple of advantages that are significant enough to comment on:

- The cooker is not simply based on cooking time; there is some sort of measurement going on that assures properly cooked rice.
- The cooker can be programmed to start cooking while you are away, so that the rice (or other food) will be ready when you want to eat it.
- The cooker automatically goes into a 'keep warm' mode once cooking is done, and will work well in this regard for at least a few hours.

This cooker includes the following:

- Cooker itself (included the digital controller and the heating element)
- Teflon coated (non-stick) rice cooker pot
- Plastic vegetable steamer/food cooker tray
- Plastic stirring spatula (used once rice is cooked)
- Clear plastic measuring cup (1 cup capacity)
- Users manual
- Quick start guide
- Rice recipes

Basic rice cooking goes like this:

- Measure uncooked rice, using included cup or any other measuring cup
- Pour rice into pot
- If cooking white rice, pour in some water, stir with included spatula (or wooden spoon, etc), drain water (this optional step helps rinse away excess starch)
- Add water to pot (which already contains rice) until water level reaches measuring mark on inside of pot that corresponds with amount of rice
- Close cooker lid
- Press POWER button
- Press either the WHITE RICE or BROWN RICE button
- Cooking starts, and is monitored by the digital controller; display shows rotating LED pattern, 'Cooking' LED illuminates
- When digital controller estimates that about 12 minutes remain, display stops rotating pattern and starts showing count down minutes until done
- Cooker beeps loudly for a few seconds, automatically enters KEEP WARM mode, 'Keep Warm' LED illuminates
- When ready to eat, press POWER button twice to turn cooker off, open lid and remove pot
- Stir cooked in pot using included spatula (or wooden spoon, etc)

The manual includes a chart for estimating cooking time, but in general white rice takes 20-30 minutes, and brown rice takes twice that time.

I have done small and large batches of both white rice, brown rice, and also a batch of wild rice, and all came out perfectly, properly cooked but not mushy. White rice had a nice level of stickiness of the sort that lends itself to eating with chopsticks, but without being TOO sticky, so you can easily break it up by stirring more with the spatula.

In my tests, I always used the recommended water amount (i.e. I filled the pot to the measurement line that matched the amount of uncooked rice I put in), EXCEPT for the wild rice; the cooker does not have a setting for wild rice, so I followed the instructions on the rice bag, putting in 1-3/4 cup of water for each cup of uncooked rice, and then using the BROWN RICE mode on the cooker.

I have not used the optional vegetable steamer/food cooker tray, so I cannot comment on that very much. But the manual includes extra steps for setting up cooking in the tray only (i.e. no rice cooking), as well as simultaneous cooking of rice and other foods. There are ways to specify time values that apply to the foods in the optional tray, so the cooker is not going only on its normal method for rice-only cooking.

Besides using the product for cooking rice, and other things in the optional tray, it can be used as a sort of 'crock pot' for heating soups, chili, stews, etc. In this case, you just put the food to be heated into the pot directly and select the WHITE RICE mode. The food will be heated and then the cooker will keep it warm until you are ready to eat it. I tested this using a can of chili, and it worked well. This use of the cooker is mostly useful if you want to program it to start cooking while you are away, with cooking completed soon before you ARE ready to eat, OR to keep the food warm if you are uncertain about when you will be ready to eat.

The pot is easy to clean. Since neither water or food are ever put into the body of the cooker, there should rarely be any need to clean it, other than wiping the inside of the lid in case any food splashed up onto it during cooking.

The quality of this product seems very good. Nothing feels cheap. My only quibbles are that the power cord is quite short (obviously intended for use on a counter top, whereas I prefer to use it on a table that is further from the nearest outlet), and the 'control panel' area is quite reflective, and sometimes I have to view from different angles in order to read the buttons and/or the display and other LEDs.

This is a great size for a family of 4. It fits neatly in the cabinet when not in use. I put a picture of it next to a typical soda can for comparison.

It's easy to clean. There is a removable top plate you can pop off and rinse after every use. The lining keeps the rice from boiling over. There is also a little removable plastic container to catch the steam droplets that you should to empty and rinse after each use.

The most I have cooked is 3 cups dry rice (about 6 cups cooked), which is more than enough for the 4 of us, including 2 teenage boys. I could probably fit an additional cup of dry rice.

There is a function called flash rice which cuts off about 5 minutes or so from the cooking time, not sure why it's not the default setting. I normally just use the white rice button.

The non-stick surface is granite like. I prefer it to a smooth surface, I find that the rice and starch seems to cling less and releases easier, making for simpler clean up.

My only complaint is that the countdown timer only comes on towards the end of the cooking session. Given that it's not that reliable to begin with, not a big deal, just plan for about a half hour for cooked rice.

My Sanyo fuzzy logic cooker died so this was purchased to replace it. This cooker does a fine job, the issues I have are not a reason not to buy it but are just an annoyance. The under lid removable piece is very flimsy and I bent it slightly trying to remove it to wash. It also does not integrate with the gasket very well after washing, you have to slid the gasket into it‚Äôs place with your fingers. Hopefully, the button the under lid attaches to will loosen up as time goes by. The thing I found most annoying is the lid is hinged on the right side of the appliance as you face the control board. If you are right handed, as I am, when you raise the lid to stir your food the back of your right wrist will bump against the lid unless you turn the appliance to the right. My Sanyo had the hinge in the rear which makes more sense, this design is awkward for stirring although if you are left handed you will probably be delighted. Nice cooker for a very reasonable price, my Sanyo was $100 more than this one.

I have used many different rice cookers in the past, and either they did not work well, or the unit died. My favorite and most reliable rice cooker was this unit for over the past 7 or 8 years. It has always worked and never had problems. White rice, brown rice or bulgur always comes out amazing. The unit is used daily, and on some days multiple times through out the day. Being clumsy, I damaged and bent the pot and was no longer able to use my unit. I checked, and found my exact unit is still being sold. No further research was needed, I bought the replacement unit and will look forward to using it on daily basis for years to come.

reviews.content: The yoga blocks and carry strap are great! The mat is very thick and cushiony which is what I was looking for. I mainly use it for weight lifting and other things where I lay on the floor. After a month of use there are a few small spots where my dog walked across it and his nails made small puncture marks in it. I can see stress marks every where that I step or put any pressure for an extended period but by the next day they are gone. It‚Äôs also a little stretchy. It works great for my needs but I don‚Äôt think it would be a good choice for someone to actually use for yoga or any floor cardio like mountain climbers.

I got this yoga mat to do stretching exercises. 1/2-Inch Extra Thick High Density mat is comfortable on the knees. It came with easy carry strap -- useful to carry or store in compact/rolled up position. I bought blue color which was as depicted in the product image. Easy to stand firmly and perform my exercises.

I bought this mat to use along with a thinner yoga mat to help cushion my bones and joints while holding specific poses. I find that this mat offers good cushion and comfort on my knees and hips. I did not have any problems with the mat slipping out of place but I also used another mat on top.

The gray color was not what I expected. It is okay but the texture makes it look dull. The thickness is good and it isn‚Äôt too soft, so it‚Äôs comfortable. The reason for a 4 star is the indentation that‚Äôs still present after a couple days and also there are a few holes on the mat.
Overall, it‚Äôs a good value for the price but the quality is fair.
I really like my yoga mat. I love the fact that it is soft and I love the extra length.
This is my third yoga mat like this! They‚Äôre so squishy that I feel so supported during my work out. I love the different colors and have even given them as gifts.
It's weirdly skinny, and doesn't unroll completely. But it's very squishy and soft!

My dad and I have recently started working out together and we started on the wood floor. The wood would hurt our backs and head and it was not very good to work out on. We just got these mats and started on them today and they are REALLY good. While doing motion activities you shouldn't use them as they slip but other than that there is fantastic stability!
The quality of the mat is very good. It is very thick so it does not hurt when you are exercising on the floor.
I cut these mats up and use the pieces for weather stripping. I can customize to fit and it works great!

name: Chalk Markers - 8 Vibrant Colors, Erasable, Non-Toxic, Water-Based, Reversible Tips, Bright Colors For Kids & Adults for Glass or Chalkboard Markers for Businesses, Restaurants, or Use Liquid Chalk Markers on Any Non-Porous Surface
description:
Product Description
WARNING! - NEVER use any chalk markers on chalkboard paint or cheap porous chalkboards.
How to get started.

1. Shake well before each use. These nontoxic, water-based markers need to be shaken thoroughly before use to mix the pigment. We recommend shaking the capped marker until you hear the ball move freely (30 seconds to a minute). If you don‚Äôt hear the ball moving inside, remove cap, press marker tip down once to release pressure, replace cap, and then shake again. Be sure marker is tightly capped and hold your finger over the cap while shaking to avoid splatter. Test flow before re-shaking.

2. Prime the marker.

On scrap paper gently press the bullet tip until you see the color reach the base of the nib. Once full, further pressure will cause the marker to leak and puddle.

3. Prime your chalkboard.

Be sure to prime your non-porous chalkboard before use by rubbing regular chalk the board and then wiping it off with a dry paper towel or rag (if you don‚Äôt have chalk on hand, you can substitute with corn starch or baby powder). Remove liquid chalk marker with a wet rag or paper towel.

	

	




Bold, bright, and fun liquid chalk markers from Bandle B. Perfect for adults and kids, this pack of 8 markers offers lively colors. Ideal for businesses, crafts, events, and every day. Write a note, write a message, draw something pretty, or sketch something silly. Let your imagination run wild with a rainbow of colors that are fresh and beautiful.

	

Perfect for hand lettering and freestyle designs, Bandle B. Liquid Chalk Markers come in 8 vibrant colors to help your designs, messages, and slogans pop off of chalkboards or whiteboards. These markers are easy to use and erase.

	

The Bandle B. Liquid Chalk Markers are the perfect way to do it. For use in your home or business, the vivid colors create eye-catching designs on your writing surface to make a lasting impact.

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS (FAQ'S)

What do I do if the color appears faded or watery?

If the color is not vibrant or appears runny, this means the pigment is not fully mixed. Just shake the marker with the cap on until color is opaque and vibrant.

What if the tip gets stuck?

If the tip gets stuck, take off the cap and partially unscrew the colored plastic piece that attaches the nip to the black body of the marker. A couple turns will do the trick and when you tighten this piece back up, the nib will pop back into place.

How do I reverse the tip?

These markers come with reversible tips. Simple use a pair or tweezers or a paper towel to pull out the tip, reverse and replace. Use a piece of scrap paper to press the tip in and release to ensure the tip is fully set.

I haven't used them in a long time, how do I revive them?

if the markers go unused for a while or seem to be drying out, they may need a little attention to get going again. First, shake it vigorously for at least 30 seconds. You need to hear the ball bearing moving inside as you shake it. Keep shaking vigorously for at least 10 seconds after you hear this sound. Now prime the nib by fully pressing it down on a clean surface. Hold it down and/or pump gently until the ink comes out.

Can I use these markers on chalkboard paint or a painted wall?

Painted boards are not recommended for liquid chalk markers as ghosting will occur. Ghosting is when you can still see a faint outline of your drawing even after erasing. We recommend sealing any non-porous surfaces before using markers.

How do you erase liquid chalk markers?

Our Liquid chalk markers can be erased easily on non-porous surfaces. A damp cloth is usually all it takes. However, on porous surfaces (non-erasable), some of the pigment can get absorbed, causing a shadow to be left behind when removed. If you've experienced this, here are some ideas to help: 1. Use a white cleaning eraser to clean the surface. These work wonders but can remove some painted surfaces, so please test first. 2. Use a baby wipe. These also work well and are somewhat less aggressive than cleaning erasers. Please test any of these cleaning techniques in a small area first as all surfaces react differently to these solutions and we don't want any damage to occur.

What else can I use my markers on?

These markers also work great on vinyl, glass, whiteboard, tile, metal, plastic, and other non-porous materials.

WARNING! - NEVER use any chalk markers on chalkboard paint or cheap porous chalkboards.

reviews.content: I took one out of the package and tried to use it. Nothing happened. So of course I decided to read the instructions. You have to press down on the tip once you open the cover, and then shake it hard to make the ink flow. Works great if you follow the instructions. Only issue is that a regular chalk eraser won't remove the writing from a chalk board, you need a damp cloth to wipe the board clean.

Colors are vibrant and the markers are easy to use. It‚Äôs my first time using liquid chalk and I really love it so far! You just have to shake them quite a bit at the beginning and press on the tip to get the color flowing.

**Update 13 months of use** My original review stands true. I didn‚Äôt start using these regularly until 4 months ago and I write a monthly calendar with them to keep track of my schedule. 1 color I rarely use is already barely working unfortunately despite shaking and priming multiple times. The markers have always been kept in the box they came in and are stored upside down. I had hoped I wouldn‚Äôt have to prime them each time I wanted to write down a new appt quick but that‚Äôs not the case unfortunately. As you can see from the attached pic, I take care of them so it‚Äôs not like they are battered and bruised! Even though I‚Äôve had them for over a year, I would‚Äôve hoped they would‚Äôve lasted a little bit longer given the fact that I didn‚Äôt really start using them until recently. I‚Äôll be looking for a different for future use.

The colors are good once you get the marker primed well. Some of the colors tend to be a little bit liquidy which makes it a little bit of a pain to get the chalkboard clean if you are particular like I am. I imagine there are better markers on the market yet these do work if you put a little extra effort into it.

Look at that brightness. I love these colors! I have tried two other boards and it does leave a little residue when you erase. I just ordered actual chalk cleaner and we shall see if that works. These colors are so fun though and last a while.

These markers are great! They write beautifully and the color looks terrific, even after several days. Super easy to remove. The instructions are clear on how to use them (make sure you prep your chalkboard in order to avoid any residue being left over after erasing!). I would have easily given this product 5 stars, except the yellow marker came with mold or something on it (see photo). Not worth my time to return it, and for my use I don‚Äôt particularly need the yellow, but definitely a bummer!
These are great markers. So much better than the ones that came with my weekly menu. Very vibrant colors and we‚Äôre easy to remove as well
I absolutely love these markers they dry really nice so when I go to write again it doesn‚Äôt smudge and the colors are super bright neon! Perfect for my chalk board
These are great! I have a menu for the fridge that uses these and it looks great

They are easy to use and so bright! Love
The only down side (and it‚Äôs a small detail). the reversible tip. You get your fingers all chalky. Since you have to pull it out and flip it around to get the chisel tip. But not that big of deal
They write and feel nice. So far easy to wipe off with some cleaner. I got two blues instead of a white though which kind of sucks.

reviews.content:
Like: I bought this mat for placement on the floor in my son's bedroom. He has autism and likes to spend time on his knees while playing and watching television. They were an excellent purchase and serve that purpose extremely well as his bedroom flooring is hardwood.

Dislike: They do tend to come apart fairly easily. As someone who frequently visits the gym, I would not recommend for the gym. Basic exercise such as yoga or stationary movement, they would work quite well. The matting is soft and very comfortable, but for a gym floor I'd want the connectors to be a bit stiffer so that they didn't come apart so easily.

My rating is based on my intended usage, not as a gym mat.

Great product. Comfortable, easy to clean. Great for ground work and protecting our floors. I am in a Mobile home and I really like these mats. I would like a little thicker maybe for a bit more support but they are still great, I‚Äôll probably add wood underneath to distribute the weight of the weight bench.
The mats are easy to clean and assemble. These piece together perfectly. Had to turn some 180 but fit perfectly once we set it up.

Apart from bedrooms my house has beautiful tiles‚Ä¶ I hate tiles! Because if they are cold and hard to walk on and I was looking for a solution for that without destroying the existing tiles. These mats are the solution! I have them throughout my house like everywhere, they are wonderful to walk on, warm and soft. Super easy to clean and vacuum clean‚Ä¶ This could be the future for modern flooring!

First - I ordered 48 tiles and only need 24 tiles. Was not sure how I was laying out the room and set it up in a "L" shaped layout - worked and looked great. Installed in seconds / minutes. If I damage any or something happens, I can swap out a tile in seconds. Seems to hold together well and if dense / firm, but cushioned. I was using carpet on a concrete floor as my cushion and it was hard on the knees and any floor exercised.

Installed these and what a world of difference. Again, firm but still a slight cushion. I use the FITBOD app and it takes you through weights to bodyweight to bands so you are all over the equipment. Only used a couple of days but loving them.

Now the drawback - I thought it was because I cleaned / washed the painted concrete floor in the basement that it was slippery when I stepped onto it from the mats. Went upstairs and stepped on the tile in the kitchen and noticed a slickness on my socks that made me walk cautiously like I could slip. There must be a some type of mold release product to allow it to come out of the molding process when they are made. Let me be clear - the mats, when on them, especially with shoes did not seem slippery to me. They are textured and noticed no slipperiness to them. It was stepping off them on the painted surface I noticed it. I am going to try wiping down with a window cleaner or car interior surface cleaner that has no shine to it to see if will cut the transfer down. Still recommend them highly.

I bought these mats for my patio which I use as my home gym space. The floor didn't have a nice surface for body weight exercise like push-ups-sit-ups and burpee's and I was having to take my floor workouts outside to the park. At first I wasn‚Äôt convinced I would like the foam surface, but after receiving them, I am glad I took a chance. I got the bright blue and they are beautiful and sturdy. easy to assemble and cushy enough to protect your knees. Highly recommend if you need an affordable and soft floor surface. :)
Very comfy under your feet and while you work out. Doesn‚Äôt effect equipment or make it wobbly. Going to order more so I can cover the whole floor for more workout space and equipment!

Installed under a cable machine and pull up station. For added support, I assembled upside-down and gorilla taped all the seams, just in case. Don't feel like moving machines to reassemble if they come loose. Works really well.
I would have given five stars except for the feeling of the surface. Who may notice? I like roll ability over the puzzle configuration too.

I put my 500 lb functional trainer on these mats and they work well. However, they are very slick from the manufacturing process. They need to be cleaned with degreaser or soapy water to remove this film. Also, the border pieces come off very easily and will likely fail over time. If you glued the corners they may do ok.

Bought for a basement workout area and my husband put it down in an afternoon. He finished the edges the following day. It‚Äôs the perfect level of cushioning for equipment and weights. Glad we took the chance on this.

reviews.content: Nice and thick, not flimsy. Followed instructions - used hair dryer to warm to surfaces, didn't use the door for almost 3 days. It remained in place for a few weeks without issue, then a small dish towel got stuck under the door - drying dog off - and the weatherstrip came right off. I couldnt imagine if there was a rug that it brushed against, it would never remain in place. If it comes off again, will look into better adhesive in warmer months, maybe that will help.

It sticks well and even comes with tacks, however I placed mine on and tried to adjust it. It ended up peeling up the door and I did not even stick it really hard because I was still thinking about it. I guess that means it probably will not come off. Mine has been on for a few months now with no movement and I did not use the tacks it came with.

The long, flat rubber sweep comes rolled up. Because it is packaged in a rolled up position not only is it a pain to straighten into a flat position but the edges are also distorted. Some of the red tape protecting the adhesive does not touch the adhesive due to a linear object being forced to curve.
I unrolled the sweep and placed it on a flat surface with a weighted object on top for a few days. This helped, but the edges were still crooked when I installed it. The installation wasn't difficult, but it looks a bit sloppy because I could not make it level due to the shape. The adhesive seems like it would adhere well if it wasn't for the curves that remained. I tacked it to the door for a couple of days to ensure the adhesive stuck.
Since installation, the product works great. It is exactly as advertised. I'm very happy with it except for the damage caused by it being rolled up in packaging.

I purchased this to keep bugs from crawling through the space under my front door, and it did the job temporarily. However, a month or two, one of the pins has already come out of the door. It takes some hammering to adhere, and you might need more than that. It's also nice that you can cut the product to your door's size, for optimum fit.

I live in an apartment and I am tired of the smell of dope entering my unit on a daily basis. I did as intructions and I cleaned my portion of my door for adhesion. I love this product and will continue to purchase this product for years to come. Worth more than what Home Depot or Lowe's carry. Buy it.

My cat kept swatting his toys underneath the closet door. Then he would stand at the closet and whine and make a bunch of ruckus until I got up and opened the door to retrieve them for him. It was becoming profoundly irritating, so I bought this thing. Now the toys won't go under the door. Problem solved.
This doesn‚Äôt take care of sound 100% but it definitely helps minimize it and not make it so loud, also helped block the light from peeping through bottom of the door.
I didn't think that the adhesive would work as well as it did. I hold amazedly well. I am opening a door over carpet and it has not come unstuck or moved at all. excellent product.

Easy to install, the sticker seemed kind of a pain to take off but very strong adhesion. The space underneath my door is a quite a sizeable gap so I wish the height of the product was longer.

So far, opening and closing the door (as well as the product going over a rug) has kept the product in place. I did hammer in the stoppers that it came with since I felt the adhesion was not going to be potent enough.

I‚Äôm not handy. My house has a room that is always freezing, you can feel the draft under the door when the door is closed. I popped this on there and it stopped that! No more adjusting the draft stopping cushion or towels every time I go in and out the door (and it‚Äôs a laundry room, so that‚Äôs often!)

description: From the manufacturer

reviews.content: I am very cheap so this was difficult for me to buy when there are other filters out there for 1/3 of the price. However, I wanted to stop buying bottled water every week and the cheap filter I bought tasted like crap so I felt like if I had any shot at enjoying filtered water over bottled water, I would have to go with a top of the line filter. It‚Äôs soooooo worth it!!!! Our water tastes great now, no weird flavor at all anymore. And the best part is that over the course of 6 months (the life of the filter) it will actually end up saving us money since we don‚Äôt need to buy bottles anymore. If you‚Äôre hesitant about the high end price, just remember you really do get what you pay for.

This filter is more expensive than others but is rated to last 6 months. If that is accurate, the price seems alright considering the alternatives.

Changing out the first filter on my fridge was painful. However, it is relatively easy to put the new one in. You are supposed to flush out a couple gallons of water before you start using it. If you notice particulates in the water, it's possible you haven't flushed enough water through the filter.

Taste has been great. I was surprised to notice neutral flavor in the water that came out. Did not have any tap water taste to it. This is a great replacement to using water bottles. Average human drinks 8 cups of water per day. If you only drink bottled water, you are spending around $18 a month, which translates to over $100 for 6 months (Yes, I did the math lol). Since this water filter costs around $50, you are definitely getting your money's worth.

Overall, while this filter is more expensive than others, it does a great job and for a long period of time.

Thank goodness for Amazon overnight! Installing new filter fixed my water dispenser. It would be better if there were instructions with product on how to install. I watched a helpful YT video. You really have to line up the slots, push hard and turn (to the right I think) - it took a couple of tries before it locked in and worked. It made kind of a hissing sound so that is how you will know.
This product is as advertised and works really well. I received the package really quickly and within 1 - 2 days after ordering it.

In July 2022, we purchased two #4 water filters for our Whirlpool refrigerator, and they were a slight bit too short and would not stay in place. In comparison, they were exactly alike, and we have not had trouble with the others bought locally. I'm not sure where these came from, but I won't be ordering anymore of these filters from Amazon. I'll have to pay more for them locally, but I've spent $99 on these two which I can't get back.
Brand name filter for Kitchen Aid water and ice. Just like I can get at Lowe's!
Very easy to install, clean water very good value

Works great in my Kitchenaid fridge. No leaks. Makes my water taste better by filtering out the chlorine taste. While it's kind of expensive, we use the fridge water for nearly 100% of our water consumption and $50 is not too much to pay every 6 months for good tasting water.
This is the filter that fits our fridge. It is FANTASTIC that we can get them on AMAZON. Works well and does a good job. Be sure to bleed the air out of the line after you install it.
WORKS GREAT! MY WATER TASTES MUCH BETTER.

reviews.content: I recently purchased the Chemical Guys Professional Grade Premium Microfiber Towels and while they are good, I haven't found them to be any different than any other microfiber towel I have used in the past. They are soft and absorbent, and safe for use on my car, in my home, and for drying my pets. The size of 16x16 inches is a good size for most tasks, and the pack of 12 towels provides a good value for the price. However, I haven't noticed any significant difference in quality or performance when compared to other microfiber towels I have used in the past. If you're in the market for some microfiber towels and you like the brand Chemical Guys, then these towels might be a good choice for you. But if you're looking for something that stands out from the crowd, or for better value, you might want to consider other options.

I hand wash, using 2 bucket method my 991.2gt3, and use an air cannon to dry it. I never touch my baby without lubrication. If you love your car, then never touch it without lubrication. Using your dry finger, even your cotton t-shirt, can scratch clear coat. So never touch your baby without lubrication. After you accept that, and realize to avoid scratches, you want to use microfiber towels. I've used these towels and they work very well. Rip off the tags of them to prevent them from scratching the paint. Spray your favorite lubricant on these to wipe any extra residue off the car. I use Ammo products. I won't use any other towel than these on my car, and my car is IG worthy. I am on IG. But I don't like using IG, nor TkTk, because those apps will literally make you lose IQ points if you spend too much time on it. If I ever need any more of these great microfiber towels, I would definitely purchase them from this seller.

A friend of mine who details high end cars professionally sent me one of these . WOW ! I am so impressed how they work ! Not only on cars but around the house !
I also bought Chemical Guy‚Äôs laundry soap for microfiber towels . That too is awesome . Remember to wash your towels with this and NO FABRIC SOFTENER ! It will ruin the absorption of the towels and leave residue .

Ps . I am a retired school teacher who loves a clean car !
Chemical Guy‚Äôs are the best !

These work great to remove wax from your car. After applying the wax and allowing it to cure for a few minutes, use the microfibers to buff out the wax. The plush, absorbent side is good for wiping stuff down, but use the other side to remove the wax. They last a super long time if you clean and take care of them. I don‚Äôt recommend them for cleaning heavy dirt, because it will stain them. It‚Äôs more of a finishing towel for light cleaning after you do the wash and dry with other towels.

Chemical guys microfiber thicks & durables good to use except the material feel same as walmart microfiber. Will leave behind few lint small pieces you will see under lights. Just wash before you use. Also the product says it for professional & premium towels came with tag???? Are you kidding with me. I have to spent 40 minutes to removed all of these tags
I always come back to this was mit just the best bang for your buck last for ever (if you keep good care of it) the bag it comes in is great for storage to keep it clean
I trust the Chemical Guys" brand and these towels bear that out. Good quality at a reasonable price.
I bought these after reading a review in Car & Driver. Very good clothes that work better than all I‚Äôve tried. Not too expensive each if you buy the larger packages.
These work good I bought them for drying my car mostly but do good with ceramic coats
Only complaint about this item is, its hard to remove and dirt or little particles even after washing. Other than that its great

Remove any objects that could get in the way of your project as it feeds out of the machine

	

Let the laminator do its thing!

Avoid pulling or obstructing the pouch as it feeds through the laminator
Your project will be hot when it exits the machine so use caution

reviews.content: These pouches are excellent! I've purchased a dozen packs over time, haven't ever had a problem with them and the price is right. I use the Scotch laminator as well. Laminating pouches that really work! No bubbles or creases. Great for home and office.

Better than what I am supplied with at work.
These work extremely well. I buy these over and over again.

This is one of the better deals I‚Äôve seen on this product. Most stores will charge you an obscene amount of money for a few slips. This lasts a very long time. It also is far better in quality. I needed it for the time being didn‚Äôt feel like sending it back . All of it seem to come with some little tiny dust thingy in it and it‚Äôs hard to come off being that it‚Äôs on the sticky part

I buy these for my preschoolers so they can have traceable worksheets, and I laminate a lot of crafts. I have never had one issue with these sheets.
