reviews.content:
I really like most aspect of this lamp, except for the timer.

First the good....
This lamp is very sturdy and has the Best gooseneck that I've every seen on a lamp. It is NOT the limp gooseneck you see on other lamps where you place the lamp in position, then it slowly Wilts like a dying flower. NOPE! This has a strong firm gooseneck that stays PUT exactly wherer you position it. If you're using this for plants, this is a must because you need exact positioning to illuminate your plants so they will get the light they need. This lamp WILL ALLOW that Perfect Placement so your plants will thrive.

The clip is very strong is should solidly attach the lamp to a table, shelf, or other surface the the clip can grab. I was suprised at the heavy duty clip. You should never have any attachment problem with this lamp.

I purchased the 50 watt version. I was suprised at how BRIGHT this lower wattage version really is. Glad I didn't order the 100 watt because it would have been too bright. Even with 50 watts, you must turn away to keep it from hurting your eyes.

Seller Customer Service is GREAT. My first lamp was defective. The selleer answered my query immediately and shipped a new lamp right away. I had the new lamp in only a few days. The seller is exceptional in customer service.

Now for the Negative....

The timeer function.
This timer works, but it may not work as you expected.
In product description, here is how the timer function is described:
"Timer Function & Multiple Settings - this growing light offer the circular memory timer function with 3 options-4h/8h/12h. When keeping power, it can automatically turn on and off every day according your settings, no more manual operation for you."

I expected that whatever time period you set would be repeated an an ON/OFF cycle forever (until you remove power from the lamp). NOT TRUE!
What I expected is that once you set the timer the lamp would but ON for the timer period, then OFF for the timer period, then ON for the timer period... etc. etc. etc.

This lamp doe NOT work this way!!! It is based on a 24 hour cycle from the time you set the timer. For example, if you set a 4 hour timer it will turn ON immediately for 4 hours, then shut to OFF.
It will remain OFF for the next 20 hours until the next day when the time that you set the timer rolls around. Then, on Day 2, it wil burn for 4 hours then turn OFF.

Each time period you select on the timer function will ONLY turn ON for that period ONCE every 24 hours. The cycle is 24 hours. It does NOT cycle ON and OFF per the time period you select on the lamp.

If you select 4 hours, it only turns ON for 4 hours per 24 hours.
If you select 8 hours, it only turns ON for 8 hours per 24 hours.
If you select 12 hours, it turns ON for 12 hours per 24 hours.

The lamp turns ON starting at the exact time when your originally set the timer.

I would have otherwise given this lamp 5 stars, but had to knock off a star for the weird operation of the timer function. Now, I probably would not have knocked off a star if the product description in Amazon had actually EXPLAINED how the timer works. Even the instructions that come with the lamp do NOT explain that the lamp operates on a 24 hour cycle and will ONLY burn ONCE per 24 hour period..

Other than this lack of explanation on the product page and the same shortcoming in the included instructions, this is really a great lamp and will earn a Five Star rating from most buyers.

Awesome ad Easy..
Just a "Plug and Play" set up!
( Find your Plants that need some extra sunlight, either Clamp onto the shelf/table, Plug into power power outlet! Push a the button for amount of Time you want, Done! )
Plus, this Light does have the smarts, as long as it stays plug in! Next day, it will turn back on, at the same time you had set it, for the same amount so time you set it for, shut off, and do it again, every day untill it loses power for what ever reason!
Do need to say - My 1st unit, worked as it should. For several weeks it worked as it should. However for reasons I don't know yet, it stopped working... While I was away for 10-12 days...(My Orchids not happy!!!) I tried every USB charger I have in the house... I could not get this to turn back on... A simple email to the Seller explaining the issues that I am dealing with Fixed my issue! About 2 days latter a new unit was on the porch!
Now 2nd unit is working just fine, as it should!
Seller does Seem to care, and fix my issues, without any hassle! Which I am looking at another light or 2 for the Office plants, (New office has no windows..)
In Short am rather happy again, and so are the Orchids...

I really do love this light. The arms are solid - I recently purchased another light with similar arm which is not nearly as firm as these are so these are much better. The clamp is great.

My only complaint is the timer. It works fine and as intended but I hate that every single light on the market like this comes with this exact same timer which limits the ability to be plugged into a smart switch for use. When turned on, you can set the time to 4, 8, or 12 hours - so for now I set mine for 4 hours starting at 8:30 am and it does this consistently every day just fine. In the event that that schedule doesn't work for me and I need to alter it, I basically have to reset everything and start all over again. This light is in the living room so if I'm watching a moving or something and wanted to turn it off due to how bright it is, yup, starting over again. I wish there was a timer-free option for this listing. I would buy several more of these.

The natural lighting in my apt isn‚Äôt ideal. I‚Äôve had plants do ok for about 1-2 years but for some reason this year they all gave up and started looking really bad; no longer thriving. This grow light, while not the most beautiful addition to my home decor (next time I‚Äôll get a white one so it doesn‚Äôt clash so much with my furniture), has been a great help. It did take a few weeks of daily use to see much improvement, but my plants eventually started looking better and even new leaves have appeared that had not grown in years! The Chinese money plant in the photos lost 75% of its leaves and I was so excited to see new babies forming. I‚Äôve been rotating the plants too so the leaves look even, as they do start angling towards the light! The instructions don‚Äôt make it clear, but this light will also turn on at the same time each day on its own, so you don‚Äôt have to worry about going on vacation!

We have a lot of plants that we usually keep on our porch during the summer. With winter coming, we knew that we'd have to bring them all inside. While some of these plants are kept close to windows and tend to get enough sunlight to keep them going, that's not the case with some others. For those, we needed lights. I stumbled upon this unit during my search and decided to order one just to see how well it would work.

Our light was delivered right on time, and within a few minutes of opening the box we had it casting a glow over one of our most struggling plants. Not much to the light, really: there's twin flexible rods that can be bent in order to direct each light to where it's needed, and those rods stay in place very well. The rods are anchored to a plastic clip, much like you'd find on a small desk fan. This clip has a firm hold with non-slip pads on the gripper, and gives you tons of options for where you'd like to position the light--not happy with where you put it? It's very easy to move. The power cord terminates in a standard USB plug, and comes with a wall adapter.

The power switch is located on the cord itself and comes with a few features. Of course there's the standard on/off positions, but there's also a dimmer: you don't have to use the light at full brightness if you're using it on a plant that prefers indirect sunlight. There's also a built-in timer that's pretty convenient, if a bit limited. You can use this timer to run the lights for 12-hours, say, after which the light will turn itself off, then turn itself back on after 12 hours of darkness. There's also four-hour and eight-hour modes if those suit your needs better. Losing power, at least on the unit I tested the idea with, will also lose your timer settings--so it might be a good idea to use a programable timer instead. However, at this price point, it's hard to complain too much about what is still a nice touch.

The light produced is a clean and crisp white light, despite the presence of dedicated red LED diodes. Your plants will get the spectrum they use the most while you'll be able to appreciate their natural beauty. When I saw some of our leaves "reaching" for the bulb after a few days, that told me all I needed to know about whether the lights were going to be effective. I ordered a second set, which was also delivered promptly and has identical build quality.

Now there's a third set on the way.

So yeah, I recommend them!

I love this light! Able to clip it onto table surfaces or place it somewhere where it can stand. You get two lamps that are flexible and very bright, so its easy to use just one of these for multiple plants. When the winter came, putting my indoor chamomile plants on the window sill wasn't giving them enough light, so I needed to find a source of artificial light that was bright enough. This was exactly what I needed. They are thriving now.

Best part is, you can plug this into basically ANY USB port. Even one on your computer if it comes down to it. It is very energy efficient and portable because of this.

I got this to supplement one bulb that was failing on one of my large fluorescent hanging grow light. The bulb wasn't available in town and to ship I thought was too much so figured I'd just get my third one on here. Stronger than the 4 head gooseneck one I have, and about the same as the lone insert in soil led goose one. I have it set for 8 hours and it's doing its job. Let's see how long it lasts before it kicks the bucket. I literally clamped it to the thin rope holding up the other large grow light then let it hang next to it, with the duo parallel with the flourescents. I put a old kid sock up there to cover up the control panel lights because plants prefer fully dark conditions, unless it's stars in the high distance

I recently got into plants when I got my my baby bonsai about 4 months ago. From there it‚Äôs been a never ending rabbit hole. My plants started to look a bit sad so looked into lighting and got this bad boy. Man when I say all of my plants did a complete 180! I purchased the 100w setup. The lights are really bright and the timer makes my life much easier with my work schedule. Supper easy to use, compact and cost effective. One thing I was originally concerned about was not having enough red LEDs but they are more than strong enough especially for your big leaf plants.

Things to note:
With the brightness comes heat and as you all may know heat and LEDs don‚Äôt mix and these lights can get pretty hot. So to preserve the light, I try to keep a fan near by just to cool the lights off a bit. I also lower the light intensity so it isn‚Äôt at max all the time. (Disclaimer: The heat has not caused any issues at all and only doing this to preserve the LEDs.)

Really happy with this purchase and plan on buy another one to grow my collection.

Update: after unplugging and replugging several times, it magically began working again and has for over a week. Hopefully it stays!

My husband got me two sets of these lights for Christmas to cover four shelves on the bookcase where I have my plants for winter. I set them up on 12/27 and was initially very happy with them. A few days later I had the chance to play with them and apply the timers, so I had them set to turn on and off together. On 1/11 I noticed one had not come on several hours after it should have, so I turned it on manually and set it for the same amount of time. 1/12, that light again did not come on with the timer, but when I attempted to power it on manually nothing would happen. I have unplugged, moved around, jiggled, etc but it will not come back on. I hope this is a fluke because the other one seems to work just fine so far deposits being shipped together, plugged into the same power source, and experiencing all the same conditions, but fluke or not, failure after just two weeks of use is very disappointing.

I bought two of these, primarily to use for propagation, and for this purpose they work very well. The timer is reliable, the arms are easily adjusted and the brightness settings allow for propagating, and for giving the carnivorous plants the low light levels they need to get through winter dormancy in good shape. They do not work so well for larger plants, however and there was no way to adjust the lights to cover an entire plant (although the light should be just enough to keep them alive in a poorly lit area). This limits their use somewhat but they are still a very good option for small plants..the Pothos I‚Äôm propagating are thriving. Definitely worth getting for very young or small plants

Timer Function & Multiple Settings - this growing light offer the circular memory timer function with 3 options-4h/8h/12h. When keeping power, it can automatically turn ON/OFF in a 24-hour period according your settings, no more manual operation for you.

name: Rain-X RX30226 WeatherBeater All-Season OEM Quality Conventional Windshield Wiper Blade - 26" (Pack of 1)
description:
From the manufacturer
Rain‚ÄëX Weatherbeater Wiper Blades

Provide a smooth, clean, streak-free wipe by using embedded friction reducers and multiple pressure points.

90% of driving decisions are based on vision while the environment breaks down blades in 6-12 months

	

	

	



Sun

Ultraviolet light and ozone deterioration both both have dramatic effects on your blades.

	
Oil

Car waxes, repellants, and exhaust hold rubber-deteriorating oil that deteriorate your blades.

	
Airborne debris

Sand, mud and dust carried in the wind can wear down and damage your blades.

	
Moisture

Acid rain and salt water (in moist air both near the shore and inland) affect your blades over time.




Rain-X Weatherbeater Wiper Blades
No matter the conditions, Rain‚ÄëX blades will help prepare you for the unexpected.

Long lasting durability: Defined by a galvanized steel frame that prevents rust and corrosion.

All natural squeegee rubber: Resists cracking, splitting, and tearing caused by heat, cold, windshield wiper fluid and salt.

High quality traditional blade: Meets or exceeds all original equipment manufacturers‚Äô standards.

Multiple pressure points: Enables even pressure distribution across entire length of blade.

Embedded friction reducers: Helps deliver a smooth, clean wipe.

Quick and easy to install: Pre-installed with small j-hook adapter and contains multi-adapter for side pin, large j-hook, and bayonet wiper blade arms.

Two out of three drivers are using potentially unsafe wipers, please check your blades today

	

	

	



Skipping

Skipping occurs when the blade develops a curvature from lack of use (e.g. left in the ‚Äòparked position‚Äô for an extended length of time).

	
Streaking

Streaking occurs when the rubber squeegee dries, hardens and cracks. It can also be caused by tree sap, road tar and other foreign substances collected on either the glass or the blade.

	
Splitting

Splitting is caused when the sun‚Äôs ultraviolet rays penetrate the rubber squeegee, causing it to breakdown and separate from the frame.

	
Squeaking

Squeaking and chattering occur due to normal wear and tear or extensive use. A bent frame can also be the culprit as the frame has inconsistent contact with the glass surface.

reviews.content: These wipers were half the price as in an auto parts store. They were delivered quickly and were easy to install. I can turn them on with the dry windshield, and they make no noise. In the rain they are far superior to what was on my 2012 Ford F150 4x4. Great produce better price....

My windshield is over 20 years old. I hadgiven up on getting any wipers to clean it 100% with all the micro pits in it. In just one use, I see perfectly clearly in the rain for the first time in decades.

Can‚Äôt beat receiving car accessories right to your door without having to go into an automotive store. I Googled what size I needed for my car type and ordered them up. They work great and were easy to install. Price was the same as Walmart or Target. No downside to buying this product. Will order again.
Exact same product sold in big box stores, but a few dollars cheaper online, than in store. Have no complaints thusfar. Wipers work and fit fine for my 2015 Ram 1500.

These are so physically and emotionally PAINFUL to install. I needed to watch a whole video and it was still unclear. I was helped by people in the comments.

RainX needs to leave BOTH adapters loose in the pack. Getting the first off and then adding back the second was a nightmare. One came off easily, the other took 20 min and a screwdriver (and preying I didn't break them. My hands hurt so bad. I had to use leather gloves to pull and push on the sharp metal parts.

Then there was actually figuring out how to get it on the hook. I got there eventually but I think I spent 45 min on all this! Now that they're on they are working way better than my old warped set. I still see a dash of streaking but it goes away almost immediately. Hopefully won't be a big deal.

Hot tip: before you throw away your old wipers, swipe the squeegee down with rubbing alcohol over and over until the cloth becomes clean. So much gunk will come off and they'll work way better. The gunk adds to the streaks.

I have had my Mercedes for 33 years and these are the first wiper blades that have worked and are quiet.
Will buy again when needed and for all my other vehicles.
In the southeast where rain can frequently be a deluge, I must have a wiper blade that can handle the elements. Uniform across the visual fields in clearing the windshield.

They are great blades. The one issue I had with them was the passenger side short blade. The correct blade side for the Hyundai Elantra Sport is 26" for Drivers Side but 14" for the passenger side. I had to redo the connector so that I could use the 16" Blade. In the future I will order the 2 blades seperate that way I will be able to get the correct fit.
Went to my local auto parts store and the price was double what I paid here. Great product as well for your money.
Fairly easy to install. It does what it‚Äôs supposed to. I will buy it again when I need to replace my blades.

name: SAMSUNG Genuine Filter for Refrigerator Water and Ice, Carbon Block Filtration, Removes 99% of Harmful Contaminants for Clean, Clear Drinking Water, 6-Month Life, HAF-QIN/EXP, 1 Pack
description: From the manufacturer

reviews.content:
** UPDATED ON 2/16/2023 **
Changing to 5 stars because it started making ice again when I emptied the ice bucket. I guess it was a sensor that stopped from making more ice and not because of water filter.

** ORIGINAL REVIEW **
I have a Samsung bi-door refrigerator that has automatic ice maker inside but without water fountain. I was able to replace it easily without turning off the water and didn't have any leak but it doesn't appear to make ice anymore... I did notice that old filter was much heavier than this new one and I'm guessing because it collected minerals and other stuff inside the filter. I will have to figure out why it's not making the ice anymore but it does seem to be authentic and genuine filter and I didn't have any water leaking problem after replacing it as other people have indicated... Will update once I figure out what's going on with my ice maker...

BE AWARE - somehow fake filters are being shipped as genuine!

I have ordered 3 filters using this listing.
The first one last July, was a genuine filter, installed no problem.
(That's why I'm giving the PRODUCT 4 stars).

The second one, received 2/10, was a fake - no authenticator tag, no QR code, and it didn't even fit into the fridge. It looked like someone had tried to file it down to make it fit, as well.

The third unit I ordered last night for overnight delivery, and I'm using it for comparison (it fits & works).

In addition to the Authenticator Tag missing on the fake filter, I also found 2 other differences on the box itself to help distinguish FAKE from GENUINE - no QR code sticker on front of box, and the last line says "For use in system DA97-08006C" on the Fake. The Genuine one has a QR Sticker and the last line says "For use in system DA97-08006C-A".

I have returned the FAKE unit and attached the information to the outside & inside of the Fake Box.

BE AWARE!

I wanted so desperately to not have to pay full price for this and looked into SO many other options for our model # and such.. after scouring the internet and combing through every review (dramatic? Maybe lol), we came to the conclusion it was just not worth it getting an off brand product. So many people had such a hard time with leaking and breaking and twisting problems. Every year for a Black Friday sale is when we‚Äôll get an new filter because I still love a discount lol

Are you someone that has read a lot about the Samsung filters not working with your refrigerator or leaking unexpectedly? I was extremely worried about that and when we got a new Samsung refrigerator I was dreading the time when the filter needed to be replaced. I went so far as to try and find sellers that could verify the production code on the side of the filter so I can make sure it's the exact same production lot as the filter that came with our refrigerator. It's possible to do that but not easy. I looked at the reviews of this listing and took a chance. Much to my satisfaction the filter was an authentic Samsung filter and came with the authentication sticker on the box and on the filter. It fit perfectly in my refrigerator and installed in seconds. If you have a Samsung refrigerator, I do recommend following the instructions to shut off the water so there's no pressure because it does make the filter harder to install. Bottom line, this listing sells genuine Samsung filters and will work with your refrigerator. I recommend you buy it from Amazon versus a third party seller that might be offering it for slightly cheaper.

I was skeptical about this Samsung filter being authentic, but it came with everything that a Samsung filter from BestBuy would come with. I was genuinely pleased. It was an exact match to the original filter in my fridge. Installation was easy, but resetting the fridge so the bright red "filter" sign inside the fridge was the biggest challenge of all lolol. Overall, if this was cheaper, I would've bought more filters from Amazon. It's pretty much the same price as other competitors.

I read a lot of reviews saying the filter doesn't fit. I turned old filter counter clockwise and pulled it out. Easy. You put the new one in and it just will not pop in. The tabs just will not line up. It was maddening. My wife tries, turns the filter 1/4 turn counter clock wise while pushing in. It goes in!! Now you turn it clockwise and your done. This took 30 attempts to figure this out. Good luck.
Works well with my Samsung refrigerator.
Fits perfectly, follow the instructions.
Easy install and replacement filter
This was easy to replace exsisting.

reviews.content:
Back in the 20th century we all relied on jumper cables and the help of a neighbor or friendly stranger to jump start our dead battery from their vehicle. It worked, but was not without issues. How long before someone came along who was willing to help? Did ether of you have a long enough jumper cable in your car? Was your battery accessible to connect to the other vehicle? How dangerous was it to rely on strangers to help?

Well it‚Äôs a new century and the technology has greatly improved. With the Noco series of small and powerful jump start power packs we no longer need the help of another vehicle. If our battery is too weak to start the car, a simple, safe, and foolproof option is waiting to help. Just attach the cables to the battery. There will be no sparks because the Noco has no electricity flowing until you turn it on. And you can‚Äôt make a mistake. If you connect the cables to the wrong battery terminals, the Noco will not send out power and will alert you to your mistake. Once correctly connected, just turn on the Noco power button. It tests your battery and itself for voltage. You will see a display of lights telling you how much reserve power the Noco has available to jump start the car. If it can‚Äôt make an accurate determination, just press the boost button to force the Noco to use its full potential. Now that was easy. So, just sit in the driver‚Äôs seat and turn the key to start the car. If you don‚Äôt have other issues, like being out of gas the car will roar to a start from the strong power coming from the Noco. Let the car run while you turn off the Noco, disconnect the cables and store it away for the next time it‚Äôs needed. Under most circumstances, you should be able to jump start a car up to six times before needing to recharge the Noco from your home wall outlet.

The main reason to buy this product is that it greatly empowers you to solve a weak or dead battery problem. No need for others to help. No waiting, you‚Äôre back on the road again in minutes. This model, the GB40 is suitable for most gasoline cars. Consider a larger capacity model for diesel engines, trucks, and locations where sub-freezing temperatures are the norm.

I have had a Noco jump start battery pack for eight years. It has never failed me. I‚Äôve stopped and helped many stranded drivers along the roadside. I‚Äôve given these as gifts to family and friends. They are safe, reliable, and easy to use for any driver without the need for any automobile knowledge. If you can find your battery, you can get back on the road all by yourself in minutes. As the title says‚Ä¶ DON‚ÄôT LEAVE HOME WITHOUT IT.

Edit:
I made it back out to the farm and the ATV battery was still dead. I hooked the jump starter to it and this time pressed the override for a few seconds and it did go into override mode. The ATV did turn over and I eventually got it started with a little assist from some ether. Updated to 4 stars.

Original review:
I have owned this jump starter for a little over 4 years and only needed it a handful of times. It is so strange when it'll work and when it won't. In trying to recall the times I needed it, one was the same year I bought it, 2018. A fill-in pharmacist we had that day went to leave after her shift and her car wouldn't start. I had come back to the store to get something, so I offered to help. I don't recall what it was, maybe an Acura or some other foreign branded car. It would not start her car, so I pulled over my ugly truck and used jumper cables and got her going. I've used it on a couple of riding mowers OK. A woman was stuck in the parking lot where I worked, ended up her alternator was shot so it did no good to jump her car, however, it did work after several tries. It was a small SUV like an Olds Bravada I think. This past fall I tried using it on an 04 Artic Cat 400 ATV and it wouldn't even try, nothing. The unit wouldn't let me even do the override function. Then we come to last night (Dec 22) and it was crazy cold. It was -9F with a wind chill of about -33F by 6pm. I go to start my truck and it could barely turn over then nothing. I grab the starter and figure I'll try it anyway. It took a couple of tries but it actually started and I was able to get home with frozen fingers, super cold. I plugged it in after several hours of warming to inside temp and the 100% bulb was the only one flashing, so it was still mostly charged.

I have kept it charged up, so I don't believe that to be the cause of not working in the past. I don't know if it's a vehicle issue with some sort of safety in the vehicle side, but why wouldn't it start an 18 year old ATV, your guess is as good as mine. Perhaps I didn't press and hold the override button until it engaged, I'll test that again.

I recommend buying a case for it to protect it from getting activated when not needed, and it's a convenient way to store the starter, cables, USB cable, and car charger adapter all in one place. Mine is by a company called Khanka. A quick glance didn't show it being sold anymore but there are other kinds available.

It allows charging of other items like you would with a battery bank and has a flashlight with several different modes. I like that it comes as a small package and mostly seems to work except the couple times it didn't. Perhaps there are other, possibly more reliable, options out there but not sure if they could be this small. Thanks for reading!

I never write reviews but this started the car on the 1st try-- when I went to start it today the battery was dead -- ordered NOCO GB40 on Amazon Prime before 10am and the unit was delivered same day before 3pm and the Car is running before 8pm.

Summary
After the 3 hours of charging the GB40 in the house -- the remaining steps to start the car took less than 3 minutes. There may be something cheaper in Amazon that is supposed to do the same thing but it is hard to believe that there is anything better.

Very easy to get the car running
Step 1 charge GB40 for about 3 hours in the house with USB charger (First time charge)
Step 2 plug in the terminal clamps to the GB40
Step 3 Connect to terminal clamps to battery and power up GB40
Step 4 When GB cannot detect completely dead battery -- press override button on GB40
Step 5 Start car
Step 6 turn off GB40 and disconnect terminal battery clamps.

The back story if it matters -- My 2007 Mustang GT is in the garage all winter under the cover -- there is a small phantom drain on the battery from some electrical circuit in the car -- very difficult to track it down. With this said, I have a device that should prevent the battery from being drained below starting voltage (Priority Start). The Priority Start device works 100% of the time during the summer and I'm very grateful to have that as a safety net while driving the car around town -- winter storage not so much.

Have had this device for about 6 months and just had to use it today. Had been keeping it in the car, but may change that after today. Went to start car this morning during a cold snap (<0¬∞F) and the battery just didn't have the juice to get the car started. Car had been sitting for a few days prior. Pulled this out of the back seat verified it had a full charge and connected to battery. This initially did not have much effect. Verified terminals attached correctly, verified the box had power and noticed what started as full power was now showing about 75% brought it inside and charged it back to full power for a few hours (during which time Temps climbed to 10¬∞F), reread instructions and realized maybe to try the boost option if needed. Once fully charged attached to battery before making an attempt to start and let sit for about a minute. Car started right up without even having to utilize the boost. Moving forward during the colder months I may keep it inside and just toss it in a bag when leaving to use the car as it did seem to work much better once warmed up a bit

This thing is amazing, never again jump a car the old conventional way sitting there reving up the engine. This thing doesn‚Äôt matter even if your battery doesn‚Äôt work at all won‚Äôt hold charger or dead for years this little and convenient device will start that car in a second. Unbelievable I don‚Äôt know how they pack so much power in such a small and convenient device, easy to carry and use holds its charger for so long . I have it for months already and still connect to the car and it sparks up like magic. Don‚Äôt know how they can make this high quality device for such a low price of under $100. Amazing . If you need more and didn‚Äôt understand my review, Ten out of Ten, 2 thumbs up, you can‚Äôt afford to not have one of these specially if you have a special car that you only use on special occasions and don‚Äôt start it up much you need this device. Trust me you won‚Äôt regret it.

I was very skeptical about this item when I ordered it, but I had burned out my battery charger and needed a more reliable alternative. Since the beginning of COVID and with working remotely, my car time has been reduced by 90%, and when you're not using your car often the battery tends to lose its charge. Factor in the very cold weather we have had recently in Texas and if you are not starting your car at least every other day and circling the block, your battery is going to die on you. And always when you need to be somewhere in a hurry.

This jump box is very compact and easy to use. The first time it didn't work and I figured I had just lost my money. But after reading the instructions (imagine that), the device may not recognize you've hooked it up to a battery if the battery is completely flat and won't make the circuit. Pushing the override button solved the problem and the car started up immediately.

So far this winter, I have had to use this twice and both times the car has started without any issues. And the jump box still has a full charge on it. This is the best investment I have made this year and plan to give out as gifts to family members for that "just in case" moment.

First of all I am mechanically challenged but this was so easy to use that if my dog had opposable thumbs she could use it! My 2005 Ford Escape truck had a completely dead battery. I had not used it in two years. I followed the directions I found on YouTube and my truck started in less than a minute. I was so happy I drove it around ( I knew I had to because of the battery being so depleted.) but I also was just happy to be riding in it again. I confess while filling the tires I even bragged to a stranger about the charger. He asked me about it and was amazed when I told him. I bet he will be buying one. I can honestly say I never used anything that was so easy to charge a truck/ car battery. I highly recommend!!I can tell you rarely do I give products I have bought this much praise. You will not be disappointed. I am so impressed I can barely contain my enthusiasm. I am taking my beloved old truck to my mechanic so I can once more drive ‚Äú her‚Äù around and smile. Thank you Noco Boost Plus!

Hanging onto my old 03 Element and it doesn't see much action anymore living in a city metro area. Still has to get moved and even when it's frigid cold, this little thing has us happy! Got it as a holiday gift for my husband and for me - He jumps the car with the boost setting in moments for quick, easy start and move of the car, and then I get the joy of him being so happy that it took 5 minutes instead of 25.

We haven't left it in the car given it's targeted use, however we do also keep it in his car when he's driving any distance just in case. Our local temps can be anywhere from -10 to 110 depending on time of year. Seeing some of the questions that were posted for this, I wouldn't suggest just leaving it in the car all the time no matter the weather, unless it's mild. At any rate, this thing has been a huge help for us when it's called for. Used it about once a week the last 3 months and only charged it twice. Great life on it.

I purchased this for my 65 year old sister. She had an electrical problem in an old Suzuki, and has used it on a weekly basis to jump start that vehicle (I've replaced it now, with an Accord). As I explained to her, keeping a lithium battery in your vehicle is not a good idea, they like the same conditions you do. They don't like cold or extreme heat, they like the same temperatures you do. She kept it in her purse, and as I've indicated, used it on a regular basis until I gave her my old Honda Accord. The Honda also has a battery that is really too small (weight savings for fuel economy, it is after all lead). She once again had to use it when the Honda battery died, and pulled it out and after 6 years and hundreds of uses, started first try. NOCO did a good job with this, don't leave it in your car, and it won't let you down.

Finally got to use this after years of sitting in trunk. Had to recharge for a few hours again first which is sad on my part for not topping it off every few months. Car started as if the battery was fine. The one drawback which does not detract from rating is the clamp leads from boosting pack to battery are like 8 inches or so. I think they would be better at 18 inches. It worked but had to good place to lay it down next to the battery. I do understand that the more wire between the source and destination, that detracts from the power yeild but just saying. Am soooo glad I bought this product!!!!!!

The review question says there is a light. there isn't one.

name: Misxi 2 Pack Hard PC Case with Tempered Glass Screen Protector Compatible with Apple Watch Series 6 SE Series 5 Series 4 44mm, Black
description: Product Description

reviews.content: I bought this but I wasn‚Äôt planning on using it all the time since I didn‚Äôt want to take away from the beauty of my mew Apple Watch Ultra. I planned on carrying it around in my pocket and only putting it on when I went outside to do work. That all changed when I put it on and saw how perfectly it fit. I thought it was going to look all big and clunky but it actually looks so good I just left it on. All the buttons still work perfectly and I didn‚Äôt lose any sensitivity when swiping on the screen. They drilled little holes for the speaker so it didn‚Äôt lose any sound quality. They also drilled little holes in all 4 corners so the mics in the watch can still hear your voice commands. It is a little harder to roll the crown up and down but the push sensitivity stayed the same. That is probably my only complaint about this watch cover that I can think of but there‚Äôs not much the manufacturer could change to make it more accessible and still be protected. If you are looking to fully protect your Apple Watch Ultra I would absolutely recommend this watch cover vs just getting a screen protector. Even though this watch is titanium and has sapphire glass it will still get dinged up if you watch YouTube stress tests people have done on it. I want to keep my watch looking as brand new as possible and this cover gives it complete protection.

Since I dropped my previous Apple Watch, and the glass shuttered (and I didn't get any money back when I purchased a new watch), I reluctantly started using a protective case. The issue is that, with the case, we lose the superb touch sensitivity which makes Apple Watch awesome. I tried a few cases before, but this one is by far the best among what I tried so far, in terms of touch sensitivity. This is the first time when I feel like I can use Apple Watch as if there is no protective cover. The only think I wish it were different is that I wish the edge of the screen not as sharp (not too sharp but not round either) and mimic the round form of the original touch screen. We'll see if it is scratch resistant, or how well the case protects my watch (I have been using less the a week so far), but so far I love it.

I got my Apple Watch last month and have been worried about smacking it against things as I tend to be a bit clumsy!

Looked at several different ‚Äúcases‚Äù and this one had the best reviews so decided to give it a try! It arrived today and so far, so good. It was easy to snap on and I like that it doesn‚Äôt hinder changing the bands out as I like to change them often, depending on what I‚Äôm wearing.

It adds just a minimal amount of bulk to the watch but barely noticeable, if you didn‚Äôt know you had a case on it. The touchscreen seems to be responding exactly as it did without it - I was worried about that but no issues whatsoever. I really like the peace of mind it offers should I hit my arm on something. Hope it holds up over time!

I put one of these on my wife‚Äôs Apple Watch (Series 2), and I can say that they are great protection! The touch screen functionality was pretty good, but just make sure you clean the watch face really well before installing it. Also, it was easy to install.

She dropped the watch in between the door and seat of my SUV, and closed the door without realizing it was down there. It was really windy that day, so there was a little extra oomph with the door slam. After hearing the crunch, I was like, ‚ÄúWell that‚Äôs gone.‚Äù

When I pulled it out, I saw the cracked protector, but the watch was perfectly fine! Definitely worth the $$

I bought this like a day after I bought my Apple Watch because I am definitely the clumsy type. I am so glad I did! I took my watch off to wash dishes and I accidentally dropped it faced down onto the granite and noticed after that this screen protector/case was cracked, but my watch was/is perfectly fine! It‚Äôs even better that it comes in a pack of 2, because that allowed me to just swap it out for the new 1. I am already considering ordering another 1 just to have on hand in case I end up needing to replace this 1 eventually. My one and only issue is that sometimes water/moisture will end up getting under it, but I just quickly take it off and wipe and place it back on.

I really didn‚Äôt want to add a case but I‚Äôm clumsy and don‚Äôt want to scratch or break the screen.
Came with two and wipes for both. Easy to use. Secures well and looks nice. Not super bulky. Doesn‚Äôt have an impact on the touchscreen which is really important to me. Also doesn‚Äôt distort the screen. Be sure to remove both the front and back protective sheets. Only on day one but so far I‚Äôm happy! Would recommend trying if you need a protective case for your Apple Watch.

I avoided getting an Apple watch for a long time afraid I would quickly destroy it. When I saw these protective covers I decided to go for it. They don't change the look of the watch, they did not scratch easily and they did not interfere with the touch screen performance and today the cover saved my watch from real damage. It's nice and warm so I opened my bee hives to make sure they had enough food for the rest of the winter. During the process a hand slip with my metal hive tool caused it to hit my watch face with a lot of force causing a web of cracks across the cover. The watch underneath was not damaged in any way. Very pleased.

I used the plastic stick on protectors in the past, but you have to replace them pretty often. I bought this for my new watch and so far I really like it. I bought the transparent one and it has not affected touch functionality at all. The only negative at this point is it giving the watch a plastic or shiny look around the sides. I may look at buying one of the color ones too, but wanted to try this out first to make sure it was functional.

These screen protectors are REALLY nice! I wasn‚Äôt going to get one but I banged the Watch a couple times so I did. I did my research on YouTube and the internet to get the best one. I was afraid it would add too much bulk and size to the Watch but it doesn‚Äôt at all and the screen touch sensitivity is 99% of the feel you get without it. It was a snap to put on. Took 5 seconds. Easy on, easy off. Screen clarity is excellent and the matte finish doesn‚Äôt make the Watch look cheap. You can hardly tell it‚Äôs on the Watch. Attaches securely. I just put it on so I can‚Äôt speak to how durable it will be but so far, I couldn‚Äôt be more happy with it! No problems charging or changing bands. Go get one!

I tripped & fell really hard, cutting up my hands, & my apple watch came crashing down to the pavement. This protector completely protected my apple watch & took the full impact of the fall!!! I just bought this apple watch less than a month ago so this protector saved me hundreds!!! AMAZING PRODUCT. So glad I got it so soon after buying my watch.

aboutProductTopics.name: Compatible model: Compatible with apple watch series 6/5/4/SE 44mm (Also compatible with 2022 new apple watch SE 44mm).
Overall protection: This case with glass screen protector is designed to offer external surface protection to your watch without compromising usability.
Easy to install: Super easy to install for its snap-on design to avoid taking the straps off first.
Kindly tip: These covers don't support while swimming because the water will get trapped underneath the cases. If you forget to take it off, you can wipe it out with a cloth or wipes.
What you get: 2 x high performance PC hard case + dry and wet wipes.

name: HELIMIX 2.0 Vortex Blender Shaker Bottle 28oz | No Blending Ball or Whisk | USA Made | Portable Pre Workout Whey Protein Drink Shaker Cup | Mixes Cocktails Smoothies Shakes | Dishwasher Safe
description:
Product Description

Helimix uses utility patented technology to mix your shakes without the need for annoying agitators bouncing around inside. As with any shaker, add liquid and then supplements to prevent anything from sticking to the bottom while mixing. Responsibly Made in the U.S. with 100% American materials. Helimix's graduated scale markings on the side of the cup range from 4 to 20 ounces. With the lid on, filled to the brim, Helimix can hold 28 ounces of liquid. Helimix will effectively mix in the range of 16 - 20 ounces of liquid at a time while remaining compact enough to fit in the vast majority of cup holders.

New and Improved Design. New Manufacturing Process. Fully injection molded in the USA for a clean, crisp, precise finished product. Helimix uses an innovative patented design to ensure every athlete's sports drink mixes smooth. The shape of the cup itself does the mixing and it works way better than you think. Forget the days of cleaning shaker balls and screens, trying to untangle them from the dishwasher rack, losing them in your cabinets, or replacing batteries. Helimix only requires the cup, lid, and your choice of supplement mix to operate. We know you put a lot of hard work into every gym session, game, and competition, so we want to eliminate anything in your path to domination. The Helimix uses shatter-proof, odor resistant, 100% BPA/BPS-free Tritan plastic to give you a clean, American Made, durable and easy-to-wash shaker bottle.

reviews.content:
A friend of ours recommended this shaker bottle brand. I love that this bottle doesn't require that stupid wire ball. And it's the BEST shaker bottle I have ever used. No clumps! I would always get clumps with my old shaker bottles. And my old bottles, no matter how quickly I'd rinse/clean them out, would hold onto odors from whatever protein/liquid I would put in them. Some of my old bottles would hold onto lingering scents so badly that I'd end up throwing them away!

We've used our bottles several times since we've bought them and I haven't noticed any lingering smells! These bottles are also so easy to clean. I just put in a little dish soap, some hot water, shake it up, and done!

HOWEVER... The lid can be really difficult to open. That's good because it makes it much more difficult to experience leaks but like another reviewer has experienced, when I've opened my lid I accidentally crushed one of my fingers under the "key ring" side of the lid. It hurt like HECK because I had to push the lid open pretty hard! I don't want to deduct a star however, because this is still a really excellent product. Just gotta watch the placement of your fingers when opening the lid.

This shaker cup is amazing. I was searching for something that won't leave my powdered protein shakes clumpy, and also just easy and quick to use. I was searching for electric ones, I bought frothers to help, but I was blown away by how easy it was to just put in my milk, scoop the powder in and shake! There were NO clumps! I wish I found this cup sooner. I would have saved myself the headache and the mess on my counter. I purchased the 28 oz in coral, and it looks very sleek. The material of the cup is great, and it really is leakproof. Make sure the lid to the spout clicks shut. It's intuitive, but figured I'd leave that tip just in case. I highly recommend this product.

I was reticent to buy this because it was almost twice the price of other more generic options but it was totally worth it. Just buy it and don't look back. No shaker balls to clean or extra parts - just a lid and a container. POUR THE LIQUID IN FIRST! Then put in your powder. Close the top, shake and you're done. I clean it by adding water and shaking, then removing the cap and rinsing. I don't even use a brush to clean it. CONS: The flip-cap has a loop in the rear that extends past the hinge and will guillotine your finger if you aren't paying attention and try to open it one-handed. It happened to me twice and I saw stars. Like catching your finger Ina mouse-trap. So now I open it by holding the top and pushing up with both thumbs while my other fingers are out of the way. Other than that, it's great.

I absolutely adore this mixer for powdered shake mixes. It does an excellent job of thoroughly blending and combining ingredients, but the best part is that it's so easy to clean because it doesn't have any shaker balls or mixing screens. You only need to clean the lid and bottle. This mixer works exceptionally well with any powdered mix and cold liquid combination, including protein powders, fruit and vegetable powders, and commercial smoothie mixes. The only issue I have encountered is sometimes having trouble opening the pop-top spout cover as it clicks into place very securely, but I prefer it that way because it prevents spills. Just keep in mind that if you're purchasing this mixer for someone with weak or painful hands, they may struggle with opening the spout cover.

I've been using my Helimix for quite a few months now and will never go back to a shaker bottle with a ball. Yesterday I forgot I had put my Helimix on top of my truck. I remembered just down the road and turned around hoping it fell off on my dirt driveway. It did not. There it was in the middle of the road with all its contents and just a couple scuffs! This is a solid product that out performs traditional shaker bottles.

I got tired of the annoying ball moving around and making noise and trying to prevent the ball from falling from my hand when rinsing my old shaker out. I tried this shaker for the first time and WOW it can mix. Did it first with preworkout which is not as thick as protein and it worked. After my workout, I tried the shaker with my vanilla protein and it didn‚Äôt feel viscous or pulpy at all! It‚Äôs like what they said, ITS PHYSICS!

I was intrigued by this product design and it's simplicity. Item arrived quicky and appeared to have no issues. Tested it by shaking it with warm water and soap to wash it. It definitely looked like it did everything the company said. However upon first use, I noticed the bottom had a crack that was a little over an inch long. The product itself mixed the powder exceptionally well (add liquid THEN powder). 3 stars due to QC, not product functionality or design.

Update: After I was refunded for the defective product, the manufacturer reached out to me. I was offered a replacement product free of charge. I have been using the replacement almost daily and it works VERY well. I have updated my rating to reflect the product accurately. Every now and then (maybe 3 times total) I'll get a little bit of powder that sticks to the lid, but 99% of the time the powder mixes perfect. Also once or twice the bottle leaked when shaking. There is NO rubber gasket/seal, so make sure to screw the lid on tightly.

This was a gift. Immediately upon opening the box I noticed the hexagonal shape of the bottle. It really didn‚Äôt need a ball to mix, my shake was smooth and perfectly blended. I think the true test will be if it can stand being dropped. It is a nice thick almost glass like plastic, but I fear it might crack.

Omg! I usually do not review things, but I have to review this! I was sooo skeptical when I ordered. I use a blender normally for my shakes, as it is the only thing that would get rid of the nasty clumps! I do have several of the ball mixing cups, but they always leave the nasty clumps behind, and I can‚Äôt stand to drink with those. This cup is amazing! First time a used, I literally shook it a few times and everything was mixed! No clumps at all!!!! I‚Äôm amazed at how well this works. I think I will order another in the smaller size ;). My straws aren‚Äôt quite long enough for the larger one that I purchased.

There isn‚Äôt a ball, insert, filter, or anything but it mixes powders, liquids, and even peanut butter to a smooth drink. My son is a power lifter and when in prep for a competition he occasionally doubles his protein powder or adds peanut butter to his drinks. This thing is amazing! Easy hold, closes securely, and cleans quick.

aboutProductTopics.name: Make sure this fits by entering your model number.

üö´ NO SHAKING ACCESSORIES NEEDED - Forget the days of looking for your wire shaker ball and buying shaker ball replacements because the Helimix uses a patented vortex blender design that doesn't require anything but a few good shakes. This also means you don't have to worry about a clogged or dirty shaker balls ruining your protein shake.

üèÜ SUPERIOR SUPPLEMENT MIXING - Helimix has been rigorously tested against other mixer cups to ensure you get the best shaker bottle on the market. Our patented vortex design allows for optimal mixing of any powder supplement.

üëÉ ODOR RESISTANT MATERIAL - Helimix is made with Tritan Plastic, which makes the cup odor resistant so you don't have to gag down your sports drinks. It's also 100% BPA/BPS-free plastic to ensure supplements stay clean.

üßº DURABLE & EASY TO CLEAN - Helimix uses shatter-proof Tritan plastic. And once your workout is done, throw the Helimix in your dishwasher for a quick and easy clean. Most other shaker bottles are made of cheap plastic and are breakable.

ü§ù LEAK PROOF GUARANTEE - If it leaks please contact us and we'll make sure you're issues are resolved. We pride ourselves in our quality products and customer service. Also, the patented design of Helimix includes a sturdy loop for easy transport to and from the gym. The Helimix is just the right size that fits in nearly all cup holders.

name: Hilife Steamer for Clothes, Portable Handheld Design, 240ml Big Capacity, 700W, Strong Penetrating Steam, Removes Wrinkle, for Home, Office and Travel
description:
Product Description

NOTE:

*Please do not add water over the Max water line.

*Never turn the unit upside down or tilted your steamer past a 45-degree angle.

*Never use the steamer on clothes that you are wearing on yourself.

*For perfect use-please use a hanger to hang your clothes while steaming.

Specification:

Unit Weight (Bare): 0.568kg.

Water Tank Capacity: 240ml.

Steam Output Time: 130 seconds.

Steam Duration: 14-16 minutes.

Voltage: 110-120V, 50/60Hz.

Wattage: 700W

reviews.content:
When I made my buy, I did not take the time to read the reviews or even consider the advantages and disadvantages of the product. I wanted to try it, and I saw this one, and it was reasonably priced, so I only thought twice before purchasing. This steamer would be a good investment for people like me who do their laundry to ensure few wrinkles; however, no matter how hard you try, you will always have a wrinkle here and there. And this steamer is small but works miracles when it comes to those tiny wrinkles. It is travel friendly, easy to store, and compact. I am satisfied with the purchase because I knew it was something other than what I would use daily. There are instances when a minor crease in my clothing makes me lazy about getting out the iron and performing all that extra work. I did not need it for anything significant, in other words.
¬†¬†¬†¬†
¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†I was excited to try it when it arrived, so I did. At first, I was frightened because there did not appear to be any steam coming out, but after 3 minutes, I saw smoke, so I recommend giving it some time after being plugged in to get it operating. I had never used a steamer before and was highly pleased. It contains enough water to complete at least one outfit. To avoid water spurting out, don't fill it up. Be cautioned not to put your hands or skin too close to the blue nozzle because this machine part gets hot. Despite being portable and simple, I tried a steamer because it doesn't leave wrinkles and lines like an iron. And just as expected, the steam did wonders for me in removing wrinkles. I also used the included brush, which worked equally effectively both ways. Although it works wonders, I would not suggest it to someone who plans to use it frequently because it is time-consuming and doesn't work as well on oversized clothing. This isn't to say that it doesn't work, just that you must review it a few times to get it to look exactly right. However, this is ideal if you're looking for something inexpensive, convenient for storage, and simple to use. Remember that it works best on smaller clothes because it will take less water, and you can get a lot done with one full cup. If you wanted to steam more than one piece of clothing at a time, you would have to stop often, turn the machine off, and let it cool down for a few minutes before adding more water and plugging it back in, and then wait another three minutes for the steam to resume. It has undoubtedly been put to use and has been helpful on numerous occasions. Getting wrinkle-free clothing has become necessary for travel and daily life. The functionality of this product is excellent, given its size and cost.
¬†
The product heats up quickly and is a perfectly manageable size. Use filtered or purified water to avoid limescale buildup that could damage equipment and stain garments. Although it removes wrinkles rapidly, it cannot replace ironing. The product is excellent overall, and I suggest it unless you plan to use it frequently for formal attire because doing so requires a lot of time. But don't let it deter you from purchasing it. I'm sure you will love it as much as I do and will use it extensively. People like me who take their time with their laundry to ensure minimal wrinkles would benefit from investing in this steamer. Despite our best efforts, there will inevitably be a few wrinkles here and there.

I had my last steamer- the kind that is on wheels with a pole to hang clothes from- for 11 years. It was time to get something new and I wanted one that didn‚Äôt take up as much space and I could take with me on vacations. This one had over 90k reviews- mostly positive- so I figured I‚Äôd grab it while it was on sale.
It arrived same day, it was simple to ‚Äúput together‚Äù and use immediately. It is very lightweight and I‚Äôd say takes up as much space as a classic blow dryer if I were to pack it in a suitcase/overnight bag.
It took a bit to heat up, my larger one had a much bigger water tank and I feel like it took about 30s to heat up. This little guy has like a cup of water in its tank and it probably took closer to a minute to boil the water. Not a big deal just something I noticed.
The steam comes out with some force so I was impressed with that-my other steamer just seemed to allow the steam to just float out of the hose attachment.
I used this steamer on 2 satin feeling camisoles that where just purchased and taken out of the packaging so they were in pretty bad shape with wrinkles and fold marks. This steamer did a pretty good job at removing all of the wrinkles in 1-3 passes. The biggest negative for me was that it sputters water a bit. I had this issues with my older steamer so it‚Äôs not a huge deal breaker, and so far I have had 0 issues with water stains but I can imagine on very delicate materials it could be bad. I also didn‚Äôt experience these droplets spilling onto my skin but the water is at boiling point so I would be careful.
Overall for the sale price of 22$, I‚Äôm willing to keep this little guy and use it as my travel steamer. I still have my trustee old steamer just in case this one doesn‚Äôt last.

This thing gets really hot so be careful not to get your hands/skin near the blue nozzle. The steam was very effective in removing wrinkles for me. I put it close to the cotton fabric I was using. I also tried the little brush it came with too seemed to do just as good with it or without it. Before I started, I hung up my wrinkled items on hangers and on a little hook on my bathroom door. I then used the little plastic measuring cup it came with and poured water in up to the MAX line. After that, I screwed the top on which has little notches that lock in place when you turn the lid. Finally, I plugged it in and waited about 2 minutes for it to start steaming. Its light and easy to use and I like how it doesn't leave sharp lines and creases like an iron can. This is why I wanted to try a steamer. However, I was only able to steam 2 size large women's scrub tops, and my 7 year old daughters flannel shirt on a full handle of water with this steamer. I usually have 10-15 pieaces to iron at a time and therefore this would be a pain in the butt to keep stopping, turning the machine off, wait for it too cool down, add more water, then plug in and wait another 2-3 minutes for the steam to start up again only to do another 3 shirts. Its just not efficient time wise for me since I can iron so much faster. I will just continue to use a spray bottle of water when I don't want sharp lines from the iron. Therefore I will be returning this steamer and buying a new iron. This would be really awesome for someone that travels alot though because its small and handheld, and ideal for doing a few garments of clothing at a time.

So far this steamer is working very well. It doesn't take long to heat up and begin releasing steam once its powered on. I tested it on my wrinkliest most finicky shirt, and it did a decent job, and way easier than trying to use an iron. On the advice of other reviews, I've only used filtered water in the reservoir (I have a hard water system), and so far no problems.

What keeps it from being a 5 star is that sometimes it sputters and throws water droplets from the nozzle when it's less than half full, so keep that in mind if you're bringing it very close to the fabric.

Initial Review Feb 22, 2023

I bought this steamer to remove wrinkles from photography backdrops. I've found that ironing a 10 foot by 8 foot white backdrop takes quite a long time with an iron. With the steamer I only need to smooth out the wrinkles in the area that will be in the photo frame. It's much easier and much quicker than using an iron.

Not much to say about a steamer. It looks nice. Is sized not to be too heavy. It holds a decent amount of water.

Put water in it. Plug it in. Switch it on. Some short time later steam comes out. It did all of these steps well.

I recommend this steamer

I don‚Äôt usually race to review and item, but this steamer is awesome!! I detest ironing. I avoid it like the plague. However, wrinkles are a fact of life and sometimes ya gotta get them out! This little steamer is a game changer!! So easy to use! Filled it up, plugged it in and had the wrinkles out of two shirts in less than ten minutes! It was awesome watching the wrinkles literally vanish like magic! I think if I had a Shar Pei, it would probably take the wrinkles out of that too!! So this is an awesome purchase, but if you have a wrinkly dog like a Shar Pei, keep it away from this amazing little steamer!

Let me start with a disclaimer: I am writing this review after only using the product once, but i will update if my experience changes after continued use.

I bought this steamer as a gift for my wife who wanted something simple to use and portable. The materials used seem decent enough for the price, it's small (definitely portable), and there's really nothing to using it other than filling it up and turning it on, which is exactly what she was looking for.

I tested it out on one of my work shirts (before/after in pictures) that was particularly wrinkly (left in washer too long before being hung on rack to dry).

I filled the unit up to just below the max line and turned it on. After about 1-2 minutes the unit was boiling and steam was steadily flowing out of the nozzle (this is essentially the same thing as an electric kettle but forces the steam from the boiling water out 5 small holes in the nozzle). I SLOWLY worked from bottom to top of the shirt on the front, back, and sleeves. After applying steam to all sides for about 4-5 mins total, I had the wrinkles down to a level that would be deemed acceptable for work in the office. Keep in mind that this unit is quite small (which is what makes it so portable), but the tradeoff for this is it doesnt produce nearly as much steam as a floor unit and hence takes more passes to achieve the "wrinkle-free(ish)" look.

If you're a big wig at a fortune 500 company, the results from this product certainly wont compare to a press from a dry cleaner (or even a decent ironing job from someone that knows what they're doing), but the results would be perfectly acceptable for normal office work or casual events.

If you're looking for something to replace your iron that gets the job done just as well in half the time, then I'd recommend going with a larger floor unit steamer. However, if you're like my wife and are simply looking for something simple, affordable, and portable that gets the job done, I believe you'll be satisfied with this product for the price like we are.

PROS:
Price (very affordable at the time I purchased from amazon).
Easy to use (just fill it up and turn it on).
Portable (can easily fit in a carryon if desired).
Does a good enough job for what I paid for it.

CONS:
MUST use while completely upright (will spill boiling water if tilted too far - potential safety concern).
The unit is quite small so it takes longer than you might think it would to achieve desired results.
Gets small amount of condensation/sputters which may temporarily cause wet spots on clothes (they dry up quickly, but it's something to be aware of for some fabrics that may have color-stay issues).

It‚Äôs pretty good for trips and to get you out of trouble but it‚Äôs not convenient for daily use, runs out of water after 2/3 shirts (probably 1/2 if it‚Äôs a big man‚Äôs shirt). I would recommend to buy something to put the clothes on so you can steam them comfortably, I have to do it on my door knob.

UPDATE:
The supplier contacted me with the intent to resolve the issue. A replacement steamer was sent to me and arrive quickly. I have used it so far on one item and I must say the result was much better and what I would expect the steamer to do, I may post pictures later to illustrate. I appreciate how quickly they acted to resolve the issue and make good.

Received the steamer yesterday and tried it for the first time this morning on a light casual top. The light came on and the water got hot, however, the light steam force did nothing to the wrinkles in the fabric. Very disappointed and will be returning. I was hoping this would be my hand dandy steam to travel with.

I just got this steamer and have several polyester blouses I just got. The blouses were folded when I got them, and therefore, lots of wrinkles. I washed the blouses thinking that would fix the wrinkles - wrong. I used this steamer and it got out all the manufacturer packaging wrinkles. I've just tried this once, so maybe with time, my technique will get better. For 5 blouses, I used three full tanks of distilled water. We live in a hard water area, so I used distilled water so that the steamer wouldn't spit calcium deposits on my clothes. The blouses came out really well. I recommend for a quick press without the hassles of an ironing board and iron.

Note: Whether magnetic hooks can hold few or many pounds,your steel is decisive!

1. A thicker Steel:

Thin steel means saturation of flux in the magnetic circuit. Excess magnetic flux is wasted in the air and can't be utilized.

2. Thinner painting/no spacer

The thick painting will give rise to a great leakage of flux, only a small portion of flux from magnetic hooks can be utilized to provide the attractive force.The thicker the painting, the worse the magnetic force!

reviews.content:
(The 22 lb magnetic hooks I bought are no longer listed in the ad. They are now selling 25 lb hooks instead. Just something to keep in mind when reading calculations based on the 22 lb hooks I bought & reviewed below.)
***************************************************************************
Among other things, I'm using these on three steel doors to hold the curtain rods that hold the curtains. They are quite strong for their size (base is 1/2" in diameter), and I'm very happy with their (parallel) holding power. I docked one star for two hooks that don't fit in their base, demoting them to refrigerator magnets.

Simply put, a magnet's PULL STRENGTH measures (in kilograms or pounds) the amount of VERTICAL force required to PULL the magnet AWAY from the metal surface it is stuck to. Applying that to these magnetic hooks means that each one, when stuck to a metal CEILING, is rated for a maximum holding power of approximately 22 lbs/10 kg before it will PULL AWAY from the CEILING. (Assuming all CONDITIONS ARE IDEAL.)

Take the same magnetic hook and put it on a WALL made of exactly the same material as the ceiling, and it will SLIDE DOWN the wall much easier than it will PULL AWAY from the ceiling (or PULL AWAY from the wall, for that matter). This is the magnet's PARALLEL HOLD or SHEAR FORCE, and it's not nearly as powerful as its PULL STRENGTH. This same concept explains why 2 magnets stuck together are easier to separate if you SLIDE them apart than if you try to PULL them apart.

Manufacturers are generally referring to PULL STRENGTH when stating the holding power of a magnet. Pull Strength is determined by the MAXIMUM AMOUNT OF WEIGHT A MAGNET HELD WHEN TESTED UNDER IDEAL CONDITIONS. PARALLEL HOLD/SHEAR FORCE can be reasonably estimated at 10% to 25% of a magnet's PULL STRENGTH. With that in mind, we'll assume a PARALLEL HOLD of 17% for these magnetic hooks rated at 22 lbs (22lbs X 17% = 3.74 lbs). Under that assumption, we can expect that each hook (if used on a metal WALL or DOOR) should hold approximately 3 3/4 lbs of weight before it SLIDES DOWN THE WALL. Obviously, that's much less than its stated pull strength of 22 lbs (the amount of weight it should hold if used on a ceiling). Because a magnet fails under less weight when used on a wall rather than a ceiling, or holds less weight than stated on packaging or sale ads, does NOT mean that the magnet is flawed or the manufactuer and sellers are deceitful. The magnet is simply demonstrating, in real life, (and perhaps to the user's dismay), the difference between its PULL STRENGTH (22 lbs in this case) vs its PARALLEL HOLD/Shear Force (approximately 2 1/4 to 5 1/2 lbs = 10% to 25% of 22 lbs).

In addition to orientation, there are other factors or conditions that influence a magnet's performance/strength/holding power, SUCH AS:
THE MAGNET:
**What is the magnet made of, what type of material? (ceramic, alloy, rare earth, etc),
**What is the magnet's CONDITION? (chipped, cracked, scratched, dirty, etc)
**What is its size and shape?
**Is the magnet "CUPPED" or not? Cupped=magnet is placed into a steel 'cup' or 'holder', like the
magnets on these hooks. Cupping 'focuses' most of the magnet's pull in one direction [the open
end of the cup], giving it more holding strength than it would have without the cup.
**How has the magnet been HANDLED? Has it been stored correctly (it matters)? Has it been dropped? (dropping magnet=not good)

ENVIRONMENTAL:
**What is the AMBIENT temperature and humidity level? Is there excess moisture present?
**Will the magnet be completely submerged, used to attract submerged items?
**What is the temperature of the metal the magnet will attach to? - What is the temperature of the magnet?

THE METAL:
**What of the metal the magnet attracts or attaches to? - How thick is the metal? (thicker = better) - What are its components?
**What is the condition of the metal item or surface? Is it BARE and CLEAN or is it coated, painted, dirty, greasy, rusty? - Is it perfectly FLAT or is it curved or uneven? Is it perfectly SMOOTH or is it textured, rough, bumpy, dented, chipped?
ANYTHING THAT INTERFERES WITH 100% FULL & DIRECT CONTACT BETWEEN MAGNET AND METAL DIMINISHES THE MAGNET'S HOLDING POWER.
~~~and that's just the short list, there's more, and it ALL matters.

I think the physics of magnets and magnetism is fascinating, but technical and complex enough to blow MY mind right out of the science book! Fortunately, for most of us 'average consumers', this very BASIC understanding of PULL STRENGTH as it relates to PARALLEL HOLD is likely the most beneficial (and easiest to remember) when choosing a household, craft, hobby or shop magnet for your particular task.
*********************************************************************************
NOTE: IDEAL CONDITIONS for testing a magnet's holding power means the METAL is thick, perfectly smooth and flat, perfectly clean and bare. Same for the MAGNET, it is in PERFECT, new condition. Ambient conditions [temp, humidity, dust-free, etc] are also PERFECT. Everything is as perfect as it can be in order to achieve the maximum holding power of the magnet, and that result is what is stated on packaging, in ads, etc. Our personal-use conditions are not likely to be as perfect as testing conditions.

How well these hooks work depend on whether you hang the load parallel or perpendicual to whatever surface the magnet is attached.

If you attach to a vertical surface (like a wall), and hang something on the hook, it will likely slide right down the wall.

However if you attach the magnet to a horizontal surface, like a ceiling, and the load is perpendicular , they work great, and easily hold 10lb.

Personally, I'm using them on cruises to hang things from the ceiling (since cruise ships have metal ceilings).

If you plan on attaching to refrigerator, stove, range hood, dishwasher door, etc.. they will slide down very easily, even with light loads (dish towel). You can reduce the sliding if you put something on the magnet side that increases the friction (masking tape) between the magnet and attachment surface.

For my specific use case, 4 stars. Reason i took off a star is because they magnet side has no protective film, so you can easily cause scratches. My solution was to put a piece of tape across the back. As long as the tape is thing enought, it doesn't affect the magnet adhesion much.

I know. It says 100 pounds, but I didn‚Äôt know how to quantify that into familiar terms. It takes a lot of strength, although not so much to make it difficult for a 70 year old woman, to pull these magnets apart.

I plan to use the magnets on cruises, to hang things from walls and the ceiling. Some staterooms don‚Äôt have walls to which the magnets hold, but using the ceiling works great for hats and other items.

I bought the 35lb hooks to take on a cruise. They're enough to hold my thick microfiber robe up. I used them to hang wet clothes to dry. When I hung them outside the balcony, they did accumulate some surface rust on them. Overall, very useful hanging various items around your cabin.

We bought these to bring on our cruise for extra hanging ability around our stateroom, and boy did they work great! Some of the heavier items slid down the wall, but we just used 2 hooks together to fix that problem. The magnets are very strong, and the size was great for our use. We will buy more for the next cruise, as we could have used some more.

I was pleasantly surprised at the strength of the magnets! The package came in 2 pieces where you have to screw in the hook into the magnet. Once I stuck those on my fridge - WOW! Those magnets are not going anywhere! I can hold up to 5 photos on my fridge with just one hook! Additionally I like that the hook gives me an extra space for keys, measuring cup, whatever I need to hang! The gold looks great and the shine is not cheap-looking. Great for small spaces or those who have many "handmade" creations from little ones to display.

I purchased these to use on the side of a refrigerator to hold broom, mop, calendar, utensils, etc. They are really strong, though they don't hold as much weight as claimed. They come with the magnets and hooks separately, but are easily assembled. While they don't actually hold my broom, mop and other long handled tools completely off the floor, they do work to keep them upright (with the bottom of the tool touching the floor). They have no problem holding hanging kitchen utensils.

The magnets are all stuck together when you get them. They will fight you to separate them. Some users may need help (like using a pair of pliers) to separate them.

These are great to hang on my metal tent posts for vending events. Some assembly required or else they‚Äôd come on a bigger bag but all you have to do is screw the hook into the hole on top of the magnet.

We bought these to take on our next cruise. Cabin walls are mostly metal on cruise ships. We hang our hats, visors, or whatever on magnetic hooks and these are stronger than the ones we took on our last cruise.
magnet not as strong as i thought, if you are going to put clothes that are wet. it will not hold up or if you use it to hold up a sweater hoodie, you will need to use 3 hooks
