Screen+Lens Protection	Screen+Lens Protection	Privacy Screen+Lens Protection	Screen Protection	Screen+Lens Protection	Screen Protection
 
 
 
 
    

1. The flexibility of the glass screen protector is the same as the plastic material, is it tempered glass or plastic?

This screen protector is a real tempered glass. The plastic flexibility is the exact reason why we call it tempered glass screen protector. Tempered glass is a type of safety glass that is stronger than ordinary glass.

2. It cannot be seen from the appearance that it is glass or plastic. As a customer, what can we do to identify it?

There is an easy, quick, cost-effective way to test it yourself, and it's very accurate. Most plastics have a melting point between 160 and 210 degrees Celsius, and glass materials are at least over 1400 degrees Celsius, so is there a lighter around?

3. Does it come with a cleaning wipe to use prior to placing on the phone?

Yes, the package includes: 4*Guide Stickers, 4*Wet Wipe&4*Dry Wipe,2*Dust Absorber.

4. How can I remove bubbles?

Use the kit in the package to clean the screen before placing the screen protector. If there are bubbles,try to gently press the bubbles with your finger or with a ruler,but the screen surface needs a thin cloth pad to avoid scratching the protector.

5. How can I remove a cracked glass screen protector?

Lift the screen protector with the card from any corner of the screen protector, then hold the corner and remove slowly. (If you find CHIP or CRACK on the screen protector, for your safety, please wear gloves when removing the screen protector.)

reviews.content: I am paranoid about my phone because of my clumsiness. I fully acknowledge my lack of grace and coordination and like to be prepared. You would think that due to cost, this set would not be affective‚Ä¶WRONG!!! I upgraded the phone in November and purchased this same brand for the new phone. Application is fairly easy‚Ä¶as easy as lining up and dealing with a sticky side but not bad. While walking after a long meeting last week on a cement pier with uneven areas I wasn‚Äôt paying enough attention to, I took a spill‚Ä¶and one harder than I realized due to the speed I was going. Huge bruised knee, nothing broken (I have really hard bones‚Ä¶a gift to a clumsy person) so I was fine. But when I looked at my phone that evening‚Ä¶holy smokes. A spider web crack in the corner and another at the bottom making it obvious where it hit. What I am most thankful for was the added camera lense cover!!! I almost didn‚Äôt add it thinking it already looked sturdy. Nope‚Ä¶it had a significant web crack that I‚Äôm sure meant had it not been there, the fall would have destroyed the lense. I am incredibly thankful for this simple but incredibly effective cover set and can‚Äôt recommend it more!

I never write reviews, but this deserves one. Absolutely 10/10- the price is great, durability better & putting it on is the BEST!! I‚Äôve never had luck putting these on with other products nonetheless getting it to stay-but these go on so easily and the air bubbles somehow suction out by themselves. I‚Äôve gone through about 6 over the years and never had 1 come lose. I drop my phone constantly, and usually on the cement, and I‚Äôve never had my phone crack with these on. Highly recommend this product!

I am very hard on my phone, I have an otter box and I never had issues w my iPhone, however when I got the new 13pro max, where the camera is flat w the back, crap I cracked the lens within a month!!! Picture and camera still worked fine, so I quickly ordered these and it works!! Although I do have some bad drops, or horse may even step on it, only damage is having to replace the lens cover which is way more affordable than replacing phone. I highly suggest this product for safety and protection.

take your time installing and no problem. ordered this before i ordered a new phone and am glad i did second day of use i drop my brand new phone on concrete and its shattered my heart sank until i peeled the protector off not a scratch on the screen or phone the screen protector took all the damage its well worth the cost id rather pay for a protector every week then a thousand dollar phone worth every cent....

The screen protector was easy to install. If not for the screen protector I‚Äôd have to pay for a new screen, which isn‚Äôt cheap. There are 2 screen protectors in the box, so I have one for the next time.

This screen protector lasted me so long and saved my phone from many damages. I dropped my phone many times on accident and not a single crack or shatter was spotted on the screen protector or my phone. 100% recommend.

Head of the Class

Give kids a whiteboard and Expo Washable markers to allow them to keep learning long after the school day is over. Take a fifteen-minute recess out of your day to be a student in their pretend classroom as they "teach" you their latest lesson. They'll get some fun study time and you'll always get a gold star for attendance.

	
The List Goes On

Multiple mouths to feed mean you're constantly catering to the likes and dislikes of others. Keep up with their varying tastes by putting an Expo board on the fridge so everyone can request their favorite fare. They'll remain satisfied and you'll be happy to never hear "There's nothing for me to eat" ever again.

	

	



Root for the Home Team

Grab some Expo markers in the team colors and go wild on the car windows. It's a fun family activity to show your support and comes off when the game is over. Which is especially nice if someone wasn't quite as victorious as they'd hoped.

	
Life Labeled

Use Expo markers to label your plastic containers. If they're clear, taping a small piece of paper on the opposite side will keep your label legible. And you can change your mind with a flick of the wrist.

	
Entertaining Possibilities

Use Expo markers on glass trays to write out the names of specialty hors'devours or wine and cheese pairings. You can also write on small decorative tiles for reusable place settings or buffet labels. Your guests will be thrilled when the only thing they have to ask is "More wine please?"

reviews.content:
Received them at 5:45am the next day after placing the order. They are decent quality, came with sleeves and a cloth. Not too bad for the price!

Comes with a cleaning cloth, that is better than most cloths out there. Also has a small double sided screwdriver (flat on one side phillips screwdriver on other). Has the UV light and a test card to see the glasses really block utv light. I checked my prescription glasses against these and they both have same results!

My daughter is 11 and looks so cute in the clear. She picked clear out, because I wear clear framed glasses! Hah! She really likes them and she wears them for mostly the entire day. Very happy it wasn‚Äôt hard to get her ti wear them since she is home schooled and in a computer 75% of the day.

Wish the delivery was just as good as the product....
When I went outside to get them the driver was smokin weed. As I got my package and pulled it into the house it SMELLED like crazy of marijuana. Its been in a back now for about a week and it smells so bad of marijuana. Apparently Amazon now employes 420 friendly people who do it while on the clock. When reported to a manager about what my experience was, she shrugged it off. My daughter is highly allergic to this and her throat started swelling shut.

Very disappointed.

It‚Äôs been about a week of work (40+ hours of screen time w/ these glass on) and these r my pros and cons.

4 Pros: 1) my sleep got better. My eye‚Äôs definitely hurt less at the end of the day. 2) They are light weight 3) The case is great for traveling. 4) Very reasonably priced.

2 Cons: 1) the frames were too small for my face, specifically the temples (the side part of the frame) which were not long enough to go over my entire ear. I‚Äôm not sure how to measure the size of my face but I‚Äôm a 6‚Äô2‚Äù slender male. 2) the nose bridge consistently leaves red marks on my nose which does fade over time.

Overall, I‚Äôd buy them again because they are reasonably priced and reduce my eye strain, but I wouldn‚Äôt buy them for me. The next pair I buy I‚Äôll look for a larger temple length so they fit my face better.

For some reason, lately, either I've been on my various devices TOO much or I'm developing some sort of sensitivity, I started getting headaches and eye stress whenever I looked at a screen of any kind. I'm on my computer (work/personal) as well as my phone and tablet, so avoiding any of those is just not feasible.

While I am trying to decrease mindless screen-time and other ways to cope (low light levels, not holding my phone right up to my face, etc) my eye doctor suggested blue light tinted glasses when I wear my contacts and possibly get that feature on a pair of new glasses.

I bought these on a whim after an hour's worth of researching and all these glasses seemed really similar in look and reviews. I did want something stylish as I'd wear them often but also funcitonal. I knew I didn't want the yellow-tinted glasses and literally just bought these with my fingers crossed and expected them to not work.

Not only did you get 2 pairs (a lot of choices to choose from too! I got the clear and dark tortoise pattern), you get protective sleeves (granted, will only prevent the lines from getting scratched and that's about it), a small eye glass screw you can attach to your keyring (!), AND a blue light to test out your glasses (which I did, and my glasses passed--yay!).

SOOOOOO, the REAL test is wearing them and seeing if they help (i.e., reduce my headaches and eye strain). And the verdict...?

THESE WORK.

I'm so shocked tbh cuz these were rather cheap. But honestly, these glasses LOOK good and are made of thick, durable plastic. I get compliments on both pairs since I got them a couple weeks ago. There is a slight difference when you put them on (a very subtle yellow-ish/gold tint) but it's not at all distracting or so different when wearing them or not. The first week, I didn't notice too much of a difference (to be fair, I kept forgetting to wear them). By the second week--these glasses have become a game-changer. I'm used to wearing them on the regular and can use my devices and watch TV and be on my computer for longer and less headaches. When I'm not wearing them, like at night and wearing my regular glasses, I get a headache after a half hour so these glasses help alleviate it a lot.

Do I still get headahes? Yes, esp if I am staring at a screen a lot but the headaches aren't as strong and not as distracting. Basically, if I'm wearing these glasses and start noticing that pressure in my forehead and behind my eyes, I know I've been on the screen too much and take a long break.

One issue i have--and possibly contributing to my headache--is that these glasses are a bit heavy on my nose bridge. Now, to be transparent, I do have a narrow, small bridge and it sits slightly lower than where the arms of the glasses fit over my ears so sometimes, certain glass style cause added pressure where it sits on my nosebridge. To be clear, I don't have this issue with all glasses so something about this design is adding to that heavy feeling on my nosebridge and I at times, I have to take them off to give my nose bridge a rest, which is kind of a bummer but hopefully I'll get used to it.

My chief complaint is how tight the arms press against the side of my head. I might have a larger head for these glasses so I used the mini-screw driver and loosened the screws enough to lessen that pressure and hopefully, that'll take care of it feeling so tight against my head.

All in all--quite pleased with this product. Just relieved it worked for me!

Great price and the 2 pairs came with a tool kit, cases, and a cleaning cloth. I really would like to star the sleep quality, but not sure, only have been using the glasses for 2 days, including nighttime. That part would be a big plus. that was a big reason I decided to try them. The glasses seem to be a high quality and right now I am quite pleased.

Oh my gosh!! I got these to help with my migraine pain to try and help with it. I got some cheap Walmart ones in the meantime and the difference is night and day! These are amazing, lightweight, and they work really well! It also helps that they're cute! The only downside is I didn't look at descriptions, only pictures so I got the blue and red ones thinking they were red and black (was and still am going to wear them to a UGA game), but they're still adorable! HIGHLY recommended!

I have been having trouble sleeping, at night, and it is partly due to using the computer until right before bedtime. So I ordered a pair of these glasses in hopes they would block the blue light so I could fall asleep faster.

The pair of glasses come with 2 eyeglass sleeves, for storing the glasses, a cleaning cloth, a tiny double-headed screwdriver, that can be put on your keychain, a little flashlight that can also be put on your keychain, and a nice box for storing your glasses or organizing your bedside drawer, and a test card so you can see if the glasses block blue light.

They do seem to block blue light--at least their test card says they do. I could see they were doing something, when I put them on, but I'm not exactly sure what they were doing. Whatever it was, it made my eyes hurt after about an hour so I think I will have to gradually increase the time I wear them.

They also hurt the bridge of my nose and my ears but then again I'm not used to wearing glasses for more then a few minutes. I suspect I will need to buy some silicone nose and ear pads for the glasses since I'll need to wear them for a couple of hours each night.

This is my initial impression of the glasses and my opinion might change over time. However, the pair of glasses seem to be a good buy as they are well made and come with some handy accessories.

I ordered the clear & pink (clear ) glasses and omg these for my face so well and they are so cute. I hate wearing glasses but these I love! I genuinely got these because I work at a computer all day & can‚Äôt afford to damage my eyes than they already, I like the little yellow tint in the glasses as well. I absolutely am obsessed that they provided a test strip and a anti- blue ray light. This is great! I may order again if I lose these, I gave 4 stars because I just got them so idk how they work. (Btw came with glasses pockets :) definitely worth it! Comes with additional accessories

I recently purchased the Livho 2 pack Blue Light Blocking Glasses and have been very pleased with their performance. The glasses have a stylish design and fit comfortably on my face, which is great for extended use.

The blue light blocking feature is effective in reducing eye strain, fatigue and headaches caused by prolonged screen time. I have noticed a significant difference in my eyes feeling less tired and strained when using my computer, phone and tablet.

The glasses also have UV400 protection which is an added bonus that helps protect my eyes from harmful rays.

The pack of two is also a great value, as it gives me a spare pair to use or share with someone else.

Overall, I highly recommend the Livho 2 pack Blue Light Blocking Glasses to anyone who spends a lot of time in front of screens and wants to reduce the negative effects on their eyes and overall well-being.

Okay this set it wonderful for the price. It comes with the two pairs of glasses, cases for each, cleaning cloth, key chain mini screw driver, Blue light with a blue light test card. The frames are nice and sturdy. Not super light weight but I think that makes them feel more expensive and sturdy. They do have a slight yellow tint to them. I feel like my eye have a better chance to relax at night and in turn helps me sleep better. I would buy these again.

I've been dealing with a concussion and got these to help cut down on blue light. It helped a lot for the TV and computer but doesn't seem to help with the phone much. Not surprised tho I think these newer phones are just so unnecessarily hard on the eyes. I will say I prefer the black ones as the clear ones create a lot of glare just from the frame itself.
The glasses came with a tester kit and a cleaning cloth as well as a sleeve type case for each pair. Good for the money!

reviews.content:
11 years ago my youngest daughter had to work hard at getting me, a tight fisted Scotswoman, to buy a Diaper Genie. I am her primary babysitter. Her oldest is 11 years old so I have owned the first Diaper Genie since he was a baby. Even after he outgrew the need for a Diaper Genie I set it aside. Well, now I am the primary Babysitter for our youngest Grandchild. I now have an upstairs and a downstairs Diaper Genie. There is NO telltale smell that there are used diapers in the house. The REFILLS are easy to use. They hold about 12 used diapers before needing to change them out. Buying the three pack is wise, then you don‚Äôt have run and buy more refills in a hurry. You can get the refills in most stores easily. They aren‚Äôt expensive. And since being introduced to to the whole concept of Diaper Genies I have come up with another use for them. We have a camper. Trash sometimes can be a problem. I decided to use one of my Diaper Genie‚Äôs as a trash can in the camper. The bags are treated with something to keep the smells away so why not use it for a trash can in the camper?
The Diaper Genie and the refills are a great idea. I wish I had invented it.
Totally worth it when you subscribe and save! We use the diaper genie STILL because it's so nice in a small house.

I got these for my daughter for my first granddaughter for her baby‚Äôs shower. She like them and couldn‚Äôt find anything better at Walmart so she asked me to get more. I bought her more for Christmas. I will have to keep buying her more.
We actually use this diaper genie and bags to hold our dog's poop until garbage day.
Can't use the diaper genie without these. Sturdy and holds about 18-20 dirty diapers
I can't find the Genie litter locker II refills, so tried this to see if it would work and seems to be a great replacement.
The best products for the baby room I love it
Very easy to use and keeps all the stinky smells inside. Definitely worth the purchase .
This works great for my husband and I! Ever since we bought them we never smell anything from our baby‚Äôs genie diaper pail. I love that it fits a great amount of diapers and it‚Äôs very durable.
I like how easy it is to discard dirty diapers and get rid of that smell

reviews.content:
Do it. Buy this lady. She‚Äôs amazing. She arrived at my 1500 sq ft. Townhome this past Friday‚Ä¶.we‚Äôve hung out all weekend. I LOVE HER!!!! Please note: the occupants of my home include two cats, my daughter, and myself‚Ä¶ all of whom ‚Äúshed‚Äù like crazy.
My house has it all: wood flooring, gargantuan area rugs, tile in the bathrooms, and this awful carpet that covers the stairs and bedroom floors. I vacuumed every inch of flooring in this house on Friday‚Ä¶.. you could literally plop a serving of spaghetti on these bad boys and eat your fill. My bestie did the DA** thing! And when I tell you that I have absolutely no idea how my household has not suffocated from the amount of dander and dust that filled the tank after my psychotic cleaning sesh‚Ä¶.I was disturbing. I clean my floors regularly‚Ä¶at least once a week‚Ä¶plus the solid ‚Äúonce over‚Äù that I do in the high traffic areas daily (kitchen, litter box area, entry way, etc.) I‚Äôm still in shock‚Ä¶..I‚Äôm pretty sure she captured hair samples that have lived dormant in the depths of the carpet on the stairs from all the previous occupants.

I‚Äôm not gonna lie‚Ä¶..price-point wise‚Ä¶. I feel like I owe someone some money‚Ä¶.. because she‚Äôs worth so much more than what I paid!!!!

I don‚Äôt normally write reviews‚Ä¶.. but I felt like hyping this lady on Amazon was the very least I could doüíÅüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Buy the vacuum!

Edited to include photo of canister after second pass‚Ä¶.
I vacuumed yesterday with my tineco. Today this is what the Bissell picked up. I ordered because I could still see pet hair in my carpet after vacuuming. We just bought the house and adopted the previous owners Great Dane because this is his home ‚ò∫Ô∏è, we intruded. He‚Äôs the best pruppet ever but his shedding drives me crazy since we‚Äôve never had an inside dog before. I used to vacuum our old house once every few weeks but feel it very necessary to vacuum daily with a pet inside. My husband and I both have bad allergies so this is a must. So happy with my purchase so far. Will go back over same approximate 22-12 area again in a little bit to see what else I can pick up. It‚Äôs fairly heavy for stairs in my opinion but I‚Äôll deal if it does this good of a job. Putting my tineco downstairs because it‚Äôs rarely used.

My old Samsung died, so we ordered this one after searching for what the best budget vacuum for pet hair is. I am so glad we chose this one so far.
Out of the box, you put the handle on and put the 2 screws in to hold it together while everything else just snaps into place. Easy peasy.
After we vacuumed our 8x10 area rug and hardwood floors and the front door rug, this is what came up. I was a little grossed out, but we have 2 cats and a German shepherd/great Pyrenees/chow mix who definitely sheds. So we needed something to really get all that hair and dander up so the kids can play safely. This was it.
It's super easy to empty out, just 2 buttons. One on the top to release it from the vacuum, and one on the back to drop the bottom over the garbage to empty it. I love that the hose is just a regular hose with attachments, you don't have to lift the whole handle off like some others. The attachments made it so easy to clean the carpeted stairs, also.
Overall, this has exceeded my expectations in the first few days of owning it. Hopefully it holds up well!!

I bought this based on reviews and it definitely performs well for our:
2 dogs + 1 cat
Hardwood, tile, wool and synthetic rugs of varying thicknesses

My main gripe is the inability to disengage the beater bar; most rug manufacturers suggest turning off the beater bar to avoid potential snagging or premature wear. Not every rug will be destroyed by the spinning bristles, but they can gradually fray and suction too much rug fiber (especially on wool rugs) and pull strands from other weaves. I somewhat resolve this by using only the highest setting, but the canister fills before I've finished half of an 8 x 10 rug. Wool already sheds a lot and I hate seeing a canister full of blue wool fibers. I now empty it when it's a ¬º full (every time) otherwise I'd need a ruler to drag out the hair, fibers, and other general ick from accumulating deep in the canister.

But this same powerful suction is excellent for getting everything else on the floor. The unit is lightweight and easy to maneuver. The swivel head works well and the head's side bristles snag debris up along the floor trim. I do not use the wand attachments because the hose doesn't stretch easily and I don't feel like fighting with it. I don't mind because I have a separate, smaller unit for upholstery.

At a good price, this vacuum is a valuable tool in my arsenal against pet hair. I'm glad I bought it. It would certainly be better with a few tweaks. If I was only vacuuming hard surfaces, this would probably be my only vacuum.

Hope this helps!

I live in a home 3 bedrooms 2 stories high. And after many years using my previous old vacuum I decided to purchase this little one. It has the soul of a much much expensive one. It is so powerful and super easy to assemble. It took me 10 mins to put it together and vacuumed my whole house lol. Love it love it and love it. I am single dude who is not looking to spend an arm and a leg in cleaning tools so this purchase is one that I am happy with. Now my place is looking very nice and clean. Final review; a solid 9.5 or even 10.

This has to be the best sweeper I have yet to own. I had another compact sweeper prior to purchasing this one, made by a different company that I thought did a great job, but nope! When I swept with my new Bissell compact, omg, the dirt that was in the canister was unbelievable!! And all of the pet hair that it brought up, BIG WOW! I absolutely love this! It's so easy to push, it feels like it could practically push itself. The canister is very easy to remove and dump out! I cant believe that I thought my other sweeper was just so great. After buying this one, I literally can see how great it wasn't! I highly recommend this!!

I purchased this in November of 2019. I have to Labradors and it has been used at minimum 4 times weekly for a 1200 sq ft apartment, including on couches, chairs, beds and other furniture.

It has worked very well and held up considering I have done absolutely nothing to maintain it.

Alas, It has started to fall apart. The wheels have broken and other random parts have started to pop off. The motor still running strong but it has been beaten up and time for a replacement.

Probably going to go with the same one or maybe the next model up.

Overall very satisfied with the purchase over 3 years later at the price point.

This has to be one of the most versatile, easy to use light vacuums, I've ever had. Overall, I have usually been pleased with my Bissell vacuums, but this one takes the prize. It is small and light weight but with plenty of power. The attachments all attach to the vaccuumn and the vaccuumn comes a part with the top part being the handheld portion for the attachments. Filter is washable and the bin is easily emptied. My vacuum was not delivered originally and a replacement was sent out. The original vaccuumn showed up a few days later and I was so pleased with this vacuum, I decided to pay for this one too and keep both. I have a 2200 sf home, one level, do I keep a vaccumns at both ends of the home. For someone with two or more levels, the price would allow you to keep one on each level, although it is light weight enough to move easily. I am very pleased with this purchase.

Very fast straightforward assembly out of the box. Unexpectedly but delightfully lightweight vacuum. Very loud of course, for a vacuum but seems to have strong suction power. Picked up a lot of pet hair real good for me. Of course, long term performance will in large part depend on how well you maintain it. I got this for my Dad and I doubt he would know what to do but with me, I clean them after each use and will clean the filters regularly and inspect the hose for clogs regularly, so that would surely affect performance.

I did not like the way the dust canister simply rests against the intake opening, it didn't really snap into it, or fit into it. Didn't seem to affect performance or leak dust, I just didn't like it and suspect it could be problematic if the canister ever doesn't fit snugly in the future.

Some have complained about hose length, the best way to use the hose is to detach the handle as that is the extension for length, but you have to be aware of where the vacuum is sitting, I don't think the brush roll stops when upright, or can be stopped when running.

An issue I've had with every vacuum I've handled thus far, the cord wrap never seems to be fully accommodating for the length of cord you have to wrap around it. It's not very long but neither are the ends you wrap the cord over, deep enough so you have lots of cord wrapping around pegs that aren't deep enough to make the cord fit without wanting to overhang or slip off.

Cons aside, for the price point I am happy with this. I wanted lightweight, strong suction and long cord. Easy to empty and maintain.

I don't know why this little vacuum gets bad reviews. It does a great job, hell I didn't even know my room was as dirty until I used this little vacuum. I've used bigger ones that were supposed to have great suction power. But this one is a little beast. It actually picked up dust and dirt I didn't know existed in my room. Though I do think it's meant more for single rooms or small living areas. Not for big houses as it does have a small dust/dirt container. If you live in a small apartment, house or dorm room this is the perfect vacuum for the job.

reviews.content: I was skeptical of all the great reviews. I wanted one for my son to bring to school next year and I saw this one on sale. I figured for the price, I‚Äôd get one for our bed and if it was bad I‚Äôd return my sons. We‚Äôll I won‚Äôt be returning his because mine truly is so comfortable. When I opened the package it didn‚Äôt seem very thick at all so didn‚Äôt think I‚Äôd feel a difference in my bed but I sure do. We have a bob o pedicure which is comfortable but pretty firm. This topper has brought our mattress to a whole other level. Let‚Äôs see how long it lasts‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.

I washed the product when I received it. It washed great and fit my king size mattress perfectly. The mattress is about 16" thick but the mattress pad could also fit a much thicker mattress. This topper/mattress pad is a good compromise over a flatter mattress pad and a very thick topper. I still can't believe the price for such a nice product. My washer and dryer are front load machines and quite large so this pad fit okay. I dried on low for 30 minutes at a time, readjusting the pad each time because it didn't move as freely as I would have liked. Before it was 100% dry I laid it out to finish drying.

Awesome product for the cost. Fits my queen bed perfectly. Smelled fine, so I just fluffed it in the dryer for 15 minutes. Filled my dryer completely. Will have to take it to the laundry mat to wash and dry, that's how big and fluffy it is. Well made, so glad I found it. I almost paid double for another I was looking at. This one had better views. My bed is comfy and cozy. I think I am sleeping better too, as knees, hips and other parts have more cushioning. I almost want to buy another and stack them for ultimate softness. I'd still be saving money. Quality product.

We have a California King mattress and my husband likes a firmer mattress than I do so after a years of not sleeping great I decided to try a topper on my half. I got a Twin XL and then cut the one side so I could fit it over my edge along with the top & bottom of the mattress. I am a restless sleeper and this has stayed put along with helped me from tossing & turning so much. I still wake up slightly achy from the firmness of the mattress but this has definitely helped! I wish I would have gotten one that was a little plusher, but I didn't know how it would work so I wanted to get one that was cost effective yet helpful. If you are looking for a little bit of a change I would recommend this topper. If you are looking for a more drastic change I would look for a different one.

I absolutely love these mattress pads. It's been a while since I've purchased new ones and these are so much nicer than anything I previously purchased. They are just so luxurious feeling and wonderful to sleep on. They don't look like your usual mattress pad and, for the price, they are amazing. I just put them on new beds at our new place, and I haven't tried washing them yet so I cannot say how they'll hold up. They came vacuumed packed to save on shipping materials which is so much better for the environment. Good job! I highly recommend these pads for a better night's sleep.

My husband and I bought a new bedroom suit, upgrading our mattress size to king. We opted for a cheap mattress since we were buying the suit, with plans to replace the mattress at a later date.

The mattress we purchased was memory foam. Memory foam can make you sweat, and our mattress does just that. So much so that we will likely wind up having to replace it sooner than later, not saving anything in the long run.

I purchased this cover for two reasons. First, to try to cut down on the sweating. Second, I can‚Äôt wash the mattress, so I always add a mattress pad or protector that can be washed if needed.

My review of this pad is that it‚Äôs sort of like a thick, fluffy comforter. It‚Äôs kind of squishy. I am not sure what I was expecting but I was going for the feel of a pillow top. It doesn‚Äôt feel like that but it doesn‚Äôt feel like you just tucked a comforter under your sheet either. All I can say is that it made the mattress a lot softer. Whether that is a good thing or not is a matter of opinion.

My husband doesn‚Äôt sleep well on it but didn‚Äôt sleep well on the mattress. He still sweats but not as much (didn‚Äôt on our old pillow top - it‚Äôs the mattress). I wouldn‚Äôt say that this would resolve that issue/cool you down that much. He also says it is too soft in comparison to our daughter‚Äôs (doesn‚Äôt have the pad on her bed). I tend to think that his issues can‚Äôt be resolved without replacing the mattress and am not going to blame them on the pad. The fact is, I doubt there is a pad on the market that would make him like our current mattress any more than he does.

As for me? I like it. Our old pillow top had gotten too soft for me (your core changes quite a bit when you have twins!) and I was having trouble getting in and out of bed at night to check on the kids. My hips were hurting constantly and my back spasms made it more efficient for me to just sleep on the couch. The new mattress was a bit uncomfortable for me, and this pad improved my quality of sleep tremendously. It is soft enough that my hips don‚Äôt kill me when I lay on my side at night, my back spasms have mostly stopped so that I‚Äôm better able to get in and out of bed with the kids, and I just feel comfortable when I‚Äôm laying in it.

I am not someone that has ever owned an expensive mattress and this is an improvement over the egg crates we used to use when I was a kid. My mom and sister liked it enough to get one for their beds and have liked using them so far (they have the same mattress and found it uncomfortable as well.... I have not laundered mine but my sister washes hers weekly and has not complained).

At the end of the day, this mattress cover is not going to make your mattress feel like a pillow top or high end mattress if it isn‚Äôt. It also isn‚Äôt going to make your mattress feel like you crammed a comforter under your sheets. It doesn‚Äôt slide around or bunch up. It is not going to solve any problems with night sweats, and it is probably going to be too soft if you like a firm mattress.

What it is likely to do is add some cushion to an otherwise too firm mattress. If your mattress is so unsupportive that your hips hurt when you lay on your side at night, it might help. If you‚Äôre tossing and turning and not sleeping well because of that sort of thing, it may help. If you just want to add a little cushion, it might help. If you just want a mattress cover you can launder, it would work (I don‚Äôt believe it is waterproof but we didn‚Äôt need that).

As for us, it is an okay purchase. Didn‚Äôt solve my husband‚Äôs problems but solved mine and I‚Äôm grateful for that. I‚Äôm sure that we will soon be replacing the mattress with a better quality, non memory foam one, and when we do, we won‚Äôt be using this any longer. For now, I think it was worth the money.

I don‚Äôt have any complaints so I‚Äôm giving it 5 stars. That doesn‚Äôt mean it upgraded our mattress - it just means that it does what I believe it was advertised to do and I got what I expected from it.

Update‚ÄîI was contacted by the seller who asked for photos of the stains and label. They are sending a replacement (and I don‚Äôt have to send back the stained one). I‚Äôm impressed with the customer service.

I washed the pad. When I went to put it on the bed, I saw a fairly light yellow stain along 1 edge. I washed it again with some spray & wash. It still had the stain, so we‚Äôre using it. Too late to send it back. It fits well and is very comfortable. Just be sure to check it when it arrives.

I did a lot of research before I purchased this mattress pad/topper. The reviews on it were superb and I am here to tell you that those reviews are absolutely true! I really didn‚Äôt think it would live up to the expectations I had, boy was I wrong! I let the topper sit for a day after I unpacked it, it is super compacted in the shipping box. Then I washed it in my top loader average size washer, used warm water on a delicate cycle. Then I ran it through the dryer, average size. You have to check on it every 10 minutes or so to make sure it drying evenly. Otherwise it can sit too long in one spot where the heat is coming in. I didn‚Äôt want it to get damaged. I used the low heat, cotton setting. Then I put it on the bed, I have a queen size mattress and it fit perfectly!! The sides and elastic are well made, fit nicely and stay it place. Man was I happy when I got into bed that night, and every night since! It is super plush, like sleeping on a feather mattress. It‚Äôs not too soft, it‚Äôs a perfect combination of soft and plush. It doesn‚Äôt leave indentations, meaning when you get out of it, it fluffs back up. Even when I roll over at night and reposition, I don‚Äôt feel an indentation. Every time I wash my sheets, once a week, I rotate the mattress topper 160 degrees. I will wash it every couple months. It‚Äôs so comfortable! I look forward to getting into bed every night! I am so happy with this product! I was thinking I might have to buy two and stack them, if this one wasn‚Äôt soft enough. So happy to find that there was no need for that. Highly, highly recommend this mattress topper. I‚Äôm surprised it‚Äôs so inexpensive, I would‚Äôve paid double for it. The quality of the material and the sewing is top notch! I only have a good things to say about this product.

I love this mattress pad. I haven't washed it yet but looks to be something that I can just throw in our washer and not worry too much about the size (queen). It is very comfortable to sleep on and I love the individual pockets - it keeps all the padding the same in each square. Love it - highly recommend.

So we had purchased a Queen memory foam mattress from Bobs Furniture in 2020. I disliked it from the beginning, but he was partial to it for the 1st couple months, then he eventually agreed with me he didn't like it. I had this issue where he would sink into the mattress and I wouldn't - which created this "sink hole" around him, and if I slept too close to him I would roll right in there and it was really uncomfortable for me. Well I randomly came across this the other night and impulsively ordered it. I wasn't sure how it was going to work out because he likes a firmer bed and I like soft. He thought our mattress was already too soft. BUT we threw it on (totally forgot to stick it in the dryer to fluff it up) and its wonderful. The sink hole has been eliminated and I can now sleep closer to him. It has made our bed so much more comfortable. Even the cats like it! Ever since we put it on, they try to sleep directly on it by our heads lol. Warning: this mattress pad will make your bed so comfy that it's a LOT harder to get out of bed in the morning LOL. Almost forgot to mention how much this thing has helped us with overheating at night. We would wake up super sweaty (thanks memory foam)- haven't had that issue since we put this on. I caught a cold and last night I definitely would have had to change at least 3 times throughout the night if it wasn't for this mattress pad.

name: Keepsmile 100ft Led Strip Lights (2 Rolls of 50ft) Bluetooth Smart App Music Sync Color Changing RGB Led Light Strip with Remote and Power Adapter,Led Lights for Bedroom Room Home Decor Party Festival
description:
Product Description
RGB Led strip lights super vibrant and even shine bright during the day!
Teenager loves them! They have the perfect brightness, multiple options, and works to the sound of music.

	

	




Let the light heal your tired state after work.

	

Let the lighting work with the movie to immerse you.

	

Lights will make your birthday party or holiday party more joyful.

reviews.content:
I purchased the Keepsmile 100ft Led Strip Lights, and I have to say, I'm pretty sure my house can now be seen from space. These things are BRIGHT!

In all seriousness, though, these lights are pretty impressive. They're easy to install and come with everything you need to set them up, including a remote control that lets you switch between colors and modes.

I particularly appreciate that these lights are so long - 100 feet is more than enough to wrap around my entire living room twice. I can now create a disco ball-esque ambiance in my home that would make John Travolta himself jealous.

My only minor complaint about these lights is that the adhesive backing isn't the strongest, so you may need to use some additional tape or glue to keep them in place. But let's be real - when you're creating a light show this epic, a little extra tape is a small price to pay.

Overall, I would definitely recommend the Keepsmile 100ft Led Strip Lights to anyone looking to add a little pizzazz to their home. Just be prepared to don some sunglasses when you turn them on!

These look amazing! But they definitely have their drawbacks. I just happened to have a cable extension that worked with its power supply, it‚Äôs only like 2 feet long from the packaging so you‚Äôll need one unless you don‚Äôt mind messy cables. Also, the remote it came with only worked for about 5 minutes then broke (new batteries didn‚Äôt fix it) but luckily the app that controls it is better than the remote. When you use the app, use some gibberish email, it doesn‚Äôt require you to authenticate it saving you from sharing your actual email. I got it on sale for less than 20$ which is quite the deal for a whole room, but just only. If you can get the strip for <20$ plus a cable extension its a deal, if not look somewhere else.

These seemed to have covered more than 100ft total. I have them in my living room and dining room of my apartment with one box. My room is fully lit up and I had to go underneath the first strip with the second one as it went around most my room. The glue works very well. I recommend turning them on to heat up the glue a little bit so it adheres to the wall easily. The app is very easy to use and is worth it especially if you want to hide the big plug behind a piece of furniture. 10/10 product for me, I will be ordering again when we find our own house because it took me two hours to put them up and don't want to do that in another apartment.

I got two of these for my two daughters (9 and 11). We installed the 1st set with temporary double-sided tape until we were confident of our layout and coverage (using your own tape is a pain). This took maybe an hour to cover the whole room. We were amazed and pleasantly surprised that the strips were long enough to do everything we wanted. We didn't cut or use any connectors. At corners, we simply folded the strip onto itself. Worked great. In our second room, we loved the way the 1st room came out so much that we used the adhesive on the strip itself. Wow! This worked so much better, and faster! 20 minutes and the room was done. Other than brushing off the dust on window frames, we didn't clean the wall or anything and the adhesive stuck great! The folded corners stuck tightly around the windows. In both strips, all LEDs worked perfectly and look great. Amazing spectrum of color and brightness that you can tune via the app and remote. Custom buttons on the remotes that you can program your favorite colors. The app worked perfectly 1st try and lets you set timers for the lights, etc. We're 100% satisfied and recommend these!

The installation process was easy. The strips stick very well to the wall. I did wipe the wall with some alcohol before placing the strips. I had bought two rolls, and they more than covered the perimeter of my room. My room is about 10ft x 10ft, and the two strips overlapped. The colors are very nice. You get to customize three colors. The remote is an 8/10. Overall, I'm pleased with the product. I've had them for about 5 months, and they're still in tack. I couldn't get the blofuetooth phone feature to work, but its ok.

First, the box cover image is very misleading. This light string will only produce 1 color at a time. This is not an addressable strip just RGB.

Second, it states two reels. This requires the power supply to be in the middle of the strips ( the box has a Y to connect the two strips) You can not chain the the strips together. I did test to see if they would light up okay when chained, and they do, but there is not a connector at the end of the strip to allow the next strip to be plugged in (this may be a power and/or saftey "feature"). You cannot put power at one end and expect to run a line 100 feet long as a result.

Out of 1 and 1/4 strips I have up. I have 1 LED that twinkles slightly. Not overly noticeable, but once seen, you can't unsee.

I used Hot Glue ( reasons) so I can't speak to the adhesion

The Mic feature is responsive, however the lights tend to strobe multiple colors rather than dim and brighten with a pre-picked color. ( I would love the team's colors to dim and brighten based off the crowd noise on the TV, instead I get a strobing effect of a bunch of random colors)

Also, the app has some "scenes" that have some predefines. Some are nice and some are obnoxious.there are some that will fade from one color to another but you cannot define the two colors.

FInally, you cannot get a yellow to show up
A good RGB value for yellow is 250, 250,60
However the closet you can get when putting in those value in the app is a color that looks like a saturated 150, 255,200.

I wasn't looking or expecting true color or a lot of features, but slightly disappointed by the lack of yellow, and unable to program a fade from one color to another.

The remote that comes with it does appear to work but only when it wants to, the mobile app is much better and works with bluetooth so no internet of things worries.

These are awesome , had the about 3 weeks and they have not budged . They are 2 rolls but they are 2 rolls connected so you can't just do one roll in one room and one roll in the other lol I didn't know before purchase. The only other issue is they turn off after a while I think maybe they get to hot
But they come back on a few min later. These have been great for the living room :)

I put these lights underneath my bed. Install was simple, the hardest part was initially pulling the plastic off of the back of the adhesive, once i was able to get a little tab separated, it came off without an issue. The 50‚Äô length was way too long and I was able to cut it to a shorter length so I didn‚Äôt have a ton of extra light under the bed. I didn‚Äôt see clear instructions in how to cut it, but I used my experience with led strips and cut in the middle of the gold color dots (not the silver ones) and it worked perfectly fine once I plugged it in. The lights aren‚Äôt the brightest LED‚Äôs on the market and the LED‚Äôs are spaced out a little further than most lights I have used in the past, but for what I was trying to do it worked perfectly. Setting up with the app was pretty simple as long as you know how to use bluetooth and scan a QR code, but my biggest complaint is that some of the colors are not true color matches, for example the yellow is more of yellow green.

Bottom line is that it works well for the money, if you‚Äôre picky and want something super high quality, I recommend you go with something a little more expensive. If you‚Äôre like me and just wanted a decent product at low cost, you should be satisfied with this.

The remote that came with these lights doesnt have the best signal and you have to press the button several times normally. They also aren't the brightest. They were very easy to put up though and can be taken down without fear of damaging the paint underneath.

There was no issues installing the lights. I even had to move them a couple times and they still stick like unbelievably the app is really fun and the lights work really great and they‚Äôre bright and they‚Äôre also dark. They‚Äôre absolutely perfect and I would suggest anybody buy them all up.

aboutProductTopics.name: APP Control and Remote Control: Stick 100 ft led lights around the ceiling, under the cabinets, under the bed frame, and easily control these 100 ft led light strips using either the Keepsmile app or remote control.

Music and Light Dance: 100 ft led lights for bedroom Comes with a high sensitivity audio sensor that flashes in sync with music, you will get amazing experience from the new gorgeous, natural and dynamic light effect.
Special Timer: Led lights for bedroom 100 ft can be used as a light alarm clock, you can set the wake-up time and end time to turn it on/off automatically, your kids will love it.
Flexible Led Strips: Led strips can be bent without worrying about corners.

Easy Installation: With strong adhesive, the led strips lights can be firmly sticked on wooden or lacquer wall and other clean surfaces, Just follow Instructions on manual and you can finish in minutes.Note that it's NOT Waterproof and is designed for indoor use only.
Widely: Anniversary,Birthday,Christmas,Easter,Halloween,Independence Day,Mardi Gras,New Year,Prom,Thanksgiving, wedding or everyday use, these rgb led strip lights can bring you a visual feast.

1. The flexibility of the glass screen protector is the same as the plastic material, is it tempered glass or plastic?

This screen protector is a real tempered glass. The plastic flexibility is the exact reason why we call it tempered glass screen protector. Tempered glass is a type of safety glass that is stronger than ordinary glass.

2. It cannot be seen from the appearance that it is glass or plastic. As a customer, what can we do to identify it?

There is an easy, quick, cost-effective way to test it yourself, and it's very accurate. Most plastics have a melting point between 160 and 210 degrees Celsius, and glass materials are at least over 1400 degrees Celsius, so is there a lighter around?

3. Does it come with a cleaning wipe to use prior to placing on the phone?

Yes, the package includes: 6*Guide Stickers, 3*Wet Wipe&3*Dry Wipe,3*Dust Absorber.

4. How can I remove bubbles?

Use the kit in the package to clean the screen before placing the screen protector. If there are bubbles,try to gently press the bubbles with your finger or with a ruler,but the screen surface needs a thin cloth pad to avoid scratching the protector.

5. How can I remove a cracked glass screen protector?

Lift the screen protector with the card from any corner of the screen protector, then hold the corner and remove slowly. (If you find CHIP or CRACK on the screen protector, for your safety, please wear gloves when removing the screen protector.)

reviews.content: I had tried to install screen protectors that came with the case I recently bought but both attempts were unsuccessful and had places where the protectors didn't adhere. So I was a little skeptical trying another product but decided to give this one a try. I'm glad I did. I followed the instructions to the letter and it lay perfectly flat to the phone screen the very first time. It would be nice if it came with a guide to position the protector like some other products do because I was concerned about alignment but that turned out not to be a problem and I aligned it perfectly. I have only used one out of the pack but I'm extremely happy with it. I keep the phone in my pocket along with a pocket knife and keys and it has not picked up one scratch. It's crystal clear and has no impact on the touch of the phone. I couldn't be happier.

This is a no-brainer. These cost less than $8 for a 3-pack, so it's less than $3.00 to protect your precious phone screen from scratches or damage. Eventually, this will get scratched or show some edge chipping due to you bashing your phone around or dropping it (that's its job). So, just peel it off and you'll see your absolutely flawless screen that is as perfect as the day it came out of the box brand new. Then, clean and make sure no dust or fingerprints or on it and put on another from the box. You'll still have another one left to use. Just be sure to get the right size for you phone.

This Screen Protector is on the small side. It also has a large rectangular cutout at the top, rather than the small cut out for the ear speaker that some other screen protectors have. I'm sure they're cutting every expense they can to deliver at this price (which is a good price). They probably label this same model for several similar sized phones.

It covers the part of the class that contains the image, but leaves a noticeable gap around the edges. I'm using a case as well, so there is not much chance of impact at the exposed areas of the glass. It'll still probably protect my screen, but next time I change it, I'll get one that more closely fits the full glass of my phone.

It's about 3mm too narrow and about 4mm too short to reach the edges of the my phone case. I anticipate the accumulation of dust, dirt, etc. in the gaps. A small issue, but an easily avoidable one. Like I said, I'll probably just pay a wee bit more for a fitted one next time I change it rather than using the extras that came with this one.

My last one was a DBrand and it did not stick well, but it did cover pretty much the whole glass. The DBrand was way overpriced. This one is underpriced. Hmmmm...

I think a lot of people out there can relate who are pretty good a dropping their phone several times every day. I‚Äôm one of them. I got these because they had good reviews. I've gotten to be a pro at putting these screen protectors on, so this one was pretty easy. I didn‚Äôt have any issues. It includes the screen wipe, dust catcher, and the smudge cloth. I was shocked at how long it took for the screen protector to crack. Especially for the price you pay for multiples. It‚Äôs been an overall good product and I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôll purchase them again when I run out!

Easy to install. Everything you need is included. The screen protector provides an added layer of protection for your iPhone screen without interfering with the sensitivity of the touch screen. Once it's installed you can't even tell it's there. Great price for the extra peace of mind.

Bought this product and was weary due to a great deal of it. Thought I might get a very cheap and flimsy screen protector. This was nowhere near what I received. I love this product and the screens have had great durability and life. When I need more I will purchase more of these.

This is exactly what I needed! I failed to read the description because this came with three glass screen protectors when I was only expecting one. This is great because I‚Äôve already cracked one, so now I have two more as backup. (I‚Äôm very rough with my phone apparently üòÇ) The screen protector cracked but kept my new phone age and sound‚Ä¶ just as I had hoped it would do!

The original screen that came with my CASEKOO case interfered on opposite corners of the case and would not seal down onto the phone screen. This screen is slightly smaller - length and width - and fits perfectly. As a result this protector adheres 100% to the phone screen. Highly recommended.
I use this screen protector time and time again. It absolutely does the job, is easy to assemble and grateful that its so cost efficient
The instructions are simple to understand and to do. I like that it comes with three covers. It‚Äôs super nice!!

reviews.content: I decided to research water filters for my shower after my hair dresser commented on how my previously healthy hair had gotten dried out and tangled along with scalp flaking! So after researching what might be the cause of my hair issues, I decided to try the AquaBliss SF100 filter. It arrived the same day that I order it, nice! Even though the reviews stated it was easy to install I procrastinated until the next day, dreading the possible obstacles that MY shower might present! After reading the instructions I decided to take the plunge and try to install it. I was stunned at how easy it was and how the well the water flowed! I had had some previous issues while installing the hand held shower head, so I had reservations about adding an additional gadget. The house is 50 years old. I am now on day two of enjoying and benefiting from the new "clean" water! I use to get out of the shower feeling like a slick film was on my skin, thinking maybe it was the moisturizing bath lotions I use or perhaps the combination of the using after bath moisturizers that maybe some how didn't completely come off during the showering. After my first shower my skin felt wonderful! No more film! I purposely didn't apply an after shower moisturizer because I wanted to enjoy that clean skin feeling!! Day two, I was eager to hop in the shower to experience this new clean feeling once again and this time I did apply the after shower moisturizer and my skin is no longer itchy and feels great! Who looks forward to taking a shower? Lucky people with filtered water, that's who! Wow, what a transformation! I just wish I had found the filter earlier on or even knew that I needed it! Now, just on day two I haven't shampooed yet, but I was so excited about my skin feeling and looking much better (this is being written in the dead of winter, too, so that says a lot) I couldn't wait to do the review! I will update after the shampoo. I didn't test the water before I put the filter on, but the noticeable difference in how clean my skin feels is what matters! Fingers crossed, this will revive my hair, too!! Also, I can't report on the longevity of the filter yet, as it has only been two days. So far it has been well worth it! Glad I took the risk and tried it!

I cannot even begin to say how much I love this filter! I don't think I quite understood how hard the water in my house really is until I installed this. It has made a world of difference! I've gone from hair that looks like I stick my finger in a socket every morning, so soft, healthy looking (and feeling) hair that is manageable and doesn't break at the ends! I have only had this for a short time and even after the first two days I felt and saw a noticeable difference.

The filter is super easy to install and made very little difference in terms of the placement of my shower head. I was a little worried it would make the shower head sit too low and the water stream would hit me in my mid back, but it really didn't change that much at all. It also didn't change the flow of the water at all, which is even more surprising! My boyfriend always complains about low water flow, so this was a particular concern, but he hasn't said anything other than that his skin feels so much better now!

Truly, this thing is amazing, and I'll be buying a replacement on time from now until I live somewhere with better water. Honestly, my hair was falling out, breaking, looked dull and lifeless, and my skin was actually scaly! I've never even had to moisturize my skin, and it was scaly! That all cleared up in the first week with this amazing filter. I cannot recommend it more!

The AquaBliss High Output Revitalizing Shower Filter is a great product that helps to improve the quality of your shower water. This shower filter is designed to remove harmful chemicals and impurities from the water, such as chlorine, heavy metals, and bacteria. The result is a cleaner and more refreshing shower experience. The filter is easy to install and fits most shower heads, and it comes with a replacement filter cartridge, which is easy to replace. The filter also features a unique multi-stage filtration process that provides superior water filtration, resulting in softer, cleaner, and more refreshing water. The filter is also durable and long-lasting, hoping it come up to six months of use before a replacement is needed. Overall, the AquaBliss High Output Revitalizing Shower Filter is a great investment for those who want a cleaner, healthier, and more refreshing shower experience.

This was very easy to install and has lots of extra pieces for continued use in the future. It has everything needed for installation (including plumber's tape). Once installed I noticed result immediately. I have very hard water to the point where the tops of my bottles have build up on them (never experienced that before in all the places I've lived). Skin had always been dry after showers and had to put oil in my hair because water was so hard. After filter installation my hair was instantly soft after showers and didn't need to use oil anymore. Skin is also much less dry and doesn't itch as much.

Con: didn't seem to last as long as I had hoped (but may just be the fact that water is so hard).

I don't care one bit about all the nonsense with infusing vitamins in the water etc, we just needed something to filter out the chlorine from the city water for my wife's hair coloring. This seems to really do the job. If the water flow is reduced, it is by VERY little. I don't know if it is all in my head or not but the water does feel a bit softer and more pleasant now but not so soft as to make rinsing less effective.

Yeah, it's super easy to install and they even provide a full roll of Teflon tape.

I just received my second one, and it‚Äôs leaking at the middle part so I‚Äôm not sure why, it doesn‚Äôt start leaking till mid shower. The first one we got never leaked so going to make sure it isn‚Äôt anything on us but I truly don‚Äôt think it is. Otherwise so far it‚Äôs not bad. I haven‚Äôt noticed a huge difference when showering tho but it is nice to know we aren‚Äôt getting straight well water on our skin.

I'm on a well and the filter restricts the water pressure. It would take a long time to fill the bathtub which is what I wanted to use it for. It was installed on my handheld shower at the bathtub, OK for just standing in the tub and letting filtered water go over my legs , I'm 86 and not able to stand for any length of time so bath is the best.

My skin and hair have improved since installing this. My town has very hard water, that was causing KP, skin & scalp irritation, and hair loss. I have some baby hairs growing back, my KP has almost entirely cleared up, and my skin isn‚Äôt itchy after every shower. Hair & skin are soft again. So glad I purchased this, and will be buying replacement filters as needed. And it comes with plumbers tape!

I moved into a new place where the water is very harsh, so I got this; my hair is noticeably softer; I've only used it a few times so far, so I haven't seen any significant difference in my skin health yet.

I went somewhere that had a water softening system and it drastically healed my flare ups around my side and the corners of my mouth. So I decided to buy a single shower filter to truly test if softening the water helps and it does. Absolutely love how my skin feels and reacts to the softer water. Truly amazing for my eczema flare ups, they're practically nonexistent now. Great product. I've been using the shower head for a little over a month now. No breaks, leaks or anything. Thanks. :)

reviews.content: Oh my gosh, get these rings. Especially if you are the type of person who changes their shower curtain for the seasons and washes the lining regularly. I can't believe I've spent my days standing on the tub's edge unlatching, unhooking, re-hooking, then re-latching, ring by ring for years! This is such a simple solution to such a stupid problem. It's not even a problem anymore. I feel like a moron for not buying this sooner.
These hooks are the best idea anybody has ever had. Soooooo much easier to hang a new shower liner! No more struggling to unclasp the plastic hook. Best money I think I've ever spent üòÅ

This is my third set of chrome shower hangers. Finally, one it works really well. The rings are plenty big enough to slide easily when the shower curtain bar. (My other ones were too tight and didn't slide so easily.)

But what I like best about these, is when I need to take off the liner in order to wash and bleach it to get rid of mildew, I don't have to take the outer carton off. But rather, I can just easily lift the inner curtain off! Makes things so easy!

I'm very happy with these!

I have purchased two sets of these now, and will never go back to regular hooks!

For starters, the convenience of being able to take one curtain off without moving the other is unbeatable. It sounds silly, but it really does make a difference! Not only that, the hooks themselves are very sturdy, and I love that they don't fall off the rod, nor do my curtains fall off the hooks!
They're fairly easy to put up, I do notice that the opening is a little narrowing than a normal hook, however I feel this adds to the benefit since they won't pop off.

I've also had to remove these due to a move, and they came off very easily with no damage!

Lastly, the first set I had held up for well over a year! The only reason I bought a second set is because we ended up having a second bathroom - the first set is still going strong with no damage or issues!

Highly recommend these :)
Super Convenient. It is the easiest thing to hang and remove shower curtains. I ended up purchasing 3 more from my other 3 bathrooms. I love this
Great product, really sleek and lends to an overall more clean aesthetic. This was my first time seeing these and I‚Äôm glad I bought them. 10/10 recommend
I like to use a vinyl shower curtain plus a clothe curtain. I love changing the cloth curtain out frequently‚Ä¶seasons, holidays‚Ä¶this makes it SO much easier!!!

This item works fantastic. Easy to install and glide so nice. My shower curtain liner is a breeze to remove to wash. My old shower curtain hooks were terrible. So hard to move across the rod. This works great. I am very pleased. I highly recommend.
These are working perfectly on our new shower curtain and liner. Apologies to the seller for mistakenly submitting feedback for the wrong product.

These slide so much better than the ones I had. The rollers help so much. The only issue I've had so far is that the cheap plastic liner come off one of the hooks now and then when you slide the shower curtain open and closed again. Like I said, It's a cheap plastic liner. The dollar store kind. Hopefully it will work better when we put the polyester fabric liner back on.

description:
Product Description
CERAKOTE CERAMIC HEADLIGHT RESTORATION KIT - Permanently Restore Your Headlights to Like-New Condition
Restore & Protect Your Headlights In 3 Easy Steps - No Power Tools Required - Will Last as Long as You Own Your Vehicle

Cerakote was founded in 1984 with a mission to develop and manufacture the highest performing line of ceramic coatings in the world. Our focus on high performance applications has spanned industries from automotive, to firearms, high-end electronics, aerospace and more. Cerakote ceramic coatings are used to coat and protect countless consumer and industrial products that you depend on every day.

STEP 1

Easily remove surface oxidation with our proprietary Oxidation Remover Wipes.

STEP 2

Use the provided ergonomic Surface Prep Pad and Discs to remove deep oxidation and any light scratches.

STEP 3

Simply wipe on our proprietary, durable ceramic coating to restore your headlights to a like-new condition that will last as long as you own your vehicle.

reviews.content:
I did a ton of research and watch a ton of videos on different kits. This kit is the only one I found that guarantees for the life of the vehicle. Keep receipts and purchase history. I was blown away at the results. It took a 2 hours to do but I really made sure I did everything correct. I hardly bust a sweat on this it‚Äôs that easy lol. The gloves kinda suck that‚Äôs the only thing I will say. Other then that this kit is great! I was looking to replace the headlights but that was upwards of $500 for the headlights no labor. So I gambled on this and it worked perfectly. Again u won‚Äôt regret this purchase just watch some review videos and follow instructions 100%. Also as a tip the ceramic dries fast so don‚Äôt remove tape till it‚Äôs dry u don‚Äôt want to touch it when it‚Äôs drying. It‚Äôs rare for me to be this happy with a purchase and I felt like I had to review this for everyone. Enjoy the pics.

UPDATE: I woke up today before the sunrise and I can see there is a little bit haze on my headlight. It‚Äôs not a perfect kit after all. U can‚Äôt see the haze when lights are off. It is a lot brighter and it‚Äôs better then before so it‚Äôs still a WIN but be aware there will be a little weird haze on headlight afterwards.

Its a quality restoration kit. Estimate on box is 30 minutes, but for me it was 30 minutes per headlight so an hour in total. Don't know how long it will last but I did it to both my truck and my wife's CRV. Headlights feel and look almost new with this kit if you put the elbow grease into it. Need to do a decent amount of wet sanding with the pad provided in the kit. Take your time with the 2000 grit to get the big scratches out, and likewise with the 3000 grit to get that fine finish. Your headlights should be a consistent milky fog when your done. They also recommend a water spray bottle. I learned at the autobody shop to use a bucket of water and either a sponge or a washcloth instead of spray bottle. Put the sponge in one hand and the sand paper in the other. Place the sponge above your sanding area and slowly squeeze letting out a constant stream of water as you sand. When the sponge or washcloth is empty simply dunk it back in the water bucket and continue the process. If you cut corners on the sanding you will have blemishes on your headlights, so take your time. I will update later to see how long the cerakote lasts.

In short this product really works. My 15-year-old car had very cloudy headlights. I was prepared to replace the headlights. I got a quote from a repair shop for almost $1,000 for new headlights and the labor to replace the headlights.

I searched and researched a lot to see which is the best headlight restoration kit. I landed on this one and figure it's less than 20 bucks might as well take a shot. As I was going through step one and step two I saw my headlights were becoming even more really cloudy and Scratched up. I thought I damaged my headlights and wasted 20 bucks. But no joke after step three it's just like a miracle happened and the perfect headlights came through crystal clear. I could not believe it. This is magic. This was some of the best $17 and change I've spent on a product. Thank you! I'm going to buy another pack for my other.

And no power tools required!

Be careful when you do step 3. you pretty much have to do it in one shot. Follow the instructions. Do overlapping swipes from top to bottom. If you try to keep going back and forth it will kind of get smudged and it won't look as clear. Also I recommend that you mask around the headlights with blue painters masking tape because as you scrub the headlights you can potentially damage your paint job.

This is definitely a "Trust the process" kind of situations. Your headlights start out cloudy, then you're effectively scratching it up even more and making them worse... until the last step.

Step 1: Tape off all surrounding areas. This ensures you don't scratch your paint. Then use the four oxidation removal pads. One after another, giving it a good moderately firm scrub. Once the pad turns yellow, toss and go onto the next one. Once all four are done, clean the surface with water and microfiber cloth.

Note - If this gets on your paint, just wipe it off right away.

Step 2: Use red pad with spray bottle filled with water, apply moderately-light pressure in singular and consistent direction to start scuffing up the lens. It's important you use a lot of water and continue back and forth in the same direction. Do this for a few minutes until you feel like you no longer understand what's happening. Then rinse and go onto the grey applicator. Do the same process. This is refining those scratch marks.

Rinse completely and dry with microfiber again. Your headlight should be cloudy. This doesn't reel right, does it. It actually looks worse.

Step 3: Completely dry lens, use ONE ceramic applicator pad and with a top to down motion, go from one side to another. Always overlapping 50%.

Step back. Let it dry and be amazed.

Final thoughts: Honestly, trust the process. I can't speak for longevity as I just applied it yesterday. I almost want to put a clear coat on it, but this was cheap enough where if I have to do it again in a year, it's not a big deal. I'll then put a 2X clear coat on afterwards. But dang, did it ever do the job I was looking for. Also, I'd assume if your headlights were worse than mine, you'd probably spend more time on step 2. Overall, I spent one hour for both headlights.

This stuff is awesome. I gave the car a good bath beforehand and then went to work on sprucing up the headlights! Beyond having detailed instructions on the box, they also had a YouTube video you could follow along as well. The only extra materials I needed was some microfiber cloths, painters tape, gloves (I have tiny hands, the provided sets didn‚Äôt work for me) and a spray bottle with water. It was very easy! Took more time to tape up the car then to sand the lights. As other said, it WILL look cloudy when you‚Äôre about to do step 3, just keep going! The ‚Äúreveal‚Äù step of the step 3 with the wipes is SO satisfying. Gave me goosebumps, haha. Going to get another box and do my mom‚Äôs car!

I‚Äôm sure there are fancy and more precise/detailed ways to really amp up this product! For someone who doesn‚Äôt know what they‚Äôre doing with car cleaning/detailing, I am more than happy with my results. Thanks for making such an awesome product that all skill sets can use!

I looked at replacing my wife's headlights on her Mazda with Adaptive Feature, ( they point in the direction you turn). They were $600.00 plus for each one. So, I decided to try this product first. I had used other products that promised good results but they performed poorly. I followed the instructions to refinish them with Cerakote Headlight Restoration Kit and both headlights now look great. Pretty simple process that most people could do it. I think they left one KEY step in the instructions. I was very careful when sanding the lens but I did scratch the paint in a couple of areas that butts up against the lens. This was on the first headlight. I taped off the second lens and I didn't have any scratches. I used Painters Tape so as not to leave any residue on the fender. Add this one step and you will be much happier when you don't have to try and buff out the scratches in the paint surrounding the lens! By the Way! I used a leaf blower on the lenses to dry they before applying the final coat. I didn't have an air compressor as suggested in the instructional demo.

This kit includes two small circles each of 2000 and 3000 grit sandpaper. My headlights had half a clear coat on them, probably left over from a previous repair. When I sanded them down with the provided sandpaper, there was a very clear difference between the two sections and I didn't want to apply the clear coat until it was uniform. Couldn't get it off with 2k. Luckily I had some fine sandpaper lying around, but I had to go all the way down to 200 (!!!) before I could remove the old clear coat. Then I had to work my way back up through 600, 800, 1000, 1200, 1500, and then use the provided 2000 and 3000 grit. If I hadn't had sandpaper on hand I would have been screwed.

If your headlights are blotchy like mine were, it might be better to get a kit with a drill attachment. This was like four hours of hand sanding. Would have been ten minutes if not for the old clear coat, but oh well.

Other than that, the resin wipes were magical. Super cool to see it instantly take effect as you slide the wipe across. Take your headlights off the car and apply the resin in a dust-free space! I have a little bit of marring, really not noticeable until you look at it but not absolutely perfect. However, for twenty bucks vs $1-2k for a new pair of headlights, I can't complain.

I can't rate longevity yet. I'm expecting a couple years; if they start to fade within the year I'll adjust my review.

I ordered this for my 2004 jeep Grand Cherokee. The headlights were crap. Like you couldn't even tell they were on at night barely. I figured I would try this stuff before buying new headlight lenses. Needless to say I do not have to purchase new lenses cause this stuff took 90 percent of the oxidation off my lenses. I was shocked how well I could see at night. I did not think this stuff worked so well. I would highly recommend this to anyone who can't afford new lenses for there vehicle. It does take some time and you can't drive for a couple hours after applying it. So make sure you don't need to go anywhere soon after. That's the only downside of I had to give one. I don't think that's bad at all though

I treated my 2011 Prius headlights with the Ceracote Ceramic Headlight Restoration Kit today. What a great improvement! The headlights on my car (after 180,000 miles) had become heavily oxidized and likely were putting out much less light then when they were new. The restoration kit used a 3 step treatment involving a de-oxidation step (involving multiple treated wipes to chemically remove the oxidation layer), a step that follows this by preparing the headlights (by a medium and separate fine sanding of the surfaces of the headlights) for a hard ceramic coating, and then applying that ceramic coating to the treated headlights. I had had these headlights "treated" at my Toyota dealer previously and found that that treatment had a minimal impact and degraded soon afterwards. The Ceracote treatment returned the headlights to their original cleanliness. Great product......

Very easy to use and it works. Can‚Äôt say yet how well it works for any length of time, but it definitely makes the headlights on both of my old Lexus vehicles look amazingly better. It did not remove the minute cracks inside the lenses, but I didn‚Äôt expect it to do so either. But, it did take the dull, yellowish hue and turn it back to clear, making them both look SO much better. I was able to use half and save the rest for later, just in case. One is in a garage in Mississippi and the other is a bit more exposed to the elements on an island on the Pacific, so we‚Äôll see how it works longterm. Hope to remember to update in a few months on both.
