GUARANTEED TO LAST AS LONG AS YOU OWN YOUR VEHICLE! - You read it right! We're so confident in our CERAMIC coating that we'll stand behind our limited lifetime warranty that it will last as long as you own your vehicle, or we'll cover the next kit for free. Our chemists developed this kit IN HOUSE at Cerakote HQ. We aren't re-bottling another company's product. This is a CERAMIC coating that chemically bonds to your headlights and provides UV protection for as long as you'll own your vehicle.

NO POWER TOOLS REQUIRED - Everything is included in your kit. There are no tools required that could potentially damage your headlights or paint. There's nothing worse than having to call your crazy uncle you haven't seen since the holidays because he's got the power tools you need. After he hollers "STAND CLEAR!!", fires up his wheezing disk sander, runs it off of your headlight and across the paint on your hood.. It's too late. DON'T BUY A KIT THAT REQUIRES TOOLS!

RESTORES AND PROTECTS FROM UV! - This isn't the classic bait-and-switch you're used to. We won't sell you something that needs to be purchased again in a few months. Our CERAMIC coating provides a layer of UV protection that is guaranteed to stand the test of time. We believe in providing our customers the best products on earth, the first time. After all, we're the chemists that have been providing world-class ceramic coatings to endless industries for DECADES. It's what we do.

3 EASY STEPS! - Cerakote's Headlight Restoration Kit is a simple, 30 minute process. Step 1: You'll be mesmerized by our Oxidation Remover as you wipe away the hazy surface oxidation. Step 2: Use our ergonomic surface prep pad to remove the deep oxidation and prep your headlight for the CERAMIC clear coating. Step 3: Cerakote's pre-moistened Ceramic Headlight Restoration Wipes restore your headlights to a like-new condition that is backed by our limited lifetime warranty.

WHY TRUST CERAKOTE? ‚Äì Cerakote is regarded as the world‚Äôs leading innovator and manufacturer of true inorganic ceramic polymer technology. The ceramic polymers and coatings produced at Cerakote‚Äôs US facility are trusted by some of the most advanced aerospace, automotive and technology companies in the world. Rely on the industry leader to protect what matters to you.

name: Funight KN95 Face Masks 50 Pack 5-Ply Breathable Filter Disposable Face Masks Black
description: Product Description

reviews.content:
I‚Äôm pleased to report these work well for me. They fit well, are sturdy and comfortable, and they feel safe because there are no gaps. They seem to last awhile, too, which I like because I don‚Äôt want to add a ton of non-biodegradable masks to landfill. I prefer to keep several masks in rotation, airing them when they are not in use, so that I can re-use them. (It‚Äôs 3years into the pandemic, I live in NYC and ride the subway, yet haven‚Äôt gotten Covid yet.)

I would buy these again. I searched like crazy for masks on a par with a very expensive type my mother-in-law kindly sent us at the beginning of the pandemic. This is the first mask I‚Äôve found that matches those for sturdiness, durability, fit, and safety.

These measure 6-3/8 inches from top to bottom (measuring from point to point of the folded mask) and 4-1/4 inches from the widest point side to side on a folded mask. Unfolded, that would be 8-1/2 inches wide.

The design is such that the masks come deeply under my chin, which I like because it provides great coverage. I have what I‚Äôd describe as a medium sized face. I do find these masks comfortable‚Äîhowever, I do not put the ear loops around my ears. Rather, I use a lace and tie the mask on in back, using the ear loops. I find wearing masks this way to be far more comfortable, and I can control how tight I want the mask to be.

My only minor complaint is that these masks smell a bit mildewed straight out of the box. To address this, I leave the mask in a sunny window 24 hours before wearing it. A very faint smell lingers. For that reason, if half stars were available, I‚Äôd give these 4.5 stars. But on consideration, I decided not to knock off a star, because I‚Äôm so pleased with these for all the reasons that are most important to me.

I'm long winded, so I'll give you the punchline first:

For the price, these masks:
1] are much better than I expected

2] have some amount of variation in strap length that doesn't matter for my shape/size of face but could matter for small faces

3] have all the "right" markings, although to me that's no guarantee of a mask not being counterfeit

4] are lightweight and comfortable for my face

5] don't seal wonderfully around the bridge of my nose when exhaling; fogs up glasses/sunglasses. Seems to seal fine when inhaling. In other words, low risk of outside air sneaking in unfiltered, highly likely unfiltered exhaled air from you would get out. Don't wear these around your high risk grandma if you are trying to protect her from you.

6] definitely have 5 distinct layers (see picture).

Long-winded verson:
As with any commercial product nowadays, it's hard to know what to expect after reading reviews. The most vocal and emotional reviewers are generally those that get a crappy product and are understandably upset. When I'm shopping for the best value version of any cheap, mass produced item, I fully expect there to be some percentage of products that made it out the door with defects.
That said, the box of Funight masks that I just received are much better than I expected. I haven't opened every single mask up, so there may be some in this box that have some of the issues mentioned in other reviews (ear straps that easily detach for instance), but so far so good. At this price, I'll be happy if 3/4 of these don't have defects.
I don't claim to be a filtration expert, but I know enough about filtration media to know that the type of material matters much more than the amount. In this case, for anyone basing their choice on these masks having 5 layers as advertised, they do; I attached a picture of a section cut out showing all 5 layers seperated. I wouldn't have been too surprised if they didn't at this price, but hey, I'll take it!
Also, all of the "correct" markings ("KN95" and "GB 2626-2019") are thermally compressed into the mask, not that I personally think that means anything. I can't imagine there is some reason that counterfeiters can't put the right markings on their masks; relying on that as an indicator of masks being legitimate makes about as much sense as looking for markings that say "counterfeit" on counterfeit masks.
These Funight masks are really comfortable for me, and do a great job of sealing around my face, except up over my nose, where they do allow some air to flow out and fog up any glasses/sunglasses I might be wearing. They're no worse than the accordian/surgeon style masks I've worn previously though.
They are comfortable over my nose, but all masks I've tried that don't have an extra strip of rubber/foam to help seal don't do a very good job for me, even some very uncomfortably tight N95 masks don't get this part right. For reference, I'd guess I have a medium size face/head for a man.
I have recently tried some 3M 9205+ masks that seal amazingly well over my nose while still being comfortable in that area. There are other drawbacks though; mainly price (about 4x the price of these Funights) but also they aren't nearly as comfortable to me as these KN95 style masks with earloops instead of full head straps. I use the 3M N95 masks if I feel the situation is more critical; i.e. I'm in a high risk area (crowded with lots of random people) or if I'm getting on an airplane.
I bought these Funight masks to use in more "everyday" situations that I don't expect to be particularly high risk, but I'd like to be wearing something more effective than a cloth mask or a single or double layer accordion style mask.
The only quality control issue I've seen thus far is, as lots of other reviews have mentioned, the ear loop lengths vary noticeably from one mask to another. Thus far all of the lengths have been fine for me; none have been too tight; some have been a little loose but putting one twist in the ear loop has been enough to get it just right. The straps seem to have a lot of stretch, so the batch I have would probably be fine for someone with a larger head than me, but might be too loose for someone with a really small face/head.

Not sure if it‚Äôs just my ears back after wearing the mask for 6+ hours at work the back of my ears begin to hurt. I can feel and see the earloops cutting into my skin. I also wear glasses so it adds extra pressure. If you‚Äôre wearing the mask on and off then you‚Äôll be fine. Just keep in mind that keeping the mask for entender period of time may lead to external ear pain or cuts. The mask itself is good but at times can feel like your just breathing your own air and that no air is able to escape through the very faint openings.

I HAVE BEEN USING THESE FOR OVER 7 MONTHS AND THEY WORK GREAT FOR ME. I HAVE THEM ON FOR 8 HOURS A DAY AT WORK. EVERYONE IN MY OFFICE HAS GOTTEN SICK MORE THEN ONCE. I STILL HAVE NOT. Might BE LUCK BUT I THINK IT HAS HELPED ALOT HAVING THESE MASKS. I have not had any ear straps brake they hold up very well

I traveled to Europe, which meant a 10 hour long haul flight, and a few extra flights sprinkled in as well. The ear straps inevitably made my ears a bit sore, but especially with a 10 hour flight I think that is to be expected. They come packaged in tens, so it was great to just have one pack on my person and the others packed in my checked bag. They are durable and I was never bothered or annoyed with them, they worked very well. The only thing is my ears getting sore, but there is probably a work around for that and also likely going to happen with any mask. They feel quality, and I do think they helped keep me safe from germs while traveling in these weird times we live in. Definitely recommend as I will be buying more when I run out!
This was a good buy for a mask. Very breathable, I could use an extra inch of elastic band, it occasionally slips off my ears. I have no problem wearing it while working out .
I have placed these mask on repeat order. They are lightweight and provide the comfort I have grown to need during this time.
The face mask fits well including the adjustable nose area. Granddaughter wanted black. They are packaged by 10‚Äôs which is nice. Order arrived quickly. A good purchase.

The ear straps are a bit short. But, they can be stretched some to make the mask more comfortable. The mask is softer than some KN95s I‚Äôve had previously. Does keep its shape mostly, but will mash easily. The black mask has a white lining which can show around the edges.

Appreciate that they come vacuum sealed in a few separate bundles. Takes some adjustment to not fog glasses, but that's how a lot of masks are. Haven't gotten sick again despite being surrounded by sick people at work.

aboutProductTopics.name: Make sure this fits by entering your model number.
Mask
Imported
cloth

Funight Ventilation Series KN95 Face Masks follow the GB2626-2019 respiratory protection standards. These standards require all masks to have a filtration efficiency of at least 95%, which means the material can filter out harmful molecules such as fine particles and dust.

Funight Ventilation Series KN95 Face Masks maintains a strict filtration efficiency standard while keeping the design comfortable and breathable. Each KN95 mask is composed of water column grade melt-blown fabric, which has been proven to be more efficient than cloth masks due to its electrostatic properties. Though this design, Funight Ventilation Series KN95 Mask has achieved breathing resistance that is 20% better than that of the GB2626-2019 standard.

Funight Black Face Mask: Increasing the width of the ear loop to 5.5 mm reduces pain on ear and makes it more comfortable. And the ultrasonic welding technology we use make the surfaces of two objects form a fusion between the molecular layers, without any rough stitches and thread ends, and make the ear hook stronger.

5-Ply Layers of Protective Filtration ‚Äì Our KN95 mask are truly made of 5 layers with 2 non-woven outer layers as well as 2 melt-blown inner layers and a non-woven middle layer to absorb small moisture particles. Which is more protective than 3-ply disposable mask to help filter out 95% of particles.

Disclaimer: This KN95 mask is NOT an N95 mask. For more information about KN95 masks please see the following before you purchase: amazon.com/AboutKN95s. Please check the outer packaging for product shelf life. Expiration date: 3 years

reviews.content:
Some of these pens are great
Some of them begin to leak out of the writing tip within an hour.
I grabbed these pens to document just specific items in production at work. So maybe 6 short sentences per day. On the first day of use, I completed my 6 short sentences and then noticed my fingers were coated in the ink. I figured i grabbed a dud and the rest will be fine.
I just grabbed out a 4th pen today and once again, my hands are coated in purple ink about 2 sentences in. So 2 out of the 4 that I have used, leak almost immediately. I am not pressing hard, throwing the pens around or anything similar.

Sooooooo, love the pens that work as they should. I am assuming that about half of these pens are leaky and the other half might be as described

I loveeeeee these pens. I have purchased them consistently for at least five years for my classroom. I have them in every purse that I own, and I've never had an issue with them leaking. They are just great.

I bought a new planner for this year and purchased the pens to use. I love the colors they are vibrant so not run. Great selection of colors as well. I use this in my prayer/sermon journal as well. The ink does not bleed through. Great value and product!

These pens are so great for journaling, writing in planners, jotting notes ‚Ä¶ they don‚Äôt bleed, they are fine tipped & vibrantly colored! And there‚Äôs more than the ‚Äúaverage‚Äù color selection! I love these pens!
I have used Le Pen to write notes and hate how quickly they push down. These are much sturdier and perfect for note writing. Surprised by the quality!

I love these pens - great for art, journaling, whatever you want to do. There's a nice selection of colors and the colors are pretty saturated. The only thing is the tip is really thin and soft and seem very easily broken - in fact, one of my markers was shipped with a split tip. Oh well
These are great pens. I use them for writing in my calendars and planners. Lots of colors to choose from and the point writes very smoothly.

They're really thin, but write well enough. I just got them today so I can't really say whether or not they last very long but they're okay. I'm happy enough. They're more like a marker than a pen though.

I adore these. I like color-coding my work calendar so these are perfect. Thin point and nice opaque colors. Thin, lightweight, and easy to hold!

All the colors are written on a standard yellow post-it note, for reference.

I like the fine tip and the smooth writing experience. I love the colors. One little thing I realized after using it is it would be great to have the basic ink (black and blue) more in number instead of the lighter ink color. Overall great experience.

name: Tenmiro Led Lights for Bedroom 100ft (2 Rolls of 50ft) Music Sync Color Changing LED Strip Lights with Remote and App Control 5050 RGB LED Strip, LED Lights for Room Home Party Decoration
description:
Product Description
TENMIRO 100 FT LED strip lights, let indirect lighting brighten your life, create more color for the room

Color changing lights bring more fun to your party

reviews.content:
El producto es sencillo, pero de buena calidad. Tiene una buena calidad en t√©rminos de la flexibilidad, dise√±o, intensidad de luz, y app. Aunque huele un poco feo reci√©n salido de la caja.

En realidad es un buen producto, solo que requiere de varias consideraciones al momento de usar.

Por ejemplo, es mejor la luz indirecta que directa. Por eso la tira es mejor ubicarla de forma oculta para que no se vean los LEDs. Pareciera obvio, pero a√∫n as√≠ pasa.

Es preferible cortar la tira seg√∫n lo que necesitamos que gastarla toda y tener una luz saturada o mediocre.

Recomiendo ubicar la luz LED sin pegarla para ver como se ve la luz en la est√©tica general antes de empezar a pegarla porque aunque es f√°cil de remover con un poco de fuerza puede que se rompa. Adem√°s el adhesivo es tan bueno que se vuelve imposible poder guardarlo de nuevo.

Por eso una vez se empiece a pegar es mejor estar seguros de d√≥nde queremos que quede.

Las tiras que sobren sirven para despu√©s ya sea para alargar tramos de LED o para aplicar en otros lugares. Solo toca comprar los componentes adicionales para ello.

We added these lights into a soffit lighting space in the ceiling. The remote allows us to easily change the lighting color to the colors already programmed into the remote, but when trying to get it to play to music we learned that we have to get an app, create an account, use an iPhone, etc. Some of the quick lighting changes it can do can be annoying in a home environment - unless you're having a party of course! Overall these can add a lot of ambiance to an otherwise plain room. They show up pretty well in daylight too.

My daughter loves these lights and now I need to buy two more sets for the other kids.

Only issue to warn about is make sure to not place the power supply/RF receiver close to a television. When you perform certain functions in the TV remote (at least it Samsung) it will interfere with the lights - will change them to blinking/change color /etc.

Other than that, easy to use with the mobile app and a lot of fun with the different colors and features.

Update: partner was able to fix box and get the other half lit again. Some lights still the wrong color though. Happy they‚Äôre on again!

These took like 2 hours to place carefully around the entire kitchen, dining room, and bathroom, but it made the rooms look soooo cool. I should have listened to the reviews because about 50 feet of the entire roll has stopped working. And some of the strip is colors it shouldn‚Äôt be. I‚Äôve had LED strips in the past that lasted years! (Wish I remembered which brand lol). So I‚Äôm pretty surprised how quickly these failed. Knew it was a red flag when the lights didn‚Äôt have that plastic coating.
Also, half the remote doesn‚Äôt work. The adjustable brightness is great though and they look cool when they do work.

The strips are in 3 foot segments that cannot be shortened easily.
The BT app to control lights works pretty well sometimes need to turn on/off a couple times for the unit to respond. Haven‚Äôt used remote much, but with limited use not impressed and will most likely toss it in a drawer and only use app to control the lights.

For the most part am happy with the product except for the excessive segments lengths.

I purchased for tv backlighting and now searching through Amazon to see if how I can complete my project without it looking like a toddler did it!

Will state good product, but make sure to measure your requirements for it to make sure 3 foot segments will work for you when cutting to fit.

I am reluctant to stick anything on the walls like this, but we ended up doing these in all three of our girls bedrooms and they look great! Installation was easy and went quickly. They stick great, but I also don‚Äôt think we will have any issue taking them down later when the kids are over them. Would recommend!

These were so cheap and there was enough to go all the way around my daughter‚Äôs room. They work great with the remote. We downloaded the app but haven‚Äôt used it too much yet. Playing the lights to music is kind of a pain because you have to upload the songs into the app for the lights - does not easily play with songs streamed from other apps. Still, very affordable and happy with purchase.

Easy to install and beautiful to look at. These will react to music and even the noise of someone speaking. There are so many options on the settings. The control is awesome as well but the best part is the phone application. You can control color of lights, and set them up for music.

My room was small enough to do in one roll. If you're room is bigger, it is advisable to realize you should pick a middle starting point so that you can start in one direction and then continue in the other to try to meet in the middle. You cannot (read: should not) attempt to solder them one end to the other to "extend them".

Installation was easy. I cleaned the area with water and let it dry. Make it easy on yourself, unroll a bit with the adhesive still on and hold it up where you want it. While holding it in place, pull the protective strip away and press the strip to the wall. This keeps you from having sections that are not quite lined up. Keep repeating unrolling a bit more and progressing down the wall while removing small portions of the protective strip until you are done. The remote is basic and needs LOS (it's an IR remote). If you are cool with using the app you can completely hide the power box as it uses wifi. Colors are a bit off (it's a cold white (closer to blue) but for the price, I wasn't expecting any sort of accurate coloring. Looks great and I love it!
The only problem I had with it was that I couldn‚Äôt figure out the remote. More than likely my fault, otherwise the product is as to be expected!

However, I merely wipe the top of my keyboard keys and was looking for something to get in between them. This does not do that. It leaves It's residue on top of the keys and does not get in between. I turned my computer off and really pushed this stuff in between. Yes, it left It's residue on the small amount of side keys it did infiltrate. Oh well. I still use it for my vents, dashboards, steering wheel and doors.

I'm pretty surprised at how well this works. It came to me well packaged, in a sealed container. I am constantly cleaning my phone, but somehow the volume button became stuck. I decided to give this a try. It took literally 5 seconds to fix the phone.

reviews.content:
There is a long distance from my home to my company, I usually drive for work and business travel. So I like to look through Amazon to find some car accessories which would make my driving process more convenient and comfortable. This time I purchased the Drop Stop Car Seat Gap Filler and YRU Car Phone Holder and both of them really enhanced my driving experience.

The Drop Stop Car Seat Gap Filler was used to resolve the issue with phones, keys and other items falling into areas that are difficult to reach between the front seats and console and I'm extremely pleased with the effect. ¬†Since I purchased the YRU Car Phone Holder, I habitually put my phone in the phone holder when I get in the car, it literally has saved me hundreds of times from dropping my employee card, keys,or any item falling off underneath the seat.

When it comes to the YRU Leather Panel Car Phone Holder, I have to say it's an accessory that helps me drive safer, this little mountable phone holder for the car is so easy to install and dependable, I just took a few minutes to attach the holder which has a very powerful suction to the dashboard of my car. The cell phone is at a good height and the long arm of the holder is just the perfect distance for me to reach my phone without looking down. For the hundreds of times I have put my phone in and taken it out it has never loosened. It is easy to squeeze the side arms to set the phone then squeeze again to release it. I can easily tilt it up, down, to the right or left to place it so I can see and hear my GPS system or speak hands free and avoid to pull my eyes far away from the road to make me drive safer. I feel safer with my phone in such a secure holder, I would definitely recommend this product!

About Drop Stop Car Seat Gap Filler, Each package comes with 2 Drop Stops (1 for the driver side and 1 for the passenger side; universal fit). You also get two bonus gifts; a Slide Free Pad and an LED Credit Card Light. The sellers are very generous and the bonus gifts are very practical.

When I eat something in my car it is difficult to avoid some food falling down in the gap between the front seats and console that I couldn't reach, I couldn't reach it with the vacuum, and it was just a mess. Since getting the Drop Stop Car Seat Gap Filler, I don't have such distress anymore! Not to mention, when I drop my phone, bottle lids, Air pod, etc. down the crack between the seat and armrest and can't reach it, now everything just lands on this gap filler and is easy to pick up.

In addition to avoiding the hassle of dropping something under your seat, there is a safety factor here - avoiding bending my head to look for something that fell while driving. I like the YRU phone holder also because of the safety factor, with the phone holder, I‚Äôve been able to put my phone very close to my line of sight and avoid taking my eyes off the road while driving.

I highly recommend the Drop Stop Car Seat Gap Filler and YRU Car Phone Holder. Sometimes, a small investment can make driving safer and more comfortable.

This is the second set of these we have purchased. It's a very simple solution to one of those PIA things we've all encountered - having something fall out of your pocket when you are driving and end up trapped between your seat and the center console. If you're lucky you'll have a lot of room under the seat to grab whatever you dropped out from under the seat. If not, you'll find yourself practically lying on the back seat floor shredding your arm to pieces trying to fish your item out among the wiring and metal seat frame.
These gap fillers work perfectly to prevent this from happening and seem to fit just about any car. Installation takes nothing more than putting the seat belt buckle through the hole in gap filler and then push it into the space between the seat cushion and the center console. It's as simple as that and you'll never have to go fishing for things under the seat again. Best of all, they last forever and you can move them from car to car. Highly recommended.

These things were easy as pie to install. Once installed the seats can still move back and forth with no twisting or shifting of the gap fillers. It's not like I drop a lot of stuff, or even very often, but when I have it was always such a mission to fish out whatever it was. Naturally if it was change, pens or French fries that found their way into those gaps they just stayed there like a layer of synthetic landfill, but keys and/or the cell phone down there always meant a reconnaissance mission, usually at time, or place that was very inconvenient. NO MORE! Ok, so it's not a necessity, really, but I'm just very pleased to not have to deal with this kind of thing anymore :) I'll be getting some for gifts too!!

We definately needed these and my partner's passenger side was both easy to install and held her seat belt attachment up so it was easier for her to get to. I dropped one star from the ease of installation because I can't seem to get it installed on the driver's side. That is probably my fault because I have to sit in the seat to install anything and that probably pushes the cushion a bit to the side leaving less space to install this. I may update this if I can get someone else to lean over and install it or do it from the passenger seat. This is nothing b ut a bit of sturdy foam with a durable-appearing cover and a slot for the seatbelt anchor but it is certainly worth the price compared to the hours it would take me to make one from scratch - definatly would recommend.

Something I discovered on Amazon when I was looking for other parts for the vehicle. These things are awesome. They attached around the seat belt attachment where you plug the seatbelt in. They move with the seat and they stay up at the top. They keep things from falling between the seat and the center console. They doing awesome job. Definitely would recommend these to anybody who has a vehicle and they have bucket seats in a center console. I would definitely recommend these to anybody is tired of having to try to fish things out from between their seats.

I thought these were a great idea but once my car became my mobile office they became a necessity. No more losing my phone or crumbs into the abyss.

Also gross side note, had to transport my cat without a carrier 2 days ago & she threw up‚Ä¶Not your normal use but it was MUCH EASIER to pull this up out of the crack & wipe it off than trying to fight my way beside & under the seat with a vacuum, cleaner & something to scrub my carpet.

Saw this project online and I had tried many different things between the seat and the consul and didn‚Äôt have any luck. Then I saw these on the Amazon website and I went for it and they are really helpful. They fit nicely. They fill that gap and I don‚Äôt have things falling down between the seats and the consul which we all know you can‚Äôt hardly reach. I recommended it also to my friend and she bought the same things. She really likes them all so it‚Äôs not an expensive purchase but it sure is helpful.

I was going to pick up a new car, drive it home, and while road trips often happen that helps collect stuff we don't intend in the space by the seats, we also have a dog that sheds a lot. This was the first thing I put in the car, as I drove back, and was glad to do so. It showed its value right away, and two weeks later, helping against dog hair too.

I have an SUV and there is a big gap between my car seat and the middle console. My iPhone was always sliding down or some other item was getting lost down there. And it‚Äôs pretty hard to fish out. If I was driving I had to stop and dig in the crack and retrieve my phone. I bought these hoping they would do what they say they were going to do. They were a little tight and I had to push hard to put them in, but I think that‚Äôs a good thing because it really fills in the gap. It works. My phone slipped and it didn‚Äôt fall in the gap and I was able to pick it up and keep going. So I‚Äôm pretty happy about that. I don‚Äôt even notice they are there. Give them a try.

I drive a 2021 Chevy Spark. The center console is lower than the seats, plus there is a relatively small gap between the seats, so the seat gap fillers with the storage options sadly don‚Äôt fit. These fit perfectly, though, and keep small things like pens, phones, and fries from falling under the seat. I stuffed them in pretty far so they‚Äôd sit level with the center console, and the seatbelt cut-out was perfectly positioned. I‚Äôm very happy with this; it‚Äôs helping me maintain my goal of keeping my car clean.

reviews.content: The product was applied to an office chair armrest that is app 2.5‚Äù wide. The 3‚Äù tape needed to wrap under for complete coverage but it barely made it. That‚Äôs not the fault of the product so no blame there. I‚Äôm not confident it will hold properly and I may need to find something at least 4‚Äù or 6‚Äù to have a cleaner look.

I attempted to repair this chair with a repair kit and it turned out horribly. I chose to use this patch instead. It looks great and has held up well. My only complaint is that the role is inside out when you get it, so it takes a little finagling to get it to lay right but once it's down, it's down.

The color matched perfectly to the leather on my sectional, and the adhesion was excellent. Very easy to work with and apply. I don't know yet to the longevity, but I am very impressed so far. The patch is hardly perceptible aganst the existing leather!!!! This have

The tape gives a good fixing for my sofa's holes, the leather suface of it feels good, and it can stick robustly on the surface, though it's kind of expensive but I think it is worthy, I have bought another one for the repair of my leather chair.

Before and after- puppies had chewed the corner of the sectional. While waiting on warranty repair or replacement I decided to give this a try. I don't know how long it will last but it was easy to use and makes it less of an eye sore. Hopefully they'll be less tempted to keep chewing with it covered.

I used it to patch over deteriorating material on a lazy boy (under my head area). For whatever reason, the material covering the chair started coming off in small particles under my head and on arm rest.

It is fairly thick, and hence doesn't follow every contour (i.e. curved ones), at least using one large patch. It seems to adhere pretty well, except one area near the top of the chair.
Covers the tears in my couch great. Easy to use. Only down side is matching color. You can see the patch if the colors aren‚Äôt perfect.

I Have a 2005 F150 with gray vinyl interior. Yes, the Fleet package. Some cracks and seam separation started on the driver's seat that I've ignored for years. So, of course it got worse.

Now, if you're wearing jeans or work pants, the cracks aren't a big issue. But if you're wearing any pants/shorts of any thinner material, that cracked vinyl finds the perfect angle to be a constant uncomfortable presence during your entire drive.

I cleaned the area first with some cleaning wipes, then again with some alcohol. I tried to hold the crack together as I applied the repair tape, and in areas that had factory seams/creases, I tried to make sure the tape made contact all the way into the crease, and not bridge over it.

I installed it 2 or 3 months back, and it's still holding up. I was worried about If the tape would roll and try to stick to my pants, or if I would just end up sitting in the same cracked seat only now with a bunch of adhesive residue all over it, etc. It has held together great so far. I don't see any movement.

Now, It doesn't look great, But if I cared about that, I wouldn't have bought the truck with vinyl seats in the first place. I can tell you the color is a bit off, and the texture is different. Again, if you really care about any of this, why are you even looking at this product? Just fix the seat and put a seat cover on it I suppose, or have it reupholstered professionally.

This a pretty good product.
Easy to use and sticks well on leather & Faux Material.
The hard job is actually finding a color that match. Seller has plenty of options.
What i did was order 4 samples (smaller packs).- kept the one that matched the most and returned the rest. Selle offers super easy return and refunds. Once i found the perfrct match i reorder larger size. Mine was black brown leather.
I guess ill keep buying for as long as i have cats üò¨üò¨

This patch is easy to use, easy to cut, strong adhesive, and a very close match to my deep brown leather couch (it‚Äôs just a little lighter). If you can get it to fit along seams, you can hardly tell there is a patch. I do not have mine all the way to the end, so you can see the edge of the patch, but in person it does not look bad or weird. It‚Äôs not obvious unless pointed out. We had bad peeling from cat scratches to the point we were thinking we needed to replace otherwise good condition couches. Luckily, this patch is a good looking enough fix I bought more for the other couch. I am hoping these patches hold up a while.

What materials are screen protectors and camera lens protectors made of? Tempered glass or plastic?

The screen protector is made of tempered glass, and the camera lens protector is made of tempered glass and polymethyl methacrylate. Tempered or tempered glass is a safety increases glass strength and flexibility by controlling heat or chemistry.

Why is the tempered glass little smaller than the actual screen of the mobile phone?

How can I remove air bubbles?

Use the kit in the package to clean the screen before placing the screen protector. If there are bubbles, please take a thin cloth and press the bubbles gently with your fingers, The thin cloth is to prevent scratching the protector.

Is this product good to use?

Yes, it touch sensitive, shatterproof, bubbleproof, scratch resistantÔºõCompatible with most phone case on the market. Come with gadgets to make it easy for you to operate; Certified by ROHS Environmental and SGS Drop Test Certification. So own it now!

reviews.content:
So I just installed this screen protector last night and I had to write a review just based on how easy it was to install! The guide for the installation was spot on in the position of the protector on the screen and the screen went on with 0 bubbles!!! Which is amazing because I basically dropped the protector on the screen without carefully lowering it from one side to another like you are usually supposed to. I have never ever had an easier time installing any screen protector.
I purchased this for an iPhone 13 so I can‚Äôt say anything about the fingerprint reader. I also am not inclined to drop my phone or scratch the protector just to test it but the protector does feel like good solid glass and the screen is super responsive.
The protector that goes on the camera is also great and super easy to put on. Again no bubbles and doesn‚Äôt interfere with the pic quality at all! I tried night time photography in very low light and the photos were crystal clear. I ended up removing the camera protector (removal is easy as well) because I use my phone carefully and have I would have the peace of mind that nothing interferes with my pic quality. But if one is inclined to add additional protection to the cameras these protectors are simply the best.

I really don't like installing screen protectors, but my gently-treated iPhone 14 is already suffering some minor scratches, so it was time to get this set.

I am really glad it included three covers, as I used two of them just getting it done right.

Some tips: the instructions are good, but to review: alcohol swab, then cloth, then use the sticky piece of paper to pick up every last teeny bit of dust. It helps to: 1) be in as clean a place as you can, 2) ask everyone to stay out of the room while you work. With this kit and any protector, the smallest bit of dust becomes a bulls-eye that will make you unhappy.

It helps to power down your phone so it's not wondering what your fingers are trying to tell it during this process.

What's remarkable about this set is the frame that helps you position the glass. That's the only part of the process that anyone can make work better for you, and this frame really did help.

After the glass is down, you take off the frame and move bubbles out until they're gone. The screen looks great and the touchscreen is fully responsive.

Good product!

As careful as you might be, you will either drop or scratch your VERY expensive phone in a way that will leave permanent damage. While the average user might accept the aforementioned as incidental damage that comes with modern smartphone usage, my readers know that a good screen protector provides not only increased cosmetic protection but preserves resale value if you are the kind of person to upgrade frequently to the newest phone. Either way, your phone is important to you ‚Äì acknowledge that importance by purchasing this (if not this kind) of screen protector.

The QHOQH iPhone screen protector (SP) is a tempered glass sheet cut specifically for the 13 and 14 screens to protect them from direct contact and provides a long-wearing buffer from scratches and impacts while maintaining the premium feel of an iPhone screen. Speaking of the feel, the SP edges are rounded off and the whole screen is coated in a fingerprint-resistant finish that further enhances the smooth glide of fingers across the screen. Installation is literally a snap! The included plastic template locks onto your phone and by aligning the SP to any edge, you can have it installed perfectly, providing complete screen coverage for the entire screen. Still not enough of a sell for you? QHOQH also provides an SP for the camera lens for the ultimate protection for uncomfortably large cameras. For its cost and in so many ways, it just feels like it was made for the iPhone.

The feature that stood out was its total protection. With the iPhone screen being as expensive and important as it is, it boggles my mind trying to understand why most SPs have a notch cut out for the front camera area. While I can only hypothesize at one time SPs interfered with the forward-facing cameras, those problems have been long resolved, and protecting those camera lenses is more important than ever with the introduction of face ID. Additionally, the SP notch will collect debris as it moves about in a pocket or purse. Fortunately, the QHOQH SP is one of the few that provides complete coverage because like you, they think every part of the screen is important enough to be protected.

In general, The QHOQH SP is a great choice for readers who would like to get the most out of their phones. Coupled with a durable case, this SP will provide months, if not years of protection from the grubby, clumsy hands of children to more serious drops and falls an adult can achieve and still look good while it is happening. I suppose you can keep looking for other SPs but don‚Äôt go for the cheapest ones but also don‚Äôt go overboard buying the most expensive for literally one ‚Äì this QHOQH SP is a great compromise of everything you need in a great SP

I never break phone screens, but the peace of mind and scratch resistance is worth the money. If you have an iphone 13 (non-max) this will work well for your phone, especially if you have a bigger case, like my Otterbox Defender. Some complain the screen protector is too small, but I'd imagine they have smaller cases or the iphone 13 max.

Came with three screen protectors, three cleaning kits, three 2-lens camera protectors, and a screen protector install guide (plastic guide for installation).

I was hesitant with getting 3 sets for only $9 and also I only have the one phone. It came today and I just installed it. The directions made it easy, it works great with my silicon case except the camera protector doesn‚Äôt fit in my case but the case I have protects the camera fine, I just wanted the screen protector. I‚Äôm happy with this product At this price even having 2 extra sets I‚Äôm unlikely to need.

Para ponerlos en el celular fue demasiado f√°cil por la gu√≠a que trae; tambi√©n fue f√°cil poner el de la c√°mara. Pero a los pocos d√≠as mi hija se recarg√≥ en la pared y su cel estaba en la bolsa del pantal√≥n y se le estrell√≥ el que cubre la c√°mara; d√≠as despu√©s tambi√©n le pas√≥ lo mismo al celular de mi marido. No se si es m√°s fr√°gil o solo ellos lo hicieron con fuerza. El protector de la pantalla a√∫n los tres lo tenemos Perfecto! Si lo recomiendo.

I've ordered many screen protectors on amazon and this one has survived the longest for sure. I've had it on for 2+ years now and there's not a single crack and I've dropped my phone about 4 times. My sister has dropped her phone several times and there's a few thin cracks. I've bought from this brand several times and I will continue to buy from them.

My husband borrowed my phone to use the light while adding coolant to the car. He sat it on the edge and forgot when he went to close the hood. The entire weight of the hood came down on my phone and we thought we needed to replace the screen. This screen protector absorbed all the force of the impact leaving the actual screen of my phone unscathed. Highly recommend!

I ordered this screen protector with a little hesitation. The design is different than most screen protectors in that the top has a small notch for the speaker but covers the camera. I am glad I took a chance on it because I really like this screen protector. It just makes sense to protect the entire phone and does not seem to hinder the quality of the photos. It is super easy to install with the plastic guide and tool to smooth out any bubbles. It feels good to the touch with edge to edge coverage and quality. So far it shows no sign of scratching. You really can't beat it for the price.

Having these two covers on my phone make me feel much safer carrying a round a nicer phone. The only thing I‚Äôve had an issue with is the glass the goes over the back camera. My first one cracked pretty easily and the second it cracks, you can‚Äôt use the flash anymore because it disperses the light. Overall pretty solid though and I feel better about protecting my phone

reviews.content: I bought the HOTOR 3-gallon car trash can. FIRST, I'll tell you that the trash can is great and even better than I'd hoped. It will definitely do the job I want it to do, and it will be very easy to maintain since the removeable bags will keep it clean. It's large enough to also serve another function very specific to our needs that is totally different from that of a trash can. Let me explain. My wife has had MS since May 1975 and is now confined to a power chair. We had an Acura MDX with a lift for her chair, but we had to trade it for a van that has ramp she can drive her chair into and then anchor it into a locking system in the passenger side. It's when she's not with me that I realized there was a problem. I had pulled into a fast-food restaurant and ordered food to take home. So far so good. The problem? When they handed me the bag of food, I turned to put them in the passenger seat, and ... then realized that there was none! I drove home carefully, but the bag skidded all over the van from front to back and side to side! You see, there's no carpet since the power chair would tear it up. The floor is a durable, smooth surface and works well for the chair and works well if your food wants to leave sandwiches and French fries all over the van! Back to the trash can. After getting it, I found that, with the top opened, the can works perfectly well as a place to put beside the driver's seat and a fast-food bag fits in it quite nicely. I keep clean bags in it thanks to Lily in Customer Service. That (finally, right) brings me to the SECOND thing and the best thing about my purchase. Folks, the customer service I've received has been nothing except fantastic! What did I contact Customer Service you ask? Not any problem with the garbage can. It's great. My issue was that I bought the 3-gallon can and I wanted to buy a supply of HOTOR 3-gallon bags for it. All I could find was links to buy their 2-gallon bags. So, I had the great experience of contacting Lily in HOTOR Customer Service asking for help. Ladies and gentlemen, she has been extraordinary to say the least! First, she told me that she was just going to send me 50 replacement bags that fit my 3-gallon can ... for free. And she did. Then she sent me a link to use for getting more bags. It was then that she told me that their 2-gallon bags also fit the 3-gallon can! They're big enough. I suggested to Lily that she might pass along my suggestion to those who do their Internet marketing that they mention on their 3-gallon can links that you can use the bags advertised as 2-gallon bags. She thought that was a good idea. I hope someone else thinks so too. Suffice it to say that I've had 14 emails back and forth with Lily and each time she has been helping me with suggestions, soliciting feedback from me, or asking for suggestions how to make their product better, etc. No matter what time of night (e.g., even 3:00 AM or 4:00 AM) I'd email her I'd get a reply almost immediately. The woman never sleeps! She has promised to help me whenever I might need something in the future no matter what it is. So, to summarize, the trash can is terrific, the bags are great and the magnets to hold them in are very nice, BUT the Customer Service is actually unbelievable! Although I don't see a problem you'll have with their products, even if you do have a problem or a question, you'll never have one that Lily won't solve for you ... no matter what time of day (or night) it might be!

I just wanted a trash bag to dispose tissue's, napkins, receipts, and other small items. If you don‚Äôt recycle cans and water bottles, then they would fit if you crushed them first. It is a very small bag and I placed it hanging on the center console touching the middle bump on the floor of the rear passenger area. If your center console does not have an area to support the bag, then it would probably be best to hang it on the front passenger seat head rest that could also annoy a large passenger in the rear seat. It accepts all thin produce bags we all use to bag our vegetables in the store, and it uses a button magnet to hold the disposable bags.
I purchased two of them and one was sealed perfectly and the other was crushed under the vacuum seal of the packaging. Anyone at a quality control position should have noticed it immediately at the assembly line. I provided the picture of how it was delivered. I took one star off due to the wrinkles it created and the time it took to try to make it look descent. It still looks wrinkled but since it‚Äôs a trash bag, I decided its not worth the effort to return.
The only optional thing it has to install are a set of plastic inserts to make the bag look stiffer. If you install them, they must be installed from the top side of each side of the nylon straps and behind the nylon straps. You can see that the upper stitches are shorter on the sewed straps to allow the plastic insert to slip in. It requires a bit of effort to bend the plastic strap in order to slip it past the upper stitches which will hold it securely behind the black outer nylon strap. I placed the other two plastic inserts in the bottom of the mesh side pockets. Overall a very nice bag for the car.

If you're looking for a high-quality car trash container, I highly recommend the Hotay brand. I recently purchased this product and have been incredibly impressed with its performance.
First and foremost, the container is incredibly sturdy and durable. It's made of high-quality materials that can withstand even the bumpiest of car rides. Additionally, the container is the perfect size - it's compact enough to fit in even the smallest of cars, yet large enough to hold plenty of trash.
One of my favorite features of the Hotay car trash container is its convenient design. It comes with a detachable strap that allows you to easily attach it to your car's headrest, making it easily accessible from the front and back seats. The container also has a secure lid that keeps trash from spilling out while you're on the go.
Another great aspect of the Hotay car trash container is how easy it is to clean. It's made of materials that are simple to wipe down, and the container's removable interior liner can be washed and dried quickly.
Overall, I can't recommend the Hotay brand car trash container enough. It's a durable, convenient, and easy-to-use product that has made my car rides much more enjoyable. If you're in the market for a car trash container, look no further than Hotay!

I bought this for my friend who has a child sitting in the backseat. She needed a small trashcan to help to trash all the items that her child throws around and the candy wrappers that are usually on the ground. After I gifted her this trashcan, she was able to put it inside her car and you do get flexibility on where you want to hang this trashcan, and it does give you a good amount of leg room for anyone that is sitting in the backseat.

It is very convenient to have this trashcan because now she uses it for her child, herself and her husband who regular puts trash in this trashcan and empties it out, they did buy small trash bags from dollar tree to put in this trashcan. It has been a couple of months now that she has tried this trashcan and loves it.

So in this case I totally recommend this product to anyone that needs a trashcan in their car.

The grey camo looks really nice in my black interior It fits perfectly behind the passenger seat, where I can reach it while driving. If I have more than one person in the back seat of my Jeep Cherokee (smaller SUV), I will need to remove it, but that's ok. If you have kids, it will work fine; but for an adult sitting in the back seat, it will encroach into their space (depending upon how far back the passenger seat is, of course). I love the design with the magnetic snaps that hold the bags. That will help so much. I did need to snip the plastic stays that go underneath the strips of webbing on each side. They are about 1/4 Inch too long. And you will need some work scissors (really strong ones) to cut them. Luckily I had some. Regular scissors, Nail Clippers, Jewelry Nippers will not work. I tried them all.

I've had many a car garbage can, so I've been burnt before but this one exceeded my expectations. I bought a 2-gallon but I'll probably invest in the bigger one later. Attaching any trashbag is easy with the magnets and I haven't had one unattached despite stuffing my Taco Bell bag inside. It does take me some time to attach the bag but magnets are hard okay? The strap to attach to my passenger seat doesn't slack and the pockets are quite sturdy and able to handle the bottle of Dasani water barely good enough for my dog. It's been a few months and a stench hasn't invaded my car. YE

I use this on my sailboat where things fly around when the sea is rough. It keeps the trash in and stays where I put it with the strap. It takes a full minute to change the bags with the necessity to roll the lip of the bag around four plastic bars and snap them in place with the magnetic snaps but the results are worth the effort for my application. I use four gallon bags as that gives me room to stuff it and still tie the bags off firmly before compacting them with my size 11 trash compactor foot in a battery box for storage to await next port call for disposal.

The only thing I would change is the strap is too short to go around the center console in my Town and Country van. I had to cobble a longer strap together to hold it to my console. I do like how, when it is attached to and behind the console, passengers in the front and second row can all use it. It is an easy reach from the driver seat as well.
It also does make it hard to move the upper part of the console back in that position but the convenience of having there ourweights the inconvenience with moving the upper console. So far it is the best solution I have found for my van.

My husband and I really like these trash bins. It's a little bigger than our old oned and the space was small, so we had to put them on the back of the passenger seats. We really like them. Now we have plenty of leg room for our passengers. The lid I was not sure would pop back up when you put trash in it, and it does! Like the pockets on the outside to put "quick and easy" things to grab.

Purchased this for my new Telluride since the kids love to throw their wrappers or other trash everywhere in the car. Works great, definitely is leak proof. My only gripe is I wish it was more sturdy. It kind of resembles a soft cooler. Definitely recommend using trash bags with this though. Just makes clean up easer. It does come with 4 bags, that are relatively easy to install.

reviews.content: Love these mats. I really like that they come with two, so you can have an extra one on hand. They work great and are easy to clean with some mild soap and water. Let the air dry and they are sticky again and good to go! I use them with my cricut maker.

I absolutely love these mats for the Cricut vinyl. My vinyl no matter if it is premium outdoor, 651 or htv its stays in place perfectly for the cut.
The value is fabulous I got 2 mats for the price of one at the leading craft stores.
This is my 2nd time purchasing and I will order again in the near future.

If you only use the green mat once in a while, it will last a long time. I've only had my Cricut since Nov. 2022 and I've replaced my green mats two times already. After a while you just can't clean them anymore. That goes for all the different mats the Cricut uses.

What can I say? They‚Äôre well priced and if taken care of properly, they last for a very long time! I like to have several mats if I‚Äôm working on lots of projects at the same time so it works great for me!
Great for iron on vinyl, not construction paper.
Great price for this product
I've been looking for new mats and stumbled on this deal, it was TOO good to pass up!
Thank you ...
They are Cricut mats. At the time I bought them, a very good deal.
This item was on sale when I got it, so it's literally Cricut brand and the exact item from Cricut but I got a better price. HIGHLY RECOMMEND! You need one of these if you're printing with a Cricut.

reviews.content:
I formerly gave this HP Multipurpose paper a 5-star recommendation. My life is full of (self-created) clutter, requiring numerous car trips for small objects--from ballpoints to markers to Scotch tape to frozen waffles to paper--lots of it, for the bathroom, office, and music studio. I wouldn't recommend this HP paper for the first of the aforementioned applications, but it serves me well in the other two areas. As copy paper, it moves through my printer without a hitch, readily absorbing ink and producing a sharp and clear final draft. As music manuscript paper, it's got enough fiber to stand up on its own on a piano ledge or music stand (many are the times that an overly thin sheet simply wilts and folds in half with no help from me). Last, the packet is a full 500 sheets (some of the store brand "value packs" show an attractive price--until the small print reveals a total of 400 sheets).

Until a couple of days ago, ordering this essential product from Amazon was a no-brainer, making it not only convenient but more economical to have the paper delivered right to my front door. But, perhaps not surprisingly, the price has more than doubled and the good feelings accordingly down a peg. Still, given the distance of my closest supplier and my tendency to motor out for a single item at a time, ordering the paper (but far less often) at its current price isn't out of the question.

Another, at least partial, solution would be to reduce the clutter with the cooperation of manufacturers and suppliers. The makers of so many of the appliances, media devices, technological toys and gadgets (including software programs) could contribute considerably toward a more manageable environment by returning to that rapidly vanishing artifact--the printed manual, or instruction booklet. From the iPad to the Kindle (with its 200-page online manual) to every downloaded MP3 music file, the assumption is--I'm not exactly sure--perhaps that we'll save the information to our computer desktops or that we'll happily print it out or that we'll read the online instructions and remember them later or that an instruction booklet would be sufficiently intimidating to prevent us from using the device or that even the most venerable among us will somehow catch up with a younger generation that can be incredibly intuitive about many of these devices and highly impatient with (if not altogether indifferent toward) printed instructions.

As I don‚Äôt often have JUST the right sentiments in my stamps, I will often write what I want to say into the word processing program on my computer, and print it out onto THIS PAPER. It‚Äôs heavy enough, and the smooth texture makes it a joy to touch. (( Can‚Äôt remember the cost of this, however I do know it‚Äôs CONSIDERABLY more expensive than standard, 20#, 92 brightness, paper. ))
Product was good. Only complaint is with Amazon. Delivery took too long. Box was open when delivered and the ream of paper was open when received.

It fits nicely in the printer. Absorbs ink as expected. Dimensions are as described. I did not weigh it to ensure it meets 20lb requirement. It allows me to print whatever I write without having to worry I'll be blocked from printing due to controversial content or foul language. Does not try to escape from printer tray, goes in willingly. Recommend 10/10

Came early love it

.
The box was shipped quickly, and the printer paper is good quality and just what I hoped for.
Good quality paper.
It's freakin paper people, what else can I say?
= repeat purchase---- always = just what I needed
When I have to give my work to someone this paper makes it look better

name: 20 Pack Vacuum Storage Bags, Space Saver Bags (4 Jumbo/4 Large/4 Medium/4 Small/4 Roll) Compression Storage Bags for Comforters and Blankets, Vacuum Sealer Bags for Clothes Storage, Hand Pump Included
description:
Product Description
Our vacuum storage bag combo is a must-have essential for saving your storage space!

Our vacuum bag set is the go-to solution for seasonal cloth storage, house space saving organization, and travel necessities.

Use our space saver bags and store away variety size items including bedding clothes, blankets, pillows, plush toys, and more. What's more: you can use our compression bags to reduce larger and fluffier items such as vests and winter coats to minimal sizes with ease. Our jumbo vacuum storage bags come in handy for packing hefty item such as big quilts, bedding or blankets.

Product Features

	

	



Double Zipper Seal

Our vacuum bags are made of durable and premium quality PA+PE and double zipper seal. The vacuum bags can be reused multiple times.

	
Triple Seal Turbo Valve

Triple-seal turbo valve ensures the space bag is airtight and protects your items for lasting period.

	
Sturdy Hand Pump

Sturdy hand pump is included for efficient suction of air and its compact size is suitable for storage and travel.

4 Steps for Easy Use

Put the items inside our vacuum storage bag
Zip along the dual-zip 2-3 times and ensure the zipper is fully sealed
Suck all the air out by vacuum cleaner/hand pump included.
Close and secure the valve cap.

20 Pack Includes

4 Jumbo: 39.35‚Äù X 27.5‚Äù(100cm X 70cm)
4 Large: 33.5‚Äù X 21.65‚Äù(85cm X 55cm)
4 Medium: 27.5‚ÄùX 19.5‚Äù(70cm X 50cm)
4 Small: 23.5‚ÄùX 15.7‚Äù (60cm X 40cm)
4 Travel Roll Up: 23.5‚ÄùX 15.7‚Äù (60cm X 40cm)

Package Quantity	30 Pcs	25 Pcs	20 Pcs	16 Pcs	12 Pcs
Pump Included	‚úì	‚úì	‚úì	‚úì	‚úì
Zipper	Dual Zipper	Dual Zipper	Dual Zipper	Dual Zipper	Dual Zipper

reviews.content:
Here‚Äôs what I have in the vacuum bags, and the size everything fits in.

Vacuum bags info :

1 jumbo : king size comforter (still had plenty of room to add a sheet set or smaller blanket)
1 jumbo : king size comforter, King size sheets (flat, fitted, 4 king pillow cases) (full)
1 large : queen comforter, queen size sheets (flat, fitted 2 queen pillow cases) (full)
1 large : 1 full/queen size blanket (thick) and 2 full size crochet blankets (could fit maybe another blanket)
1 medium : Queen/full comforter (kinda thick/fluffy) and still had room.

*The pump worked fine for the bags. You will be there for a couple of minutes ‚Äúpumping‚Äù the air out, but it‚Äôs kinda fun/stress relieving (at least it was for me) but if you have a vacuum (with a hose) it would definitely be faster.
*The bags seem thick and zip well. If you‚Äôve used the ziplock space bags, (it‚Äôs definitely a slightly different type of plastic used) but I‚Äôd say these bags feel thicker and slighter more durable than ziplock. (Also cheaper for the amount you get) I had a ziplock storage bag and the plastic ended up tearing by the zipper, I don‚Äôt feel like I‚Äôll have that issue with these bags.
*I have not yet used the ‚Äúsmall‚Äù bags, or the roll compression bags. I was able to fit everything in the other bags. But I have no doubt they will work just as fine as the other. However since the roll compression bags don‚Äôt have cap to be vacuum sealed (from my understanding you just roll the bag and air gets pushed out the other end ‚Äúcompressing‚Äù the bag) I can‚Äôt say how well that works, or if at all. But I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôll be fine for smaller items like clothes or what not, maybe not for big or thicker blankets. But I haven‚Äôt tried it yet.

Over all if I need to buy more bags, I will continue to buy these. I feel like it‚Äôs a good price for the amount that you get, good quality and comes with its own pump. Great for if you travel and what your items vacuum sealed but you have no vacuum handy.

***(Photo of all the bags stacked : on the far right are the 2 jumbo (white, & red and black checkered) the bottom 2 on the left are the large and there‚Äôs a medium stacked on top of them.)

Okay, in my head, I THOUGHT this product would be great, air gone, ease of packing. In REALITY, it didn‚Äôt go like I pictured. I pack my suitcases to their size, meaning; using all the nooks, crannies and up to the edges (even that space between the handles INSIDE the suitcases of today (usually filling it with undies, socks, tank tops etc). Well, it‚Äôs hard to compress your items by hand while rolling. The air outlet is sometimey, (I flipped the bag over, straightened out the seal etc, before IT got the idea of what I was trying to do. Second, (and this is on ME), IF I put neat, pressed and wrinkle free clothes in the bag, ROLLING THEM, to get the air out; is NOW a problem (so I tried to lay them in flat and stacked, roll the plastic THEN had to sit on the clothes to get the remaining air out (it worked, but that whole process was IT for me). I used 4 bags out of 20 and quit. Finding out even with the air out, the bag is flat and does not utilize the nooks and and crannies of my suitcase was even a NO for me. They would me MORE appropriate if they were being used for storage of sheets and other flat items, but again getting the air out is a straight hassle. The zip closure popped off the 1st time I tried the 1st bag and I thought I broke it, but it slipped back on easily to reseal the bag. I put a king sized blanket in first. Maybe I should have just tried the clothes, because THIS HAND STRUGGLE is NOT it‚Ä¶ Use one with a vacuum IF you gotta do it, but I know I won‚Äôt be using them for traveling.

Came with all of the parts and on time without any damage!
The jumbo bags really are...JUMBO. I got this for a trip to pack all of my belongings in a relatively small suitcase and I really only needed to use 1 roll up, 1 small, and 1 medium. There were a few comments that were complaining that they were sent a set of bags without the suction valve, but I guess they failed to realize that they were roll-up compression bags? I don't know. The roll up bags work pretty well although they do require a big of pressure. When I first started rolling them nothing was happening but you have to apply consistent and pretty firm pressure and then you start hearing the air release at the bottom of the bag.

If I am being picky, I don't like how the bags turn really crumpled once you actually open them after they've been compressed but it's really not a big deal. The hand pump works fine...it just takes a really long time. In the absence of a vacuum cleaner, I would recommend manually squeezing as much air out as possible first and then completely sealing the bag AND THEN using the hand pump.

Also if you are trying to use a medium sized bag in a smaller container, once you put the clothes/items inside, fold it in half and then vacuum so that it conforms to a smaller shape.

I will try to update this after my trip.

I have packing cubes and zip lock bags you squeeze the air out of and these are the best I've found. The convenience of not needing to squeeze all the air out eliminates the concern to pop open the zip lock seal OR squish all of your clothes into the base of the bag (which naturally happens when you try to push & roll the air out).

Being able to layer items, place them where needed and then pump the air out allows me to plan packing my suitcase more efficiently. I love knowing if a toiletry item leaks, my clothes are safe and smaller items like chargers and my toothbrush is easier to find in a pinch. I even was able to use these bags to pack my king size pillow into my carryon with room for everything else around it because you can suck the air out of the pillow (I'm picky on my pillow comfort when traveling).

Very good quality vacuum bags for the price. Bought the 30 pack. Handpump works fantastically.

I remember buying the Amazon Basics version of these a few years ago - they fell apart after a few uses, plastic cracked and ripped through.

These seem to be a much thicker, sturdier plastic and I have faith they will last much longer. I also paid like 40 for 8 of them at the time, so it is good to see that the price has been reduced drastically.

Been reading the reviews - want to set people straight on a few things. If you are finding that the bags regain air after a few days: make sure you're leaving at least two inches at the end. If you're applying too much pressure right at the zipper, you're bound to get a leak.

Also, it's not a one and done zipper.

Run it back and forth a few times with the clip, and then with a good hard finger squeeze for good measure.

Most vacuums don't have enough suction to pull all the air out, so you're probably gonna use the hand pump at the end just to get it as flat as you can - make sure you're not overdoing it. Check the little rubber stopper in the center when you're done. If it looks deformed, then you've created too much negative pressure inside the bag and ruined the seal. If you put the cap on its going to keep it deformed and able to suck in tiny bits of air at random. Lift it and fiddle with it until it is perfectly round and centered. If you need to start over, do so. You don't want to open a storage unit full of inflated bags, it's awful, trust me. Like putting a light bulb in your mouth, it'll go in, but it won't come out.

And finally, make sure your cap is nice and snug.

Great product, will probably order more.

Should say however, it has no packaging. It just is a shipping sticker slapped on the product box. As I live in a very wet, snowy area, I was a bit annoyed with that.

So when I opened the product I was pretty skeptical. Not only had I not paid much for the whole kit (which is suspicious all on its own :) ) but the plastic felt thin, "crunchy" and the top seal was basically what seemed like a cheap ziplock seal. BUT I grabbed the giant heavy fleece blanket from atop the couch, stuck one it, closed it up (the slider puts the top edges together, but you still have to pinch the edges together a la ziplock) and figured I'd try the little plastic pump before likely having to get out the vacuum five seconds later. Nope. That lil guy had the air sucked out in under a minute, and voila! So now not only can I put away all the extra comforters etc, but with the diff sizes, I can store the kids old clothes,the winter coats and snow pants that take up a giant Rubbermaid in the closet, and so many other things! As a screenprinter, I also have a lot of blank shirts in storage, that take up space and still somehow manage to get ruined in the basement air even contained in boxes or bins! And the fact that the little pump actually works means I could use it wherever and not have to worry about having an air compressor or some such nonsense around. I'm having a truly adult moment here, gushing about great storage solutions, and I couldn't care less :)
Edit: after the initial excitement and taking them all out, I realized that 4 of the smaller sized bags didn't have the pump pieces on them..just 4 lrg ziplock bags. I use one to store the rest of the bags in..the rest look like they could be for pillows, but they may be a little small for any that I have. I'd check the box for an explanation, but it was soaked thru when the Amazon delivery driver didn't read the delivery note of 'put inside back porch bc extreme storm approaching' lol. I still love the bags but I needed to mention this, and the fact that I'm not super positive of how many times the bags will be able to be used. When I took the blanket out, the bag was of course, no longer smooth and whatnot, but it made me worry about the thin-ness of the plastic again. Again, this is still one of my favorite things, I just want to be 100% on this review :) So should they fall apart after being re-used a few times, you'll hear about it here :)

I had some old clothes and fabric items from childhood and college I wanted to vacuum seal for storage and preserving, bought this online after finding it and feeling good about price. Suction Device is straight forward, place items in bag, try to lay flat so everything doesn't curl up, screw in pump, and pump until air is satisfactorily vacated. I only used the provided pump so cannot comment on how attaching vacuum works. Partly my fault for not looking closer, but I was disappointed that the 4 roll up bags do not have a suction port and cannot be used for vacuum sealing. They have it illustrated, but I think it should be specified a bit better, but that is my only complaint about this item!

I‚Äôm moving from the west coast to the east coast. I bought these for my clothing,bedding, towels, etc. I read one of the reviews that mentioned leaving about a 2in. Space between the opening and the items. I have had them sealed in the bag for about a week now and none of them have opened up. It‚Äôs just a matter of how you use it. You cannot fill them to the brim with items as this will cause the opening to burst/break open.
I also noticed some other reviews that stated there are bags that come without suction holes. Just a friendly reminder that these are the packing bags that are used for travel when you may not have access to a vacuum.
The bags work extremely well! I highly recommend!!

These bags are probably wonderful for storage, but not as great for travel.

I recently purchased these for a trip to Europe and they certainly came in handy when packing. The pump (included) was great for getting the bag as small as possible, so I was able to fit more in my suitcase. However, after my flight they were never able to seal and suction the same. I know this is fairly common for most bags to do with the changes in air pressure on a plane, but I was hoping these would be different. I still managed to get all of my belongings home, but with much less room.

These seem like they would be great for storing items like blankets and such that you don't need to access often.

I got the storage bags for an upcoming move. The box itself arrived beat up looking but everything inside was sealed in plastic bags. The bags themselves are unmarked so I had to take them all out and compare them to figure out the sizes. It took me a couple of tries to figure out the seal. You need to slip the closure several times to make sure you have a good seal. The closure falls of easily but does also go back on just as easily. I have found that some items are shrinking better than others but that is probably something I‚Äôm still doing wrong. Overall they do the job as described.

name: Beckham Hotel Collection Bed Pillows Standard / Queen Size Set of 2 - Down Alternative Bedding Gel Cooling Pillow for Back, Stomach or Side Sleepers
description:
Product Description
Luxury Pillows You'll Love



The Beckham Hotel Collection Gel-Filled Fiber Pillows are crafted with a super plush gel fiber that puts all other standard pillows to shame! They are expertly tailored to ensure maximum comfort in any and all sleeping positions.

	
No-Shift Design

High-quality materials keep their shape without bunching or distorting, no matter how long you use them.

All-Season Use

Breathable cotton and cooling technology regulates temperature for a cooler sleep all night long.

OEKO-TEX Certified

Our pillows are OEKO-TEX and made with 100 percent down alternative, providing you comfortable sleep.

Plush Support

Extra loft design provides support needs related to stress, neck pain, and other aches.

The Optimal Choice for All Sleepers

Whether you're a supine sleeper, a power napper, or you love a sideways siesta - our cooling pillows for sleeping can accommodate you. The plush bounce-back design will shape to your favorite position

 
How to Prep

Pillows are compress packed. For best use, prep as below:

1. Open the plastic wrap & remove the pillows

2. Fluff the pillows vigorously and wait 24 hours

3. Once fully loft, use the pillows as desired

 
How to Clean

The pillows are fade and stain resistant. For best results, clean as below:

1. Wash on a delicate cycle using cold water

2. Dry by laying flat on a well-ventilated area

  
Shop From Our Family of Products
	
BHC Luxury Gel Pillows
	
BHC Pillow Case 4 Pack
	
Soft 6 Pk Bed Sheet Set
	
BHC 1300 Series Comforter
	
BHC Reversible Comforter
	
4-Piece Luxury Bed Sheets
	
4-Piece Patterned Sheets
