Material	Gel Down Alternative	Silky Brushed Microfiber	Ultra Soft Cotton	Goose Down Alternative	Reversible Goose Down Alt.	Silky Brushed Microfiber	Ultra Soft Cotton
Size	Queen Size	Standard / Queen	Twin XL	King / California King	Full / Queen	Twin	Full
Pieces Included	2 Pillows	4 Pieces	6 Pieces	1 Comforter	1 Reversible Comforter	4 Pieces	4 Pieces
Other Sizes Available

reviews.content:
OK, let's clear up a few things:
1) I am a real buyer, was not given this pillow, was not paid to review this pillow. There's no way I'm doing any of that.
2) I want everyone to know exactly what I'm giving an opinion on. This "Beckham Hotel" pillow is the very same as others called "Sleep Restoration Super Plush Gel-Fiber Filled Pillows". That's what the package the two pillows (costing $35 total) came in reads, and there's a small bar-coded sticker with tiny writing indicating the Beckham Hotel re-branding.
3) There's NO smell. There's NO mildew. They arrived factory clean and shipped in a nice, zipped plastic container bag.
4) They arrive dead flat. When you remove them, they start to fluff up. I'd say after an hour or so they are ready to use. Fluff them a bit, and you can sleep on them right away. It's not necessary to put them in a dryer and in fact it could be detrimental. Not sure.
5) I waited a month to write this because I wanted to be sure I liked the pillows. I do!
6) I had some doubts at first because I thought they'd be too soft, but after a couple of nights I would now describe them as soft, yet firm enough to support my head and neck correctly. I start out sleeping on my side and of course, at some point end up on my back, and then often back on my side.
7) They're heavy enough to no move around, but not heavy like a (solid) memory foam pillow is. They stay put in other words.
8) I purchased the queen sized ones. Now, it was sort of interesting to me that these are 20 inches wide, and yet a queen size pillowcase is also 20 inches wide. Yet, a pillow is quite high and a pillowcase is of course - flat. This means it requires some effort to squeeze the pillow into the pillowcase. BUT, perhaps this makes the pillow seem a bit firmer than my initial impression of it was in paragraph #6. At any rate, it works and these have worked out well for me.
9) I woke up in a hotel about 4 years ago with neck pain and had it ever since. All sorts of chiropractic efforts, daily neck stretches, painkillers, etc. just didn't seem to get rid of it. I ditched my Tempur-Pedic s-shaped solid memory foam pillow and tried several other pillows I got locally. They all went back. I got these pillows, continued on the daily neck stretches and now I'm feeling fine with no more neck pain. I noticed about a week ago I was waking up with no more neck pain. That's a relief.

That's about all I can tell you Amazon shoppers. Buying a pillow is a wilderness of choice. I spent a LOT of hours on here looking. And of course pillows, and the comfort of them, is very personal and subjective. I can only say, for me, these worked out. If they don't for you, I assume you can return them, possibly with some shipping cost. I don't know. I'm not a regular Amazon customer and not a Prime member.
Best of luck finding yours!
-MSW

I have been searching for a pillow that holds and supports but also is soft &comfy. I've tried expensive memory foam and temperpedic pillows and they are always too hard even though your head "sinks " in. I just want alot of fluff but not feel like the pillow flattens 2 weeks later.
It's been 3 months so far and the pillow STILL retains it's shape and original height. I co sleep with my 2 year old and the pillows always have a lot of body weight on them and constant movement, but they still support and hold !!! That awkward gap between your neck and the bed is filled with this pillow because it maintains it's height and fluff and doesn't sink down too much. I always make sure before bed I obsessively HAVE to grab this pillow and I put them in special pillow cases so I always know where they are on the bed and which to grab.
I thought the price was decent considering you get 2 good pillows.

Cons: a possible con is if someone doesn't like this style of pillow. Everyone is different and needs something different from their pillow. If you are the kind of person who likes that memory foam /temperpedic pillows, then this pillow probably isn't for you. If youre someone always trying to layer super soft pillows up under your head, because you like the softness but also need the support - this pillow may work for you.
I would say this is on the SOFT side for pillows - not for those who don't want their heads to sink in. However, because the softness is layered up so high and has a great width/THICKNESS, your head and neck gap will also feel supported. If you don't want a puffy/high pillow, and prefer flatter thinner ones - this probably isn't for you. !
These pillows were def. A hit for me! And I noticed much better sleep even just after the first night. I have to be raised higher to sleep now because my son sleeps better when I'm boosted up at an incline. I was so tired of stacking a million pillows that didn't feel that soft anyway. This takes care of that problem !

I gave 4 stars because a product can always be improved. I never do 5 stars unless a product is the most perfect it could ever be. Plus, like I said, the quality will be objective as what works for one person in a pillow may not work for another. Overall, disregarding that, and in general , it's a well made comfortable pillow in general.

I really bought the pillows with no promotion or incentives for my own personal use. First of all, I have 3 cervical-spine fusions so my neck support is critical. I have bought every price-range pillow out there including feather, gel,foam,hybrid,down and mixed materials, etc.. I usually end up cutting open my pillows and adding or removing filling to get the best comfort. Here is how this one performs. It takes a while to fill out. I put it in the dryer and used it about 6 hours later. It was a bit flat but I used it with a folded towel. Through the night it puffed up a bit more and I removed the towel. It still wasn't quite right. So I inserted the queen size pillow into a zippered standard size pillowcase. This smaller pillow case caused the filling to be compressed enough to make it feel fuller. Now it's about perfect. I know it won't last. Eventually I will use the 2nd pillow for filling out the 1rst one and continue doing that until I replace them in about a year. This is why I invest in a good zippered pillow cover so I can continuously alter the comfort by increasing the filling. Hope this helps someone out there searching for that perfect pillow. Sleep Well!!

Let me start by saying I am PICKY about pillows. So picky that I have a pillow I bring every time I travel because without it I won't sleep well. So when my favorite pillow was discontinued I was in a panic for a replacement.
Bought these, sight unseen, based on reviews alone. And so far I am VERY happy with them. Just soft and poofy enough. Doesn't go flat or lumpy. SO comfortable. Time will tell if they hold up long term, but for now they have become my new favorite pillow. Try them, if you're particular about your pillow it's a safe bet!!

I am not easily convinced even when a product has lots of good reviews. I had seen these pillows over the years but just couldn't make the purchase. Well, after the last go around of cleaning our long ago purchased pillows I knew that the time had come to replace them. After some research these kept coming up and I thought I'd give them a try. Very comfortable! I normally like a firm pillow but this is supportive without being hard, doesn't flatten out and retains a good shape when fluffed. Very satisfied.

So I feel at this point after spending a thousand or more dollars I should know what a good pillow is. I have a terrible neck with three herniations so it does hurt more often than not.

My boyfriend started complaining of the same and then I thought that maybe it was because of the pillows since he has no neck issues. So I thought well shoot let‚Äôs buy more pillows because well, why not!!

I found these and was excited for all of the reviews. I also thought the price was fair if they didn‚Äôt work out no huge loss.

They came in and were vacuumed sealed. We took them out and let them fluff up, to my surprise there was no odd smell. Once they did fluff up I was skeptical. They were light and fluffy and I honestly did not think they would offer any support based on how they felt. But I said I‚Äôll give it a shot.

Holy moly!!!! I put my head on a cloud of pure happiness. I kept it to myself as to not get my happiness up too much as I‚Äôve felt great on pillows before until I wake up and can‚Äôt move my neck.

So we slept and we slept like babies!!! I mean that. For me I don‚Äôt sleep well in general and average 3-4 a night before the pain sets in. These puppies worked!!! Hello 8 hours of sleep!!!

I asked my boyfriend how he slept and if he liked them. He said I think we should buy more, ‚Äúthat‚Äôs the best pillow I‚Äôve ever slept on‚Äù.

Needless to say it was well worth the try and the price point. I‚Äôm very happy for once with a pillow and you should be as well. If you‚Äôre thinking of doing it, just add it to your cart and checkout because I feel sure you will enjoy them just as much as we are.

I didn‚Äôt know what type of pillows you sleep on actually mattered until a week ago! I sleep on my stomach and I have a deep arch in my lower back so I used 2 or 3 pillows. Wake up with tense shoulders and wanting someone to walk in my back lol. Like it was bad. This past week I‚Äôve slept the best I have in a while. I love my new pillows! I bought 2 king and 2 queen. Any other pillow should be against the law!!

The pillow is okay. I bought the two that made a set because of the cooling effect. It‚Äôs not there. Yes, the pillow feels cool overall until you put your head down. That naturally warms up and stays warm. You would have to move to another section of the pillow to feel cool under your cheek or neck if you sleep on your back. I will give the second one away. Too much trouble to send them back. As pillows they are okay just disappointed that they didn‚Äôt feel cool once I put my head on it.

I have been suffering night sweats. (Yay, menopause.~) I bought these on a whim, desperate for a good night's sleep. I didn't have high hopes, as I've been disappointed by many false claims. These were amazing! The first time I used them, I was a little disconcerted by HOW WELL they worked. It reminded me of my old waterbed (back in the day) when it got a degree too cold. These pillows feel like they suck the heat away from your skin. For helping with my temperature control issues, they are awesome.

I wear a CPAP at night. These pillows 'resist' the swivel on my full-face CPAP differently than normal pillows. It took me a couple nights to become acclimated. That is a consideration for users, rather than a criticism. If recommend beginning to use these pillows a couple nights BEFORE you absolutely need/must/sleep/collapse. (Parenting is glamorous.)
#

Sick and tired of hard memory foam pillows I decided to try one of these out. First off, they are very soft and fluffy. The biggest complaint i have is I like to usually only use one pillow and if you are the same way, you will be slightly disappointed with these. Not supportive at all really and my head sinks to the bottom almost. I have remedied this by using a flatter pillow under one of these at the same time but that misses the point in my opinion. Now I do know that I kind of have a fat head so maybe someone smaller frame would not run into this but if you are a larger person, I would accept you are going to have to use another pillow along with this one for good support.

reviews.content:
Arrived day one and item was ripped directly in the seam and completely unusable. I guess you get what you pay for‚Ä¶. Such a bummer

‚Äî- update: sent a message to the seller as well as Amazon. Replacement arrived and so far so good. The seller was insanely attentive in fixing the issue and also wanted to insure I returned as a customer. On top of that they wanted to make sure no one received my faulty return as their order. And asked for further feedback on where, how and the status of the rip/faulty item.

This is not the first time I‚Äôve ordered from bedsure and will not be the last since their customer service was so diligent in making things right.

I ordered two different colors and we love them both. At first when I opened them I was unsure, they felt very different than what I was expecting. Honestly I almost sent them back. I have had another brand and out of the package felt much different- so I was going off of that. I really liked this price point and it has such wonderful reviews I thought okay, let's wash them and see what happens. I'm so glad I did because after washing they were perfect! Love that they offer the fold over end to hide the pillow edging, and the end isn't floppy. It looks polished and nice on the bed. The reviews are correct, but them you'll love them!

I have had these pillow cases for a few months. I hand wash them in cold water with a plant-based detergent and it seems to work really well. If I had a washing machine with a gentle cycle, that would have done the trick too. Very comfortable sleep. My pillow is of hypoallergenic contour type and the regular size pillow case fits great. I did buy the deep dark green and it's gorgeous. Beautiful color. I do double my pillow cases to protect the pillow so it lasts better/longer too so underneath I have a flannel pillow case.

I prefer satin/silk pillowcases to help prevent hair breakage/frizz. I have long that is naturally 3C curls and I straighten it from time to time so I‚Äôm prone to frizz. I purchased this pillow case because I like to try to brands and I liked the color. Not my favorite that I‚Äôve had but it‚Äôs nice for its price. The fabric is sewn inside so that the pillow ideally can sit comfortably in the slot without sliding. Nice concept but my pillow falls right out of it. I think I may just stick to the satin cases that zip but they are not as nice aesthetically.

I‚Äôve been using these satin pillowcases for a while now. I‚Äôve washed a couple times as I alternate with white ones I had. The quality is great and did not change after washing. The size is perfect and the fact that it has a ‚Äúsafe pocket‚Äù to hold the pillow inside is awesome because satin is slippery and it keeps the pillow covered (different from the other brand/style I have from another vendor, the pillow slides out of the satin cover all the time).
I am very happy with the color (gray), the quality and the size of it.

I usually use satin pillowcases but beware any dark colors... I bought this in burgundy and after two nights of sleep it is covered in microscopic dandruff and skin cells.... made me feel really gross considering my head never itches, my hair is silky and soft, and I had no clue I had dry scalp.... material also seems to hold heat more than my previous ones... and material did feel a bit cheaper but I thought maybe after I wash it a few times it will feel better...

I bought these cases the other day . I love satin . I prefer satin to silk. I have a bliss silk pillowcase , but I prefer satin . Now these are not super premium satin , but for the price and you get two cases they are fine to me. I did a repurchase for my Grand Daughter. I hope she likes them . I know I do . If your thinking about purchasing these i would say give them a try. I like them or I would not repurchase them .O:-) O:-)

That‚Äôs right - no more bedhead! My hair is not tangled or frizzy in the morning. I have naturally curly hair but can also straighten it - and it will look good in the morning! I actually think washing at night, drying, and then sleeping on this pillow case makes my hair look best. Also great is how it cools down fast - so refreshing to scooch to a cool spot in the middle of the night. Only downside is that i snagged the satin on something- earring? Necklace? Dryer? Who knows. But it still works great. I wash it in a laundry bag and then air dry it. Looooove it! Bought for my daughters and sister!

I have bought 6 sets of this pillow cases for my self and gifts. Came packaged nicely in an envelope you get a email on instructions. They do make a difference on your hair and skin. My 95 year old mother has helped her with her hair and ear skin. I don't feel a need to buy the VERY experience pure silk ones this work just find.

I love my silk pillowcases they're so good for your hair and skin and definitely help keep me cool on hot nights. My one and only complaint is that they slip off my pillow pretty easily but it doesn't bother me very much because it only takes 2 seconds to fix.

reviews.content: These have been great to store my milk. My only complaint is you can‚Äôt use the measurement on the bag. Make sure to measure before putting in the bag and then right the correct measurement on it. Sharpie works great!

I have been exclusively pumping for 8 months and have been using these bags consistently. They have 2 sealing strips at the top of the bag which make them reliable and leak proof. I never had an issue with them leaking in my freezer. They are easy to use as you simply rip off the plastic at the top, open it up and pour your breast milk in. The plastic they are made out of used to be thinner and I did have issues with a few when I defrosted them, however, they recently reinforced the plastic by making it a thicker better quality bag and I haven‚Äôt had any issues since.

Two things make buying something tough:
1. Most good reviews don't talk about how well things hold over longer periods of time. So I waited several months. Bought this item over and over again when more bags where needed. Every time they worked flawlessly. I'm surprised, as I expected that out of the hundreds of bag, some would have been faulty. However, that was never the case. These bags hold the milk well whether in the fridge, for shot term storage or frozen, for long term storage. They are also easy to pour the milk from the pumps and easy to pour the milk into bottles.

2. Reading the 1 star reviews, usually brings to light some glaring faults in the product. For this product I have read several people having problems with leakage. It made me hesitant before buying first time. However, I never had any leakage happen to me. So my thoughts are that either those people received faulty bags, or have not properly sealed and stored the milk. In case you are wondering how to do it properly - Take out all the air out of the bag before sealing it, then close the double zip-locks. Make sure both are sealed with the air out. For cold storage keep the bags standing or lying (I prefer standing), for frozen storage keep it lying. Never fill it more than what it can hold.

TL:DR
These are great bags, bought them over and over when ran out, they don't leak and are easy to store and use.

In the photo - Left side: A bag with milk from the cold storage. Right Side: A bag with milk from the frozen storage.

These work! Zipper works great and if you follow directions for freezing breast milk you won‚Äôt have any issue with bags busting. I tried generic options and always came back to these. I used a medala pump and still preferred these.

great milk storage bags, no problems with tears or leaking. only downside for me is small but kind of annoying. the part with the date/oz label gets in the way when pouring in milk since it‚Äôs not connected on the sides if that makes sense? i‚Äôm a new mom and still very tired these days so the bottle has gotten in the way with the opening a few times and resulted in a few ounces of milk in my lap üò≠ i‚Äôm more careful these days but I wish that could be fixed so it would be easier to pour while i‚Äôm trying to stay awake lol

I like that this product is easy to use. The bags are not too big or too small. The plastic is good quality and I don‚Äôt have any leakage once they have been in the fridge or the freezer. I am 40 days PP and already gone through a whole 200 Ct of bags. Would buy again and would tell family and friends about it.
These lay flat and store easily in the freezer
Muy buenas bolsas
Me sirvieron mucho cuando mis vasos estaban todos ocupados. Trae suficiente que te ayudan por un buen tiempo. Hay que saberlos sellar para evitar derrames pero son excelentes.
Muy f√°cil y practico

reviews.content:
I have purchased 3 diff brands of these little portable chargers to find the best one.
So I have this I-Walk, a portable INIU (w. flashlight) & 1 Anker portable charger.
Of them all, the IWALK is THE ABSOLUTE Hands Down BEST OF ALL them, (FOR AN IPHONE ONLY!)
I say this because I have used mine w my iPhone so unbelievably often!!!
AND Also because it is so very easy to use & bcuz it is comfortable while ur using it also! Too, It has the updated c plug-in port & all you have to do is just plug it into your phone & then it charges your phone while you are using it! So you can still use your phone while it is plugged into the wall.
And while it‚Äôs plugged in, it‚Äôs still charging your phone & itself also!
It also is so easy to maneuver around when it‚Äôs plugged into ur phone. The way it‚Äôs formed, where it‚Äôs curved, smooth, & not too heavy or unwieldy, fits to ur hand comfortably while it‚Äôs plugged into the phone! So I find this one WAY easier to hold & use than all those brick type ones I mentioned that I bought.
So‚Ä¶ Yes, in my personal opinion, this is an absolute FIND for me!
And because of that, I then purchased this 2nd one as a gift for my sister. She had seen mine & how great it looked, how easy it was to use & to carry around. So she sd ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs my Xmas present‚Ä¶ 1 in green!‚Äù ;)
Which reminds me‚Äî I also was very surprised at how well this pink I-Walk is holding up in my purse. I have had the pink one maybe 2 months now & I don‚Äôt have it in anything at all. I just throw it in my purse, and it is surprisingly resilient and resistant to scratches! Which blew me away also as usually light colored items pick up scratches & blemishes so easily! But not this‚Ä¶ So I just absolutely adore this little invention bcuz it is so useful, helpful, & handy!
Ok, Onto the Cons: The Only con I have is the price‚Ä¶ It is a little high, in my opinion.
But it IS a quality product that I use on a (sometimes) daily basis, so I decided it‚Äôs well worth the money to me.
So‚Ä¶. Bottom Line: Would I buy it again!?!
You betcha!!!

It‚Äôs handy for when you need to charge but don‚Äôt want a cord. It‚Äôs a bit awkward in your hand but maybe that just needs some getting used to. It also charges your phone extremely slowly. I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs because I have an older phone (iPhone 11), but I‚Äôve had it on charging for over an hour now and my battery has gone up only 5%.
I would see more benefits if it charged faster, but I have had better and faster portable chargers with cords. I bought this to use when I travel and am using my phone a lot or photos and navigation for easier use without a cord, but honestly I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this if that is what your intended use is. If you‚Äôll use it to charge your phone and leave it alone for hours in your bag, that‚Äôs probably fine!

This is a nice and convenient charger that fits snugly onto your phone. The prior one we had was a brick and while it also included the charging cord, it was not as convenient to carry as the brick charger would be hanging off the phone. This one fits easily into your phone so it becomes all one piece. It is not as powerful as other portable cargers but convenient to carry around and get some juice to your phone when it is about to die.

I not only use his charger for travel, but I use it at home. One of the reasons is because I have a kitten that chews on my cords, and this way I can charge i my iPhone at home and the cat doesn‚Äôt bother it so to me it has several great uses for travel and at home.
Have only used once. I like not having a cord to mess with. It charged my iPhone fairly quickly, but I can tell it will probably only charge it once before needing recharging itself.

Best part of this little guy is how small and convenient it is to throw in your purse (or a generous pocket.) If you‚Äôre going to be out and away from an outlet all day, this is an accessory that‚Äôs really nice to have. Plus it‚Äôs fairly lightweight in exchange for something that can really help out in a pinch.

Charges relatively quickly in a few hours. Extra nice design touch is an attached rubber cover that protects the lightning connector from damage while it‚Äôs not in use, bouncing around your purse.
I got my grandsons one and I got the bling one. They work perfectly fine. I just don‚Äôt like how long you have to press done on the button to turn it off and on. Good product though.

It does charge my phone pretty quick when I need it to. The charger itself drains very quickly. Does take a good amount to charge the charger as well. If your phone is dying and you use this, don‚Äôt expect to get another use out of it (after you charge 1 device). It has def come in handy but it‚Äôs not great.
I have a defender case for my iPhone and the charger doesn‚Äôt stay in my phone. The concept is awesome and would have been ideal for our trip but I would have had to take the case off.

I got this because I work 2 jobs and I have to clock in and out at one job. Usually my phone has a low battery by the end of my shift and this is great to have to charge my phone and still keep my phone on me. I‚Äôm glad I got it.

reviews.content:
I was concerned that the piece would be cheaply made, and wouldn't look good in my office that I would describe as "classic executive", as I needed to change from my old "classic" desk pad with the side flaps (I paid well over $200 for it) as my business transitioned to virtual appointments, and the need to place a large computer monitor on my desk. This means I needed a sleek, long, and narrow (my old pad covered the cable hole at the top end of my desk) pad that would accommodate my keyboard, mouse, writing needs... oh, and of course a cup of coffee nearby at all times, of course.

This pad over-delivers! It looks sleek and professional, while performing ideally! Inexpensive doesn't have to mean cheap, and this pad is a real bargain.

You will probably need to place heavy books on the ends for a couple days once unpackaged, but it's a small price to pay for such a great and well-priced desk pad. I am extremely happy with this purchase!

I‚Äôve had it for less than 24 hours now but overall, my first impression is pretty good. True to color shown, size is great for my desk and nice texture. Definitely be gentle with it when you are trying to get it to be flat because it does hold any indentions, if not permanently then for a very long time I would assume because the material is very soft. It has an unpleasant chemical smell to it that I‚Äôm sure will go away with time but is a little distracting when I‚Äôm sitting at my desk. The smell was a lot stronger when I first took it out the package, almost nauseating and gave me a slight headache, but now (12+ hrs later) its still noticeable but tolerable. Can‚Äôt speak to how easy it is to clean yet or how long it will last but I do recommend for the price.

Overall, I like these mats. They look nice, are of good quality, the PU leather has a nice texture, and it overall looks quite nice while protecting the top of my wooden desk.

The only word of warning I would give is that the color varies slightly from what you see in the picture. I bought the dark blue mat to lay on my black desk and the blue is actually a little darker than I expected based on the pictures online. It's not a deal-breaker by any stretch, but it's something to be aware of.

Also of note, the PU Leather does have a bit more resistance to it than a normal cloth-covered mousepad. Not an issue for me, but something to consider if you really want your mouse to glide over the mat.

I was really surprised how well it worked, great quality piece!
I'm very picky about all this things, I got this pad for my home office workstation where I work 10 hours a day at least. It lays very flat, feels great, most silent moms movement I had so far and non sticky at all. I been using it for two weeks now, so far very good.
I highly recommend it!

UPDATE: The surface of this desk pad is a very nice-looking and feeling fake-leather. Fine... except that that texture also makes it very easy for things to stick and they are not easy to get off. I have been used to a smoother formica-style desk surface and am used to being able to clean it off without effort as it was completely smooth and tough. This surface doesn't work that way, and it's pretty easy to damage the surface if you try to hard. Even using a fingernail to try to loosen something can mar the surface. As indicated below, I think this is a good product. However, I selected the 'pale grey' (which almost perfectly matches my desk surface) and I'm going to order a 'dark blue' one because I think the dark color will hide things like minor discolorations as I won't try so hard to keep it looking perfect as I think less will show on the dark color. Of course, if you never eat or drink or let a ball-point pen point touch the pad, you'll be fine. I did that with a pen, just a tiny little dot, but on the pale grey it stood out.

For roughly $12/13 this is a very nice product. I got the light gray color as I wanted something that would 'disappear' and my desktop is almost excactly that color. Mine, and I assume all, has a textured finish. It looks and feels nice, though if you spill anything it will be a bit more tedious to clean. I like the fact that it has just a little bit of thickness, but not much, as I got it so that I could rest my hands on the desk while using a mouse but I didn't want anything (like a padded mouse wrist rest) that would elevate my hands more. This provides just the amount of softness that I needed.

One thing to be ready to do: It arrives rolled up (and nicely boxed) and when you unroll it the end that was on the outside will relax pretty much on its own, as will the rest of it. However, the end that was the inside part of the rolled-up pad gets a little bit... kinked, maybe, and I found that putting things like heavy books completely covering that end and the few inches, and leaving them overnight helped flatten it out nicely. I mention this because my first thought was that maybe it wouldn't flatten out but I figured with over 50,000 good reviews it probably just needed some help and it would be fine, and it has been.

I bought this to cover my glass table since I'm using it as a desk right now - it goes the job and has a nice feel to it. I chose the largest size, which might have been more than I needed. My mouse works well on it, although I wouldn't recommend writing directly on the pad.

This is as advertised. I wanted a large pad for my desk. I was mostly looking for a large mouse pad (since the wood desk is too glossy to work). The fit that bill perfectly, but also makes writing easier and acts as a good coaster in a pinch. It is a bit thin (why I only have it 4 stars), but that should be expected at the price. It came rolled up neatly, with simple instructions on getting it to lay flat quickly. Overall, I'm happy with this purchase.

I work in a rented office. The desk I use is painted with black paint. After several years of use, the paint wis bubbling up and tearing. Additionally, the paint rubs off on my hands. This is a fantastic solution. I bought the larger size and tucked it under my three monitor risers. It's perfect. It feels good under my hands, lays flat, has no smell, and looks fantastic. I wish I would have purchased it sooner. :)

My desk was starting to show wear in the spot where my arms rest to use my keyboard while I work. I bought this to use to protect the desktop. It laid flat within minutes, it's soft, comfortable, and stays in place. I bought the shorter version, since I didn't need it to extend out any farther, and I don't use it as a mousepad. It's perfect.

I'm very happy with my desk protector. I chose the olive color and it's true to color, it's the perfect fit for my L-shaped desktop. I not only wanted a surface for writing, but also wanted to protect my glass from getting scratched - could also be used as a mouse pad too! I did not rate the rating for gaming because I'm not a gamer I just wanted for traditional office use. If you're in need I would highly recommend!

name: Anker Portable Charger, 313 Power Bank (PowerCore Slim 10K) 10000mAh Battery Pack with PowerIQ Charging Technology and USB-C (Recharge Only) for iPhone, Samsung Galaxy and More
description:
Product Description

	

	



Airline Friendly

Take and use on any flight safely, and stay powered up on your journey.

	
Exclusive Technology

Anker's exclusive PowerIQ and VoltageBoost technologies combine to ensure the fastest possible charge up to 2.4 A. Does not support Qualcomm Quick Charge.

	
Trickle-Charging Mode

Designed to provide optimized charging to low-power devices such as earphones, Bluetooth speakers, and other accessories.

Anker 313 Power Bank (PowerCore 10K)

The Slim and Compact 10000mAh Portable Charger

From Anker, America's Leading Charging Brand

- Faster and safer charging with our advanced technology

- 55 million+ happy users and counting

Astonishing Size

Anker 313 Power Bank is incredibly slim and light for its large cell capacity. It can charge a phone up to three times and most tablets once. Weighing just half a pound, it‚Äôs only slightly heavier than a baseball and is designed to fit comfortably in your palm or pocket; perfect for work or traveling.

Advanced Charging Technology

Anker's exclusive PowerIQ and VoltageBoost technologies combine to ensure the fastest possible charge up to 2.4 A. Does not support Qualcomm Quick Charge.

Trickle-Charging Mode

Trickle charging is designed to provide optimized charging to low-power devices such as earphones, Bluetooth speakers, and other accessories. To activate, press the power button twice or press and hold for 2 seconds until the LED indicator turns green.

Recharge Your Way

Use Micro USB or USB-C (input only) to recharge in just 4.5 hours. Micro USB cable included. USB-C and Lightning cables not included.

Notes:

- USB-C cable, Lightning cable, and AC adapter not included.

- When the trickle-charging mode is on, the last LED light will remain green, regardless of battery status.

- The two input ports may not be used at the same time. The USB-C input port has no output function.

- Compatible with 12'' 2015 MacBook (USB-C cable required), iPhone XS / XS Max / XR, Android smartphones and tablets (including the Nexus 7), and other USB-charged devices.

- Recharging will take 5.5 hours with a 10W charger (not included) and the USB-C port cannot charge devices.

- ‚Äã‚Äã10,000mAh is the total nominal rated capacity of the internal battery cells.

- Dimensions: 5.87 x 2.68 x 0.55 inches; Weight: 7.5 ounces

- The power bank is flight-approved and allowed on a plane.

reviews.content:
Charger by definition needs battery. The more power packed, the heavier the charger becomes.

This charger is no difference in terms of weight. It's heft but the size helps making it easier to carry than others. Anker makes the same shape / size as a modern smartphone. This makes it easier to hold while you charge and use your smartphone as needed.

It's different than other chargers in that it has only one output, an IQ output. There are two inputs - a micro USB and USB C input. I am not sure what the design decision was. But I felt it's overkill. May be it was for the benefit of people who have not migrate to USB-C who still have micro USB cable / charger.

In regards to the output, you need to find a USB-A cable, which is very common to find and many people probably have a few laying around. However, there is not that many people have USB-C to USB-C cable.

As some of you know, not all cables are the same. I tried a cable thought it would achieve good result based on past experience. But I got only normal, i.e. slow charging speed. So I switch to another thin cable I have at the moment and voila, it achieves SUPER FAST CHARGING per my S20 FE. Please try different cable if you find it not achieving the speed you expect.

As for capacity, I am not sure about the 10,000 mAh claim through my limited experience with it. It lose one blue dot, meaning 25% charging my phone. I thought at the time, it doesn't look right as the charge I gained is not 2500 mAh. As you may know, most battery can't reach 100% but 80% efficiency. A very good one may reach 90% or higher.

All in all, it was OK for the price I paid with the unique feature it provides.

I read one review that said this power bank is good but it takes a long time to charge. I bought it thinking it can't be that slow where it won't charge to full from empty overnight. I started charging it and my goodness does it take forever to charge. I plugged it in to charge and it started with the 3rd blue light blinking. It has been blinking for almost 3 hours now.

Update: 4 hours later and the 4th blue light is finally blinking

This power unit now takes as long as 8 hours to recharge itself. It also uses up a full charge when charging my phone 2 1/2 times. I am disappointed in its lack of longevity. The Anker can be wireless but whether wired or wireless, it heats up my phone in a way no other power unit does. It is not the only power bank I use, so it is not being unreasonably stressed at all. The other power banks I have still work appropriately and charge themselves and charge items almost the same as they did when they were new. For example, one of my power banks is 3 years old and works as it did when it was new. The Anker has been in rotation for about a year or so and I only trust it at home. I no longer take it when I travel.

When a transformer blew in my neighborhood and we went 5 hours with no power just as I walked in the door with a nearly dead iphone 13, I discovered my old power bank either incapable of fully charging my current phone (I got it when I had a 6) or too aged to do so. Based on media reviews I bought this from Anker. Did it charge my phone? Yes, but it‚Äôs barely compatible with modern Apple devices. When I went to charge the bank, I found The included cord only has a old style usb end and the other end doesn‚Äôt fit in any Apple device or adapter I own. So thankfully I had an old adapter laying around that took usb or I could not have charged it. The cord also doesn‚Äôt have a lightening end so I had to use the old Apple cord from the old adapter to charge my devices because the bank won‚Äôt charge a device using a lightening to usb-c cord. It only outputs using an old usb. If you use Apple, buy a different brand,

i am very forgetful and often forget to charge my phone overnight, so portable charges are a necessity for me. i was happy with the price point it was at, but i should‚Äôve read the description more carefully. you can only use regular usb cords to charge your phone, so the charging speed is a little slow. i prefer being able to use usb-c cords. i also dislike the display that shows you how much battery life is left. it is 4 dots indicating 100%, 75%, 50%, and 25%. this is incredibly vague and i would appreciate a more dedicated system. i am able to charge my iphone 11 from 10% to 100% plus probably 20% more. i use my macbook charge to charge the device and it probably take an hr to get it to 100%. not unhappy, just should‚Äôve paid more attention before i bought something.

I bought this a few months ago as 'emergency backup', if I happened to be away from a charging source (so, not in a building or car; generally for camping and the like). The battery in my Galaxy S8 has degraded over time, and I wasn't ready to get spendy on a new phone, nor did I look forward to 'cell phone surgery' to replace the battery (the days of popping off the case back and swapping out in a minute or two are long gone, sad to say). So I ordered this up. At 10,000 mAh, I figured I should get enough charge to get me through a jam.

If you're thinking... "S8! That's a dinosaur!" -- you're likely rocking something much more current, and aren't worried about off-grid power. Yet. But remember -- all batteries degrade with time.

After having used it... my thoughts
- Takes a bit to charge up, once discharged (so once you've discharged, plan ahead). Especially the first time.

- However, once it's charged up, the self-discharge rate is slow, so you don't have to constantly keep it plugged into a wall wart, etc. You can charge this up, once conditioned, and pack it away for a few weeks to a few months.

- The 4 LED meters on the front are handy for determining SoC / Time to Charge

- Form factor on this is very similar to the dimensions on my S8 (although a little thicker, and of course, heavier)

- A shorter USB A <> USB-C cable does double duty -- USB A to bring the charge to the phone / device via USB-C, then remove & flip USB-C into the input of the Anker, while plugging the 'A' end into any compatible port to recharge it.

- Comes with a black cloth bag with drawstring closure, which is nice to keep that short USB cable together with the device. Nothing fancy, but useful.

- And probably the best, after using Qi-Wireless for 90% of the time over the life of the G8 -- this thing puts juice into the phone, quickly. I can go from 5-15% charge to 30% in under 30min. Not sure how many amps it's charging at (rated at 'up to 12' -?), but it's definitely quick. If you're caught somewhere without power (or even if you're not) -- this device is a lifesaver (figuratively & perhaps literally, I guess).

Technically, I guess you're not supposed to use the phone while charging with a power bank, but it comes in handy for those times where you need to use the phone a little longer, but need a little juice to tide you over (it juices the phone so fast--especially vs. Qi-wireless--that you say "I might as well just keep it hooked up to this)). I think it'll charge close to 100% in about 90 minutes, maybe less.

- Since my G8 battery is ~ 3800 mAh (?), I can get up to two full charges out of this thing, or many 'partial' charges. From full, 30 minutes' time on the G8 doesn't even remove one 'dot' from the 4-light meter. This is real value, in my book. Because most of the time, I can get back to a power source in 30min or so.

So... for what I'm using it for, which is to buy time until I decide to finally (!) upgrade my phone, and keep the S8 running a little while longer... it's an excellent accessory, from a trusted company. Since this has been out a while, and been superseded by higher-cap devices, solar-capable chargers, etc. -- it's also cheap -- about the cost of one of those replacement battery kits (with batteries that came from who knows where).

Not often I unequivocally give the full 5-stars... but this product gets them from me. Recommended.
(oh, and mine came new in a box, so if yours doesn't... get in touch with Anker for a new replacement)

I bought this after a recent power outage at my house. Great to make sure you can use your phone if you need to. If you've got USB-powered ANYTHING you need one of these. I only gave 4 stars for travel because it's a little heavy. If you need a boost, say, on the plane, you could get a smaller, lighter one. But it's absolutely money for power outages when you suddenly need a device charged.

Yet another quality mobile phone battery charger from Anker. It works great, no issues, it can charge my Pixel 6 Pro from ~low~ to full and still have charge to spare.

My biggest complaint with this battery is the size. The old versions of Anker's 10000mAH batteries were shorter and thicker. They have changed this batter to be thinner but longer. Its almost as large as my Pixel 6 Pro, which itself is a 6.7" phone. This battery is HUGE compared to the old models. I am sure its related to the internals they are using. But the issue this creates is realted to "pocketability". This thing is so large that I cannot really fit it in my pocket easily with my phone that its charging, and its so long that it sticks out of my smaller rear-pockets. The only comfortable way I have found to use this charger is to keep it in the rear pocket of my backpack and use a longer USB-C cord to charge my phone in my pocket.

With previous batteries this was never a problem, I could fit both the battery + my phone in the same pocket, not so much with this model. Maybe your mileage will vary if you have more pockets or bigger pockets or smaller phones.

Its not a deal breaker but it does mean that if I want to take this charger with me, I generally need to also bring along a bag of some sort.

Charged my iPhone SE. Did what it needs to do. iPhone SE was not on the list that it would work with so I took a chance but it works fine with this model. You'll need to supply the cable to connect your phone to the charger.

Great size for portability and usefulness.

I had one before, but lost it while traveling.
I don't have the ability to run an electrical cord to the middle of my living room. Instead, I charge this every couple of days and use it to charge phones, game controllers and remotes all from the end table by my recliner.

It also comes in very handy when traveling.

name: Celestron - 70mm Travel Scope - Portable Refractor Telescope - Fully-Coated Glass Optics - Ideal Telescope for Beginners - BONUS Astronomy Software Package
description:
From the manufacturer
Travel Scope 70

Grab the Celestron Travel Scope 70 and go anywhere‚Äîfrom your backyard to another continent. Ample optical performance is packed and ready in this ultra-portable backpack kit.

	
Manual Alt-Azimuth mount

The Travel Scope is a manual alt-azimuth telescope with a pan handle to navigate the sky with ease. The mount is set on a 1.25‚Äù steel adjustable tripod, which you can adjust to the desired height.

 
Portability

Whether you‚Äôre hiking into back-country or going through airport security, the Travel Scope won‚Äôt slow you down. The telescope, tripod, & accessories fit inside the backpack for easy traveling.

 
Objects to Observe

The Travel Scope features a refractor style body ideal for both terrestrial and astronomical observing. Fully coated glass optics provide vivid images of wildlife, the Moon, and planets.

 
Celestron is Here for You

Optics can be intimidating, but Celestron is here to help. As one of the top telescope maker, we offer outstanding US-based support and how-to videos, so you can enjoy stargazing hassle-free.

   
Better Viewing

Accessories include two eyepieces (20mm and 10mm), erect image diagonal, and a travel backpack.

reviews.content:
Celestron travel scope is a good product for what it is made for. It is primarily a terrestrial viewing scope. The objective (large lens in front of the scope) is good quality and is functional. However, the eyepieces that come with the scope are (in my opinion) lower quality (this is probably done to keep the total cost of the scope low). Without a decent eyepiece the experience of viewing objects will be minimal.
What I did was invest about $25.00 (they can be higher priced - based on quality) in a good quality 20mm x1.25 inch (a good standard starting size) "Plossel" type eyepiece (several listed on Amazon for under $30.00). The addition of a higher quality eyepiece really changed the viewing experience with this scope. Or, if you want to get into astronomical viewing with this scope Celestron makes an Observers Accessory Kit (#94308- you can get it on Amazon - about $70.00). It comes with two Plossel eyepieces -17mm and 6mm-, a moon filter (definitely will need it to bring down the glare if observing the moon), a 2X Barlow lens (doubles the magnification of the eyepieces), and two planetary filters, and a case. It seems like a well put together and thought out accessory kit (I know, another $70.00 !!).
Also (as stated in other reviews) the tripod is weak (when extended to its full length). What I recommend is getting a sturdy table (and chair) and set the tripod (in its non-extended or shortest length) on the table. Sit in the chair, and rotate the 45 degree prism (with eyepiece attached) until you can see what you want. You don't need to be standing to view the stars (or whatever)!! It is even better to get a 90 degree correct image diagonal to view the heavens with (that way you don't have to bend over so far, and you can aim the scope higher - I know even more money - actually about $45.00 for a starter correct image diagonal). Become familiar with how the pieces attach (eyepiece to 45 degree prism to insertion in the telescopes focusing tube-and how they can be rotated to your seated position) and you will get a lot more enjoyment out of this well made product.
Remember, this is not a heavy duty alt-azimuth tripod with slow motion controls (Celestron #93607 - which looks like it would fit this scopes screw on base). It is basically a standard camera tripod. You will have to "play" with it and figure out (especially on celestial objects) how to aim it high and then tighten the adjustments (which will lower the object into your field of view). You could even buy a heavier tripod with the same type of adjustments that this tripod has - Celestron #93610- it would make the scope more secure if you needed to fully extend the legs on the tripod - I have one that I use with some of my other telescopes - you just have to get used to the way it adjusts -think each mentioned tripod is about $80.00 to $90.00 (that money just keeps adding up !!). The adjustment for lowering the object into view while tightening the tripod controls takes some getting used to, but it can be learned -and is part of the overall "experience" of this fine travel scope.
Also, about the adjustments on the tripod. The vertical (up and down) lever on the tripod - do not back it out all the way. What happened to me is that a small nut that attaches the handle to the tripod will fall out. So what I did was put a piece of tape over the hole where the nut is - so if I backed out the adjustment to far, the nut would not fall out (no big deal - just need to be aware that it could happen).
I have had this scope for several years, and have seen many celestial objects with it (although I use a correct image 90 degree star diagonal - as stated previously). It is a nice scope for its intended purpose, however (in my opinion) it does need a couple of upgrades (as suggested).
Further, if you need to make the tripod more secure when it is on a table top or partially extended - try draping some "strap on ankle weights" over one or more of the tripod's braces (let one or both sides of the weight rest on the table - so you don't over stress the brace). I had some old strap on ankle weights lying around, just draped one over the brace (without strapping it down), and it makes it much more secure. Also, you get two ankle braces in a set. So you will have an extra one if you need it !!
So let's review. The most important item on any telescope is the objective lens (as stated previously) the large lens in the front of the scope. The Celestron Travel scope objective lens is of good quality, that's where I think the product excels. I recommend to buy a higher quality eyepiece (Plossel type), add some weight to the tripod (as suggested)-do not extend the tripod into its fully extended position (becomes really shaky and weak)-keep it as "low as possible"-preferably on a table top (add an "ankle weight" to the fold out extensions), learn how to rotate the 45 degree diagonal so you can view while seated (this won't change the correct image view of the object), and you have a very well made, fairly light weight travel scope. I have used this scope for terrestrial and astronomical purposes, and as a "spotting scope" while at the range. Works perfectly !! I hope this review has assisted you in your decision (I know -I didn't intend for this review to be so long - but there you have it !!). Have fun !!

A decent starter telescope, but, as others have said, the tripod is a piece of junk, and the spotter scope is diffiult to use. We went up to Joshua Tree Nat'l Park to see the "new" comet and even with the tripod on the hood of the car, using the telescope required crouching almost onto one's knees. Very wobbly and hard to keep trained, esp. when one's fingers are freezing cold! Also, the fasteners for the tripod legs almost guarantee that you'll pinch your finger at least once every time you extend a leg. To use the telescope at all, even if you have a low chair it'll crick your back. Sadly, I'm betting many beginners will become so frustrated they'll give up and return the whole thing. Get a decent tripod, one you can stand up to use, or even sit comfortably in a normal camp chair. The telescope DOES give a good look at stars/planets however. The instructions should also tell you which of the eye pieces you should use, depending on what you're looking at. As it is, this may be best used for peering into neighbors' windows. No, don't be a creeper. Don't do that.

TL;DR Review: Great portable scope. Get a separate tripod - tripod wobbles.

Definitely recommended for anyone who would like to take a scope with them on a trip, for someone who doesn't have the space for a permanently mounted scope, for a student whose interested in astronomy, or as a fun add-on to keep in the trunk on trips to anywhere. It‚Äôs small, lightweight, and priced right. It‚Äôs light enough that a five-year old could carry it for an entire trip without effort, giving them direct participation in the setup process.

This is an amazing little telescope which you can easily take anywhere you're going. Looking at the moon, you'll be able to see the moon in fantastic detail, clearly seeing the ridges of the craters peaking above the moon's northern pole. Aimed at any patch of the sky, stars will become visible when before you saw nothing but darkness.

As with all telescopes with this magnification, you will not see the individual rings of Saturn, but you will be able to make out the halo of the rings. Jupiter's moons, though, will be easy to spot, but speaking of spots, you won't see Jupiter's red-spot. Mars and Venus are indistinctive.

As for galaxies, if you know where to look, Andromeda can be seen. As for using this scope for daytime viewing of birds and bees, it's perfect.

My recommendation is to pair this scope with a Gosky Cell Phone Adapter Mount (you can order one here on Amazon - see my review for photos and videos take with it) and use your phone's camera to capture some amazing shots. Note positioning the Gosky is tricky, so prepared to be frustrated as you try to get the phone's camera and the telescope aligned. It‚Äôs not a defect and it's not something you're doing wrong - it's just worth it, but difficult. And if you want to get photos of objects you can't even see through the telescope with your phone, Google "android [or iphone] astronomy photo stacking", "NightCap Pro," or "iastrophotography".

What makes this scope a winner it how easy it is to carry around. The included backpack has enough extra space that you can easily toss a laptop or Chromebook in it - I have.

It also comes with two high-quality eyepieces (20mm and 10mm) which allow you toquickly switch them up as needed.

Each lens also comes with a cap (a needed feature), though I wouldn't fret too much if I lost one. The side finderscope is well aligned and will make targeting much simpler.

But the tripod! The tripod! It's OK, but because it's tiny and lightweight, it's not stiff and suffers from touch-wobble. You'll repeatedly find yourself aiming for an object and then when you let go of the telescope or tripod, sometimes it will move out of alignment. You just need to be cognizant of this and use a light touch once you've locked it down to where you want to aim.

Since I‚Äôve gotten it, my son and I have used it in City locations and in the country ‚Äì obviously it works great in both locations.

So if the tripod is poor - why did you give it 5 stars instead of 4? For the size, price, and weight of the tripod, it‚Äôs what you would expect. A sturdier tripod will weigh a whole lot more and will be bigger, killing the portability aspects of what without the tripod would automatically make this a 5-star telescope. So it‚Äôs neither the tripod‚Äôs fault nor the Celestron‚Äôs. A better-built tripod would weigh more and cost a lot more.

As a person who doesn‚Äôt read manuals, do read the instruction manual. Some parts aren‚Äôt obvious. I managed to figure out how to put it together but would have had a much easier time if I had taken two minutes to flip through the instruction manual.
Good telescope, if you trash the tripod that is included and get a real tripod to mount to it.

I don't know why people are expecting the results of the Hubble Telescope in the reviews. It does exactly what it's designed to do. It takes the moon and makes it look like a large marble that's placed a few inches from your eye that's in pretty good focus. You can see some craters on the Moon, but you can't see Niel Armstrong's footprints. You can see the rings of Saturn, but you can't count them like a tree that's been cut in half. I'm not sure why some individuals have ridiculous expectations for something that's less than $100...

There are better scopes out there, sure, but it's a great beginner scope for kids and amateurs. I got this for my 7 year old who has shown interest in the Cosmos. If he really gets into it, I'll invest more later and pass this to his younger siblings. For right now, it's perfect.

The frame is light, but the scope is light and doesn't need a heavy duty frame. It holds the scope, which is what it's designed to do.

All the pieces were accounted for, and it came with a backpack so it can be taken on trips so you don't need to buy a separate case to hold it when you're traveling in the car or walking somewhere.

It does what it was designed to do. Great for kids and amateurs at a modest price to see nature, take it to a long distance shooting range, see space a bit better, and anything else that is legal to do. If you want to see a nebula, and have a few thousand dollars to spare, go for it and buy that kind of scope.

For the normal people with real expectations, this is a great telescope for beginners and kids. Well worth the investment if you're unsure if you want to invest a large amount of money to see footprints on the Moon.

Take care!
Love the product but that part (where the spotting scope is too loose

Jam√°s hab√≠amos tenido un telescopio y la vdd ten√≠amos miedo que no pudi√©ramos usarlos, y no! Padrisimo s√∫per f√°cil de usar y lo mejor de todo la cara de mi ni√±o, su sonrisa al ver la luna.. inolvidable! .. vali√≥ pena!

For background I've never owned a telescope and haven't done much astronomy since high school.

I bought this as a gift for our bright 5.5 year old daughter, knowing she may need to grow into it a bit. Before settling on this particular model, I considered paying several times more for a good T-scope the whole family could use for years to come. However, after reading more about beginner scopes, I agreed that a more complicated or powerful scope could discourage her. Further, although she thinks astronomy is pretty neat today and she can name all the planets (including a few dwarfs), there's a chance her interest wanes. In that case, I'm only out $100.

It took me about 30 minutes to skim through the instructions and assemble the scope. Adjusting the finderscope was a little more difficult, however. I found myself wishing it had some simple calibration screws that would move the crosshairs left/right and up/down. Instead, the finder scope is held in place by inserting it into a broad ring with three inward facing screws. It was a bit of an effort to get this calibrated (still not 100%) and I can tell it would easily be thrown off if bumped or if I pack and unpack the scope. Basically, you don't want to touch it after calibration (and try to get a 5 year old to not touch something interesting like that).

I'd read reviews saying the tripod may be flimsy, but I wasn't concerned given we have two others for our cameras. Nevertheless, it seems to work and I left one segment on each leg unextended so our daughter could reach the viewfinder. I found Jupiter w/o much of a problem, but because the scope is front-heavy, it required a few iterations of sighting, loosening-moving-then tightening the panhandle, and sighting again before I got accustomed to the scope "dipping" after I'd locked things in. Perhaps there is a technique that makes this easier, but I believe some scopes have counterweights to manage this. Perhaps a sturdier tripod would help.

That said, these are all things I can deal with and weren't entirely unexpected. I was impressed that not only could we see Jupiter but also its four largest moons. I initially thought they might be a lens flare or a defect, but after looking at on line photos I confirmed it's the real deal, which was pretty exciting. Worth noting that a little kid will have a harder time closing one eye and steadily looking into an eyepiece to see something as small as a planet. I'm hopeful the moon is easier for her. Mom has already joked that Dad has a new telescope.
It is very easy to use for our young people also great for them to learn with about GODS creation.
It was a gift for my grandson he seemed to like it.

reviews.content: So I finally clean my bathroom and hung this curtain. Let me tell you, if you are not a morning person or you have a hard time waking up in the morning I would not get this curtain. I mean don‚Äôt get me wrong I love the light cancellation (if that‚Äôs a thing) that it brings but let me tell you be prepared for a low light shower. I had a white or opaque curtain before so maybe it‚Äôs just me getting use to low light in my shower. I definitely love it, just trying to warn you. This curtain should come with a label Warning: Don‚Äôt Buy If You Are A Shower Sleeper, May Worsen Sleepy Conditions!

I have never been happier with a shower curtain purchase. After years of dealing with plastic and other kinds of cloth, I was about to give up on trying to prevent ugly mold in our tub. It seemed like no matter what I did to keep them clean, even running them through the washer wouldn't do it. Within a week the whole problem would start again, and honestly taking a shower curtain off the hooks and putting it back on week after week gets old fast. So I poked around on Amazon and found this one, not really expecting much. I was very wrong. Not only does it dry quickly, but it barely gets wet to begin with. It's also very light compared to a plastic curtain or a regular cloth one that is wet. I measured carefully to make sure it wouldn't hang too low, so the magnets attach about halfway down the wall of the tub. Really it's just perfect.

So I got this with a little worry it's was what they said it was.... I LOVE IT! It's lightweight but has heavy magnets at the bottom. It hasn't let any water through to these outside yet, and it dries really quick. Which it a big plus because thes longer it takes to dry thes more chances increase for mold. It's easy to wash, which I did when it first arrived. So I would recommend this product to anyone.

I bought this on a whim one day after being so tired of having to throw away my vinyl/plastic liners after they begin to mold. Yes, you can spray the vinyl ones down after every shower but who has the time or will to do that?

I decided to look online and found this. A washable liner? Sounds like a dream come true instead of buying a new vinyl one every few months.

So far, so good. The liner itself is pretty thin but it has weights to give it some...weight and hang in the tub without being annoying. Water beads off the side and it dries quickly. I haven't had any signs of mold or mildew as of yet. I still haven't had to wash it yet and I do wonder how it'll hold up after but I'm really happy with it so far. Also, since it's a fabric liner, it almost looks like and doubles as a shower certain.

If something does happen to have it after several washings, it's still clearly a winner over vinyl and I'll buy more.

This shower curtain is great! It‚Äôs very soft, I hate the plastic ones. Plus the metal things at the bottom do a great job staying attached to the tub. Plus it just makes the bathroom look nicer. It was easy to install. I‚Äôm definitely not using any other inner curtain from now on, this one is it.

I've never liked adding a liner behind a shower curtain, with their swimming pool plastics and poor light filtration. Also, almost all shower curtains in stores are for a full size shower with a tub, and I have a shower stall (no tub), so they are far too big.

This company offered liner-free products in more sizes than I had ever seen, which enabled me to find one in a size that fit my needs better than the "one size fits all" items available in stores.

The fabric has a nice feel, and is opaque enough to not make the shower too dark, while still providing privacy (good for those with low light showers). Magnets at the bottom add some weight, though not quite enough for my household, apparently: a forceful / errant shower spray can push the bottom of the curtain out of the stall, resulting in water on the bathroom floor (parents of children are forewarned *chuckles*).

The product is also machine washable, not overly stiff, and made of a material with no outgassing. Needless to say, I am overall very pleased with it.

Pros:
‚Ä¢ A wide variety of widths (including several different lengths)
‚Ä¢ Pleasant, natural fabric feel
‚Ä¢ No outgassing like plastic liners
‚Ä¢ Machine washable
‚Ä¢ Good light filtration while still allowing privacy

Cons:
‚Ä¢ Could be a bit better weighted at the bottom

Finding a liner that is 78 inches is difficult. I didn‚Äôt want to spend a fortune. I wanted it to be waterproof and I didn‚Äôt want a plastic liner. This meet all of my needs.
I used it immediately when I received it and it worked great. It is waterproof and not a bulky liner. For the price it‚Äôs wonderful.
It‚Äôs simple, without lines. Can be used just the way it is without a regular curtain.

After years of going through plastic liners, I finally gave in and purchased a washable one. I loved this one so much that I bought 2 so I can swap them out for those times that I just don't get to the laundry but want to change out the liner.

Machine washable and then I prefer to line dry - I wasn't certain if I could put this in the dryer.

I love this so much that I'm starting to get them for care packages for friends moving into new houses!

I love this shower liner! I was so tired of buying plastic ones all the time. This liner is the answer. Water repellent on one side, hangs nicely, and magnets that are strong that keep the liner in place. Highly recommend!

So my main issues with previous shower curtains were thet they either bubbled up when I took a hot shower, or they weren't actually waterproof and water got all over the floor. This one is great in that the magnets keep it down but done make it bubble up and it seems to actually be waterproof! Great purchase.

reviews.content:
I actually got this for reading in bed, lol. My husband has to leave for work early but I like to read into the wee hours. I hadn't liked any of the book lights I had before, and I thought I would try this, since it goes around my neck as opposed to being clipped to the book. It's not heavy on my neck at all. Other features I like:

1. It has 3 brightness levels, so you can choose what you need based on your eyes and/or surroundings.

2. it also has 3 different light settings, warm, cool, and daylight. The warm is really very yellow so although I prefer warm light, in this case I don't. But since I have other options to choose from, and I really like those, I'm fine with that.

3. It's FLEXIBLE! This is probably one of my favorite features. I can adjust the position of the lights based on where I'm holding my book, or to make sure that it's shining away from hubby. Both sides are separately movable, so the light on the side where hubby is sleeping, I tend to flex further inward so that the pool of light is away from him. The "arms" can also be flexed up or down, so really, you can adjust this to whatever feels best for you.

4. I also like that because this goes around my neck, it has so many more options than being just a book light, although that's why I bought it. I've used it for tasks around the house, walking my dog at night, and other things I hadn't really thought of until I had the product in hand.

5. It's rechargeable, with an included cord. I have yet to recharge it, and I've used it often but not for really long periods of time in one stretch, so I'd say for now that one charge seems to last a decent amount of time. It has lights on the back that indicate whether it's charged or not, so far, mine is still fully charged, if the # of lights is any indication.

I'm really very happy with this and actually look forward to tucking into bed with this; previous reading attempts involved covering the lampshade so hubby could sleep, and then it would be too dim for me to actually see, or if I adjusted the cover, then it was too bright for him. This really allows me to adjust it to whatever position and brightness works for both of us. This would also be great for plane/bus trips where the lights are off if you still want to read an actual book (as opposed to an e-reader with light).

This item is powered by USB and is simple, quick and long lasting . The design is practical and very flexible to adjust it to your needs.
I love to read or do crossword puzzles at night in bed. I am always falling asleep with every light object glowing for hours. My husband had a hard time falling asleep with a power grid blazing in our bedroom which is not hard to understand. I had to seek a more equitable way to solve this dilemma.
My solution: put the TV on a timer which is usually available in your settings menu and then put on the CC so lower volume would work. Even without this master plan, I find this necklight a great find for toning down the glare of other light sources while reading/working in bed or chair!!!
THEN take this lightweight neck light and pick a mode: reg,cool or warm. The ends of the light beautifully illuminates an area that does not distract anyone else( unless you shine it into their face) and you can fall asleep knowing that not only that you are not bothering anyone but you could simply shut it off in the morning .
Plug it into where you charged your phone in during the night and way before nightfall this wonderful device would be ready for use without the need of batteries.
I have taken it on a three day mini vacation and forgot a charger for it and it was perfectly fine! I love it!!!! It is very lightweight and not the least bit uncomfortable. I love it!!! Great for a gift for night owls or those elderly with a roomate.....Have I mentioned that I love it ?????

I've always been a huge reader but in recent years have found it hard to read for as long a period of time as I used to. I like to read before bed and I found myself tiring quickly. It took me a while to realize that the light I was reading by just wasn't that good, and the constant minor strain of reading in those conditions was what tired me out.

I really love this reading light. It has three kinds of light and three brightness settings, so you can find what you're most comfortable with in the conditions in which you are reading. Already bought one of these for my sister and am planning on putting on my list of best gifts for reading friends.

I love to read and often find low light challenging. This little light did the trick. I can read in bed lying on my back or side, propped up or anywhere that there isn't sufficient light. It doesn't bother my husband when I read after he's gone to sleep. It's light, the beam is bright, can be directed where it's needed. I especially loved that the company owner sent an email advising me of a plastic film to be removed from the lens before use. I would have missed that. Since I just received it, I have no idea how long the battery will last, but it charged up quickly with the enclosed cable and a c block. I'd buy another when this one dies.

I‚Äôm using this light for knitting and crochet close detailed work as I read on my backlighted IPad. It has so many possible uses if you need to shine a bright light on things and need to be hands free.

The seller was terrific in reaching out to me to point out that I needed to gently remove the plastic film on the lights and fully charge the unit before use. I love that there are settings for the type of light (warm white, daylight, etc) as well as the brightness of the light. It‚Äôs so lightweight and comfortable plus the flexible arms help direct the light exactly where you need it. I probable use this product 2 or more hours a day and I love it!

For starters - this is a great light. It is lightweight, quiet to turn on/adjust, and targets fairly well to my crochet work or other items close by that I want to focus on in low light or dark rooms.

I got the new/upgraded model, in Grey (IE: New Grey) and so far have been able to use my high powered USB-c phone charger and cable to charge it, I did not need to use the cable that shipped with it. This is helpful as I have a 10ft USB-C to USB-C high-speed cable with a 45W USB-C wall charger parked on my end table and by my bedside for fast charging my electronics and can charge this light with the same setup. I saw many reviews about the original / non-upgraded version (the listings without 'new' in front of the color) being a bit more picky about the cable and charger strength/power and may have needed their specific cable and a lower powered wall charger, so this was important to me.

I had been very thrilled by the news that I could turn on only one light instead of both - reiterated several times in Q&A etc that this was true for the 'new'/upgraded version too. Unfortunately, even when asking specifically about the 'new' or 'upgraded' version, answers seemed to be that YES one light could be used. No info on how to make that happen though and I cannot find a way to do so. If you know - please please comment on this review with 'how'.

On the old version (look at the product listing/pictures) - there was a power/brightness click-through button on each arm that operated that one light only and the 'color' or 'warmth' of light was on the back of the neckband.
On the new/upgraded version (IE: "New Grey" vs the old model as just "Gray" or 'New Pink' vs 'Pink'), one arm has a on/off button, the other arm has 2 buttons, one for color/warmth and one for the three brightness settings. The power resumes color and brightness from last use and turns on both lights. The brightness button adjusts both lights. Not what was pictured in reviews about using one light.

If there is a way to operate each light separately, I'd love to hear HOW. Not just that it can be done. I've posted the question a couple of ways in Customer Q&A to no avail.

I do a lot of sewing, knitting, crochet, and quilting. I was on a tutorial on You Tube and saw the person teaching this tutorial how much she loved this product and helped her to see better with lighting at night sitting in her chair doing her crafts. I bought it and I absolutely love this product. Been using it every night to do my crafts and love the different light setting that it offers. Just the fact that I‚Äôm not struggling to thread a needle or dropping a stitch knitting or doing cross stitch is such a plus with this neck light. I will also be using this to read in bed. Great product!! You will love it!!

I can't imagine using this even on the low setting if you're sharing a bed with someone sleeping, just bc it is pretty bright still, but I'm also a light sleeper so that may just be me wondering how people could sleep with a little light on hahah. Otherwise it's really cute (though my sister laughed lol) and plenty bright enough! Bought it in time for a storm and the power tends to go out, so it's definitely come in handy(: haven't had to charge it yet so that's pretty good

I bought these (multiples) for when we lose power and we need to navigate the house in the pitch black. These are not just for book reading (though they excel at it!) - you can read a book and shine the other half on your mate...not that I would do that ;-) hehe But in all seriousness this thing works like a charm, it has adjustable brightness and is bendy so it can be aimed wherever you need it to be. Easy on/off switches and you can have one side brighter/dimmer than the other - or off! It's a great item so far - unclear on battery life, but I would assume it is average. Highly recommend.

I've been very happy with the light, especially the way it can be adapted to a lot of reading situations. The ends of the light are quite flexible and it's possible to focus the light it in a lot of different ways--not just around the neck pointing down, but able to illuminate wherever your reading matter happens to be, For example, if your pet wants to sit on your lap, right where your book usually is (not that they ever do that), no problem, you can hold the book above and point the light right on it. And adaptable to lots of other situations also.

aboutProductTopics.name: [3 Color & 6 Brightness Adjustable] 3 useful color temperature modes: yellow(3000K), warm white(4000K) and cool white(6000K). Each head owns an independent switch for 3 brightness levels dimmable. You can choose a comfortable setting as you wish for reading, knitting, camping, or repairing etc.

[Rechargeable & Long-Lasting] USB Type-C rechargeable which is reversible and thus easier to plug in compared with other Micro-USB. Up to 80 hours (general reading, single head) of powerful, non-diminishing brightness from the included premium rechargeable 1000mAh battery.

[Eye Caring & Ergonomic Design] No flickering and blue light filter design with advanced LED beads. No eye strain any more for both kids and adults. The arms are supple and adjustable so you can get the angle most comfortable to you. Ergonomic neck around design, and it is totally hands free!
[Partner Friendly] Special narrow beam angle(90¬∞) design. It is bright enough to the area you positioned and at the same time dim enough to not disturb your sound asleep partner.

[Product Guarantee] 1.Original patent applied. 2.FCC, CE, RoHS, PSE approved. 3.Worry-free 18-month warranty and friendly customer service. 4.Product Box Contains: 1*Glocusent LED Neck Light 1*USB Type-C Cable (24") 1*User Manual 1*Bookmark 5.NOTE: Use the included Type-C cable, your original cable or a third-party certified one ; AC adapter not included.

Intense, bold colors take center stage even from a distance. Erasing is a breeze, wiping away cleanly with an EXPO eraser from most nonporous surfaces, while the low odor ink is perfect for classrooms, offices, and homes.

Track, Schedule, & Present
